Summary: Very friendly staff. The property is quiet large. Very close to John Wayne/Orange County airport. They do have a hotel shuttle. I was there for a very short period of time but my room was large and seemed clean. I enjoyed that my room had a mini fridge and microwave. Bed was comfortable. Had a deep jacuzzi bath but i did not use it. Overall lots of space and slept well, seemed to be a pretty average hotel that tries to add the elegant decor flare, but I wasn’t there for long enough to judge the rest of the property!

Excellent restaurant and great happy hour for small plates.  So great to be able to charge your vehicle for free.  Friendly staff  Beautiful courtyard to eat outside with heaters.  Noisy with the airport as expected but not at night.

Our stay was a pleasant surprise. Nothing like the usual generic stay at most hotels.  The Ayres had interesting history and decor. The model ships throughout and use of stonework was beautiful. Our room was large and comfortable and the parking was very easy   I would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel but bring you own snacks
Summary: My room was spacious and comfortable. However, like many higher end hotels, simple amenities such as a variety of free coffees in the lobby throughout the day were missing. I would have appreciated vending machines or a small shop with a variety of snacks or even ice cream for when I returned late in the evening, but with a craving for just a little something sweet before bedtime.

I was among many people who stayed at the Ayres Hotel during this conference. Every employee was more than helpful, polite, friendly with a smile on their faces. We had all questions answered promptly and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Breakfast in the dining room was delicious and quick before we had to leave. The rooms were very comfortable and clean and the coffee in the room was even delicious! A rare thing in hotels! The hotel was close to the airport and the church we needed to be at. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are in the area.
Room tip: There are rooms available that overlook the pool or the courtyard if you would like that.

Summary: This Hotel is Always very clean and quiet I recommend this hotel to everyone. The room service is very good as are all the people that work for Ayers hotel. We have stayed at many of the Ayers properties because we know what to expect every time.

Summary Heading: Perfect for a nice stay or a special event!!
Summary: We had our wedding at the Ayres in December of 2022, and we are so happy we chose the Ayres hotel. We had the ceremony and reception there, and our huge family who lives all over the country stayed there. Everyone was impressed with their rooms and the hotel itself. All the staff at the Ayres is amazing but we especially want to thank Miguel, Marcos, Hector, and Lesley for their top-notch and friendly service. The pricing is extremely reasonable!! Less than you'd expect from the classic look and feel of the hotel.  Dawn, Group Services/Catering Manager, was the main wedding contact. She was such a support throughout the whole wedding planning process and the wedding itself. She truly went above and beyond and will always be one of our key memories from our beautiful, perfect

Summary Heading: Perfect place for a wedding, business, and vacation
Summary: Stayed for a week for my daughter's wedding, which was at the hotel. Ceremony in the courtyard, reception by the pool. Perfect. The staff is friendly, helpful, and felt like part of the family.   Dawn was the wedding coordinator and absolutely perfect. I called her several times with last minute requests (a couple of guests needed high chairs for their babies and Dawn made sure to have the seats in the correct spots; a table for the flower petals; removing some of the Christmas decor, etc) and she was sure to provide.  She was super hands on for the rehearsal (she ran the rehearsal), and wedding and I think we all knew she was there and ready to help.  Front desk staff is great. Friendly and helpful and always asked how things were going.  Security was even amazing! We were a

My room was clean and comfortable. The service at the restaurant was very good, the server handled my takeout order efficiently and the salad was yummy. The hotel is a very good value for the Newport Beach/Costa Mesa area.

My fiancé booked a night stay here after a week of poor sleep at our apartment due to ongoing construction. Our hope was to get one night of guaranteed restful sleep, but boy did we choose the wrong hotel. This hotel is located almost directly adjacent to the John Wayne Airport, and from 7am to 11pm there is near-constant noise from a stream of airplanes departing and arriving directly overhead the hotel. We stayed on the third floor and ended up leaving about two hours after checking in - our apartment was actually quieter than this hotel. The layout of the hotel - around a central courtyard - amplifies the airplane noise, if anything. If our room had bordered the courtyard, I imagine airplane noise would've been worse.
Room tip: Extremely noisy due to nearby airport runways
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review! I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you encountered regarding the surrounding disturbances and the location of our hotel. Although we wish you had a 5-star visit, we appreciate your feedback as we can use it as a tool to improve for the future. It would be a pleasure to have the chance to welcome you back for a 5-star visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: Very nice stay.  Room was nice and large   Very clean  Front desk was very helpful .  We had a good breakfast and service was good. Food tasty     We stay often and enjoy the hotel in new building.  We were in main building once and did not like it as much.

This hotel was generally nice.  I was happy to stay here, but that was all spoiled in an instant by an unpleasant hotel employee.  I was eating at the hotel restaurant, asked for the location of the restroom, and was directed do the restroom in the lobby.    The lobby restroom had some amateurish signage indicating that it was closed for painting.  The door was wide open, and I really had to go, so I used the restroom with no problem.  I didn’t see any fresh paint, and didn’t touch any painted surfaces anyway.  As I exited, a heavyset hotel employee got very unpleasant with me.  (I have no idea what she was trying to accomplish.)  I explained that I really had to go.  The hotel employee pointed out some scrawled signage that would have directed me to an alternative restroom (if
Manager Response: Dear Valued Giest,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay! I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you may have encountered regarding the service you received from our team and our bathroom being closed for a refresh. Our goal is to provide the most exceptional experiences, and we are disappointed we did not successfully do that for you this time. If you are ever in the area again, we hope to have the chance to welcome you back for a 5-star visit.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: I stayed here Nov. 2, 2022. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful upon arrival. On the way to my room I noticed the elevator smelled like cheap perfume. I opened the door to my room and was enveloped in a sickeningly sweet chemical smell. Elevator smell on steroids. I went and knocked on my colleagues door to see if it smelled. It smelled nauseatingly awful as well. My employer booked and paid for my lodging. I stay in hotels regularly and this wins for worst experience ever. The room smells, I smell, my clothes smell. I just want to go home and shower. I did turn on the ac to air out the room. Just made it worse. Will never come back if I can help it.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your rating and review! I would like to extend my most sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have encountered regarding the surrounding smell of our hotel. Our goal is to provide the most exceptional experiences and are disappointed we did not successfully do that for you this time. If you are ever in the area again, we hope to win your trust and provide you with the stellar accommodations you most deserved.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: If a merchants website states that one can obtain a late check-out at 3:00PM for $30, then the hotel should oblige a guests request. The hotel should not offer a check-out at 1:30PM for $30 and then state that the hotel guests sometimes prefer a specific room; therefore, they cannot accommodate the current guests request for a 3:00PM check-out. The front desk also stated that the hotel would be at capacity, which was not true, since I was fully able to book the room of my choice for the evening in question. I do not recommend this hotel due to their dishonesty and will not stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for writing a review based on your recent stay! I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you may have encountered regarding our late checkout policy as it is based on availability. We strive to provide exceptional experiences and are disappointed we did not successfully do that for your this time. Your feedback is appreciated and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back and provide you with the stellar accommodations you most deserve.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights in October – what a lovely place! Upon arriving off the busy LA roads, you are transferred to a tranquil and quiet environment of the Ayres Hotel. The lobby is grand and check in staff were friendly and welcoming, and so were the complimentary freshly baked cookies! The lobby also includes a water fountain which was handy. There are lots of interesting photographs and ship models of the Ayres family around the hotel which are very interesting to see and learn about the history of the family of years gone by.  There is ample complimentary guest parking around the hotel, which itself is situated around 10-15mins from Newport beach – 20mins from Huntington Beach, but very near to all amenities you could need, fuel, restaurants, shops, bars etc.  Our room

My son is a student at UC Irvine. I've been trying out each of the hotels nearby. I stayed at Ayres over the Anteater Family Weekend. Lovely hotel, it's an interesting layout, very large and somewhat of a maze getting to my room. It has a lovely restaurant with enclosed outdoor seating around a fountain. The room service was daily, which is exceptional. I have had to request this at other local hotels. My only complaint is that this hotel is very close to the airport, early AM sleeping was a challenge due to the planes taking off overhead. I'll definitely go back, but will arm myself with ear plugs for sleeping.

Right near the Orange County airport is a charming hotel that will make you feel  as if you've discovered a hotel in Europe to write home about. The ambiance is warm,attractive and spotlessly clean. The outdoor patio attached to the restaurant is attractive with its ring of flowers in the center.Only objection is you are under an open sky and the flight path and noise of planes .But unlike many restaruant s today it's quiet enough to have a conversation  and the food is delicious.. All over the small hotel are seafaring photographs.I  had an accessible room, which was spacious and comfortable. The only objection I had was that the tub was too high to stop over and use the shower.but there's a  bench to help you. The staff was courteous, helpful and eager to make sure that guests

We have had the pleasure of staying at the Ayres Hotel Costa Mesa multiple times. We have always had a wonderful welcoming from the staff, rooms, restaurant, bartenders have always beed great! Place is always clean, and perfectly located to all of our favorite place when visiting SoCal.

Excellent experience all around!  Accommodations were inviting clean and comfortable!  Our meeting space was ideal! And loved being steps from your pool courtyard. In addition our working lunch buffets in the courtyard were truly amazing!  Delicious in every way with such lovely seating. Loved the variety! Ambiance was delightful! Service, excellent! The location of your facilities is convenient to so much including excellent dining.  Your cuisine was SO great, I chose to eat EVERY meal there! Mmmm.  The selection was top notch and included selections for every palate including vegetarian options!  My favorite was the roasted beet salad with citrus and chicken!  Absolutely delicious.  I loved your option of dining inside, but chose to dine outside in the beautiful courtyard for

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend and they over exceeded our expectations & made our trip the best! Everything was so clean, the hotel staff were kind + helpful, and the amenities were great. The staff was very attentive even bringing us towels within 5 minutes of calling. The hotel itself has such a unique aesthetic and is so close to everything! If we ever find ourselves coming back to California we would definitely stay here again! Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: DO NOT STAY HERE - especially sports teams
Summary: The hotel is listed on a soccer stay and play list. Worst experience in 12 years of traveling. Hallways and dining area above 85 degrees. Security guard screaming at parents and cursing at children. He told parents they weren’t on vacation, shouldn’t have a drink, and screamed from the balcony at guests in the pool. The pool is located in the middle of the hotel - instead of booking the teams around the pool in case of noise, they booked the teams at the back. Children and families swimming are going to create some noise. They shut the pool down at 8 PM.  He followed several 17 year old players around, calling them “f-ing white boy tiktokers” because they recorded him following them. When confronted, he blatantly lied about it and created lies. When speaking to the manager she

-hotel staff are rude  -can’t sit anywhere’s in the hotel ground indoor or out with friends and family after 10pm! -charged me $30 for a 1pm late check out when check out is at 12pm  -object’s thrown over the wall from the Canal or 7-11 store and broke 2 windshields  -ice machines are broken
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your recent stay. I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you may have encountered regarding the service you received from our team, the amenities we offer, and the surrounding disturbances. Our goal is to provide the most exceptional experiences, and we are disappointed to see that we did not successfully do that for you. Your feedback is appreciated as we can use it as a tool to improve for the future. If you are ever in the area again, we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for a 5-star visit.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: We love the old world feel of the Ayres!  Lots of history, elegance and taste.  The courtyard restaurant - with excellent food - really reminded us of Italy.  We totally enjoyed our breakfasts and happy hours there - and you will too!  Rooms are well appointed, beds are comfortable, staff is fabulous, and the Ayres offers a great value. We would absolutely stay again.  Thank you so much for an enjoyable stay!!!

Very happy with this hotel, safe location and no additional charge for parking.  Rooms were clean and staff was great. Close to airport so you will hear some planes taking off while eating breakfast in the court.  Never really heard planes inside room.   Would definitely recommend and look forward to coming back.

We always check availability at Ayres first as it is such a comfortable and inviting place to stay when we are away from home.  We prefer the suite and take advantage of the restaurant as the food is delicious.  There is ample seating available around the pool and in the courtyard with the restaurant.  The staff is friendly and accommodating.  It is close to the airport so starting at 7 am, you can hear the planes take off.  We were not bothered by this as we have lived in the area and planes can be heard in most of the Newport Beach communities.

This was a repeat stay. Wonderful and convenient location. The staff is consistently attentive and congenial.  We are repeat guests because the hotel is reliable and a great value, especially as there is no charge for parking. The bed was very comfortable. The little touches such as coffee and muffins in the morning as well as cookies in the evening are welcomed.  Next opportunity we will return without hesitation.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, Not a Great Sleep
Summary: The Ayers is a charming older hotel with the rooms laid out around two courtyards, which gives the common spaces a nice feel, although the rooms are a little dated. For me, the challenge was that the rooms didn’t really support solid sleep: the blackout curtains are not “light tight”, the HVAC system is an older one that cycles on and off, so you can’t count on steady white noise, and the construction of the building doesn’t shield you from the noise of other guests in the rooms around and above you.
Manager Response: Dear Carol R.,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your recent stay! I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you encountered regarding the comfort of our guest rooms and the surrounding noise. Our goal is to provide the most exceptional experiences and are disappointed we did not successfully do that for you. If you are ever in the area again, we hope to have the chance to welcome you back for a 5-star visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: There is an ambience about each of the Ayers properties, but the Costa Mesa site stands a cut above.  The charming lobby, the clean up-to-date rooms, the courtyard restaurant.  And speaking of the restaurant - try the angel hair pasta with jumbo shrimp.  Delicious!  Nice happy hour, too.  Friendly people, great location.

Summary Heading: Excellant for business trvelers who needs John Wayne, Santa Ana airport close by.
Summary: I can only judge from my low class, casual business traveler who uses economy class for traveling, this hotel comes high in both service and location. Room is very clean, free parking, good restaurants around, while the in house restaurant is also a good choice.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel (but read the note below about aircraft)
Summary: A truly fantastic hotel, with comfortable rooms, welcoming environment, a nice courtyard and pool area, an absolutely outstanding restaurant and super friendly staff. Cherine and Fernando at front desk, Miguel and José at the restaurant, and all other staff members really made our stay at the hotel fantastic.   I am not given it a 5 star rating only for one reason: beware of the aircraft movements on your head! The hotel is located very close to the airport, and even if the SNA airport imposes a no-flying time from 11pm to 7am every night, if you are sensitive to noise, the flying aircraft on your heads might be annoying.   Apart from that, everything is absolutely perfect! Very recommended!!!

Very lovely hotel. The room was very clean (no carpets!) and had a mini fridge which we appreciated. It was on the first floor, close to the lobby, and we were impressed at how quiet our room was.  It is close to the airport take off runway so there is a bit of jet noise during the day, but the John Wayne Airport shuts down to jet traffic every night, so there was no noise at night. I slept like a baby. The restaurant is nice also. We had several meals there and the waiters were polite and accommodating. You also had the option of eating indoors or in a gorgeous courtyard. We would be happy to visit this hotel again in the future.

We arrived for a sporting event, and everything from check in to check out was nothing less than perfect. The room was clean and spacious, the hotel itself was beautiful. The staff in the restaurant was top notch even when we showed up with 20+ people at 8:30pm at night. The food for dinner was delicious. Breakfast staff was just as helpful and kind. Breakfast was just a little blah, potatoes were still hard and didn't taste like anything and eggs seemed a little undercooked. Lobby is beautiful and welcoming. We would definitely stay here again if we are in the area.

Summary Heading: Annual May trip for 10+ years, wonderful service!
Summary: We've made a trip to CA for client meetings in May for over the past 10+ years. The Ayres Costa Mesa was recommended to us the very first time and we've come back ever since. We book two rooms, we use the conference rooms and we order from the restaurant. The service has always been wonderful all around! See you next year!

We found this little gem of a hotel about a year and half ago and decided to have our wedding here and we have been coming for dinner and a weekend stay before our wedding day and it's always so nice and beautiful throughout. I was surprised how close this is to our home and had the best wedding and reception party here! The food is excellent and the service is always the best. We got a lot of compliments for this hotel to have our wedding at and we had plenty of family and friends stay here over the weekend and they all loved it.

Traveling for a long weekend. We selected this location for its proximity to our plans.  Friendly staff. Clean. Hotel is in the flight path. Cute patio. Nice pool and hot tub.   We’re already booked for our return trip this summer.

Summary Heading: Great staff, clean rooms, easy to find!
Summary: We rented 3 rooms. Check-in was easy, rooms were clean, and the staff was fantastic. We had breakfast in the courtyard and it was delicious. Staff very attentive to our needs, and assisted us in joining two tables together in order to accommodate all at one large table. Everyone was friendly and did all they could for us. One of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. Felt like I was appreciated and found my new home away from home. Price was great, too.

Summary Heading: Nice to see a Security Guard outside the hotel
Summary: My friends booked this hotel for us. We didn’t arrive until after midnight. Room was large and clean. I almost wish we could’ve stayed more than one night. Staff was friendly even at midnight. There are 2 buildings. We parked far away from the lobby building. Fortunately there was a  security guard outside who led us to the lobby,

The staff were all so very accomodating! Room was very nice & CLEAN! Food in the restaurant was hands down AMAZING. Quality was out of this world & so good. You will NOT be disappointed staying here!!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel - Nice Break From Chain Hotels
Summary: Rooms are large, clean, new and have character - as does the common areas and dining area.  Staff is extremely friendly.  Very convenient to Orange County John Wayne Airport and the Newport Beach area..

Very nice hotel.  Friendly staff.  Clean rooms!  Hotel shuttle.  The pool area is nice.  It was very relaxing.  The food was great at the restaraunt.  It is in a nice quiet area.  Close to the beach and shopping.

I visited the hotel while attending a conference in the area recently. The front desk staff (and shuttle staff) were very friendly, courteous, and helpful. I found them to be highly professional. The hotel itself was okay, but I would probably go somewhere else if I visited the area again. The facilities seem quite dated. The pullout couch in our room was not clean and we had to call the front desk to ask them to come and change the bedding (which they did promptly). So, an A+ for staff; a C for the hotel itself.
Manager Response: Dear GlobeTrotterNL1,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your recent stay! We are pleased to see that you were satisfied with the service you received from our team. I would like to extend my most sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have encountered regarding the cleanliness and comfort of our hotel. Our goal is to provide the most exceptional experiences, and we are disappointed to see that we did not successfully do that for you this time around. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to have the chance to welcome you back for a 5-star visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: 3 out of 5 of us were attending a conference at the hotel.  There was ample parking and rear doors to easily get to our rooms.  1 elevator which was undergoing repairs/refacing(?) but still happy to have it. Ice and vending on each floor near elevator.  As close to the airport as this is, it wasn't loud or noisy. We had 5 rooms and the hotel accommodated us to all be on one floor near each other.  Location was okay, a little hard to drive north from the hotel.  Bristol St is one way (south) at the hotel.

The entire hotel staff was wonderful, if you needed anything the staff did everything they could to assit. The Le Chateau Garden Bistro resturant has great food and service. This was my first stay at this hotel and I will definetly return.

Summary Heading: Great stay in a lovely hotel
Summary: We spent a couple of days in Costa Mesa before flying home and the hotel is perfectly located for Balboa Island and OC. Everything from to staff to the room was great and the restaurant is highly recommended.

As a Midwesterner who does not go to California often, I had never heard of this chain of hotels. I am so glad that we tried them out, and I would stay here again. The staff was friendly, helpful, and made sure things were right ( a little bump when we got there was quickly taken care of). The hotel has a beautiful courtyard with a fountain, and the restaurant and bar seemed nice - we only had drinks and dessert in the courtyard one night (yummy creme brulee). It was easy to get to, has nice handicapped parking, and is close to a gads station and 7-11. The best part for me was the handicapped accessible room - the best i have stayed in. The bed was a normal height, so I did not have to catapult into it, and the accessible shower had an adjustable shower seat that could be used

The hotel was basically fine but they are remodeling a room which was directly over ours. Loud construction noises started at 7:30 am. We had to get up and dressed and leave the room because it was very intrusive. We told them at the front desk that this was happening as we walked out to breakfast. We got no response. Poor management I am afraid.
Manager Response: Dear CMuirhead,  Thank you for writing a review based on your recent stay with us! I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you encountered in regards to the surrounding noise and renovations. Our goal is to provide the most exceptional experiences, and we are disappointed to see that we did not successfully do that for you this time around. If you are ever in the area again, we hope to have the chance to welcome you back for a 5-star visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: A nice business hotel servicing John Wayne Airport (SNA) with free shuttle service to and from the airport or anywhere within 3 miles.  This hotel is right on the flight path for SNA for it is not suitable for families with small children/infants or people who are light sleepers.  The hotel is currently being remodeled so be aware of day-time noise. The staff was wonderful, polite, and spoke several different languages.    Within a 5 minute walk you will find:  Starbucks, McDonald's, Taco Bell, sushi, Chinese, Mexican, sandwiches, AM/PM, 7-Eleven and two other gas stations.  Pom & Olive is an amazing Mediterranean restaurant with fabulous low prices.    There is a business center with two computers and printers, there are 2 standard bicycles to rent, onsite safe at the front

Summary Heading: Not as great as I had expected
Summary: I used to be local and had been in this hotel before years ago when a friend stayed here.  I recalled it being really nice at the time.  Actually staying here, though, is a different story.  First of all, if you are sensitive to noises, do NOT stay here.  This hotel is on the airport flight path so you hear the boom of every plane that takes off from SNA.    Second, I stayed here on business for three nights and not once did room service clean my room.  Every day after I came in,  my bed was never made and nothing was picked up.  Third, this place is in bad need of a facelift.  It's old and dingy.  The rooms are updated, but my shower drained poorly, and just walking through the carpeted hallways when most of the hotel is outside (and it rained the whole time I was there) was

Please do not use the 2nd entrance when arriving to this hotel. I packed an infant and luggage walked to the lobby and the door doesn't open. No signs that state that there is a main lobby when you drive in. My stay started off very frustrating. My family and I were staying here for my sisters wedding we booked multiple suites. Nice room size however the lighting is terrible, room is so dark so ladies and gents if you like to do your makeup this isn't the hotel for you or pack a ring light!!!  Overall the stay was good, staff was nice hotel was clean. It's just a bit dated.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay! We are pleased to see that you were satisfied with the service you received from our team and the cleanliness of our hotel. I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have encountered in regards to navigating around our hotel and lighting in our guest rooms. Your feedback is appreciated as we can use it as a tool to better improve for the future. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to have the chance to welcome you back for a 5-star visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: We had to temporarily stay in the hotel while our home was being fumigated commencing early Monday morning. Had made prior reservations and went in early that Monday to inquire about early checkin. The receptionist was very professional, polite and accommodating allowing us to check-in early without delay. Room was very spacious and clean,  the pillows .....well I found them to be very soothing ( down filled) my only recommendation would be to replace worn USB outlets. Asked the staff for additional blankets and they expediently supplied them. Enjoyed the restaurant, the food was very good with a wide selection. The courtyard with the waterfall was relaxing and pleasant and created a nice ambiance to enjoy during dinner.

If you love the smell of bathrooms in old gas stations where they have spilled disgusting air freshener on the floor or If you have several air fresheners hanging from your car’s visor - you will love this hotel. The smell of chemical air fresheners in this hotel is totally overwhelming!   It’s strongest in the rooms, but I could smell it in the elevator and even on the indoor/outdoor carpeting on the outdoor walkways.  I tried several different rooms. But opted for one that at least had two windows so I could get a cross breeze to eliminate the smell. Didn’t work.  It is so strong that I can taste it and it’s making my nose run.  Oh — and the pool looks dirty, and the bath towels are cheap and small
Manager Response: Dea BeachDreamer,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay! I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have encountered in regards to the surrounding smell and our pool throughout your time with us. Our goal is to provide the most exceptional experiences and we are disappointed to see that we did not successfully do that for you this time around. Your feedback is appreciated and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for an improved visit the next time you're in the area.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: We love the Ayers hotels.  This one was really nice but right at the runway at John Wayne Airport so a bit noisy.  Staff was very helpful.  Ate in their restaurant it was really good very good.   We love these hotels.

Friendly welcome, clean facility, great service, great restaurant, easy departure.  We will stay there again. Didn't have luggage cart upon arrival. Nighttime cookies were very much appreciated. Outdoor dining at the restaurant was very pleasant.  Doors remained locked after 6AM.

Max room capacity is 4 people.  I have a family of 6, so we had to get two rooms.  I requested they be adjoining or at least close to each other and we were originally placed on opposite ends of the hotel.  No complimentary breakfast. If you like to sleep in, this is not the hotel for you as the planes at SNA start taking off promptly at 8:00 and rattle the entire building every 10-15 minutes.  It’s a very pretty hotel but not the best option around. Also their coffe is horrible in the rooms and their “powdered” creamer came out of the envelope in chunks.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your recent stay! I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have encountered in regards to the surrounding noise and with the original rooms assigned to you. Our goal is to provide the most exceptional experiences for our valued guests and we are disappointed to see that we did not successfully do that for you this time around. Special requests are based upon availability, but we will always try our best to honor these preferences to the best of our ability. If you are ever in the area again, we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for a 5-star visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: Nice room. Quiet, easy check in. Good location. Had a conference there. Food was good. I would definitely go back again if in the same area. Easy in and out of the parking lot. Airplanes were never an issue at night. Loved the boat drawings and pictures.

Summary Heading: Great stay, even for just 1 night
Summary: Hotel was clean and charming. Reminded me a lot of hotels we stayed in previously in Rome and London. Comfy bed. Nice to have USB ports in the bedside lamps. Quiet AC/heating unit in room. We were located in room 201, which is right upstairs from the lobby and next to the fitness room, but we didn’t notice too much noise.

What a gem of a hotel!  For starters, the ambiance was appealing - think "old world" without crossing into pretentious territory.   I happen to like courtyards and this hotel has two  - one with an European style central fountain surrounded by tables for outdoor dining, the other courtyard with the hotel pool.    The room itself was spacious and clean.  Super comfy bed - perhaps the most comfortable hotel bed I've slept on or at least a tie for most comfortable.   The third sheet on the bed was appreciated (it covered the thick comforter and provided assurance that every surface the skin touched was freshly laundered.    But I mainly wanted to write this review to give a shout out to the fabulous shuttle drivers - both John and Chris were superb and not only provided efficient

This hotel is a real great place to say. It is located near to Newport Beach and Balboa Island which are two of our favorite places to go to. The rooms are really nice the beds are comfortable and the staff are very friendly. I have stayed here several times and this is my go to place when I come down to this area.

We generally stay at Hilton brand hotels but this time we chose to try Ayres Costa Mesa. Wow we were Pleasantly surprised at how nice it was. Despite being located right in the city as soon as you drive in the parking lot it feels very quiet with lots of pine tree landscaping . The hotel has such a unique design because you have these two large outdoor courtyards several stories tall and the hallways meander in and out of them with various hotel rooms on one side.  in other words you can walk out of your room and in a few steps you enter an outdoor hallway which goes next to one of the courtyards with the wonderful outdoor air . In one of the courtyards they have an 8 foot deep pool with an amazing Jacuzzi under an awning which was very clean. We did not try the restaurant but

I love all Ayres hotels. This one was clean, modern, and hospitable. Breakfast, room service, pool area all very nice. The hotel itself is beautiful.  Marble, antique furniture, cute outdoor patio. Our room with a view of the pool down below. Overall a wonderful place to stay.

You feel like home when you stay here, it is all So cozy.  Rooms are very spacious and clean, beds are very confortable.  The Staff in general is super friendly, always with a smile.  The restaurant is really good, breakfast in the terrace is a must.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel - highly recommended for families with students at UCI
Summary: We stayed at this hotel as we were in the area to bring our daughter to college at UC Irvine.  The hotel is a five minute trip to/from the airport (SNA) (the hotel has a shuttle that will pick you up from the airport on arrival and bring you back for departure); 10 minutes to campus; 10 minutes to the Bed, Bath and Beyond store in Santa Ana; 10 minutes to the Target stores in Tustin and Irvine University Town Center - overall, close to great shopping and restaurants and the beach (Corona Del Mar State Park).    Aside from the great location, the hotel has a European feel, great service, excellent restaurant - Le Chateau Garden Bistro, wonderful pools and work out facilities. The rooms are quite lovely too. I had rooms in both the Suites Building and a guest room in the main

We stayed here for two nights for a family wedding. The hotel is quaint and comfortable. It offers plenty of options for group gatherings. Everything was well-kept, clean and uniquely decorated. I loved the local historic photographs in the hallways! There’s a lovely courtyard that offers food service and beverages from the adjacent hotel restaurant. Our children enjoyed the pools and the staff was friendly. Our hotel room was clean and comfortable as well. My only complaint was the musty smell the room had upon entering but it wasn’t a dealbreaker. If you’re sensitive to such things, perhaps a room that is not at ground level would do the trick.

Summary Heading: so french feeling and amazing ambiance...
Summary: our room was in the main building, in between the breezeways... one of which overlooked the gorgeous french bistro garden which was absolutely beautiful, and the other overlooking the pool. it was clean, nicely done, included two sinks, a fridge and single cup coffee maker. the location of the hotel itself was practically within walking distance of the airport, and literally within walking distance of starbucks, sushi, a market, and a gas station. it was extremely convenient to the 405 and PCH.

Summary Heading: We had a block of rooms set aside for our 50th high school reunion and we were accomodated with a nice cocktail party tt
Summary: This hotel was quite lovely, with the flavor being early California history with pictures of event happening in Newport Beach and surrounding area going  back many decades.  I loved the Spanish style architecture with the center of one being a fountain and the dining area outside under umbrellas or in the sun.  Loved the food which was good prices and had the best brunch.  It was neat and clean and had the feel of a large B&B with real furniture! The staff was courteous and personable a

Staff was Super friendly & Courteous .. Property is Safe & Clean !!   Great Bang for the Buck !!  FOOD IS FABULOUS & Reasonable...    No worries about being by the Airport   Even The Jets are  Considerate .. This   will be SoCal Destination We will be  Staying again in the Future!!

Nice hotel with several unique amenities   A little on the aged side but rooms are updated   The in house restaurant had good food reasonably priced, a happy hour, and courtyard with fountain for a relaxing atmosphere.

This place was very good in every way.  Our room as spacious and nicely furnished with real furniture, as opposed to typical, boring, hotel furniture.  Comfortable  bed and bedding. Nice toiletries, roomy bathroom.  We were promptly given more coffee for the coffee maker and towels, etc. whenever we requested them.  The courtyard cafe was pleasant and the breakfast was pretty good.  There is an extended happy hour which was appreciated.  We would stay here again if ever in the area.

We just returned from a four night stay, our first, at Ayres Hotel Costa Mesa/Newport.  What a pleasant surprise it was!  From our initial registration to checkout, the Hotel staff and management could not have been any more accommodating and cordial than what we experienced.  The Hotel is kept immaculately clean, the food we tried for both breakfast and Happy Hour was wonderful and the service attentive, and the room accommodations were very comfortable.  Seemingly, the entire staff to provide service above and beyond.  The little extras, like the lobby coffee stand and water purification station and the  fresh baked cookies each night, are amenities which communicate "we value our guests."  These are things which impress frequent travelers.  We also loved the convenience of

We only spent one night but found the hotel above expectations.  Room was large and beds had very comfy mattresses.  Pool and spa very clean.  Customer service at front desk very helpful.  Restaurant was a big surprise. Lovely courtyard with fabulous menu. Food was delicious and wait staff extremely attentive.  Even had a surprise birthday dessert!!  We’d definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: I really liked this hotel, just wish they provided room service
Summary: Everything about the hotel was excellent.  I loved the courtyard and swimming pool and their restaurant's breakfast was so delicious!  The only thing 2 things I was disappointed with was that they did not provide room service and we stayed there 4 nights.  That was a long time to stay without room service.  The other thing is that we stayed in the King Suite in the main building which had a king bed and a couch bed.  The couch bed definitely needs upgraded, it was pretty hard and not very comfortable - would be nice if they  upgraded these couch beds to Serta foam or something more comfortable and nice.  Oh one more thing, but not a deal breaker - they need to restock the towels at both their pools more often.

I booked here based on the reviews so I feel I should be completely honest so the next person has all the deets. First and foremost the hotel was extremely clean and very comfortable and the front desk for the most part was very friendly. For that they would get a 5.   **Please note we were in the second building so this review is for the second building only. The issue is the noise. I realize that hotels can be noisy. However, here there are extra noises. A constant buzz sound. Every 5 minutes or so there was a random buzz and I could never find where it came from. Second the refrigerator hums constantly and never stops. It’s almost a whistle, so if it is quite you will hear it loud and clear. Third if your room is by the entry of the building be prepared to hear everything

There was literally sewage coming up from the sink and toilets. My son became ill and we spent the night at the hospital. When I went to the front desk to extend our trip one more night I figured the least they could do is give us one free night since we were in the hospital all night

The location was perfect right next to the airport with free shuttles back and forth. Restaurant was very good food and not extremely pricey.  Miquel, the waiter was exceptional -- such wonderful personality and service. The rooms were nice, however, they could have been cleaner upon check in.  Bed comfy.  You can hear everything from people walking above you in your room and every sound in the lobby and/or courtyard -- thus having a "curfew" of 10 p.m. to be quiet.  That was quite obnoxious and we were there as a group and wanted to enjoy being with each other.  In fact, the security was quite rude about it. Hallways and elevator needed cleaning.  for the entire weekend, the same pieces of lint were on the rug in the elevator throughout my stay.  I wanted to commend,

This is not an excellent hotel but was decent. There are some good things and a few not so good things. It is close to the airport so you will have early morning airplane noise. They do have a curfew so it doesn’t begin until 7 AM during the week and 8 AM on weekends but the planes fly right over the hotel. The front desk is very helpful and friendly. The beds are comfortable enough with very nice pillows but the sofa bed is not comfortable at all. I had to put the mattress on the floor with some blankets over it so I didn’t get woken up with feeling the springs through the mattress. It is clean and had a quaint feel to it.  I’m not a fan of the courtyard feel but that’s just a personal preference. I like more of an open feeling around the pool and hot tub. The hot tub was

Summary Heading: They strickly enforce a noon check out
Summary: I like this hotel. I've been staying there for years. In fact, I have friends that are friends with the owners.   And when my wife and I travel, we like being generous. We had some food delivered to the room and we tipped large. We went down to the bar and ordered a couple beers and we again tipped large. We ordered lunch by the pool and tipped large again. And when we checked out of the hotel early, we left a very large tip for the maid.    But this generosity was not returned.  We were going on an early morning bike ride and we weren't sure if we would be back by check out time. So my wife and I check out of the hotel early. We threw all our stuff into our car and rode off on bikes.  When we got back, we asked if it would be okay to use the jacuzzi before our drive home.  We

This was our second stay at the hotel, and it was as nice as the first though the pandemic created some differences.  I love the hotel, which is spotlessly clean, has a warm atmosphere, is beautifully designed throughout, and the wonderful courtyard is perfect for good meals and fellowship with others.  I hope to stay in it again in time.

Summary Heading: Motel - not even close to a “luxury” hotel
Summary: I rarely leave reviews but felt compelled after staying at the Ayres.  This property is absolutely nothing like it looks like or as it is described online.  At best it is a 2 star motor lodge motel.  Our one bedroom king suite room was dark, dingy, smelled horrible, very dirty old carpets, old furniture, old doors.  The bathroom was very small and the toilet was basically in front of the sink with no room to maneuver.  This room was in the main building which I would avoid at all costs.  Even worse than the room was the restaurant.  Our food was horrible and the service was so slow and disorganized.  We ordered salmon with vegetables and rice.  It was very evident that the food had been microwaved.  The rice was so hard you couldn’t even eat it.  Portions were tiny.  We would

We always stay at an Ayres when we visit CA. Up until this stay, we have always enjoyed this hotel. When we walked into our room, it smelled extremely musty and the carpets are long over due for a shampoo or replaced. When entering the bathroom, we were greeted by a roach on the bathroom counter. I called the front desk and Veronica apologized and promptly moved us to another room. She also added that they normally get complaints about the sewer size roaches, not the small ones. That did not make me feel better. The next room we were given was on lean in such a way that the closet door would not stay open. It would close by itself every time we opened. The door to the room had a 2 inch gaping space where at that moment understood how outside bugs enter the rooms.  We had to put

I enjoyed the calm peaceful hotel in Costa Mesa.  After a long day it was nice to come back to the hotel, have dinner and relax for a few hours before turning in for the night.  The restaurant serves delicious food both for dinner and breakfast!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your kind rating and review! We are thrilled to see that you enjoyed dining at Le Chateau Garden Bistro and you had an overall comfortable experience. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back for another stellar stay!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: I stay here for work on a weekly basis. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms could use some updating. Very close to the airport and not too far away from Newport Beach. Behind the hotel in the Ayres Plaza they have sushi restaurant and thai restaurant which is super convenient after a long night of work. I love that they have tubs with whirlpool in the king suites. Sometimes I feel like the linens do not get changed, so I do bring my own pillow cases and request for fresh linens so I can change them out myself. Hotel is equipped with fitness center and a cute courtyard for dinner. Food is pretty decent in the courtyard.
Manager Response: Dear Sandyna S.,  Thank you for your rating and review! We are pleased to see that you found our hotel to be beautiful and you enjoyed dining at our onsite restaurant. Your feedback on our linens is appreciated as we are always open to hearing ways we can better improve for our valued guests. We look forward to welcoming you back for a satisfactory stay the next time you're in the area!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: My kids and I stayed overnight for my Grandsons 6th grade promotion. Everyone had a really great time. The staff was friendly, the food was excellent, and the rooms were clean and cozy. We had a great time.

In town for a wedding with a lot of family members staying there.  It was such fun to have the courtyard available and the restaurant was fantastic, with quick and polite service outside.  Rooms were big and the beds were so comfortable. We really appreciated the 12:00 noon checkout time, too.  Oh, and the happy hour was GREAT!

This hotel is beautiful. If it was just my husband and I I'm sure we would have walked around and had a few cocktails, but from what we saw it was nice.   We checked in at 4. Myself and about 5 or 6 other people checking in had to wait to fully check in because rooms were not ready. It was only about a 10 minute wait. We got to the room which was very easy to find. Room was very nice, had a microwave,  mini fridge and jacuzzi tub. We were with our kids otherwise I would have enjoyed that tub.   We pretty much just slept there overnight. Didn't walk the grounds or anything. Didn't even check out the pool, which I thought we were going to do.   My 3 stars is because of the beds. Those beds were one of the most uncomfortable beds I have ever slept on. We need more reviews about the
Manager Response: Dear DebbieSneed,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay! We are thrilled to see that you found our hotel to be beautiful and you had an overall great experience. I would like to extend my most sincere apology for any discomfort you may have encountered in regards to the bedding in our guest rooms. Your feedback is appreciated as we are always open to hearing ways in which we can better improve. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to have the opportunity to welcome you back for an improved visit!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: My wife and I had our wedding reception/ceremony at a nearby off-site location and to accommodate some guests that were traveling out of town, we reserved a section of rooms at the Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa.   The team at the Ayres were exceptional and we couldn’t have been any happier with the service we received. We would like to shine a spotlight on the Senior Sales Manager Kara Kellogg!! She was amazing and we are so thankful that we had her support throughout this booking process. Due to COVID there was a lot of shuffling that took place with our wedding date and therefore the dates on the wedding block had to be adjusted.   She was more than flexible with us and was very communicative. I’m so glad that on the day of our event she came out of her office and introduced

We were in town with a group for a wedding. The courtyard worked very well for gathering in small groups, having drinks and eating. Food/bar service was excellent. All employees were friendly and helpful and the location was perfect. The food in the restaurant was also very good. The only downsides are the intermittent jet noise during the day and the fact that, although the room was clean overall, the carpet needed a good cleaning and seemed to have a smell of urine. We would stay here again. Overall nice hotel.

I love the courtyard!  My room was comfortable and clean. I love that there is a fridge but wish there was a micro wave too.    I return to this location time and time again whenever I visit OC. I love this hotel!

Our stay was great. The only reason why I don't give them 5 stars is our room smelled. Like bug spray or musty. It was clean but just had a bad odor. Other than that, the food and staff was amazing. Very very friend from checking in to the staff at the restaurant. we had a great time.

My wife and I found ourselves needing a hotel last minute due to a delayed, then canceled flight. Securing a room after a day of frustration and six hours on a plane at the terminal, was a God send. We stayed at your hotel about five years ago fir a family wedding and were totally comfortable then as well. Thank you for attention to detail, excellent service and cleanliness. We especially loved your restaurant, having enjoyed dinner and breakfast. We’ll be back I’m sure.

Room was fine, tv was tiny compared to most, outside courtyard was nice and peaceful. My complaint was that the security confronted me saying that my daughter was being to loud. That he could hear her screaming from inside her 2nd floor room. He was by the front desk...lol... interesting since I was in the room next door and couldn't hear a thing. Not saying she wasn't laughing with her friend having fun on a vacation, but seriously...screaming. it was probably me watching the fights.

Excellent service, extremely clean, very quiet. The staff is excellent very friendly and really cater to their guests. A lovely hotel environment that meets all requirements of an excellent hotel experience and stay at a very affordable price Fresh coffee and muffins provided in the mornings.

This hotel was decently priced. The hotel was beautiful inside and out. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. Very clean and friendly staff. I will return to this hotel the next time I am in the area.

All staff very nice.  We have stayed at the Ayers Costa Mesa many times.  Just retuned from staying there 13 nights. We missed receiving USA Newspaper.  The muffins in the morning were not always available.  They are very good.  Too bad they cannot set 2 aside for you.  The pool is pleasant. Hotel is close to our family, Newport Beach, Huntington Bech and South Coast Plaza.

Great rooms awesome staff great location. Going to come again. Really enjoyed the ambiance and the pools were great.  Excellent room service. Super clean. I highly recommend it to my family and friends.

Summary Heading: Ayers is our Home Away from Home.
Summary: The Ayers in Costa Mesa has become our go to when we visit our daughter and her family.  The price is fair, the rooms are always spotless, spacious, and comfortable and the staff is thoughtful and kind.

Lesley has always been a wonderful person when we come to the hotel.  Lesley is personable and provides excellent customer service.  The staff was friendly and helpful throughout the visit.  William and I will continue to return.

From the moment I stepped onto the van for the ride from the airport, until I left two days later, I was provided  nothing but great service. Everyone was friendly, the atmosphere was charming, the room comfortable and clean. It ended up being a great place to spend time with extended family. We spent hours both on the courtyard as well as inside the restaurant dining and visiting. It was the perfect setting. I’ll be back!

I have to say, Ayres Costa Mesa has become my favorite place to be! It’s like an oasis. I can be in one place, have great service, delicious food and beautifully prepared, perfect atmosphere, relaxing poolside lounging, and even bring a pet! I have stayed 3 times and each time exceeded my expectations. The other day I referred to it as “my house” when asking my grandson if he was coming over from his nearby dorm to visit. As soon as I said it, he laughed and said, “Grandma, that’s not your house.” I said, “It’s better!”

Circumstances caused me to have to travel to HB by myself. I have MS and need very specific accommodations so I don't fall. When I arrived in my scooter the staff was respectful and aware of my need/ request for a specific type of room. They were helpful and kindly directing me where to park. Having stayed in this area before, I'd choose the Ayres hotel for future visits.

This hotel is next to South Coast Plaza and close to Fashion Island.  The property is nice with large rooms (kitchenette) and the rates are reasonable compared to other local hotels.  Staff provided good customer service and the hotel restaurant served good food.  The only negative is the room needed new carpet.

We stayed in a junior suite. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. We ate breakfast and dinner at the hotel restaurant a couple of times. They had good food and friendly staff. We could also get food 'to go' and eat in our room.  We stayed 4 days. Because of Covid, housekeeping will not service the room everyday. It is ok to use the same sheets and towels, but trash is a problem. Trash builds up in the two small trash cans in the room. If you eat meals in the room, you will have to take the trash out yourself.  You might also run out of toilet paper, chase housekeeping to get toilet paper and tissue paper.  It is an old hotel, but kept up fairly well. No internet connection on TV so you would not be able to see your favorite Netflix movies, but free wireless for your

We have stayed at the Ayres Hotel a number of times since April 2020 and have been very please with the service, restaurant and staff. The rooms are always clean and sparkly - linens are fresh and the bathroom is very nice too. We would highly recommend!!

It’s been a good experience staying at Ayres Bristol Costa Mesa. Quiet near the freeway and airport. Food are awesome and price are reasonable. I am recommending the place again for such wonderful time of stay at the place. Customer services are awesome and friendly.   Regards,  Normelita

Summary Heading: Best hotel I have ever stayed in...
Summary: For anyone who knows me, or has taken a look at my profile, you will note that I am well-travelled, and I have stayed in many hotels, ranging from bad to good and everywhere in-between. This review is about, in my humble, experienced opinion, the best hotel in the world. Not the most expensive or the most lavish, rather one that hit every possible target dead center. Quite exceptionally, and as I was relocating I stayed in this hotel for a long time (in total 6 weeks).  The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable (I stayed in two different rooms – about halfway through my stay, and at my request I moved to a larger room (for a modest rate increase), the front desk had no issues and happily modified my reservation and even sent someone to help move my luggage.  The restaurant

I have stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa several times in the past. My experience is the same..The Hotel is very well decorated and designed for the price point    The home baked cookies at 530 pm are a nice touch. We had dinner with Tempura Shrimp.appetisers for only 6 dollars..The shrimp were large.  I utilized the Jacuzzi as well. For locals wanting a getaway day or travelers passing thru Orange County check it out

We had a wonderful experience, the staff was friendly, the pool was kept warm (since we did stay at this location in January) The whole experience took us away I felt like I was in Italy! When we went to breakfast they asked us if we would like to sit inside which was very nice.  Mask & social distancing was , which I was not a fan of, but they were very polite about it.  Customer satisfaction was definitely their top priority:)

I was pleased with the accommodations. It was a nice room . The staff was helpful and friendly. I had been on the road for 31 hours straight so it was nice to be able to check in and relax. I ordered room service the first night. The food and service was very good. The front desk mailed a letter for me and arranged for a cab to pick me up and take me to the wedding. All in all it was a great experience

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Staff, Fantastic Venue
Summary: My fiancé and I stayed here the first weekend of December, when we were supposed to get married there. Thanks to COVID, we had to postpone it a year but thought it might be nice to go and get away anyways. It was LOVELY. They took such good care of us, the room was huge, and it had a jacuzzi tub that fits two. I was in heaven. Delicious dinner and breakfast too. All smiles here :) thanks Dana and team!!

Lovely boutique hotel with beautiful courtyard restaurant and pool area.  Delicious food in the restaurant.  Clean and very friendly staff.  We have stayed here multiple times and the quality is consistent.  Highly recommend!

The thing that struck me most about this hotel was how nice everyone was. From the front desk to the restaurant and everyone in between. It was so refreshing.  The rooms are a nice size as well. I'm so tired of spending a ton of money for a miniature hotel room. I could work comfortably with the large couch and desk.  Finally, we had a small issue and it was taken care of immediately. I love it when people care.  I wan't to highly recommend, but I also kinda want to keep it all for myself.  Shirin

Very much enjoyed my stay (11/8 - 11/13), very clean, elegant, comfortable, love the hotel gym, unlimited restaurants, shopping centers, things to do near by. Staff very friendly and professional. I stayed at many hotels during this pandemic period and this hotel is by far the best in making you feel comfortable while keeping you safe.

First time staying here.  The staff were very friendly, check in/out were a breeze.  The rooms are very clean-slightly outdated. Beds were comfortable. Adorable outside courtyard  for food and drinks. I will definitely stay here again.

Clean hotel and friendly staff. We have stayed at this property several times and we have never been disappointed. It resembles an Old World style which makes the property quaint and comfortable. Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: Hidden Jewel - Great Place to Stay
Summary: I’ve stayed here now 3 times in the past 2 months and look forward to my next stay. Great prices, great service, nice hotel. Very comfortable beds. Clean. Beautiful lobby and courtyard. Not too crowded. Great location near Orange County airport, Newport Beach, Huntington Beach and lots of great shopping and restaurants. Close to Fashion Island. The building next to main hotel is recently remodeled and has a more modern look and jacuzzi bathtubs. But either building is fun to stay in. Definitely be going back again soon!

I come out to CA every 45 days and Ayres is my go to place to be with my children so they can enjoy its facility, friendly staff and their lovely courtyard as we have our meal. It feels like you're in Italy...   Highly recommend Ayres Hotel in general!

the employees were very friendly at the check in counter and we were a family of 8 people. we needed three separate rooms and they accommodated us with no problems. Rooms were very clean and the price was excellent. Ate in their lobby restaurant and the service was very good there also but were we were sitting there was a very strong cat smell! All in all a very good experience.

Really nice hotel, friendly staff, clean rooms.  Hand Sanitizer when enter and people socially distanced in elevators which I really appreciated.   Would definitely stay here again. My partner and I stayed in a king suite with the jet tub- I highly recommend.

Summary Heading: More like a motel not hotel
Summary: Very old and cheap looking place.  Definitely a motel not a hotel. Not sure why this place is rated at 4 stars maybe 2 stars. Tiny room. Looked like a haunted house inside and outside definitely will be avoiding this place.

This hotel is so beautiful. Loved the decor in the lobby, hallways, room and that restaurant in the middle of the building! Gorgeous! The front desk staff, waiters, even maintenance were friendly and inviting. I wish we stayed more days to explore the rest of the hotel. Will definitely be returning here.

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel and very good restaurant
Summary: We made a last minute reservation to visit a family member in the hospital. We have stayed here before and liked the Hotel. This stay was brief, but we got a nice room and met some other family for breakfast the following morning. The room is spacious, with a refrigerator and coffee maker. If there is a down side, the Hotel is close to the airport and it can be loud after 7 AM.

My stay was nice. I think hotel stays have a different vibe/energy in the midst of the COVID. The prices were fair and COVID regulations are being implemented & followed. The rooms & hotel were clean & the workout room is FIRST CLASS. I think they should have a fungoes shui expert come in because I was not a fan of the mirrors on the wall facing the window. They had Prime Rib available and breakfast avavible also with nice outdoor patio seating. Parking was plentiful & safe but strict. You have to remember to place your parking ticket on your dash or risk being towed. There is a small center that you can walk too also that has massage, hair salons & a really good breakfast/lunch cafe with yummy coffees & teas. It was a Good Stay :)

Front Desk Staff upon check in was GREAT! Shout out to Courtney for helping us upgrade our room! And that's where the great experience ends. We stayed here back in July and it was amazing, we recommended this hotel to friends and decided to return here this weekend for a family "staycation". This time we booked for 3 nights, we checked in on Thursday evening and stayed through Sunday. On Saturday night we decided to go to a drive in movie with the kids. While there we received a call from the front desk around 8pm, the woman told my husband our card on file declined and to stop by the front desk... we were confused as we had paid for our room in full plus our deposit at check in. But we were enjoying our family time and told her we'd stop in when we returned. She did not state

Comfortable, clean, relatively new, responsive.    We needed a place to go to for repose from the smoke and wildfires. A good spot.  Made our reservation over the phone, staff was friendly, helpful and swiftly accommodating.  Check in was easy and we rented a suite for five nights with a very fair rate.  The stay was quiet, uneventful, restful. Little to no noise from other guests. Parking was also very good.   What could be better?  -Swifter pick up of trash from trash bins in lobby, laundry and ice areas. On a few occasions, there were overflowing.   -Front Desk staff were very sweet, kind and really did their best. I got the impression they were easily overwhelmed or maybe they got slammed on the weekend, but perhaps the hotel is understaffed?  -Parking lot was being

This hotel is good for the price. The location was okay- there are some restaurants within walking distance, but you do need a car to get anywhere. The hotel itself and the room were a little run down looking- broken curtain in my room, messy floors- but comfortable overall. Comfortable place to stay if you're visiting the area.

This hotel is great for the price.  Nice rooms with Great beds!  Staff is very nice.  Two swimming pools and a hot tub.  The courtyard is nice to eat at, outside.  The food was good at breakfast, before the virus. They had a buffet you paid for.  Plenty of great places to have dinner in the area.  All rooms have a frig, coffee maker, and microwave. Maybe, only the suites have the microwave!? Anyway, very good for the bucks!  I have stayed there several times. Always clean. Good travels and be safe!

Summary Heading: Family and Friends visit to Newport Beach
Summary: Ayres Suites was like home away from home. When I arrived to the hotel I was greeted by the front desk Personnel. They were professional friendly. This visit was a family visit. I’ve lived in Newport Beach for 27 years. Regretfully, miss living here. I sold my home in 2016 moved to New Jersey to be closer to be adult children. My visit back the Ayres Suites Hotel was my 1st choice to stay. Close to everything . Arriving into Santa Ana airport the Ayres Hotel was close to the airport. Don’t let that fool you! Is a gem. The Newport Beach and all it has to offer is 8 minutes away. My photos below was taken in Balboa and Lido Island. I gave Ayres Suite a Five Stars. “ Outstanding “safe clean close to everything.

Went and decided to stay in Patio King Junior Suite (Rm.167 I think). There was hair on the bed and in the tub, mold in the fridge, and red "blood like" stains on the curtains. The phone also didn't work. So, I had to walk to the front desk which is located in a separate building to notify them of these concerns. They bought in a new fridge that barely cools anything. A lady came in to "clean" the curtain, but when she left there was still red stains on it. They never rectified the hair situation on the bed but it was only on the comforter, so I tossed that on the floor. And I didn't realize the hair in the tub until late at night but I couldn't call the front desk because the phone still wasn't working.  Would I stay here again? No. There is no reason why a hotel room, let

Fun! Clean. They were able to accommodate my entire family, very comfortable and clean. The price for the area and location was perfect! Way better and accommodating than an ARBNB. Very easy to find. Parking was perfect too!

We visit the Ayres Costa Mesa- Newport location whenever we are in town. The hotel is charming and the customer service is always excellent!  Our room was impeccably clean and the Courtyard dining is so special and unique.  We truly enjoy our stay every time!

The hotel lobby and other common areas look decent. However the rooms are dated and run down. The Jacuzzi tub only fits one person. Also, check-in is 3 PM, but my room was not ready when I went to check in around 3:15 PM, and I had to come back and ask for a different room because the manager had given me a room without a Jacuzzi tub. There are plenty of hotels near Orange County Airport with the same price point. I would recommend going to another hotel.

The rooms were very clean.  Pool was nice too.  We loved the spaciousness of the rooms.  We had adjoining rooms with our family and that was a wonderful experience.  We will definitely be  going back here.  Will be our new "home" when visiting the Orange County Area!

Excellent location, services and amenities along with a very friendly and knowledgeable staff!  The hotel and room were beautifully maintained and cleaned to perfection!  I would stay her again anytime I visit the area.  Staff goes above and beyond in making their guests stay a memorable one! Even being so close to the airport you never here a sound when you are in your room.

Hotel with nice decor.  We enjoyed having breakfast in the terrace next to the fountain.  Unable to enjoy the bar and indoor dining area due to covid-19.  Staff was great.  Rooms and pool area were clean. Make sure to ask for a room away from the pool and terrace as I'm sure it could be a little noisy.

Property is beautiful. The grounds are very well maintained. The room was very clean, there just needs to be a full length mirror. Bed very comfortable. Pool and Jacuzzi were perfect. Food tasted great, although a few more menu selections would have been nice.

We checked in and the front desk staff was great. Got to our room in the main building and it smelled really weird. Room was simple and outdated. We checked things out and discovered there were a bunch of little bugs crawling out of a small crack near the bathtub. We phoned the front desk and they offered to move us to a suite, complimentary upgrade, in the renovated building.   Our new room was larger and bug free. The hallways smelled like sewer and were hot. The new room also had a weird chemical and moldy smell. Not sure what it was. We travel with a candle and room spray so the room odor was bearable after the candle was lit and we sprayed the room.   The window AC unit was loud and clunky. The bed was not very comfortable. The refrigerator, table, and couch in the room

Everything was great until I tried to watch tv and it was too small to see. I suggest getting larger TVs.  But pool was nice, one pool was being fixed during our stay. Also gym didn’t have sanitizer during our stay.

Holiday weekend , it was very nice 👍 to stay there . Good, great people with good attitude, helpful, friendly staff service. We thank you 🙏 guys for the way you treated my family so glad to have you in area.

The room is okay;  you can barely hear the airplanes from the airport, and you get free cookies at night and muffins in the morning (I wish they would have told me about it the 1st night, we discovered it ourselves) .... but the pool and jacuzzi make this place special!

Ayres Hotel is by far the best hotel I have ever been to. Clean, beautiful, and the staff is amazing. I had my wedding here recently and I couldn't have asked for a better place or a better staff to have my wedding with. Thank you all so very much for a day and experience I would never forget.

Our stay was amazing! We were there for a wedding. It was beautifully set up both for the ceremony and the cocktail hour and the area for food and dancing. The only thing I would have changed was the temperature in the hall were the dancing took place, it was a bit hot. Other than that it was a wonderful stay.

Very nice and clean room, comfy bed, beautiful property and large pool with lovely surrounding area. There is a nice central outdoor patio area for dining or sit inside the restaurant.  Staff was always friendly and the complimentary breakfast was a few choices off of the restaurant menu. A very enjoyable stay and I will definitely reserve there again.

I came to Newport Beach for my doctor consultation appointment. The room was dirty with moths and bad smell.  The staff are unfriendly. Cleaning service is poor.  I Left day early. I am not recommend it this hotel.

I want to take the time to say thank you to the wonderful and friendly hotel staff!  I was met by rain this AM. And needed to go from suites to shuttle, Israel was so wonderful to escort with an umbrella!! That’s really going above and beyond!!!

It sucked. Was hoping for a relaxing time with my wife, but the atmosphere killed it. The only redeeming factor was the pleasant staff. It was drab and depressing. The room smelled of cleaner and was outdated. Much better options nearby. Will not come back.

The hotel staff was very helpful!  The rooms were very nice with bar sink, fridge and microwave included.   The suite had an amazing bathtub with jets.  I would love to see a cable television upgrade...my husband's only complaint.   Buffet breakfast was included in the cost of the room. Overall,  it was a lovely weekend couple get away!! Hoping to Enjoy it again!
Manager Response: Dear Travelingat60,   Thank you for your stellar rating and review! We are pleased you enjoyed the jetted tub in your room and you were satisfied with the service you received from our team members. Your feedback on our television service is appreciated and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: The Staff member who checked me in was rude and unprofessional. I came for some peace and quiet before I had to fly back out for work and I was only harassed for signature. Ridiculous. See review left on hotel site for additional information.

The hotel was clean and updated.  The staff from the front desk to the maids were friendly and professional.  The onsite restaurant staff was also friendly and professional.   The food was great - Both breakfast and dinner.

This was a sister trip and ate everyday in the restaurant.  Wonderful food, great staff, comfortable rooms and the location was great.  It is close to the airport so you will hear the planes, but that is part of the charm

I’ve stayed here a few times always had a excellent stay. The van was quick & efficient with friendly service. The checkin staff provided excellent customer service. My Suite was modern with comfortable furniture. The bed was awesome. Overall I had a excellent stay.

The hotel was beautiful, particularly the court yard. They had a small bar and restaurant that were quite nice and not too pricey. The rooms are spacious but the king bed I was in, and at least one from another friends room, was extremely springy - as in springs were old and sticking in your back depending on how you rolled. The beds somehow were stiff with no support at the same time. Because it was a king bed and I was alone I could move around the springs, but it certainly leaves something to be desired.

Have stayed at the Costa Mesa Hotel numerous times; does not disappoint.  Clean and comfortable.  Italianate Design and surroundings and the friendly staff make customers feel special.  Within six miles of beach life and shopping.  Only negative comment I can make is the hotel is on a one way road which is at times inconvenient; but is of no fault of the hotel.

Very comfortable hotel. Large rooms. Friendly staff. Free EV charging. Free WiFi. Free parking. Have stayed here many times. Small but inexpensive breakfast buffet. Our hotel of choice when we are in the Costa Mesa area.

I spend 4 beautiful night on this amazing facilities nice location good and nice bedroom, amazing pool, breakfast no words for describe. This hotel make my stay  was spectacular I recommend and if I have other opportunity to go I will do it again.
Manager Response: Dear 791luisrp,   Thank you for your kind rating and review! We are delighted to see that you had an exceptional 4-night stay with us and you enjoyed dining with us at Le Chateau Garden Bistro. It would be a pleasure to welcome you back the next time you're in the area!   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: Nice cozy hotel with old world charm.  The room we had was a suite with a sitting area and little 'bar' area-quite nice.  The bed was very comfortable and both my husband and I had the best sleep there-better than home.  Keep in mind, this hotel is very close to the Airport so you will hear jets taking off early in the morning (7am start it seemed).  I sleep with earplugs whenever I travel as I don't like to hear other guests going and coming at night or early morning so it didn't bother me or wake me.
