We ate in the restaurant one night and it was OK.  We stayed here 3 nights in January 2020.
Manager Response: Dear Sun Chaser G,   Thank you for your thoughtful review based on your recent stay with us! We are thrilled to see that you found our guestrooms to be comfortable and cozy. Your feedback is appreciated and if you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back for another great stay!   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: LOVED the beds, great vintage atmosphere, great staff
Summary: I slept so good on the comfortable bed and great pillows. I need a pillow like that for home, what brand is on your beds? loved the bathroom was separated from the bedroom. There was a fridge and sink in the bedroom, great for leftovers. We ate at their restaurant and it was excellent. Will review as well. FREE PARKING! hello, that is initially why I chose this hotel. We came to shop and leave stuff in the trunk, so don't wanna deal with valet. Parking was free and plentiful. Doors were secure, you need a card to get in, liked that. They had cookies out in the evening. They have a very early breakfast buffet, which we slept thru both days. Plane noise a non issue. The beautiful patio garden with a big fountain was great but too chilly to enjoy. Staff was great and we had an easy

The included buffet breakfast was excellent including the service.  Towels were missing in our room and had to request for some.  Stay was ok if you don’t mind the sound of planes after 7am and before 10 pm as it is close to John Wayne Airport.

Summary Heading: Nice cozy hotel with great staff
Summary: Stayed one night for an event.  The hotel has an upscale, home feeling.   Hotel staff is friendly and accommodating.  Restaurant on site as well with great food selections and pricing.   Great stay near the John Wayne Airport.  Hotel offers free shuttle service to and from the airport.

I have stayed at the "Ayres Hotel Costa Mesa" in Newport Beach for some 15 plus years. I go there annually to visit family. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Just to name a few. It's very convenient for me as I live in a different state, it's only 5 minutes away from the John Wayne Airport. Ayres must treat their employees very well as I know many of them by name as they have worked there for many years. The hotel, restaurant and other staff members are very friendly & helpful with all aspects of your stay. All the rooms & suites are very well appropriated clean & comfortable.  This hotel also has 2 swimming pools & hot tubs. For a great dining experience do not miss the Le Chateau Garden Bistro which has amazingly good food, you will not be disappointed which

The hotel was five minutes from the airport and they had a free shuttle.  This hotel  had a very nice lobby and court yard. I have not complaints, the staff was knowledgeable and rooms were clean.  The man in charge of the shuttle went out of his way to make sure I was at the airport in time.  Definitely would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Terri Z,  Thank you for your thoughtful rating and review! We are pleased to see you were satisfied with the service you received from our team members and that you had an overall great stay. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: There was nothing wrong with our stay by any means. The hotel was clean and staff (the limited interaction we had) were okay. I have zero complaints about the room but the overall hotel was just okay. There was a very small conference, maybe 10 people, in dining room area,  so we were unable to walk through to get out and to the front lobby. That was a little inconvenience, especially because it was raining. The walkway to the front was along the busy street so I could see someone with kids having an issue with that.  The hotel is very close to many accommodations. That was convenient. We did not stay here long enough for us to fully experience the hotel or the area. Nothing really stood out to us as amazing, but there wasn't anything terribly wrong either.
Manager Response: Dear Danielle F,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review based on your recent stay. We are pleased to see that you had an overall great stay with us and found our hotel to be in a convenient location. I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you encountered in regards to the events happening during your stay and maneuvering around our hotel. Your feedback is appreciated and we hope to welcome you back if you are ever in the area again!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: With the exception of a slight discrepancy in the final bill which I will be addressing shortly The hotel staff and experience was good. I think my biggest issue with the hotel was that I did not know that there was construction going on which was kind of a pain. Had I known that I would’ve encouraged my niece to try and get a better room rates for her guests.  The dinner was great and our accommodations were good.

I stayed at the hotel for a business trip. I arrived at 4 pm, but couldn’t check in because of a computer issue. They told me to check back in an hour. About 20-30 minutes later, a coworker arrived and was allowed to check in, so I went back to the front desk from the bar as a bus full of people arrived and I had to wait in line behind them all while they checked in, despite my arrival being ahead of them.   When I got to my room, the air wasn’t on. It was hot and musty in the room. The room was nothing more than average, at best.   The location was good, and they offer an airport shuttle, which is nice, but the airport is very close. In fact, it’s so close that the noise is almost unbearable at times. The planes did stop around 11 pm, but we’re back at it early in the morning.

We have stayed here a few times and have had great experiences. Staff were friendly and helpful. Great price . The happy hour is great and the dinner was really good!! The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. We will definitely stay here again.

Very nice rooms, great amenities, friendly staff and convenient location. Great breakfast, nice pool, several meeting areas, and shuttle service to and from airport was much appreciated. The Ayers hotel was almost too nice for a business trip. For my next stay I will have to bring my family along with.

Ayres Chateau has been a family favorite for years and has hosted guests of UCI in a comfortable and affordable way. There is a convenient shuttle from SNA to the hotel and to the university. Wish it had stayed a secret.
Manager Response: Dear Patricia T,  Thank you for your 5-star rating and review! We are pleased to see that we are your chosen hotel in the area and that each of your stays has been comfortable. We look forward to welcoming you again!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Clean and close to the airport
Summary: This is older style hotel with dated rooms. Everything was clean though. Location is close to the airport, UCI, etc. While convenient, the close proximity to the airport also makes it loud when planes are near. Shuttle to the airport was great!

Ayers is a super place for people to get together in big groups. Twice now ten years apart we have been to Ayers for class reunions and getting together with everyone in the courtyard. Good location and close to everything. Restaurant is good. Breakfast is good, they know how to cook bacon!!
Manager Response: Dear Arlene M,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your experiences with us! We are delighted to see that both of your class reunions at our hotel went well and that you enjoyed the food we offer at Le Chateau Garden Bistro. It is a pleasure to provide exceptional experiences for our valued guests and we look forward to welcoming you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: While the site was under construction, I didn’t mind it that much.  It was the airplane traffic that really bothered me.  I won’t be staying here again.  Too noisy and kept me up well onto the night and then woke me up at 6:30am!
Manager Response: Dear 577karib,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay. I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you experienced in regards to external noise surrounding our hotel. We wish the best experiences for our valued guests and would love to be able to welcome you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The Hotel looks and smells old. The parking is very small. You are either parking right next to another car or you have to take up two parking spots. The staff are Great, but the bed is too soft. After the second morning, my back was hurting. Make sure that there’s No more then 6 people in an elevator at one time or you will be stuck. It has happened two times while we was there. The breakfast, lunch and dinner was great.
Manager Response: Dear mikkie2003,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent experience with us. We are pleased to see that you've enjoyed dining at Le Chateau Garden Bistro and that you were satisfied with the service you received from our team members. I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you encountered in regards to the bed and our elevators. We strive to provide our guests with exceptional experiences and your feedback is appreciated as we can certainly utilize it as a tool to better improve. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back for an improved experience!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed 2 nights and this was booked as a group booking with my daughters softball team. The booking was easy to do and the reservation and check-in process went smoothly. The check-in was quick and friendly. The rooms were clean, quiet, and comfortable. The grounds are beautiful. The immediate surrounding area has lots of food options and gas and easy freeway access. The only negative to report is the restaurant on premises. They were out of French Dips at 5pm. They offered prime rib as a substitution but it was double the price at $40 a plate and nothing was done or offered for the inconvenience, such as a small discount on the Prime Rib. The service was verrrrrry slow as well. The food that the rest of the family ordered was sub par for the price paid. We would not

Since we had our son's wedding block here in 2016 we always find ourselves coming back as we know it'll be a must wonderful stay!  From the comfy rooms to the clean pool to the gorgeous courtyard. We always enjoy the restaurant and having a drink white sitting in the courtyard which is magical at night. I highly recommend the Ayres!!

Summary Heading: The entire staff is outstanding and did everything to make my trip special.
Summary: Thank you for having the wonderful staff you have! Everyone was so nice to me while I was there I just cant say THANK YOU for all they did. Miguel in the restaurant was especially kind and really took very good care of me. The food was fantastic and the court yard made every day special!
Manager Response: Dear Jill J,  Thank you for taking the time to write a kind review! We are thrilled to see that we were able to provide you with an exceptional stay at the Ayres Hotel Costa Mesa, especially Miguel at Le Chateau Garden Bistro. We strive to provide each of our guests with the best experiences and we hope to welcome you back sometime soon!  Sincerley,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stay at this hotel 4-5 times per year for kids athletic events and have never been disappointed with the service, the room or the amenities. We checked in Saturday and were mistakenly given a room with a single bed and within 5 minutes we were in a room with two queens. The pool is always a hit after a long day and the breakfast discount for the kids makes it comparable to going out.
Manager Response: Dear Adrienne M,  Thank you for your thoughtful review based on your experiences with us! We are pleased to see that you have enjoyed each of your stays at our hotel and the service you received from our team members. We look forward to welcoming you all back the next time you're in town!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: A beautiful, serene, family oriented, fun-filled oasis amidst the oppressive heat & formidable freeways
Summary: Spacious rooms for families Location is quite close to Santa Airport Friendly, courteous staff, very patient with large groups of children, who had a soccer tournament near by. The staff always had ice cubes and plastic bags for the tired boys in the lobby, restaurant and courtyard, despite the fact that there are ice machines on every floor, the buffet breakfast was always sumptuous, nutritious, healthy with an array of choices. The beautiful pool and jacuzzi offered a soothing balm to the aching limbs of tired athletes Thank you
Manager Response: Dear Bertand N,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a thoughtful review based on your recent stay! We are thrilled to see the team enjoyed our spacious guestrooms and had an overall exceptional stay. It is with great pleasure that we provide stellar experiences for our valued guests and we hope to welcome you back the next time you're in town!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with nice amenties.
Summary: Oceanside to Huntington Beach can be a traffic mess on a holiday, hence the stay at Ayres the night before Thanksgiving. It was a very   relaxing evening with comfortable bed, restful sleep and very nice front desk service with smiling people! That makes a stay even better when you can connect with the staff. I have stayed here before when I lived in OC so familiar with the Hotel and will stay again when needed. Great staff, nice rooms and knowing I will be comfortable makes it great!

Summary Heading: A little bit of Europe in CA
Summary: A real jewel close to the airport. When you walk into the living room the area where you check in You have to remember where you are. Many rooms even over look the courtyard complete with fountain. The staff go out of their way to make everyone feel comfortable. The food is gourmet. The little plates 4 to 6 is our favorite part in the late afternoon.

The front desk and security was the worst ever. Woman behind the front desk should not be dealing with the public. She hates people. Very rude! Booked the shuttle to leave for the airport at 5:00am the night before and then received a call at 4:45 that the shuttle was full and we had to Uber. Just one example. Never again! The rest of the staff, including food and room service were very nice.

Summary Heading: AFTER  25 YEARS WHAT CAN I SAY
Summary: What is already known could stand being repeated it is what I say every year I come back,to my home away from home twice a year for 25 years.. May it be for the friendly stall the clean rooms great Bloody Mary's and my new favorite the seafood bisque love it! Who knows some day I might even use the gym, thanks guys...

Came down to be with my 93 year old mother.  Turns out this hotel was far from her current residence.  In and out of this property was also a bit troublesome.  Worst of all, this property was FAR below the level that one would expect from this chain.  I have stayed in Ayers hotels (for the same purpose when they were in those respective areas) in Seal Beach and in Laguna Woods, and those properties were Excellent.  That is why I chose Ayers again.  This was a bundled trip through Expedia.  When I discovered my error of location, and was very disappointed with the property, I informed them Last Night, that I would be departing today.  They advised me to speak with Expedia.  Expedia advised me that they would have to speak with the manager at 9 AM this morning, and that I would

Very very nice hotel.  The bed was beyond comfortable, the courtyard cafe had very good for and service, pool area was fun. Very quiet even though close to airport.  Walking distance to several good restaurants.   I will definitely come back on my next trip to SNA.
Manager Response: Dear Jan T,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review based on your recent stay! We are pleased to see that you found our guestrooms to be comfortable and you enjoyed dining at our onsite restaurant, Le Chateau Garden Bistro. It would be a pleasure to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This definitely is not a 4 star hotel. Rooms were average but clean. Free parking was awesome. The courtyard is very quaint, especially at night. Spent some time at night under the stars and cute lights...until I saw a cockroach. Ew.
Manager Response: Dear 77Ellee,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay with us. We are pleased to see that you enjoyed our complimentary parking, as well as spending time in our quaint courtyard. I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have experienced throughout your stay. Our team strives to provide exceptional experiences for our valued guests, so please let us know of any issues you may encounter during your stay and we will do our best to resolve it in a timely manner. We hope to welcome you again!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at the Seal Beach location, Fountain Valley and this past July at the Costa Mesa/NewportBeach location. Each summer my husband and I head to Southern California for a little R & R. The Ayres hotel staff and accommodations never disappoint! Housekeeping is top notch. Everything looks and smells so fresh and clean. The courtyard restaurant is delightful with quality food. The rooms are spacious and did I say CLEAN?!? I am a very satisfied Ayres Hotel customer. We will be returning, as we have the last several years.
Manager Response: Dear BeachLady712,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review based on your recent stay! We are delighted to see that we were your chosen hotel to visit this summer and that you enjoyed dining at Le Chateau Garden Bistro. We look forward to welcoming you back for another exceptional stay in the near future!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Older hotel. Common areas smell like an older hotel but the room was super! Clean, large, and the beds were lovely. Sherin at the front desk was delightful and helpful and Rob our shuttle driver was personable and fantastic. Well done Ayers for hiring fantastic people and keeping such clean rooms.
Manager Response: Dear Tseudn2019,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review based on your recent stay! We are pleased to see that you found our guestrooms to be spacious and our beds comfortable. Our team strives to provide exceptional experiences for our valued guest. We will absolutely let Sherin and Rob know that they were able to help make your stay with us a great one. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stayed at the Ayres Hotel in July 2019.  I was laying in bed watching television when a bug crawled across the bed comforter.  I killed it.  A short time later, I noticed a bug crawling on the pillow next to me.  I looked around the room and found about bugs crawling all around the window, curtain, wall, bed, etc.  (See photos)    I was in tears.  I immediately called the front desk while beginning to pack up my things. I could not get out of this room fast enough.  A maintenance representative responded within 10-15 minutes with a can of bug spray.  After I pointed out to him all the places where bugs were running around, for some reason he chose not to spray.  A short time later, another gentlemen came to the room who appeared to be in a supervisory position as he was
Manager Response: Dear YourSkyPrincess,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay. I would like to extend my sincere apology for any discomfort you experienced during your time with us, including the guestroom you were originally placed in. We are disappointed to see that this unlikely event has occurred as we strive to provide exceptional experiences for our valued guests. With that being said, it was confirmed that our team has made the effort to reach out to you regarding the inconveniences you have faced, but that initiative was denied and the complaint was closed. Once again, we do apologize for the inconveniences you've experienced and we hope your future accommodations are comfortable.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Ayres Hotel Costa Mesa because we were attending a UC Irvine event. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. We also received a UCI discount. The courtyard was lovely and there were two pools to choose from.   At first we were worried about the airplane noise, but luckily, the airport Nextdoor shuts done 10-7 at night.   We encountered a few things that we aren’t used to.  There was not a complimentary breakfast. If you wanted complimentary hot coffee, you had to get to the lobby before 7 a.m.  There was a coffee maker in our room, but we didn’t brew any since we thought there would be some downstairs as we checked out.   I suggest shopping for a few items beforehand to put in the fridge in the room.  There is also a microwave.   For the money, location,
Manager Response: Dear Unrestedmom1,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay with us! We are pleased to see that you found our courtyard to be lovely and that you had an overall great stay. Your feedback regarding the amenities we offer is appreciated as we are always open to hearing of ways in which we can better improve for our valued guests. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This was an interesting stay. We had a problem where someone who checked in the same day as us also got keys to our room and were told to go to our room when their actual room was on a different floor. Front desk was very apologetic. Besides that, my only complaint is the fact that the maid would come at the most random times - once she showed up at like, 8:30 A.M., when the day before she hadn’t shown up until after 3. She usually came during the earlier morning and woke us up though. Other than that it was quite a charming little hotel. Most of it is pretty open air, and they seemed to be best at accommodating larger groups. The pool does get to 8 feet deep, so be aware for little ones. The elevators are kind of creaky, it’s easier to take the stairs to get to the pool area

Summary Heading: A great place to stay in Costa Mesa, CA
Summary: Great location, easy to get to, excellent rooms & service.  I would go there just for the food!  I enjoyed the pool and spa but mostly my wife and I enjoyed the patio dining and wait staff!  This is our second time staying here and will not be our last!
Manager Response: Dear jpa1232,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay with us! We are pleased to see that you found our hotel to be in a great location and that you enjoyed dining with us at Le Chateau Garden Bistro. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: There was a baseball team staying and they pulled the fire alarm at 1 am. Hotel didn't do anything to apologize especially when they admitted that they caught kids doing it intentionally. The halls and elevators reeked the smell of weed. We have stayed here many times before this but this time was an exceptionally poor stay.
Manager Response: Dear Swyc J,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay with us. I would like to extend my most sincere apology for any inconvenience you experienced in regards to the fire alarm being pulled and the aroma of the elevator during your recent stay. We always wish the best experiences for our valued guests and are disappointed to see that we were unable to successfully do that for you this time around. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to have the opportunity to welcome you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for one night on our trip to Irvine.  We had a great time! The front desk staff was very professional and friendly and checked us in right away.  There were fresh baked cookies in the lobby (always a nice bonus in my book!). The hotel is very clean and well kept, and has kind of French / boutique vibe to it.  Beds, pillows, blankets, temperature in the room were all comfortable, no issues with any of that.  The only warning I have for other travelers is that there is a small airport right next to the hotel and you can definitely hear the planes fly over fairly constantly.  They do stop flying at night so we had no problems sleeping and we were up early enough that it didn't really bother us, but if you want to sleep in make sure to bring some earplugs. Overall we
Manager Response: Dear Alisa B,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review based on your recent stay! It was definitely not the workers fault as they were just doing their job.  The elevators were in the construction zone & carpet glue had been laid on the other side of the double doors to get to the elevators. Myself & a son opened the doors to head to the elevators, stepped in the glue.   Overall this stay was poor & a waste of money. The chain has a whole has always been great for previous stays but this time was a miss.

I only needed one night and I was pleased with the service I received from the staff.  Check in was quick and I was in my room within 5 minutes. The room was large and spacious. There was a small wet bar with tea and coffee products. The bathroom was squeaky clean.

Summary Heading: Decent hotel for this star level
Summary: I had a business trip in OC and just needed a place to sleep. Normally, this would not be the style of hotel that I would choose, but it was near my event.  The hotel is in an off the beaten path location (not walking distance from a ton of stuff), however it is close to several freeways and is bordering Irvine, Newport and Costa Mesa. It is also close to John Wayne Airport. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and service oriented.  The rooms were a good size, with a coffee machine, fridge and other amenities. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. If you need a quick stay for a business trip, I would recommend this hotel. It also seemed like it would be good for families.
Manager Response: Dear JenHillJHCCS,  Thank you for your kind review! We are pleased to see that you have given our hotel a try and that you had an overall comfortable stay. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back for another great experience!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The staff went out of their way to be sure the rooms were all near each other and when possible connecting. It added to the enjoyment of this comfortable hotel. We also greatly appreciated the convenience of the quick shuttle service to the airport. Thanks for making the trip so effortless.
Manager Response: Dear Mary C,  Thank you for your kind review! We glad that you enjoyed your stay with us while attending your high school reunion and that you found our guestrooms to be comfortable. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Everything we look for in a hotel
Summary: For starters, we were able to check into our room an hour early, giving us a little extra time to get ready for a function that afternoon. The front desk staff were very friendly and efficient. Parking was convenient.  Our Junior Suite was clean, spacious, and well lit, and had lots of drawers to store our belongings, a roomy closet, and plenty of places to hang towels in the bathroom.   The breakfast buffet offered all kinds of choices, something for everyone. Or we could have ordered from the menu. The service in the restaurant was also friendly and efficient.
Manager Response: Dear Barbara S,  Thank you for your kind review! We are delighted to know that you found guestrooms to be spacious and that you enjoyed breakfast at Le Chateau Garden Bistro. If you are ever in the area again, our team would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stay here for business on a fairly regular basis.  The rooms are always tidy.  They have a fridge and microwave in the room and the pool and hot tub are nice.  The staff is always helpful and professional.  My shuttle driver was extremely helpful and friendly - he went above and beyond the call of duty. I really appreciate the level of service I received!
Manager Response: Dear Julia L,  Thank you for your kind review! We are glad to see that you are satisfied with the exceptional service you've received from our team members and you enjoy spending time in our pool area. We look forward to welcoming you back the next time you're in town for business!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The room was clean (one slight exception was it appeared housekeeping forgot to switch out the soap and we had used soap, after calling the front desk the issue was rectified).  Our room was large, over looked the pool.  It was quiet, the staff was friendly and the location and price can't be beat.

Very happy with our experience. Lovely decor! Restaurant was very busy and we got good service. We didn't have the buffet but some friends seemed happy with it. Our group had a hospitality suite and a lot of folks came and it worked out well.

Great Service, Great Hotel, Kara Kellogg in Sales is Amazing to work with. She makes sure every detail is taken care of. We had 19 rooms total. Our stay was perfect because of her and the great service at your front desk.  My whole group will be back in Feb for another wedding.  Thank you!
Manager Response: Dear oneblessedgal,  Thank you for your kind review! We are glad to see that you and your entire group enjoyed the service received from our team members and that you had a great stay with us. It is with great pleasure that we provide these exceptional experiences for our valued guests and we look forward to welcoming you all back in February!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Pleasure to Arrive, Convenient Location, Nice Amenities
Summary: this trip I stayed in the main building; the rooms are large, have a nice little bar area with a mini fridge and all the amenities you need in the bathroom. Although a lighted mirror would be awesome, as i'm too short to really use the bathroom mirror for putting on makeup! I really appreciate the full size mirror, but it would be nice if there was a plug near it. There are microwaves near the ice machines, i didn't use it this time but have in the past. Coffee machine in room, I didn't use it there is also a nice restaurant in the patio serving coffee in the morning and a great coffee shop two buildings over (they are a little slow) but lovely cappuccino!
Manager Response: Dear DuneDivaDB,  Thank you for your kind review! We are delighted to see that you found our hotel to be in a convenient location and that you enjoyed the amenities we offer. Your feedback regarding the mirrors we provide in our guestrooms are valued as we are always open to hearing ways of improving for our valued guests. We look forward to welcoming you back the next time you're in town!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We really liked the hotel although we were pretty disappointed with the inability to use the pool in our building the day/night we stayed due to a wedding reception that night. They had another pool at the building next door but we chose this hotel over others because of the pool in our building. Really upsetting. The cookies at the front desk were a nice touch but I guess know to ask ahead of time if the main amnenity you’re paying for is going to be closed for a Sunday night October wedding. Very unexpected.
Manager Response: Dear DelaineyR1,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review in regards to your recent stay with us! I would like to send my sincere apology for any inconvenience you experienced in regards to the pool. We value our guests and truly appreciate the insight provided. Thank you again for your feedback, we hope to welcome you back sometime soon so that you are able to enjoy our pool and have an overall exceptional experience!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien -Moore General Manager

Summary: We are a big fan of the Ayres chain and this hotel did not delate our thoughts of the Ayres name. Very easy access to the freeways, fairly good location to a lot of things to do for the kids. The only downside was the slightly confusing entrance. This hotel is in 2 separate buildings and it took a second to figure out where the main desk was. It has a very cool setup though, almost makes you feel as though you are in a New Orleans building. Great staff, good breakfast; we will definitely be back!
Manager Response: Dear Karina B,  Thank you for your kind review and for choosing to stay with us at Ayres Hotel Costa Mesa! We are happy to see that you enjoyed the ambiance of our hotel and found us to be in an optimal location for your needs. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We were there for my husbands 50th high school reunion.  It was the hotel where they had a block of rooms at a slightly reduced rate.  Never been to an Ayers property in the past.  We LOVED it.  The property is very clean, super friendly staff, and cozy.   The room was nice any spacious.  Lots of bathroom countertop space.  Bonus was a beverage center.   I forgot my toothbrush, and asked where the store was because I forgot my toothbrush.  It was provided as a complimentary item.  This is the only hotel, to my knowledge, that provided a toothbrush at no charge.  Typically, they are in the little convenience store for purchase.   We came back from the reunion at 11 pm and the bar was closed.   But this is not a deal breaker.   I would NOT hesitate to stay at Ayres again.
Manager Response: Dear Kathie H,  Thank you for your kind review! We are glad to see that you enjoyed your first stay with us and found our guest rooms to be spacious. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back for another great stay!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I can’t say enough about the staff. They were so accommodating. The room was clean and comfortable, there are two pool and hot tub areas to choose from. Breakfast was not much more than continental and was a little disappointing to have to pay so much for such little choices. Everything else was wonderful!
Manager Response: Dear Tammie T,  Thank you for your kind review! We are delighted to see that you had a comfortable stay with us and that you are satisfied with the service you've received from our team members. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manger

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel Costa Mesa-Newport Beach is great!
Summary: Atmosphere was wonderful and clean, food was very good, beds were comfortable, and the staff was all very friendly and helpful. The only negatives I found (and they are minor) are the gym equipment is old, the pool water had too much chlorine, and the planes flying overhead steadily were noisy but they stopped flying at about 11:00 pm so we were able to sleep.

We recently spent three nights during a business trip. We had trouble sleeping on their king size bed because we sank so far into it. The room carpet had faint stains in several places.  Incoming jets to Orange County airport fly overhead, so eating or drinking in the interior courtyard can be noisy at times. Restaurant staff serving diners in the courtyard were not trained well. They often couldn't remember orders, rarely asked us if we wanted more drinks or food, were slow and often not around.
Manager Response: Dear Gene W,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay! I would like to send my sincere apology for any inconvenience you experienced in regards to the bed in the room you were in and the service you've received at our onsite restaurant. We appreciate your feedback as we are always open to ways we can better improve for our valued guests. We hope to welcome you back for an exceptional stay sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Staff has no respect for Guests Hotel is run as a Construction site / Office Building
Summary: We stayed this last Weekend... The Hotel is well Maintained as an Office Setting, not a Hotel The Housekeeping Staff is Loud always with Radio blasting on high along with Gets and Airplanes going over the Building all day and Night from the Airport across the Street, Yelling to each other and Housekeeping Manager same as Restaurant Staff! No one ever goes out of their way for anything! Only to be Rude! no one ever says hello everyone is Rude!  Never attentive to the Gusts, they act as if its a Construction site ONLY SPEAKING SPANISH EVERYPLACE YELLING! The Restaurant Manager is the same... The Staff seems more like Construction Workers than Waiters Never respectful only Rude! Food is SMALL and WAY over Priced the Guests in the Restaurant Both for Dinner and Breakfast we could
Manager Response: Dear johnL9919YE,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay with us. I would like to send my most sincere apologies for any inconvenience you may have experienced throughout your stay in regards to the surrounding noise and the pricing of the dishes at our onsite restaurant. We strive to provide our guests with the best experiences and are disappointed to see that we were unable to do that for you during this visit. We will absolutely share your feedback regarding the noise levels you have observed throughout your stay to our team members as we are always open to ways we can improve for future guests. We hope to be able to welcome you back for a better stay sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Had a wonderful finish to our trip to Southern California by staying here.  There was nothing I needed or wanted here.  The 12 o’clock check out time thrilled my wife.  The restaurant was great, food great, drinks even better.  Thanks and you will be our go to place when we need a place near SNA.  CHEERS
Manager Response: Dear Brian D,  Thank you for your kind review based on your recent stay! We are delighted to see that you had an exceptional experience at our hotel and onsite restaurant, Le Chateau Garden Bistro. We look forward to welcoming you back the next time you are in Costa Mesa!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for two nights both nights my electric door key did not work. The front deskhad to have maintenance take care of that so I could get into my room. Also on the first night I woke up with bites all over my legs. I call down to the front office and reported this fortunately I was able to sleep in the other bed in the room without any further issues
Manager Response: Dear donna l,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your recent stay. I would like to send my sincere apology for any inconvenience and discomfort you experienced during your time with us. We appreciate your patience with in regards to the key cards for room not working properly. We can assure you that we are currently working on fixing the key card issue throughout our hotel. In addition, I do apologize for any discomfort you experienced in regards to the bites on your legs. After further investigation, we are happy to update that we did not find evidence of bed bugs in the room. Your feedback is deeply appreciated and we hope to welcome you back for an exceptional stay sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Staff is very pleasant and efficient.  Rooms were well appointed and facilities were good.  Convenient to several tourist attractions and easily accessible from major roads.  Stay was arranged by 3rd party but was at end of runway of John Wayne airport so somewhat noisy during periods of stay
Manager Response: Dear Jim H,  Thank you for your kind review and rating. It is a delight to see that you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Staff is excellent.  Maids always make up the room with the correct towels, etc.  Would like to see new carpet installed. Convenient location and parking. Great muffins and paper in a.m.  Nice pools.  Computer and printer available to print
Manager Response: Dear dmdiehl,  Thank you for your kind review and rating! We are thrilled to know that you have found our hotel to be in a convenient location. Your feedback regarding the carpet in our guestrooms is appreciated as we are always open to ways we can better improve for our valued guests. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for a night. The check in was easy and the staff friendly and professional. Free wifi pass was given and the company I work for ment a free breakfast was offered.  The hotel is built around 2 courtyards one with outdoor tables and the other a pool. My room was large but felt very old in terms of decor, dark wood, and a dated feel. The room also had an odd smell that wasn’t musty but like being in an old home. The A/C was full on so feeling cold I switched on the heat. The smell from the HVAC was like that of burning electric and although no smoke or visible fuems were apparent the smoke or CO3 alarm triggered for a few seconds. I opted to turn off the units and open the window which opens but a few inches but enough to fumigate the room.  The room has a large seating
Manager Response: Dear karlconnolly,  Thank you for your thoughtful review regarding your recent stay with us! We are pleased to see that you found our guestrooms and bathrooms to be spacious. It is also fantastic to see that you found our beds to be comfortable. We always hope our guests enjoy relaxing and comfortable accommodations and your feedback is paramount when we are looking for ways to improve. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to be able to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The Ayres Hotels generally are very nice and a good value for the dollar. I have stayed at a few different locations. The Ayres Hotel Costa Mesa-Newport Beach is a great location and convenient to LAX, John Wayne Airport, Disneyland and many attractions in Los Angeles and orange Counties. It's surrounded by great shopping and restaurants within easy travel distance. The rooms is comfortable, clean, with great beds! The Hotel restaurant is excellent. The staff are friendly and service is pleasing. It has a great pool for those much needed working breaks and active kids! Ayres is considered a boutique hotel. Enjoy!
Manager Response: Dear denimwings,  Thank you for your kind review! We are pleased to know that you found our hotel to be in a convenient location and of great value. It is with great pleasure that we provide the best experiences for our guests and we hope to welcome you back sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: A very decent stay with rich classy French outlook in the hallways of the hotel.  Take a visit to the next building, it has a King's palace like appearance and furniture in downstairs hallway. We enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: Dear Rai2017,  Thank you for your kind review and rating! We are thrilled to know that you had an exceptional stay with us in our luxurious guestrooms. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: great experience at check in and check out & very good customer service at the restaurant/bar areas - Facilities are very clean, and rooms are super comfortable. They have a complete breakfast buffet and cookies every day at evening. Happy hour has great selection of beer/wine.
Manager Response: Dear lirivera,  Thank you for your kind review and rating! We are thrilled to know that you had a very comfortable stay with us and enjoyed the service you received from our team members. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We had a 1st floor room just off the main courtyard. I'd recommend against this room location.  You can hear everyone walking by, plus there is the noise of carts (housekeeping? food?) going by your door.  Added to that is periodic jet noise from OC Airport.  Not quiet.  Room was good.
Manager Response: Dear dancingcould33,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review regarding your recent stay with us! We are happy to see that you found our hotel to be in an optimal location for your needs. I would like to send my sincere apologies for any inconvenience you have experienced in regards to the surrounding noise. We always hope to provide our guests with the best experiences and hope to welcome you back for a better stay soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel.  Conveniently located to the John Wayne/Orange County airport and amazingly beautiful.  The pool courtyards were great.  Room was more than comfortable.  Price was very reasonable.  A definite recommend!
Manager Response: Dear mmk97504,  Thank you for your kind review! We are pleased to see that you had a comfortable stay with us and found our hotel to be in a convenient location. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Place to Rest while working hard
Summary: Ayres hotel provided a very restful, quiet room for our stay while attending a conference.  The conference was demanding and required home work at night.  My wife got sick the last night and we had to call for towels and clean up of bathroom and staff was very responsive.

My friend and I had a little weekend getaway and we really enjoyed our stay.  The room was clean and loved the style. The restaurant was delicious and the entire staff of the restaurant and hotel was friendly and helpful. There was a delicious sushi place right across the street and very close to the freeway so getting places was a breeze.  The pool was inviting and we enjoyed lounging the afternoon away.  The only negative is the noise from the planes overhead.  Not their fault but it is hard to have a conversation in the courtyard with the noise.  Overall it was a nice weekend.
Manager Response: Dear Ashley B,  Thank you for your kind review! We are happy to see that you had an exceptional weekend getaway at our hotel and enjoyed the delicious food at our restaurant. If you are ever in need of another relaxing getaway, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: So it was my first time staying at the Ayers Costa Mesa/Newport Beach and I must say it was nice. Upon entering the hotel, we were greeted by the front desk staff, the lobby was clean, and we were assisted right away. The gentlemen who assisted us with checking in was polite and professional. He provided detail instructions and a map on how to get to our room and parking. The room was clean, and well vented. However, I did notice that the hallways were humid and there was no AC circulating as we walked through the hotel to access our room. Other than that, no issues.   We used the pool and courtyard which was very clean and nice. If I need to stay in the area again, I would be interested in staying here again. Lastly, the price for one night was very reasonable.
Manager Response: Dear TONIA A,  Thank you for your kind review! We are pleased to see that you enjoyed our pool and courtyard area. Your feedback on the hallways are appreciated as we always hope to provide our guests with the best experiences. We hope to welcome you back sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The hotel is very conveniently located near the airport and 20 min to Newport Beach.  The rooms are comfortable and clean. The dining lanai very nice and the food delicious (especially the churro waffles!) The pool area was not kept up- no towels and the hot tub very foamy. We asked for the heaters to be turned on , but were told no-go ask front desk.   Do not rely on the hotel to airport shuttle. We made reservations to be on the 6:25 van and after letting front desk know we were waiting we were told someone would be in shortly announcing the van was ready to load. After a full van of airline crew departed at 6:25, we again asked about our van.  Again told to wait. Finally we asked AGAIN and were told someone had not shown up for work and "Did we have a reservation?" When we
Manager Response: Dear searlesclan,  Thank you for your kind review! We are pleased to see that you found our hotel to be comfortable and in a convenient location. I would like to send my sincere apologies for any inconvenience you may have experienced in regards to our pool and airport shuttle service. Your feedback is valued and we hope to welcome you back for an exceptional stay soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Location for our need as we were attending a conference was excellent . Staff extremely helpful with a wonderful lobby and lots of seating . Afternoon cookies and lots of fresh water . Pool and courtyard areas are very old world look and inviting . Rooms are well appointed except bedside table lamps are so tall that one has to get out of bed to switch them off unless you have xxxl long arms . No safe in the room .  Carpeting in hallways is old and smells musty .  Noise control is excellent as it’s very close to the airport . Free shuttle is quick and staff is very polite . Rooms are very clean and bathrooms are very up to date .
Manager Response: Dear Shaziajang,  Thank you for your kind review! We are pleased to know that you found our team members to be helpful and had an overall enjoyable stay. Your feedback regarding our rooms and hallways are appreciated as it helps us to better improve for our valued guests. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We had to be in Fountain Valley for an early morning specialist appointment at the Orange Medical Center, so booked rooms at the last minute to be close by. Arrived very late at night, but the front desk couldn't have been nicer and more sympathetic. The rooms were spacious and spotless. Very quiet. Tastefully decorated with all conveniences of a four star hotel. Breakfast included -- generous buffet with hot and cold selection including your own waffles!)  Easy access to freeway.  Many casual dining restaurants in the neighborhood, which is a combination of nice residential and commercial. Pretty convenient to Orange County sightseeing locations if you have a car and don't want to be overrun with tourists.

My last review talked about the spotty WiFi.  It's improved a lot since my last visit (at least in the main building.  ProTip: request a room in the main building (if you want a shot at decent WiFi).  Also note: the carpet was really dirty in my room.  I suggest bringing a spare pair of socks you can wear when you're getting ready in the morning unless you like very dirty soles of your feet.
Manager Response: Dear Scott W,  Thank you for your kind review! We are pleased to see that you enjoyed your recent stay with us and that you were satisfied with our complimentary WiFi. Your feedback is valued and we look forward to welcoming you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Spacious room! Very quiet. Great service. Shuttle service. Nice pool area. Close to the airport! Lot's of good restaurants nearby! Very comfortable and cozy. A little noisy during the day with large planes taking off.
Manager Response: Dear Carl S,  Thank you for your kind review! We are pleased to see that you had a comfortable stay with us in our spacious guest rooms. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel and Close to Airport
Summary: After reading the reviews on here prior to booking I was worried about the jet noise, but it didn't bother me at all. I don't hardly remember even hearing the jets. The hotel room was a suite with separate living room area and a bar. It  was clean and we enjoyed our 2 night stay there. The shower head was high which we liked. My only complaint is that the air-conditioner didn't give you the option to run the fan continuously. I like to do that at hotels as white background noise while sleeping. So it was constantly cycling on and off all night. Hotel air conditioners can be loud.
Manager Response: Dear Steve H,  Thank you for your kind review! We are delighted to know that you found our hotel to be clean and that you enjoyed your stay with us. I would like to send my sincere apology for any discomfort you experienced with the way our air condition units operate. Your feedback is valued as it allows us the opportunity to better improve for our future guests. We hope to welcome you back sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed here because my high school reunion was here.  The venue for the reunion (around the pool) was nicely decorated and just right for our group.  The room we had was clean, nicely furnished and comfortable.  All the staff we encountered were friendly and most helpful.  The breakfast buffet is a bit pricey, but the food was good.  Overall, a very nice stay.

Summary Heading: Ayres Newport/Costa Mesa: Near the action
Summary: My son and I had two college visits to complete in July: USC and UCI.  We wanted a hotel near major freeways, since we needed to travel to Los Angeles.  But we also wanted it near the beach, dining and shopping.  Ayres Newport/Costa Mesa fit our needs to a "T!" We had the King Suite, which gave us both privacy.  We ate breakfast at the on site restaurant twice: it was very good and fairly priced.  We fit in a couple of visits to Fashion Island and tried out a few new dining places. We drove down from Nor Cal; however the John Wayne Airport is in close proximity. The staff was friendly and we would book this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Quality hotel. Very handy for visiting Newport Beach.
Summary: The rooms are large with good facilities. There is a  good quality restaurant on site which is reasonably priced. The hotel provides a complementary shuttle bus to drop you off within walking distance of Balboa Bay and Newport Beach. I would recommend using this because parking at the beach can be hard work. My only suggestion would be to make sure that the return bus is at a convenient time,  otherwise get a taxi back to the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear markcaunce,  Thank you for your kind review! We are happy to see that you had a comfortable stay with us in our spacious guestrooms and enjoyed our onsite restaurant. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We had a great experience! I will definitely return . The front desk staff were very friendly and polite . Greeted us as soon as we got there ,made us feel at home . We had an early dinner and food was delicious!
Manager Response: Dear Loudenson,  Thank you for your kind review! We are delighted to see that you have had an exceptional stay with us and enjoyed dining at our restaurant. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Beautiful entryway, sitting area. Clean and comfortable room. My granddaughter absolutely loved the sailboats in the lobby and the pictures in the room. We spent the day at the beach and stayed overnight before driving home the next day. Perfect getaway.
Manager Response: Dear cmiacono,  Thank you for your kind review! We are happy to see that you had a comfortable overnight stay with us and enjoyed the décor throughout our hotel. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Good value, good location, some caveats
Summary: We're a family of four, including two teens. We decided to leave Los Angeles early on a Friday afternoon to beat the traffic to Costa Mesa, stay at a hotel to relax for a few hours and then head on over to a concert at the Pacific Amphitheater. After the concert, we walked around the Orange County Fair and stayed the night back at the hotel. The location worked out perfectly and we got a good rate for over $200 plus tax.  The whole plan worked out great with just some inconveniences.  Overall, the hotel was attractive, calm, pleasant with two pools and a courtyard with restaurant. We asked for a quiet room on the top floor but it was next to an elevator which can be noisy so we opted for a lower level on the second floor. The room was attractive, very comfortable and spacious

I hope to be able to reserve a room there every time I visit the Costa Mesa/Newport Beach area. Courteous and helpful staff with large, clean rooms. The Breakfast Buffet was very good in the Restaurant.

We have used the Ayres hotels in the past, but never the one in Costa Mesa. What a pleasant surprise! The hotel beautiful and very large (250+ rooms)! We made our reservations at the last minute and were upgraded to a junior suite upon our arrival! The pool is large and well-maintained. Our room had a leather sofa and beautiful wood furnishings!. Centrally-located to Orange County airport, South Coast Plaza is minutes away, easy freeway access. Most importantly, the entire staff was friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Very nice, clean and pretty hotel.
Summary: We booked 2 rooms. Both very nice and spacious. Beautiful courtyard to snack and a nice happy hour. Had lunch in the restaurant was quite good. Comfortable. Could not hear others in adjacent rooms though airplanes go over head but not that frequently and stop around 11 pm.

Summary Heading: Perfectly serviceable hotel close to O.C. attractions. Extremely Noise-sensitive peeps may want to rethink, tho.
Summary: I found the hotel to be very clean, easy to find, nicely appointed rooms, with lovely common areas.   The set-up is a bit strange, in that this hotel comprises two completely separate buildings. I'm glad we were in the one where the lobby was located. The pool area was a bit quieter, more private, and prettier. Only thing was, after 3 or 4 pm, the pool is not in the sun because it is in a courtyard surrounded by 4-5 stories. Other than that, it was fine, great in the early hours, and the jacuzzi was very nice as well.  The courtyard outside of the restaurant has tables for outside dining, or just to read the paper, as I did, with my free cup of coffee. There is a very limited breakfast provided free of charge with toast, bagel, coffee and tea. There is a larger more elaborate

Nice rooms and facilities. Breakfast was amazing! All staff were very accommodating! Airport noise was very loud outside, but couldn’t hear the planes from inside the rooms. We would definitely stay there again.

This hotel is in a perfect location for airport access and the yearly Orange County Fair. I brought a group in there that was playing the Orange Cty Fair and everyone was extremely pleased with the rooms (king jr suites) and my group check in was seamless. Thanks to Leslie (Asst Front Desk Mgr) and Diana (Sales Coordinator) for making my job much easier.

Very good service. Didn’t make it to excellent because the jacuzzi needs cleaning but we enjoyed our stay. The Italian restaurants is really good and pretty fast.Rita the housekeeping lady was the best

Summary Heading: Frist time to the east coast / CA
Summary: the rooms were great, The staff very helpful and freindly , The rooms and whole hotel was really clean, cozy and  comfortable lobby and convenently located. Our two grown boys loved it as much as my husband and I. Also great breakfast !

I enjoyed the stay very much at the Ayres Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa CA  The room was very clean and comfortable and the restaurant was very delicious as well.  I plan on staying at the Ayres again for my next work trip!

I enjoyed my stay very much. The customer service was excellent from the complimentary airport shuttle through check out. The room was spacious, comfortable, and very clean. There are numerous common areas throughout the hotel to relax, chat with friends, or read. The center courtyard is lovely with a large fountain as its centerpiece. It is close to several nice restaurants and a quick uber to the beach or high end retail.
Manager Response: Dear s73645,  Thank you for your kind review! We are delighted to see that you found our hotel to be comfortable and had an overall exceptional stay. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Excellent stay at the Ayers Hotel. One of the best breakfasts included in the price that offers a variety of food. You definitely get what you pay for... For once! Pool was a big hit with the kiddos and enjoyed the happy hour for the adults.

Stayed here for 2 days as part of a program.   The hotel has adequate parking, rooms are comfortable and well maintained. Additionaly it is close to the airport and freeways so it is easy to get around    Ordered room service one evening and had the garlic chicken roast. It was nicely done and service was prompt and friendly
Manager Response: Dear ManishSY,  Thank you for your kind review! We are glad you had a comfortable and convenient stay at our hotel. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Hotel feels very cheap and tired, nothing luxurious about it
Summary: everything was just fine, not great.  Room was booked for 4 guests, but not enough towels or pillows for 4 people.  Stayed two days and room was not cleaned once.  Everything in the hotel (furniture, artwork, carpets, bedding) felt really cheap, like it was from china
Manager Response: Dear Joshua C,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review! I would like to send my sincere apologies for any inconveniences you may have experienced during your stay at our hotel. Your feedback is appreciated as it helps us to better improve for future guests. We hope to be able to welcome you back for a better stay soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful.
Summary: Front desk staff was always attentive.  Wait staff was somewhat inflexible for splitting tab even though one night we were the ONLY ones being served.  Waiter was not very friendly and situation could have been handled better for a better customer experience.  HUGE difference in service between restaurant and outside patio as we visited both while we were there.  My suggestion would be for the wait staff to be a bit more flexible for a better customer experience.  Food was excellent!  Used the shuttle from the airport which was very prompt and the driver was friendly.  Rooms were very clean and comfortable with nice attention to detail.
Manager Response: Dear Denise S,  Thank you for your thoughtful review! We are glad you had a comfortable and overall enjoyable stay. We appreciate your feedback on our restaurant as we are always open to ways we can better improve for our valued guests. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: First Time Ayres stay, won't be the last
Summary: The rooms were clean and staff was amazing with information. Great price for a team event ask for a group discount. There was no charge for parking, which other hotels in the area charge for. Free WiFi and cookies in the lobby weekdays with some favored water.
Manager Response: Dear chaskim,  Thank you for your kind review! We are glad you had an exceptional first time stay with us and you found our team members to be of great help. If you are ever in the area again, we hope to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Ascetically appealing. Courtyard is beautiful and welcoming. Large pool and jacuzzi and cabanas. Saw two large water bugs in the cabana at night that caused me to leave. Bed/linens were comfortable. Close to airport, but with the a/c fan running all night, it acted as a sound barrier to this very light sleeper and I didn't hear a thing. Spacious room. Did not use the t.v. Wifi was good. Staff was pleasant. I would recommend this place. We ate at nearby Acapulcos (great!) and Sweet Basil Cafe (yum!). Recommend them both if you like Mexican and Italian cuisine for decent prices and location. Starbucks, gas station, and several fast food places are nearby. Close to the freeway.
Manager Response: Dear Nancy A,  Thank you for your kind review! We are delighted to see that you had a comfortable stay with us and found our courtyard to be beautiful. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you for another exceptional experience!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I returned to the Ayres Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa on a business overnight. As always, the place is clean, welcoming and the staff nice and accommodating.  If you get the opportunity to eat at the restaurant Le Chateau, you won't be sorry. Good food and terrific service! Thank you Ayres Staff!
Manager Response: Dear Cher M,  Thank you for your kind review! We are delighted to see that you have returned to stay with us again and had an exceptional stay. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We ate on the beautiful patio for dinner and had great food! Our waiter was the BEST! Rick Diaz , he's amazing! He remembered that we had visited a week prior and what we had ordered including our drinks!

Summary Heading: Extremely convenient to SNA and very charming
Summary: Stayed here for one night on business to the Beckman Center/UC Irvine. It was extremely reasonably priced, and very convenient both to the Center and to the Santa Ana/John Wayne Airport. There is a plaza across the street with many restaurants and a Starbucks, although the hotel also has a restaurant that I did not try. The room was spacious, quiet and well appointed. The hotel lobby is very comfortable, and the Wifi was free and fast. I would definitely stay there again when I return to the area.

This hotel is very close to John Wayne International Airport so you do get some airplane noise, but the accommodations are very nice.  The hotel clerk was very efficient and friendly when we checked in. We weren't there long enough to use any of the amenities, but they seemed to be very clean and in working order.  We stayed on the weekend, which is their slow time so we got a decent rate.

The Ayres hotel was clean, quiet and has a beautiful courtyard. It was enjoyable to look at from the room and it was relaxing to sit by the fountain for breakfast. I would stay here again if I come back to the area.

I have been in the hotel business for over 10 years. I recently embarked on a new chapter in my life re-entering the workforce for AAA Southern California. To train me, my company booked this hotel for me for the week of attending the University. From the Front Desk to the Housekeeping Staff, I rate this 5 Star. This is a true boutique hotel, classy, elegant, clean & quiet. I felt very safe. The Le Chateau Bistro is warm and inviting!! I felt like I was in the middle of Paris as I sat in the courtyard. Food was out of this world! Thank you for making my new journey a delight!
Manager Response: Dear Pamela G,  Thank you for your thoughtful review! We are delighted to see that you found our hotel to be warm and inviting as those are some of the things we always strive to provide to our guests. It is with great pleasure that we provide these exceptional experiences for our valued guests and we hope to welcome you back sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I was in town for a few days for my niece's graduation.  This is the first time in sometime that I have traveled alone and was somewhat apprenhensive. I should not  have been.  I arrived to a warm greeting. When I explained I was alone she put me in a wonderful room not far from the lobby and people. I felt very safe.  The room was large, comfortable, and well furnished. The breakfast had all the necessities.  The parking is plentiful and the property well maintained.  It is so nice to stay in a hotel in southern California and feel at home not just like I was passing through.

The hotel was clean, quiet and the beds were very comfortable. Great accommodations for the price, better than expected and would stay again.  The staff was nothing but professional and kind over the phone. Very accommodating.
Manager Response: Dear 2tlc96,  Thank you for your kind review and rating. We are happy to see that you found our hotel to be comfortable and enjoyed an exceptional stay! We hope to welcome you back sometime soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel, good location and good staff - just would think twice about breakfast
Summary: I have stayed at this property nearly half a dozen times in the last 10 years.  Always enjoy my stay.  Clean rooms, nice amenities and good staff.  I was with a group - business and they were all in the main hotel while I was in the adjunct building.  My disappointment was breakfast - as it was not as good as it used to be.   Lots of items had run out and were not promptly replenished.  I would not choose to eat breakfast there again - you can get a better breakfast elsewhere.  I would stay there again, in a heartbeat!  It I wasn't trying to be good - I would be all over the cookies in the afternoon!
Manager Response: Dear nancyesca,  Thank you for your kind review! We are happy to see that you enjoyed our clean rooms and found our team members to be great. Your feedback regarding our breakfast is greatly appreciated as we are always open to ways of better improving for our valued guests. We look forward to welcoming you back sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Absolutely blissful anniversary weekend with my fiancé. It was the ideal hotel that I was looking for(cozy/romantic) and whilst there, everything was so easy! Checking in, going to the adorable restaurant and room service!(10 stars for room service. They had forgot something from our breakfast order & the waiter was so quick in returning with it!) Location wise- Perfect for us! Able to go to the Wedge, fashion island and Rusty Pelican all in one day! We both had the best time and felt 100% relaxed the whole weekend.
Manager Response: Dera laurenmseawright,  Thank you for your kind review! We are delighted to see that you had an exceptional anniversary weekend here at our hotel. It is with great pleasure that we provide the best experiences for our valued guests and we hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Booked for one night only as I am a vendor at the OC Marketplace. Easy to get to from the fairgrounds. Loved the room, nice and clean and quiet! Great room service too! Food was really good and staff was very polite and on point.
Manager Response: Dear Melody H,  Thank you for your kind review! We are happy to read that you had an enjoyable stay with us and our hotel is in a convenient location for your needs. We look forward to welcoming you back sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This hotel was everything that was described and more. My rooms bathtub was equipped with jets which was a pleasant surprise! It was very clean and all around incredible. If in the area I would definitely stay here again.

Very pretty hotel for a wedding with rooms close to area for wedding and wedding set up Staff is very frendly and willing to help a great contact is Susan O'brien Moore the general manager  pools have handycap lift chairs for pool and hot tub

Loved our room. We stayed just one night, but the room was wonderful.  Bed was very comfy and the room had a great view.  When  you first walk into the hotel you notice the beautiful surroundings and attention to detail.  We definitely will return to the Ayres Hotel.

We wanted a place close to Newport Beach but didn’t want to pay the price & stumbled upon Ayres.  What a welcoming friendly staff that greeted us upon arrival. We went to our room not knowing what to expect since it had an “older” feel but it was wonderful! Room and bathroom were big enough for us (with 2 teenage girls) and even had a microwave by the ice machine so we could heat up our late night snacks after a day at the beach!  We didn’t even hear the planes while we were sleeping like we thought would be an annoyance!

Elegant hotel. Nice rooms, details like woodwork on panelling excellent.  Charging for my Tesla wonderful at 220 volts. And considering all, prices very good. We’ll be back. Well located between Fashion island and South Coast Plaza and SNA airport.

I very nice hotel with (bonus for electric car owners) free charging for hotel guests.  The hotel and grounds are mostly well maintained.  Also, a nice bistro is located on property with (for a fee) breakfast buffet and happy hour as well as lunch and dinner.  Three things that you need to be aware of:  (1) it's right on the takeoff pattern of John Wayne Airport so you will get a 7 am wakeup call with jets flying over; (2) WiFi is dodgy in some rooms.  I've been told they're working on it, but haven't seen any improvement in the last few months; and (3) this hotel caters to airline crews so it can get booked quickly.  Better to book a few weeks in advance.
Manager Response: Dear Scott W,  Thank you for your kind review! We are glad you enjoyed dining at our restaurant and found our car charging stations to be an added bonus to your stay. We truly appreciate your feedback and hope to welcome you back for another great stay soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Reasonably priced and very convenient to John Wayne Airport.  Clean, spacious rooms and friendly staff.  I stayed only briefly overnight, but will remember it as a good option for the future if I am flying into SNA or departing from there the next day.
Manager Response: Dear Ted-Vilma,  Thank you for your kind review! We are glad you found our hotel to be an excellent option when flying into the John Wayne Airport. We look forward to seeing you the next time you are in town!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: There seems to be a problem with the housekeeping dept. They do not understand "Do Not Disturb" and do not communicate with the front desk. I was there working on a project and worked the night shift. The front desk gave me a great room. The problem was Housekeeping. Repeatedly, they would knock or come in when the room was listed as "Do Not Disturb." Then they would call me and my coworker to ask when we wanted our room cleaned. Finally, after a visit with the hotel manager, this idiot behavior stopped. It would have been a fine experience, otherwise. The hotel is nice. The beds are very comfortable. The restaurant if good. But, it is hard to remember anything other than the repeated wake ups the first several days. I will say, the internet is crappy slow and there is no option
Manager Response: Dear kathyhurstdavis,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on your recent stay with us. We are glad you found our beds to be comfortable and enjoyed dining at our restaurant. I would like to send my sincere apologies for any inconveniences you experienced with our housekeeping team as we always hope for our guests to have the best experiences. We hope to welcome you again sometime in the near future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We were recommended the "Ayres" brand from some friends who stayed at a different location, so we booked at this site since it was closer to my wife's conference. Our stay of 5 nights started out with an upgrade to the suites unexpectedly, so of course we were initially wowed. The staff (Beatriz?) at check-in was so friendly and seemingly concerned with us as guests. The suites building (two separate buildings) was exceptionally nice with a sitting area (and fireplace) that I personally used several times during our stay. Our rooms were excellent; clean, cozy, and not a thing to complain about. Shuttle to and from the airport was extremely easy and drivers were so professional and friendly. We took advantage of the happy hour at the hotel restaurant - Le Chateau several times

We really enjoyed our stay at your hotel. It is very clean, beds are very comfortable and very conveniently located. The staff is very professional and polite and we have no complains. We will definitively return Thank you

I like this hotel which is close to UC Irvine where I was going. Rooms are good-sized with comfortable beds. The court yard is charming. The pool is open from 7am til 10pm, the jacuzzi hot, both features important to me.

This is a well appointed boutique hotel. Room was better than expected - clean comfortable and spacious. Staff was courteous and checkin process was smooth. There were a bunch of Tesla Wall chargers and at least one J1772 for EV cars. Breakfast was expensive so didn't eat there. Loved the collection of historic photographs and model ships displayed throughout the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Eagle_Bird1,  Thank you for your review on your recent stay! We are happy to see that you found our guestrooms comfortable and our team members courteous. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I ordered the Patio King Suite. The patio was totally without the charm of the rest of the hotel. Uninviting, so I didn't use it. The room was clean and slightly larger than ordinary hotel rooms. There was a Jacuzzi tub which I could not figure out how to work.  The parking and hotel location were terrific. I would skip the hotel breakfast. $13.99 plus tip. There was hard dry scrambled eggs, bacon, and dry tasteless pancakes, plus some sweet rolls and different add ons. I am sure there must be some other restaurants nearby offering really good breakfasts for less money.
Manager Response: Dear Sharon A,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review on your recent stay!
