I am pleased to see that you found our hotel to be spacious and in a stellar location. I appreciate your feedback in regards to our breakfast as it allows us to better serve our valued guests. Please do not hesitate to let us know if you ever need assistance with any of the amenities that we offer in the future. It is our pleasure to ensure our valued guests enjoy a comfortable stay and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back again soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: As both an Entertainer & Motivational Speaker I get to experience many a hotel and Ayres Hotel & Suites is definitely one if the better ones. I found the personnel to be professional and courteous.  The hotel and my suite were traditionally styled, and well maintained. I certainly got my monies worth.  Whenever I find myself in need of hotel accommodations back in the Costa Mesa area, I’ll definitely revisit Ayres.

Great experience from start to finish. I made my reservations on the hotel website, very easy. Check in, friendly and knowledgeable employees at registration. Our hotel room, amazing. We stayed in a regular room with 2 queen size beds the first weekend and stayed in a 2 queen size beds suite, great upgrade. The hotel appears older and remodeled in some areas, nice decor. Bar area, great service. Cookies in the lobby, delicious. Check out, flawless.

Summary Heading: high end cozy and classy. quiet and luxerious without fancy.
Summary: very easy to check in....plants and fountains  outside patio, breakfast room.  unexpected and wonderful.  this will be our go to hotel anywhere.... did i mention excellent rate!! very comfortable bed, which is really important to me.

Very clean and well maintained.  No sign of neglect or wear anywhere.  Rooms are immaculate. Very comfortable beds.  Good food in the restaurant.  Staff is VERY friendly and helpful.     Our number one choice in the SNA area.

Let me start with how lovely our arrival was at the hotel. A very friendly greeting from staff. We loved the old world charm as well. A nice charming boutique hotel. We found our room to be clean much larger than we expected. Our junior queen suite included a microwave, small fridge and a bar/sink area. Bed was very comfortable. Nice small table & two chairs. We dined twice at the hotel, one evening for appetizers as we had been out all day and just needed a little something. The second time we came back after a day of exploring and had a really delicious lunch and beverage in the courtyard. Now to share our bit of disappointment, the first day we arrived we put our luggage in our room and headed out to find a grocer. Came home with perishable items knowing we did have fridge in

We are from NY our son got married this weekend we had 32 rooms and a breakfast on Sunday after the weeding .Wehad a 3 day celebration with all of our family and friends mostly all from the east coast I found the hotel to be perfect extremely clean and cozy for everyone. staff was also very helpful I would consider staying there again it was all I had been searching for with a bar and a restaurant and pool for the kids great stay

Please note that this location is located right at the end of the runway of John Wayne Airport. You will hear the planes take off and may not be able to hear anything else while the planes are directly overhead. The courtyard-facing rooms get the noise from anyone who is speaking, laughing or talking in the courtyard.  The rooms are nicely decorated and the staff is extremely friendly.
Manager Response: Dear msjeenee,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your recent stay! We are delighted to see that you found our hotel to be nicely decorated and our team members friendly. I would like to send my most sincere apologies for any inconvenience you have experienced during your time with us in regards to the noise surrounding our hotel. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My husband and I have stayed at the Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa for many years. The Old World look of it, the etched panels on the door, the Foo Dogs at the entrance, the patterned carpets, all delight my sense of tradition. In fact, we held our 50th wedding anniversary in their restaurant over seven years ago. My one regret is that the charming gift shop that used to be run by Karen is no longer at the hotel. It's been swept away and replaced by a paneled business center. While the buffet breakfast used to be free, it is now costs $14. I would like it to have a few more hot items; maybe even Mexican beans which could be added to the tortillas. Othrwise, I am glad that the Ayres continues to be available for our OC visits.

This was my first stay at this brand of hotel. From the moment you walk, you are greeted with smiling staff members who quickly check you in. The room is very well appointed and quiet. I had to cut my visit short because I stayed too far from where I needed to house hunt and I booked my reservation through a third-party and was concerned about whether they would refund the additional two nights I had reserved. The hotel staff was very understanding and made a note that they would approve my cancellation even though I had booked through a third-party. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to my friends. The decor is a little outdated, but this is the vibe they are going for I believe. I prefer it to the minimalist direction a lot of hotels are going

Summary Heading: Great place, but still needs some upgrades.
Summary: Overall I like staying here. It is a good value and conveniently located for my needs.  Because I stay here for work purposes, my biggest complaint is their wireless. In the evenings when I typically try to catch up on things, it is so slow I can't work. The rest of the time it is adequate.  If it is included in your room price, the breakfast is one the best included breakfasts I have had.   I wish there was a way to officially stop housekeeping from cleaning the room everyday without puting out the do-not-disturb sign. They need to incorporate a list of rooms that have requested no cleaning during their stay. My stays are for 3 - 5 days, so I can keep it clean and don't need new towels everyday.   Also, for being in the path of the airport, the rooms are not as noisy as you

This hotel and restaurant are all in for customer service. Beautiful room, friendly staff committed to make your stay perfect, and delicious meals (specific acre for those of us with allergies). Totally allergy friendly. Support this location if you have a choice - we need more places like these!
Manager Response: Dear dimpels73,  Thank you for your kind review! We are glad that you found our rooms to be beautiful and were able to experience our team members commitment to providing exceptional service to each of our valued guests. We look forward to welcoming you for another satisfactory stay soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: This is a gem in the city!
Summary: Checked in for a weekend in the Irvine/Costa Mesa area. Upon our arrival, which was early, our room wasn't ready but the person and the reservation desk promptly got on the phone and found another room for us to check into at that moment. Overall I gave the hotel an excellent review because of the decor, service, cleanness, location and comfort of the hotel. It truly is a gem in the city! I want to go back just to relax. If your worried about air noise, I didn't notice much in my room and the planes stop at night which I appreciated.
Manager Response: Dear Going4fun,  Thank you for your kind review following your recent stay! We are happy to see that you were pleased with the service, decor, cleanliness, and comfort of our hotel. We are greatly appreciative of your kind compliments and look forward to welcoming you for another relaxing stay soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Staff was great, room was emasculate, food was simple but really good. I'll definitely stay here again.   Room - clean - comfortable - quiet  Staff - always willing to help - efficient - nice  Food - basic - good tasting - and fairly priced.
Manager Response: Dear intentlee,  Thank you for taking the time to write a kind review on your recent stay! We are so delighted to see that you found our rooms to be immaculate and comfortable. We look forward to welcoming you back soon for more delicious food and another great stay!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa has been my favorite hotel for years when I have workshops at Piecemaker's Country Store.  But, this past stay there have been many changes.  The cost has gone up and the service has gone down.  Breakfast is no longer included; the shuttle service is now less than 4 miles; the waiters in the dining room seem most unhappy and slam down plates and utensils; the breakfast buffet no longer includes fresh fruit other than melon.  Our group this past week had 4 rooms and we all concluded that we'll be looking for another hotel in the Costa Mesa area.
Manager Response: Dear PattiCulea,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on your recent stay! We would like to thank you for returning to stay with us over the years and want you to know that your concerns will be addressed with the appropriate team members. Your feedback is greatly appreciated as we are always open to hearing about ways we can improve. We hope to see you again!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This is a great hotel that is close to the John Wayne airport. The hotel has free breakfast that is top notch and a good resturant that has good food. I enjoy the rooms and the gym as well because they are clean.
Manager Response: Dear Mark T,  Thank you for your thoughtful review. We are happy to see that you enjoy staying in our clean accommodations and found our food offerings to be top notch. We look forward to welcoming you again sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Had a super comfortable room on a tournament weekend where I coach two hockey teams. The schedule was crazy but every night I had a comfortable quiet room to rest in. In my opinion they have the BEST breakfast in town.
Manager Response: Dear Dave I,  Thank you for your kind review! We are happy to see that you found the room to be comfortable and that you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast. We look forward to seeing you the next time you're in town!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Love to stay here when we return to OC 2-3 times a year.  Great location, ample free parking and usually able to get my favorite room!  Accommodating staff, comfortable stay always.  Good value for price and within walking distance of favorite coffee house and sushi!  Our granddaughter loves the heated pool!
Manager Response: Dear Diane P,  Thank you for taking the time to write a kind review. We are so glad to see that you always find our hotel to be comfortable and of great value! We look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: two nights.........very comfortable and clean with elegance.  Breakfast a bit pricey, good access and parking.  Good access to John Wayne airport.   Just have to continue for a few more characters so here they are.
Manager Response: Dear ronald8,  Thank you for your kind review! We are glad that your two night stay with us was comfortable and that you found our guestrooms to be clean. We look forward to welcoming you back sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Good big rooms with dining table, microwave oven, mini fridge, extra sink in the room area (though I was staying in a suite, not sure how normal rooms look like). Interior design is questionable (unless you like "expensive looking plastic" style), but all is clean and nice. The only reason I did not give 5 stars - is tiny fitness room which gets crowded, no space to do floor exercises, and very basic equipment. If you are a gym enthusiast, stay somewhere else or have a membership that allows to use some of the nearby gyms like 24hr fitness/LA fitness/etc.
Manager Response: Dear Olga N,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review on your recent stay! We are glad to see that you found our rooms to be spacious and clean. In addition, we appreciate your feedback on our fitness center as it allows us to better improve for future guests. If you are ever back in the area, we would love to see you again!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The hotel staff at check-in and check-out were incredibly friendly and polite. The bed in our room was rock solid which made for poor sleep and sore backs. Overall pretty clean except our young son found a condom under the bed, fortunately it was not used and still in packaging. No complimentary breakfast but had free cookies in the lobby. Loud airplane noise as it is across the street from the airport.
Manager Response: Dear adoubleux57,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review on your recent stay with us! We are happy to see that you found our team members to be friendly and accommodations to be clean. I do want to apologize for the unexpected discovery as that was a misstep on our behalf. In addition, we do appreciate your feedback on our Ayres Celestial sleepers in the room as it allows us to better serve our future guests. We hope to see you back with us sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stayed here 5 nights during a training at UC Irvine. The shuttle service from John Wayne airport was very convenient. Check in was fast, and the staff was friendly. I was impressed with the beautiful courtyards which I would have liked to spend some time in had it been warmer. The room I stayed in was fine but nothing special. Negatives: the carpet seemed pretty worn, the comforter covers were basically two flat sheets that kept bunching up, and the shower head was too low (I'm 5'10"). Positives: the room and bathroom were very clean. I liked that the window opened a little bit to let some fresh air in at night. I tried the breakfast the first morning and it was good, but not worth $14 + tax. I found a microwave next to the vending machines in the hallway in which I was able
Manager Response: Dear aprui,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thorough and thoughtful review! We are delighted to see that you found our hotel courtyard to be beautiful and that you had an exceptional stay overall. Your feedback on our shower head and comforter are greatly appreciated as it helps us to better serve future guests. We hope to welcome you back in the near future for another satisfactory stay!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This is hands down one of the most pleasant hotels in the area. The staff were extremely professional yet very personable. The facility is well appointed with a classic boutique vibe and all the amenities one would expect from a  Hotel charging three times the price. Unfortunately I had to move up to LA for business and that’s when the disappointment set in. NOTHING in the LA area even came close to experience provided  To me during my stay at the Ayers. I highly recommend this hotel. I firmly believe they take seriously the rule.. Never inconvenience your guest. Not so much in LA. :(The Ayers... Great facility, Great service, Great food, Great location.
Manager Response: Dear Marshall 1060,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review on your recent stay! We are delighted to see that you found our hotel to be in a great location, and had an overall pleasant stay. It is with great pleasure that we provide our guests with the best experiences. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My wife and I spent a long weekend at the Costa Mesa location. We don't like staying in cookie cutter chain hotels when we travel. Ayres has the look and feel of a small European hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean, the staff is friendly, and the fresh baked cookies in the afternoon are delicious! We would definitely stay at this hotel again.
Manager Response: Dear Bossbear,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review on your recent stay! We are delighted to see that you found our rooms to spacious and our team members friendly. We look forward to welcoming you back for another exceptional stay and more freshly baked cookies to indulge in!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stay at this hotel while on work trips and always have a pleasant experience. With a great location- easy access freeway, close to the airport and especially the friendly and helpful staff, such as Israel who is always ready to help.
Manager Response: Dear steve s,  Thank you for your kind review on your time with us here at the Ayres Hotel Costa Mesa! We are happy to see that you’ve had pleasant experiences at our hotel and that we are in a convenient location for your needs. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Ayres is one of the most beautifully maintained hotels in the area. Close to John Wayne Airport, but tucked back into a quiet area. Beautifully decorated, beds that beckon you to lie in comfort, great amenities, and a local restaurant and lounge that serves delicious food and great drinks. I will never stay anywhere else when in the area.  Take the shuttle down to The Lab, a quirky, cool anti-mall. Across the way is another great shopping/dining area. Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff!
Manager Response: Dear LoreleiPatrice,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a thoughtful review! We truly appreciate your kind compliments to our hotel. In addition, we are happy to hear that you found our rooms to be comfortable and our food offerings delicious. We look forward to welcoming you again soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Really nice place for a fair price
Summary: Recently stayed at this Ayers, and my wife and I were really pleased with it.  It's comfortable, and aside from an occasional airplane from the John Wayne Airport passing overhead, it was quiet and conveniently located.  There was a nice restaurant and bar, and even a happy hour.  The staff was very attentive and helpful after I demagnetized my room key.
Manager Response: Dear Dan_D_12719,  Thank you for your kind review on your recent stay with us! We are happy to know that you found our hotel to be a convenient and comfortable place to stay. If you are ever back in the area, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Le Chateau has delicious food and great service.  The hotel has great service and are always friendly and helpful.
Summary: I stay here often for work purposes, but when I am down in the area for pleasure, this is my first choice as well.  It's location is great for easy access to many localities and the staff of the hotel and the restaurant are second to none.  They always exceed my expectations.  Thanks Ayres and Le Chateau!

Located close to John Wayne airport.  Rooms and common areas are clean and well maintained.  Lots of sushi options in walking distance.  No in-hotel store, but 7-11 nearby.  Complimentary breakfast was fine.

Stayed for a night. Got an upgrade in the check in and ended up in a huge room on 4th fl. Bed and pillows are just perfect and the room was very quiet - with the exception of airport noise from time to time. Didn't go to the brekkie so no comments about that.

This is a beatiful hotel! Very clean and friendly staff, location can't be beat very close to the airport. The hotel resteraunt is also very good. Hotel is within close proximity to many attractions. We took a drive over to Santa Monica pier and had a great day.

Ayres Costa Mesa is our go-to hotel when we visit family in the area.  Walking into the gracious lobby immediately relaxes us after traveling and the desk staff are always warm and friendly.  The rooms are spacious, with all the amenities one expects in a good hotel.  We also love the on-site Le Chateau Bistro, which has a wonderful breakfast buffet, as well as serving lunch & dinner indoors or alfresco in the lovely courtyard.

Stayed at hotel for baseball tournament.  Grounds and facilities were very nice and well kept. Kids loved the pool/spa after a long day of baseball.  Dads enjoyed the bar and the restaurant was very good as well.  Would definitely stay here again!

Beautiful hotel!  Rooms were clean and well appointed.  Convenient location close to the airport, the beaches and good restaurants.  Staff was courteous and very helpful for anything we needed.  Highly recommend!

Great very spacious rooms, good service and in my mind the best breakfast at Costa Mesa/ NEWPORT Beach .  The fitness center is small but the location enables wonderful running trails that one can start and end at the hotel

This was my second time staying here. I enjoyed my stay. It was enjoyable and relaxing. I liked the comfortable beds and quiet room (despite some sort of construction going on across the hall and downstairs). This hotel is still a good value..

Summary Heading: Your Hotel has lost it's heart and what made it great.
Summary: We have been staying there for many years. We make trips down each year to visit with relatives and enjoy your Southern California sunshine. The Hotel is great and the rooms and the beds are great. but you have lost what has made your hotel great and that is the enthusiasm and spirit of the people who work there. I think part of it is when you started charging for breakfast instead of making that part of the experience. To wake up and walk down to the courtyard and enjoy a beautiful Southern California breakfast experience after a great nights sleep. The people have changed in these past two years also as it seems like they are all doing their jobs, but they have lost heart in being part of what made you great. Even the breakfast experience now is not the same as it was. It is

We stayed at the Ayres Hotel for 2 nights for our daughter's softball tournament.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  The breakfast buffet was better than most hotel breakfasts.  Only complaint was that the laundry facility was in the adjacent building and was a hike from where our room was.  Doing laundry to wash 12 girls' uniforms took a little more time than expected, but otherwise, our stay was pleasant.

The rooms and facility are clean and comfortable, all around nice staff, beautiful and pleasant courtyard, convenient to all locations and good restaurant for all meals with plenty of convenient parking as well.

Wonderful hotel.  Jacuzzi tub. Close to Newport for dinner, corona dark mar for a walk on the beach at sunset. Staff extremely friendly and helpful.  Hotel has an onsite restaurant for breakfast. Food is delicious.

The hotel was  great! Staff was friendly and polite.  The hotel was like a step back in time with all the old photos and wood trim, tastefully furnished.  The dinner we enjoyed Friday night was delicious.  I was not disappointed

I chose the Ayers Hotel on Bristol & Santa Ana Ave in Costa Mesa for my brother who is in a wheelchair. This visit he wanted more space, accessibility & comfort than my home provides for his needs. I couldn’t be more satisfied and same with him. First the customer service was great! A real person at the location answered the phone & my questions. They were very accommodating to my brothers needs and friendly. The Hotel is beautiful and nicely appointed! The restaurant is nicely decorated & inviting. There is patio dining as weather permits but the only downfall there are the jets going over from John Wayne airport. Inside the hotel & restaurant we didn’t notice the jets at all. We all thought the room rate was very reasonable.

Summary Heading: Old World Charm with a feeling of home.
Summary: The hotel reminds me of some hotels that I've stayed in Europe.  Miguel in the Garden Restaurant could not have done anything better. His knowledge of the various dishes, his recommendations and accommodations in meeting our questions were truly impressive.  The second night, not only did he treat as family, he remembered our orders from the previous night. He needs a raise.    Arrangements for shuttle service to the airport and within 3 miles of the hotel were expertly done by Bill and Barry.    Reception staff are friendmy, smiling and very helpful.  If you need to stay in the Newport Beach/Costa Mesa area, I can't recommend any better place.

Summary Heading: Best hotel that won’t steal your money around OC Fair
Summary: A small group of us attended a concert at OCFair. The staff was helpful, offered their shuttle service to take us there, and all were friendly. The room is very clean, as expected with Ayers Hotels (love their venues). Beautiful courtyard and pool area, neat lobby and restaurant. Definitely will recommend others!

Conveniently located, beautiful decor, comfortable beds and pillows... spacious rooms, and separate vanity and food areas.    Room and bathroom were clean.  Tub was jetted and allowed for soaking in it up to one's neck!

Very comfortable bed. Clean room, halls, lobby and restaurant. Friendly staff. We enjoyed dinner and breakfast buffet in the restaurant. Favorite place to stay when visiting family in Costa Mesa and Irvine.

In old world feel is one thing an old run down hotel is another.   The employees are sweet and wonderful,  however the overall feel of the hotel, besides the lobby is run down and truly in need of an update.   The room's furniture isn't just old looking it's truly old!

Immaculate room, lobby and restaurant decorated beautifully for the holidays.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Could not ask for more and would highly recommend. It was so affordable that I will stay here every time I come to visit my son in Costa Mesa.

Love staying at the Ayres, as I am always taken care of.  Since I have stayed at this hotel numerous times, I have gotten to know the staff and they are professional, friendly, helpful, and I enjoy being personally greeted by the staff even if I have not been to the hotel in months. These personal touches make staying at the Ayres extra special.   I enjoy the free shuttle service-- another perk that is great.   Food is great in the dining restaurant and I enjoy the buffet breakfast in the morning. When dining in the restaurant, make sure you have the time to spend on a leisurely dinner.    And if you like to play pokemon- there are 2 poke-stops at the hotel!

We had a nice room. They were renovated but we were not really effected by it. Staff were friendly  room was a good size and very clean. Extra towels were not a problem. We loved it. Only down side was alacart breakfast my husband ordered with our two little girls was disgraceful. Clearly left over dry and cold food off the buffet that had finished half an hour earlier.

Very nice and very clean hotel, the lobby and grounds are beautiful and nicely done. Beds and pillows are very comfortable, we would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay. Very pleased!!!

Summary Heading: Modern take on old world charm
Summary: A great little gem in the middle of a big city the Ayres has it all.  Great courtyard in the middle of updated guest rooms that are clean and well kept.  Convenient to John Wayne Airport and the beach. I recommend this quaint hotel whole-heartedly!

Just stayed for one night.  The room was comfortable and had everything we needed.  The onsite restaurant was very good.  I would recommend the Ayres Hotels for anyone looking for a reasonable deal in Southern California.

Summary Heading: Very comfortable bed, everything else thumbs down.
Summary: I booked this hotel though Hotwire which I'm learning is always a mistake.  Hotwire listed it as a four star hotel which it assuredly is not.  The first room I was given, one facing the highway, was dank and musty and dark.  I requested a room with more light and was given another room which was slightly better on the dankness front but which smelled of cigarettes.  The one window in the room barely opens.  The room was shabby generally but the bed was very comfortable.  I was looking for a relaxing getaway in Newport Beach but what I got was a bit depressing highway side spot close to the airport.  The bright spot was wondering out for a bite to eat and finding the fantastic Japanese restaurant Kappo Sui just around the corner walking distance.  If you find yourself at the

Felt like a large Motel 6 that has had cute rustic window shutters added and lots of marble tile laid in the lobby area. Hallway carpets that look like they came out of Las Vegas in 1972. Noisy through the wall air conditioner. Mediocre bed and sheets. High polished marble tile used in bathroom floor area, which was a slippery as one might imagine. Both of us came very close to going down.   I think that Ayres wants to do a good job, but they are not using the right design team. I stayed at a national chain the next night, less money, much more comfort.    I would return if I had to, but it would not be my first choice.

I was honestly blown away by my experience at this hotel! The hotel was decorated tastefully for Christmas, everything was spotless and tidy and the staff were always upbeat, friendly and helpful! I asked for a crib at the front desk and it was in my room and set up by the time we got to our room! The food at the restaurant is very good and they have a great happy hour! I was there alone during the day with our 5 month old as my husband went to a class and I felt very comfortable and welcomed there, as if staying with family. I will be staying here again for sure!

We had an excellent stay here! The only reason why i gave it 4 stars is because the water pressure from the shower was weak. Other than that, our stay was perfect. Our room was clean, check in was easy and staff was very helpful and kind!!!

We recently stayed here after attending our whale watching adventure which I highly recommend! Hotel was very nice and clean. It was well decorated for the holiday. There is a restaurant onsite as well as a lounge. They have a courtyard located in the center of the rooms which was my favorite thing about the hotel. My husband and I enjoyed a cocktail here and sat and just enjoyed the ambience. The pool area was also located in the middle of the hotel and had nice cabana seating. Unfortunately the jacuzzi was out of service or we would have enjoyed that area too. Our room was a good size and had a leather couch inside that turned into a sleeper. Lastly the had fresh baked cookies in the check in area.

This is probably the 4th time I am staying here.  I think the rooms seems to have been renovated as it looks pretty new.  The hotel provides cookies in the evening and some pastries and coffee for us who have to be on the go before their breakfast start at 6:30am. It is very thoughtful.

Very accessible hotel near the airport. Decent gym for a quick workout and clean rooms. Did not dine so no comments there. The lobby and main entrance are very pretty and decorated nicely. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. I found this to be a very reasonable priced hotel worth every penny.

stayed from 12-4-17 - 12-8-17   first few days the wiff was great but the last three days the wiff was slow and poor.     near the airport so you do hear the planes     place was clean and well cared for.   staff was great and supper nice.

We had a a block of rooms this past weekend. The Hotel was really nice, clean and the courtyard was super quiet, the breakfast was fantastic. The staff was very professional and very helpful.  Leslie was wonderful to work with. Kara Kellogg, Sales Manager is one of  the best in the Industry. Everything was perfect and wonderful! High recommend this hotel, by far the best in Orange County for any of your needs.

Excellent staff,comfortable rooms, great location, and good food at restaurant. The restaurant manager is  excellent, always friendly and willing to gime you local advice if you ask. Our Breakfast was always a joy. :)

Summary Heading: Love the Ayres Hotel and Suites!
Summary: The Ayres Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa/Newport Beach is a lovely place to put our UCI visitors. Our visitors always comment on the comfort of their stay and the morning breakfast. Thank you for taking such good care of them.

I have stayed a few times at Ayres Costa Mesa, and each time has been a great experience from the accommodations, the food, and most important the staff.  I live locally but use the Ayres when I am hosting a group of old friends.  We have always planned on taking advantage of its great location by eating at nearby Newport Beach restaurants.  However, we never seem to make it out of the hotel as we have learned it is far more convenient to eat at the on-site restaurant.  Breakfast, lunch and dinner.  All meals are reasonable and great.  A few hints about staying here... ask for a room that opens to the open patio in the lobby courtyard.  This is a great place to gather with friends from other rooms.  Also, if you have a party of six or more for the restaurant, then ask for their

The Ayres Hotel is a perfect place for a business stay. The hotel have all the facilities you need. Rooms are well maintained and good in size also. The hotel is very close to the John Wayne Airport, so you need to accept noise from the planes taking off - so if you are sensitive to that you should ask for a room that are facing the inner courtyard. I have stayed several times at this hotel and every time it have been good. I would appreciate if they upgrade their breakfast buffet to be of a little bigger international character.

Summary Heading: Amazing Boutique Hotel WALKING distance from the airport!
Summary: Amazing amenities, such a cute boutique feel, with amazing customer service. For this type of hotel, i was amazed at how reasonable the prices were. It beats a nice chain hotel all day, since this is more of a cozy feel, with way better service! Love everything about it- highly recommend!

We stayed at Ayers 7 different  times this year. We were never disappointed. The staff was always acomidating, and kind, Fresh cookies, and strawberry cucumber ice water is out on check in. Fresh pastries, coffee and the New York Times are out in the morning before the breakfast buffet begins at 6:30am. The hot Southern California style breakfast buffet is exceptional, and the dinning room with fireplace and garden with fountain makes me feel like I am on vacation in Europe. We spent my daughter’s birthday there this year. The Christmas decorations were very old world, and really lovely.

I like this hotel.  However their workout room is not 24 hours.  They rent rooms next to the workout room and therefore won't open it until 5:30 am.  If you are still adjusted to the east coast time zone and want to get the day started with some exercise  (or are a really early riser) you are out of luck. If the machines/workouts are that noisy, I can't imagine any good time to stay next door. They should just not rent these rooms next unless they are last at a steep discount..

The hotel is right off 405 , around 10 minutes from Newport Beach. I was given the room on the first floor , which is a no no. It just did not feel quite safe . The hotel has an outdoor patio for food and drinks and the rooms are clean . There was no water in the room , even bottle that I could pay for , I don’t know how they expect a person to drink water in such a situation.

When I called to book the room the receptionist went out of her way to check on the group discounted rate for the small festival I was attending, and she called me back right away. The bed was very comfy and the room was nice. We ate dinner at the restaurant and everything was delicious. I noticed air traffic noise from the nearby airport as we were checking in but once we were in our room I didn't hear it. Overall, a very pleasant stay.

I stay at this hotel when I need to travel to the Newport Beach area.  It is convenient to freeways, and, most importantly, it has free parking.  For years I relied on Priceline  for hotels in the area, but too often a good price was erased by $25 a night parking.  The Ayres Hotel is clean, comfortable, and offers good value.  it is not luxurious, but it is an excellent value.  I appreciate the mini-fridge in the room, too.

This is a lovely hotel with two separate buildings.  We were on the 4th floor of the 2nd building (not the one with the lobby).  The junior suite with king bed was very spacious!  The bed and pillows were comfy.  The bathtub had jacuzzi-like jets (but didn't try them).  Yummy cookies in the lobby (but they are out only until 7:30pm!) . The breakfast buffet was very nice - good food and nice table ware (no plastic).  The people at the front desk were very friendly.  I truly like this hotel and would recommend it to anyone!

We registered at this hotel because it was selected by a couple for their wedding accommodations. It is a lovely hotel, quiet, elegant, well priced, convenient to highways and super close to John Wayne Airport. Large rooms. Clean. We were on first floor and had a sweet small patio with table and chairs. Great staff. It's a bit confusing at first because there are two buildings. A primary one where you check in and they have guest rooms, and a secondary one that only has guest rooms. They are only about 100' apart across a section of parking lot. It works out fine. Just a bit wonky at first. A beautiful courtyard open to the air in the main building.

Outside of buildings do not reflect much nicer inside environs.  The two distinct buildings are odd and appointments very lovely, however, I attribute the empty large common areas to the fact that the property was under renovation.  Really nice courtyard in main building.

Summary Heading: The quality of staying in a crown jewel of Orange County!
Summary: Like staying in a piece of socal history.   The housekeeping staff are some of the best ANYWHERE (and I travel worldwide).  Room service is a true bargain (first ever!), far better and faster than the restaurant and the staff bends over backwards to be the best of the best.  They reset my hotel standards, will be hard to beat them.

This is my first time staying at this hotel, and I love this place! This hotel in general is very clean. The Food is delicious and reasonable prices. The staff are so friendly and helpful! The staff is always greeting you and do their best to service you. The staff are truly professionals in every department! The hotel is only 2 minutes away from John Wayne Hotel! They have shuttles to and from the hotel. You are only a few minutes from all the main shopping malls and great restaurant. This place is just centralized! I have been staying in 5 star hotels, and this hotel is just "spot on" those ratings! Thank you for a great time during my stay!

Summary Heading: Five star food and wait staff
Summary: The room was clean and quiet food at restaurant was outstanding tremendous staff  Each meal was better than the next - it’s a great hidden gem and I will absolutely go back and recommend to friends - highly recommended

Long story, staff and rooms were good. I just would not suggest having large events like getting married there. I had to change rooms 4 times becuase of construction / being placed by the restaurant (being the groom). Might be different for you but I definitely didn't enjoy my night before my wedding. But the day of and night was amazing.

This place is up there with one of the best hotels I’ve ever stayed in. Staff friendly, helpful and very welcoming. Gave us a free upgrade to a room that was amazing. It had a separate bedroom then in front room had a mini kitchen with all facilities a sofa desk and tv etc We stayed here for a wedding that was nearby. It’s a perfect location and we’re looking at coming back here in the next year or two when we visit Disney. The Pool is very nice even though a little chilly. The place is so clean I was so impressed. Can’t wait to come back

Good all around stay - staff was friendly and helpful.  Room was spacious and clean.  Food and drink were OK as well.  We used one of the meeting rooms for a small meeting and that also worked well - good furniture, facilities and coffee break.

The Costa Mesa location is a great hotel.  The rooms were clean and spacious.  The staff was helpful and professional.  The breakfast buffet is a nice variety except now they charge for the buffet where they did not in the past.  This was a surprise to us. The location is great for getting to John Wayne Airport.

I like to stay here when I go to Orange County on business.  It is close to SNA and a clean nice hotel.  Have probably stayed here 15 times and never had a bad experience. The staff is friendly and I like the cookies they have in the evening.

From the front Office desk ( Israel & the girls on his shift were always amazing and helpful) To the dinner staff ( ALL OF THEM) , to our breakfast welcoming committee David...  ( He was always so sweet and had such a great personality.) I always looked forward to checking in. Having to call this place home for 7-1/2 weeks for business, the rooms were always clean, the cookies fresh, the water amazing and the atmosphere was fun!!!!!!  Thank you so much for everything, Naomi :) AAA

The hotel was clean and quiet. I got room service and it came promptly   The eggs were not too bad and the sausage and fruit was good. Room service was complete and I would definitely stay at this place again. It was in a good location and close to the freeways.

Carpet looked worn, thin and old. No complimentary breakfast was offered, which has been the norm in my experience, breakfast buffet was nothing special with a charge of a whopping $13,95. Coffee to go, after spending this high price on average buffet, a charge of $2 for a cup of coffee to go. Ugly view of an alley and bed spread was scratchy and thin. Won’t be returning. Will spend my money elsewhere.

Had to stay there on short notice, fires nearby had us evacuate for a night. (House is fine). Booked here since all hotels on orange were already full and this was near my husbands office so he wouldn’t need to fight traffic home. Hotel is under construction but our room was nice.  Clean, hard mattresses, which I like, and no smoke in the air there!  No complaints!

Summary Heading: My 'Go To' Hotel in Orange County CA!
Summary: I have been going to this hotel yearly (when in the area for a conference) for the past 20 years and have never seen a Hotel (or business) so consistently on the mark!  From the great polite professional customer service you are greeted with at the front desk, to the beautiful 5-star decor, to the excellent food in their lovely restaurant with an open courtyard to eat as well, to the beautiful grounds, two pools and hot tubs, gym, and sophistically appointed rooms all with mini fridge and lovely newly remodeled decor. I also love that the rooms are spotless each time I go, being the clean freak that I am.  I seriously look forward to the stay here each year, just 5 minutes from the Santa Ana airport, great breakfast buffet as well. Need I say more?  Great stay year after year

Clean, quiet room with adequate bathroom and free parking - but that’s about it. Smell of mildew throughout the property that happened to be under construction (we were not told of this). Hard bed. No complimentary breakfast. I expect more for $204.56 and damn it - I deserve it!

Rooms are great! Front desk staff great! Greeter at the restaurant front desk in the morning was Great! The only thing I can really complain about is that the staff in the restaurant could use some customer service skills. The restaurant food was delicious!

I'm here on business for a total of about 8 weeks.  I've hit a few rough spots and Israel, who works the front desk, has been gracious and kind in helping me.  He really cares about the guests well being and it shows. His professional warmth has been making my extended stay much better,  as though there's friends here and not just staff. Thank you,  Israel,  for your continued help. I need it! :)
Manager Response: Dear Lyndsay_Wednesday,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with a positive rating and detailed feedback following your stay! We are delighted to see that our friendly team member was able to elevate your stay and provide you with the excellent experience you deserve. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien General Manager

Summary: Had to find a hotel quickly due to a mandatory evacuation. Checked us in rapidly and were very kind and endearing to the situation. Gave us a free breakfast for our troubles. Extremely nice staff. Didn't stay long enough to enjoy amenities but had a great breakfast in their beautiful restaurant and patio. It appeared they had bikes to use and several vans fo transportation.
Manager Response: Dear andravb,  I am pleased to see that we were able to find appropriate accommodations for you. We strive to redefine hospitality and I am pleased to see that we did just that during your stay. I hope to welcome you back in the future, under different circumstances of course.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Terrible visit  No hot water for shower  Late cleaning room service  Courtesy shuttle service mostly for airline crew and trips to airport.  Asked for balcony room.  Got 1st floor room with enclosed patio.  No view at all.  Charged smoking fine and did not smoke i room.  I do smoke do my clothes may have had smoke smell buy did not smoke in room.  Just a terrible experience overall.  Cannot recommend hotel to anyone.  Charged

I stayed here two nights on business. The hotel is being updated in certain parts. There is an "old" smell to the hotel. I had to change rooms because my water wasn't getting hot enough to shower in. They do have a cute courtyard to eat outside, that was neat. We stayed here on business because blot was a preferred by our employer. If the price was right I would stay here again on personal trips.
Manager Response: Dear Ksharkey18,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. The insight you have provided is greatly appreciated as it will allow us to make improvements wherever necessary. I kindly invite you to return to our hotel in the future, we will happily provide the best value.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: At first we didn't know what to expect since it wasn't in a busy location or anything. The hotel was very clean and the court yard was beautiful. The staff was friendly and they also have an onsite restaurant and the food was great.
Manager Response: Dear kerh884,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay as well as the clean and spacious accommodations we offer. Thank you for your compliments regarding our on-site restaurant as well as our attentive team members. We hope to welcome you again soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Yes, the hotel is charming and lovely and well maintained. Even the restaurant food was great. It's fun. But the staff! They were outstanding, every single one of them. And there were just no problems. I enjoyed every minute but I especially want to commend the hotel on the superb staff and their authentic  helpfulness.

The room was comfortable and clean.  Shower was nice and towels were soft and good size. The refrigerator is a great feature, as are the homemade cookies in the lobby! It would be nice if there was a safe in the room.  The restaurant has limited hours but a great menu.  We did not have an opportunity to eat at the breakfast buffet, but the menu looked great with very reasonable prices. This is a very convenient location, the staff is very friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again.

I was so I'll and no none bothered me so I could just rest.  I was in town for a wedding which was incredible .  Everything I needed was right there or in the walking area  the entire hotel was so clean everywhere.

The Ayres Hotel by the John Wayne Airport is always beautifully cleaned!  Staff is WONDERFUL on a regular basis!  I Always send my out of state/international visitors to the Ayres!  The bar is small but very nice.  Cookies and infused water seem to be in the lobby each time I visit too.

This hotel is a gem. The gorgeous French theme really impressed me. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are ample and furnished quite nicely. I slept great on their extremely comfortable bed and couldn’t have been more pleased with my stay. I will definitely stay here again and plan to check out their other hotels as well.
Manager Response: Dear PHXMom99,  Thank you for your excellent review! I am glad to see that you enjoyed our boutique style decor and friendly team members. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien General Manager

Summary: Very nice hotel, definitely photogenic! Front desk ladies very nice, good customer service. Room is clean and spacious, everything’s great and looking forward to staying there again soon, will be my only choice in the area and I’ll recommend to friends and family as well.

I have stayed at Ayres several times and I have always enjoyed my stay. The employees are always pleasant and informative. The rooms service is quick, efficient and the restaurant makes a mean grilled salmon. I will recommend Ayres to all my family and friends.

Very nice, clean and spacious room. Close to the beach cities but for a good price, hotels near the beach are very expensive. Small airport nearby so a lot of noise from smaller aircrafts but not at night. Breakfast was very good, bacon, eggs etc, but also plain yoghurt and fruit. Coffee was good.

Room was nice, very clean, hotel nice, but they need service elevators for their staff, every time we went to use elevator we had to wait for anyone of the following to get off or on before we could use, this included room cleaning staff with large cart, or hotel waiter staff with large cart for different meetings/weddings or dinners. The breakfast was ok little high priced for what was offered and not much choice in food. Bar on Saturday night closed down before 10pm.

Ayres Hotel was a very warm, comfortable resort. The staff was very friendly. Our room was very nice. It was a great advantage to us to be near the airport. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it for others.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I enjoyed reading about your pleasant experience at our hotel. Your compliments regarding our optimal location, attentive team members, and our accommodations are warmly welcomed. Thank you again for your feedback and the recommendations of our hotel. I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The hotel is nice however they put me on a floor that was completely under construction. There were only 3 rooms on the floor that were in use. Many things in the room were off - light bulbs out, plugs that didn't work, fridge that had to be worked on to work. You could tell it wasn't a room that they were planning on using. The most disappointing thing is that they didn't even alert me to this during check-in or offer any type of perk for staying under these conditions.
Manager Response: Dear rsurrenda,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review informing others of your experience. Please accept my sincerest apologies for any and all disturbances. We are adamant about posting renovation notices on our website, however, understand these notices can be easily missed. We also encourage our valued guests to voice any and all concerns immediately so that our team has the opportunity to remedy the situation in a timely manner rather than after check-out. I hope this isolated incident does not deter you from staying with us in the future as we would appreciate the opportunity to welcome you back. Thank you again for your generous review and rating.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Terrible Experience, will NEVER Stay HERE AGAIN the employees were very rude and the flexibly to make changes is impossible.  I was not the only family that felt this way.  We booked a total of 18 rooms and for the most part all felt the same way.  The breakfast was described as being the best but it was not.
Manager Response: Dear avalosbu2003,  I regret to see that your experience was anything less than exceptional. It saddens me to see that we were unable to provide exceptional service, however, we are more than willing to offer any and all necessary accommodations as long as availability permits. Rest assured that improvements will be made wherever necessary and we certainly hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back for an exceptional experience.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for a wedding.  The hotel was very nice.  The room was a good size, comfortable, and clean.  The outdoor courtyard to eat in and the outdoor pool were very nice.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  I would recommend staying here.

Very nice room with comfortable bed. The only issue we had was, my husband went to check out the restaurant for breakfast at 9:15 and the person there kept repeatedly telling him they close at 10. When my husband went to the front desk, he was told that the buffet ended at 10, but we could order of the menu. So we went elsewhere.

This is the second time that I have stayed at the hotel for work.  The rooms are clean, spacious, and have a fridge and wet bar.  There is a shuttle that will take you to the John Wayne Airport or anywhere within a three mile radius.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The food in the restaurant was very good.   Also, there are two pool areas.

Pros:  Ayers Hotels are my first choice. Check in was a breeze, staff very friendly.  Asked for any available upgrades and was quickly given an option. Jr king suite was very nice including a jacuzzi tub. A treat after sight seeing. Hotel is about 3 miles from South Coast Mall , 20 minutes from Disneyland, 25 from Knotts Berry farm. Hotels typically are charming, comfortable, properties and this did not disappoint. Cons: a charge for breakfast unlike the previous Ayers I've stayed at and the pillows definitely need to be upgraded.

Came for work and was impressed with the hotel.  Pluses: - nice decor - reasonable prices - free shuttle to John Wayne Airport - clean rooms - pool and hot tub - decent food - super friendly staff--Every employee you meet or pass in the hallway is so friendly and helpful.   Would definitely stay here again.

we stayed as part of group for a youth soccer tournament. could not have been more pleased. great value, good size rooms, breakfast buffet was good and the ambiance was very nice. staff friendly and helpful. I've paid much more for far less on other trips. this was one of the best! Thank you
Manager Response: Dear steveY2656CP,  Thank you so much for choosing Ayres Hotel and Suites Costa Mesa and for the candid review you have shared. Your compliments regarding our spacious accommodations and our attentive team members are warmly welcomed. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Enjoyed our stay here for my son's soccer tournament over Labor Day Weekend.  Rooms are clean, quiet and spacious.  Included breakfast was awesome and made for an all important start of the day.  Very close to Newport Beach and others - 15 minute drive made visiting friends easy.

This is our second time at this location and there have been some improvements.  The furnishings, the comfort of the beds and the staff are now spectacular.   The food at breakfast was great too.    We will be back.

Beautiful hotel, Close to all amenities.  Rooms were beautifully decorated, quiet and clean.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The breakfast buffet offered many different options.  The grounds are well kept and lovely.
Manager Response: Dear lifesgreatredding,  Thank you so much for your candid review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciate the insight you have provided. Your compliments regarding our unique decor, attentive team members, and premium amenities are greatly appreciated. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Great central location for shopping, dining and entertainment
Summary: Love this chain of hotels! Always the small, boutique feel, even at the larger properties. Rooms are very clean, crisp and comfortable. Most of the time they're  very quiet and relaxing...however, this property is directly under the flight path of the Orange County airport!! Even so, in your room, the noise is well muffled, but sitting in the courtyard it was impossible to converse during the frequent take offs..hence the 4 stars instead of 5!!

Charming hotel with warm inviting Lobby and friendly staff. My room was very spacious and bed was excellent, I like the suit style kitchenette area and furnishings are elegant. It feels like a stay in Europe. The gym is small but it has adequate free weights and treadmills. I'd come back here and enjoy the restaurant next time.. Looked great!
Manager Response: Dear David G,  I am thrilled to read of your pleasant experience. Your compliments regarding our ambiance and the decor of our hotel are greatly appreciated. Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a review. I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Nice little boutique hotel close to shops and restaurants. Bathroom a bit small, Check in was a bit slow but friendly  Ours was in a separate building from the main check in hotel. A bit more pricey than others in area  Nice courtyard and restaurant

Upon arrival I noticed a musky smell in the lobby and in the halls. When I entered the room there was powerful perfume/masking smell. The odor was so strong, all my cloth smelt like it when I got home. Management needs to address this problem.   AJ

Our group was really happy with the restaurant, outdoor areas and the rooms. I slept really well on the super comfortable bed, and loved using the hotel shuttle to see some spots in the area. We'd definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear 366lindsay,  Thank you so much for the candid feedback you have provided. I am thrilled to see that you enjoyed your experience as well as our accommodations and premium amenities. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Just doesn't make the 4 star mark
Summary: It's an older hotel that is rather quaint but more in the need of an update or makeover.  I now understand those who question that it's a 4 star hotel. It does have the amenities but feels more like a 3.5 star hotel.  It's not the best location, on a busy street and you can't really walk to anything. The old building smell is something that only a true renovation could cure.
Manager Response: Dear cctravelerCctx,  Thank you so much for your candid review. The feedback you have provided is greatly appreciated as well as the suggestions you have shared. I also apologize for the confusion, we are in fact a three-star hotel. Thank you again for your feedback, I hope you consider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Decor was warm. Loved the patio. It was nice to see it decorated with flags over Memorial weekend . Shuttle to Newport Beach. Great for couples or families. Friendly staff. This is the best value if you want a comfortable stay near the beach without the overpriced hotel fees.
Manager Response: Dear Rebecca L,  Thank you kindly for your review and the great compliments you have shared regarding our ambiance and attentive team members. We strive to provide the best value for our guests and I am thrilled we did just that during your visit. Thank you again for your feedback, I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Small hotel, small room, smelled musky, bad location with beggars up the street at the gas station. They are not well equipped for business meetings or classes. There are some good restaurants a short Drive away and a parking deck in the basement which is convenient with elevator access from deck to floors. Not recommended.
Manager Response: Dear Ralph R,  Thank you kindly for your review. Though I regret to see that your experience was anything less than exceptional, I truly appreciate your feedback as it will allow us to make improvements. I hope you allow us the opportunity to welcome you back in the future as it would be our pleasure to provide you with the exceptional experience you deserve.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stay in hotels 3 nights a weeks and this was a really poor one..its a hotel used for airline employees so for sure we are paying the difference. For $200 a night you get dirty carpets, a air conditioner unit ( loud, smelly and who uses those anymore?) and no water. They have no water in the rooms or on the property EXCEPT in a vending machine so if you happen to not have any cash you will be asked to go to the shell next door. BTW a small aquafina is $2.50 in the vending machine. Now I am fine with that when I am at a courtyard hotel..but not a "suite". Its very loud because you are right at the airport. Stay at the Hilton Costa Mesa which is the same area and same price with lovely rooms and comp coffee in the lobby and always plenty of water stations. This place needs to be
Manager Response: Dear Brenda B,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review informing others about your recent experience. Please accept my sincere apologies for your experience being anything less than exceptional. Your suggestings and the feedback provided are greatly appreciated. Rest assured that we will make improvements wherever necessary. We certainly hope to welcome you back in the future to remedy your opinion and provide you with the exceptional stay that you deserve.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The staff was very helpful and the property very well maintained. The air conditioning in the meeting rooms seems to have sitting water of some sort which caused an odd odor (mold?) and caused a slight breathing issue however I would step outside on every break for some fresh air and that seemed to help.
Manager Response: Dear kandaceOwens,  Thank you for reviewing Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciate the candid feedback you have provided. I look forward to welcoming you back soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Our team booked several rooms and everyone was very happy. The staff were above and beyond helpful and generous, rooms were great, the property had several areas for our large group to gather/hang out, and the breakfast was wonderful.
Manager Response: Dear jodilynno,  I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your experience at our hotel. Your compliments regarding our attentive team members, comfortable accommodations, and premium amenities are greatly appreciated. I look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location and nice shuttle drivers
Summary: I booked this hotel because of the reviews on TripAdvisor. It is in a great location. I used Lyft alot because some of the places were outside of the 3 mile zone where the shuttle travels. When I used the shuttle service Barry and the other driver ( I am sorry I didnt get his name- an older Latino gentleman) were very nice and helpful. The reason I give it 4 stars and not 5 is the restaurant. The service was very slow during happy hour and breakfast the next morning.  Happy Hour the bartender was solo which made no sense given how busy they were. Breakfast had a lot of people working there, most were getting the buffet not ordering off the menu. I was seated and then basically ignored in the restaurant. It took a long time for someone to take my order and even longer to get my

Clean room , comfortable bed, friendly staff . Cozy in house dining and the food is also great . Nice lobby and patio  area to relax and unwind after a busy day. I like the proximity to UCI AND JOHN WAYNE Airport . Easy access to freeways.

I had the pleasure of staying here last weekend before a flight at John Wayne Airport.  The room and amenities were very nice.  Had the opportunity to use both the pool and spa and both were nice.  Chrissy on the evening shift was very pleasant and provided great customer service.  I'll be back!
Manager Response: Deat MrDRose,  Thank you so much for your candid review. I am pleased to see that we were able to provide distinctive service during your limited time with us. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Ayres property in Costa Mesa and were pleasantly surprised.  The rooms were impeccably clean (this coming from someone who is extremely picky about hotel room cleanliness).  From the lobby to the restaurant and the pool area, it was easy to tell that the Ayres family takes pride in their hotels. The staff was friendly throughout.   The level of service was also top notch.  On our first night, we returned to the hotel to find that a driver had hit an electrical pole (or two, I think) nearby and our building had a complete power outage until morning.  Staff members were at the ready with flashlights and glow sticks lining every single hotel path, step, and hallway.  Windows were able to open to allow rooms to cool down as needed and plenty of outlets were

I was not familiar with the Ayres brand until a friend recommended it. What a surprise!  This is a great property that super-convenient to Orange County airport. There were obviously some close flyovers - to be expected - but they stopped at a reasonable hour and didn't start back up too early.   The suite was comfortable and quiet. And the restaurant is a must while you're there. Great, relaxing atmosphere and fantastic food.   I plan to stay here again when business brings me back to the area, and I would definitely give other Ayres properties a try.

I really can't say enough good things about the service at this hotel.  If you want slick rooms, you can stay elsewhere - but if you want helpful, quick, caring service - then stay here.  They are a busy hotel, good for kids, decent breakfast and wifi - conveniently located by the airport - but also close to kids sporting venues in the Orange County area.  There is a Starbucks, McDonalds, 7-11 and other restaurant choices all within walking distance.  Very appreciative of their service.

I've stayed at this property on occasion over the past 7 years. I used to love this place. My past two visits, one in November 2016 and the most recent in July 2017, have both been negative. I was a late check in, arriving after 9pm, and the energy at the front desk was frenetic. The phone was ringing and there was a guest waiting in line. The combination appeared to be too much to handle.The gentleman checking me in recited some well rehearsed monologue that I could hardly understand because he was speaking so quickly. I like to feel like a welcomed guest and not a robot. He issued my room key and I decided to check out my room prior to moving in my bags. I learned the hard way on my last visit that there is an area of this hotel with tired, outdated rooms. Sure enough, as a

I was there for my High School Reunion.  The rooms are great.  The event went smoothly and the environment was fitting for the hotel site.  The location was central towards Irvine and very close to freeways.  I enjoyed the stay.

The rooms were very comfortable and quiet - which is interesting because it IS in a flight path for John Wayne airport. But, I never heard a plane when I was in my room. I specifically made note of that because when I was outside - I heard them a lot! All of the staff that I encountered were very pleasant. I ate breakfast there everyday and it was good. They also have great coffee!! No need to go outside the hotel to get my morning coffee which is not common in my experience - although there is a Starbucks within walking distance if you prefer. Although I did not personally use the pool - the pool area was very nice looking - but I certainly would not want a room that was around the pool area unless I had kids with me. Then it would be awesome to just walk out to the pool. I

Staff very helpful especially the shuttle drivers and bellhop staff.  The room was comfortable and the accommodations in room were excellent. I will be back.  Very close to John Wayne Airport but not too loud.
Manager Response: Dear Richard K,  THank you so much for your candid review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your experience as well as the attentive service our team provided. Thank you for your compliments regarding our accommodations and optimal location. I look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I'd stay here again in a heart beat. Super close to the airport (maybe 5 min), great breakfast buffet, clean rooms, some rooms with a nice view of the courtyard, business center, pool, etc. I really enjoyed my 2 day stay here!
Manager Response: Dear Rebecca H,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am thrilled that you enjoyed your stay as well as the optimal location of our hotel and the premium amenities we offer. I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The hotel was nice - grounds were clean and well maintained.  It's located near the airport if you need that.  The food at the restaurant and caterer was top notch, people are nice rooms are decent size.  No real complaints other than the airport noise.
Manager Response: Dear Kevin S,  Thank you so much for the great review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your experience and truly appreciate the feedback you have provided. Your compliments regarding our accommodations and service are warmly welcomed. I hope to serve you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Hotel location is convenient for my purpose. 7-11 is just next the hotel. and hamburer, Japanese, or other kind of restaurants are around there. Staffs are kind and friendly, so it is easy to ask something to staffs. Morning buffet is relativery not expensive nd servise is great, however, quality is so-so.
Manager Response: Dear reih701,  Thank you so much for your candid review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your experience. Your feedback is greatly appreciated as well as your compliments regarding our optimal location and attentive team members. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Staff are very caring and supportive it's a very friendly environment. Restaurant was nice, bartender was great. Dinning is available outside too, that's nice. Shuttle was great to and from Balboa tomorrow I'll try another location..

Summary Heading: Very nice feel to the hotel with paintings, furnishings and courtyards.
Summary: If you like a European feel then this hotel satisfies. Enjoyed our stay. Breakfast buffet is very good and we enjoyed evening drinks from the bar which stays open until 10pm. The elevator is small and slow so we used the back stairs quite a lot to save time. When full, parking is tight but we were able to find something even after 10pm when we arrived. Only drawback is that being close to John Wayne Airport, during the day there is frequent jet noise overhead...not from the room...but makes it uncomfortable in the courtyards when chatting. Overall reasonable value for a nice hotel in a nice location - close to Airport, Costa Mesa, South Coast Plaza shopping, Fashion Island Shopping, Newport Beach and Irvine.

I love the Ayres! Perfect for our high school reunion at the Newport Beach Tennis Club, the warm atmosphere is welcoming with lots of vintage images of Newport Beach and the surrounding areas.  My parents live about six minutes away making it the ideal place for our family's many adult children and their families.     I would say because of their consistency over the dozen or more years, I rely on the Ayers Hotel and stay as often as possible.    I see they have some new policies which were enacted regarding parking.  Logically, they are hoping to provide hotel guests parking for their vehicles in the large lot.  I was nervous about why I was asked to sign a duplicate Permit to prove I received it.  That was unusual for me, usually the facility either notes your vehicle's

Summary Heading: Accessible Room in an impossible location
Summary: I need and asked for an  accessible room. The accessible room was located at the very end of a very very long hallway.When I asked to be moved I was told the hotel was full, Also the other accessible rooms where all located in this area at the end of this long hallway.It was so difficult to leave the room once I was in, that for my two day stay at the Ayres Hotel I had to plan as few trips in and out of the hotel as possible.Who ever put the four accessible rooms it this terrible accessible area should be ashame of themself. I will never stay at an Ayres Hotel again and if you need an accessible room chech where it is located.
Manager Response: Dear Sea-FAB,  Thank you so much for your candid review. Though I regret to see that your experience was anything less than exceptional, I truly appreciate the feedback provided. I hope your future accommodations are comfortable and satisfying.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept on, clean, quite, friendly staff, easy access on and off freeway. We liked it so much we spent a lot of our time at our hotel. We will be staying here again soon

The hotel isn't much to look at from the street, but inside is a different story. Inside felt like a calm, quiet oasis with the blocks of hotel rooms broken up by open air courtyards that held a little fountain area with cafe tables (adjacent to the restaurant but open to all) and the pool. Our room was spacious and comfortable. The times we made requests to the front desk, we were given double whatever we asked for quickly. My one complaint is that the hotel's layout is confusing! They need labeled maps in the hotel rooms. Fortunately, the front desk was always happy to help with any questions.

Our company uses this hotel for its employees. Always are greeted by a very friendly staff. The rooms are large and clean, it's quiet, and the beds are very comfortable. There is a great little bistro that has great HH prices. Can't go wrong staying here.
Manager Response: Dear scott v,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your experience as well as the service our attentive team provided. Thank you so much for your feedback. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The staff treated my family and friends so well during our wedding weekend, so well that we have already started planning return trips for next year. The pool was clean, well maintained and the pool side service was delivered wth professionalism and pride.  The front of the house derive went out of their way to accommodate my family from overseas that had to either extend or cut their trip short by a few days. This meant so much to my wife and I during the days leading up to our wedding.  Our overall experience at the Ayers was top notch, Orange County and the staff at the Ayers know what customer service is suppose to be all about.  We will be back again at the end of summer and are looking forward to our next visit with the sales team and staff at the Ayers.

The Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa was absolutely beautiful. The rooms were spacious and clean. The staff was wonderful and extremely accommodating. The food at the restaurant was unbelievable. I will definitely being staying here again.
Manager Response: Dear rclinkard,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review to inform others about your recent stay. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay as well as the accommodations we offer. Thank you for your compliments regarding our attentive team members as well as the fantastic food at Le Chateau Garden Bistro. I look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Visited the Ice Cream Museum. The Aryes location is always very nice and customer service is excellent. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The availability of the microwave  is the best. The pool area and over look from the room is very soothing. I loved the history.
Manager Response: Dear ladeej2u,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your experience. Your compliments regarding our attentive team members and the service they provided are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for your insight. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This property is wonderful the staff is always smiling and ready to help out. The rooms are spacious and the mattress are very comfortable. The cafe serves a nice breakfast and a delicious dinner. ✔️👍🏼
Manager Response: Dear 990sonia,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am thrilled that you enjoyed your visit as well as the attentive service our team provided. Your insight is greatly appreciated and I hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Nice hotel and great service. Good for business, pickup at airport and free shuttle to nearby business location. Bar and restaurant ok. Driver and reception friendly, clean rooms, reasonable prices. Seems like mostly adults at hotel.
Manager Response: Dear ieee_poulsen,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciate the feedback you have provided. Thank you kindly for your great compliments. I hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Pretty quiet, clean, pleasant environment, close to freeways, pool, jacuzzi, restaurant with breakfast buffet, good coffee, non-smoking and warm cookies.  What more could you want?  Business Center, good A/C.
Manager Response: Dear familysleuth2001,  Thank you so much for the great review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your experience at our hotel and the value we strive to offer. Your compliments regarding our optimal location and accommodations are greatly appreciated. I look forward to welcoming you soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager
