Summary: This place was perfect we had 2 rooms one on the hotel side and one suite. The court yard with the fountain was beautiful and the room was steps away from the pool.  The suite on the other side was roomy and comfortable with 3 kids and 2 adults.Loved everything about it
Manager Response: Dear lovebug29044,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. I am thrilled to see that you enjoyed your time with us as well as the accommodations we offer. Thank you so much for the insight you have provided. We hope to welcome you back very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Always pleasant and now with car charging stations!
Summary: My husband and I have stayed here several times, since we have family in the area.  The rooms have always been clean and well appointed; we have yet to have a room that was not quiet.  Previously the room had come with a breakfast buffet which had everything - hot (eggs, potatoes, sausage, bacon, etc., along with cold muesli, fruit, yogurt, muffins, breads and delicious coffee.  Now you have the choice of adding the breakfast buffet or ordering off the menu, which we have chosen to do the last few stays.  This was already a favorite place for us to stay, but now with the free electric car charging stations (Tesla - don't I wish!) and regular charging station for our Chevy Volt that is a terrific added bonus.  The only negative and it is minor is that it is not easy to access the

We had a family stay here.  The doesn't look like the beautiful pictures online.  The carpet in our room was so dirty, the little kids' feet were black after walking around on it. On the phone, we were quoted one nightly price for all the nights we were staying there. When the bill came, there was a different price for each of our four nights, and none of them were as low as the price quoted on the phone, some much higher. On the positive side, the wait staff in the restaurant was extremely friendly and helpful, and the food was quite good.  They have a nice happy hour also.
Manager Response: Dear seashoregal05,  Thank you so much for your review. Though I regret to see that your experience was anything less than exceptional, I do appreciate the feedback you have provided. Rest assured that your insight will be used to make improvements wherever necessary. Thank you again for your review and your compliments regarding our friendly team members.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The Ayers is a perfect place to hang your hat for a day or 2, or a week!  The staff is helpful and friendly, and every convenience is right at your fingertips.  We have stayed numerous times for medical trips, and the Ayers never fails us.  The shuttle service makes it so easy to come from out of state and not have to worry about renting a car.  The restaurant is delicious, the business center makes it easy to check in for flights or look online for outings.  The location is perfect--we have walked to Balboa Island and to a few local restaurants in beautiful weather!  This hotel is our Go-To!

I always use Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa- Newport Beach. Because convenient location, good service, and a clean room. Also, they have a discount program for University of California Irvine student.

Summary Heading: Avoid this hotel if you expect four diamond service and rooms
Summary: Front desk seemed uninterested and rude. Gave us a handicap room even though we did not request or require. Went back to front desk and gave another room. Room was old and worn out, carpet dirty, AC in window. Really do not know how this hotel is four diamond.
Manager Response: Dear Tyler S,  I do apologize for any confusion. We are not a 4 diamond rated hotel, we are a 3-star hotel. Nevertheless, this confusion does not excuse us from providing sub-par service. Please accept my sincere apologies for the service you received. Your insight is truly valuable as it will allow us to make improvements if necessary. I hope you consider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This is my 13th year of staying at the Ayres Hotels, my 11th in Costa Mesa. Just as things change, so some remain the same. This is true with the Ayres Hotels. From the change in the adorable little gift shop to a beautiful business center, the included breakfast buffet, to the additional purchase of it with your room stay. Understanding how to keep costs down while still providing the best they have to offer is a main priority with Ayres. But through it all, many of the same faces from Jose the bartender, who always has a smile and a kind word to the fantastic servers in the restaurant, still remain the heart of Ayres. Shuttle service with a smile, always engaging in conversation. The employees are a joy. Beautiful rooms, the most comfortable beds and linens. I've said it

Good modern hotel right next to John Wayne airport. It seemed to be well used by airline crews, business people and vacationers. Has a lovely courtyard patio with a central fountain, where you can just sit or take breakfast. Our room overlooked this courtyard and, because the weather was not great, it was not much used in the evening. I could imagine that on a warm evening, there could be some noise from the courtyard which would be heard in the overlooking rooms - but no evidence for that from our stay. There is also a good restaurant attached to the hotel, where we had a good meal. Only downside was that no was breakfast included, and there was some noise from the planes -but that stopped during the night, so no problem.

Clean and friendly, excellent staff, always a pleasure to stay.  Been staying there every time I go to Irvine.  I always see pilots and staff from airlines staying there as well, since close to John Wayne airport, so that say's a lot!!
Manager Response: Dear tcl0se,  Thank you kindly for your continued loyalty and for taking the time to write a review. Your compliments regarding our attentive team, top-notch service, and comfortable accommodations are all greatly appreciated. I look forward to serving you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: A very nice clean hotel. The pools were great and the room was clean and well layed out. Check in process was easy and simple. Everyone seemed friendly. Only complaint is the noise from airport but what can you expect when staying near airport. Would definitely recommend

A good experience from start to finish. Before the day of arrival I called a couple of times for changes and information, the girl on the phone was helpful and friendly. (Not like the girl my sis had to deal with at her hotel. Rude front desk) The hotel as a whole is very calm, clean and inviting. I love the patio area with the fountain. Very cute. My daughter and I went for a walk there while we waited for everyone else to wake up. The rooms were very clean and comfy. The food at the restaurant was very good. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Gina N,  It is a pleasure to see that you enjoyed your stay. We constantly strive to provide exceptional customer service and I am glad we were able to do just that during your stay. Thank you so much for your kind compliments regarding our attentive team members. Thank you again for your review I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stay here at least once a year, when we attend the Newport Jazz Featival. They have shuttle to the event which saves on parking. The shuttle is nice if you like to enjoy a few drinks while you listen to the music.  Great reception staff. The rooms are large and well appointed. If you're staying longer than over night check out a junior suite it includes a whirlpool tub, which comes in handy after a day of shopping or a visit to Disneyland. This place is close to great shopping and the ocean. It has it all. They pick up from the airport too, so next time you are visiting Orange County CA think about staying at the Ayers you will have a great stay

Obviously I was expecting those cookies to be fresh baked (a la Doubletree)  Besides this...the hotel is very nicely decorated as I think most viewers have commented on.  My problem with it is the thin walls!  My son and I stayed here for our visit to Irvine (which is about 10 min. away) and we could hear a pin drop but when someone walked in the hallway using a regular voice we heard her very clearly!  I shudder to think what it would be like if some wild party was going on or more people were at the hotel - it was not too busy the night we stayed.  We were on the first floor and again we heard people who were chatting by their car.  We did the happy hour in the bar so that my son could get some calamari - he enjoyed it...I was to full to eat.  The staff was friendly enough but

Hotel was very clean, and rooms were clean and peaceful, very relaxing.  Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful all the time.  Location is very well situated you can get to the beach and other office buildings in short time.  To top it off, there is a Japanese restaurant across the street, you can walk to, takes about 3-5 minutes walk.

Summary Heading: Courtney was extremely helpful as was the rest of the crew.
Summary: Courtney was extremely helpful as was the rest of the front desk crew. She even helped us with Uber.  Your crew were extremely knowledgeable and helpful and courteous. Thanks to all for your personal attention to detail.  Sincerely  Kathleen McDonough

Stayed for 3 nights.  Close to airport and shuttle was so quick and easy! Staff was extremely friendly.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Location very convenient.   Only drawbacks- safes available at front desk but not in room.  No free breakfast.  Would definitely recommend an stay again!!

This is a very nice hotel.  It's a little hard to get to, but very close to John Wayne airport.  Just down the street is an amazing place to eat if you like Mexican food.  It's called Acapulco and is worth the time to go there, especially for the lunch buffet.

Summary Heading: Very beautiful and nicely decorated hotel
Summary: My husband and I stayed here and just loved it. So pleasing to the eye when you walk in and see the lobby. The staff are very professional and so nice. We stayed here on a tip from my sister and I am glad we stayed here.

I enjoyed my stay at the Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa.  Close to the airport, friendly staff, unique layout including interior courtyard and my room was very comfortable.  I was also able to rent a bike at the hotel and pedal to Newport Beach for a great bit of recreation while I was there.  I also enjoyed the nautical theme and pictures telling the story of LA development history on the walls.

I was in Costa Mesa on business and found this an excellent place to stay. The staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and nicely appointed. Bed was fine. I also enjoyed the historical photos on the walls along the hallways on the first floor.

Summary Heading: Ayers Hotel in Costa Mesa, CA
Summary: The staff at Ayers are extremely helpful - if you are there through the weekend, they can give you some great ideas of places to go besides Disneyland.   I have found everyone from the front desk to the van drivers to be very helpful and friendly.   The restaurant has one of the best salmon salads that I have every had and would highly recommend it.

Summary Heading: great location in Costa Mesa, CA
Summary: We have stayed at the Ayres hotel upon the recommendation of our relatives who live in the area.  The hotel is very classy and has a European feel.  The courtyard is so lovely.  The beds are comfortable but as with almost every hotel, the pillows are not to our liking.  That is our only complaint.  It is a little tricky getting in and out of the hotel because it is on a one-way street, but it is close to Orange County airport.

Upon arrival, tv didn't work, toilet didn't work... was going to hang out at pool for a couple hours while room was getting cleaned and Maintinance fixing problems only to find out a wedding was taking place and could not use... so then I go to a quiet patio area also used as outside seating for restaurant, which was pretty much empty, only to be asked to leave if wasn't eating or drinking from bar... that was last straw... The rooms were clean although carpets were old and stained and room decor is out dated big time.... only thing good about this place is the price , probably will not return

I stayed at this hotel over a 3 day period for a business conference.  Great hotel, restaurant, and staff! I was very pleased with my stay.  The hotel has unique, nautical themed artwork. feels like a very local boutique hotel but with extremely high quality service.

We were conducting a 2-Day Business Meeting at the Ayres Hotel and many of the participants were also staying at the hotel. The service was excellent, tastefully decorated and near everything. The only time I heard the planes flying overhead was by the pool! We also had a delightful dinner in the restaurant.  I would recommend extending Breakfast Buffet to at least 9:30AM preferably 10:00AM and making sure the food buffet is hot - French Toast and eggs were cold

The hotel is in perfect locaiton from the Airport and access to major roads. Overall the hotel is clean, rooms are comoftable, excellent vibe and good bar & resturant on premises. The staff is very helpul.

We had a customer event using one of the Ayres  meeting rooms. The staff did an awesome job catering to our needs. The hotel rooms are very nice as well. We will definitely be back. The restaurant was very good.

This was such a fun place to stay. It's really pretty, and close to everything (Newport Beach is a 15 min drive, malls and good food are close, coffee shop and gas station on either side).  The staff was also really nice.  I didn't get to go in the pool but there's great furniture surrounding it under canopies... it looks really relaxing. There's a cardio room and weight room. It has everything, but doesn't feel like a cold, corporate environment. It feels like you're staying on the riviera or something.

This hotel has it all.  Clean, comfortable rooms and a great restaurant on premises.  Very quiet and good location.  We had dinner and breakfast at the restaurant and both meals were very good.  Pool and Jacuzzi, too.

I recently stayed at  the Ayres Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa for business  and I was pleasantly surprised by the great value, location and friendliness of the staff.  They are close to all the major sites and beach without the hefty prices!  My only disappointment was breakfast was not included in the room price, but my company was afforded a discount at this location.  Happy hour was nice pricing also, with reduced appetizer prices along with adult beverages.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.  I did not have a "suite" but a colleague of mine did and it had a microwave and refrigerator, perfect if you are traveling with children.  They also have a fitness center and pool on site.  I will definately stay there again!

Summary Heading: Great location and deals for wedding block
Summary: Ayres worked with our venue with giving a great deal on hotel blocks so we decided to go with it and also stay there ourselves the night before and of the wedding. the rooms were great and the hotel is nice. Staff was very friendly and it is located very close to John Wayne for traveling guests. My only bummer was we booked the biggest suite, a 2 room one and it was a LOT smaller than I thought it may be BUT we made it work for getting ready the day of. They also offer free parking which is huge for most hotels in the area. Definitely would recommend to other people in the future.

Such a pleasant surprise! It's a wonderful weekend getaway. It's super quiet and the traditional decor is beautifully appointed! It reminded me of the wonderful conservative 5-star hotels of The French Quarters.   Israel at the Front Desk is engaging, helpful, and it shows that he truly loves what he doesn't!

Room is very centrally located for my needs there are lot's of place to eat and drink in walking distance. Having a restaurant on the property allows you to stay close. Rooms are very clean and the staff friendly.
Manager Response: Dear kerridaniels,  Thank you so much for your review. I am pleased that you enjoyed the comfortable accommodations we offer as well as the optimal location of our hotel. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and I hope to welcome you back in the near future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Everything was exceptional!  The room , the restraunt, the staff! The room was very clean and smelled fresh upon arrival. Hotel decor was beautiful.   have officially made AYRES our go to hotel when traveling.
Manager Response: Dear ttaran_181575,  Thank you so much for the feedback you have provided. I am pleased to see that your experience was exceptional and that our team was able to provide a personalized guest experience. Thank you so much for your kind compliments and for making us your go-to hotel! I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Review for hotel used for OC marathon
Summary: I stayed here for the 2017 OC marathon and found it very useful, easy to find, close to the racing site and loved they offered race day shuttle at convenient times. I would use it again.  hotel was as expected. staff was friendly and informative. hotel was clean. ate at mitsuwa for dinner which is close by. offered late check out for the race participants.
Manager Response: Dear Monica S,  Thank you so much for your feedback. I am pleased that you enjoyed your experience and greatly appreciate the feedback you have provided. Your compliments regarding our optimal location and attentive team members are warmly welcomed. I hope to serve you again soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We enjoy staying at your property every time we come to Costa Mesa!  The pool area is very nice and the staff is very friendly.  Parking on some nights was a little difficult but other than that, we had a great stay.

Hotel is very nice. The staff extremely helpful and friendly. It was convenient drive to UC Irvine and airport. We had the time to take a ride out to Laguna beach and hotel again  conveniently  located. Recommend to anyone.

We enjoyed our stay at at the Ayres Hotel and Suites. This property consists of several buildings. Our room was not in the main building.  It was very beautiful and decorated in a classical baroque style. The bed was very comfortable and large. There were not outlets near the bed, which made charging my phone difficult. The room has a nice lounge couch with a mini fridge, microwave, and wet bar. We were assigned an accessible room, so the bathroom had a roll in shower with a curtain. I did not like the set up of the bathroom, as it caused water to pool on the floor. We ordered food from the restaurant and it was delicious and not too expensive, as far as room service goes. The pool and jacuzzi area was nice, too. Free parking and Wifi. Overall, it was a great hotel.

great place to stay. unassuming from the outside but very nice inside. will stay again!  feree coffee in morning only available very early and goes quickly. restaurant in hotel has very good food and daily happy hour.

Really great place to stay. Clean rooms. Clean bathroom. We enjoyed happy hour in the garden. Great food at great price. Lovely wine. Close to eateries across from hotel on Bristol st. Starbucks within walking distance! Near Mariners church which is a great campus. Near the beach. Near Van Guard University. Enjoyed our 2 night 3 day stay! Highly recommend.

We stayed at this hotel during a visit to Concordia.  It took us less than 15 minutes to get to the university and it offered a very reasonable Concordia discount.  This hotel reminded me of a quaint European style hotel.  It had a beautiful outdoor patio area.  The room was comfortable. The mattress could have been better but was not uncomfortable.  The a.c. in the room didn't work as well as I'd have liked but we all slept fine.  And the best part of the hotel was the extremely warm, welcoming and helpful staff.  Don't expect much, though, from the breakfast buffet.  It was more like a bigger version of the type of breakfast you can get for free in most hotels.  There is an IHOP less than 5 minutes away by car.  The location of the hotel is within walking distance of

Great Hotel! This hotel was very nice, clean and conveniently located to University of California, Irvine. My 2 sons and husband went for UCI's open house in April and found the Ayers hotel very accommodating. The only drawback is not having breakfast included with the room price, especially if you just want to grab a quick, small bite, and not have an entire meal. A food voucher at their onsite restaurant would be a nice plus to this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Lindsey M,  Thank you so much for the feedback you have provided. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your experience as well as the accommodations we offer. The insight and suggestions you have provided are greatly appreciated as it will allow us to make improvements wherever necessary. I hope this does not deter you from returning to our hotel in the future as we would love the opportunity to welcome you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I would definitely stay here again.  The price was reasonable and the accommodations were very pleasant.  There is a pretty courtyard to enjoy socializing and a brunch is also included in their restaurant within the hotel. We used our Triple AAA card and got a discount as well.
Manager Response: Dear cindypK4525SS,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and the value that we strive to provide each valued guest we meet. Thank you kindly for your feedback and the compliments regarding our accommodations. We hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Professional staff, hot, delicious and timely room service breakfast. Excellent shuttle service to the airport. Room was perfect. I will always try to stay there when I am in the area. Conveniently located.
Manager Response: Dear E7019AIcindyf,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am delighted that you enjoyed your stay and the service our attentive team provided. Your compliments regarding our perfect accommodations and the premium amenities we offer are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for the review!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Received a free upgrade to a deluxe suite. This was exceptional and has spoiled me for standard rooms now. It was very clean and well decorated. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel is close to amenities. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Bob C,  We strive to provide a distinctive guest experience and I am pleased to see that we did just that during your visit. Thank you for the great review as your feedback is appreciated. Your compliments regarding our attentive team members and the cleanliness of our accommodations are warmly welcomed. I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Rooms are spacious. Very conformable beds. Has two swimming pools, Breakfast is fantastic. Staff is very friendly and courteous and well prepared for emergencies (There was a power outage at 5 in the morning -due to an auto accident) and the staff had "glow sticks in all hallways and public areas in less than 5 minutes. Fast and easy check in and out. Provide complementary coffee and rolls in AM and cookies in PM. Very central location to many activities and destinations in Orange County for our 5 day stay.

I had to stay unexpectedly for one night visiting an ill relative and leaving really early the next morning. At first I checked in with Marissa whom was warm, informative and friendly, what I would expect from a front desk agent. She even gave me a 10% coupon for breakfast. I used to be in the hospitality industry and even in management level years ago so I have an idea of the dos and don'ts of the industry. The hotel was clean and cute but needs major decor renovation. Very old fashioned! Then things started to go downhill at 3am when a couple of intoxicated guests were loudly laughing and yelling for nearly an hour up and down the hallway waking me up with a major headache. Then I woke up at 6 and quickly got ready to eat breakfast and check out for my hour drive back. Upon

The staff always goes above and beyond to make sure you are satisfied. Perfect location to visit Newport & Huntington Beaches. They have a free shuttle that will take you most places that you would like to eat and SOCO Mall. Definitely try the breakfast buffet, it is really delicious.  Excellent Hotel.

We have stayed at Ayres in Costa Mesa and have always had a great stay.   Rooms are clean and comfortable.  Staff is always very nice and helpful.  Breakfast is good and affordable.   Location is very good.   The only drawback is parking--not enough spaces and the spaces are very small.   Overall, though, we really enjoy our stays here.

We had a junior suite, room 271 in the suites building. I thought the price was right for the size of the room. What was extremely strange was the on/off switch for the jacuzzi tub was across the bathroom next to the light switches. At first I thought it was a heater switch, because you turn it like the old fashioned heat lamp switches. So, I never did turn on the jets. The staff is very friendly and gave us a room even though we showed up early. The only thing is it was on the 2nd floor, and I could feel the person above me walking in late and getting up early.  Shower water pressure was good. Towels are thick, not 5 stars but good. Bed is comfy and plenty of tv channels. we did not use the pool or fitness center. we did have drinks and some food in the courtyard. Beware if you

We have stayed at the Ayres Hotel, Costa Mesa since 1989 when it was known as the Countryside Inn.  Always the same friendly atmosphere, clean and very comfortable. Ideal for Newport Beach and Balboa Island.  Courtesy transportation saves the hassle of driving and parking, plus you can enjoy a glass of wine with your meal without worrying.

This is a fabulous hotel with terrific customer service.  I always feel welcome and appreciated.  I love the courtyard, restaurant, room, and especially the airport shuttle always available for me so I don't have to rely on family to take me to and from.

Summary Heading: Comfortable Place in OC That Won't Break The Bank
Summary: I've stayed here twice now in the last month.  Friendly and efficient at reception.  Rooms are large and comfortable and quiet.  Nicely appointed if a little too fussy and old-fashioned for my taste.  Not stylish with clean lines.  But high quality linens and beds, etc.  This is not W or Westin, but neither is the price.  Plus free parking and no "Resort" fee.  Excellent value.

I have stayed at this hotel several times while attending a yearly conference at UC Irvine.  It is conveniently located, It has great service, and the staff is very friendly and helpful.  I walked to campus through on the bike path and it was beautiful.  The food at the court was great, coming from the midwest it felt great to sit at the courtyard, sip wine, and have hors d'oeuvres.  I have also had to do work overnight at the hotel, and used the computer and printer, and ordered room service.  Top quality.  They have coffee early in the morning with pastries, though there is also a Starbucks just a block away.  Close to Newport Beach too.

The service and rooms at the Ayres are excellent. The staff are polite and helpful in general. While we were there there were some drunk, noisy guests. When we complained about being woken in the middle of the night, action was only taken when my husband threatened to call the police. We were subsequently given a complimentary night. However, there is no policy for the staff with regard to dealing with noisy, drunk guests. The staff will be polite to everyone so there is no guarantee of a quiet restful stay at the Ayres.
Manager Response: Dear 575chandrew,  Thank you for the insight you have provided. I am glad that you enjoyed our accommodations as well as the welcoming service our team provides. Your concerns are also appreciated. Please note that the actions our team members take or do not take are always with our guests' best interest at heart. Safety is also a priority for us. Thank you again for your insight.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: A Week's Stay For Annual Off-Site Conference
Summary: I always stay at the Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa.  In the multiple times I have stayed here, my assigned room was always clean and fresh, and the staff is always pleasant and helpful.  I like to fly in to John Wayne Airport (SNA), and this Ayres is just across State Highway 73 at the end of the departure runway.  The airlines only take off between 7:00 AM and 9:00 PM for noise considerations, so early mornings and late evenings are  peaceful.  This Ayres is very close time-wise to restaurants, the South Coast Plaza Mall, and Newport Beach.  The Ayres has a sit-down restaurant with a breakfast buffet.  I highly recommend this hotel, but just leave a room for me!
Manager Response: Dear randyj64,  Thank you so much for your candid review and for choosing Ayres Hotels time and time again. Your compliments regarding the cleanliness of our accommodations and our attentive team members are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for your review and for the recommendations of our hotel. I look forward to serving you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The plus points: it's close to the airport, offers a free shuttle bus, the courtyard and the staff are extremely helpful and cheerful.  The minuses: it's tired and needs a bit of TLC, it's dated in virtually all decor, the breakfast....... which was advertised as a buffet is a sad and sorry excuse............. yet costs $14............... two items on offer I couldn't even identify. The location isn't great either on a road that at least on 4 occasions had road racing going on through the night.
Manager Response: Dear X4571ODrossm,  Thank you for the feedback you have provided. Though I regret to see that your experience was anything less than exceptional, the feedback you have provided is greatly appreciated. I hope you consider staying with us in the future as renovations are underway.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This hotel is very nice. We were upgraded to a suite and appreciated the extra space in the room and the bathroom. Staff was very friendly. We ate at the restaurant for breakfast and dinner and both were good. The only drawback is that it is near the John Wayne Airport so the noise was a bit of a distraction, at least until about 10pm. Overall this was the best hotel on our trip to Southern California.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel and Staff !! But KEEP ALL POOLS open ALL Year !!!!
Summary: 2 Great pools--MANAGER PLEASE TO DO NOT SHUT THEM DOWN ---WITH SAID " MAINTENANCE"-----AS YOU POSTED IN THE SUITES BUILDING in Late Febr/March.....we all know you just dont want to supply towels !!!!  We come here a lot and we see the trick !!     Jared at Front is Great and helps us often with room Changes--Please tell him thanks !!  and ALSO Barry the Driver is Great and takes us where we need to Go Between his runs !!  Thanks to him TOO !!  Great Food...just a little Pricey...Rooms ALL need serious updating ....smells like Grandmas old Couch..
Manager Response: Dear Dana R,  The insight you have provided is greatly appreciated as well as the kind compliments in regards to our attentive team members. Rest assured scheduled maintenance on our facilities is done with our guests best interest at heart and to comply with regulations. Thank you again for your feedback. I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Terrific base camp for a business trip.
Summary: The hotel is well appointed and clean, and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  I was concerned that the nearby airport traffic would be noisy, but there must be restrictions on evening and early morning flights.  I slept fine!  I had a lovely dinner in the hotel restaurant one night, but otherwise dined out or grabbed a quick breakfast from the 7-11 around the corner when coming in from my jogs.  There is a beautiful forest preserve around a marsh with a bike trail less about 3/4 of a mile from the hotel.  Don't miss it!  One morning I rented a hotel bike and did the 10 mile loop.  It was great fun, and easy with the map and excellent pointers that I received from Barry at the hotel.  The van service was excellent.  My thanks to everyone for making it a great stay.
Manager Response: Dear Patti P,  Thank you so much for your candid review. Your compliments regarding our boutique accommodations and attentive team members are greatly appreciated. Thank you for the wonderful insight you have shared. I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Large clean room in odd location.
Summary: It is an airport location hotel. Staff was friendly, parking was limited when full, and the gas station along property had guys sleeping around it hugging their liquor bottles and luggage. By morning I watched another dog through a dumpster.  The eating options in close proximity are limited but there is a good sushi place.    The room had the A/C off upon arrival and it was warm and musty but clean.  It was a huge room in a building not connected to main hotel and desperately in need of updating, but it was clean.     So all and all an average hotel not bad if you need to be near the SNA airport and aren't bothered by the vagrants around and near property.
Manager Response: Dear celeste652,  Thank you for your review. The insight you have provided is greatly appreciated. Thank you for for your candor, I hope you consider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The hotel is well kept. The staff are friendly. The food is good. For the cost of a room night, it is a truly exceptional property. The room itself was very pleasant and adorned in non "antiseptic" boring "chain" hotel furnishings. I had a lovely stay.
Manager Response: Dear David F,  Thank you for your compliments regarding our accommodations as well as our attentive team members. It pleases me that you enjoyed your experience, especially the value we strive to offer! Thank you again for your insight, I hope to welcome you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Decent hotel, with large rooms, pleasant outside areas and pool
Summary: The hotel is in a convenient location close to beaches and not too far away from LA, (45 minutes if the traffic isn't too bad) Considering the hotel is on  a busy freeway and near to Joh Wayne airport the hotel rooms are very quiet. We had breakfast a couple of times and the museli/yoghurt option was very good, large portion with plenty of fresh strawberries. On another morning we went for the full buffet breakfast which, for the $13.99 price was again very good. We ate in the restaurant one evening and the quality was good. We had a "Deluxe Queen" room on the ground floor. The room was large with 2 very comfortable beds, the shower was decent (once we got the hang of it). Coffee maker and coffee was provided, although we had to keep asking reception for tea bags ( a major issue

Hotel was nice, old world yet charming. Receptionist at front desk when we checked in on the evening of the 24th was not quite efficient and friendly  She wrote 147 for room number 167 and the number 6 looks like a 4, we went all over the other building to find 147 and could not find the room. Came back and she said it's 167 not 147. Didn't even apologize  Other than that, our stay was enjoyable, housekeeping was great. Bed needs a mattress cover and more pillows. We only had 3 on our bed and when we mentioned to housekeeping, she brought 2 more and added the mattress cover immediately  Convenience location  Parking a bit crowded every night and tough to find a parking spot. Car space was tight as well. If you have electric car I noticed there are several charging stations

This is about the most clean hotel I have ever stayed in, and I am very picky about my hotels. The bathroom was exceptionally clean and the water in the tub did not pool around the bottom when I turned it on like most experiences I have had in hotels. It also had a good shower head. The bed was made perfectly. We enjoyed use of the pool and hot tub. This hotel is pretty centrally located to the beach cities, South Coast Plaza, the Irvine Spectrum, and airport. There are a lot of restaurants nearby, including fast food and nicer casual places. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Stayed here to meet friends staying at a nearby hotel.
Summary: The room was fine, but very disappointing to see the 13.99 breakfast charge, which used to be included, and consisted of buffet style eggs rather than freshly made. Our friends ordered omelets off the menu and were charged $1.00 per item in the omelet, i.e. $1.00 for tomatoes, $1.00 for cheese, $1.00 for mushrooms, etc. so they ended paying even more. All in all, very disappointing. The beds were comfortable, but there was a frequent screeching kind of sound from the pipes the entire time we were there.

The hotel told us about and reserved tickets for us for the bus to bring us to Disneyland. The bus driver told us to be at the designated spot at Disneyland at 10pm. We arrived at 9:30pm to be sure we were in plenty of time. The bus didn't come. The gentlemen directing the buses told us the bus wasn't going to come and we would need to take a taxi back to the hotel. $50 later we were back at the hotel. We talked to the weekend manager who basically said "that's your tough luck." We also talked to the general manager on Monday. Her response was "you missed the bus." Not often does a person run into such lack of responsibility and lack of concern. We won't stay with them again.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff but rooms from the 1980's
Summary: The staff was great and very friendly and helpful. The grounds are very clean and the pool and patio area looked beautiful. The rooms were from 1988. Very outdated and needed to be remodeled. Just older comforters and lamps. Needed more outlets by the best and desk area. Location was good and the van driver very helpful.

I have chosen Ayres for my stay in Orange County for the past three years and I haven't been too disappointed. The one in Costa Mesa is very close to the airport (which the hotel provides a shuttle service to/from) and is within walking distance of places to eat. The staff is courteous and is always ready to work with you. The area is fairly quiet and the beds are comfortable. The only two things that kinda bothered me this time was the wifi (I should've asked for an ethernet cable or brought my own) and they wouldn't let me take the food from the happy hour special back to my room. Not really a big deal. Overall my stay was what I expected so I'll consider staying there again on my next visit.

I have stayed at this hotel a few times over the past four years.  The rooms were nice and I enjoyed the breakfast buffet that was included in the price.  However, I just returned from my stay there and after sitting down to the buffet and having one small scoop of fruit and yogurt, I was hit up by the attendant to pay $13.99 for what I ate!  No one told me when I checked into the hotel that the rules had changed and there was a charge for breakfast now!  So, I had one cup of coffee and a small cup of fruit for $14.00.  I will never stay there again because I felt so ripped off!  Poor Management!

My daughter and I stayed one night and were quite pleased. The hotel staff were very friendly, and the room was clean and comfortable. Cookies in the lobby at night were a nice touch.  Our only complaint in the room was that the air conditioner was a little loud and the hairdryer a little weak. The wifi worked fine. We were able to take advantage of the hotel shuttle one day, although on another day they were unable to take us because they were down by one driver - so it might be helpful to think of the shuttle as a pleasant surprise rather than a service to which you're entitled. Breakfast was good, but a complaint here was that the menu says steel cut oats, but what you actually get is rolled oats, which isn't the same thing. But the complaints are really very minor, and

Summary Heading: Not a 4 star hotel but advertises itself as one.
Summary: Location was fine and hotel clean. It lacked many amenities a 4 star hotel would have and Ayres is overly ambitious with its star rating.  The Duke Hotel is a 4 star hotel  and if you compare the Ayres, the Duke gets an A, the Ayres gets a C.  Nothing wrong with the staff or hotel, I felt scammed in requesting a 4 star type of hotel and got the Ayres.
Manager Response: Dear Tiger_Girl1974,  Thank you for taking the time in reviewing your stay. Our property is actually classified as a 3-star hotel. If you are referring to our score on TripAdvisor, please note that this score is derived from what guests have rated our hotel. Nevertheless, I apologize for the confusion and any inconveniences it may have caused. Thank you kindly for the feedback.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: First time, overall pretty good with a few areas of opportunity
Summary: First time here and I will be back. As the title states overall pretty good. The check in process was painless, there are times they get backed up as airline crews must use the Ayres Hotel to stay when they have lay overs. The room and bathroom was clean and everything was in good working order. I had the breakfast buffet on both mornings and the quality of the food was good. The area of opportunity I'd like to share is what they refer to as the Cardio room. That was pretty weak. For travelers that like to get in a descent workout during travel, this leave a lot to be desired. They do have a small workout room in the adjoining bldg but nothing to write Arnold schwarzenegger about. Great location adjacent to John Wayne Airport, I am not aware if they run a shuttle service. The

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay at this hotel while in town for a wedding.
Summary: The hotel is located very close to the airport and near shopping. The service and quality of the hotel were excellent. Complimentary use of the computer was very convenient. The staff was very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Kathleenlorencz,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at our hotel. I am delighted to see that you enjoyed a wonderful stay at Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa. We are pleased to know that you enjoyed our friendly service and convenient amenities. I certainly hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I happened to be here for meeting and found the place just ok. It's close to the airport, which is nice, but I am sure there are better hotels. I am a Hilton Diamond member and stayed here because of the meetings. if I would do it all over again I would chose another place. It's not a bad place, but it needs a big makeover. The place is getting old and needs a clean up. The staff was friendly and helpful, but that was about it.

Summary Heading: Another great stay at Ayres in Costa Mesa.
Summary: Our room was great, the staff is so friendly, and we took the hotel shuttle to Metro Pointe for a fun afternoon of shopping.  We also walked to the nearby park and enjoyed the sun as we watched the tide recede.  We will be back!
Manager Response: Dear Hunter H,  Thank you for the feedback you have shared. I am thrilled that you enjoyed your experience at our hotel. Your compliments regarding our accommodations and our attentive team are warmly welcomed. Thank you again for your insight, we look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I visit Costa Mesa often and visit different hotels looking for just the right one! I decided to try the Ayres after all the TA accolades. I booked a Junior Suite. The day prior to check in I called and asked for an early check in for around 12:30 PM and was told that if I wanted to check in at 11:00 AM it would cost $30.00, I again told the young lady I was looking at 12:30 and she said that would be no cost but I needed to call back tomorrow. I expected that ~ no big deal. The next morning I called and again was told it would be $30.00 if I checked in before 3:00 PM. We showed up at 2:53 PM and the agent called housekeeping to "see if our room was ready". We were told "no" our room wasn't ready but we could have the room on the 4th or 2nd floors directly above or below "our

Summary Heading: Close to the airport.  Impossible to measure up to other Ayres Hotels
Summary: The room service and the reception are great.  However, the room quality hotel decor are a far cry from the other Ayres Hotels, particularly the one in Manhattan Beach.  It could just be massive complex of a building that Ayres decided to brand its hotel, but the old European and almost Romanesque grandeur that I found so endearing about the other Ayres Hotels are really lacking at this particular establishment.  Probably OK for family, but not enough for couples on romantic getaway.

Had a travel issue and delay and the airline put me up here overnight. Was not expecting much but shame on me! AYRES was amazing from the get go. Kevin the shuttle driver was so nice and professional and helpful. Check in with Ms. Marissa was easy and quick and she and her coworkers did a great job explaining my options for things to do while here. Thanks everybody!!! You made my day!    Sincerely Dale

This is my second stay at this hotel, decor is very out dated, very, very traditional, dark. The hotel needs an update. Furnishings are tired and dated. Very lack luster all together Time to come in to the 21 st century!

It is close to John Wayne Airport so you do get flight noise at times but not at nihht.. it is easy access to Irvine and Newport Beach. On site restaurant is nice, especially the breakfast buffet. Parking is tight but 0lenty of spaces.

This was a beautiful hotel - the room was roomy and the décor is fantastic.   The huge jacuzzi  tube was a pleasant surprise.  The staff was very helpful and took care of my many requests.   I would definitely stay her again.

This hotel was excellent. It provided us everything we needed. We love staying at any of these hotels. The beds and pillows are so comfortable. We can stay in bed all day here at the hotel. We will definitely go back!!

I find all the Ayers I stay at to be pretty similar.  Nice rooms and great staff.  This was no different.  The staff is courteous and my boys enjoyed the dine in service.  It is larger than others I stayed at.

Nicely decorated. very clean, friendly staff with professional manners. Good size room. The hotel has homey feeling. The central courtyards are beautiful. I will definitely recommend this hotel and with any opportunity, I use this hotel again.

A little more expensive than we usually stay at.  However, they had a great group discount for our water polo team.  The breakfast is second to none.  We've stayed here before and it's the main thing we look forward to.  Perfect for my family.

Summary Heading: My whole family enjoyed our stay here!
Summary: Some say I'm a picky person, there was absolutely nothing to pick here!  Check in was easy, the location was perfect, free shuttle to the mall was great, the comfortable beds and pillows were a plus!  Our family booked two rooms next to each other for my daughters bday. My daughter enjoyed the hotel and took lots of pictures in their beautiful lobby area and outside by the fountain. It was a cold weekend and the pool was nice and warm which was awesome (well I didn't swim in it but my husband said the water was nice) I even took a picture of the brand name of the bed and pillows I loved them so much!  Everyone was very sweet and helpful at this hotel which is always a nice thing.
Manager Response: Dear Daisy A,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review. I am pleased that you enjoyed your experience and the attentive service we strive to provide. Thank you so much for the valuable insight you have provided and the kind compliments you have shared. I truly look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: My stay at the Ayres Hotel was very pleasant despite the uncharacteristic rainy weather experienced all week.
Summary: My stay at the Ayres Hotel was very pleasant despite the uncharacteristic rainy weather experienced all week.The rooms were comfortable and the staff were helpful and courteous. The food at the hotel was very good and there were plenty of places nearby (some within walking distance) to experience other good foods as well. I have stayed at more expensive hotels near the area and some of them were not as nice as this one. I would definitely stay here again if given the opportunity.
Manager Response: Dear Paul C,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review letting others know about your recent experience at our hotel. I am happy to read that you had a pleasant stay and greatly appreciate the feedback you have provided us with. Your compliments regarding our attentive team members and the accommodations are also warmly welcomed. I truly hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Stayed at this hotel while in the area for work.  Room was large and comfortable.  Quiet at night also, even though it was very close to the airport.  Common areas were all very clean and well kept. The courtyard was nice too.  Will stay again if in the area.
Manager Response: Dear RTfromSD,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am thrilled that you enjoyed your stay and the size of our comfortable accommodations. The feedback and kind compliments you have shared are warmly welcomed. Thank you and we hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: In town for one night:  1- Not bad at all, clean.  2- Beds are comfy.  3- TV in room, don't know if they have internet for free or not.  4- Right off the highway, next to lots of eateries and coffee shops.  5- Quite place with a very nice patio.  6- Service good. No issues.   It's a budget travel hotel, no fancy, but very clean and acceptable.

I attended a conference at this hotel over four days.  Booking was easy; the desk staff were friendly and helpful, and the service throughout was outstanding. The location is convenient located near the airport. Then hotel is ideal for business meetings, but I wouldn't put it on my list for a family vacation because of the need to drive to any nearby attraction. Still, the hotel offers flexible shuttle transportation.

My ID was taken from my room while I was out. Hotel staff was unconcerned and not helpful in recovery.  I did not have time to file a police report but the only possible access to the room was by hotel employees.

I spent four days this week at a conference in this hotel.  The guest rooms, the conference rooms and the hospitality rooms were well maintained.  The service provided was excellent.  I could hear airplanes in my room in the evening.  They did not keep me awake.

We came down here for my son's hockey tournament. I have 3 young children so we booked 2 rooms.   The hotel is really clean and well located. The breakfast buffet was good.   The only disappointment we experienced was that  I had asked for joining rooms when I called to book the reservation but somehow it was lost in translation.

Summary Heading: OK for short stay.  Not as nice as the Fountain Valley property.
Summary: If being close to South Coast plaza is important to you, or if you do not drive, then this could be a good choice.  The room itself is fine.  It's got a bit of a musty "hotel cleaner / bleachy" smell when you first walk in, but you'll quickly adjust to it.  Everything seems to be nice and clean in the room.  I do not like the location at all.  I find the access from/to the freeway kind of awkward for those who are from out of town.  The property is quite large if you have to park far away from the entrance, the alternate access doors to the building are locked between 11 PM and 6 AM forcing you to make a very long walk, which was not fun in the rain.  Should be able to access those doors using a room key.  Also if you go through one of those alternate doors, the stairways look
Manager Response: Dear chad2001,  Thank you so much for the candid feedback you have provided. Though I regret that your experience was anything less than exceptional, I truly appreciate the feedback you have provided. I hope that you chose to stay with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I always stay here when I'm Orange County. Quick shuttle to airport as it is right nearby(if airplane noise a problem to you then perhaps not a great  choice here and maybe reduce a star but was not that bad for me). Breakfasts very good!  Lots of sitting areas in a few lobbies.  Service was tops!!  Great place for small meetings.   Just an all round wonderful place for the price hotel.

Small Boutique hotel with a great Breakfast  Hotel Shuttle Great Beds Quiet They are a little farther away from the Airport but everything else is great They pick you up after you call them Not sure how often they go to the Airport as I had a friend drop me off

Summary Heading: Amazing hotel, stayed here at least 5 times!
Summary: This is a perfect hotel for visiting family, Orange County, Disneyland, Balboa Peninsula, Laguna Beach and so much more. They offer meals in their restaurant, but there are countless places for breakfast, lunch & dinner. Our favorite was the newly opened Water Grill for dinner.
Manager Response: Dear A2006QMbarbaraf,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. I am delighted that you enjoyed your stay as well as our optimal location. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel in Costa Mesa-Newport Beach area
Summary: Love this hotel. Very nice staff. Restaurant on site has good breakfasts and is great for lunch and dinner too. The serving staff is wonderful and very personable and has wonderful suggestions for menu. Felt very welcomed on arrival. We have stayed here several times a year for several years. It's a great location for going to Disneyland, to Balboa Island for the holiday festivities, and other sites in east LA and Orange County. Desk clerks are quite knowledgeable of area or offer to look up locations. Great hotel and great staff.

Summary Heading: Lovely Dec stay at quaint Costa Mesa hotel with euro flare!
Summary: Lovely stay in a suite with all normal comforts and a fireplace!  Hotel grounds well kept and gorgeous holiday décor made you feel at home.  Friendly helpful staff and great value of accomodations.  Restaurant high quality and excellent service.   Hotel a little awkward to find and parking is not sufficient for size of hotel with holiday events underway.  2 pools and restaurant, plus fitness room.   A holiday party was underway in area of my room Sat night and very noisy due to band, but after complaint staff had them tone down the noise quickly. Beds could be more comfortable.   I would recommend, as great value for area.

We stay at the Ayres several times a year and each time are treated well.   The rooms are nice and well serviced.   There is space to relax and we appreciate the sofa to sit on rather than having to sit on the bed to watch TV etc.   The Bistro offers good food and the staff has been there a long time and are always friendly and provide excellent service.
Manager Response: Dear 99curts,  Thank you kindly for your review. I am pleased to see that you are satisfied with the service that our collection strives to provide time and time again. Thank you so much for your compliments regarding our spacious accommodations and the food at Le Chateau. I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: After receiving the key to our room, we entered into a special needs room.  We went back out and told the attendant that we did not ask for that room nor do we need it. The front desk person went and ask the manager to come out. The manager told us that since we booked through a third party, that was the only room available.  But he said that he would give us a complimentary upgrade to a larger room but we would have to walk to a different building and into a private party.  At that time, we weren't sure what we were getting into but we went ahead and accepted it.  To our surprise, it was a suite!  The room was spacious, clean, had a jetted tub, and was beautiful.  We loved it!   We had such a nice rest in such a comfortable environment.  This room was the highlight of our

Have stayed at this Hotel many times and they never fail to make sure that I'm a happy customer..they go out of their way in doing so which is why I would highly recommend staying here..comfortable bed, ultra clean bathroom and very tasty buffet breakfast
Manager Response: Dear anozinsdca,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to provide some feedback. I am pleased that you enjoyed your experience and the value that our hotel offers. Thank you so much for your continued loyalty, it is truly a pleasure to serve you. I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The staff is courteous and attentive.  The restaurant is fabulous and food is great. The property reminds me of a European chalet.  Beautifully decorated and well maintained.  I would stay here again and highly recommend a stay here.
Manager Response: Dear MJCAN,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. Your compliments regarding our attentive team and the decor of our accommodations are greatly appreciated. Thank you so much for your compliments of our hotel. I hope to welcome you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Good value for what is offered
Summary: For what is offered it is good value, spotlessly clean and friendly staff. They have two buildings we were in the main hotel. Rooms are very spacious and beds, pillows, linens and towels are very good quality. They have some excellent services on site such as bar a la carte restaurant offering room service if desired also a guest laundry facility, plus daily housekeeping.  There is a pool and jacuzzi,  business centre, ATM and free parking plus free wifi (patchy), a fitness centre,shuttle service. Location is central to access the beaches of Newport,Laguna, Dana Point, Crystal cove, Balboa island and Huntington, the shopping areas like South Coast Plaza and fashion island, then into LA for the theme parks of Disneyland and Universal Studios and whale watching by Newport pier.

Staff at the restaurant and bar made our stay extra enjoyable! I will definitely be back! It was a pleasant surprise. Lots of character, warm and friendly. Both my friend and I agreed. We ended up having all of our meals there.

The desk was efficient, helpful, and very friendly.   A bit of a walk to the room as there were an abundance of corridors.   The restaurant was great for breakfast,  but was the same thing each morning :(    The room was very clean, spacious and an abundance of TV channels!    The main dislike was the parking, as the parking spaces were VERY small and had to walk a loooooong way to the front entrance as there was not an entrance in the rear of the building.
Manager Response: Dear Music-by E,  Thank you kindly for the feedback you have provided. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay as well as the delicious fare Le Chateau offers. Your insight is greatly appreciated, I kindly encourage you to stay with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I recently attended a Board meeting at this facility. The room was simple, but met our needs. We had lunch catered by the in-house provider. The service was excellent and food delicious.   Looking over the common areas, it was very clean, nicely decorated, and quiet. I imagine this would be a nice place to stay. I'm so convinced that this is where I'll book the next time a business trip is planned to Costa Mesa.  Check it out!
Manager Response: Dear PTRBIGEBA364WC,  Thank you so much for sharing your experience. I am thrilled to see that you enjoyed your time with us. The feedback you have provided regarding our accommodations, team members, and grounds are greatly appreciated. I hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Extraordinary experience at an affordable price..
Summary: Everyone here makes your experience more like a visit to family than a hotel. In fact we stay here several times a year and from management down to the servers in the restaurant, it's always special occasion. By far my favorite hotel and we travel a lot!
Manager Response: Dear Y8779VEkellyb,  At Ayres Hotels, we strive to provide the best value for our guests. I am pleased to see that we were able to do just that during your visit. Thank you kindly for your feedback and for your continued loyalty to our hotel. I look forward to serving you again soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: So, while this hotel was ideally situated for our purposes, the breakfast buffet is pretty poor--tasteless eggs and tasteless bacon.  The larger issue for us were the roaches that scurried out from beneath the ice machine and were found in two of the three rooms we rented.  Nice enough folks work, here, but didn't seem terribly concerned about the roaches or care about my suspicion that the two GINORMOUS dumpsters against the back wall of the hotel might be causing the problem.  I also thought that there were public health laws against dumpsters aligning the walls of a hotel or restaurant.  I am going to call Public Health to see if, maybe, someone with more authority than I can give a greater nudge than I about moving the garbage a greater distance from the hotel, maybe

This hotel was tucked away in Orange County not far from the airport or the University we were visiting. The hotel was very clean and the staff was friendly. They just replaced all the mattresses the day we arrived so that was an added plus too. Make sure you get the cookies during your stay. Check with the front desk when they put them out. P.S. They go quick so don't miss out on them. They didn't have free breakfast but there is a restaurant on the premise and plenty of dining nearby.

Summary Heading: Overall another great stay at a great hotel
Summary: Just a minor hiccup at check in...tried for an early check in and they said they would call me when the room was available but never got a call!  Other than that, it was a GREAT STAY. Spacious rooms, French influences, tasty breakfast buffet, super comfortable beds, great housekeeping staff and good cookies in the evening.  I managed to lock myself out of the room and I have a mobility issues while my knees heels and the girl at the front desk volunteered to bring the key...that more than made up for the check in flaw.   I would stay again in a heartbeat....
Manager Response: Dear nancyesca,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Though we do our very best to accommodate early check-in requests, unfortunately, there are times when we are not able to do so as they are subject to availability. Nevertheless, I am pleased to see that you enjoyed our accommodations, premium amenities, and attentive service we strive to offer. I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This was my second stay at the Ayres. The rooms are nice, maybe slightly larger than average, but nothing remarkable. In fact, I was a bit bummed that housekeeping came to clean but simply remade bed and stocked towels... they failed to even take away dirty glasses or replace coffee cups. On the other hand, the front desk staff was very nice and helpful. I LOVE the lobby areas in both buildings. There are sitting areas in front of a fire place where we were able to hang out for extended times as we were traveling with a very large group of people. The pool off the main building also is a great place to hang out. Lots of sitting areas inside.  Pretty good breakfast buffet which was included with our room.

Summary Heading: So good I should keep it a secret!
Summary: Best service. Nice facility and furnishings. Convenient location near John Wayne airport. Reliable and regular shuttle service. Nice breakfast buffet (not a huge selection but very good food quality). Lots of restaurants close-by: mexican, sushi, fast food, Equadorian and more. Convenience store 1-minute walk.  I travel for a living. This is my favorite domestic hotel for business travel. Not fancy. Not elegant but very nice, quiet, and comfortable and convenient. I look fowrard to my stays at the Ayres.

Summary Heading: Do not pay for garden view/walk-out upgrade
Summary: We love staying at the Ayres Suites in Manhattan Beach etc but this hotel, while beautiful in the lobby, was subpar in the room. We were visiting Vanguard University. We paid for a jr. suite. It was not a suite. Also, the hotel has two properties. The one with front desk had typical hotel surrounding a beautiful garden with seating. The other where we stayed, had a pool on end in the parking lot motel style. Our room had a walk-out fenced tiny piece of property that looked at the fence which was right next to the parking lot. What a disappointment.
Manager Response: Dear Lisa M.,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel. Your loyalty to our sister hotel and our collection are both greatly appreciated. Nevertheless, I do regret to see that your experience at our hotel left much to be desired. Your insight and the concerns you have raised are greatly appreciated. I truly hope this does not deter you from returning to our hotel.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: Nicely appointed hotel with great staffing, courteous and gracious and efficiently expedient!  Each employee we came in contact with cared for us with pride of ownership in mind; as if we were in their own home!  The breakfast buffet was delicious and a huge value added to our stay!  Parking was convenient and the hotel itself was quite comfortable and quiet! Even for being by a freeway and airport!!!  Plus, we were traveling with a sports team of teen boys...the hotel was wonderfully accommodating and I still never felt that the boys encroached on a restful, relaxing and enjoyable stay.

room little dark, but very nice, yes I would stay here again. Very helpful for a great sushi restaurant, very good value, nice on site restaurant for breakfast. Did not like sign on table, telling me tip not included.

Summary Heading: My New Favorite place Very affordable
Summary: I'm sorry we only had one night there but I'm looking forward to the next time We are local and needed someplace close to work and I have been there for lunch many time's We truly enjoyed the bar and restaurant the French Onion Soup is the best I have ever eaten and the Margarita OMG so good I had two!! The only thing I think they could do is have a TV guide in the room and the young woman at the front desk could be friendlier like the Servers in the restaurant THEY WERE GREAT!!!!
Manager Response: Dear esteemheth,  Thank you so much for sharing your experience. I am thrilled to see that you enjoyed your time with us. We certainly cannot wait to welcome you back either! The feedback you have provided regarding our accommodations, team members, and delicacies are greatly appreciated. I hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We just stayed 5 nights at this Hotel and we had a Very Nice stay. Staff we Very Helpful and provided Very Good Service.The room we stayed in was Very Nice, only draw back was that it was not very close to elevator(s). Parking on a couple of days were hard to find.

Summary Heading: Comfortable but could use a little updating
Summary: The person who checked us in was efficient but not very friendly.  Not what I expected.  The room was fine, bed and pillows comfortable but the property is looking a little worn in the rooms.  It's next to the airport so make sure to request an interior room overlooking the courtyard if you can.  Do not stay on the side facing the Shell gas station and airport.  Although I will say the windows in the room seem to be pretty efficent at blocking noise.  There is no central air conditioners.  They are all in window units but they were reasonably quiet, unlike some of these types of units I have had other places.
Manager Response: Dear CyndiMom,  Thank you kindly for writing a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent stay. Though I regret to see that your stay was anything less than exceptional, I truly appreciate the feedback you have provided. Please accept my sincere apologies for the service, or lack thereof, that you received during your stay. Rest assured that this is completely out of character and does not alighn with our culture of caring. I hope that this experience does not keep you from returning to our hotel.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: GREAT value for the money, friendly staff.
Summary: GREAT value for the money.  Super affordable, free parking, great service, and great on site restaurant.  I would definitely stay here again.  Worth the extra to get an upgrade to one of the large suites.

Looks old, was told it was 2 buildings put together and used to be a Quality brand hotel. You walk corridor after corridor after corridor if you are in the 240's for rooms. A lot of tv channels to choose from but no guide.  If you are in for the night (after long travel) and watching tv, prepare for checking each and every channel every 30 minutes to see what's on.  Usually, hotels offer on screen or a visitor magazine showing what is on the channels for a week.  Nothing like that here.  Front desk said I have been the only one who has ever inquired about this. Rooms had a stuffy smell and bleak compared to other Ayres.  Not one of the better Ayres for sure. I had hoped Ayres would be consistent with each other.   Sad looking room.
Manager Response: Dear terrynkathy,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review about our hotel. Though I regret to see that your experience was anything less than exceptional, your insight is greatly appreciated. We appreciated the concerns you have brought to our attention and we will make improvements wherever necessary. Thank you again and we hope you consider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I have eaten at the hotel restaurant several times and every time, was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and drinks, not to mention the service was outstanding. The beds are super comfortable, too. The front desk staff are accommodating, and the shuttle drivers are very kind and helpful-they do what it takes to help out. Best brewed coffee, desert tray, and pot roast was excellent! Great wait staff!

Booked on line and was very pleased with the price!   We didn't expect so much and was very pleased with our stay.   We were given a suite, plenty of space, wonderful bed (except for the huge bed pad) wouldn't stay in place LOL.    Very comfortable and VERY clean!   The pool and bar area and dinning was superb as well.   It was a little fun staying at the Ayres hotel and Suites considering our last name is Ayres :)

My company has used this hotel for the past 4 years for an annual training conference. 5 of us travel over from the UK and rent a large conference room for 12 days. We also send 10 large crates prior to the even. The hotel staff are excellent and can't do enough to accommodate us whilst we are there. Nothing seems to be too much trouble for them and we all enjoy our stay and conference, that's why we keep coming back. The hotel is very close to John Wayne airport & they also provide a free shuttle. I would highly recommend this place for business or pleasure

Lovely hotel, we were upgraded to a suite, which was very nice, clean and comfy bed. Only thing about the room which was not very nice was the horrible carpet, which although clean could do with an upgrade. Also there was no safe in the room. The pool area was very nice, although the pool was VERY cold. We did not use the restaurant, although the cookies which were left out for guests every day, we absolutely delicious Only downside was having to travel to get to beach and other attractions.Staff also very pleasant and helpful. Loved the old photographs on the walls.

Summary Heading: This is my second review and this place is still GREAT!
Summary: I stay in this hotel 25 - 30 nights per year and have for the last 4 years. Being next to JW Airport there are many other hotels nearby - most are more expensive and not near as nice.  You can tell a lot about a place by the staff and the good people that work at Ayres are always happy and so attentive. Many have been there 15 - 20 year or longer. That too is a sign of a solid place.  The restaurant and bar are excellent and the breakfast buffet, (which is included) is world class.  And there are MANY other restaurants, stores, Starbucks, etc well within walking range.  You can't miss with this place!

Rooms were beautiful, cleaned and comfortable.  Great breakfast included, the stuff was very accommodating all the way.  Great place to stay, good location. will definitely recommend for any travelers, business, couple, family and even solo

When I first arrived, I thought the place looked a bit old and worn. But it is very well kept up. Almost trying to be classic.  Every time I walked through the halls, there were many maids always cleaning, which is always a good sign.  Also, my room was very clean. No complaints at all.  Additionally, my room was quiet. I didn't hear my neighbors at all. Finally, the wifi was excellent. I was able to stream an entire movie on my i-pad, with no buffering whatsoever.   My only criticism would be the location.  All my activities were in Newport Beach, So the ten minute drive to the coast was a 'minor' inconvenience.

Summary Heading: Good value as always with Ayres, but there is airport noise
Summary: I stayed here for 2 nights. I had stayed at 2 other Ayres locations in Southern CA and was happy with the company (they offer $30 late checkout 3PM which is a life saver for kids who need mid-day naps). They are a good value for what you get.   The rooms are not as large and well appointed as other Ayres locations, but they were fine and the climate control was good. The bed was comfy and quiet as usual, and the bathroom + hot water was good.   The hotel is fairly close to John Wayne airport (I didn't realize this when I booked it), and the airplane noise is very noticeable. It was OK with us, but some people would not like this. Also, the hotel is on a one-way street, so it can be a bit of a hassle to drive to and from sometime. Parking is free though, and we didn't try their

I have returned to the Orange Co area every year for business for the past 13 years now. Every time I have stayed at the Ayres Hotel & Suites. I am always impressed with their excellent service, price and comfortable accommodations. Wonderful a staff and meals. Thank you for the shuttle service. Doug

I found the Ayres Costa Mesa - New Port to have very friendly staff, to be a clean and comfortable place with plenty of amenities. The breakfast was filled with popular choices and even tasted great! A perfect fit for both families and business travelers. The European look and feel gives it a unique appeal that just makes you feel like you can relax at any place on the grounds. Plenty of seating, comfortable chairs in and outside of the rooms, and the court yards are perfect for an evening beverage with fresh air. I encourage you to give this location a try!

Summary Heading: The good and the not so good
Summary: The staff at the Ayres in Costa Mesa are friendly, attentive and professional.  The parking situation is not good.  There is barely enough room for 1 car per room.  We were there for 3 nights and had a long uphill walk to the door every time we left and came back.   The restaurant was nice, the wait staff excellent and the food was good and bad.  My husband had a wonderful steak one night, my ravioli was left on the plate.  Breakfast was better if you ordered off the menu.  You had to go to a different room and get your own coffee If you had the buffet - which they started to dismantle while you ate.  They set up the breakfast buffet while we were eating dinner.   The Ayres Costa Mesa had two buildings with a parking lot in between.  We had a "Junior Suite".  It was like a
Manager Response: Dear ERIN B,  Thank you so much for your compliments and the feedback you have provided. I am pleased to see that our attentive team provided excellent service and that you enjoyed the food that Le Chateau has to offer. Nevertheless, I regret to see that you were unhappy with our parking lot. I hope this does not deter you from returning to our hotel. We would love to welcome you back for another enjoyable stay.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We picked this hotel on the strength of it's reviews here and it's location. We have never stayed at one of this chain's hotels before. It was easy to find via satnav from LAX and is well positioned for the freeway and it's proximity to a gas/petrol station, 7/11 store and several small independant diners/restaurants and several chain ones.  The hotel was, in my opinion, superb. Quite possibly one of the best I have stayed in, from the front desk staff to the choice of coffee for the in room percolator. It easily scores the perfect 10 out of 10.  It's one potential drawback, is it's proximity to Orange County airport. The flight path for take off was right over the hotel. From about 7am to 10 pm there was jet noise. This didn't affect us as were out and about all day and the
Manager Response: Dear Simon O.,  Thank you kindly for choosing our hotel and taking the time to write a review. I am happy to see that our optimal location met your needs and that our accommodations were the best you had stayed in. Thank you so much for your warm compliments. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This hotel offered everything you could ask for. We chose it based on the proximity to the beach and the reasonable rate.
