The hotel was clean and quiet, the employees were all friendly, especially Vincent during our check in. The kids were super impressed by how "fancy" the hotel is. They have a beautiful courtyard to enjoy breakfast and coffee.  The only negative which is very minor, is that the air conditioner is a unit rather than central air which I prefer. It kept our room cool though. I would recommend this hotel and will likely return when we make our annual Disney/beach trip.
Manager Response: Dear LLLfromAZ,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel. I am pleased to see that our accommodations offered everything you needed and that our the optimal location of our hotel was conducive to your needs. Thank you kindly for your warm compliments regarding our premium amenities and the recommendations of our hotel. We hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Is only reason it is not 4 star Hotel was nice and clean rooms very nice, and friendly staff just no bottled water in the rooms to make your coffee. No one drinks water from California little noisy from the airplanes taking off but it's very convenient for the airport
Manager Response: Dear Andrew O,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay at our hotel. The concerns you have raised and the feedback you have provided are greatly appreciated. I do hope you consider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Okay so I want to start by saying we are diamond members through a major hotel chain but wanted to give this hotel a chance since the reviews on here say it's a pretty quaint nice boutique hotel.  The most recent reviews did not say anything too out of norm. All seem to say property was great .   If you look at my listing you will see that I have more good reviews than bad . I am a very fair person.   We've stayed at a lot of hotels and this one could be listed up there as one of the worst if not the worst .   Maybe my mistake was booking it through Priceline so they were less likely to care what we had to say since we didn't book direct .   The hotel is in need a update majorly . I do not even know where to start . The hallways were dark and just seemed creepy . There was trash
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to share a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your stay at our hotel. Whether booked directly or through a third-party, rest assured that we treat all of our valued guests as equals. With that being said please accept my sincere apologies for any and all inconveniences and for your experience being anything less than exceptional. Had these matters been brought to our attention immediately we would have done anything necessary to better your time with us, as long as our occupancy levels permitted. Nevertheless, I greatly appreciate the feedback you have provided as it will allow us to make improvements wherever necessary. Thank you again for your review, highlighting your concerns, and for the opportunity to serve you. We truly do hope to welcome you back in the future for the experience you deserve.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I really like the location and the amenites.  Very quaint cute hotel. I Was attending a function at UC Irvien at the hotel was 10 miutes away.  This made it very convenient when I had to travel back and forth.
Manager Response: Dear Michael H,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I am pleased that you enjoyed your stay as well as the optimal location of our hotel. Thank you for sharing your feedback, I hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My friends and I opted to stay at the Ayres last week to attend a concert at the amphitheater.  The lobby is beautiful  The staff personable.  They have an on-site restaurant.  Had the most wonderful  chinese soup and asian salad for a quick lunch.  Again, the wait staff were very friendly. The room felt very luxurious.  And very quiet.  I was very impressed.  Oh and room service for breakfast was fast and delicious.  I am looking forward to returning soon.
Manager Response: Dear Debe5069,  Thank you fo taking the time to review our hotel and for letting others know about your recent experience. I am contented to see that you enjoyed your visit and thought so highly of our accommodations. Thank you again for the wonderful feedback, I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Comfy beds, pillows, new decor and cleanness. Always, have a great time and they always accommodate our large group gathering on our visits.  The only thing I feel needs an upgrade is the hallways, looks creepy for a movie.
Manager Response: Dear Patricia H,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and it is always an honor to host your group gatherings. Thank you for your feedback, I hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stay here whenever I'm working in the area. I typically stay at Marriotts, otherwise and if there were more Ayres hotels throughout the states, travelers would be happier. I love the feel of this hotel, with it's beautiful landscaping, nice rooms, courtyard and restaurant/bar onsite. The rooms are clean and well appointed and the staff is always very friendly. The food is very good and the menu varied and has enough to choose from that you wont get bored if you stay for a week or two. I wish the bar area was a little bigger so you could chat with more of the hotel guests, but I love all the dark wood paneling. I have stayed at a few other hotels in the area, but my first choice is the Ayres - give it a try!
Manager Response: Dear Corey C,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay. I am happy that you enjoyed your stay, the accommodations we offer, and the great food offered at Le Chateau. Our team strives to provide attentive service to all of our valued guests and I am glad to read that we did just that during your visit. Thank you again for choosing Ayres, I look forward to seeing you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We had a great time during our 3 day stay at this hotel. We liked the food, the pool & the hot tub. Nice location for our stay. The staff worked very hard to make our stay enjoyable. Very comfortable. We definitely plan to stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear romaine180,  Thank you kindly for sharing your feedback regarding your experience at our hotel. I am contented that you had a great stay and enjoyed the accommodations we offer as well as the food at Le Chateau. Thank you for your feedback and the compliments regarding our decor and the distinctive service our team strives to provide. We look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stayed for two mid-week nights in a king suite.  Comparable to what you get at the Embassy Suites - Irvine but at a more competitive cost and FREE parking.  I drive to OC once a month and have an electric car which requires I hunt around for a recharge station during my trips.  The Ayers has Tesla connectors provided to hotel guests free of charge (register at the front desk).  For me, I check in, plug in and am ready to go with a full charge in the morning.  Easy-peasy!  The location is in the heart of OC airport area businesses and with easy freeway access, you can get to anywhere in OC efficiently, considering traffic.
Manager Response: Dear Scott W.,  Thank you for the wonderful insight you have provided. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay, as well as the accommodations and premium amenities we offered. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and we hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Our room was so enjoyable-loved looking over the court yard, great choices for room service meals, friendly-helpful employees, there were rooms blocked for other people going to reunion in advance so there was time to have friends gather in the room for some one on one...  Got to relax before and after the reunion and really felt like we "got away".  The fireplace was a really nice touch as well.
Manager Response: Dear JohnplusDebbie,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed your accommodations as well as your experience at our hotel. Thank you so much for the great feedback you have provided, I hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I highly recommend this hotel. It is clean, great staff and a delicious breakfast buffet is included. The outside breakfast area has a European feel to it. You will enjoy yourself. Even the planes that fly over all day doesn't put a damper on your stay.

Suite was very nice roomy well appointed very clean.  Hotel shuttle picked up at airport as advertised. Great food especially the breakfast buffet. Inside and outside dinning. Convient to John Wayne Airport about 5-10 minutes away. I would stay again. Staff helpful and friendly..

Once again, Ayres Hotel and their staff helped to make my vacation stay at their hotel memorable, comfortable, safe and secure. My room was perfect (as usual), the bed a total dream for sleeping in late. :) Nice rooms, large sitting area, plenty of closet space, wardrobe storage. The towels are large and super absorbent. Quiet and lovely. Want to check out a little eating or shopping close by? No car? They shuttled me down to The Lab and The Closet for a quick bite, and some fun shopping. A call for pick up,  and 5 minutes later, they came and brought me back. There's a reason I won't stay anywhere else......actually, quite a few as you can see from above. Staff, rooms, food, service, attitudes.....thank you for having the best of all!

Very clean and comfy, reasonable rate for Costa Mesa area. Restaurant called Fusion down stairs was excellent for a late night snack or cocktail. Will use this hotel everytime I need a place to stay in Costa Mesa. Check in and out was quick. Asked for additional toiletries and they were generous.
Manager Response: Dear edmwilson,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your accommodations as well as the great food at Le Chateau. Thank you fo the feedback, we look forward to seeing you again soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Very comfortable and convenient for next day flight out. Not really a vacation - like place or neighborhood but great for a business trip or last night in town. Appreciated the spacious space with kitchenette. Shuttle is great. Food is fine. A quiet place.
Manager Response: Dear Rachel P,  Thank you so much for taking the time to share some insight. Your candid feedback is greatly appreciated. I am happy that our optimal location met your needs and that you enjoyed the spacious accommodations. We look forward to serving you in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: The ONLY Place To Stay in Costa Mesa!
Summary: Okay, let me begin by telling you I am picky, very picky. I needed a hotel for a week long stay. This wasn't just any stay, it was recovery from major surgery. I scoped hotels in the Newport area first and visited them to choose my room. I has a double queen junior suite here. I love the decor! It might not be everyone's cup of tea, but that is what it is like, an elegant European hotel with courtyards and fountains and antique furnishings. My room was so quiet which was a concern so near the Santa Ana airport. The staff were all friendly, helpful and accommodating. There is a free shuttle to and from the airport, and Fashion Island/ Balboa as well. Any small problem was addressed and fixed right away. The room was large and had all the amenities required. Even the housekeeper

I booked the hotel online under my name, my wife went there with my credit card I used for booking and a copy of my ID, they wouldn't let her in, saying it is the hotel policy!!! After waiting for me in the lobby, we got into the room. The room has a tv and a fridge, it's condition is ok. The parking is free.
Manager Response: Dear Hany G,  Our hotel established and follows policies for the safety of our guests. For security purposes, we do require that the guest checking in has a reservation under his/her name and a credit card that matches a government issued ID, this benefits the guests as helps prevent identity theft. Thank you again for your input.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Great rooms that are spacious and comfortable.  Nice restaurant on premises.  Two large reception areas that are very comfortable with plenty of seating on couches.  Two pools,  one indoors and one outdoors.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay, as well as the accommodations and amenities we offered. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and we hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Quick Stay but will be back for more time
Summary: Have family that lives in the area and needed a room for one night. Very nice place (as all Ayres are) but friendly in the budget department.  Checked in late in the evening, room was great. Spacious with a nice view of the outdoor courtyard. Place was very clean. Little things mattered at this place, plenty of fresh towels, comfortable beds and great pillows. Very quiet hotel as well.  Location is a tad tricky since you can only make a right turn out of the hotel onto Bristol and head south, of course we needed to go north, but a quick detour to the next street and back onto the road we needed and we were right as rain.   Glad we found this place, we'll use it more often when visiting family in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Corey C,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay. I am happy that you enjoyed your stay and the accommodations we offer. Our team strives to provide attentive service to all of our valued guests and I am glad to read that we did just that during your visit. We look forward to seeing you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Room was clean and spacious. Bed was comfortable. The bathroom was a little small, but the bath tub was great. I liked the european-style architecture and design. Really close to the airport, but we didn't hear noise at all.
Manager Response: Dear romaine180,  Thank you kindly for sharing your feedback regarding your experience at our hotel. I am contented that you had a great stay and enjoyed the accommodations we offer. Thank you for your feedback and the compliments regarding our decór. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The Ayres Hotel are a good hotel, perfect for both business and private stay. The rooms are at a good size and well maintained. Bar and Restaurant in the middle of the hotel with a nice courtyard touch. Food quality is at the middle level, good but not fantastic. Staff very friendly, a hotel to return to.
Manager Response: Dear Kenneth B,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and the spacious accommodations we had to offer as well as the attentive service our team provided. Thank you again for your feedback, I hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: It was ok for one night for the price. The room smelled musty. The bed was not comfortable. Lots of noise from the courtyard until late. Room service was fast but shells in both crab cakes. Check in staff was fast and efficient. Check out was easy.

We only stayed for 1 night, so I don't have a whole lot to comment on.   The hotel appeared to be clean, and the lobby was beautiful. We had a nice room, which was a decent size. The king-sized bed was comfy. The room was well appointed with a seating area & a small fridge. The only thing missing was a safe.  I always feel better when my passports & other valuables are locked in a safe, while I'm away from my room.  Other than that, the place seemed very nice. I would return to this hotel again, on my next trip to California.

To begin our Retirement from Teaching trip, we decided to stay near the airport since our flight was the next morning.  This hotel was not only convenient for that, it also had a restaurant, where we met relatives and friends for a Bon Voyage dinner.

Summary Heading: Stinky sheets and a small pool
Summary: Stayed here for two nights visiting friends in OC.  First night, when we went to bed around midnight, we discovered that our bed-sheets smelled awful.  Not just a little smelly, it smelled very very bad.  I called the front desk and they said they'd send someone with new sheets.  About 20 minutes later, a security guard brought new sheets to our room and apologized that we'd have to change them ourselves.  We had to throw those sheets in a corner in the living room.  Next morning, we noticed sheets thrown out from the room across the hall from us.  Guess they had the same problem.  No comps were offered for the sheets.  The pool was smaller than expected and the deep end was 8 feet deep, so poor swimmers should be careful.  The elevators had a very strong chemical smell.  Saw a

Summary Heading: Never Heard of Them but will definitely be back!
Summary: Stayed one night at hotel near airport because of early flight out of Orange County-Santa Anna at the end of our vacation.  Great rate (reserved on Hotel.com, non-refundable, no breakfast included), fantastic staff/service.  Shuttle on time, polite driver.  Every staff member we encountered was so polite and friendly. Beautiful hotel with outdoor courtyard restaurant.  Wait staff wonderful in restaurant.  Rooms were clean and spacious.  Coffee maker and fridge in room.  Common areas were beautifully decorated and very clean. Pool and hot tub were nice.  Fitness room was small and had just cardio -- bike, elliptical, and treadmill but they were well maintained.  Did not notice noise of planes until morning while having breakfast in the open air courtyard. Hotel has the feel of a

The architecture is interesting, obviously a European influence.  Staff was very helpful.  They have a courtyard by the restaurant and an outdoor pool in another section.  The hotel was probably full two of the nights we were there, but it didn't seem overcrowded.  It is kept very clean.

Summary Heading: Very friendly staff and clean hotel halfway between the beaches & Anaheim.
Summary: Very clean and professionally run hotel. Friendly staff where nothing is too much trouble. Clean and tidy rooms. Cosy pool. Didn't sample any food from the restaurant so unable to comment on the food, but was always busy. Even got to witness a wedding and it's reception with no intrusive noise.  Would like to give a huge thank you to Alondra from the front desk & the restaurant manager on shift that day for keeping our son's iPad safe when we misplaced it.

Stayed here for 1 night for work. Enjoyed the hotel. It is French themed with a nice courtyard and restaurant. Great outdoor pool. 5 minutes from the airport with free shuttle. Free Wi-fi in room. My room had a fireplace and fridge. Restaurant is nice, good food for lunch and breakfast. Only docking them because it was pretty noisy. Bring your earplugs.

I have mixed feelings about this hotel based on who I spoke to and dealt with. Upon check in no one at the counter knew of or heard of the "best rate guarantee" plastered all over their website (check it out under specials). So we came to check in with a rate lower than there's expecting the rate match and 15% off stated. We did not obtain this from an opaque website or an international website and adhered to the terms and conditions (used hotels.com) the person at the front desk proceeded to tell us that the "rate is too low and I can't give you that rate", and "price match is to the hotels around us, not online".   This made no sense and we pondered this in our room that night, which was a room right off the lobby and super loud (sad face).   In the morning there were 2 new
Manager Response: Dear PabloPicano,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. While I wish you had a better experience, your candid input is greatly appreciated. We work hard to redefine hospitality and it is apparent in this case that we fell short. However, the Best Rate Guarantee requests are actually handled off-site by our Guest Loyalty representatives. We would have been happy to oblige and honor the lower rate, however, because these requests need to be handled off-site, policy requires that they are to be submitted within 24 hours of booking your stay and at least 48 hours prior to your arrival. Nevertheless, I do apologize for the lack of information my team provided. If you allow us another chance, I can assure you that we will do our best to demonstrate to you the distinctive and personalized service you deserve.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: beautiful hotel, rooms, pool, and hot tub, everything. Nice hotel shutter to Balboa island. Friendly front desk staffs and helpers showing me nearby places. I left $5 dollars (in 25 cents) for the room cleaners but nothing taken away / was stolen. The janitors/cleaner staffs are honest people. Finally I have to state on the envelope that "this is tip". We like them all. Accepted government rate. Very happy with my choice. Definitely going back if I will visit that area again in the future.
Manager Response: Dear nene123478,  Thank you for the outstanding review of our hotel! I am glad to read that you enjoyed your stay and could not thank you enough for the warm compliments you have shared with our team and TripAdvisor travelers alike. Your feedback and recommendations of our hotel are greatly appreciated. We hope to see you again very soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This is a beautiful hotel. Very clean. The pool is beautiful & they have a lovely courtyard you can overlook. Room was very nice. Comfy beds.   Con: This is right next to an airport so it gets very noisy in the morning. You will hear the airplanes going over the hotel repeatedly   However, I'd stay here again.

We stayed here one night for an event in town. The check in was quick, room was clean and quiet, and the bed was comfortable. I also liked that the room was very dark because I sleep better in a room with no outside lights slipping through windows and door frames. This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel and will be back.
Manager Response: Dear bbaldwinl,  Thank you for the great review and for returning to our hotel! I am delighted that you enjoyed your stay and the well-appointed accommodations we offer. We hope to welcome you back again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The Ayres hotel in Costa Mesa has great prices and the hotel is always clean and the staff is very friendly.  I love that they have a big breakfast right in the hotel. They have gone the extra mile on more than one occasion for me.
Manager Response: Dear MOIE-D61,  Thank you for the wonderful review of our hotel! I am glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. Our team is truly humbled by the kind compliments you have shared regarding our personalized service and the cleanliness of our hotel. We look forward to seeing you again very soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My family stayed here this past week for a softball tournament in Huntington Beach area. This hotel was in a great central location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The grounds were well kept. They offered good hot breakfast options. Nothing negative to say. Had a great time!
Manager Response: Dear Amy K,  Thank you for the taking the time to write a review about our hotel! I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and that our optimal location met your needs. Our team is humbled by your kind words and great feedback. We hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: While the facility is fine, every member of the staff that we encountered was rude and/or dismissive.  There were weddings going on the entire weekend and it was made clear that the wedding parties took priority over any other guests.  Wedding parties were milling around the hallways and common areas all weekend and the staff was entirely focused on them.    I understand that those weddings are big business for the hotel, but that doesn't mean that other paying guests should be ignored.  Pool was closed all weekend for weddings, so regular hotel guests had to use the back pool in their second facility, which was motel quality.  We are local and hanging out in the pool during the heat wave was a primary reason for booking, so we were extremely disappointed about this.  When we
Manager Response: Dear Matt F,  We strive to provide the same level of service to all of our valued guests as we simply have nothing to gain by favoring one part over the other. Per the wedding party's contract, the pool had to remain closed, nevertheless, we did our best to provide accommodation and access to our second pool. Unfortunately, I regret to hear that our second pool was not up to par. Please rest assured that your concerns will not go unnoticed. In regards to the service you received, or lack thereof, please accept my sincerest apologies. As previously mentioned, we make it our mission to provide top notch service and it is apparent that we fell short of that. I truly hope your future accommodations are comfortable and satisfying.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This hotel is such a great value! It's a very high class, 5 star resort fir a fraction of the cost. The rooms are absolutely stunning, with beautiful European furniture and huge four post beds! The bathtubs are HUGE and my favorite part of the room! Cannot recommend enough! Fabulous!
Manager Response: Dear Lollydrop,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel and your kind compliments regarding the value of our hotel! I am contented that you enjoyed your stay and truly appreciate the feedback you have provided. We hope to welcome you back the next time you are in the area!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel twice now and really love it! This has become our yearly summer destination. The bed is SO comfy and the sheets and pillows are fluffy and soft. The bathroom and vanity area are big and well-lit, and the room is always clean. You can tell they pay attention to detail. We stay in the suites building, which is nice and quiet, and has plenty of parking. The European decor of the hotel makes the whole experience feel luxurious. The wi-fi is a little spotty, but not too bad.  Now on to the service... Checking in was great, Devon (the assistant manager, I think) was super nice and helpful! He was the best person that I dealt with during our stay. Checking out was somewhat different. Long story short, the girl tried to charge us for breakfast, and it took way

Roomy, clean, affordable, and off the path from the normal California craziness in July - but still close to Huntington Beach and more.  Would stay here again if in the area.  Try Coffee Nature next door - great coffee shop.
Manager Response: Dear Andrew T,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and had the opportunity to stop by Coffee Nature, it truly is a wonderful coffee shop. Thank you again for your kind feedback and we hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Pool is closed for private event?
Summary: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for a quick overnight awhile back and we were impressed by this property. We walked around and the courtyard and main pool area looked great. When we got the chance to runaway from the city for a few day the Ayres seemed perfect. We drove down today, spent a great day at the fair and we were excited to check in to our rad room and cool off in the pool. Wait, what? Closed for private event? No notice. No heads up at check in. No email before your cancelation period expires. Called down to the front desk because our whole plan for tomorrow was to spend the day kicking  it at the pool. Nope. It will be closed at 2:00. Come on. The draw here is the outdoor spaces. It's not cool to hang that carrot out there and then pull it without warning. It's an

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel with a European boutique Feel
Summary: This is a lovely, well-appointed and beautifully furnished hotel. The staff is responsive and helpful, the beds and couches are on a high level and more comfortable than most hotels. Whether you are lingering over a cup of coffee on the cozy patio, darting out after breakfast to enjoy the beaches, breathtaking Pacific views, Disneyland, or  shopping, this is the home base you want for your OC adventures.

Summary Heading: Old World decor meets New World amenities
Summary: It's taken me several stays at this location to finally review this lovely hotel. There's a reason why it's usually booked solid. The staff are always very welcoming. The rooms are large and beautifully appointed. The Jr. suite accommodated my family of four very comfortably. Our room was serviced daily by Maria G. who seemed to know/notice exactly what supplies needed replenishing and did so, quickly and always with a smile. If the opportunity allows for breakfast, then I highly recommend the onsite restaurant. The Ayers  Hotel Costa Mesa feels more like a elegant inn than a chain hotel.

We saw pictures of this hotel online and it was even nicer when we got there.  In the summer, the hotels in Irvine are packed and the prices are pretty high.  We researched several hotels in the area and this one had the lowest block prices for the weekend we were getting married.   We booked a hotel block with Kara Kellogg and she was able to give us a good deal for our guests.   When we were getting married, the block system that they had was different from what other hotels were offering.  They give you a smaller number of rooms (5 to 10 rooms every time you ask for them, you can ask multiple times) but you are not obligated to pay for them if they don't fill up.  You had to call directly in order to get block rooms, but otherwise, it was easy.  Kara took care of everything
Manager Response: Dear Yi C,  Thank you for taking the time write a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience at our hotel. Your feedback and your warm compliments regarding our team members, distinctive service and communication are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for your review and for sharing such a memorable occasion with us, we look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Ayers Costa Mesa for our wedding weekend.  Kara was extremely helpful and got us a hotel block for our hotel.  The hotel is in a convenient location near Irvine and John Wayne Airport.  The rooms and suites are beautiful, parking is plentiful, and the hotel restaurant is good.  The hotel itself has very nice furnishings, a very pretty fountain, and 2 pools.  We really liked the nautical themed paintings and ship models. The staff was friendly, polite, and helpful.  The shuttle is very convenient too.
Manager Response: Dear amazumda,  Thank you for the wonderful review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciate your warm compliments. Thank you for the wonderful feedback and we hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend visit to the OC Fair / Pacific Amphitheater.  Because we've enjoyed several stays at the Ayres in Anaheim, we assumed that this one would be just as nice.  The front lobby is beautiful, however it ends there.  The hotel just has a tired, old feel to it, and all of the hallways just reeked of disinfectant.  We were disappointed that this hotel did not offer the complimentary breakfast that the other Ayres hotels do, but charged $13 for it.  Definitely not worth $13 so we decided not to partake.  We had lunch later in the courtyard which was very good.  The room itself is ok - we reserved a one bedroom suite.  The carpeting was shabby, the closet door was crooked (it would slam shut if you walked away from it) and the bathroom was so
Manager Response: Dear Kimba403,  Thank you so much for your candid review. The feedback you have provided is greatly appreciated as it will allow us to make any necessary improvements. I do regret to hear that the design at our hotel was anything less than exceptional and that our complimentary shuttle service left much to be desired. Once again, thank you for your feedback and I hope your future accommodations are comfortable and satisfying.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My wife and I vacationed in France and England last September and the interior décor of the Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa California brought back fond memories of that trip. It's like you stepped into an elegant hotel from the past in Europe. However, the functionality of the room was modern. The Ayres Hotel Costa Mesa has amazing spacious areas around the property for guests to relax that I've never seen at other hotels in the US. The room was very comfortable and I slept better at the Ayres Hotel than I do at home.
Manager Response: Dear Robert B,  Thank you for taking the time to write a great review of our hotel! Your kind compliments in regards to our decór and accommodations are greatly appreciated. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Nice hotel clean great pool area good breakfast  Smaller rooms than other ayers we've been too and alot of airplane noise until 10pm   But great customer service  Weird location on one way road  Near freeway and alot of parking
Manager Response: Dear Melika78,  Thank you so much for writing a review about our hotel and your recent experience. I am glad that you had a pleasant stay and we truly appreciate the kind compliments regarding our wonderful team and accommodations. We hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Stayed here overnight before we took the ferry to Catalina.  Good location-great mall with lots of good restaurants nearby.  The beach wasn't far, but heavy traffic made it a longer trip than usual  The rooms were nice and well appointed.  Nice pools and patio areas.
Manager Response: Dear Hhagen68,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and that our optimal location met your needs. We hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The ambience of the hotel is very luxurious.  The rooms are spacious and have a lovely assortment of amenities and the courtyard is very pretty.  It was our first experience at an Ayres Hotel but hopefully not our last.  It is located near the John Wayne Airport so it is possible to have noise from the airplanes taking off.
Manager Response: Dear 67snowball,  Thank you for sharing this wonderful review of our hotel. I am happy that you enjoyed your stay and the ambience of our hotel. Thank you for your kind compliments and great feedback. We hope to welcome you again very soon.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We really enjoyed the Suite.  Beds were super comfortable.  It is a beautiful hotel.  We had paid extra for early check-in because we were driving through the night before our arrival.  We arrived even earlier than the 11 AM check-in, and the Front Desk graciously allowed us to check in even earlier.  This was such a blessing, as we were exhausted.  We really appreciated this excellent customer service!!
Manager Response: Dear gotf8th,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel! I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and that our accommodations met your needs. I greatly appreciate your warm compliments regarding our personable team. We hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Extremely clean hotel.  Beautiful rooms, great food, and very friendly staff.  I staff there every time I attend a work event. Check in was so easy, nice outdoor eating area.  Happy hour.  Workout equipment, very quiet.

Elegant, vintage hotel. Courtyard with fountains is the perfect European-feeling area for breakfast, conversation, or merely relaxing. Hotel restaurant offers great food, and breakfast buffet is quite lovely.  Takes a little while to figure out how to work shower water, and to figure out how to get around in the hotel- many nooks and crannies and hallways- look at a hotel map to see where the closest stairs are for your room, and get your bearings.  Staff are very helpful.  Age of original building shows slightly, but not in any way that should make you think twice about staying here.

The location of the hotel was perfect for us. We found the staff to be very courteous and helpful. Their room service was excellent. They delivered the food prompt- fully and it was delicious. Unfortunately we were always in a rush and did not get to enjoy eating outside around the pool area. My only complaint is the parking lot spaces are so narrow that it is difficult to get in and out of your car. Almost every driver had parked on or over the line, which made it a tight squeeze to open the car doors without hitting the cars parked next to us. However, we will definitely stay here again.

Absolutely loved staying here for 2 nights. Had a room facing the courtyard which was great. Rooms were very clean and nice, parking was free, was in a good location, and the staff was friendly. This will be my go-to hotel in this area.

Summary Heading: Vintage decor was beautiful, the courtyard was amazing
Summary: We loved the King Suite. Everything was clean, the hotel staff was really friendly, and the restaurant service was great. Be aware though - there's a knob to adjust the pressure of the shower head water! We spent the first day of our trip with little water pressure till we figured it out. lol   I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. There's something so charming about the vintage decor...I loved it.

very clean, big rooms, helpful staff. check in and out was very fast and easy.  Restaurant on site was very nice, great atmosphere and food.  The pool was very cold but the hot tub was great.  The weather was a little cool and drizzly but we have a great time.

Very nice and clean hotel. Rooms are big and confortable, nice happy hours daily 50% food and drinks up to 06:30 Excelent staff snd service, very good location in newport beach.it id very tecomendef hotel to accomodate

Summary Heading: Second Stay at Ayres Costa Mesa
Summary: I highly recommend the Ayres Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa. I have stayed here twice when visiting my nephew. The hotel is beautiful in decor. The staff are very accommodating and helpful. The food is outstanding - very fresh and deliciously prepared. The rooms are clean; spacious; and appointed with a big desk, small fridge and comfy bed. I will stay here every time I am in the area!

I love the decor - very Old World with Renaissance style art and furnishings. I had a fridge, microwave and deep soaking bathtub in my room. There's also a gym and laundry on site, as well as a pool and hot tub. The hotel is in a great location - google said a beach was close by - but it was rainy during my stay so I didn't go. Instead my group and I ended up at Acapulco Restaurant a few blocks away on a rec from one of the  ladies at the front desk.  I loved everything about my stay here, including the carved elephants at the entrance. This is a fantastic property!!!

We stayed here for 2 nights while visiting our daughter who lives in Irvine.  The room was clean, the price was reasonable, the hotel convenient and the staff friendly.  We would stay happily here again.

nice hotel property.  The staff were very helpful.  The room was very nice and modern. The pool looked very inviting but I was there on business and did not get a chance to swim.  The breakfast buffet was very good offering a wide variety of foods.

Ayers has the best rooms, service, breakfast and is very clean. If you need anything the staff will bring it to you very quickly. The prices are reasonable, I will stay here again. I stayed at the one in Ontario, CA.

I stay at the Ayres Costa Mesa often for business in OC and is one of my favorites.  Forget the cookie cutter, big business travel hotels with monstrous, open air lobbies filled with restaurants and bars.  This is a charming, quaint, throwback style hotel with an excellent staff and 4 1/2 Yelp stars restaurant.  Good news is it's very close to John Wayne Airport - bad news is it's very close to John Wayne Airport so plane noise can be loud if you're outside at one of two beautiful pools or on a private patio.  Evening cookies and free shuttle service withing 3 miles and three daily trips to Balboa Island is a plus as well.

I have stayed at almost all of the Aryes in California and have stayed here before. Although they are undergoing upgrades their processing is the same. (I do not agree with) the room was not very clean and the patio room was unimpressive. I would not pay extra for it. it was only about 3 feet deep. beds sagged and bathrooms had had exposed pipes that I was not happy to look at.  Also had to pay extra for breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear ocstay2013,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. I regret to read that your stay was anything less than exceptional. Please accept my most sincere apologies for falling short of your expectations with regards to our accommodations and our cleanliness. We hope that this does not deter you from staying with us in the future as we are making improvements wherever necessary on a daily basis.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We have meetings in an overnight stay, the food was great. The elevator in the back is very slow so use the one at the front of the hotel. The staff uses the elevator in the back but you can still use it.  The pool area only has 2-3 hours of good daylight so unless it's a hot day it's kind a cool.  It's still on the flight pattern for SNA, orange county airport so starting at 7:30AM and you're easily woken up. The airplane is still  n full throttle, for the air abatement over the rich peoples houses in Newport Beach.  This hotel was not in the air abatement area.   The rooms are very nice and the beds are comfortable with the little mini fridge.  There's a Starbucks in walking distance and a burger place plus other things down the street.  It has a shuttle to and from the

Our room was fine but housekeeping never came and cleaned our room. We were gone all day and came back at 9:30 PM to find our room the same as we left it. I called Housekeeping for fresh towels for the morning and they said they would be up in 10 minutes and they never came. We had an early flight out so we had to use towels that we had thrown on the floor from the day prior. I tried calling the manager after we returned home and she never called me back.
Manager Response: Dear sunrisemomof3,  Thank you so much for taking the time to provide some feedback. I regret to hear that our services fell short of what was expected on both yours and our end. Please note that this level of service is completely out of character for our team members. Management makes every attempt to return any and all correspondence. You may reach me directly at sobrienmoore@ayreshotels.com for further assistance if your wish.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: A well appointed hotel with great service. The restaurant was not the best for breakfast  and the service somewhat OK. Drinks were adequate and affordable. Others said that the dinner service and food were good.

We have been coming to this hotel for 25+ years for anniversaries, birthdays and weekend getaways.  When we first started coming here it was called Country Inn and Suites.  Although we live only about 100 miles from Costa Mesa/Newport Beach, we feel like we are in another world on a grand vacation.  We were given a lovely suite facing the courtyard, but it was very, very noisy from the airplanes.  We have always stayed in the interior rooms in the past which are less noisy.  When I told the front desk our concerns, they didn't hesitate to move us.  We were upgraded to an executive suite, which was still noisy, but not as bad as the courtyard room.  Thankfully, planes do not fly between 10 pm and 6 am.  The room was very spacious and we felt like royalty.  My only real gripe is

My home away from home.... what else is there to say?  The desk staff are most helpful and accommodating.  The hotel provides what is probably the best breakfast in Costa Mesa, and it very reasonable... i.e., FREE!

The beds were comfortable, the room was clean, the personnel friendly! The breakfast buffet was adequate as well. Great value for your money! Matters not to me that the decor isn't "updated"--I thought it was a lovely place!
Manager Response: Dear Susan H,  Thank so much for reviewing our hotel based on your most recent visit. I am happy to hear that you were satisfied with the accommodations we offer, the cleanliness of our hotel and our amazing team members. Thank you kindly for your feedback and we look forward to serving you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The hotel was clean.  My room was very roomy and the bed was super comfortable with plenty of pillows and nice bedding.  I was in town on business, so I didn't hang out in the hotel much but the lobby area and the other lobby area with the fireplace were very nice.  I ordered room service one time which was the shrimp salad.  It was reasonably priced and had plenty of large, delicious shrimp.  I would stay here again and definitely recommend it.

Staff is friendly and room was great. Love the bed and pillows. Room is comfortable. You can hear in the morning the flights from the airport landing and taking off but not bad. For sure we will be back.

Summary Heading: Great atmosphere, clean room. Great pricing.
Summary: Stayed for two nights in the middle of the week for business.  The room was very clean and the customer service was good.  The only opportunity is the carpet. The carpet is starting to age a little and you can see.  Breakfast buffet options are limited to your normal bacon, sausage, eggs, pancakes, etc.

The room was clean and had everything we needed for an overnight stay. It would be perfect for someone who doesn't mind the sound of jets overhead (it's in the flight path of John Wayne Airport). We were in a room on the patio where loud conversations went on until the wee hours. We may have been near a maintenance area because we were woken up by someone on a walkie talkie or cell phone on speaker. Other guests seemed to be enjoying themselves, but it was a bit too bustling for a couple who wanted a quiet and relaxing night.
Manager Response: Dear jspracher,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. Please accept my sincerest apologies for your experience being anything less than extraordinary. I regret to read that your stay was simply adequate, nevertheless, I would like to kindly encourage you to return to our hotel in the future. We do ask that our guest let us know if they have any special requests such as a quiet room or a room away from the patio. We constantly strive to go above and beyond so we will work hard to accommodate any and all requests.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I reserved a room while in town for my daughter's graduation.  Prior to arrival I had called and sent an e mail asking if it was possible to have certain amenities in the room prior to her arrival.   I was also given the name for the closest florist which is in walking distance.  Krissy was by far the nicest front desk person I have ever encountered,  She assisted me with the arrangements.  Gina emailed me as well.  David, the food and beverage manager assisted and since the day after her graduation was Mother's Day he suggested we go to their brunch. It was amazing!!

Really nice environment, perfect location to reach beautiful locations, big and very clean rooms, kind staff, good room service. We are very much satisfied with our staying and recommend this hotel for business or leisure.
Manager Response: Dear Lorella G,  Thank you so much for your candid review. I am contented to see that you had a perfect stay at Ayres Hotel and Suites Costa Mesa. Your recommendations of our hotel along with you compliments are greatly appreciated. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Not my favorite stay, but it wasn't bad either. I only stayed for one night for a friends wedding. The location is close to many restaurants and shopping, it just depends on if you like staying at hotels that feel like they were decorated back in the 60's or not.  That is one thing that surprises me about many of the big fancy chains is that they all feel like they are stuck in a time warp, but I guess some people like it. So if that is your fancy, then I'm sure you'll be happy.  The courtyard is full of wire chairs and tables (I prefer cushioned chairs and benches) and the hallways were difficult to haul my 2 suitcases down (I am traveling full time, so I do carry 2 large bags).  Again, it's ok, so if the price is right and you are on a budget, go for it. But if you want

Summary Heading: Wonderful Hotel, Excellent Restaurant terrible service in Restaurant
Summary: Your rooms are absolutely beautiful, then I got a new mattress while I was there, it was heaven....................However, your restaurant on site has excellent service, BUT terrible service, it was the worse I have ever had, except for my first night there and I had Rodel, But REUBEN was the worse, it took me 35 minutes to get bread and French onion soup?????

Summary Heading: Very happy with this hotel for business trips
Summary: Staff is courteous, rooms are clean, and their bar and restaurant is decent. I'd recommend. The only odd thing is that the decor is somewhat cheesy. They are going for a European look, but it is an eccentric mix of styles and books on the wall in the bar are fake.  I do like the classical music piped in the lobby and the fireplace in the lobby of the suites building.

This family does great hotels.  I love the Ayers hotels.  The rooms are clean and neat and the cost is great for the value !!!!  This location is great for Costa Mesa and Costa Mesa is a value but so so close to Newport Beach and Fashion Island.  Try this place and enjoy a great value.

We stayed at the Ayers Costa Mesa, April 21-27, 2016.   We stayed in Sept 2015 and returned due to the clean rooms, and the friendly staff.  Must not forget the Danish rolls in the a.m, and delicious cookies in the evening.  I wish they would include breakfast.  I like the courtyard and the location.  We live on ?Maui and will return since we have family nearby.

Summary Heading: The Fairmont Newport Beach Hotel is much nicer with the same price
Summary: It's close to UC Irvine campus (about 5-10 minutes drive). Room and amenities remind me of Motel 6 or Super 8 - small room, old fashioned bed headboard, small elevator, tiny gym, vending machine with a microwave next to it on each floor. At dinner time the whole floor smelled because someone heated food in the microwave. The lobby looks more like a higher-end hotel/resort, though, and the courtyard is cute. Staff is very friendly too. But I couldn't get a good wifi connection in my room. Personally I would much prefer the Fairmont Newport Beach Hotel, which is more modern and costs about the same.

Relatively close to a lot of places and things to do in that area. Also a lot of excellent dining choices. Awesome hotel for the price. Definitely felt more expensive than what I paid. Very clean and gorgeous room. Plus loved the jacuzzi bath in the room!

I liked this place... it was a good deal, good service.. good location... with a very European courtyard to relax in.   Close to all freeways. 10 min from beach. 2 min from the airport.  plenty of free parking.  I didn't care for the breakfast buffet.

Summary Heading: When they tell you that you can't access your Room from the Hotel Lobby...RUN!!!
Summary: I always loved staying the the Ayres. Generally their room and hotel atmosphere have a warm feel to it. However... the stay at Ayres was horrible. They told me I would have to drive to the back of the hotel to access my room. Once parked in the back...there was a back door propped open. The entrance/exit was used by the workers. The room was located upstairs, which is what I requested, but it was right next to the laundry room for the Hotel. The room smelled musky. The elevator was right next to the room, which at the time I thought was convenient, but I had to wait for the workers to go first bringing smelly trash in the same elevator as the guests. I will never stay at the Costa Mesa hotel..PLEASE BE AWARE.

Stayed for 2 nights, room was on the 2nd floor and beside the reception area which resulted in a lot of noise from guests heading to and from reception and the elevators.  First night we were kept awake with the guest above "stomping" around the room for almost 3 hours - reception were informed but there was no difference to the level of noise - are the walls/floors incredibly thin or are guests incredibly selfish to whats acceptable??  Room was a good size with all the usual amenities although the air-con had to be on super cool or not at all to avoid a smell of mildew. Facilities were as expected 2 pools and 2 gyms - 1 in each building although when sitting at the pool it does get super noisy with the overhead planes - maybe the hotels location just a bit too close to the

Summary Heading: Surprised by how good this was!
Summary: A reservation was made for us at this Ayres Hotel by the hosts of a meeting we attended. We had never heard of this hotel or the others using this name.  Unfortunately, we were there only overnight and for breakfast. It's a place we would have loved to stay at longer. The overall ambiance was beautiful. Our room was spacious, the bed was very comfortable and despite the proximity to the airport, peacefully quiet.  Breakfast was excellent (we had the buffet) and overall service was friendly and courteous.  If back in that part of California, we come stay at the Ayres Hotel!!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Costa Mesa
Summary: I will definitely return! I'm a definite  fan of the Ayres Suites. Very comfortable beds, clean rooms,and convenient location to Newport Beach area. The on-site restaurant was convenient but the food was only so-so.

Summary Heading: BEST PLACE TO STAY IF YOU HAVE A GROUP
Summary: Cannot give Ayers Hotel enough kudos for their great service and accommodating staff.  We had a group of 15 people and the sales staff made certain that they asked enough questions to determine our needs for the weekend.  The arranged rooms for us that allowed us to contain our "party" to the courtyard area.  We were able to have drinks from their bar by walking just a few steps from our rooms and they accommodated an excellent dinner in their restaurant (again only steps away from the party).  Their rooms were clean and beds EXTREMELY comfortable.   We are having a larger party in October and will most likely book at Ayers.  Love that this is a little boutique hotel with a Big heart.  Also, they had a full house the night we were there, but somehow it didn't feel like it.

My recent stay at the Ayres Hotel was fabulous. Good location. The one King Bedroom Suite was really cozy and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful, hands down. Thank you kindly for keeping my stay comfortable. My weekend was relaxing.

Summary Heading: DON'T STAY at the AYRES HOTEL
Summary: The hotel is nice, but the staff is incompetent, uncaring & do not follow their motto of "WE CARE ABOUT PEOPLE*WE VALUE TEAMWORK*WE DELIVER RESULTS*" they failed on all 3. Lacking in customer service, they stand by "THEIR" policies and procedures, not the industry standard, & would rather die standing by them then to care about the guest & for this I will never stay at an Ayres Hotel again!
Manager Response: Dear TraveltheOC,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to provide some feedback regarding your recent experience at our hotel. I regret to hear that your interactions with our team members left much to be desired, nevertheless, we hope that your future accommodations are comfortable and satisfying.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This a great hotel.  Way bigger than it appears on the outside.  Very quiet rooms.  Staff was super friendly and helpful.  Restaurant was very good and fairly reasonable on price.  However, It was fairly slow on taking an order and delivering food.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable and easy to get around
Summary: Very nice hotel near the airport in Costa Mesa.  We stayed there to meet up with my family for a Southern Cal trip.   Rooms were definitely clean and comfortable.  It was also very easy for my dad who gets around with a walker to get to his room easily as opposed to being in a big resort.  Since it is near the airport, you will hear airplanes starting around 7 AM but that's true of many of the hotels in the area.   Very centrally located to do a variety of things in the OC

Summary Heading: Lovely place to stay for our anniversary
Summary: Our room was quiet and pleasant, and we were not disturbed by any noise from other guests. We appreciated having a room away from the pool and other areas of heavy foot traffic as it probably added to the peacefulness we enjoyed. The patio was a relaxing place to spend time in the late afternoon enjoying the lovely spring flowers and classical music playing softly in the background. Perfect place to have a glass of wine and an appetizer. We have stayed at two Ayres Hotels and the ambiance is very pleasing. It made a delightful place to get away for our anniversary.

We really enjoyed our stay at Ayre's Hotel in Costa Mesa.  It is perfect for our family with good sized rooms, reasonably priced breakfast buffet, nice pools, free parking/shuttle, etc.  It was a great experience!

Our experience was top notch from the timely pick up by the hotel van, to the quick check-in, clean room, and friendly staff. We enjoyed an hour by the pool as well, although it was only 68 degrees. We were the only ones at the pool and there were no towels. I called the front desk and a gentleman arrived in 3 minutes with towels for us. We also utilized room service and it was delivered in less than 30 minutes and the food was delicious. We will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel Costa Mesa is a top notch establishment!
Summary: We enjoyed everything about Ayres Hotel Costa Mesa: beautifully designed rooms; excellent art work in the public areas; delicious breakfast; caring and helpful staff; quiet stay in our hotel room; great location.  My wife and I had a very restful, peaceful and fun time at Ayres.  We highly recommend it and will be back!

This hotel is close to John Wayne Airport that there is constant airplane noise. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. There is not enough storage in the dressers in the bedroom. The air conditioner is loud and the sofa bed was so uncomfortable. The bathroom is small and there is no place to store personal items other than on the counter. Overall the hotel is  nice and the staff is very attentive.  I would not stay at this hotel again.

Whenever we visit Irvine, we only stay in this hotel. We love the pool fascilities and the location. it is so close to all of the things we love in the area, Mitsuwa marketplace, diamond jamboree, the ocean (especially Crystal Cove plaza) and the university  of Irvine. It is a perfect location, very close to the airport, too!

The suite was large and well equiped.  Coffee facilities were provided but no tea. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was lovely.  The hotel was being renovated so it was like a building site. But I'd imagine when it is restored it will be lovely. The breakfast was great with a lot of choice. The staff were really nice and friendly. I would recommend this hotel.

This hotel is the closest to my daughter's school and I enjoy staying here.  This time we ordered room service and it was very timely and good food too.  We were able to use the jacuzzi for relaxing at the end of a long drive and it was a pleasant experience as well.  Definitely recommend staying here if you are in the area.

I am a 27-year airline pilot.  I have stayed in more hotels than I care to talk about.  The Ayres is one of my favorite hotels.  Clean, comfortable and predictable quality.  The staff is very friendly.  The atmosphere is beautiful and very conducive to relaxation.  The breakfast is not as quite as good as it use to be...

This is a nice hotel and I find the rooms and decor to be consistent with their other locations. This one took me by surprise as they put me in a building across the parking lot. It looked as if it was another hotel they bought and converted it to their brand. I had to walk out to the street, down the sidewalk, and then to the entrance of my building. The wifi worked well, the staff was nice and it was great to have a fridge and microwave in my room. I enjoyed a drink at their bar...back in the main building...and I found the bar decor to feel like a men's smoking room from the 20's...but without the smoke...kinda interesting.

Our stay was very short but it seemed like a great spot.  We booked a one bedroom king suite with king bed and separate "parlor" with a queen sleeper.  The space was nice for the four people in our party.  King bed and pillows were very comfortable.  Queen sleeper was ok.   Hotel staff was very friendly.  We called housekeeping in the a.m. for more towels and they were delivered promptly.  Staff informed us on checkin that there was a wedding celebration just ending.  We appreciated the information and noise was not a problem.  Hotel is nicely appointed and welcoming.  Adequate free parking. There is a restaurant in the building which we didn't use.  There is a pool and another separate courtyard area with lots of seating that is surrounded by the hotel.  It looked like a nice

My first stay at an Ayres property.   It was just OK - probably won't stay here again.  I arrived late at night due to a flight delay - and it seemed like I was dumped into the last available room - in the out building.  Room felt dated - almost like I was staying in the basement.   Nothing terrible - employees were very nice and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. I regret to hear that your first experience at our hotel left much to be desired. We kindly encourage you to give our hotel, or sister hotels, another opportunity. We would greatly appreciate a second opportunity to provide you with the service you deserve.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed there only for one night mid-January for my husband's work annual party, so I wish I had more to review but we hardly have time.  we walked in after midnight, and had to leave before 8 the next day.  For what we have seen, the lobby area is great, but the rest of the first floor (from the back of the hotel) is showing age.  The floor to get to the room (we're on the 4th or top floor I believe) feels slanted and old.  The pool area looked good from our view from the top, but we never got to use it.  The room is good, a good size, and is clean.

The Ayres was very clean and the employees at the desk were very kind..  Stayed there one night for a business meeting in the area and got a good night's sleep.  They have all the amenities that a business traveler needs.  I brought my wife with me and relaxed in their pool area.

Our stay was very pleasant.  There is much to recommend and little to disparage.   We ordered room service twice.  The first was the Angus burger was about on par with a Dennys.  Not bad, but...Dennys.  And after repeatedly stating no ketchup, not on the burger, or for the fries, and asking for mustard on the side, i got a cup with 1 mayo, 1 mustard and 6 ketchup packets. Dennys treatment.   That order also included a casadilla which while tasty, was tiny. A single small tortilla, flipped over.  For 11$s it was really not worth it.  Our second meal was far better.  Ahi sandwich and a roasted Turkey sandwich that we liked very much.    While the room was great the bathroom was tiled with the most slippery marble i ever felt.   My wife and I were nervous walking in the bathroom

Summary Heading: First Ayres I have been disappointed with.
Summary: The bathroom smelled like cigarette smoke the whole time I was there. The toilet had not been thoroughly wiped down on the outside. The marble squares in the entrance floor had sticky spots. The front desk did not inquire about my stay.
Manager Response: Dear MannersPanama,  I regret to hear that your experience at our hotel was sub par. Our team constantly strives to provide exceptional service to all of our valued guests and it is apparent that we fell short of our highest commitment during your stay. We kindly urge our guests to voice their concerns immediately so that management is able to remedy the situation during your stay. We hope this isolated experience does not keep you from returning to our hotel in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This is a very nice, comfortable hotel located on a busy thoroughfare about 2 miles from John Wayne Airport. The common areas and the rooms are well decorated, roomy and clean. I stayed here for a quick overnight because of the proximity to the airport and because of the free shuttle. Upon arrival at the airport I called for transportation and the front desk said it would be an hour before they could pick me up. No explanation, alternative, or apology was offered. A nice stay other than that.
Manager Response: Dear Ann N,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review letting fellow TripAdvisor travelers know about your recent stay. Your kind compliments in regards to our well-decorated grounds and optimal location are greatly appreciated. Nevertheless, I regret to hear that your experience with our complimentary shuttle services left much to be desired. We hope this experience does not keep you from returning to our hotel.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Biren-Moore General Manager

Summary: Stayed here while in Costa Mesa for a business trip recently. The entire property looks like someone's charming estate. There is not feeling of an institutional hotel or the typical amenities usually associated therewith. Staff was incredibly accommodating and I plan to make this a regular stop in my rotation.

I was staying at the hotel for few days on a business trip and it was very nice, very nice and very quiet hotel, very good service and a big breakfast, a lot of parking. the rooms a re very big (maybe too big) but very well taken care.

The shuttle at the hotel is very helpful in not having to drive to dinner they will take you within a 3 mile radius.  Staff was very helpful.  Bar at hotel little expensive.  Had stayed at another Ayres in past.

I have stayed at this hotel a few times.  They are close to the John Wayne Airport and have shuttle service for early morning departures back east.  This is nice when you have an early flight and you can count on the shuttle...but be warned, this is a Flight Crew hotel and they compete for the early shuttle spots so make your reservation when you check in.  Rooms are very nice and reasonably priced.  The restaurant is very good too.

I really like the Ayers Hotels and this location met our needs while attending the CWEA/SARBS Annual Awards program. Instead of driving 150 back home, we checked into the Ayers and spent the night relaxing instead of stressing. This may not seem like a big deal to lost, but my room had a USB  outlet for charging g my phone right at the nightstand. #brillant as it makes perfect sense but most hotels don't get this. Thanks Ayers for making our stay a wonderful time of rest.

I've stayed here twice in last 3 years on business.  I really wasn't sure what to expect since I did not make the reservation.  Easy to find and not far from major freeways, and close to everything in Orange County.   Was pleasantly surprised and overall experience was very nice.  The rooms were good sized for me and a friend I was traveling with, 2 queen beds.  Bathrooms were average sized, clean and plenty of the basics(conditioner, shampoo, soap...) and clean towels etc...  TV was new, but didn't have time to see what channels they had to offer. Wifi was free, average speed but more than good enough for checking email, fb and updating blog. Like the TV, the pool looked nice, but did not have the chance to take a dip.  The breakfast buffet was a highlight!  Great food, plenty

Summary Heading: Excellent, enjoyable stay at the Ayres
Summary: Room was great, courtyards are fantastic, and it's within walking distance of the Upper Newport Bay Nature Reserve, which is a great place to spend an afternoon.  Big thanks to Kara and Winston for helping me book my stay on short notice!

Very clean and lovely hotel.  We decided to get a Jr Suite and very impressed. The size of the room was great, good internet, I liked the two lobbies for the different hotels and separate  entrances.  The bar is retro - 60's and very nice - decided to stay late to meet some friends and bartender let us stay late - which was very kind.  Large bathroom - good parking area and overall excellent customer service.  Would recommend and return.  Ah ... one caveat - proximity to John Wayne Airport and airplanes start early - 6 a.m. +/- - so good for business trips - but if you want to sleep in late - possibly not.  I would still stay again.

Looks like maybe a recent remodel was done. Not my taste, but done well. My suite had large traditional  wood pieces in espresso finish, a leather couch, and desk. Outside facing rooms have no real views, interior rooms overlook a lovely pool or dining area.  Artwork on the walls is definitely a step above what you'll see at any other hotel this size and at this great value. Same goes for the staff - courteous, capable, clearly spoken and very helpful.   Free - parking & wifi and a great nightly rate.   Best uses for this one - business stay, family SoCal get away (not too far from attractions and the beach), or weekend travel to see friends & family near by.

Stayed for business trip. The staff was helpful. Stayed in a suite - very nice large room. There are several meeting rooms.  Lunch was served by pool. The in-house restaurant breakfast buffet was excellent and was also great for dinner.

Summary Heading: Nice staff, mostly clean rooms, good location.
Summary: Our room was quiet and the staff was very friendly. However, we did have a huge roach show up in our room. It was disgusting and made me wonder if there were others that we didn't see. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Summary Heading: Great spot for a meeting in the OC
Summary: Was here for a meeting, close to the SNA airport, but also close to attractions.  For the shopper there is a shuttle to South Coast Plaza and Fashion Island.  It also has a shuttle to Balboa Island.  Staff was excellent, rooms are mini suites and include a microwave and small fridge.

Summary Heading: Great boutique hotel with friendly helpful staff
Summary: I decided to stay here for Surf City marathon weekend. The reviews are accurate...a nice boutique hotel and the friendly, helpful staff made it a great stay. Our friends spent part of the afternoon hanging with us in the comfy lobby. The staff recommended a great venue to watch the Super Bowl...and the driver took us out on short notice - and picked us up after the game.

Summary Heading: A nice hotel, but here's some advice....
Summary: The room was very very clean and in good condition.  The staff was always super nice and friendly. The bed was comfortable. The carpet in my room was worn out, but very clean. There was good heat in the room (self-controlled), which you'll need for the oddly cold nights in Costa Mesa. If you want more than one blanket you'll have to ask at front desk. The hotel is three stories but very large and spread out, and my room was at the outer reaches -- took a long time just to walk to the front desk and restaurant.  I recommend asking for a room near the front desk.  FYI, there is no microwave in room -- it's in outer hallway, shared with other guests. The tap water in Costa Mesa tastes disgusting -- I needed bottled for tea/coffee/drinking. Only way to get good water is vending

The location was perfectly situated for our purposes.  Comfortable beds...loved the décor.  The front desk staff was very helpful and courteous.  Parking was convenient and close to our room.  My only complaint is that there were some very noisy guests above us and in the hallway outside our room.  The sound carried very clearly into our room.
Manager Response: Dear crbedell,  I am delighted to hear that our optimal location served all of your needs! Thank you so much for the kind compliments regarding our decor and our amazing team members. We regret to read about your unpleasant experience regarding the neighboring guests. We hope that you consider staying with us next time you are in the area.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My stay at this luxurious hotel was absolutely fantastic. From the front desk service to the friendly shuttle attendants this hotel is as good as it gets. I booked I ahead of time and everything was smooth. The rooms had a very luxurious feel to them as did the hotel as you walked around.

Professional, courteous staff. Front desk staff was especially helpful and went above and beyond to assist.  Dinner and breakfast were delicious: good food and tasteful preparation.  Room was clean and tidy, with comfortable furnishings.  Great location: convenient to airport, shopping and restaurants. Will book here again.

We stayed at Ayres in Costa Mesa for 10 days and our daughter was married in their courtyard.  The staff and amenities were wonderful.  Our room was great and kept clean during our entire stay. We had many requests of the staff during our stay to prepare for the wedding and everyone of the requests were met promptly and without any hesitation. A continental breakfast would have made our stay more enjoyable as the buffet breakfast was too much most morning

Summary Heading: Generally OK facility, stupid customer relations policies, several irritating oversights in the room
Summary: This  facility is OK -- not great, not bad. It is getting a bit tired, but is still reasonably good. What hugely irritated me was that the hotel has "policies" that prevent the otherwise sympathetic an embarrassed staff from giving proper customer service. For me, it all started at checkin. My local business office made my reservation through Expedia. Thus the reservation was in that person's name, not mine. We figured this out quickly as I knew the name, but Ayres policies would not let me in the room. So -- I had the front desk phone the individual involved who confirmed the room was for me. Ayres, ridiculously, would not accept this. They demanded a fax from Expedia. The local office I was visiting had to contact Expedia  (not easy to do quickly), and Expedia had to send a

After living in Orange County for a numbers of years, business requires my return on a regular basis.  I stay at the Ayres in Costa Mesa whenever possible.  The accommodations are great, the service is outstanding and the breakfast is delightful. Love visiting during the Holidays as well.  They decorate the hotel nicely and helps make the experience relaxed.  Keep up the great work !!

Nice staff, very clean. Rooms are a nice size and make you feel at home. Beds are extremely comfortable. Centralized location. Near numerous restaurants and convenience stores. And of course they have a great restaurant. Nice pool and courtyard.

Summary Heading: A Bit of Tuscany in Costa Mesa
Summary: We always have enjoyed our stays at Ayres Hotels in SOCAL and had the opportunity to visit the Costa Mesa Hotel during our New Year's holiday. As with our previous experiences with this hotel group we were impressed with the facilities. The rooms are up to date and well appointed, immaculate throughout and have amazing beds!  All of the staff is attentive and helpful and enjoy their jobs. I would surely recommend this hotel and any of Ayres Hotels and Suites if you are looking for a great room, friendly staff, and good value for your dollar.

I stay at this hotel before in february 2015. Service is not like before I request late check in before on telephone, they say no problem. When I go check in now is problem and no possible. I will stay at other hotel in future
Manager Response: Dear Robyn N,  Thank you so much for taking the time to provide some insight on your most recent stay. We appreciate the feedback you have provided and regret to hear that your stay did not meet your expectations from previous stays. Nevertheless, we apologize for any confusion that we may have caused. Please rest assured that you are free to check in anytime after 3 PM, we have a team members around the clock who are readily available to check you in. We hope your future accommodations are comfortable an satisfying.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: From check-in to check-out, our stay was very enjoyable.  I work in the hospitality industry so I have to admit I have high expectations when staying anywhere and this hotel did not disappoint. Jesus, the front desk agent was friendly, charismatic and knowledgable. The room was quaint and comfortable and had a nice patio area. I took a bath in the jetted tub and really was able to relax. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wants a nice hotel at a reasonable price.

Summary Heading: 4 nights of fun and amazing service best location great price
Summary: THE SLANG OF 'TOP TO BOTTOM'  this describe the above hotel I been air line employee for 30 years stayed number of hotels in USA and out of USA one of the best hotel I ever stay  Location is very ideal almost every thing available in nearby even fast food

Summary Heading: Great value, clean, convenient, friendly staff - ALL GOOD! :-)
Summary: This is a practical accommodation for its proximity to John Wayne Airport and the Newport/Costa Mesa/South Coast Plaza area.  The hotel is a little dated in its ambiance, but it is super clean, comfortable and the staff is TERRIFIC.  Everyone in every position is friendly and helpful. The price is right and it is an easy home base for South OC visits. (FYI, the only reason I am giving 4 instead of 5 stars is the dated decor.)
