We began staying at the Ayres Costa Mesa in the early 1990s when the hotel housed a lovely gift shop run by sisters Karen and Laurie and provided a complimentary, cooked-to-order breakfast for its guests.  A lot has changed since then, but Ayres is still our favorite hotel in the area for its quality staff, reliably clean accommodations and proximity to airport and shopping (both within 5-10 minutes). The electric vehicle chargers are a recent bonus.

Summary Heading: Great place with quiet rooms, delicious breakfast!
Summary: Loved staying in second building in a King Suite with a large tub, big room, kitchenette, nice pool in back and second one in main building's courtyard.   Breakfast is delicious, hot, made to order and all you can eat! Makes getting out for your day very easy. Centrally located to John Wayne Airport, beaches, Newport Harbor, world class shopping, tons of entertainment, restaurants, 5 blocks from hiking on the Back Bay and Disneyland about 20 min away.   Main building has some very interesting historical photos in the halls that show Newport Beach in the old days and as the harbor was being built. Enjoyed seeing these.  I called directly and they kindly matched the best price I had found on the internet.

The room was large and clean. The reception staff did their very best to arrange for us to be allocated a different room to that originally allocated. Location next to John Wayne airport make it very handy for travel from there. Restaurant staff also very friendly and food was fine.

I stayed at the hotel because it was close to my work.   Great place to stay for a great meal and a great stay.   Try the pot roast! The area offers great places to catch as well.   Front desk staff was very customer orientated.

I booked my stay as a result of all the overwhelming positive reviews I read.  It seems that most revolve around the way the place looks as you walk around the grounds.  The decor around the hotel and the courtyards are nice, but I wasn't staying because I liked the way the place looked as I walked to my room.  If you've stayed at any Ayres Hotel, you get the same decor at any other location, so it's nothing really out of the ordinary when compared that way, other than that, it's not worth the price I paid, especially considering that there is no complimentary breakfast.  I've stayed at several Ayres locations around SoCal, and they have all had great complimentary breakfasts.  Not here.  I stayed in the king suite with my family.  Everything was much smaller than I anticipated.

We booked this hotel through a travel agency in conjunction with a softball tournament - having never stayed at a Ayres property we were a little nervous (we tend to stick with brands that we know). We were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived - this hotel is BEAUTIFUL!!! The lobby was gorgeous and our room was in the main building on the third floor and looked out on the courtyard with a fountain and bistro tables. The room was very nice and the beds were comfortable. The staff in both the hotel and restaurant were very courteous and accommodating. The free breakfast buffet was great and while the dinner menu was a little limited it was very good. We have definitely put this brand on our list of properties that we love to stay in!!!

nice elegant European style rooms, bath tub with spa facility, Free cab service, huge rooms with huge comfortable beds, well equipped with everything,nice staff, very close to Orange county airport and down town and south coast plaza

I had to book a room for one night in this area and I had short notice. I looked at all the hotels in the area and due to the reviews here I chose this hotel. I would not stay here again. Some may call this place vintage, some may call it old. The room was ok, nothing to rave about... the heater/AC made SOOO much noise it was very hard to sleep at night. I kind of feel bad for the employees of this hotel because most of them (except for the front desk people) looked miserable so it makes you wonder if they aren't paid well or treated well. We went to the restaurant for breakfast, which was mediocre and no one even asked us if we wanted water or coffee but I noticed they asked another table nearby, not sure why we got ignored while others got service but that's not cool

Very upscale place, great service. everyone is so friendly and nice ive stayed here about 5x now, and I enjoy it each time. Its a very affordable place great restaurant inside and everyone at the bar super friendly.

We stayed at the Ayres on the list night of our trip to Anaheim, as we had an early morning flight the next day and wanted to be close to the airport. Hotel was beautiful and very clean. The staff was less than pleasant though. We had 5 suitcases/bags and no one offered us luggage assistance to our room (and there wasn't anyone around to ask either). Also, when I booked the room, I called to find out if the airport shuttle was available 24/7, and the woman who answered said that it was. Come to find out, the shuttle isn't available 24/7 and didn't begin running until 5am. Unfortunately, that didn't work for us since we had a 6am flight. The hotel is very close to the airport, so if you have a late arriving flight or early morning departure, it's a great option. Just plan on

I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel. Parking was adequate. Location good. Staff competent. Cookies yummy. Bathrooms immaculate. The room was large and beds memorably comfortable.   The only drawback is that for the same price, if not less, I can stay at the Holiday Inn Express down the road and it comes with a decent, free breakfast. For this trip because it was a group event, I had no choice. I couldn't mind staying again but if booking on my own, then the HIE would get my money.  Only drawback is that the layout of the hotel is slightly confusing. My daughter tried to find her friend's room and we got lost and kind of gave up. So if you are in a group, try to get rooms at least in the same building.

Summary Heading: A gem of a hide a way
Summary: I travel and stay at many different hotels, and this was a rare find hidden away just minutes from John Wayne airport.  Clean and beautiful.  Room service so don't know why other review said they had a problem getting food? My only complaint was the bathroom counter in my room (191) was so small, and toilet had no lid, so several times things fell in the toilet, and that is not a happy experience. Hope hotel reads this.  But stay it's great and very friendly and helpful staff.

Summary Heading: Nice place to spend a night
Summary: This hotel was nice for an overnight stay. Our room was spacious, very clean and well-presented. It was a little difficult to get food when we arrived around 3.00pm but the staff were friendly and helpful, and we did eventually get a snack. Reasonably close to shops. We were going to Cirque du Soleil; it was very close to that.
Manager Response: Dear Christine D,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay. We are happy to hear that our optimal location, along with our amazing team members, exceeded your expectations. Come back and stay with us again soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The hotel is very nice. We stayed in a king deluxe room with a faux fireplace. It doesn't actually give off heat it mimics the look of a fireplace, complete with a crackling sound. The room was very clean and well furnished and included a small refrigerator.   Even thought the hotel is near the airport I never heard the planes.
Manager Response: Dear Joni8818,  It is wonderful to hear that you found our accommodations to your liking for your special getaway. I appreciate your kind words and hope you will choose to stay with us again the next time you are in the area!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Close to JW Airport and local Shopping
Summary: We spent the night after visiting the Segerstrom Concert Hall - it was only 15 minutes away --  In addition, the hotel was close to John Wayne Airport, and the Camp, and South Coast plaza shopping   And easy to jump on the 405, 55 or 73 fwys  Only downside was access to the property based on the center divider on Bristol

Summary Heading: Nice stay once again @ Ayres Costa Mesa
Summary: We have stayed here multiple times since our daughter started at UC Irvine. Very nice breakfast,staff, rooms & general ambiance. The bar has a daily happy hour with a good selection of adult beverages. We especially like the wait staff at the bar.

Summary Heading: Good hotel for meeting and also some relax time
Summary: The waiting and sitting areas around the hotel are classic and beautiful, as well as the room where I stayed.  The pools and hot tubs are easy to access, and having a fridge and microwave can be helpful too.  I enjoyed getting to eat at the restaurant and also travel down to the coast.  Orange County is a very nice place to get to spend time, and Ayres was a very pleasant place to stay.

It's reminds me of staying at grandma's house, and that is a total compliment. It has a feeling of retro elegance and comfort. The convenience of being right by the airport and a few miles from the beach. Plenty of choices for dining in and around the hotel. It has a pretty decent fitness center, but hey, it's So Cal! Get your butt outside for fun and fitness. I am a runner, so hitting the trails of the Back Bay is a must for me. Great for walking too. It's less than a mile from the hotel. There are bikes to rent as well. Afterward I did a nice soak in the jacuzzi in my own bathroom. I miss the Managers Happy Hour with free drinks that they used to have, but that's ok. It's a great place to stay

Excellent price for a clean, comfortable hotel.  The rooms and hotel were clean and comfortable and the staff very friendly.  I was very disappointed with the room location and should have been warned.  Room 107 had terrible noise from a large party that gathered that night in the courtyard and was very noisy starting a 6:15 am from people going to breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear SBtraveler1,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent stay at our hotel. We are humbled to hear that you enjoyed the value of our hotel but we would like to apologize for the unpleasantness caused by the location of your room. We always urge our guest to input certain request, such as "quiet room on the top floor", upon booking their reservations. We always strive to meet the reasonable needs of our guests whenever possible. Thank you again for review and we look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Overpriced, inedible food, unfriendly staff, improper communication
Summary: Even though the AC was running and the room clean when we got there, it was musty and we needed to open the windows and air out the room before we felt comfortable staying in it.  Upon check-in, we were told about the free breakfast.  When we went to get breakfast, we were told that the breakfast was for one person only and were charged $14 + tip for a breakfast of reheated eggs and a couple of stale muffins. When we went to the front desk to inquire about the charge, we were told that in addition to having to pay for the overpriced breakfast, there was also going to be an extra $10 per day charge for a second guest in the room.  This is about expectations and If there was going to be extra charges, they should have told us this upon check-in or even better when we made the

We were 4 people sharing a room with two queensized beds. It was space enough and the interiordesign was old fashioned and that was great. Everything was new and clean but the design made you feel like an old, english hotel. The breakfast was good and they varied it a bit.

We were in Costa Mesa for one night only to attend an event at the OC fairgrounds, when booking this looked to be the best available hotel, enjoyed the look of the hotel, the rooms are nicely kept and spacious, good restaurant along with a really nice courtyard, breakfast cost was an additional $10 per person, small buffet, but good enough to get you started, the staff was nice and friendly, it is near the airport so you will hear some air traffic in the morning, the hotel is well centered in terms of being able to drive 10 minutes and you can be at the beach or local shopping centers. Only complaint would be that the cleaning staff is loud, which is not cool in the am after a long night and you're trying to sleep in, the two way radios that they use were pretty loud, and the

great room décor, and set up, two pool to chose from has banquets room, restaurant and bar. Nice place to get away and relax and also party too. enjoy staying here at least twice a year. Love the friendliness.

I attended a training course at this hotel. It was very accommodating and met the needs of the group. Water, hot water and coffee were available all day. The hotel was very clean. The staff is very busy but always available to help

I stayed here for 10 days. Everything and everyone was very nice the whole time. Easy access to highways too. One thing to keep in mind is that they cater dinner parties around the main pool area. That means you can't use the pool. Although, there is a smaller one across the way in the other building.

Went to a training course that was held at the Ayres Hotel and stayed at the hotel with my husband.  It is a beautiful hotel! Very clean and nicely decorated, great restaurant for breakfast and lunch, nice pools/hot tubs in court yards, very close to the airport - some plane fly by noise, but not too bad!

My family is totally not satisfied with my stay here. There was a cockroach in the room, an ant in the bathroom and one of the beds had blood on the sheets. Beds were super uncomfortable. Will not be staying here again that is for sure. Service was extremely slow at check in and check out. Girl at the front counter asked if we wanted to speak with a manager regarding our stay, when asked how long it would take she said she would have to see if they are busy. What a joke.
Manager Response: Dear Camille C,  We appreciate your honest feedback and would like to express our most sincere apology for your stay being anything less than exceptional. Please rest assured that our hotel is held to the highest standard of cleanliness. With that being said, due to the severe drought, we have had occurrences with German Water Bugs as well as ants. As a result, our property -- including the rooms and the underground lines-- are treated constantly. In the future, we encourage you to bring any issues you may experience to our attention immediately. For example, your dissatisfaction with our linens, so that we are able to resolve the issues in a prompt manner. This will help us to better serve our current and future guests and will help ensure you have a comfortable stay. We regret to hear that you received a less than courteous, friendly and professional treatment. There is absolutely never an excuse for poor service and we hope this does not keep you from returning to our hotel. We genuinely hope you will give us an another opportunity to provide the services and accommodations you deserve.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The room was nicely furnished  & Clean. Easy access to the freeways. Plenty of restaurants in the area to choose from. The lobby was lovely and has a European elegance about it. I would stay their again.

Summary Heading: Can I rate it better than 5?
Summary: What an excellent stay. I was there for five days during a business trip and really enjoyed my stay. The morning breakfast is amazing, and the rooms are very clean, comfortable and decorated very well. I didn’t get to use the pool, but it looked great. The bar has a great selection and more than fair pours. I couldn’t have asked for better customer service. Everyone was very friendly, helpful with questions about what is in the area and never seemed inconvenienced by customers. I stay at a lot of hotels, and there are few that I would give better than a five rating if I could, this is one of those hotels. The only thing that I don’t like about this hotel is sometimes I get “creeped” out by the décor because it reminds me of the movie The Shining.

Stayed here because it is affordable and only short stay from the Catalina Flyer which we were taking the next morning. Room was clean, comfortable and quiet even though it is near John Wayne Airport. The pool and spa were located in a relaxing environment and the cookies in the lobby were a delicious snack.

My wife & I have stayed at the Ayres, Costa Mesa, on a number of occasions & have had no complaints. During our most recent stay we went down stairs for the free breakfast & were told it was not included, although during check in we were told it was included. This was surprising & disappointing considering the previous 5-6 times we have stayed there in the past year there were no issues.

The hotel and rooms are relatively nice, although the location of the facility is decidedly so-so - nothing in the immediate vicinity except freeways.  The Chateau Restaurant was pretty marginal - leaden waffles, partially scrambled eggs.

Visited the hotel this week for business. Very close to the John Wayne Airport (SNA) in Orange County, CA. Staff was great and very accommodating. The rooms were very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel.

My husband and I stayed at the Ayers in Costa Mesa for eight nightes. Our room was clean and housekeeping did an excellent job to make sure our room had all the towels we needed.   I notified them in advance that we would be arriving at 2 am after traveling 48 hours from South Africa and to have our room ready since we will be exhausted.  The gentleman at check in was waiting for us and quickly gave us our keys and we were in our room.  We were concerned the next night there was an event outside our room in the pool area.  It did finish around 9 pm and we only heard in our room when the man on the microphone would raise his voice.   Yes we heard the planes but that was at 7 am when John Wayne Airport opened. The planes must be lined up ready for take off, but we were up by that

Summary Heading: Not the glamorous place it's rated
Summary: I was disappointed.  This is a glorified Country Inn and Suites, in fact it actually WAS a former Country Inn & Suites property.   Ayres has done little to upgrade or differentiate itself  from other mid-tier properties.  The staff were not as organized or professional as I had hoped or expected and the room  was not nearly as comfortable as I'd hoped (A/C was off and the place was sweltering when i arrived - took 60 minutes to cool down).

This was heaven on earth.  The hotel felt more like a quaint country inn - well appointed and super comfortable.  In a quiet part of Costa Mesa but close to the freeway it was the perfect spot.  Staff was fantastic!  I stayed in the suite building and the room had a patio, jacuzzi bath, super comfortable bed, and lots of room to relax and work.  I wouldn't stay anywhere else while on a business trip in this area.

Good location. I needed an inexpensive hotel near Newport beach for 1 night as I had a golf game planned the next day. Rooms are somewhat old and dated. Mattress reminded me of Motel 6 although the sheets were cleaner. Planes flying over starting early morning from nearby John Wayne airport.  Front staff was great but that was it. Restaurant people didn't even say Good Morning. Overall a safer than Motel 6 but somehow I felt chose the wrong hotel.

Stayed 3 nights in the Suits building (the one next to the main building with the two open air atriums).  We were on the third floor with a two queen junior suit.  Room was spacious, Wet Bar nice, Fringe and microwave very helpful.  Furnishings in public areas quite opulent, if you have a few moments, take the time to look at the paintings, statues, vases, and model ships.  Room furnishings also very nice. Beds very comfortable.  Our room was on North side, South side gets a lot of sun (potential for heat). While the AC was out in some of the common areas, the room AC worked great and kept us cool. Maid service was the best I've experienced - very nice and helpful, in fact, all of the staff were very helpful.

A stayed 3 nights at the Ayers in Costa Mesa when I attended a high school reunion.  It is a pretty nice hotel and provided a really nice room at a reasonable price.  I had a generous room that had a separate bedroom.  The bed was comfortable and the room was clean and well-equipped.  The biggest negative issue that I had was the persistent aircraft noise.  It is very close to the John Wayne Orange County Airport.  Fortunately, the traffic stops at night.  I really appreciated their van service to the airport.  There is not much within walking distance, but it is otherwise a place I would recommend.

This is my second stay this year. i came back because I was so pleased the first time. I come to Orange County 2 to 3 times a year- and I think this will be my permanent choice for all my visits! Classy and simple. Fridge and Microwave. Nice quiet, unassuming location. Beautiful decor and lobby. Laundry facilities. Wi-Fi free with room. Fits my needs to a T! Great value for what you pay.

This was our first time stay at Ayres and we certainly impressed by the value. The room was among the least amount in the area and no added resort or parking fees. The lobby is beautiful and the staff at the registration desk extraordinary. We felt welcomed immediately. The room was very nice, bed comfy and overall experience very good. Our only complaints were the hallways were very hot and when you entered the room there was a very strong chemical smell. This hotel has great installation because it is very near the airport and we could never hear the airplanes and there was a wedding by the pool below our room and we barely could hear any of the celebration and it was over before 10:00 p.m. We used the spa and it was well maintained and fun. This is a great value for the money

I stayed here for business.  I am EXTREMELY happy with my stay.   My flight arrived very early. I was still able to check in earlier than normal. The staff was very helpful. The room was GORGEOUS.  Clean, neat, comfortable.  The complimentary WiFi made my life so easy because I was able to quickly get a lot of work done. The property is VERY well kept. Everything looks like it is properly taken care of. The pool and its surrounding areas is clean. The restaurant has great food at a reasonable price.   The day I was leaving, my 1040am flight was canceled. The next flight was at 9pm.  The staff worked with me and allowed me to check out at 6pm.  They are wonderful. I enjoyed every minute I spent here. I will return and I will refer to everyone I know.    Thank you so much!!!!

The Ayres Costa Mesa is a great place to stay if you are in the Costa Mesa area. Our family of four stayed here in July, 2015 for 6 nights while visiting relatives and attending a family reunion nearby.  Having never stayed at one, we did not know what to expect from the Ayres brand, which seems to be a west coast family owned hotel chain. We were pleasantly surprised and would definitely stay in an Ayres hotel again!  Rooms are well kept and very clean. Our room had 2 queen beds, a large closet, a small fridge, flat screen TV, a coffee maker, a hair dryer, convenient power outlets and USB ports, a desk and chair. There was a 2nd sink & mirror outside the bathroom which was handy. No microwave in our room, but there was one located just down the hall next to the ice machine and

Have stayed once before.  Comfortable, spacious rooms.  Nice buffet breakfast in the morning, though found out it wasn't included with the room.  Book online for a better deal.  Convenient location, close to airport, shopping and University.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel at an excellet price.
Summary: I really enjoyed staying at the Ayres. I stayed for 2 weeks. The room was clean and had plenty of space. Having cookies in the lobby every evening and a breakfast buffet every morning was awesmome! Free parking is a rare in the Irvine area.

I must admit that I had doubts about this hotel. Prior to my stay, I'd never heard of the Ayres brand and the website depicted a "Medieval Times meets Motel 6" experience. I'm glad to say I my preconception was completely off.  The staff consistently exceeded my expectations. From the moment the shuttle picked me up at SNA until my return to the airport, the staff was incredible.   My room was large, exceptionally clean and well-appointed. Little things like USB ports in the outlets near the desk and nightstand and  an outlet near the bureau for ironing make a BIG difference. My room had a fireplace (which I didn't use) and a full-size leather club sofa. Room decor was an odd hybrid of traditional social club meets early 90's modern - but the room was quiet and comfortable.

Such a beautiful,  peaceful place to stay.  My daughter loves the jacuzzi bathtub available with a suite.  Conveniently located near shopping and the beach.   This is our second time staying here for vacation from New Mexico.   We will continue to stay here every year we come.

Summary Heading: Boutique feel - love the Bistro on site!
Summary: Stayed here when in California last week. The hallways were hot, as was the elevator. The rooms were nice and cool. The on-site restaurant was very good and has quaint seating outside of the bistro. The hotel was supposed to email the receipt to me, and I gave them my email address (it was different than the one listed who reserved it for me) and they assured me it would arrive. It did not, it went to the person who reserved it. The van shuttle was fabulous!! The drivers were super nice and super fast!! Loved being able to be picked up by the hotel shuttle and taken to my meeting the next day.  BRAVO!!

We flew in for a family member's wedding and had a great time at this hotel; and the group rate was a great price! The accommodations were very spacious, clean, and comfortable. We were able to make use of the pool and sauna that were well maintained. The bar and restaurant staff were fantastic - very attentive and the food was delicious.  Our only negative was WiFi, but that was because the local cable company in Orange County was having difficulties, so the hotel cannot be held responsible for that. Apparently the "heat" was unseasonably high for the area (being from the Northeast, we've definitely seen hotter), which could have been a contributing factor.

Summary Heading: Confusing building, but a nice stay.
Summary: The Ayers Hotel is located just off the end of the airport runway, but we only noticed flights when we were in the restaurant courtyard or by the pool. Not a single issue with our room, our welcome or our stay. The building can be confusing, but I'm sure we would have figured it out if we had stayed more than one night. The food at the restaurant was good and seemed to be the only place during our stay in southern California that understood what hard cider was (and had it!).

Our room was decorated so beautifully.  We had a swimming pool close and it was  such a welcome activity since it was very warm here in California at the time  We ask for first floor as I have a problem walking and we got a wonderful quiet  room on the first floor.

We have stayed before and booked six nights this time.  The building is well maintained, rooms clean and bed comfortable.  Yes, at 7am the air traffic from Orange County Airport begins so if you are a light sleeper, you will be awake by 7:01am.  The former complimentary breakfast has gone the way of many travel amenities and replaced by the breakfast buffet that will dent many travel budgets.  There is a good breakfast place a half block away--get some exercise and go there for better food at much less cost.  The Happy Hour special menu is good but limited and mostly fried--go for it if you are looking for a good deal with complimentary cholesterol.    Downside was the sleepy and less than truthful response of the front desk when I called from airport for the 10 minute  "free

Terrible fat foam pillows.  Parking spaces were made for sub sub sub compacts, though SUV's, trucks, & large cars all shoved into them. No wi-fi. Curtains you couldn't pull & secure to keep sun out in the morning.  Nowhere in bathroom to put my makeup & stuff.  Booked a month in advance, given a handicapped room. No "working" wi-fi.  Mediocre. VERY basic.

Summary Heading: Lobby area is misleading as to overall quality of hotel.
Summary: Rooms are old and dated. Noisy room in front of courtyard where people dine and drink  late at night and early in the morning. Internet service went out for a day. Issues with housekeeping staff never completely resolved by Hotel management. Told they would follow up and never heard another word. This hotel is average at best and that is being generous.

Summary Heading: A little bit of elegant Europe
Summary: Very pretty place. A courtyard and pool area tucked inside, all elegantly decorated.   Was a $5 uber ride to some very happening bars. Also a cool bar inside hotel that closes at 10pm  Great deal as there was a promotion when we called them that got us a free 50 cash card.

I thought the bedrooms were comfortable and clean. The bed was very comfortable. We opted for the buffet breakfast. The price was reasonable and they offered lots of protein choices. One morning they offered a vegetable frittata which was absolutely delicious. We had a couple of dinners at the restaurant. Everything was delicious. Try the olive relish with the bread. Yummy!

I could say without a doubt I would recommend Ayres for anyone who would be in this area. It's comfortable spacious with beautiful outdoor area near restaurant which I have pleasure of viewing from my room.  Food is really quite excellent  and I often use room service. Rooms are well-kept clean, large and quiet you cannot hear  surrounding noise next around you.  It also appears they've done some updating since my last visit. When I come to Costa Mesa for business this is where I absolutely want to stay.  But it's very family-friendly great parking in a good location near restaurants gas stations and a nice safe area.

We enjoyed our stay here. Nothing spectacular but everything met our needs. Elegant lobby. We didn't explore the rest of the common areas. The restaurant seems to get good reviews. Although there's just a single elevator up front and one toward the back, we never had a long wait for one. The room we booked was their 265 sq ft "deluxe" king. I think it's actually the smallest they offer but it was quite spacious with a sofa bed in the sitting area if you need it.  For the hotel size, it seemed like parking could be an issue but there were ample available spaces. I was wary of possible plane noise since they are right next to John Wayne Airport. It didn't help that we had a room on the third floor at the front of the hotel. Yes, the planes can be loud but it was surprisingly not

Summary Heading: Add 1/2 point more. Good but weird category
Summary: I really wanted to like this place more. Picture a country inn and suites structure, refurbished and decorated with over the top, random new rich, baroque style marshall's items. Less is more! This place is a bit overdone and gives the appearance of thinking highly of themselves..haha... Ps- unlike their in room brochure boasts, this place doesn't have an inch of European charm or style. It feels like a set decorator was hired at some point. Picture medieval times meets Disneyland.   PROS A+ for effort Good service Nice pool Ok gym Quiet setting Clean rooms Attention to detail  NOT SO MUCH Spotty wifi Kitschy decor Basic rooms So so location. Good for short visit. Must have car or ability and desire to walk several miles

Friendly staff especially Gena.  Hotel location is near most of needed attractions and shopping centers/areas.  Short distance to John Wayne Airport.  Reasonable facilities: gem, swimming pools, laundry room, famous restaurant: Le Chateau Restaurant & Lounge, Cobblestone Courtyard, Fountain and Gardens, complimentary high speed internet, complimentary car parking, two stylish lobbies Having the complimentary homemade delicious cookies is a nice gesture. Utilize the hotel shuttle bus to Balboa Island, Fashion Island Mall, the South Coast Plaza, or other nearby shopping centers

The front desk is awful. Completely inconsistent in details like: check in policy, late check out, holding luggage & trying to get it back, essentially any function of an actual front desk.   The only thing worse than the inhospitable front desk is the restaurant. The service is awful, waiters are nowhere to be found and are slow to come, if at all. Once you have placed an order, good luck actually getting it. My husband got the bill just 5 minutes before his coffee arrived, which was 15 minutes after his meal, and 45 minutes after ordering it. On top of that, the wait staff (I'm looking at you Orlando!) doesn't write things down, delivers drinks one at a time (if at all, as noted above), drops food before giving you utensils (and has to continuously be asked)  or bring you the
Manager Response: Dear jennys27477,  Thank you for your time in reviewing your recent stay with us. Please accept our most sincere apologies for any and all inconveniences you experienced during your time with us. Thank you for outlining your experience at our restaurant. I will be passing your review on to the restaurant manager to ensure that this does not occur again in the future. We hope that your accommodations, which were not mentioned, were to your liking at the very least. Again, thank you for your review of the restaurant.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: ok hotel. considering the location, and other factors : not worth it.
Summary: it is a fancy hotel, but lacks in some basic aspects. the good things first. real nice pictures and lobby. great stuff with the yachts and other decor.   if you are located in the main hotel, then great ( or maybe.. ). atleast you have a nice lobby and a building that is sort of secluded.   if you are on the other building, or pretty much on any floor in any building, you have to shut your blinds completely at all times ! It is a pity that you cant have the nice california sun shine into your room. Most of the windows are such that, you are open to view from the parking lots or the highways.  The dull lighting and the decor does not do any justice to the rooms either. The first impression is that you walked into a slightly updated best western or something !! which is not so.

Beach trip to Newport Beach, Ca. Short stay, however, the quality and service I have come to expect from Ayres was evident. Every member of staff we came across smiled and spoke. We did not use pool, fitness, nor ate breakfast there, so I have no comment on those. The place was cleaned, everything worked as it was supposed to.

Great place for a weekend getaway.   Quiet, clean, and no extra surcharges like a lot of hotels in the area.  Also the price was reasonable for a weekend stay.  Beaches, disneyland,  and angel stadium are easy commutes
Manager Response: Dear cold1za,  Thanks for staying with us and thank you for your five star review. Your kind comments are very much appreciated and we are glad that you found our location suitable for your needs. We absolutely look forward to serving you again soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Everything about this hotel is first class. The rooms were nicely appointed and the bathroom shower had a very nice gentle spray option. The beds were very comfortable and the a/c unit was very quiet. The hotel has nice pool in one of its two internal courtyards. The other internal courtyard is very nicely decorated and serves the property restaurant which adjoins the courtyard. The restaurant menu is not overly large but we ate there 3 times and every meal was good. Outdoor parking was abundant. If I am ever in the Newport Beach area I would certainly stay at the Ayers again.

Summary Heading: Wish my stay could have been longer.
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel several times within the last couple months, and have had several great stays, however, this latest trip was pretty incredible.  Check-in (around 5:15pm) with Lesley was so great. She remembered my name, was incredible friendly, and truly made me feel like I was a valued guest. I stayed in a King Suite, in the main building, it was my first time staying in their suites and the only complaint I have is that this trip only required a one-night stay. I would've loved to have been able to enjoy the room amenities/conveniences more.  Tips:  When you step into suites that are located above the courtyard you may quickly think that it's too noisy (voices seem to carry), however, once you make it to the bedroom you can't hear a peep.  The "location" rating

This is a beautiful hotel and holds up to the Ayres quality I expect when I stay at an Ayres hotel. Lovely restaurant where you can choose to eat in the restaurant or eat out in the patio. Extremely large pool, excellent for swimming laps. I had a view of the airplanes taking off-perfect for me!
Manager Response: Dear Blessedrn,  We appreciate you taking the time to review our Ayres Hotel and Suites Costa Mesa. We are extremely proud of the products and services we provide both at the hotel level and at our restaurant. Thank you so much for your kind compliments and cannot wait to host your next visit!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This hotel is nicely appointed, with good amenities and a convenient location. Although perhaps a bit dear, vis a vis other Ayres locations, it is reasonably competitive in its market. It helps that this area has one of the finest climates in the world.
Manager Response: Dear jg3arrow,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to share some feedback regarding your recent stay. We are pleased to see that you enjoyed your time with us and appreciate your kind compliments as well as your honesty. We hope to welcome you back again soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: From the moment I walked in I was very impressed with the hospitality of Gina. As I was going to the elevator houseman Chris greeted me and asked if I needed help. Chris showed me the easiest way to get to my room. The room was facing the courtyard and was just lovely and it had a jacuzzi tub. Which was just what I needed after a long day.There is a complimentary shuttle within a 3-mile radius which I took advantage of to see a movie. Delicious breakfast buffet.
Manager Response: Dear ItsNever2L8,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor informing others of your recent stay at Ayres Hotel and Suites Costa Mesa. We are truly fortunate to have Gina and Chris on our team as they are always willing to go above and beyond for our valued guests. We are thrilled to see that you enjoyed your stay. It is always humbling to receive such warm compliments regarding our exceptional team and luxurious accommodations. Your kind compliments are greatly appreciated and we look forward to serving you many more times in the future!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: As a frequent traveller I have paid significantly more for significantly less quality in a hotel. The Ayres Hotel is not a typical hotel in the sense of architecture, meaning you don't have those standard hallways where one room is crammed next to the other. Many rooms have direct access to the courtyard next to the restaurant. The atmosphere is relaxing, the service is excellent, and the food is amazing. I'd come back anytime!
Manager Response: Dear WFV2015,  Thank you so much for your very thoughtful review. We are constantly striving to be a better value than our counterparts in the Costa Mesa area and we are deeply humbled that you agree. Thank you again for your kind words and we hope to welcome you back again soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Good hotel for a good price
Summary: We were greeted by extremely friendly front desk staff that mistakenly sent us to the wrong elevator. Upon realizing, I asked for some clarification and was was given the most sincere apology, along with a bottle of local wine and a box of chocolates for the mistake (which was not a big deal at all).  The friendly staff continued throughout and even the cleaning staff greeted us with a smile and a hello.  As others have mentioned, the hotel is old fashion but it is very well kept and had a certain "old world charm" to it. Our room was quite large and had everything we needed. The location is near the airport but we did not hear airport traffic at any point of our stay. There are lots of dining options within a 5-10 minute drive so we did not dine at the hotel during our stay.
Manager Response: Dear Matthew C.,  Thank you for your time in reviewing your recent stay and for your kind compliments. Our friendly and professional team is always overjoyed to hear when they have left a standout impression to our valued guests. We certainly appreciate your feedback and hope to serve you again soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: asked for a room that opened onto the most romantic courtyard.....it was so sweet! my husband returned to OC after a year away and we wanted some quiet time in a place with character and ambiance....Ayres was wonderful.....lots of historical pictures on the wall....different sitting areas, each with its own unique character.....lounge and dining room with a different type of charm.....food great and reasonable....morning coffee next to the fountain in the courtyard was so Tuscan!  hate to even mention this but......no guide on the TV; couldn't find any movie; station listing glued under tv itself so using the remote from bed meant going all up and down to find a channel I recognized....glad I took a book!   close to Balboa Island and Newport Beach if you like tourist stuff! We

We just returned from a 5 day trip to Costa Mesa and stayed in a Junior Suite at Ayres Hotel & Suites. The staff was friendly and helpful. They shared local maps and directed us to restaurants and a local grocery (Von's) where we were able to save money stocking our own fridge. The water tasted great out of the tap or for making coffee, although we bought bottled water for day trips.   This suite met and exceeded our expectations. Comfortable king size bed, wet bar, couch w/ coffee table and desk area. Modern HD TV where we were able to plug in our own portable DVD player. There were plenty of plugs to juice up our electronics, WiFi access was excellent and a network cable was provided should clients wish to connect direct.   Ayers is green conscious, which we admire, although

Summary Heading: Nice stay at the Ayres in Costa Mesa
Summary: Had a nice, 2-night stay at this hotel in July for a family wedding.  Did not get a chance to explore any of the amenities but enjoyed the pleasant atmosphere and cleanliness of the room and hotel.  My only complaint would be the cost and quality of breakfast.  I was aware that it would be $10 per person but it was more than that the morning we ate at the hotel's restaurant - maybe higher on the weekend??
Manager Response: Dear michellen18,  Thank you kindly for providing some insight on your recent stay at our hotel. Though we appreciate your kind compliments you have shared, we regret to see that you did not get a chance to explore all of the added amenities we have to offer. We kindly encourage you to come back soon to have a true Ayres experience!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Very clean and friendly staff. Right off the 405. It is convenient. The rooms are spacious. Didn't get to use the outdoor pools but it looks like there are two of them.  The only problem I had with this hotel was the internet. It's free but i couldn't really get reception from my room. I stayed in room 315. As i move closer to the main building, i noticed the signal got stronger. I like the Anaheim hotel better.

Summary Heading: Nice and Convenient Hotel in Costa Mesa
Summary: Very good location and friendly staff. My stay was only a short time, 21pm - 6:30am. But I enjoyed the stay very much with a room service, Coffee and Orange Juice. Free WiFi was nice enough. Hot shower was comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear KEN E,  Thank you for sharing some insight regarding your recent stay with us and for your compliments regarding our convenient location and friendly team members. Though your stay was short, we are pleased to read that we made a lasting impression. Once again, thank you for your feedback and we hope to welcome you back again soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: In the very expansive area if Newport beach, This hotel is proper, close to Disneyland , close to the seaside, Santa Ana airport. Rooms are old fashioned but nice, breakfast on average . Swimming pool is ok . Convenient but a little bit far from the seaside

The hotel is situated in a calm neighborhood, except for the airport next to it flights are shut down between 11pm till 7am which is fine. The hotel is clean and service is excellent. Rooms look new, free parking and wifi. Hotel surrounding has multiple food chains and gas pumps.

Comfy beds. Windows actually open to the outside easily. Air conditioner quiet. Love the mahogany furniture. Attractive pool & spa area in courtyard. Highly recommend. No long waits for the elevator. Stairs easily accessible. Free parking!!!

We stayed here for a family wedding.  When I walked into the lobby I had the sense of staying in a higher grade hotel.  The lobby was clean and tidy and even though we arrived really late in the evening the staff was friendly and helpful.  Completely exhausted  we arrived to our room and loved the clean atmosphere the moment we walked in.  The bed was something straight out of heaven.  My husband and I just bought a temperpedic bed for home and he kept insisting that we were going to take the bed in the hotel room home with us.  It was so comfortable.  Free Wifi and the kids loved the pool.  Very family friendly.  Will definitly be staying there again.

Front desk staff couldn't of been nicer.  Very warm and helpful.  Cleaning staff helpful as well when we needed their assistance.  Very clean beautiful room.  Nice dinning room for breakfast with beautiful outdoor area with fountain.

Beautiful hotel and comfortable stay. This hotel is pretty central to both Huntington beach, Newport and Laguna with a 15-20 minute drive in each direction. It is only 5 minutes from SNA airport which is convenient. I think this is a great  hotel especially for the price. It is well kept, extremely clean and has a very classy and relaxing air about it. The staff was friendly and there's a beautiful courtyard and restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner. (Breakfast is not included with your stay). Parking is also free which is nice. The rooms are spacious, clean, comfortable and relaxing.  (However, if you are looking to be located in the heart of a beach or cute shopping village within walking distance I wouldn't exactly recommend this, everything is a bit of a drive.)

Summary Heading: Nice stay and the price was great!
Summary: We travelled here for business AND pleasure - our goddaughter got married.  We were a bit apprehensive when we checked in and were told to go to a separate building, but the building was nice - our room was great!  We only wished that breakfast had been served in that building.

This place is a solid choice in the area. The rooms are spacious, and the beds are comfy.  We had a conference at the Westin, and the shuttle drivers got us back/forth easily.   The check in process was a bit clunky, and there is noise from the airport, but either I fell asleep or it cut out later in the evening (prob both). Some of the rooms are a bit hard to find the first time, but once you know where you're going, your set.   Parking is free (big plus!), wifi is included and it works well.

Thoroughly enjoyed my visit here.  Rooms were very nice, comfortable and clean.  Getting ready was a breeze because there was 2 counter/mirror/sink areas.   Although we were there for business this hotel gave us the vibe of being on vacation.  The pool is lovely.  It rained during our stay so we enjoyed the hot tub instead.  Parking was very convenient.  Staff friendly and helpful.  Checking in and out was very quick and easy.

Beautiful property with several enclosed courtyards and two pools.  Rooms were large and well maintained; our King room was very large with comfortable couch and nice desk.  Separate bar sink & refrigerator outside bathroom was very convenient for coffee and snacks.  Housekeeping was excellent; all staff members we interacted with were friendly, professional, and welcoming.  Hotel is 5 minutes from SNA airport.  Can be quite noisy when sitting outside (like dining in the courtyard) but sound insulation in rooms is excellent and plane noise not a problem with windows closed.

Lovely boutique hotel. From the moment of arrival to departure customer service is exemplary! Every need and concern was catered to in a professional and friendly manner. The entire staff was lovely from the service at reception to the dining for breakfast at Le Chateau and housekeeping. I even had an incident in the parking lot with my rental and the manager Jeff completed the necessary incident report to take to my rental agency (turned out it wasn't needed but the support was greatly appreciated). Loved the room! My two sisters and I had a fantastic birthday weekend and couldn't have chosen a better place to stay in the Newport Beach/Laguna Beach area. The bed was so comfortable and the room had everything we needed for a relaxing respite from the day's activities. My brother

We chose this hotel for location and the reviews considered it a great stay.  I wondered what the other reviews saw? The carpets smelled, the elevator had some air freshner to cover the smell like that in car washes.  The hotel is in the flight pattern for Orange County Airport so you could hear flights taking off especially starting at 6:30 a.m. The old fashion airconditioning blew noisily. And I was full of congestion from the mold. The housekeepers had not cleaned the room at 3:30 one day so we went without.

This was a very beautiful and comfortable hotel.  Our large room was decorated beautifully with a comfortable couch, table and chairs, refrigerator, microwave and oversize king bed.  The hotel is right across the street from the John Wayne airport and the airplanes fly right over you.  I was expecting for it to be loud, but I never once woke up to the sound of a plane.  We went down to the bar for a glass of wine before going to dinner.  Nice, cozy bar.  The bartender was very hard to understand and not real attentive.  Didn't eat at the restaurant but there were several patrons in the bar eating............the food looked very good.  Check in and check out were handled efficiently.  Beautiful lobbies with beautiful furnishings and fireplaces, which were nice since it was

We stayed here for two nights on vacation because we thought it was a good central location to visit all the beach cities and we thought it was lovely. Very friendly at reception. Very nicely decorated. Our room was upgraded and we had a cute little fireplace and view of the courtyard. It was very clean. We ate in the courtyard restaurant and weren't expecting too much, but it was delicious and kept us full most of the day. I would definitely go back to any of Ayers locations.

Summary Heading: Great Option for Anaheim and Newport Vacation
Summary: This hotel is in perfect location to easily access Newport Beach and Anaheim.  It was great for our family vacation.  We were able to stay at a nice hotel for the same price as a dump in Newport and we were able to get to Disneyland quickly.  We loved the room and the hot tub and pool area is fantastic.  We will definitely stay here again.

This hotel was very good, there where four couples in my group and each room was great for our 3 days. The hotel was also close to travel to the Newport Jazz Festival that was held during the end of May. It also hard transportation to the concert if u didn't want to drive. The restaurant on site was convenient and ok.

Summary Heading: Had a wonderful and peaceful time.
Summary: Excellent room, excellent pool, excellent service....No complaints! I was there on business but my older children came with me. So they were very well taken care of and I felt comfortable going off to training. Thank you for a great and peaceful stay!

I recently stayed at this hotel for a wedding nearby. It is right next to a Shell Gas Station then you turn right in. The architecture and landscaping is very nice. You can tell this place is cared for.   The lobby counter was very tall for my shorter friend, but it lends to the high ceilings and antique décor.   The room was clean, had a sink outside the restroom so you do not have to drink "bathroom coffee" as my friends have called it.   The beds were great, clean, and overall I wish I could have stayed longer. Outside the room (303) was a pretty patio area that I believe belongs to a restaurant. I wish I had time to eat there!   They offer a breakfast until 10am for $12.99 which sounds lovely. They were great accommodating me when I took a room key and parking pass for my

Relax, get room service, take off your shoes.  The Ayres is a great place to get comfortable.  Restaurant on premises is what you would expect of hotel food.  This is a great location with lots of dinning options close by so go try something new if you have the energy after a long day or just sit back in the new hot tub.

Summary Heading: VERY NICE HOTEL IN COSTA MESA, CALIFORNIA
Summary: The Ayres Hotel and Suites is located  just East of downtown Newport Beach, California. It is only about a 10 minute drive to The Pacific Coast Highway. The rooms are nicely furnished and large enough to be comfortable. The rates are very reasonable for the area. Breakfast is not included but there is a buffet breakfast available for $10.00 per person. Also there are tons of places to eat along The Pacific Coast Highway, on Balboa Island or The Peninsula. Free parking is available right next to the building.

Summary Heading: Converted Country Inn & Suites with Boutique Touch!
Summary: Being a loyal Starwood guest, I was tempted to book the Westin in Costa Mesa.  But, when I had a nice coupon on Expedia and saw that Ayres was a VIP hotel, I took the chance and booked it!  Not only did I get a great rate but upon check-in we were upgraded to an executive suite!  We couldn't have asked for a nicer room on our last night in California.  The Executive suite had a separate sleeping area with king size bed and TV.  The main area had a nice mini bar, leather couch, TV and the bathroom had a jetted tub!  We didn't have time to take advantage of all the great touches this hotel has but it looked amazing.  The décor around the hotel gave it a nice European feel and they have two outdoor pools.  We chose the main pool over the suite pool because there wasn't anyone there

This is a well-located hotel if you have destinations in the Newport Beach-Costa Mesa - Santa Ana area. Rooms an be a bit dated, but are clean and comfortable. You won't be hit with those annoying and expensive surcharges for Internet and parking. For that reason alone, this has been my hotel of choice on my last two trips to Orange County. I will definitely choose it again next time.

Summary Heading: overnight stay for evening in Laguna
Summary: Wonderful place to stay. We stayed there after a night in Laguna at Pageant of the Masters. Comfortable beds, great amenities. Side note special note: odd circumstances but special anniversary earrings accidentally down the drain. Let front desk know. Within minutes someone was there in minutes. Earrings recovered special weekend saved. Thank you so much. This was our second "pageant" stay. Can't wait till next year.

This hotel is very clean.  You can tell that they emphasize this throughout the facility.   The check in process could be streamlined  and there is only one elevator to the rooms which is slow.  I figured out the stairs rather quickly as I am very impatient.    If you have any sensitivities to noise ask for a room facing away from the airport runway or you will awake to jet airplanes blasting out of John Wayne at full throttle. The hotel is very close to the departure end of the runway.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, centrally located to everything
Summary: This is a wonderful hotel except for a few things, none of which Ayers can do anything about.   First, the bad: One, it's a pain to exit the hotel on Bristol.  You cannot go west, so you have to loop around.  Not a major pain, just an annoyance.   Two, It's right on the landing path for John Wayne Airport.  You'll have to get used to planes flying over head every 3-10 minutes.  Living near O'Hare growing up, this didn't bother us, but it may bother you.  On the other hand, this good: Staff was some of the friendliest I have ever met.  Front desk, housekeeping, restaurant, everyone was outstanding.  The GM runs a great ship over there.  Rooms were clean, relatively quiet, pool is nice, just a great reasonably priced place in the middle of multi-milllion dollar homes. in newport /

Summary Heading: Week of business in southern california
Summary: I had a week where my primary meeting was in Irvine but other meetings ranged from Torrence to San Diego.  I had one day where I was going to work from the hotel.  I had a room with patio.  This was delightful on the day I was working from the room.  The rooms are nice with plenty of room and the common areas are very nice.  The employees are friendly and helpful.  I was on a ground floor and could hear the people walking around above me but it was not too bad.  I tried the buffet breakfast one morning was disappointed with it and went outside to eat the other days.  There are a lot of restaurants very close to the hotel. Ordering from the menu is the way I would probably go in the future.  This is the second Ayers hotel I have stayed in Orange County and have found them to be

It was a great relax full stay. If I'm ever in orange county we will stay again. It was a great location to dent king. Great shuttle transportation also. Breakfast was great . Enjoyed the pools an view from terace.

Summary Heading: Drinks and food make it shine
Summary: Here on business and have to say I will be back for this one. The embassy suites cocktail hour is always nice but this place had a great bar and food was above average for hotel food. Service was good and room was clean.

Overall, we reallyenjoyed our stat, as it was very quite, peaceful, and the beds were extremeley comfortable!  However; we found it is not very "walker" friendly!  I  must use my walmker because of medical issues that cause me to fall extremely easy.  Our room was4k at the rear of the hotel, of which normally  nmot a problem.  However, because the hallway also included some areas that also went outside, the d2oors appeare to have been  removed.  But they did mot  remove the bottom jamb,. This iis wgat caight the front wheels of my walker every ti me I came up to one,  so I would have to pi ck upp the walker tko get by them.  This ggreatly iincrseasd my chances of falling!

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a week about two weeks ago.  We were ready to leave by the end.  While the staff was super nice and friendly, the accommodations left much to be desired.  We paid for the breakfast.  It wasn't worth it.  We upgraded to the junior suite which came with a mini bar area, a fridge, and a microwave.  The floor in our room was uneven.  It was about 3 degrees elevated on one end than on the other end.  The dark red carpet was stained in multiple spots (which I find kind of disgusting).  You can definitely hear the planes flying by.  And the shuttle that takes you to the beach still requires a good half hour walk from the drop off location.  As other guests have said, the shuttle service prioritizes pick-ups and drop-offs to/from the airport
Manager Response: Dear joysauce83,  Thank you kindly for your candid review regarding your most recent experience at our hotel. Please accept our deepest apologies for your stay being anything less than exceptional. Although we are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our level of guest service, we regret to hear that our accommodations were sub-par. We would like to kindly encourage you to give us another chance to provide you with both excellent customer service and room accommodations.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: A Memorable Banquet, that was diabetic-friendly
Summary: As a former Chef who was also a Faculty Helper for hands-on training for The Small World Initiative for Antibiotic Discovery in June 2015, we had our Banquet at the Ayres Hotel, which was conveniently close to National University, which was the Host School.  I got the impression our food was prepared elsewhere or perhaps catered by an outside firm, but that's just an incidental observation of mine.  Whichever was the case, it was excellent, with juicy roast chicken cooked perfectly (the stuffing was seasoned right, although I could have no more than a taste).  The vegetables were also cooked and seasoned correctly (which is harder to find than it should be).  They had some perfectly ripe fruit afterwards, which this diabetic really appreciated.  The only difficulty was the

I have been coming here for the past 10 years. Although the prices have gone up I was still okay with that because I figured they had to account for the prices of the free breakfast that I enjoy the convenience of. However that all changed this year July 2015. I was first told this when my wife walked in from going to get breakfast and informed me that breakfast was no longer free. I was disappointed because this was the main reason why I've been coming here so long. Now that the prices are comparable to other hotels in the area and there is no advantage either I will have to start looking at other hotels. I guess I wouldn't mind paying for breakfast but the breakfast is buffet style and over priced ($13) for the powdered eggs and greasy bacon. Maybe if they had a cook to order
Manager Response: Dear flashking,  Thank you kindly for the candid feedback you have provided based on your most recent experience at our hotel. Your loyalty to our hotel is greatly appreciate. We deeply regret to hear that your most recent stay was anything less than exceptional. We cannot express how sorry we are for failing to inform you of the breakfast charge we implemented last year. It certainly is understandable that you were disappointed to arrive at our hotel and find out that we no longer offer that as a complimentary amenity. It is vital feedback like yours that allows us to make improvements where need be. We thank you profoundly for you insight.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We loved our Ayres Hotel & Suite in Costa Mesa overnight stay before going to a financial seminar at the Balboa Bay Club.  It was a delightful surprise to find such an elegant, but welcoming staff and hotel.  The Outdoor plaza with fountain with New Orleans  style chairs and tables for a glass of wine was so relaxing and reminded us of New Orleans or Europe.  Ayres Hotel here in Costa Mesa has a European  feel to it.  We often come to the Newporl Beach area from our home in Las Vegas, and this will be our new place to stay.  A definite winner for sure.  Plus they have a restaurant on the premises but a great sushi restaurant just walking distance across the street.

The location is central to many venues in Orange County.  We have stayed at this hotel over half a dozen times.  This time however, we found that our breakfast was no longer included.  I wish the reservation person I spoke with had mentioned this new twist.  I have no problem paying for breakfast, but I clearly identified myself as a previous customer.  I was surprised when my husband ate breakfast at the hotel that they presented him with a bill.   The room was very nice, as usual.  The airport noise stops early (about 10:00 p.m.) and then it is silent.  The bed is comfortable and the bathroom is well appointed.  Overall, always a good value.

I have to say that although the hotel is beautiful, there is a lot that could improve. I'm going to have to start with the front desk, I overheard a customer say " You haven't look at me so you wouldn't know that my credit card and ID have been there for 5 minutes) this lady Gina was loud and rude. The gym doesn't open until 5:30am , so if you have somewhere to be by 7  or 8 for get about working out all day , as, the gym is pack in the afternoon and evening as it's extremely small. When I got to my room my tables were dirty, then I was "YAY, a jetted tub in my room", well not really, I started running the water and what do I see?! dead skin residue everywhere... "ALOT of it" I tried to clean it three times it didn't work. So needless to say,I didn't use it,  the cleaning is not

We really enjoyed our stay at the Ayres Costa Mesa Hotel. It was a very spacious, clean suite that fit the 3 of us really well. The down stairs sitting areas were convenient to relax and chat. Both buildings are decorated with marble and interesting wall art plus the history of the Ayres family. Although we didn't eat at the restaurant, it looked like a well ran place to eat and hang out. The staff were very friendly and helpful. As for the John Wayne Airport being close by, I seldom noticed the planes taking off when we had the a/c and fan running all the time. The area around the hotel is very safe and well maintained. We walked to Starbucks in the mornings which is just a block away. We also went to the area called the Camp to eat lunch which is located down the street. It is

Summary Heading: Great location to visit the area.
Summary: Close to highway and 2 major shopping malls. A nice room (junior suite) well equipped with extras like microwave, fridge and a sofa.  It totally met our needs. That said the décor felt a bit old and uninviting. Though it did not bother us as we are early risers, you can clearly hear jet planes taking off the airport close by starting it seems like 7am in weekday and 8am on weekend. We would still stay there again knowing the facts.

Summary Heading: A very nice place to stay
Summary: You can't tell from the parking lot just how nice this hotel is on the inside.  Don't let the very slow elevator and weird stairwells influence you either.  Get into the room and see how pretty it is, how spacious, and how very comfortable your bed is before you make a judgment.  The swimming pool and jacuzzi are excellent and well maintained.  The size of the room surprised me, as I had just stayed at the Anaheim Hilton for several days before arriving.  That hotel had us in a cramped 400+/- square foot space - the Ayres rooms are much larger and as nicely appointed.  In fact, there were conveniences such as phone charging station, a wet bar that did double duty as a second vanity, a fireplace!, a full sized fold out sofa bed, a writing desk and a real bureau, etc...    Things

The Ayers in Costa Mesa was a beautiful place to stay. The decor and feel of the hotel is very regal. The staff was super accommodating. When we showed up we were given a room that had a slight stink to it. Almost like someone smoked in it and they tried to cover the smell. They gladly and quickly gave us a new room. The new room we got was a little old. The way we could tell was the grout was coming out of tile work on the floor. But the stay was great and the people were wonderful. We weren't impressed by not getting the free breakfast like most Ayers offer. It was a full buffet though and the food was good. If you plan to eat breakfast there pay for it online when you book because it is $10 per person. If you buy it there it is $12.99 per person. I know I touched on the few

My boyfriend a I stayed here for a couple of nights. The patio was a great addition to have fresh air. Bed was comfortable too. European decor to the max! However, you get used to it. Only wish it wasn't under the flight path. Overall the stay was perfect and excellent customer service from the front desk to housekeeping.

Very clean and comfortable stay. Well sound-proofed so not much noise from other guests or road traffic which is hard to believe as it is very close to the local airport. We purchased the optional breakfast ahead of time and found it to be very worthwhile. It was cheaper to order it this way as well. Breakfast consisted of a hot and cold buffet. A very good stay. Parking is free

Summary Heading: Nice stay in a good hotel
Summary: perfect Home the rooms are spacious the staff is smiling and helpful pool and spa very well (in the shade from 16h) easy to reach restoration is correct and there are restorations around the hotel the weak point: the takeoff of aircraft from 8 am
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for the outstanding review you have written about our hotel. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and that we were able to create an environment that felt like home. hope to see you again very soon. Thank you again for taking the time so share some feedback. We hope to welcome you back again soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Comfortable Room - Not Happy with Shuttle Service Availability
Summary: For many years my Employer has required me to stay at this hotel (preferred rate) and recommend my customers stay here.  Good- My bed was comfortable and the noise levels (when a jet was not taking off from the airport across the street) were decent. The staff I interacted with were polite and professional.  Bad- My office is about 3.5 miles from the hotel. We often recommend customers stay at this hotel due to a decent price and a supposedly good shuttle service (within 5 miles). For an entire week I received complaints from my customers that they could not get a shuttle at the needed time. For example, our meetings ended at 4:30pm, the hotel told my customers they would need to wait until 6pm.  One of the days I forgot my rental car keys at the office and due to a lack of
Manager Response: Dear Eric B,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to share some feedback based on your most recent experience at our hotel. While we appreciate your loyalty and your business, we regret to hear that you had a less than favorable experience. Please accept our most sincere apologies for the scheduling conflicts you faced in regards to our shuttle services. We truly appreciate your honesty and your vital feedback as it allows us to make improvements where need be. We certainly hope that your experience does not deter you from returning to our hotel. We kindly urge you to give us another opportunity to provide the exceptional customer service we strive to provide each guest during each stay.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This is a great property and close to the airport. The pool area are nice and clean. The rooms are always nice. I didn't get to eat from the breakfast buffet.  Other Ayres properties I've stayed at have had nice buffets. They've always been included with the price but you need to pay extra at this property. I had the Monte Cristo sandwich with truffle fries for dinner that was responsibly priced and the best tasting I've ever had. It was noisy outside because of the planes, but the beautiful courtyard was serene so it didn't matter what was going on overhead.

Summary Heading: Nice stay in a good hotel
Summary: Excellent hotel. Large rooms, very clean,beautiful landscspe and architechtal building,frindly people ,near to airport very good price and much much more... We stayed there 2 nights and we had one of our best sleep out of home.  Thank you all hotel personel! Thank you.

Stayed at this Hotel last May/June 2014 and was very impressed. I stayed in room 285 - it was the best hotel I stayed in during my 2014 California trip and the common rooms, pool area and breakfast room were above expectations. As my room was near the laundry I found this location very convenient ( I couldn't hear the machines, but close enough to go back and forth, instead of waiting around). My only feedback was on the included breakfast - which was very good - but I did not take any money for tips the first morning as I did not realise I should.  Whilst there is not a lot of dinner options within walking distance I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

What a well decorated hotel with very nice staff. We arrived on a Thursday for business for my hysband and was greeted with an upgrade which is always nice. We asked about transport to event he was working at and was  told to sign up. As there were many people booked into hotel for the event ( all being paid for by owner) we decided to just drive ourselves. Anyway we had a suite in the building next door,we had no trouble finding room, very spacious nicely done on 2 and floor. We had met our friends in the patio of main building for a cocktail, I couldn't figure out the odd smell that seemed to be in a few areas. Anyway we had complimentary breakfast every morning which was just OK but did enjoy our dinners for 2 of the evenings, again very friendly staff. The planes did not
Manager Response: Dear Trish A A,  Thank you kindly for the feedback you have provided based on your most recent stay at our hotel. We truly appreciate the kind words you have shared in regards to the decor of our hotel and our friendly team members. We are thrilled to see that you enjoyed your stay, however, we regret to read about the troubles you faced upon check out. We genuinely hope that this isolated incident does not keep you from returning to our hotel. Thank you again for your review and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I'm flight crew so I stay in plenty of hotels. This hotel has the worst breakfast and to top it off they want $14 after tax for it. I frequent the John Wayne airport and for the price of the room, I'd suggest breakfast be included in the rate. The rooms are pretty nice as are the beds. They don't seem to have clean rooms before the 3pm check-in time which in my case is a problem for my required rest period. If I was going to have the pay the same price again for breakfast I wouldn't stay here. Nearby Radisson has a much better breakfast or I would stay at an Embassy Suites or the like. The only breakfast option here is buffet style and nothing else. A Hampton Inn or similar will have a better breakfast and its included at no extra charge. The hotel is just past the departure end

The hotel was a clean, quiet place to stay. I needed a shuttle to Mass on the weekend and to the airport. The hotel was very willing to give me a ride - both drivers were pleasant.  I ate breakfast in the restaurant one morning - the food was fabulous! I will be returning to the area and would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Sue I,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay at Ayres Hotel and Suites Costa Mesa! We are thrilled to hear that we were able to provide the exceptional customer service we strive to provide each of our guests with during every visit. Thank you so much for the kind words you have shared and for the feedback you have provided us with. We hope to welcome you back again soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I cant say enough about this place. it is now a couple of months since i last visited this hotel, but I cant help but remember how great this place is and how good its people are. Gina, Cecilia, Kim, and Sadi at the front desk are angels. Its close to the JW airport and close to highways. But I keep coming back to the people - the owners and the staff. I have never seen the owners at any other property take a personal interest in the properties as well as their staff, and I have never seen staff that is so focused on excellent quality of service and that cares about its owners (obviously the goodwill goes both ways!)  This is my stop for any future visit the the area.

After my terrible experience at Hilton Irvine/Orange County Airport (lost stuff in the room), I switched to Ayres hotel. I stayed there in total for 3 weeks from Feb to April 2015. I really liked this hotel. It is a nicely decorated; especially in the Suite building, the lobby is really beautiful. The room is spacious. There are plenty of parking places for visitors. The breakfast is just the same as other hotels, nothing special, but not that expensive either. Staffs are friendly. I did not have any trouble during my stay. In general, I felt very comfortable staying in this hotel. I also recommended it to my colleagues who traveled to Irvine for work; most of them switched to this hotel as well.
Manager Response: Dear PoneL,  Thank you so much for taking the time to share a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent stay at Ayres Hotel and Suites Costa Mesa. We regret to hear about the awful experience you had at the Hilton, however, are thrilled to see that we were able to turn things around for you! Thank you kindly for your recommendation and for the compliments regarding our ambiance and world-class team members. Your valuable feedback is greatly appreciated and we genuinely hope to welcome you back again soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice location - handy to John Wayne airport...no longer free breakfast included in all rates
Summary: I have stayed here at least 4 times...in the past breakfast was always included.   This time there was a charge...$10 for buffet.  Still a decent deal but surprised at the change.  I was in the adjacent building...took me forever to find as I had always been in the main building so did not even think to ask for directions.  The rooms are good and the housekeeping is good.  I prefer the main building.  Getting in a out of the parking lot is tricky as it requires a long turnaround if you want to head in the opposite direction.  Front desk staff is nice...we have a person in our party that had accidentally booked the wrong nights and I think they settled that all up.

Had a Priceline reservation for Saturday, May 30, 2015. Got there in early pm, room not ready, so gave info and left. Came back later to check in. Had requested top floor, quiet room. There was some child convention there with inattentive adults not supervising. We were put on the second floor, by the pool, which was supposed to close at 10pm. It didn't.  I had told the front desk that I was returning a rental car to SNA & would be at the pickup at 930pm. I called from there at 926 pm and there was no record of my request - 20 minutes for pick up. I had requested an airport shuttle at 8am next morning. When we got there at 745am, there was no record.  But the WORST part was not being able to sleep. When I returned from the airport that evening, my wife said she had called
