Manager Response: Dear TiggerLarry,  Thank you for taking the time to offer some insight on your most recent experience at our hotel. Please accept our most sincere apologies for the the inconveniences your were dealt during your stay. We would greatly appreciate the opportunity to welcome you back in order to offer the exceptional guest service we are know for. Thank you again for your candid review.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed in one of the junior suites for our anniversary. The room was nice, the jetted tub was amazing and the breakfast buffet was a good deal. There were even strawberries and champagne with a nice Happy Anniversary note when we got to our room.  When we made our reservation, the price of the buffet was $10 but by the time we arrived the price had gone up to $12.99. When I mentioned the difference in price, the agent at the front desk was more than happy to adjust the rate for us. The only draw back was that we could hear the pipes whenever someone in one of the adjoining rooms was running water. It was quite loud really and depending on how long someone wanted to shower, it could drag on for what seemed like forever.

We drove from Ventura Co. to set up our Clan booth for the annual Scottish Fest at the Orange Co. Fairgrounds the Friday of Memorial weekend and needed an early check so we could return to attend a sports banquet for our daughter and come back the same night. The staff couldn't make this decision but after speaking with the manager and explaining our situation she was very helpful in allowing us a 12 noon check-in.

Summary Heading: I found this a very pleasent expenice and would recommend  this hotel.
Summary: I stayed on this hotel because my nephew was getting married and this is where his family had blocked some rooms.   I found that they did a nice spread for the breakfast buffet.  I ate lunch there one day and had a sandwich and some coleslaw.  I like the coleslaw (I think that it was homemade), and it had a nice kick to it.  It cost me around $14 for my lunch.
Manager Response: Dear Biff1964,  Thank you for taking the time to write a great review about our hotel! It is delightful to read that you enjoyed your stay and had the opportunity to indulge in some of the decadent dishes that Le Chateau has to offer. Thank you again for the feedback you have provided with us and we hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Not what I was use to
Summary: Stayed at the Ayres for about 1 month week after week for work and that was the main reason I choose the hotel for a one night stay. The service is good at the front desk the room are good a bit small but clean. The problem I encounter was many of the amenities they previously had offer are now gone fresh baked cookies at check no more, complimentary breakfast no more, no complimentary water bottles in the room. If I didn't have this amenities before I think I would have been ok. But many of the reason I booked this hotel was because of this amenities and I can swallow paying over $150 and nothing included.
Manager Response: Dear latinos28,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to share a review informing fellow TripAdvisor travelers of your experience at our hotel. It is true that we no longer offer a complimentary breakfast, however, we have made some upgrades to the breakfast. It is available at a nominal fee of $12.99. We are truly sorry for any inconveniences these newly-implemented policies may have caused you and yours. We genuinely hope that this does not deter from returning to our hotel or any of the other locations in our collection. We genuincely wish to keep providing the exceptional customer service to you that we always have. Thank you again for your review and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Stayed on business and was very impressed with the beautiful room at a very reasonable price.    Van service to KSNA is very helpful as was the abundance of Uber rides hovering just minutes away.   Great choice! Considering the extremely pricey nature of the area.   It would make a great vacation Hotel for Disney trips.

Summary Heading: Clean comfortable room, friendly staff, great location
Summary: We almost always stay at the Ayres Hotel when visiting our son at UC-Irvine. The location really can't be beat - close to UCI and the Orange County airport. The staff is always friendly. The restaurant, Le Chateau, has unexpectedly high quality dinner and appetizers. Alas, the breakfast buffet is no longer free (now $10).  The reason for the four dot rating is that the hotel is directly under the airport flight path. So if you're the type that is bothered by noise, this hotel probably isn't for you. But the noise doesn't bother us. We've been very happy with the staff, restaurant, and rooms.

Summary Heading: Great palce to stay on business
Summary: Nice rooms with king size bed, very comfortable. Tub is jetted when it has been a long day. Close to everything and easy to get around. Good local restaurants. Staff is very helpful and left extra coffee in the room on request. Nice work desk and comfortable couch. Clean and redone real well.  Heated pool with a spa.

Hotel was older but very clean. be advised of the shuttle service. It is on a first come, first serve basis. If you are attending an event like we were, you may be out of luck with a shuttle service to and from. We didn't have a ride the first day of our event and had to walk. Thankfully the rain held out for us.
Manager Response: Dear Cojack80,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a review letting fellow TripAdvisor travelers know how your recent experience at our hotel was. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay along with the cleanliness of our property. Please accept our most sincere apologies for any issues you may have encountered regarding our shuttle services. Thank you again for your feedback and we sure hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: As expected rooms are well appointed.  This hotel is located and the end of the John Wayne Airport runway so if noise is a problem I would suggest earplugs.  Airlines do have a curfew so they are not flying until 7am.  My only complaint would be the plumbing noise in the room.  We could hear water running quite loud, but it could have been the location of the room.  Very close to South Coast Plaza and World Class shopping.  There is an award winning restaurant on premises and I happen to know that a lot of the local insiders have lunch here on a regular basis.  We stayed two nights and our breakfast was hot and very good.  Service was very attentive.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

We booked from the OC Marathon website, and we had a large, spacious room at the back of the building which was nice and quiet.  The bed was nice and comfortable and the shower was great.  One of the front desk staff helped me out with directions to the get to the marathon finish; with all of the road closures, that was invaluable information. My only regret is that we didn't stay a couple of nights!

Summary Heading: Just don't eat the breakfast buffet
Summary: We had several of us staying here for my son's wedding.  Great beds, showers, quiet rooms.  We loved sitting by the pool and the pretty garden area.  However, the breakfast buffet was cold and yukky.  We were down there for an hour and a half and never saw them add food.  So whatever they put in there at the beginning will still be there!  NOTHING was warm - eggs, bacon, potatoes, oatmeal.  So - stay there, but skip the breakfast!
Manager Response: Dear StaciMcFlo,  Thank you kindly for writing a review on TripAdvisor to let fellow travelers know about your recent experience at our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay, however we regret to hear about your unpleasant experience during breakfast. Rest assured that we will implement the necessary training to avoid this issue in the future. Thank you again for your informative review and we hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Services was excellent all around. The front desk answered all questions and the shuttle drivers were top notch. The pool and hot tub are well maintained and the restaurant served good food. Great service and excellent atmosphere.
Manager Response: Dear Chris A,  Thank you so very much for taking the time to write a review informing others about your recent stay with us. We are delighted to read that you enjoyed the quality of our service and courtesy of our team members. Thank you again for your review and hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Had a great stay at this hotel, it provided a shuttle to and from my OC race this weekend. Will be staying here again for next years race! The hotel was clean, the staff was nice. I basically don't have any complaints
Manager Response: Dear Odulia,  Thank you for the wonderful review you have written about our hotel regarding your most recent visit! We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay! Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My wedding party and I stayed at this hotel over the weekend and everyone had a great stay!  The front desk and the rest of the staff were very friendly and accommodating.  Our rooms were comfortable and well maintained, and the rest of the property including the pool area and courtyard were great to relax in!  My guests and I were able to use the free shuttle service which was also convenient.
Manager Response: Dear Valerie L,  We are very grateful for the great review you have written regarding your recent stay at Ayres Hotel and Suites Costa Mesa. Thank you kindly for the wonderful opportunity you have given us to impress you.Your kind words in regards to our amazing team members and their services are greatly appreciated. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: What a wonderful experience and stay we just had at the Ayres for the OC Marathon weekend! The hotel had shuttle service for runners and spectators to and from the race. They also accommodated our service dog with professionalism. Staff were friendly, helpful and upbeat. Our room was clean, spacious and the beds oh so comfy. On top of this the price was great, and they did not require a two night minimum, which many of the surrounding hotels did for this same time period. We'll be back!!
Manager Response: Dear Sandyw248,  Thank you for taking the time to write a great review in regards to your recent stay at Ayres Hotel and Suites Costa Mesa! We are thrilled that you enjoyed your stay and had a wonderful experience. Your kind words in regards to our culture of caring and providing exceptional guest service are greatly appreciated. Once again, we appreciate the time you took to write a review and we cannot wait to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Very nice hotel for the runner. Mini bar and fridge in room was perfect. Quiet. Nice staff. Clean, quiet rooms. I ran to the start of the half marathon at Fashion Island (4 miles)with no problem and then back to the hotel from the the finish (1.5 miles) with no problem. My only complaint is the confusing floor plan with limited signs to get you where you need to be. The maids couldn't even tell me how to get to the lobby when I was trying to get there at checkout, but that is my only complaint. Good hotel.

Summary Heading: NOT RECOMMENDED for the OC Marathon.
Summary: They will not accommodate a late check-out request (you will be charged $30 for just 1/2 hr later).  Room was dated with worn carpet and a terrible sofa sleeper (no roll-away beds available). Two stars because the restaurant/kitchen staff were super friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Irunhalfmarathons,  It is understandable that you are upset after your unpleasant experience during your stay at our hotel. Please accept our most sincere apologies. We regret to read that our accommodations were not up to par with your needs. Unfortunately our rooms are not large enough to accommodate rollaway beds, due to Fire Safety Code. For the safety of our guests, we do not make them available. Unfortunately, during high occupancy dates, it is impossible to accommodate every guests' requests for a late check-out. For this reason, we implement a fee for those who do want that additional feature (based upon availability, of course). Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience our policy may have caused you. Thank you again for your review and the kind compliments regarding our team members.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The stay was average. The room was clean, a little outdated in style, but overall an average room.  The elevator was broken during my stay, so it was a bit of an inconvenience carrying luggage up and down the stairs. Lastly, I was a bit surprised the stay didn't come with a complimentary breakfast given the room cost.
Manager Response: Dear Kristen K,  We are absolutely grateful that you took the time to write a review informing others about your recent stay at our hotel. It saddens us to read that your stay was anything less than exceptional and, though our European-inspired decor is not for everyone, we kindly encourage you to stick around as renovations are in the works before this years end. We are terribly sorry for any inconveniences the inoperable elevator may have caused you, however, we genuinely hope this isolated incident does not keep you from returning in the future. Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I am perplexed because parts of this hotel are very nice, but overall very disappointed.   This property is located very close to Santa Ana / John Wayne airport, with yes, the jets flying over quite often. You do hear them, so be warned.  A lot of Corporate housing at this hotel, as well as airline crew. The lobby is clean...and furnished Old European? Shabby Chic? Can't figure out the theme, if there is one. Photos of historical Newport Beach line the walls, which are very interesting, but  the French furniture...I just don't get it. Business center in the Lobby area...Cookies in the afternoon add a nice touch.  And the most unfriendly front desk staff I have ever met. I don't get it. If you don't like what you are doing, get another job. People come to the front desk
Manager Response: Dear SandyJones43,  Thank you for taking the time to share some feedback regarding your most recent stay with us. While we genuinely wish you had a better experience at our hotel, it is feedback like yours that we learn from and use to improvements where necessary. We are sincerely sorry to hear that your stay was anything less than exceptional; a disappointment even. Because of our proximity to John Wayne Airport, there is some airplane noise, but never earlier than 7 AM or later than 9 PM due to noise restrictions the airport MUST adhere to. Fortunately, we do encourage our guests to request rooms towards the back of the hotel for a quieter experience. We work diligently to deliver an exceptional guest experience and it is apparent in this isolated case that our team members fell short. Once again, the vital feedback you have provided is greatly appreciated and we hope that all of your future accommodations are comfortable and satisfying.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I still am not sure what to think of this place.  Very different.  Somewhat Gothic. I felt sometimes like I was at the Haunted Mansion at Disneyland!  The elevator was broken, so we had to walk all the way to the back of the hotel, which yes, is a long was, up the back elevator and then all the way back to the front of the hotel.  Me (woman) and my 17 year old daughter.  There was a stairwell we could take, but we had luggage.  I was very surprise no one offered to help with our bags!  The room was large and clean.  Maid service arrived everyday but usually late in the day.  Not that it was a bad place, it felt safe and clean, just very odd.  I can't decide if I like it or not still.  We had breakfast buffet, it was good, but not part of the room fee, which I had read from other

This is a really nice hotel.  I love all of the art decor, table and chairs in the hallway, wood panels in the elevator.  There are ceiling fans in the rooms, granite counters, and a marble round table.  I really like the free breakfast, eggs, hash browns, bacon, sausages, ect... The happy hour free wine and food.    Nice job guys!!

Summary Heading: The night employees almost ruined our anniversary
Summary: I should start by saying that the hotel is beautiful. I wish I could have explored the patio, restaurant and the pool area but I was too busy dealing with some pretty incompetent staff. Upon arriving and being checked in by Carl (the evening manager I believe) I attempted to make small talk and mentioned that my husband and I were staying over night to celebrate our anniversary and his birthday the next day. He just typed away and barely even acknowledged me, stopping only long enough to ask me if we needed a parking pass and telling me where the best place to park would be before he sent me on my way. After getting lost (The room numbers don't always go in order... what's up with that?) We finally found our room and went inside - ready to hang out by the faux fireplace in the

This place is nice. Took me 2 seconds to find out that the curtains are hooked on the corner. Which prevents you from fully sliding out the curtains to block the light. I unhooked them and there was no problem. Hot tub is nice. Floors are bit dingy so bring slippers. And shower shoes are always a good idea when traveling.  I got the king suite on 3rd floor. Fold out couch was comfortable enough.  And bed was nice and cozy. Breakfast was good Nothing fancy. Nice microwave and mini fridge.  Two TV that worked well. On negative side, the layout of the hotels floor plan was confusing.  Needed more signs to better direct guest to pool, restaurant and elevator. In future I would come again but request 1st or 2nd floor room suite.

As an airline employee I live in hotels. This is one of the best places we stay nationwide.  Everything is impeccably clean, the staff is extremely friendly and professional.  The breakfast buffet is outstanding, the hotel van from SNA is always on time, I could go on.  Right down to the outstanding art in the hallways. I have never had a bad experience at this or the other AYRES we stay at in LA.  You should book this place.

Check-in was easy, Hotel is laid out nicely, very upscale. Restaurant was very good and service was top notch. My son had a migraine after coming back from a local Expo and the front desk staff called around to find the closest store with Excedrin Migraine! Way to go Ayers!
Manager Response: Dear Steve D,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review about our hotel as well as your recent stay with us! We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that the check-in process was smooth. It is a pleasure to read that you received exceptional guest service both at the hotel and at our onsite restaurant. We constantly strive to exceed our guests' needs and it is always a pleasure to go above and beyond to do just that. Thank you for your review and we cannot wait to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Staff was extremely helpful and friendly, the property and décor are beautiful, and the enclosed patio reminds me of a hotel terrace you'd find in Europe. The stay was peaceful, and I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.
Manager Response: Dear Delaney L,  Thank you for your review of our hotel. We are thrilled to read that you enjoyed your stay and that our team was able to provide the exceptional customer service you deserve. Your kind compliments concerning our friendly and helpful team members are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Not the value it once was
Summary: We have been guests at the Costa Mesa Ayres Hotel & Suites for many years.  Last year we chose to stay the hotel for a couple of weeks while helping our children after the birth of our fourth grandchild.  We just returned and were quite disappointed with our stay. The Ayres we had come to know was a terrific value.  When you arrived you were give tickets for a drink in the bar on weekdays, a wonderful breakfast and free parking, plus, most importantly a highly competitive rate.  Today's rates are less competitive.  The free drink went away a couple of years ago.  To our surprise, so did the free breakfast this year.  The breakfast buffet is quite a spread and certainly worth the $10 price -- if you are a big breakfast eater.  I was more surprised to be told that if I got up
Manager Response: Dear Bill166,  Thank you for taking the time to share some feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We regret to read that your return to our hotel was not up to par with your previous stay. Nevertheless, we wish you had a better experience with us upon this most recent visit. The vital feedback you have provided us with will assist us in making improvements where needed. This is vastly important for our present and future guests. Please accept our most sincere apologies for our breakfast policy. We kindly encourage you to give us another chance to earn back your trust.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: A very safe and comfortable stay.
Summary: The hotel rooms were clean and the bed was wonderful.  I stayed at the Ayres for 7 days and enjoyed the wonderful restaurant which was efficient, had great customer care and a very accommodating menu.  Oh, I don't want to forget the warm cookies in the lobby every evening.  Even though I was there on business, I did take advantage of driving to Newport Beach Balboa Pier one afternoon.  Loved the community, the quaint bungalows with the mix of new homes.  Loved it!

Nice room with a very comfortable bed and nice linens. The front desk staff are wonderful and very helpful. Thay offer a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel which was a huge help. The hotel bar staff was helpful and friendly in getting me an order to go. The WiFi  was okay. I did have an unfortunate breakfast finding a hair in my potatoes.....Yuck!!!!

I've stayed at the Ayres before. When our company was sold, we switched to another hotel. I stayed there a few times, and decided I just didn't like it, so came back to the Ayres. Food is better, service is great. Many employees have been there a LONG time. I do miss the tapestries in the lobby, though. They keep it updated, maid service was good. One of my pet peeves is when housekeeping doesn't fully refill the in room coffee service. No such problem at the Ayres--it was correct EVERY DAY.

It had been years since I'd stayed here so it was nice to return. The room had everything you could want, was nice and clean and had a nice whirlpool tub. When I first checked in I was reminded of the airport noise and being on the top floor, I was getting reluctant. Fortunately, the flights stop in the evening leading to a super quiet sleep. The location of the hotel is great as you're close to tons of attractions. Free parking not far from your entrance door. We were very comfortable and will return.

Stay a week in this fantastic hotel is an unforgotten memory. Every day after business one thing that i love is stay in the room, the service, all the staff are very helpful and the place are very fantastic.

The best of many Newport Beach hotels we have stayed in.Spacious rooms,,nice hot hot tub,and superb attention from all the staff.We needed a foot stool to get into the bath and they rushed out and bought one from a medical supply house within the hour.Free cookies at tea-time,local free shuttle,no resort fee or parking charge,the managers door is always open. We won't be staying anywhere else next time

The staff at this Hotel could not have been more accomodating!  Everything we requested was instantly taken care of.  The cleanliness along with the beautiful surroundings made our stay perfect.  Thank You!
Manager Response: Dear David M,  It was a pleasure to have you as our guests and we are ecstatic that you felt our team members were accommodating. We encourage our team members to go above and beyond to meet our guests' needs. It brings us so much joy to know that we left a lasting impression through the exceptional service our team was able to provide.Thank you for the amazing feedback and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The hotel is a nice facility and the staff are very helpful and friendly. Loved the buffet breakfast (eggs, potatoes, bacon, fresh fruit, bread, cereal, etc). The hotel has the largest pillows I have seen in a hotel! Pillows and bed were very comfortable. The hotel has a shuttle to run you back and forth to John Wayne airport. The airport IS near but planes can only fly between 7:00 am and 11:00 pm.

The Ayres gives you a feeling of relaxation from the moment you enter your room. All staff members were friendly and focused on making you feel at home. The Ayres made my trip even better than expected.

I am usually not one for an older hotel, although I love this one! The staff here are all very friendly and helpful as they should be. The grounds are very well maintained and everything seems to be upgraded where needed. It's not to far from the beach only a ten minute drive! Breakfest is not included but they do have a nice Buffett!
Manager Response: Dear Faran F.,  Thank you so much for your kind compliment regarding our hotel, we truly appreciate the feedback you have shared regarding your stay. We are thrilled yo hear that you enjoyed the ambiance we strive to create. It was truly satisfying to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I was at a conference held at the Segerstrom Center for the Arts.  The hotel is less than 10  minutes away with an easy route.  Staff were pleasant and accommodating.  The room was large and comfortable.   It is an older hotel and laid out over a large area, I had to ask to find the restaurant and gym facilities.  The pool is in the center of a block of rooms and can be noisy but it quieted down in the late evening.  Overall a good choice and price.

It was such a cute well kept Inn.  For the price you pay it was amazing!!!! And we slept so well in the bed.  I can't remember when we have been so rested.  We will definitely be back next year for the same conference!

I booked this hotel for a one-night stay, but wished I could have stayed longer. The staff members were friendly and check-in was efficient. I had arrived early but my room was ready. The lobby is lovely, with two complimentary computer stations tucked in a corner. I had booked a regular room rather than a suite, but it was quite large. It included a wet bar area with small fridge in addition tot a large bathroom. the king bed was very comfortable, with nice bedding and great pillows. The room was spacious enough that a love seat and table was included. The flat screen TV had HD and many stations. The free internet worked great, and free parking was a plus. A friend and I enjoyed a nice lunch in the patio.  I hesitate in giving this hotel five stars for a couple of reasons. The

Summary Heading: Second experience in this hotel chain and also liked
Summary: Travelling by car from LA to San Diego in a very slow way i stopped here and found to be a great cost/benefit option . I visited Newport beach and Laguna beach in a 2 days period . There are 2 buildings separated by the parking lot but both seemed nice . Rooms confortable and breakfast very basic. Ihad to pay for parking and breakfast.

Firstly, I did not take any photos because they would not have done this hotel justice.  I reviewed TA before my trip and once I arrived was amazed at how beautiful it was.  Oriental rugs, stately and COMFORTABLE furniture throughout the property and rooms.  China cabinets with china and vases, stone hearth fireplace, it was like being transported to another country.  I had a patio king suite with jacuzzi tub and mini fridge and microwave, it appeared that there were only three patio rooms but I could be mistaken.  My room also came with breakfast but I think that was part of our group rate so this should be verified because I saw some other guests that had to pay, only $10 for the buffet so not bad.  The breakfast was actually the best "hotel" breakfast I had ever had so even

The staff here is the best.  Very helpful.  European style feel in the courtyard.  Great little bite meals at certain times in bar.  I've been coming to this hotel for many years for work and pleasure.  Great location.  Right on the bus line to Laguna, Newport and Balboa.  Also the van will deliver you to some areas on a set schedule.  Rental car, bike rental and restaurants close by.  I do miss the decore that was in the hotel many years ago with the big beds in the courtyard building.  King suites in the other buiding really nice.

Very pleased with my recent stay at Ayres Costa Mesa. Great location, very nice boutique hotel, excellent value (promo for junior suite with spa tub). Hotel accommodated my request for high floor/view that I made during the booking without having to ask at check in. Easy parking right outside the suites building. Loved the room, loved the spa tub, and enjoyed in-room breakfast. Very close to everything - South Coast Plaza + anywhere in Irvine and Newport Beach. Very accessible right off hwy 73. The airport is right next door so you will hear planes taking off and landing, but only during the day - John Wayne airport has a curfew.

Summary Heading: Bipolar Hotel: European Look on the Surface but Some Flaws Underneath
Summary: Step into the beautiful lobby at the Ayres Costa Mesa and you will be amazed at the ornate European  lobby. But, distracted front desk staff may snap you out of it. They need to stop and focus on the needs of the person in front of them. Unfortunately, they were not what a weary traveler needed at 10 p.m.  The first word should be yes, how can we make that happen?  With key in hand I went to find my room in a labyrinth-like maze of buildings, rooms, and floors, so you needed a map to find your room.  Kinda felt like a hamster going through various tunnels and between buildings.  Room was lovely and big enough.  Spa tub did not work.  You should also know that the restaurant closes promptly at 10 p.m. with no room service available and no wine after that time.  Not even at 10:10

Great location, prices, staff, facilities, and room. The van pickup/deliver service was flawless; and you can reserve your trip at the front desk. The restaurant is very good, not a Michelin star candidate, but perfectly suitable for a nice meal - either in the pleasant courtyard for lunch, or inside after dark. Wine selection is thin, though good. The bartenders are definitely not in the "mixologist" mold, but can make a solid martini. As another reviewer noted, the breakfast is probably not worth the trouble, especially if you are carb sensitive. There is a decent selection of shops within a short walk for odd needs: 7-Eleven, Starbucks, pharmacy, laundry, etc. I am a swimmer, so a quick heatup in the hot tub, and then early morning laps in the chilly pool were a delight to

Great location, reasonable value, generally a high standard of quality and service. Only breakfast was disappointing and not worth the cost. Would definitely stay there again, but look elsewhere for breakfast

Summary Heading: Best Staff I have encountered in a long time!
Summary: Not much to say other then the staff being great! From the front desk to the drivers, buffet staff, and house keeping! Everyone was very friendly and accommodating in a prompt fashion. Thank you for a great business trip Ayres Hotel! I'll be checking Inn again!

It was a nice break for the family,the weekend was extremely warm, the kids enjoyed swimming. Everything was well kept and clean. The roons are gorgeous.The location was quiet and convienient.The staff wasvery friendly.

I came here for business and never had been in the area before.  This place was recommended by the company I was going to see since it was close.  Wow -- this is a  pleasant surprise.  From the courteous front desk people to the cool decor to the rooms themselves.  The only negative was the breakfast -- pretty average buffet layout with over cooked scrambled eggs, etc. Some of the items on the ala carte menu maybe good but I didn't try them.   However, the bar area is nice too -- little pub style going on with a decent selection of things to drink. :)

The staff was very courteous and helpful my entire stay.   Housekeeping did an excellent job keeping my room clean.  There are two pools to choose from.  I really enjoyed the pool in the courtyard  It was very peaceful and relaxing.   The pool was clean.   Parking was never an issue even though a couple of events were going on during my stay.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms. Elevator not working. Parking sucks.
Summary: As always, the rooms are nice snd clean.  However, the elevator nearest our room was not working so having to walk up and down the stairs, in unseaonably hot weather, in a 3 piece suit and long formal dress was extremely uncomfortable. Also, someone should be out there ticketing the rude guests who think it is ok to take up two spots because they park like crap and have no respect, or decency, to repark straight. My son and daughter-in-law came back from their wedding and had to park in the strip mall next to the hotel at 3am because the few open parking spots were not even big enough to get their compact car in. The parked cars visibly had room to park within the lines but the drivers, obviously, have no respect,  or class,  to repark straight. Hotel management should post

Quiet after a long busy day. Very Clean. Comfortable bedding. Close to Airport but close to restaurants! Very Friendly staff willing to go above and beyond. Where we choose to stay when passing through...

Great stay for a great price.  Hotel was clean, comfortable, and nicely appointed.  Staff was very friendly. I appreciate that registration was amply staffed to handle check-ins and phone calls quickly and efficiently. (I hate waiting in line while 1 poor employee has to juggle everything).

Summary Heading: Reasonably priced for clean, elegant, comfortable hotel
Summary: Great location for any occasion, friendly helpful staff, traditional decor, very clean and reasonably priced. Walking distance to many restaurants. Breakfast buffet available for $10 per person. Terrace charming next to restaurant. Pool area kept up well.

Nice hotel with comfortable feel. Very cozy rooms and furnishings. Good location, easy to find. Close to a variety of restaurants. Easy to get on and off the freeway. The lobby was immaculate, and the rest of the hotel followed suit.

I have been staying in the Costa Mesa location for years whenever I am in Orange County. I love this hotel....rooms, staff, meeting rooms, food, everything. I travel all over the world and this hotel has no peer in value!

We stayed here 3 days and ate 2 dinners and 3 breakfasts there. Both dinners were great. Our server, Miguel, was excellent. He 'gets it' with regards to customer service, and we tipped him accordingly. Breakfast however was a different story. Service was slow and stopped with one cup of coffee. My wife ordered some sausage and it was burnt and she couldn't even stick a fork in it. It should never have been served in the first place. The waiter, when it was brought to his attention, merely said "Pork has to be cooked well". Each day the breakfast staff was lousy. Our room was clean and the housekeeper, in charge of our room, did an outstanding job straightening things up. I have to agree with another post in regards to only one elevator in service, seeing that we were on the

All n all, this is my second time back and I must say that it has been a wonderful experience. Very organized and very personable staff. Always a pleasure to stay at the Ayres!   Ps the breakfast is great as well as the cookies in the lobby, alwaysfresh!

Hotel is a little dated, but well kept and clean. I stayed three nights. Noise from the airport made me keep my window closed, which was disappointing since the weather was perfect. Free wifi worked OK after several reboots. Great full breakfast in the morning was included with my room.
Manager Response: Dear SuperHogFan,  Thank you so much for you candid review. We would like to kindly invite you to return, as we plan to renovate our hotel this year! We truly appreciate you taking the time to share some feedback regarding your stay with fellow TripAdvisor travellers. We would like to remind you, for future reference, that you are more than welcome to input room requests; such as top floor rooms or quiet rooms, upon booking. Such requests cannot be guaranteed, however, our team does their very best to accommodate you accordingly. Thank you once again for your review and we hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: The hotel has the potential to be better.
Summary: I've stayed at this hotel several times in the past, but stopped booking with them due to customer service issues (front desk personnel and the cleanliness of the rooms). I was happy to see that they had upgraded their lobby area and remodeled the rooms (good job!). However, it was disappointing to see that they still had some of the same personnel issues in terms of service and cleanliness. It was also disappointing to see that their elevator was out of order and no one felt it necessary to at least offer to assist guests with carrying their luggage up the stairs (low service). Additionally, I've stayed at several different hotels in the area and all do a much better job with their buffet breakfast service in terms of setup/presentation. More attention to detail is needed if

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay at the Ayres Hotel - - First time experience
Summary: I have traveled most of my life on business and pleasure.   Gold, platinum member of most airlines, rental car companies and a member of most hotel clubs.   I used Priceline at the last moment to get a hotel and asked for 3.5 stars or better.   I ended up with my first visit at the Ayres and was extremely surprised.   Better than most 4.5 star hotels.  Staff was extremely helpful and nice and especially enjoyed talking to David the Food & Beverage manager.   A real asset to the hotel.  Ate dinner and breakfast there and the dinner was outstanding like going to a top rated restaurant.  Room size was Awesome and the entire hotel had an extremely homey feeling.  The only constructive critcism I can make is the AC / heat is a bit noisy and more on a level with a 3 star hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Scott P,  We are delighted to read that your first stay at Ayres Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa was a successful one! We are honored to have welcomed a traveler of your caliber and even more to be held at such a high regard. Comparing our hotel to the 4.5 star hotels you have stayed at is quite humbling! We certainly appreciate the kind words you have shared regarding our hotel, our friendly and helpful team members, as well as our onsite restaurant. Rest assured that we intend to take your suggestions regarding the AC/Heating unit into consideration. Once, again thank you kindly for your review and we genuinely hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The locations of this hotel is perfect.  Close to the Orange County Airport and the South Coast Mall.  The staff was helpful, I arrived prior to check in but there was no room available at the time.  My room was large and comfortable and quiet considering the proximity of the airport.  Excellent service in the restaurant at breakfast.  Would stay here for sure on my next trip.
Manager Response: Dear Schwaby126,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a review to inform fellow travelers about your recent stay at our hotel. We truly appreciate the feedback you have provided and are delighted to hear that you had an overall enjoyable experience with us. Thank you kindly for your warm compliments regarding our accommodations, our optimal location, and the exceptional service we strive to deliver each of our guests! Thank you again for your time and we hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: It was ok.  I would like to give a better rating but I can't this time.  I got the room for a friend visiting me.  The room smelled stale and the elevator was broken the entire time I was there.  The wifi wasn't strong enough or something because she could use the data or text on her phone.

Summary Heading: You know how to accommodate your guests!
Summary: The room was wonderful and I was treated very well by all the staff that worked in the restaurant and the van service you provided to the folks going to Piecemakers. The accommodations were beautiful, quiet and I would be glad to bring my husband next time to enjoy this wonderful area.
Manager Response: Dear Lindadollmaker, Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent stay at Ayers Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa. We truly appreciate the kind compliments you have shared regarding our amazing team members and the accommodations we provide. Providing exceptional customer service to all of our valued guests is our top priority and it is truly satisfying to know we were able to do just that during your stay. Thank you again for the wonderful review and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary Heading: Clean and Comfortable, But Some Problems
Summary: I stayed here for three nights while attending a doll-makers' workshop. Piecemakers, the workshop host, had made arrangements with four different hotels for discount rates. Although this hotel was the most expensive of the four, I chose it because the description said the hotel would provide free shuttle service to the event, and a free breakfast, and because several of my friends were also staying there. The pros: The room was clean and comfortable. Because I have asthma, I had requested feather-free pillows and I felt that the hotel had made a special effort to provide as allergen-free a room as possible. The staff was professional and friendly, and one of them, Yadira, went out of her way to show me the "Cardio Room", which was not on the hotel map. The breakfast included a

Clean, gorgeous room & bath. And, the man that helped us at the front desk, Kevin, gave us superior customer service! Will stay again and again! The beds were soft, pillows fluffy and decorations beautiful. We loved EVERYTHING about this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear ern2015  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent stay at Ayers Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa. We truly appreciate the kind compliments you have shared regarding the cleanliness of our property, our amazing team members, and the ambience of our hotel. We strive to provide exceptional customer service to all of our valued guests and it is truly satisfying to know we were able to do just that during your stay. Thank you again for the wonderful review and we hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: We were lured by a Spring Special of 25% reduction in rates.  It turned out to be 20% for the weekday, but nothing for the weekend.  The pillows are too fluffy and the foam pillows they suppled were shredded foam, not solid, which were just as bouncy.  The neighbor's jetted tub worked continuously for three hours, causing our walls to rumble and shake.  There were silverfish in the sink.  The recumbent exercise bike did not work and were assured it would be fixed the following day.  It wasn't.  The internet ad claimed a free breakfast, but were told on check-in that it would be $10 per peon, or an extra $100 for the 2 of us for 5 days.  When I asked for a banana or orange I was told that the breakfast hall did not carry either fruit.  How could this be?  The telephone did not
Manager Response: Dear Yuriko77 Thank you kindly for taking the time write a review on TripAdvisor about your recent experience at our hotel. Your feedback is vitally important to us as it helps make improvements were need be. In regards to your recent stay, please accept our most sincere apologies that your stay was anything less than exceptional. We are currently offering a 20% discount on multiple night stays during spring, but we are sincerely sorry for any false information you were giving in regards to the discount amount and the price for breakfast. Guest satisfaction is truly important to us and for that reason we kindly encourage guests to bring any issues that could jeopardize their stay to our attention; so we can provide and immediate solution whether it be accommodating you in a different room or replacing the phone. Thank you once again for your review and we only hope that you’ll give us another opportunity to redeem ourselves in the future. Sincerely, Susan O’Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We love to stay at Ayres Hotel of Costa Mesa.  We have the coming for 14 years, for two weeks on business.  The rooms are always clean and fresh.  The bedding is perfect, with comfortable mattresses. We often eat in the restaurant for dinner because of the good quality food, fine service, and convenience after a hard day of business. The location near John Wayne Airport is one of the reasons we choose Ayres. Also, it is near the ocean, great shopping, and the freeways.
Manager Response: Dear Minnmary, We are so very thrilled to hear that we have been your chosen hotel for the last 14 years! Our impeccably appointed rooms, exceptional customer service, and convenient location are truly what bring our guests back time and time again. Your loyalty is greatly appreciated. Thank you so much for choosing to stay with us, we cannot wait to welcome you come back soon!  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: It was my first time in Costa Mesa and I loved staying at the Ayres hotel. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, the decor and the pool and spa are really good. The food was excellent and the waiters were great too. Thanks for a lovely stay. Would recommend it to anyone.
Manager Response: Dear Martyn S, Thank you kindly for taking the time to review our hotel, we are thrilled to hear that your very first stay with us was a success! It is our top priority to deliver only the best service to all of our valued guests. We are so delighted to hear we were able to provide you just that. Once again, we appreciate your generous compliments and are looking forward to your next stay!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: Ayres purchased this hotel from Country Inn and Suites and then did very little to update it.  In my room (which was in a separate building from my traveling companion), the refrigerator did not work, the hairdryer was a nightmare to figure out how to operate (and I'm a fairly intelligent person), and the bathtub faucet leaked.  All night...drip, drip, drip.... UGH!  The wifi code they gave me also did not work and although we requested a shuttle back to the airport the next day, they were unsure they could "fit us in" and almost made us panic since we had a flight to catch.  Also, with our company contract, at the front desk, we were offered discounts on breakfast but we were given a hard time when we went to the restaurant to eat there.  Not impressed at all with this hotel.

Summary Heading: Beautiful elegant hotel 10 minutes away from Newport Beach
Summary: On a 1-10 scale I would give Ayres Hotel an 8! An eight because they do not inform you there will be an additional $50 fee for incidents during booking which can cause inconvenience. The other issue I had was the price of the room while a jacuzzi and stairwell were in the middle of renovations...
Manager Response: Dear AJA M, Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a review in regards to your recent stay at our hotel. We are terribly sorry for the miscommunication upon check-in regarding the $50 incidental deposit. Though this is pretty standard for hotels we would like to apologize for failing to notify you. Customer satisfaction is extremely important to us and for that reason we encourage our guests to bring any issues that might jeopardize their stay to our attention so we can do our best to resolve the issue. We truly appreciate the feedback you provided and we sure hope to see you again soon! Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: Love the Ayres Hotel. Costa Mesa location is my favorite. Beautiful rooms,  beds are perfection, towels to wrap up and love! Service is outstanding, restaurant/bar has great food and drinks. Safe and comfortable with a good fitness room too! Love, love, love this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear LoreleiPatrice Thank you kindly for your review and the enthusiasm you have shared. It is a joy to hear that you enjoyed you recent stay with us and a great honor to be one of your favorite locations in the Costa Mesa area. Thank you again for the wonderful review and we hope to welcome you back soon. Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We love the Ayres! This was a return stay, and we were not disappointed! The rooms are large with great amenities. Housekeeping staff exceptional! Nice area and a few restaurants close enough for walking.
Manager Response: Dear galleygoddess, Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay at Ayres Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa. We truly appreciate your feedback and are thrilled to hear that you had such a pleasant stay. Thank you again, for choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you again very soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brie-Moore General Manager

Summary: I had a wonderful stay at this Ayres. It was record setting check in with a smile. I wish I can remember the young lady's name but it was so quick and effortless that I didn't catch it. We stayed in suite building which was elegantly decorated. Our room was very clean and quiet. The bath tub was amazing. So relaxing.  My wife and I had free concert tickets near by and we didn't even make it because we wanted to enjoy room. Spacious clean room with nice bathroom toiletries. Will definitely stay again.  Only complaint was I left some really expensive bath products and they could not be found as of the time I wrote this review. Kind of suspect. But if they are found I will edit this review.
Manager Response: Dear Anthony C,  Thank you so much for all of your kind compliments about our clean and comfortable suites as well as our amazing team members.  We are so happy you enjoyed your recent stay at Ayres Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa and truly appreciate the feedback you have provided. Thank you for your insightful review and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My daughter and I stayed here for two nights because she was auditioning for the dance program at University of California Irvine.  The location was perfect for us. We never had to drive more than 10 minutes to get to the beach, the school, shopping or restaurants.  The hotel is beautiful and every employee I encountered was polite, helpful and extremely proficient at their job.  Best of all, the room was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. We had a room overlooking the pool, and we were never bothered by any noise. We ate breakfast in the restaurant on our second morning and it was very good. The staff did an excellent job of keeping everything on the buffet fresh and full and there was a good variety of choices. We also used the wifi extensively and never had any
Manager Response: Dear Racquel H, Thank you so much for the wonderful review. We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay, found our location to be convenient enough to meet your needs, and had a very satisfying experience! We truly do aim to please, whether it be by providing exceptional customer service or creating a conformable ambiance, and are glad we were able to do just that during your stay. Thank you again for taking the time to let others know about your experience and we hope to welcome you back soon! Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manger

Summary: Wonderful staff. Clean large rooms.close to local restaurants. staff was very helpful and accomadating the price was wonderful for the area nice pool and hot tub.Laundry facilities on-site for long visits. Close to fashion island for shopping and food.
Manager Response: Dear Monique W, Thank you kindly for your candid review! We truly appreciate the feedback you have provided and are filled with joy to hear that we were able to provide an environment that felt like home to you. Thank you for your kind words regarding our amazing team, we truly do strive to provide excellent customer service and we are glad we did just that during your stay. Thank you once again for the review and we hope to welcome you back soon! Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary Heading: A very nice hotel near John Wayne Airport
Summary: Hotels near airports are not necessarily known for their charm, but this one is a welcome change from the cookie-cutter chains. Located adjacent to the airfield (a couple of minutes by car), the hotel is warmly and tastefully appointed. Our room was large and very comfortable, with a cozy feel to it without being cramped. The restaurant in the hotel serves a surprisingly good dinner, and is a nice place to stop by for coffee.
Manager Response: Dear jk61-California Thank you for taking the time to post a review on TripdAdvisor regarding your recent stay at Ayres Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa. We greatly appreciate the kind compliments you have shared about our hotel, we are thrilled to hear that we made a lasting impression during your stay! Glad to hear that you enjoyed your time with us, thank you again for the wonderful feedback you have provided and we hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely  Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: This hotel has just the right mix of old charm and all the luxurious amenities I want!  Comfortable beds, spacious rooms and everything is well maintained. The restaurant downstairs has excellent food and the service at this hotel is warm, friendly, efficient and accommodating. It proximity to the airport is perfect.  I will keep coming back and I will be on the lookout for other Ayres properties when I'm traveling!

We really enjoy staying here. The staff are friendly and helpful. My husband had eye surgery near by and we were able to rest in comfort. The food that we got at the hotel was very good and we really enjoyed it. We have stayed before here and the staff remembers us and delivers a tray of fruit and cheese to our suite, which is so nice. We will go and stay again at this property.

I stay at this hotel a couple of times per month on business. The rooms are always spotless and the service is great. I've literally stayed here 100 times or more over the last several years and it is always a pleasure! If you don't have a car during your stay, the shuttle service can be quite handy to visit local attractions as well.

We have fallen in love with Ayres! This is the second time my husband and I have stayed at an Ayres property. We love the interior design where you feel like you are in Europe. The customer service is 5 star and we were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a suite at no extra charge. We will definitely be back!

I'd never stayed at an Ayres Hotel but was pleasantly surprised with the fantastic service and quality of rooms & amenities.  The hotel staff was very friendly and the room was both unique and glamorous.  The bathroom was especially nice with a jacuzzi tub and nice shower.  My only complaint was that the hair dryer was the standard hotel wall-mount small dryer.  A real hair dryer is always appreciated!  Beautiful decor and all around great hotel!  Will be returning here when in the SoCal area.  Free wi-fi and parking a huge plus!

Nice place. All went well. I'd stay there again. I'm glad I didn't book at a cheaper hotel closer to Knott's Berry Farm because as you get closer to the park the area gets more sketchy. This hotel was 30 minutes away from the park and was a good choice.

A really nice hotel at a great value, for business or pleasure. Wonderful, convenient location. They have a great staff from front desk to housekeepers. A very nice place to stay and at a very good price.

Everything was up to my expectations. I've stayed there twice and each time went well. Some of the features I liked the most included free wifi, pool/hot tub, and an exercise room. The location was great too. I would definitely stay there again.

Excellent service throughout the hotel, very clean rooms and comfortable beds, good breakfast, beautiful decor, they have a good restaurant so you don't even have to go out to find something. I was in the area for a seminar and would stay here again. They even had cookies in the lobby! Felt very upper class for a reasonable price!

I have stayed at this property about 4 times so far, over the past 3 years.  My experience is always great.  Great breakfast nice staff.  Rooms are clean and comfortable.  The price is not high if you can get a special rate.  Location is good.

Yes, one is below John Wayne airport....however...sweet hotel...alittle New Orleans / Europian...comfortable, great service / friendly staff... a really very good resturant.  Quieter and more privite stay in the suites with extras.  Wonderful photographs throughout.

Let's get this straight; It's not a kids' resort. There are two pools, but not much else for kids to do here. Not much to do within walking distance of the property.   Still, it's a nice place to stay. It's clean, charming, and fairly close to local attractions. (Balboa Island is a 10-15 minute drive, Laguna Beach is another 5-10 minutes away, and depending on traffic, you're about 20-30 minutes away from Disney and Knott's.  My wife and I brought our 2 daughters (6yrs and 3yrs) for a 3-night stay.  Using this hotel as a base for our visit was great. Hotel staff was super friendly and helpful. On the first morning of our stay, I asked the house keeper for a few extra coffees for our room. After that day, we found several extra coffee packets each day in our room. (it's the

Summary Heading: A very good deal in a very good location
Summary: We stayed for three nights at Ayres Costa Mesa because we enjoyed Ayres Laguna Woods so much.  As at other Ayres hotels, we appreciate two USB jacks at the desk and two by the bed for charging devices. We used both. Free Wi-Fi for unlimited devices was quick. Staff were super-helpful and attentive, although at times a bit pressed. Nice to have Le Chateau restaurant only a few steps from our room.  Although it probably is good value, the buffet breakfast for $15 plus tax plus tip wasn't competitive with ala carte at nearby places. They provided scrambled-only eggs. Only muffins, no rolls. Mixed fresh fruit and yoghurt. Pancakes. We felt we got a better value at Bill's Burgers across the street which stays open a lot longer than Le Chateau and offers more breakfast options.   You

Decided to stay the last two nights here, due to early flight.  We were staying at the Ayres Seal Beach earlier in the week.  Knew we could not go wrong with this one.  Do not worry about the plane noise flying by the hotel.  They have a no fly time during the night.  They also have a shuttle that will take you to the airport.  This Ayres did not have the hot free breakfast, but did have coffee and muffins in the lobby at 5:30 am before we loaded on the shuttle.  Everyone was polite, helpful, nice.  The rooms were exceptional.

Summary Heading: Costa Mesa hotel.   Nice, but I miss the complimentary breakfast
Summary: Clean hotel close to Jihn Wayne airport.  Friendly staff, reasonable rates, nice rooms, free internet.  But the complementary breakfast is now $15 per person for the buffet and I am just cheap enough to walk across the street to McDonalds rather than pay for breakfast since hotel began their new policy as of October.  This will factor into my decision about staying here when I visit the OC next time
Manager Response: Dear BNW-SoCal, Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay at our hotel. We truly appreciate all the kind compliments you have shared in regards to our convenient location, our amazing team members, and the accommodations we provided. Nevertheless, we want to apologize for the inconvenience that our newly implemented breakfast charge has caused. We hope that the nominal breakfast fee does not outweigh the overall value we strive to provided and you choose to continue staying with us. Thank you again for the insightful review and we truly hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Good service but smells a bit?
Summary: Maybe we just visited at a bad time, but my family and I spent five days at this location and our whole hall had a musty "old" smell to it unfortunately. Everything else was great, and the service was wonderful. The front desk is helpful and knowledgable on the area.
Manager Response: Dear imtrulytiff, Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay at our hotel. We are saddened to hear that your stay was anything but exceptional due to the musty smell during your visit. Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention and we hope this incident does not keep you from staying with us again. Thank you, again, for your review and for the kind compliments regarding our team members. We truly hope to see you again soon. Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: We really enjoy the Ayres hotel chain in Southern California.  All the hotels offer good value for a very good & clean hotel.  The Costa Mesa one is no different.  Very clean room, great decor, free parking, free wifi, etc... Staff was nice and things went well during our stay.  The only strange thing was the breakout of the buildings between the hotel and the Inn.  Only one lobby to handle all the guests, but you need to go between buildings for some rooms.  Other than that we had a great stay at this hotel.  Not as nice as the Ayres Hotel Orange that we stayed at previously, but nonetheless a very nice hotel.  Would recommend this hotel and would go back next time we plan to visit Irvine.

Very helpful staff, clean room, and prompt service. The drawback is it's so close to the airport that you hear all the airplane taking off noise from 7am-10pm. But overall I recommend this hotel because of the nice staff here.

This establishment is the best value and accommodations in Orange County. The hotel is very well furnished with an interesting theme of models of old boats. The room furniture is a departure from the "plastic" furniture and bland appointments which exist in most other hotels. That makes the atmosphere in the room "warm" and inviting. My disabled wife and I stay at Ayres on our occasional visits to Newport because of the feeling of comfort in the rooms and hotel in general. One has to stay in this establishment to experience what it offers because it is now a rarity even in the most expensive accommodations. We no longer consider other places to stay when in that part of California. Every visit is as good as or even better than the one before and we were totally enamored with
Manager Response: Dear Brent R,   Thank you for reviewing your recent stay and for your compliments regarding our optimal location and friendly team members. We hope to serve you again soon!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: stay at this charming hotel great service and great value for the hotel rooms where very clean and nice staff friendly and helpful enjoyed our stay would stay again parking was easy the decorations for christmas was really nice going to go back again for sure
Manager Response: Dear goldenstar19,  Thank you for reviewing your recent stay and for your compliments regarding our optimal location and friendly team members. We hope to serve you again soon!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Yearly business trip with my Wife!!
Summary: My wife and stay at the Ayres hotel every year! We either stay at the Seal Beach location or the Costa Mesa location.  They have great service and it is always a pleasure to stay here.  The beach is close by and the hotel has a really good breakfast each morning that comes free with the room.
Manager Response: Dear Arthur A,  Thank you kindly for your TripAdvisor review! I am humbled to see that we have exceeded your expectation with our convenience of location and exceptional service! We look forward to welcoming you back again soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place for the business traveller
Summary: This hotel has great amenities and an excellent, friendly staff.  I had a very comfortable stay there while on business in Orange County.  The rooms are well appointed and large, the atrium is beautiful (though I didn't have a chance to spend much time there), and the breakfast was great.
Manager Response: Dear Phil R,  I am humbled to see that we have exceeded your expectation with our convenience of location and exceptional service! We hope to serve you again in the near future.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: The staff is friendly and efficient! The rooms are nice with comfortable bedding and everything is very clean. The wireless internet was very fast! I needed to upload some videos to the Internet and I had no issues at all.  I also used my iPad with some apps that are normally sluggish on a wireless connection with no problems.
Manager Response: Dear kadeking,   Thank you so much for your review and for choosing Ayres Hotel and Suites Costa Mesa as your destination. We are delighted to hear that you found our services and amenities to be convenient for your recent stay.  Thank you once again for your feedback and we hope to serve you again in the future!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien Moore  General Manager

Summary: Made a quick overnight trip to Costa Mesa for an art gallery event. This hotel was ideally situated near both the airport and the gallery, and the hotel shuttle provided speedy transportation to/from both so we didn't need to rent a car. The shuttle also transported us to/from Balboa Island which was convenient. The beds are comfortable, there's an onsite restaurant and a 7-11 nearby for miscellaneous items.
Manager Response: Dear PPop54,   Thank you so much for your review and for choosing Ayres Hotel and Suites as your recent destination. We are delighted to hear that you found our amenities and services to be convenient for your recent stay. It is also great to hear that our hotel was ideally situated to meet your needs. Thank you once again for your feedback and we truly hope to see you again soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien Moore  General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Ayres for 3 nights while we were in the area for two art shows. Everything about the hotel was just about perfect. I don't usually give hotels 5 stars because that it as close to perfect as an establishment can get. We had a very nice Jr. King Suite room that had a couch and working table and a VERY clean bathroom! Bed was comfortable, great pillows.The front desk service was wonderful; the restaurant staff worked very hard to keep everything fresh at the breakfast; waiters at our dinners were knowledgeable and entertaining (food was fabulous); the property itself is clean and we loved the art all over - everywhere seemed to have a painting or print hanging on the walls! (Being artists ourselves, we obviously appreciated that!) If we ever get to
Manager Response: Dear Janice54,  Thank you kindly for your detailed review regarding our inviting and comfortable room accommodations. I am elated to see that you found your room tidy, well-appointed, and spacious as well as thoroughly enjoyed  our European inspired decor. Our team members work diligently to provide excellent service at all times and I'm delighted that they were able to do just that during your stay. We look forward to your return and appreciate your kind compliments!   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Stop Lying About The Free Breakfast
Summary: I have been staying at Ayres Hotels for many years and have stayed many times at many different properties.  This stay was soured by what I felt was deception on the part of the management at this property regarding breakfast.  On the main page of the Ayres Hotel web sight it says, "Southern California Hotels  Our collection of charming Southern California hotels features living-room style lobbies, comfortable accommodations, complimentary hot breakfast, and a warm European ambiance." This covers all hotels in southern California. Yet they tried to charge me $15 for breakfast. This is a new policy and counter to what is clearly stated on their very own web sight.  After I brought this to the front desk clerk's attention I was shown a much more difficult to find and more obscure
Manager Response: Dear Bill S,   Thank kindly for taking the time to share about your recent experience at our hotel. In regards to your recent stay, on behalf of our Management team, please accept our sincere apologies for your stay being anything less than exceptional. I am so sorry for you being misled in anyway due to the wording on our website home page, however we greatly appreciate you bringing this issue to our attention as it helps us prevent this miscommunication from occurring again in the future. Your loyalty to our hotel means everything to us and we truly hope that this recent change in policy does not deter your from any future stays. Thank you again for your vital feedback and we only hope that we will have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.    Sincerely,   Susan O’ Brien Moore  General Manager

Summary: Completely loved this hotel. Staff was really friendly. Bed was comfortable. Breakfast buffet was good. During the day you can heat the planes taking off but not at night. No biggie! Loved my stay!!!!
Manager Response: Dear AVLeggs,   Thank you for your kind compliments regarding our attentive team and complimentary amenities! We hope to see you again soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: Rooms were great and service was excellent.  Enjoyed the stay and was a great meeitng site.  Lunch around the pool area was a nice break from the meetings.  Breakfast included in the room price was a nice touch.
Manager Response: Dear Jerry H,  Thank you for your kind compliments. We hope to serve you again in the near future!   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Very comfortable stay and really nice staff
Summary: My business partner and I spent 2 nights in room 258 on second floor for a 2 day seminar.  The room was a double queen bed room which is handicap accessible.  It was a $10-15 a night cheaper for this room and only difference is there is no tub and zero clearance shower for handicap.  Overall staff was extremely nice and accommodating.  Our room came with complimentary breakfast buffet which was better than most and the bacon was crispy.  They had eggs, French toast, juice, coffee, potatoes, oatmeal, toast etc.  We also ate catered lunch on site which was good for a conference.  Rooms were clean and the hotel had charm.  There is a heated pool and hot tub. I would definitely recommend for business or personal travel.  I think my wife would like it so that says something. It came
Manager Response: Dear Chris C,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us! Your kind compliments are warmly welcome as our team works diligently to leave a lasting impression for each of our guests. We would love to welcome you back again soon, hopefully with your wife so that we can exceed her expectations as well!   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: We definitely enjoyed our stay in Costa Mesa-Newport.  The Ayres Hotel and Suites were much more than expected.  Somewhat recently renovated, the rooms were spacious, the bed comfortable and the quaint boutique feel was great.  My only complaint, is that we booked the hotel through a third party (tripadvisor, booking.com etc) and the front desk had a hard time finding the reservation.  Thankfully they had a computer in the business area and I was able to find my reservation.  That was a little annoying but did not taint our trip. I would also like to note that the evening reception  and warm cookies were a definite plus.  Having a on-site restaurant/bistro that allows you to enjoy the courtyard, all adds to the ambiance of the hotel.  Can definitely see another trip in the future
Manager Response: Dear 5cweetharus,   Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review to let others know about you recent experience at our hotel. It is great to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and that we exceeded your expectations. Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience while locating your reservation, however we are happy to hear we were able to resolve this issue and that your overall stay was a success. We are truly grateful for your feedback and hope to welcome you back while on you next trip!   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien Moore  General Manager

Summary: We went straight from Manhattan Beach Ayres to this one, and this one even better, rooms were much more modern and carpet was more fresh. Breakfast was very good, and it is complementary. Restaurant serves great lunch also. Rooms are very nice. Staff is very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Ann M,   Thank you so much for your candid review and for your loyalty to Ayres Hotels. We are happy to hear you were able to indulge in our full American breakfast and truly appreciate your kind compliments in regards to our restaurant and our amazing team members. Thank you for your feedback and we hope to see again soon!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien Moore  General Manager

Summary: My fiance, 4 year old, and I stayed one night at the Ayres Hotel & Suites. We booked a one bedroom suite. From the moment we arrived the staff was very helpful and professional. The lobby was lovely w/ a classic touch. We enjoyed roaming the hallways as we admired the European art work, the photos of Orange County during the 1930's, and the antique furniture.   The one bedroom suite on the third floor over-looked the adorable courtyard. It was such a lovely view. The suite was spacious and perfect for a small family. The living area was separate from the bedroom. The living area had a TV, sofa bed, desk and chair, and bar/kitchenette area. The bedroom had a king sized bed, TV, and plenty of closet space.   We dined at the Le Chateau Garden. It was an elegant experience. The food
Manager Response: Dear Bendy W,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay in detail! Our hard working team certainly appreciates your kind words regarding their top notch service and friendly demeanor. We keep many factors in mind while carefully selecting locations for our Ayres properties. It is of the utmost importance to provide a convenient and safe surrounding for each guest to enjoy their temporary home away from home! We do indeed have an Ayres Rewards program where you can earn 5 points per dollar spent. You can sign up at rewards.ayreshotels.com and start earning points today! Thank you again for reviewing your recent stay. We look forward to serving you again in the near future  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien Moore  General Manager

Summary Heading: I loved this hotel and will definitely be back!
Summary: I had a luxurious king suite for a week. The room was always clean and well stocked and the staff (from the front desk, room service, and housekeeping) always attentive to any special requests. I did hear the planes taking off and landing which interfered with watching the news on TV but that is a tradeoff I knew about ahead of time and with having a convenient location to the airport. The breakfast buffet was nicely done and the staff made sure  I always had a full hot cup of great coffee. I used the shuttle twice and they were very courteous, professional  and on time! The location was excellent for visiting UCI and shopping. The WiFi worked great. For old school luxury, classical music and traditional atmosphere, this is just the place for me.

Summary Heading: There is a certain air about the Ayres!
Summary: Never stay anywhere else when we are in California.  So beautiful, and friendly, everything spic and span, and very classy.  Very friendly staff. Happy atmosphere.  We are looking forward to our next stay.  This time we were there because of a family members funeral.  Bonus was meeting Don Ayres who also attended the memorial service since he was a friend of my cousin who had passed away,  and is  a fellow Gideon.   That was a definite highlight. They were decorating for Christmas while we were there, just gorgeous. Definitely recommend the Ayres!

Love the location of Ayres Suites, very good restaurant in the hotel - Le Chateau Garden Bistro(check out their crabcakes, they're phenomenal!!)  and very accessible to all attractions. I love it's accessibility to all good restaurants in the area period. Special shout out and complements to the Hotels shuttle service for driving us around town . I enjoyed my stay in this Hotel, the housekeeping was great. The complemetary breakfast for the guest was awesome, you can't beat that. I will definitely go back to this hotel when I go back to Costa Mesa . By the way the fresh baked cookies and muffins at the lobby is to die for..cucumber water was so refreshing..unfortunately they have a cut off time when to take the cookies out from the lobby- i was looking for a cookie during a late

I would consider this hotel average. The hotel and room were clean. The bed was okay, but overall the hotel did not meet my expectations. I stayed in an Ayres in Diamond Bar, CA that was wonderful! But this one was disappointing in comparison. The room was dark and had very basic/minimal furniture.The free breakfast was horrible and cheap. The hotel itself is like a maze and it's hard to find your way around it. The location is not that great either (kinda shaddy) and it's located on a one-way street; if you miss the entrance, you have to drive around the block.
