Just thought I'd add my two cents especially since other reviews indicated that it was a very nice hotel. There are lots of other hotels about two miles north that are in better locations. I passed on an opportunity to
Manager Response: Dear Newhiker1,   Thank you kindly for taking the time to share about your recent experience at our hotel.  We truly appreciate your feedback us as it helps us to refine the service we provide to our valued guests. In regards to your recent stay, we are genuinely apologetic for your disappointment with our guest rooms and complimentary breakfast, however sincerely appreciate your feedback.  We only hope you will give us a a second chance to provide you with a better experience in the future.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: No pollution here. The Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa is clean! This place is clas from the moment you enter the property until the moment you leave. Rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated. In fact a stroll through the lobbies and hallways is like going through a museum of antiques of fine furniture and art . The restaurant has a good selection from snacks to entrees and is very well priced. I attended a conference there, but would not hesitate at all to stay there for personal reasons. Very, very, classy
Manager Response: Dear Ray S.   Thank you kindly for your wonderful review about your recent experience at our hotel! We truly appreciate your kind words concerning our decor and the cleanliness of our hotel. We thank you once again for your review and hope to welcome you again soon.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: The location of Hotel is Good, Staff Very Nice, Very Helpful, Rooms were clean and well kept up. The Price paid for what we received was to high. Next time we come down to Costa Mesa to visit our grandchildren, we will be looking for a less expensive location.
Manager Response: Dear dacoleman437,   Thank you so much for your candid review about your recent experience at our hotel. We truly appreciate your feedback as it helps us to improve our service. Thank you again for your review and hope to welcome you back again soon so that we can improve upon your experience with us.     Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed at Ayres Orange a few months back for a Disneyland trip and loved it so much that I booked @ this one hoping for the same great experience. The Ayres Orange had a lot of families with kids staying at the hotel and, in contrast, I did not see any families with kids in our entire stay at Ayres Newport Beach--it was all adults, mostly business-folk. The rooms were decorated with much more fancy furniture. I was not expecting our bathroom to have a humungous jet tub in it--which was an added bonus. When I booked the hotel a few months back, it said that the breakfast buffet was complimentary and thank goodness I printed that out and had it with me because at check-in the front receptionist told me that breakfast was going to cost $15 per person per day. When I pointed out

We had  to come to the area for a friend's 50th Birthday Dinner at Antonello Ristorante near South Coast Plaza and this was a perfect location for easy access to and from the venue.        The staff were welcoming and friendly.  Room was very spacious and Great Beds!
Manager Response: Dear 2Higgins,   Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent experience at our hotel. Summary: From the time you drive into the reception area to the time of departure it is a "five Star" feeling. The staff is always ready to accommodate your every need.  Extremely high quality decor and exceptionally clean rooms

Summary Heading: Spacious rooms, comfortable, clean, modern, and quite
Summary: The rooms are well insulated.  My room was right next to ice machine and elevator - a horrifying thought - but it was VERY quite.  The blackout drapes worked beautifully too.  The room was spacious.  The beautiful courtyard patio was a perfect place for coffee the next morning.  Didn't try the breakfast because I had brunch plans elsewhere.
Manager Response: Dear cj0z,   Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. Summary: Came down just for the weekend in OC for HS reunion; this hotel offers a convenient location near the John Wayne Airport and southern OC towns (Irvine, Newport Beach, Costa Mesa).  Found it very convenient, more so than the designated hotel for my HS reunion.  Breakfast included; just normal.  Room was in great shape; front desk people were friendly, and hotel offers a free airport shuttle.
Manager Response: Dear JKSFTraveler,   Thank you kindly for your review and for choosing us as the host hotel for your reunion! Summary Heading: Very good experience then beg bugs change it all
Summary: It's a shame I have to give this hotel a poor rating because everything else about it was good. From the outside, the hotel - although a bit dated in design and poorly lit inside - seemed well-maintained. The staff were very nice. The first room I stayed in was very organized and tidy. The location is not really walkable to restaurants and shops but that's ok because I had a rental car, and the hotel was within short driving distance to the beach and shopping areas. My positive impression of the hotel went out the door the minute I got bit a few times by bugs. They could only have been bed bugs because I didn't feel them until I turned down the lights and went to bed. I even have a photo of one of them I killed. I called a front desk personnel who was able to move me in the
Manager Response: Dear ILMF2014,   Thank you kindly for taking the time write this review on TripAdvisor. Your feedback is vitally important to us as it helps better serve our guests.  In regards to your recent stay, I would like to extend my most sincere apology for the incident that occurred in your room. I certainly understand how an incident such as this can spoil any guest’s stay and again, I am so sorry that this was the case with your room.   Please know we have strict standards and protocol in place to ensure against incidents like these and that we provide our team members with thorough training twice a year in regards to this matter. That being said, if even the slightest trace of bed bugs is detected in one of our rooms, that room is systematically treated and put out of order for ten full days to ensure there is no problem of this nature.   As an experienced hospitality professional, this incident is both frustrating and disturbing, as we strive to consistently provide exemplary service and comfort to our guests. For this reason, please know that we take serious action against any incident that causes such inconvenience and discomfort for our guests.   Once again, we undeniably apologize for the troublesomeness and discomfort that you experienced at our property. We thank you kindly for your review and hope that you’ll give us another opportunity to redeem ourselves in the future.  Sincerely,   Susan O’Brien Moore General Manager

Summary: very quiet, nice staff, easy to find. love this hotel has a nice feel (Reminds me of when we went to Paris) $40 cheaper than the other hotels nearby. the deluxe room has a mini fridge and a sink outside of the bathroom, very helpful when getting ready in the morning. close to the Newport Aquatic Center for early rowing start times :)
Manager Response: Dear Johanna P,   Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at our hotel! Summary: The hotel was great for a little family get-together. Close to beaches and airport. Breakfast was really nice. There are two pools, one mostly in the shade and another with more sun. We really had a great time! Thanks!

I was in this weekend for Reef-a-Palooza and my wife and I stayed at this Hotel for the even.t A lot of vendors and guest stayed here so it was pretty busy. Even close to the Airport (John Wayne) you could hear the planes if you were outside but nothing in the room. The room was beautiful and comfortable and very elegant. Customer service was short of amazing and very helpful and polite. Great breakfast if not included you can charge to your room. We really had a great time at this hotel and will definitely stay again.

I have been staying there three days a week for six months and the staff is always been friendly and the accommodations are worth much more then they charge. If I had to complain about something I would suggest the management invest in new cooling units for most of the rooms. You cannot beat it for the money!

I really like the staff at the Ayres.  The driving staff and the front desk staff especially Bill, Aaron, Rick, and Courtney & Cecily are Awesome.  If you want to feel at home then you arrived at the right spot.  The only thing I would improve is the carpet and the food.

Fabulous choice for our sons wedding hotel.  We booked a total of 39 rooms.  The service was excellent.  Loved the full hot breakfast and beautiful courtyard to meet and visit each day.  Pool and hot tub were great!   Would definitely book again.  Close proximity to airport and not far from Disneyland and wedding venue!  Thank you!

Summary: We were traveling from the Central Coast of California and planned on stopping near Long Beach.  However, the first Ayres Hotel we stopped at was too expensive.  We called the Costa Mesa location from the car and spoke with a helpful representative who gave us a great price.  The room was large, the bed comfortable.  The location is very near many things including the beach, OC Airport, and Newport Beach.  Great breakfast included.

Responsive staff, comfortable beds, restaurant and room service on site as well as free parking and Wi-Fi!  Ayres hotels are a great option in SoCal.

Summary: This was my second visit this year and once again it was excellent. The included breakfast is better than most places offer. Staff super friendly. Airport shuttle terrific service. Love John Wayne Airport. I was literally out of the hotel at 5:30am and at the gate in line for a coffee at 5:45 am. Amazing!  As Arnold said I'll be back."

Summary: My husband and I live in the Inland Empire (Calif).  He had to have surgery on 9/23/14.  The surgery was scheduled to be done in the Irvine/Costa Mesa area.   Since we are familar with the traffic going into Orange County, we decided to go to O.C. the day before & spend the night in a hotel so that we wouldn't have to wake up at the crack of dawn & battle the traffic into O.C.      After looking at just about every hotel in the area, I decided to go with the top reviews.  We stayed in a room with a king size bed that overlooked the pool and had an electric fireplace.       The check-in on 9/22/14 was easy and friendly.  My only negative w/the check-in, was that there were no bell boys to take our bag up & I am disabled.       The room and bathroom were clean, and the bed was

Summary Heading: Our Get Away at Ayers Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa
Summary: We enjoyed your hotel very much. Gina at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. Our room was very clean it also had a small refrigerator in it which I liked as I could keep my drinks cold!  My husband and I ate breakfast every morning in the restaurant.  The food was fresh and tasted great!  We would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Orange County or the surrounding areas. even though the hotel sits close to the airport the noise level was minimal. I liked the fact that our beds were made daily , yet we were encouraged to reuse our linens to help preserve water! My husband and I will definitely be returning as it is in a great location and close to many things. Keep up the good work, we will be seeing you again in the near future!

Thank you again for your generous recommendations and we look forward to your next visit!   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary Heading: Home away from home (only more luxurious!)
Summary: We love Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa; it is our home away from home (only more luxurious!).  Our daughter attends UC Irvine and we stay several times a year.  We love the friendly, helpful and polite staff, the lovely rooms, the comfortable beds, the delicious breakfast, the pools, the convenient parking.  Thank you for taking such good care of us!

Our trip was a mixture of business and pleasure. The hotel was accessible, clean and friendly. We were able to take the shuttle from the hotel to a night out with friends, and were dropped off and picked up promptly by the courteous drivers. We would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Warm greeting- check Great room, bed and immaculate- check Healthy variety breakfast- check Great value- check Great location- check  Recommend this hotel for your stay in Orange County!You are welcomed by smiles upon checking in and the backdrop of the warm rich furniture. The breakfast is available from 6 am to 9 am and everything  is fresh. The beds are very comfortable and cleaned everyday. I like that they encourage reuse of linen to cut down on waste of natural resources.   Top notch facility for s great price

Seems a little too much on the Disney side of interior design if you like old world French manors in a stucco box next to gas station and near an airport. The service was good. The property was clean. The rooms were too small to have two adults and two children. The breakfast was a nice touch. The wifi was spotty. While there's not bad with this hotel, it's just my first choice.

The Service at this Hotel was above and beyond The room was very comfortable, clean and easy to do my work from. I would stay here again, The  only complaint i have is breakfast was just ok not  what I'm use to i only ate there once in my 3 days.

I visit this property annually when I go to the Women of Faith Conference w/my sis. The property is beautiful, staff is great. They ran out of bacon at breakfast, and one of the waiters went in the kitchen and brought me a few pieces. TOTALLY made my day :)
Manager Response: Dear Sandra J,   Thank so very much for your review and thank you for choosing our hotel as well as for your continued patronage. Summary Heading: As always. A great place to eat
Summary: I have stayed here many many times. But when staying in August I was in a different hotel not too far away but decided to return to ayres on a Sunday vending to eat. I was greeted with open arms by the fantastic and lovely bar and restaurant staff. My girlfriend and I enjoyed a brilliant meal with amazing service. The prices here are also extremely good. Highly recommend this establishment for a great nights stay or a wonderfully dinning experience with brilliant staff. Thanks Guys.

Perfect plan for a good hotel. Lovely courtyard and the floors / plan was atrium style, which allowed a good view. Dinner was good and breakfast had a good variety. all staff were courteous and friendly. No complaints here!. rooms well appointed and spacious. Wifi good. Transport arrangements were perfectly organized by the hotel staff. the only draw back is if you fly in to LAX the drive is very long and a taxi fare can cost close to !50 USD from the airport to the hotel. i will definitely stay here again - but fly into John Wayne Airport.

Full breakfast with great service provided in the am. The suite was spotless, roomy, warm and inviting. Bed was comfortable. I would definitely stay here again and recommend others to stay as well.  Very pleasant experience. Thank you Ayres for making my stay a pleasant one.

Summary: It is a beautiful hotel. I spent 26 days there and it was better every day. It should be easier to use the points program. I would like to stay here again. The hotel is next to and in line with the airport so you are always in the flight oath for JWA but only until 10:00.

The staff was very friendly, they were very gracious about accommodating my 10 lb service dog and the area was nice and had shops and gas stations etc. very close by.

The house made yogurt was unbelievably delicious. Will go back!

Sil

The location is conveniently located near South Coast Plaza, Fashion Island and even just a quick drive to Newport Beach.  It is the perfect place to stay when visiting the OC.

Summary Heading: Real hidden charm of Costa Mesa.
Summary: We have been going to this hotel for many years, it never failed to amuse our family. the rooms are so clean and nicely decorated, the staffs are very courteous upon our arrival each every time, the foods are way at the top compare to other hotels, especially French breakfast. This hotel has earned its rating of 5 stars base on bang for the bucks, hand downs. We will continue to come back when we have a chance.

Summary: Overall, the value is terrific. They do a real good job with the decor in the common areas, interesting art and era furnishings.  Definitely not a cookie cutter feel.  We were able to stay here, but drive to the Ayers in Anaheim to catch a couple of Star Tours jaunts, and the inside of that was lovely as well. The rooms were clean, the wifi free and worked great, breakfast was really good.  Pools were a little small and looked a little neglected.  Front desk staff were friendly and helpful as well as the breakfast staff and housekeeping. The location is super convenient to all things OC, nearby convenience stores are nice for stocking up. Cookies in lobby were great when they had them, which leads me to my only complaint: I know that hotels need to be able to book multi-night
Manager Response: Dear uab9253,   Thank you kindly for taking to the time to write such great review about your recent experience at our hotel. We thank you again for your candid feedback and look forward to welcoming you back again to show you an experience even better than the last.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This hotel is wonderful!  The staff are so courteous, absolutely clean, big  rooms and such comfortable beds.  The breakfast was abundant and delicious.  I recommend you stay here and you will not be disappointed.

We appreciate your generous recommendation and hope you chose our hotel again for your next visit to Costa Mesa.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: Ayres Hotels are the BEST value in the business and this one is no exception. Beautiful lobby with classical music playing. Beautiful furniture throughout. Beautiful courtyard with a big fountain that doubles as outside dining for a VERY cool little bar and restaurant with great food. (Try the 4 hour pot roast with a glass of Pinot). The place has a very European European feel.  I've stayed a places twice the price and nowhere near as nice. First class all the way.

I've stayed here a couple of times. The second time I asked for a top floor because the first time I was woken up at 5am each morning by the jet-lagged flat-footed guest above me.   The room I was given this time was the furthest possible room away from the entrance, which was fine by me as I wasn't disturbed once. The room was left spotless each day and the attitude of all of the staff was warm, friendly and professional.   The whole place is very attractive and there are many areas outside of the suite to take advantage of. The restaurant serves great food, there are two pools and large lounges with very comfortable sofas.  The only downfalls are the shuttle bus, which is very unreliable, and the room service staff turn the aircon down to super cold instead of leaving it at

Summary Heading: Our wedding hotel for guests and ourselves
Summary: Our experience was...alright. The hotel is very nicely decorated, clean and has a nice courtyard and lobby area for gathering. I spent a few days going in and out as my entire wedding party and some guests stayed at this hotel for our wedding in Newport, about a 10 min drive away.   They were nice enough to set us up a very flexible block at a good rate for our guests. I was a bit irritated as the hotel had plenty of rooms that night and my groomsman needed a room last minute as his other plans for a place to sleep fell through. They accommodated him but charged him the full rate instead of the block rate, despite their extensive availability that evening.  I had talked up how nice our room would be to my fiance and arrived that evening with her as my wife. After reaching the
Manager Response: Dear PositiveRate23,   Thank you kindly for taking the time to share about your recent experience at our hotel. We truly appreciate your feedback as it helps to better service our guests. In regards to your recent stay, please accept our most sincere apology for the mix up that occurred with the amenity during your stay, however we are pleased to hear that this issue was eventually resolved. In regards to the room block rate, we are so sorry for the miscommunication that occurred with the room rate for your groomsman. Please know that we are always happy to honor a special group rate for our valued guests, however in order to receive this discounted rate, reservations must be booked before the negotiated cutoff date. Nevertheless, I apologize that this was not clearly communicated and thank you for your kind understanding. As for our breakfast, we do offer and extensive full American breakfast complimentary to our guests, and apply a nominal fee $10 dollars if our guests wish to invite others to join. We apologize however if just coffee was the case, and are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our breakfast selections.  Thank you once again for your candid feedback as well as compliments regarding our breakfast and staff and we will gladly use your suggestions as a way to help improve our service in the future. We would like to kindly encourage you to consider staying with us again in the future to demonstrate to you the service that we’re known for.  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: Breakfast was very nice. Definitely above average. Our room was nice. The bathroom was clean except for several hairs left in the toilet & sink. Not very appealing. Over all it was a decent, quiet place to stay.

My husband & I had rented a condo in Irvine for 12 nights only to be astounded by the poor condition of the property after we checked in.  We spent one night at the condo feeling as though we were being punished for something, yet we did not know for what?  We agreed to leave the next day and worry about the repercussions later (the landlord turned out to be a stand-up kind of guy and agreed to refund us our money).  We were now homeless, which I much preferred to that condo, so we either had to find another place to stay or we would have to cut our trip to Orange County to one night.  I don't know what site my husband was looking at online, but somehow he found Ayres Hotel & Suites and what a stroke of good fortune that turned out to be!  We had never heard of this hotel group,

It's clean! It's been clean each time I've stayed. The breakfast is good and it's a nice looking hotel. The employees are very nice. They recently added a coffee shop in the little strip mall next to the hotel that you can walk to which I loved. Good coffee and very friendly employees.
Manager Response: Dear Lori J,   Thank you so much for taking the time to write such a great review in regards to your recent stay at our hotel. We are pleased to hear that you have received the same exceptional customer service time after time. Coffee Nature truly is a new a great addition to the location! Thank you once again for the feedback and we hope to see you soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General manager

Summary: We booked this hotel because we were taking our son to college.  It was 2 miles away which was very convenient.  It was beautifully decorated. The breakfast was delicious.  The area to sit and eat breakfast was very peaceful and beautiful.  We asked for extra blankets and there were there within 4 or 5 minutes. Will definitely be staying here again when we visit our son at college.

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel and Suite-A Very Nice Hotel in Costa Mesa
Summary: On a recent trip to Newport Beach, we decided to save some money by staying in nearby Costa Mesa. There are good reasons why this hotel is the #1choice in Costa Mesa on Trip Advisor. Our room was large, pleasant and well-appointed, with a separate counter with sink and small fridge. Our room even had a small gas fireplace. Prices are reasonable, and a full breakfast buffet is included. Rooms are grouped around two open spaces, one with the pool and hot tub, and the other the open plaza of the Courtyard Restaurant. Those around the pool can be a bit noisy. In addition, the hotel is on the flight path to the nearby John Wayne Airport. These minor points aside, this is a very nice convenient hotel, only a short drive from Newport Beach.
Manager Response: Dear Martin R,   Thank you kindly for sharing your feedback about your recent experience at our hotel. It is truly pleasing to hear that you enjoyed your stay and appreciate your kind compliments in regards to the cleanliness of our hotel, services and amenities. We apologize for any noise inconveniences that may have occurred due to our close proximity to the airport and hope that this did not cause too much of a disturbance to your stay. In the future, we would like to kindly encourage you to please request a room located in a quieter part of the hotel. We try our very best to accommodate our valued guests' special requests. Thank you once again for your review and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary Heading: Party hotel, no parking, front desk overwhelmed
Summary: This weekend 8/16/,8/17. The pool area had over 100 people down there drinking and partying with coolers full of glass beer bottles and lots of kids(2 soccer teams). It was unsafe. They refused to all leave when security asked them to. We begged for towels for over 14 hours. They never came.Parking is free because you can't find a parking spot. We had to walk to a nearby shopping center about 3 blocks away. The front desk did try to listen and kept apologizing.It was like a college frat house. It wasn't good for families.
Manager Response: Dear francesca g,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a review about your recent experience at our hotel. Your feedback is very important as it helps better service our guests, both present and future. In regards to your recent stay, we are truly devastated to hear that you and your family found your stay to be anything less than remarkable. We pride ourselves on providing only the most comfortable and relaxing experience for our guests and I apologize that this was not the case during your stay. In regards to the pool area, we apologize for any disruption this you caused as well as for the lack of prompt service addressing this issue .Thank you for bringing this isolated incident  to my attention and for your kind understanding. That being said, we would like to kindly encourage you to return to our hotel, perhaps at a time when it is more suitable for your family so you can truly experience our exceptional service to the fullest. Thank you once again for your review.   Sincerely,    Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: This is a quaint, homey and lovely hotel.  They were very nice upon arrival.  The rooms are a nice size but there is only one sink in the bathroom which is annoying but its ok for a short stay.  The rooms is clean, and there is a coffee maker which I love .  They also have warm delicious cookies in the lobby in the early evening.  The complimentary buffet breakfast was a great surprise.  And not just Danish and coffee.  I mean a full American breakfast with yummy eggs, sausage, bacon, toast,oatmeal, cereals, fruit, etc.They even supplied cups to go,if you want to take a cup of coffee to your room.  I was impressed. I found there to be a lot of kids and families however but I think it was just because of summer so it was noisy at breakfast. On the plus side, they even gave us a
Manager Response: Dear Thebestofeverything,   Thank you kindly for taking the time to share about your recent experience at our hotel.  In regards to your recent stay, we are pleased to hear you took advantage of some of our great amenities such as our complimentary full American breakfast as well as our freshly baked bookies. Thank you again for your generous recommendation and we will be patiently waiting for your return!   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary Heading: Our first experience with the Ayres Hotel
Summary: We very much enjoyed the Hotel. From our arrival, we were assisted by a polite, courteous professional who treated us as guest and welcomed us.  The hotel was beautifully decorated and clean. We felt like we were in a luxury and very warm setting.  We were very comfortable staying and enjoying the fire place, entrance area, restaurant, pool and spa area and our room overlooking the court yard area.  We were amazed in the quality and prize of our stay.  We will diffidently be coming back.  We also enjoyed the fine dinning and recreation and amusement venues near by.

I stayed here for 4 nights to attend a wedding in Newport Beach.  The shuttle arrived at the airport within 10 minutes.  For those who are not familiar with John Wayne airport, the shuttle waiting area is outside the airport between columns 5 and 6.  The shuttle drivers were courteous.  I also took the 12pm shuttle back to the airport.  The reception staff was welcoming.  I arrived after 3pm and appreciated the cold drinking water in the lobby.  There were cookies around 6pm on Sunday.  Also The room was clean with a king bed and a large LG flat screen TV.  There were a desk and leather chair, a drawer chest, a leather love seat, full length mirror, a coffee maker with coffee bags, a sink outside the bathroom and a small fridge.  Towels were thick and clean.  The bed was very

We stayed in the hotel part of this hotel and suites. The room had two comfortable queen beds, a large closet with lots of hangers (a rarity in most hotels), a small refrigerator and places for two to do their hair and makeup. Our section is built around two coutyards... One has tables, a fountain and flowers which is perfect for breakfast (complimentary). The other has a pool, jacuzzi and cabanas. This hotel is right on the edge of the John Wayne Airport so there is airplane noise but it does not start until 7 a.m. on Saturday and 8 am on Sunday.  This is a very convenient place to stay for the Laguna Beach Pageant of the Masters you can avoid the Canyon and drive down the coast. Free Wi Fi is included.

My family and I stayed in a one bedroom suite.  The room was perfect for us as we could let our daughter sleep and still be able to relax in the living room.  Everything was clean and well kept even for what looked to be an older hotel.  The hotel staff was always friendly and willing to help.  This is right next to John Wayne airport so you do hear jets flying by all day long but really isn't noticeable while in the room.  The beach area is ~15 minutes away as long as you take back roads.  If you take the highway it will consistently take much longer due to traffic.  Besides breakfast, we didn't eat at the restaurant so I can't comment on their food.  Breakfast was ok, would have liked a little more variety but it was decent and included so not much to complain about there.

My wife and I came from Santa Barbara for each of us to eye operations at NVision about 1 mile from Ayres Hotel and Suites. Everything went great from our checking in and being warmly greeted to the beautiful suite. We also dined in their restaurant and enjoyed an excellent meal Breakfast the next morning was one of the best if not the best we have ever had!

We stayed for 4 nights in the Suites.  The room was very clean and nice and large.  Loved the extra dressing mirror and table outside the bathroom.  Made it easy for me to do makeup while other family members were in the shower.  The hotel staff was very professional and pleasant.  The housekeeping service even organized our many pairs of shoes!  The location is right at the end of the runway for John Wayne airport so you do hear jet engines.  However, we never heard them at night or early am.  We really weren't in the room during the day.  It was great to have a laundry on site.  Also with the location, it is located on a one way street (Bristol) so it was a little bit of a pain to get in and out.  Had to make U turns.  Would definitely stay here again if in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Denise W,   Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor to let other know about your recent stay at our hotel. We strive to provide exceptional customer service to all of our valued guests, and we are so glad that we did just that during your stay.Thank you once again for your generous recommendation\ and we look forward to welcoming you back again soon!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: Quaint hotel!  Great price for the size of the rooms!  Super friendly staff who are willing to help in anyway they can.  We got the king suite and it was the perfect size.  The bed and pillows were so comfortable, really wanted to take a pillow home!  The restaurant had great food but we felt it was a little pricey for what they offered.  Overall, great hotel for a great price.

I booked a room and a conference room for business. The shuttle driver was polite and got to the airport within 5 minutes of me calling the front desk. Make sure you go across the street to the shuttle area! I almost missed it.   The room is spotless and smelled nice, like soap. The hotel itself is not new, but it's very clean throughout and the garden and fountain are beautiful. Pool looks nice. The food from the hotel restaurant was pretty good, (I ordered room service and the waiter who delivered my meal was incredibly polite and they called me to give me an update on the food and tell me exactly when it would be delivered (I guess to make sure I wasn't in the shower or something). I got the Angus burger with Blue cheese and it was a huge portion.   My only complaint (and
Manager Response: Dear Trekkie_Fan,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to share about your recent experience on TripAdvisor! It is wonderful to hear that we were able to meet your transportation needs in a timely fashion and that you were able to indulge in some of the delicious food that Le Chateau has to offer. We appreciate your kind compliments in regards to our rooms, the cleanliness of our rooms, and your overall hotel experience. Thank you again for your review and we hope to welcome you back again soon!   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: After researching many hotels in this area, I settled on this one.  It was the perfect location between South Coast Plaza and Fashion Island where my friend and I enjoyed 2 nights for a girlfriends getaway.  The staff was lovely and the room was a perfect size for us to share with two queen beds and a seating area with a desk.  The morning breakfast was better than I anticipated and the outside pool area was perfect for relaxing. I am already looking forward to going back with my husband for a couples retreat.  I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who likes charm with ease, convenience and customer service.
Manager Response: Dear Tracy G,   Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor about your recent experience at our hotel. We are so pleased to hear that you were able to enjoy your recent getaway and that our friendly customer service team was able to cater to you. We truly appreciate your compliments about our hotel and amenities and are delighted that we were able to exceed your expectations. Thank you once again for your kind words and we look forward to welcoming you back on your Couple’s Retreat!   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary Heading: The Best of the Ayres Hotels I've Stayed At
Summary: The Ayres Hotels are a really good choice if you're coming to Southern California.  We've stayed in four different ones -- and three of them were great (Ayres Inn in Orange is a "pit" in comparison to the others.  Two pools and spas, two breakfast rooms, jetted tub in bathroom -- a lot better than staying in one of the big chain hotels in the area.  AND free parking!
Manager Response: Dear bluejay19golf,   Thank you kindly for taking the time to share a review about your recent stay and for your patronage! We truly appreciate your generous feedback and recommendation of all of our Ayres properties and are pleased that we were able to exceed your expectations. Thank you once again for your review and we would love to welcome you back very soon!   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: This was my second time staying at this property for work. I knew I would be arriving late after making the 6 hour drive, so I called around 9pm (Thursday evening) to let the hotel know and asked about the possibility of a late checkout. The woman I spoke with said she would make a note about my late arrival but said I would need to check with the morning person about a late checkout as she wasn't authorized to do that. When I did arrive (4am), the gentleman told me that he was in the middle of "rolling over" the account data and that I would need to wait in the lobby for about 10 minutes before he would be able to help me. After the long drive, every minute was painful. When he was able to help me, he was confused about when I was leaving and couldn't seem to find my
Manager Response: Dear Lindsey S,   Thank you kindly for your candid review, your feedback is greatly appreciated. Although we did not exceed your expectations, nor our own, it is feedback such as yours that we learn from and use to improve our service as a whole. Please accept our most sincere apology for the several inconveniences you experienced during your stay, from the complications during check in, to the lack of cleanliness of your room.  We strive our best to deliver an exceptional guest experience at it saddens us that this was not the case during your stay, although we truly appreciate your patience and understanding. Nevertheless, we are grateful to hear that you were thoroughly impressed with our full American breakfast as well as our convenient location. We thank you so much for your review and hope we are able to one day show you the service we are known for.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: I made and cancelled reservations at three other establishments before stumbling on Ayres Hotel & Suites. The rooms were clean, the beds very comfortable, and the complimentary breakfast excellent.  Front desk staff were professional, friendly, and efficient. The only negative is that their drinks are quite pricey...but perhaps this is the norm for that area of the world.  I loved their garden area for dining or socializing.  This is the place I would stay if ever in that area again!
Manager Response: Dear jgk809,   Thank you kindly for taking the time to share your review on TripAdvisor. We truly appreciate your feedback and all the kind compliments you shared about our hotel. We strive our best to deliver quality customer service and we're glad we were able to do just that during your stay. Thank you once again for your  generous recommendation and we hope to see you again very soon!   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: I am a professional traveler/business guy and I have never encountered such a rude front desk clerk im my career. the room smeeled like moth balls and found hairs in the sink. I always wander why the maid doenst lift the bathtub plug when she is done cleaning. parking is a real problem as well. Airport noice is a big problem
Manager Response: Dear Steve R,   Thank you kindly for taking the time share about your recent experience at our hotel. In regards to your recent stay, we are truly saddened to hear that your stay was anything less than exceptional. Please accept our most sincere apologies in regards to the unprofessionalism you experienced with our staff as well as the unfortunate issues that occurred with the cleanliness of your room. Please know that these isolated incidents are not typical of our service, and I truly apologize that we did not exceed your expectations, nor our own. I certainly empathize regarding the points you mentioned and have addressed these issues thoroughly. We truly appreciate your understanding and hope that we are one day able to demonstrate the service we are known for. Thank you again for you review and candid feedback.    Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary Heading: I loved staying at the Ayres Hotel
Summary: The rooms were clean.  The windows opened.  The air conditioner was quiet and cold.  The water pressure of the shower was perfect.  The location was perfect for going to Laguna Beach, Huntington Beach and Costa Mesa.  The airport is literally 5 minutes away so there are a lot of planes passing by, but that did not bother me much.  There are 2 pools and a hot tub.  To access your rooms you have to walk through outside corridors which I loved!  I stayed in the middle of June and the weather was beautiful.  The breakfast was awesome too!  Eggs, potatoes, bacon, waffles or pancakes (it alternated each day), fruit, toast, muffins and coffee.  They even have the coffee flavoring they use at Starbucks and lids for the cups so you can take the coffee with you.  I have traveled a lot and

I reserved 5 rooms, and changed them around a couple of times. Which is always a pain, but I spoke with Jackie, Gina, and Kimberly at different times but all were excellent. Very nice, helpful, and knew what they were doing. So I spoke with a manager Corrina (I think) to let her know how great I think her staff is. Then when we checked into the hotel we spoke with Melissa a few times, and again great service. She was helpful and personable. The hotel itself was beautiful overall. I think the pool might need some love, but it was clean and quiet. The only complaint would be you can hear planes going by during the day, so if your napping this might be a problem. But they don't seem to fly at night. The bed was comfortable, room decor was nice, overall a great stay for a great

This is my first time staying at an Ayres Hotel, and I was pleased to see that the nice decor and pictures featured on their website reflected the reality of staying there. I was VERY impressed by how polished and well-kept everything was. Check-in was quick and efficient, made sure you knew all the essentials for your stay, and the staff was friendly despite being busy.  My room was spotless, well-kept, and exactly what I needed. The bed was comfortable with clean sheets and bedding, wifi access was solid. The bathroom was very clean, featured a nice jacuzzi option, and it actually had an exhaust fan so it would not turn into a rainforest after spending 15 minutes in a hot shower.  I will definitely book again!

Clean and comfortable room.staff was very accommodating since we had arrived a day early they were able to get us a room that we could stay in for both nights without having to switch rooms the next day. Amazing breakfast!! If you're a fan of bacon...this is the place to go!

My family and I enjoyed our stay ate the Ayres Hotel so much. The atmosphere was wonderful,we enjoyed the beautiful artwork and ambiance of the hotel immensely. The hotel was so clean, orderly, comfortable, and peaceful. The staff was extremely polite, and helpful. I would definitely recommend staying there.

The  rooms were very nice and had a "non-chain" feeling. Breakfast got boring. Staff was sometimes aloof.but Melissa was refreshingly kind and caring. We were disappointed with our room location. Rooms at the back of the hotel overlook the housekeeping facility, with bins of laundry and trash. There were also hallways being used as temporary storage areas.

Summary Heading: A great place to stay near the airport
Summary: The facility is lovely and smells nice, it feels like an upscale hotel but not too pricey.  The staff are very nice.  The friendly desk agent Gina helped me out when my reservation had been accidentally cancelled, and she got me another room right away.  The included breakfast was very good, a full hot buffet with bacon and eggs and oatmeal and fruit.  I will definitely stay there again.

I always stay here when I have meetings or events in the area. The rooms are spacious, the beds, linens and pillows are luxurious, the breakfast is always nice and the prices are reasonable, what more could you ask for? What I really like about this hotel is that I get a good nights sleep, not always the case at other hotels.

Summary Heading: Very nice, clean place close to many attractions
Summary: We spent 3 nights at the Ayres hotel. If you can get one of the one bedroom suites you will be happy. This is an older, very well maintained hotel. None of the typical smells in many OC/LA hotels. I really like the courtyard where you can eat or just relax around the fountain and flowers. When outside your room you will likely hear the planes from John Wayne airport take off. If you are staying there on a busy weekend, you may not be able to check in before 3 PM. Our 3rd floor one bedroom suite was very nicely decorated, clean and Quiet. You are only a couple miles from World Class shopping at the South Coast Plaza. About 5 minutes from Newport Beach and 20 minutes to Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm. I might add if you are flying into the area, the John Wayne Airport (SNA) is

So far, this is our favorite hotel in SoCal.  The service is excellent, it is beautiful.  It was close to everyplace we had to be in Irvine, as well as a quick trip to the beaches and Disneyland.  Also, their complimentary breakfast is excellent with a variety of choices.

We have made a habit of staying at Ayres every time we visit the Orange County area.  The overall value cannot be beat.  The complimentary breakfast is a big bonus, the rooms are nice, location is great, and the hotel staff is beyond helpful.  This time we dined in the restaurant and enjoyed that as well.

Summary Heading: Don't plan on sleeping in pass 7am
Summary: Had a chance to stay for a few nights & the overall room was ok, location was so so & found out the hard way that the John Wayne airport is right next to this hotel. The take off planes rumbled the room (as well as anyone that can't sleep thru an earthquake) at 7am sharp! The continental breakfast was ok. We have stayed at a few other Ayres & we have always had a great stay. May think twice about this location for the future.
Manager Response: Dear SCook333,   Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a review about your experience at our hotel. In regards to your recent stay, please accept our most sincere apology for your stay being anything less than exceptional. We pride ourselves on delivering only the best service to our guests and I apologize in failing to exceed your expectations. Although we are located a short distance from the John Wayne Airport, please know that we do have some rooms available located a little further away from the airport, which are generally quieter. We always try our very best to accommodate our guests special requests and again apologize for any noise inconveniences. Thank you again for your candid feedback. We appreciate your understanding and would like to kindly encourage you to reconsider staying with us again.  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: This hotel came very highly recommended and it met every expectation.  Beautiful hotel, very nice rooms, very good hot breakfast, very helpful and friendly staff.  Convenient location near freeways, shopping, dining, etc.  Would love to stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Jason K,   Thank you for taking the time to write such a great review about your stay at our hotel! We are so pleased to hear that we met your expectations. We appreciate your kind compliments about our clean and comfortable rooms, delicious full American breakfast and the  friendliness of our staff.  We are truly pleased that you enjoyed your stay at out hotel and hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: Outstanding hotel experience! All staff members were very courteous and competent. The property is very clean, has a rich decorum with an enjoyable classical music sound track quietly playing, and is well maintained. Our Suite style room was very nice, clean and comfortable. Included in the room rate is a quality breakfast. This Ayres Hotel & Suites is only a 5 minute shuttle van ride from John Wayne / Santa Ana Airport. Be aware that the hotel is located very near the end of the airport runway and the aircraft take off noise is noticeable, however, it is short term and tolerable. Only a 10 minute drive to Newport Beach, 10 minute drive to a shopping mall or expanded restaurant selection, 14 miles (40 minute CA drive) to Disneyland. I highly recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear Wendi H,   Thank you kindly for your review and for choosing our location as your destination. We are truly overjoyed to hear that you had an outstanding experience at our hotel! We strive to deliver the best customer service possible and it is truly delightful to hear that we did just that during your stay. Thank you for your review and for your recommendations, we look forward to your next visit!   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manger

Summary: We just wrapped up a GREAT 10 day stay at the Ayres Hotel and Suites I cant remember a 10 day hotel stay that I didn't find at least have one or two things to complain about!!  Well not at the Ayres property. The place is in a good location to get around, the rooms are clean and spacious, the staff is awesome from front desk to food and maid service!!!  I would highly recommend this hotel for any type of stay.  PS the flight pattern for SNA goes over the hotel but starts around 7AM and ends at around 9PM so there are some times when the pool or courtyard areas get noisy!! Still great!
Manager Response: Dear Richard M,   Thank you so much for your candid review and for choosing our location for your 10 day extended stay destination. We are overjoyed to hear that our hotel was able to exceed your expectations and truly appreciate your kind compliments about our hotel service and amenities. Thank you again for your review and we look forward to welcoming you back soon!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary Heading: Nobody Told us that this Hotel is located right at thé End of an Airport runway!!!!!!!!
Summary: Ubearable noise from airplanes taking off from The airport right next to This  hotel starting  every morning at 07.00 am and not ending until 11 pm.  Hotel rooms older in mexican Style with a Nice courtyard in The middle.  No double glazed Windows to reduce the aircraft noise
Manager Response: Dear hasse13,   Thank you kindly for your feedback about your recent stay at our hotel. We’re truly sorry that your sleep was disrupted due to the noise of the airplanes and thank you for your understanding. In the future, we would like to encourage you to please request a room located farthest away from the direction of the airport in order to ensure a quieter stay. We always try our very best to accommodate our guests special requests. Thank you again for your candid feedback and we only hope you will reconsider staying with us again in the future.    Sincerely,   Susan O’Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed here after flying into Orange County and had easy access to all the attractions in the area.  Interesting décor with nautical theme and even some Ayres family history, overall very nice feel.  Microwaves are available for every floor, which helped with some meal prep, and an above average hot breakfast was included with our room.  Combined with a helpful staff, we were very happy with our stay and would return.  Only con is access can be difficult depending on which direction you are arriving on Bristol St., try to arrive from the SW or NW.
Manager Response: Dear Tim C,   Thank you kindly for your TripAdvisor review and for choosing our hotel for your recent stay.  It is pleasing to hear that you were able to enjoy our complimentary full American breakfast and that you received excellent service from our staff. We always strive to provide only the best service for our valued guests and love hearing feedback such as yours! Once again, we are ecstatic to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and look forward to welcoming you back.  Warm Regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: Very classy for the price. Very clean and up to date. The airport is 3 minutes away. The breakfast was prepared every morning and it wasnt just rolls and donuts. Eggs, bacon and pancakes or french toast and diced potatoes. This was included in the room cost. I have paid alot more for alot less. I would definatly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Randy F,   Thank you for taking the time to share a review about your experience at our hotel! It is pleasing to hear that you enjoyed your stay and we thank you for your compliments regarding our delicious Complimentary Full American Breakfast. We do our best to provide only the best services to ensure an excellent stay and were so delighted to hear that we were able to exceed your expectations. Thank you again for your generous review and for your recommendation of our hotel!   Sincerely ,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: Stayed here with my wife in June 2014. I've visited SoCal for over 20 yrs and never knew this place existed. I stayed away from fear that is was near the airport and also it was in an industrial area right off the 73. Stayed because my usual spots were booked or had jacked up the prices in-season. I feared my wife wouldn't like it because it wasn't a name brand. She landed before me and checked in first (I had a business appt). She called me and I asked her how she liked it. I was prepared to move after the first night. But, she said she loved it. Very quaint and European in feel. She told me she was sitting in the courtyard by the water statue drinking a glass of wine.    That alone is an endorsement. My wife is a name-brand snob and is not a fan of exterior entrance hotels due

My mother in law and I stayed for one night. She and I really appreciated the location; its near the freeway entrance and also near shops! We also liked the pool and spa. The room was very clean and nice. The only issue we had was our room was located directly above the laundry room and we heard the machines running all night long.   Overall, hotel is great!
Manager Response: Dear carmella n,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor about your recent experience at our hotel. Please accept our most sincere apology in regards to any noise disturbances that you experienced due to the sound of laundry room.  In the future, we would like to kindly encourage you to inform our staff members about any noise issues to ensure that your stay is as comfortable as possible. We always do our very best to make sure that our guests are comfortable and appreciate your understanding for these noise disturbances. Thank you again for your candid review and we hope to see you again soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary Heading: This hotel is beautiful, immaculate and every employee was helpful and friendly.
Summary: We were very happy with our stay.  The hotel is decorated beautifully and the guest rooms and common areas are spotless.  The staff are very friendly and went out of their way to help us when we asked for area recommendations.  We will definitely stay here again when we visit Southern California.

Had a great family stay.  The room we were first given was not what we reserved.  I was required to show my copy of the reservation confirmation, and I was then offered the room style we had booked.  I was told they only had one room left, so I think if we were any later we may not have been able to get the room we reserved.The room was clean and very comfortable.  Shuttle was nice, but be aware it only runs 4 times per day! Breakfast was great.  Afternoon cookies a big hit with the kids!  Will definitely book again!  We have stayed at Ayres in another location...that was very nice, but this was even better!  Thanks!
Manager Response: Dear JS201450,   Thank you so much for your review on TripAdvisor! We are ecstatic to hear that you and your family were able to enjoy your recent stay at our hotel. We apologize for any inconveniences that occurred during check in, however are glad that we were able to resolve the issue with your room type. We appreciate your kind compliments about our delicious full American breakfast and loved hearing that your children enjoyed our special touch of the  freshly baked cookies. Thank you again for your generous recommendation and we look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: A wonderful mini vacation with a home away from home atmosphere. After dinner we had cookies and played checkers. Nice peaceful evening. The breakfast was great it was very convenient and comfortable. Everyone was on their "A" game.  Thanks.

Summary Heading: My stay at the Ayres Hotel Costa Mesa
Summary: My daughter and I spent a lovely weekend at the Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa.  The staff was extremely accommodating as soon as we checked in.  Our room was clean and inviting, and the continental breakfast was very nice.  The lobby was beautiful.  We have stayed at an Ayres Hotel in the past, and what especially brought me back was their willingness to allow us to stay just one night on a weekend.  They are one of few hotels in the area which was willing to do that.  Other hotels required a two-night stay.  I would definitely go back again and highly recommend it.

I've stayed here several times and this time had a problem with reserving the right room. They made a mistake ( which happens) but they went overboard correcting it. Moving us up to the Execurive Suite. Everyone on staff accommodated us from the room cleaners to the restaurant staff!!! The know what "customer service" means!!

The outdoor patio was really private & a nice way to drink coffee and relax.  The only negative was the proximity to the airport.  During the day you hear airplanes.  Average room a but outdated.  Very clean overall.  I saw several employees cleaning throughout the day.
Manager Response: Dear Christine H,   Thank you so much for taking the time to write a TripAdvisor review. In regards to your recent stay, I would also like to offer my most sincere apology for any noise disturbances due to the close proximity of the John Wayne Airport. Nevertheless, we truly appreciate your kind compliments in regards to our serene patio and courtyard area as well as our clean comfortable rooms. We thank you again for your candid review and patronage and kindly encourage you to consider staying with us again. Thank you again for  your feedback!  Warm Regards,  Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: If possible, I stay at Ayres hotels when I can. Great service at an exceptional price. Rooms are spacious. Also have a great restaurant with an outdoor patio setting to enjoy the weather. Friendly and courteous staff.
Manager Response: Dear Erl E.,   It is fantastic to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. From our bountiful American breakfasts to our friendly and knowledgeable staff, we work hard to provide many different services to create experiences like yours. Thank you for making us your destination and we look forward to seeing you welcoming you back in the future!  Warm Regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My daughter and I stayed here back in April and we both enjoyed the resort. This was our first time staying at this chain and we definitely will making this a "go to" brand.  Service was excellent.  The hotel was beautiful and well maintained.  Back of house staff was friendly as well.the front desk staff.  Breakfast was a great option and we really enjoyed the variety.

Summary Heading: very good value, just need to work on gym & breakfast
Summary: nice hotel, friendly staff, very good restaurant menu and food quality. clean and comfortable. gym way too small for the hotel size and the clientele, need to improve breakfast quality and vary menu choices

We were there with a wedding party.  I was impressed with the quality of the hotel.  Very quiet & clean.  I also liked the decor & the overall aura of the place.  The staff was very professional and unobtrusive. The small downsides were the small selection & never changing breakfast buffet items, (we were there for six days) and the housekeeper who almost never left all the toiletries or coffee items in the room.  These were small problems compared to the beauty, quietness and comfort of the hotel.  We would highly recommend this hotel.

Great hotel for a vacation.  The courtyards and open air feel were very relaxing after a long day at the beach.  Service was excellent and the breakfast is a great way to start your day.  Highly recommend for anyone traveling to Orange County for vacation.  Conveniently located and a great value.
Manager Response: Dear Bart A,   Thank you kindly for your review and for choosing our hotel for your recent vacation! We're very pleased that you were able to take full advantage of our delicious complimentary Full American Breakfast as well as relax in our Courtyard. Once again, thank you so very much for your lovely review and especially for your generous recommendations. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: Was a very good experience!  A real nice facility and staff. A very clean hotel with a friendly staff.  A wonderful complimentary breakfast.  Convenient to airport with free shuttle service. Would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Naomi L,   Thank you kindly for taking the time to share about your recent experience at our hotel. We truly appreciate your feedback! Delivering excellent customer service is our top priority and it is delighting to hear that you found our staff to be so friendly and accommodating. Thank you again for your lovely compliments about our hotel and we can't wait to welcome you back in the future!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: Stayed here a few times.  The decor and service put it a step above all the hotel chains with similar rates.  Almost feels like a bed and breakfast at times..   The complimentary breakfast is quite good and seating in a comfortable outdoor plaza with a European feel.    Other hotels in this chain has the same feels.  Its our favorite place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear Ron E,   Thank you kindly for taking the time to share about your recent experience at our hotel!  We appreciate your kind compliments about our European boutique inspired decor as well as friendly service from our staff. We're always striving to deliver the best customer service and its wonderful to hear we exceeded your expectations. Thank you again for your kind review and for your patronage!   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: This is a great hotel. It was nice and quiet when we were here. The room was clean and the staff was helpful. We arrived early and our room was not ready. So while we enjoyed lunch in the restaurant, they prepared our room and we were able to get in to the room early. This is a great property!

Once again we were very happy with our stay, although it was only for one night this time. We picked this one for our anniversary and it was well worth it. High class but budget friendly. Warm welcome and check-in,very nice large room with microwave and mini fridge and whirlpool tub. Free wi-fi and breakfast are also included. It is near the airport, but that wasn't an issue. Easy access from the freeway and minutes away from fine dining and shopping. The hotel is well maintained and so romantic. The other property was in Seal Beach and I would recommend both and would definitely stay again! Thank you Aryes family!

This hotel surprised us. The best; Nice rooms, good room prices, full breakfast, exercise room, pool, airport shuttle and friendly staff. Close to Newport, Anaheim,The only downside is the exercise room, old and not very good.

This is a great property - quiet, very comfortable, and very friendly staff. Great Pool. Gym is small,  but enough for me. I am a regular here and i just love the place. Would go there again and again!

It was great having the full breakfast available.  Pretty clean rooms & bathrooms.  A bit muggy inside but I'm from dry weather so I may be a humidity-wimp.  Fitness center was pretty small but standard and appreciated.  Could use more outlets next to the beds but appreciated the usb hook-ups.
Manager Response: Dear raqueLandefeld,   Thank you kindly for sharing about your experience at our hotel. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our Full American Breakfast, clean and comfortable rooms and overall experience at our hotel. We appreciate your suggestion about placing more outlets and USB hookups in the guest rooms. We’re always looking for ways to improve our service and will definitely taking your suggestion into consideration. Thank you again for your sharing your feedback and we look forward to welcoming you back in the future!   Warm Regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: A very opulent hotel with great staff
Summary: Stayed two nights for a nearby web conference. I was very impressed by the service and the decor. The breakfast buffet was great. I got a 'VIP' card that gets you discounts at local stores but I didn't use it.  Check out the bar Dirty Nelly's across the street. It's in walking distance and has a great staff.

I stayed at this hotel with my 4 year old, 2 year old, and newborn.  I loved the free breakfast, free wifi, and free parking!  The breakfast was yummy!  Eggs, Bacon, French toast, potatoes, fresh fruit, oatmeal, muffins, cereal....my family stocked up!  The man who checked us in, Chase, was super helpful and helped me to get a great room.  The pool area is really beautiful, as well as the outdoor breakfast tables around a fountain.    The room was nice, though a bit underwhelming.  Our view was really ugly, so we just shut the curtains.  I imagine that a room overlooking the fountain area would be best, and next time we stay here, that's what we'll ask for!    The hotel is right by the airport, but I didn't really notice any noise, besides when we were outside eating breakfast.

Enjoyed my business trip w/my stay at Ayre's Hotel.  Staff was always friendly, great breakfast brunch each a.m.  Nice restauant for dinner, drinks & relaxing.   Loved the patio area where we could sit outside in the morning and relax.     Rooms were clean.  Lobby was always clean Airport RIGHT next door and I never once heard a plane from inside my room.    Recommended stay!
Manager Response: Dear Linda H,   Thank you kindly for you genuine review! We appreciate your kind compliments and are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our beautiful property as much as we do. Once again, thank you again for your review and we look forward to welcoming you back in the future!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I was referred here by my company and I can see why. This place is an EXCELLENT value. Great accommodations. The room was very clean and comfortable. Le Chateau is a little expensive but great food. The décor rivals the best hotels.

Summary Heading: Stay there for business and love it
Summary: I always stay here when in town for business. This is not your typical hotel room.  It is more like a mini vacation every time i stay there!  Glad that I was introduced to the Ayres.  I have stayed there many many times. Always a great experience.

My family was in town for a wedding/family reunion. We all stayed at the Ayres hotel because they gave us a good rate. Everyone enjoyed this hotel because there was a good breakfast included and there was a courtyard area where we could sit and enjoy catching up with family. The staff was very attentive and accommodating to our needs. Will definitely stay there again if in the area.

what a friendly staff!  From the time we walked in to the time we walked out!  What a beautiful hotel!  My husband and I had a wedding to attend in Newport Bluffs and they offered a shuttle service to take us and pick us up!  What an awesome service!  The room was very comfortable as well was the bed!  Complimentary breakfast the next morning was also a very nice perk!  We would not hesitate to recommend or stay at the Ayes anytime we need a hotel in CostaMesa/Newport!  Wish we had time to enjoy the pool and spa........next time :))
Manager Response: Dear Cyndi B.,  Thank you kindly for taking the time write a review on TripAdvisor and for choosing our hotel!  In regards to your recent stay, we were delighted to read your lovely compliments about our European inspired hotel, Full American Breakfast and the complimentary shuttle service.   We are glad you were able to enjoy your one night getaway and would love to welcome you back in the near future so you can enjoy our pool and spa!   Thank you again for your review and recommendation.   Warm Regards,   Susan O’Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Friendly staff! Great rooms! Complimentary breakfast buffet with all the fixings! Beautiful decor! Will stay here again. Close to all major attractions in Newport and Costa Mesa area. Great place to stay if you will be attending Newport Beach Jazz festival in May. This hotel was about 4 miles from venue. Saw a lot of other jazz festival attendees at this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Sula0020,   Thank you kindly for taking the time write a review on TripAdvisor!   We appreciate your kind words about our hotel and are delighted that you enjoyed our buffet breakfast and found our European inspired decor to be beautiful. Our designers put a lot of thought into the decor for each Ayres property and it is very gratifying to hear compliments such as yours.    Thank you again for taking the time to share about your stay and we look forward to welcoming you back soon, or for your next trip to the Jazz festival!  Warm Regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary Heading: The perfect get away in Costa Mesa
Summary: Very rarely do you find such a great hotel where every member of staff so obliging and the food way above the average experience but it was such a pleasant stay.  Ample parking, close to restaurants, great facilities, including a swimming pool and Jacuzzi pool.  The rooms are very comfortable and nicely sound proofed yet only 10-15 mins away from John Wayne Airport (via free shuttle)  I hope they keep up these great standards - it's a real gem.
Manager Response: Dear MSimmonds,   Thank you very much for taking the time to write such a generous review about your recent stay  We truly appreciate the kind remarks you had to share about our convenient location, cozy and comfortable rooms and the excellent service you received from all of our staff members.   Delivering the most sincere hospitality and service is what we aim for every day and we are pleased to hear that your expectations were exceeded.  Thank you again for taking the time to share about your recent stay and we look forward to being of service for your next trip to Costa Mesa!   Sincerely,   Susan O’Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here at the Ayers Hotel. The front desk staff were all very friendly and helpful upon check-in and throughout the entire stay. I stayed in the suites tower which had clean rooms and helpful cleaning staff. My room was comfortable and I lives having a refrigerator and microwave in my room. The breakfast is fantastic. The pools are nice---but I wish they had more lounge chairs as the pool was very busy the day I went. The location is great for food, shopping, and recreation. Very convenient for travelers as the hotel provides airport transportation to the nearby Orange County airport. I highly recommend this hotel and thanks to the staff for the wonderful stay!

Very beautiful hotel. I had a room on the ground level. I could not hear any noise at all above me or around (except the occasional plane taking off from the airport which wasn't bad at all). the restaurant on sight was fabulous! i couldn't be more pleased. The pool area in main building was very nice. The one in the other building closer to the back was nice too however it always takes just one or two guests to make it unpleasant as happens everywhere. i wanted to relax in the hot tub but a father and son were monopolizing it while dads music blarring over the hotel speakers and the son head first in the water feet flaying about with pool toys all around him.REALLY??? in the hot tub? Seriously folks get in the pool with that stuff. Let other people enjoy the tub too geez...
Manager Response: Dear Sunfire4u,   Thank you kindly for your candid review and for choosing our hotel for your recent stay! We truly appreciate your kind words and are pleased to hear that you enjoyed Le Chateau Garden Bistro, as well as our beautiful hotel rooms!    I would also like to offer my apologies for the inconveniences that occurred during your time by the pool. In the future, I encourage you to please bring any disturbance issues to the attention of our guest service agents, so we can do our best to reach a compromise with any noise issues.   Once again thank you for choosing our hotel and we look forward to welcoming you back in the future!   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: Stayed for 3 days at this great place.  Clean, spacious, very comfortable beds and pillows, nice in-house restaurant. Awesome helpful staff, beautiful courtyard, full breakfast buffet and a free shuttle within 5 miles--we followed the desk clerk and the driver's advice and headed to a wonderful dinner and stroll on Balboa Island. We will stay here again.

We were in town for my brother's wedding and my only wish would be that we could have spent more time at the hotel. Definitely do happy hour/dinner in the courtyard if your trip allows, the food was delicious and the staff was wonderful. The pool/ hot tub area is beautiful!

Good location. Easy excess from freeways. Plenty of parking. Nice, clean room. Friendly staff. I wish they had different option in option in breakfast for vegetarians other wise food is good too. Close to airport.

I found the staff to be curteous, helpful and friendly and with the renovations the facility to be completely satisfactory.  Their free breakfasts were simple but solid and the restaurant (only did lunch one day) had great service and the fare was first (I would suggest the ahi tuna with radish sprouts sandwich:this was melt in your mouth awesome.  There are also a number of reasonably priced restaurants within easy walking distance as well with good eats. Rooms are good sized with a comfortable bed and reasonably fast internet. I give it an A+ for the overall experience.

Summary Heading: Great affordable hotel for business or pleasure
Summary: The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful.  The food was good and the room was clean and comfortable. The common areas were comfortable and surrounded in art work.  Being so close to the airport and not far from Newport Beach, I would definitely stay here again for business or pleasure.

We stay at the Ayres several times a year because of the convenience and the comfort.  It is a great hotel and the staff is extremely helpful.  The hotel is clean and comfortable and the restaurant is great.  It is convenient to John Wayne Airport and shopping.  Great place to stay, always my first choice.

I have lived in this area on & off for many years and have driven past this hotel numerous times always wondering why people would stay there. It's located in a random place at the end of the John Wayne Airport takeoff runway and not really near anything noteworthy without having to drive there. This hotel seems to be frequented by airline pilots, flight attendants, business travelers and surprisingly quite a few families.When I found myself needing a place to stay that was close to my families home in Corona Del Mar I took a chance on the #1 Trip Advisor rated hotel in Costa Mesa and booked a junior suite with hotels.com. Upon arrival I was immediately impressed with the decor. It's very European with a nautical flare and features many framed photographs of what the area looked

I stayed at the Ayres for a week while on a business trip.  The shuttle to and from the John Wayne Airport was great and to be able to use the shuttle to anywhere within a 5 mile radius was also a plus.  The rooms on the first floor were a bit noisy due to a group of fraternity guys there, so hearing doors being slammed continuosly and loud talking and laughing was not the best.  Overall the hotel was convenient.
Manager Response: Dear lleeot,   Thank you so very much for your honest review and please accept our sincerest apologies for your dissatisfaction. We truly try our best to above and beyond to please our guests and are truly sorry if you did not have a comfortable stay. We are always more than happy to move guests to a more suitable room should we be made aware of the problem. We hope this has not soured you on our hotel and that we will still have the opportunity to welcome you again.    Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien- Moore  General Manager

Summary: I stayed at the Ayres hotel in Newport Beach for a conference and while I normally don't review this kind of hotel, I felt I should because of its overall excellence. The staff is very professional and kind, the hotel is elegant and in great taste. The rooms are large and quite new with good furniture, linens, etc. If you go to UC-I or need to stay in the area, I can't think of any better place to do so. Also, the breakfasts are abundant and the lovely courtyard is a great place to eat.

I have stayed at the Ayres in Costa Mesa many times.  It is much better than anything in the area and surpasses many hotels in its price range nationally and internationally.  The rooms are large and comfortable with lots of extras.  Breakfast is of especially high quality.  It is well located.
Manager Response: Dear Helen M I,   Thank you so much for taking the time to share a review about your experience with us! We would also like to thank you for your loyalty to our hotel. It truly pleases us to hear that you believe our hotel is so wonderful compared to those in the area, and it is such an honor that you think so highly of our services at both a national and international level. We honestly cannot thank you enough for all the great things you had to say about us. We hope to see you again soon!   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien- Moore  General Manager

Summary: We recently enjoyed our stay at Ayres Hotel and Suites, along with some other friends who were in town for a gathering. Our room was very comfortable with ample space, comfy bed and other amenities, all for a reasonable price. The facilities are nicely maintained. The breakfast bar had great healthy selections.
