The location is very convenient to the airport and yet the rooms are reasonably quiet and well insulated. The hotel has very good access to nearby freeways that serve Orange County. When we are in Orange County again we'll be back to this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear SanDiegovisitor_10,   It was a pleasure welcoming you recently. Thank you sincerely for your review and for choosing our hotel. Thank you so much for your sincere remarks about our accommodations. It is great to hear that you and your friends took advantage of our complimentary full American breakfast. Once again thank you for taking the time to leave a great review about your experience and we cannot wait to see you again!   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien- Moore  General Manager

Summary: This hotel was very clean, staff professional and friendly, breakfast was excellent. I will definitely stay here again! The cleaning staff made our stay very comfortable. Anything we needed they gave us. The shuttle service to the airport was a great convenience.
Manager Response: Susan H,   Thank you kindly for your review and for choosing our hotel for your visit. We truly pride ourselves on providing friendly and efficient service to our guests. From our clean rooms to our delicious full American breakfast, guest satisfaction is always kept in mind. We aim to please, therefore we try to go above and beyond to meet the needs and wants for our guest. We would like to thank you again for sharing your experience with us and we kindly encourage you to visit us again!   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien- Moore  General Manager

Summary: I've stayed at Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa several times on business -- and it's such a comfortable hotel that when I was throwing a party for my new daughter-in-law, I decided to have everyone stay here. The restaurant is clean and very nice. The beds are comfortable. The food in the restaurant is great. The breakfast is very nice. And the location is right around the corner from the Orange County airport -- so it's close to the attractions and beaches. You can't go wrong with this hotel!

After a week long stay I have absolutely nothing to complain about! The staff were fantastic, knowledgeable and friendly - the facilities were clean, excellently maintained and well equipped. I'll be back without a doubt!
Manager Response: Dear Alex D,   Thank you kindly for your honest and enthusiastic review! We pride ourselves on our excellent guest service, so it was truly a delight to hear that we made such a favorable impression. We aim to please and are glad we did just that during your week long stay. Thank you again for taking the time to share about your experience with us and we hope so see you again soon!   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien- Moore  General Manager

Summary: Every time I stay at the Ayres I have an excellent experience. The rooms are clean, a friendly staff and great breakfast.   I would recommend staying at the Ayres if you are travelling to the Costa Mesa/Irvine area.
Manager Response: Dear Jerry T.   Thank you so much for your review! We are truly grateful that you have chosen us as your preferred hotel destination time and time again. It is delightful to know that you enjoyed our European inspired rooms, the service, and of course our complimentary Full American Breakfast. Thank you, once again, for your review and for recommending our hotel; we are definitely looking forward to catering to your needs when you visit next.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: From the outside, this looks like an ordinary property.  But don't judge this book by the cover.  Large rooms, great breakfast, attentive staff, classical music in the lobby, the list could go on and on.   We were here for a business meeting.  It proved an ideal location, and a relaxed setting.  I'd book here again.
Manager Response: Asiadream,   Thank you so very much for your candid review and thank you for choosing our hotel! It is truly delightful to here that we are anything but ordinary. We are glad you enjoyed our ample sized rooms and the European inspired ambiance, which truly is relaxing. We cannot wait to see you again and we would also like to thank you one more time for sharing your experience with us.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien- Moore  General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Ayres while at a conference nearby. I couldn't have been more pleased. Our room was clean, the hotel was lovely, the pool and other courtyard areas were beautiful. The beds are very comfortable and have the most amazing pillows- I slept like a baby! Our breakfast was delicious, and service was exceptional.  Every employee was gracious and eager to provide excellent customer service.  We are looking forward to our stay there next year when we attend our conference.
Manager Response: Dear Kimberly W,   We cannot thank you enough for all the wonderful things you had to say about your experience at our hotel! Guest service is our top priority, and, with that being said, it is truly an honor to hear you say that you could not have been more pleased. It is also wonderful to hear that you enjoyed our complimentary full American breakfast. Once again that you so much for you review and we cannot wait to host your next stay,  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien- Moore  General Manager

Summary: This lovely hotel is close to the airport and many business parks, so very convenient for business travelers. What sets it apart is the outstanding customer service. Not only did the shuttle pick me up and take me to the airport, the service also picked me up at the client's office and took me to the airport the next day. It's great not to deal with cabs or rental cars. I really liked the pillows in the room. I inquired when I returned home and was given extensive information regarding ordering including an offer to contact the sales rep on my behalf. The front desk and waitstaff were equally as helpful. Whoever does the customer service training for the Ayres should be used by every business in the service sector. The only reason I didn't give the property 5 stars is that the

I stayed at this hotel recently and was very pleased with every aspect.  The hotel is very nicely decorated and very clean.  The room felt more like a room in a house and was very quiet even though it overlooked the pool.  Bed linens were fresh and pillows were heavenly!  The staff was very friendly and polite.  My only suggestion would be to replace the shower head or raise the water pressure.  Also, some of the room location signs were a bit confusing.  I met another guest who was lost in the hallways looking for his room.  Lastly, the mini-fridge was a bit loud but these are NOT deal breakers!  I would definitely come back and stay here again.

Enjoyed the say...great that shuttle is available with 5 mile radius.stress free. Would recommend this .there are plenty of places to eat and close to fairgrounds and airport and beach.desk amazing and cookies always a plus
Manager Response: Dear blessed2bsaved,   Thank you kindly for choosing our hotel and for taking the time to share a review about your experience! We are glad to hear you took advantage of the various amenities we have to offer, like our shuttle services and our delicious cookies. Thank you so much for your recommendations and thank you again for your review. We hope you choose to stay with us again in the near future.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien- Moore  General Manager

Summary: Decorated like a very high end hotel but the room rates are a really great value.  The staff throughout the hotel, from check-in, to food service, to room service, are all helpful and genuinely nice.  I was traveling on business, which I don't like very much, but really felt comfortable there.
Manager Response: Dear MarkieMaypo   Thank you kindly for your review! Our hotel has a European boutique inspired decor and it is great to hear you appreciated the ambiance. We aim to please and we try and do whatever we can to meet and exceed our guests' expectations. Whether your stay is for business or pleasure we will still deliver the great service all of our valued guests want and deserve. With that being said we encourage you to visit our location for your non business travel as well. Thank you again for your review and we hope to welcome you back soon.    Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: My room is perfect its overlooking the swimming pool. this wasn't a planned vacation but I'm glad I came. I am just laying in bed and feeling good. You must wake up for the complimentary breakfast its a full breakfast. 1 cup coffee maker in in your room.                breakfast
Manager Response: Dear chefdesire -  It was a pleasure welcoming you to our hotel. Thank you so much for taking the time to share about your experience. Spontaneous vacations are just the best! It is a delight to hear that your found our accommodations to be perfect for you and that you took advantage our delicious complimentary Full American breakfast. I would like to thank you again for your sincere review and encourage you to consider staying with us again.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: I have stayed in this hotel twice before this, and were about 7 & 9 years ago. The hotel still looks the same, and I like the nice area between the restaurant and lobby where you can have some drinks in the evening.   Although it is not a new hotel, the place is well maintained I thought. The room I had was clean and spacious. But was given a room with two beds which I was upset of. Requested for a room with only one and bigger bed, but was not available :)  I like the idea of having USB ports on the wall so that we can charge our devices without the need of plug and adaptor.   There is nothing much for breakfast, having the same thing for my 3 nights stay. I hope hotel can consider to alternate the Bacon with Sausages, Scrambled egg with Fried Egg, French Toast with Pancakes.

I was in a pinch and needed a document scanned and emailed.... The staff scanned it and emailed it to me...helping me close an important sale.  Chris and Robin were especially helpful and the whole experience shows Ayres helps business travelers in ways that I haven't seen often at other chains.  -Jon

pleasant rooms, nice complementary breakfast, congenial staff, but the shuttle is often not available for rides to UCD if you have time constraints although I have had no problems getting picked up from the airport

Found staff to be very congenial and concerned about my arrival and stay. Food was fresh and flavorful. Room was comfortable and clean, however I would prefer not to have any source of continuous scent added to the room's environment.

Stayed there only one night for business but really enjoyed my stay in this beautiful cute and cozy hotel. I wish I would have spent the week end there instead of in a really sad hotel in Los Angeles. I tried the restaurant too and it was pretty good.

After our first free breakfast, we opted to go to one of Newport Beach's awesome bakeries for the rest of our stay. Aside from the horrible breakfast (greasy, floppy bacon, inedible eggs, no bowls for cereal...), we actually quite enjoyed the hotel. We got a great price and were very pleased with the value.

Great property Great service Great location Complementary breakfast, WiFi, Gym, Business Centers (multiple locations) Rooms come with a refrigerator and wet bar style extra sink Elegant decor throughout - Very regal Next to everything - South Coast Plaza, TBN, Disneyland, Knotts

I stay at this hotel several times a month.  I have been very pleased with the hotel staff, including the desk staff, shuttle drivers, and housekeeping staff.  My room is always clean and the complimentary hot breakfast buffet is quite good with a very attentive morning restaurant staff.  The staff has gone out of their way to call me by name and ensure my hotel room completely meets my needs, including several upgrades. Finally, the free shuttle service within 5 miles has really made traveling easier and more convenient. I would highly recommend a stay at this hotel.

Summary Heading: This hotel is a class act.  Great service and extremely clean.
Summary: Service was fantastic.  The room was the best cleaned room of any hotel I have ever stayed.  The staff was friendly and  ever helpful.  Super breakfast.  I will recommend this hotel to all of my family and friends.

My daughter and I stayed at this hotel during a trip to tour college campuses in the area.  The hotel was centrally located, the staff very helpful and friendly and the food was wonderful. The complimentary breakfast was fantastic!

Summary Heading: Always a wonderful place to stay
Summary: I'm a Wisconsin-based road warrior, and I've stayed at this property probably 250 nights since the early 90's.  At least two of the staff have been there the entire time.  This is a wonderful family-owned boutique chain.  The hotel is immaculate, the rooms comfortable and quiet, and food is well-prepared.  I've also stayed at other Ayres properties, and they are fine, but this is my favorite.

As soon as we, my wife and I, walked into the lobby, we loved it. the decor was beautiful. When we walked into our room, we were so impressed. The room was a Junior Suite with a King size bed and a queen size sleeper sofa. The bathroom had a Jacuzzi bath tub and shower. The room was so nice looking, it had a European/French look and feel. Since we were on the first floor, we had a balcony with a table and chairs. So romantic. We'll be back for sure.

This hotel will stop at nothing to make their guests feel comfortable. Rooms and facilities are very clean. You can not beat the price for this type of luxury hotel. The food at Le Chateau is wonderful! The staff are very friendly from check in to bell desk to restaurant staff. I have stayed at many hotels, this one is at the top! Thank you Ayers Family and Staff!

During my two-night stay, I found that everything at the hotel was wonderful: the decor,  amenities, breakfast buffet, cookies at tea time.  The service personnel are well trained and eager to help.  Another important plus: the hotel offers free shuttle service to and from the airport.  I would like to stay at each of the twenty properties in CA.

My family stayed there over the past weekend, and staffs are very friendly. It has European style design, and we enjoy the breakfast in the courtyard. The room is well decorated, with glassware instead of plastic cups. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet also.
Manager Response: Dear dCapitola,   Thank you so much for choosing us for your stay and for taking the time to write your review. We love hearing that our team has made such a favorable impression. European-inspired is definitely what we strive for as well as great breakfasts and dining experience. The courtyard is a beautiful area to enjoy your coffee in the morning or an afternoon meal. We greatly appreciate you staying with us for the weekend and hope you will have the chance to visit again very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: I made plans to stay here for a family reunion and received many praises for my excellent hotel choice. At a time when most other hotels charged a lot more than usual, I was gladly surprised to still find an option within everybody's budget. The architecture, art work, furniture, and classical music background created a very nice atmosphere. The breakfast had many options and was delicious. The bed was really comfortable. The location was great for the plans we had to explore several beaches. The staff was very helpful.   Thanks for being part of the wonderful memories we made in this trip.

overall we enjoyed our stay at the Aryes  Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa.  It was very central and close to places that we needed to travel while in California.  The rooms were nice and clean and the staff was very friendly.  The only problem we encountered was that our reservation was for 4 people and we had a room with one Queen bed and a pullout queen sofa bed.  There was no linen, pillows or blanket for the pull out bed.  Other than that we completely enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: Dear Edgar N,   We greatly appreciate you choosing us for your stay as well as taking the time to write your review. When sleeping in the room with a queen sofa bed, we agree that the linens should be available promptly and apologize for the inconvenience. We will work to make sure these accommodations are met. We strive to find the best locations possible to provide an enjoyable and easy stay for our wide range of guests. I am glad to hear that we were able to make your travels as easy as possible. Again, I apologize for the inconvenience but am glad you enjoyed your stay. I hope you will have the chance to visit us again very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary Heading: I really wanted to like this place...
Summary: I stayed at this location because it was relatively close to the area I needed to be (Irvine). With that said, I didn't really need a whole lot to make my stay enjoyable, easy check in, and some peace and quiet.  The check in was easy except they couldn't give me the room I requested because they were sold out. What's the point of reserving and requesting a room if you can't honor it?  Ok, whatever, not the end of the world.  The quiet on the other hand is not something I can negotiate on.  Especially when I'm paying. I'm not talking about quiet in the bar or near the pool, I just wanted quiet in my room. The guest above me had kids that ran around all night.  I'm not saying that kids shouldn't be allowed to run, I personally don't want to hear it. And since they were "sold out"
Manager Response: Dear Jacqueline,   Thank you for taking the time to write your review and for choosing us for your stay. We try to make each guest's visit as accommodating as possible. At times when our hotel is sold out due to multiple events taking place at our location or in the area, or groups staying at our hotel, we are not always able to accommodate every request and we do apologize for the inconvenience. We are working hard with our kitchen team to provide a quality driven breakfast with plenty of variety. I apologize that the breakfast was not satisfactory for you in the morning. Providing a breakfast that starts the day off right for our guests is important. Again, I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and hope you will still consider staying us in the future.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore  General Manager

Summary: I enjoy the atmosphere here.  It has a wonderful welcoming feel and the people are incredible helpful at the front desk.  It is a great location.  The hotel and rooms are gracious and I will stay there anytime I am in the area.  Feels like home!

Summary Heading: Disappointing experience at this Ayres location
Summary: We stayed at this Ayres Hotel the night before flying out of John Wayne Airport.  It also happened to be the night *after* we stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Laguna Woods.  I have to report that this location suffered by comparison.  The air traffic from the airport is loud.  On the Friday night we arrived, the hotel seemed packed--very hard to find a parking space, and loud parties/meetings seemed to be going on in and around the pool courtyard, with the noise sometimes seeping into our room.  We found the back door to the hotel propped wide open when we finally found a place to park and brought our luggage in.  At about 9 p.m., the guests above us returned to their room and ran around endlessly (kids? drunk adults? who knows?).  We finally just put our ear plugs in and went to

Summary Heading: I highly recommend Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa!
Summary: I stayed at Ayres for a 2 day conference hosted by the California Consortium of Education Foundations. I represented the Castillero Middle School Education Foundation as incoming President.  I was VERY pleased with hotel experience.The customer service is the best I've experienced to-date and I have some travel experience. Staff are pleasant, responsive, considerate and courteous.  Rooms are designed to today's trends, with flat screen tvs, wet bar and fridge; are clean, well furnished, designed for comfort and hallways are well lit and wide.  Elevators are quiet and smooth ride.  I really like the modern mediterranean 'look', colors and feel of the whole hotel. I like the indoor/outdoor enclosed garden and outdoor courtyard with the well-maintained table top accents (herbs in

This Hotel is very nice, clean, and a little different in then your normal hotel. The difference is that the property is beautiful, the courtyards, pools, lounge are all very nice.  The staff is over the top, will trained and very professional.

I really enjoyed my stay at Ayres Hotel & Suites. They were very accommodating, helpful and the breakfast was full and delicious. The rooms were comfortable making my stay like a home away from home. The workout facility was good too. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great weekend at the Ayres Hotel
Summary: We love staying at the Ayres Suites, Costa Mesa.  It is close to shopping and everything in Newport Beach and Costa Mesa.  It has a great breakfast and good parking.  The price is very reasonable and it has a feel of a boutique hotel

Summary Heading: Wow - wonderful staff, clean room, great value!
Summary: My fabulous experience began before I even arrived, and my visit was on a whim.  I made my reservation Wed. night for a Fri. arrival, then invited my sister to join Thurs. morning.  She said yes, so I called the hotel to amend the reservation, and Gina was very nice and accommodating.  She was able to get us 2 queens instead of the 1 king bed even though they were pretty full.    We ate in the restaurant Friday night, and the food was fabulous!! It was supposed to be a 1-night stay, but Saturday morning we decided we weren't ready to end our mini-vacation yet.  The front desk was able to accommodate us again, and we stayed in the same room.  The hotel is conveniently located within a few miles of both South Coast Plaza and the Irvine Spectrum, so we had plenty of dining and

This was clean, quiet, and comfortable. I actually bumped up my rating one star simply because of the restaurant on site.  To respond to a few other previously mentioned problems...yes, parking is limited and due to the prevalence of SUVs, the larger spaces are full way before evening arrives...but it's free.  Adapt. Stay in. Enjoy the lovely hotel you're paying for and go to the Chateau for dinner. The free breakfast is also a very nice plus. It gets the job done, and if you're traveling with kids, it's very convenient.
Manager Response: Dear formerlocal,  Thank you for your kind review of our hotel. We are so very pleased to see that our on-site restaurant helped improve your overall experience here. It is nice to see that you were able to thoroughly enjoy the hotel during your visit, especially in terms of the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. We hope to see you another time soon and thank you again for taking the time to leave a positive review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience here.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: First time at the Ayers Hotel (Costa Mesa), I was kind of wary of the location because of my 9 month old son.  I thought the airplanes taking off at John Wayne Airport would be very noisy, especially at night.  But to my surprise, it was just fine.  My son liked seeing the airplanes in the sky during the day.  Once you figure out what is around the hotel, it is a good location.  The South Coast Mall is relatively close by.  The staff are very nice and helpful.  The rooms are clean and nice, breakfast was included in my stay and it is a breakfast, not just muffin's and coffee.  But as one person pointed out, the parking is cramped even for "compact" cars.  Overall a good experience and I would recommend giving it a try if you are in the area.

This hotel appears to be part of a small chain that provides standard big chain amenities with a quaint hotel feel.  The hotel itself is nice and the restaurant had good food at a good value.  The staff was also responsive, friendly, and helpful.  I would stay here again when in town on business.

We've stayed at this Ayers before, but aren't sure about returning. Some things to consider: wifi on the third floor was unusable, with a pathetically weak signal; parking is extremely cramped especially if you return late in the evening - if you have a large vehicle, good luck; there were three false fire alarms during the night - mentioned the ruined night's sleep at checkout and barely got an apology from desk staff at checkout.
Manager Response: Dear Wheresperry -  Thank you for staying with us again and taking the time to write a review. I apologize about the inconvenience with the lack of parking spaces. Sometimes when we are sold out it can be difficult to find parking, but on the other side along the suites building there is additional parking as well. I understand that not having WiFi in your room can also be very inconvenient during your stay. I have talked with the tech team in the hotel and we are working to ensure the signal stronger on the third floor. Thank you again for taking the time to write a review. I am very sorry for the inconvenience during the stay and I hope you will consider to continue to stay with us in the future.   Regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Another wonderful weekend stay at the Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa.
Summary: You must visit the hotel bar and restaurant. The bartender Jose makes your bar experience great. After learning the types of cocktails I enjoy, he suggested some of his specialty drinks. They were all delicious. We had a large party for dinner and the waiters and staff were flawless. We all agreed that our dinners were a culinary delight!
Manager Response: Dear Juliettemarie38,  We are more than delighted to see that you enjoyed your weekend here at our hotel. Your kind words and compliments of the service during your dining experience are greatly appreciated and will surely be shared with the team. It is nice to see that our bartender was able to suggest specialty drinks based on your preferences. We hope you will visit another time in the near future and thank you for taking the time to leave a flattering review of our hotel and restaurant.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stay in hotels at least 15 days a month. The staff at Ayres treated me extremely well. My room was clean and classy and the facilities are beautiful. Check out the fountain area and enjoy a relaxing morning, afternoon, or evening. This hotel is top shelf.
Manager Response: Dear Todd D,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a glowing review of our hotel on TripAdvisor to let others know about how accommodating our service was. We truly strive to offer the highest quality of service and accommodations and are thrilled to see that we succeeded in that goal with your stay. We are so very pleased to see that you were able to enjoy the fountain courtyard for a relaxing morning. We hope to see you again soon and thank you once more.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Always stay here on trips to Costa Mesa
Summary: The atmosphere is its signature:  European charm and elegance without being pretentious.  Rooms are comfortable and nicely designed/decorated.  The courtyard with fountain and flowers is so relaxing and a retreat from the busy world outside the front entrance.  Breakfast is excellent and the setting is stylish but family friendly.  The kind of hotel you look forward to visiting.

All rooms, hallways, public spaces are sparkling clean. Everyone friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Beatrix at front desk who graciously got my iPad on line! Breakfast perfect and served on china plates. Wonderful old world furnishings throughout. Thank you Aryes for a great vacation!

I've been here twice and it keeps getting better i have a very long trip to Costa Mesa (i'm from Argentina) and is truly a gem near SNA. Great staff. With no doubt i'll be there in a year again! Many thanks to the staff for creating a home away from home!

Summary Heading: Weird layout, awful breakfast, not for the young
Summary: We only stayed one night as we had a conference there. They obviously don't work with groups and it took ages to get everybody checked in. It was late though, but they knew a group of 20 will be checking in, so they actually don't have an excuse.  The rooms are big and comfortable, with a small kitchenette, which is unusual, but nice to have. The hotel itself has a weird layout and is actually quite big, even if it doesn't feel like it. The hotel theme, which tries to mimic and old country Hotel of some kind, isn't really my cup of tea and I would rather don't have shelves of fake books.  Breakfast is included in the price, which is a bonus, but I wouldn't book here just because of this. The breakfast isn't really that great and service is very slow as well. The restaurant will
Manager Response: Dear NamXpert,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a candid review of our hotel on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience here. Please accept our heartfelt apologies that your stay was anything less than exceptional. We understand how the decor of the hotel is unique and may not suit everyone's taste. None the less, we appreciate the feedback and will keep it in mind when making improvements to the hotel. We hope you will reconsider staying with us another time in the future and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: As others stated,  free wifi, free breakfast, free but tight parking.   The hotel in general was very clean and nice looking. For a free breakfast it was well above average.  They do post "does not include gratuity" on every table so it really isn't free but for $5 it is still a great deal.    I stayed in the executive suite.  The room was clean and well done but I was expecting two beds.  The second bed was a pull out which is only average.  The main bed was very comfortable.    For the price the suite was a good value even though the pull out is not a super comfy bed.  Would work just fine for the kids.     Didn't use the pool but it looked nice and had a beautiful layout in a courtyard setting.
Manager Response: Dear Joe L,  We were so very honored to have you as our guest recently, thank you for taking the time to leave a review to let others know about your experience. We are pleased to see that you found your One Bedroom Suite and the complimentary full American breakfast buffet to be of a good value. We hope the next time you come to visit you will be able to enjoy the heated pool and spa. Thank you for your feedback, it is greatly appreciated and will most definitely be kept in mind when making improvements to guest satisfaction. We hope to see you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My husband and I absolutely love staying at Ayres Hotels, so when we learned we'd be in Irvine this past weekend I wasted no time in searching for the closest an Ayres.  EVERY aspect of our stay was top drawer, starting with guest check in.  Beds were amazing, comfy.  Rooms are nicely sized, bathroom spotless.  Grounds were well maintained, there was even a courtyard with soft lighting and patio table where you could enjoy a cocktail.  Restaurant and bar on premises (this is not the case with all Ayres).  Breakfast of eggs, bacon, potatoes, pancakes, fruit, breads and pastries, coffee and juices ready bright and early.  Of course, I've come to expect but am always amazed that breakfast is NOT served on paper plates....love the real thing!  Great location, minutes away from
Manager Response: Dear 1_Polo_mom,  Thank you very much for recommending our hotel to others on TripAdvisor by leaving a flattering review of your experience here. We are thrilled to know you thoroughly enjoyed your stay, especially in terms of the comfy and clean accommodations. It is nice to know that you were able to take advantage of the fountain courtyard and were more than satisfied with the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. Thank you for all the compliments and feedback, we sincerely appreciate the time you took to let us know we are doing our job in satisfying our guests. We hope to see you soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Great hotel and location.  Went to run half marathon here and this hotel was perfect. Breakfast for free.  Wi-Fi free and parking free.  They have happy hour Mon to Thur with free wine.  Pool. Close to shopping.  Not far drive from the beach. Coming back here in the summer for 4 nights with my family.

Really friendly and efficient service. Clean abounded. Only reason I did not rate as excellent was the otherwise excellent restaurant came up a little short on the buffet breakfast. Tasty, but lacked the variety I would have appreciated for a 3 day stay.

Summary Heading: Always a pleasure to stay here
Summary: My husband and I have stayed here approximately 7 times in the past year, and have always had a good experience.  The staff has always been very accomodating and helpful.  We enjoyed our stay here so much we ended up having our wedding here!  Rooms are always clean and beds are comformtable.  Cleaning staff was very honest.  I left a $10 tip and forgot to write a thank you note.  When I returned to the room the room was clean and the tip was still there.  The breakfast is not overly exceptional but it is fine.  We asked for poached eggs and the staff was willing to help.  The food in the restaurant was always good for lunch and dinner, and the bartender was always attentive.

This is the best kept value secret in OC, a first class hotel with friendly staff, great pool and spa, only minutes from the beach. We stayed over the Valentines weekend, rooms were large with extra sink and fridge, comfortable bed and most of all quiet. You also get a lot of extras, complimentary breakfast buffet with fresh eggs, bacon, waffles even pastries. You also get free WiFi in room and free parking, they even have fresh cookies in the lobby. No better value in OC, I plan to stay at least 2-3 more times this year.
Manager Response: Dear Ogwhitt,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience at our hotel. Thank you for considering us "A gem in the OC," it is truly an honor. We are delighted to know that you found your accommodations to be large, well equipped and quiet. It is nice to know that you enjoyed the extra amenities, such as the complimentary full American breakfast buffet, Wi-Fi and parking. We cannot wait to welcome you again in the near future. Thank you again for your kind review!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Whether you are stay for a night or in my case 22 days, this is a well priced, clean, friendly well run hotel that offers good value for money and a reasonable range of amenities given the price.  Stand outs are the staff attitude, with everyone being helpful, and the restaurant menu being good quality & value for money, though after 2 weeks I tried everything and I was getting bored.  Downside is aircraft noise, starts at 6:30am and finishes around 10pm, so if you are a light sleeper make sure you ask for a quiet room.

Summary Heading: Very comfortable and charming local hotel
Summary: The Ayres is a local southern California chain that is family owned. This property is charming and comfortable and feels more like a family hotel than a chain. The staff were warm and welcoming. The hotel is located near the airport and between freeways so it is quite accessible. Occasionally there is aircraft noise but it was not enough to prevent a sound nights sleep. The pool is a good size with a hot tub and cabana type furniture. There is a good restaurant in the hotel. The staff were knowledgeable and quick. The food was well prepared but there are excellent restaurants near by so this restaurant really caters to the guests. I wanted to take a yoga class nearby and since there were no airport runs scheduled the hotel kindly shuttled me to the class. Overall I recommend
Manager Response: Dear Valina D,  We were so very honored to have you as our guest recently, it is a great pleasure to see that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. We truly strive to offer the highest quality of service and are ecstatic to see that we achieved that goal with your visit. It is also nice to know that you were able to enjoy our on-site restaurant. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know how pleasant a stay with us can truly be. We hope you will visit another time soon and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Entering into the lobby the artwork is reminiscent of an earlier time. The utilization of stone in combination with chest high front desk, domed lighting and high ceilings you sense grandeur. Classical music piped throughout each floor and public areas with a library themed and white/blue porcelain decor add elegance. In the pub/restaurant area the TV plays CNN instead of sports elevates the sophisticated feel. Hints of cinnamon fragrance waft throughout. Very clean and the beds were incredibly comfortable. HOWEVER, beware of the fold out couch to sleep in, although it would probably not be an issue for children, a jealous fight could ensue if two adults had to select between the two for themselves!
Manager Response: Dear CheepsLB,  Thank you very much for leaving a flattering review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. We are so very pleased to see that you found the common areas and your accommodations to be elegant and sophisticated. It is also nice to know that you found your room is be clean and comfortable. We hope you will stay with us another time in the near future and thank you again for letting others know how pleasant a stay with us can be.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Awesome, Friendly staff. Very clean rooms. The beds are "to die for" (actually purchased a mattress for my own bed). Great breakfast (full breakfast which is FREE!!!). This is my preferred choice in the Costa Mesa area. When I bring the kids, Disney is only 10 miles away.

Check-in was easy.  Rooms/public areas are getting a bit dated, but are all very tasteful and clean.  The free breakfast was excellent, and the cookies at night were a nice touch.  A little noise from the airport, but no big deal.

Summary Heading: A great place to stay in the Costa Mesa-Newport area
Summary: We really enjoyed this hotel. We wanted a place to stay that was close to relatives in the Newport Coast area and this place was in a great location. Very easy to get to/fro, however, we warned that you are very close to some toll roads so if you want to avoid paying a toll like we did ($2.75) be careful of which freeways you get on.   We got the Executive Suite with a king bed in the bedroom and a queen sleeper in the living room. Our child slept quite fine in the queen sleeper (although the mattress was thin, I don't think I would have been comfortable). The king bed was ultra comfortable - actually one of the most comfy I've ever slept in. The suite was spacious with two TV's, a desk, small fridge, sink, microwave, lots of drawer space, a patio door that opened to a tiny
Manager Response: Dear DimSum2008,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. We are overjoyed to know that you found your accommodations to be comfortable, clean, and spacious. Thank you for complementing our staff for being courteous and very helpful; we truly strive to provide quality service and are thrilled to know we succeeded in this goal with your stay. Thank you for recommending our hotel and for sharing your experience, we are looking forward to having you in the near future.   Sincerely,  Susan O’Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Very pleasant facility - great value for romantic weekend
Summary: This hotel is perfectly located for many of the best Orange County attractions. It is less than 10 miles from beautiful Newport Beach (and probably cost 50% less). The facility is new, clean, well-decorated and the rooms are first rate. Very tasteful ambience, free wifi and full breakfast. There are two pool areas with jacuzzi and many rooms have whirlpool/jet bathtubs (nothing fancy but still pleasant). The king bed is VERY comfortable. At times we noticed they were short-handed (getting room service after 3:00 PM is very iffy) and they have a very narrow check-out window (extra fee if yu check out too early OR too late). The facility is next to John Wayne Airport, so occasionally you hear planes but only briefly (and never after midnight). There are many restaurants nearby,

Our experience at the Ayres (CM-Newport) was amazing! We went during Christmas, so the hotel was decorated beautifully and everything was really quite perfect. Our room was clean and lovely, the beds and feather pillows were exquisite. We rested well in quiet surroundings and very much enjoyed the hot breakfast provided each morning. There were other small touches such as cozy indoor and outdoor seating for relaxing, computers in the lobby and ice cold cucumber water. Parking and check in/out were smooth...and honestly I have nothing but praise for the Ayres hotel and staff! My only regret is that my family and I forgot to leave tips for the cleaning/breakfast staff. THANK YOU AYRES HOTEL!!

This is by far the best stay in a hotel that my wife and I have had in our lives.  I previously worked for ARCO as an auditor and I have stayed at hundreds of hotels and this is the most well run, clean, neat well decorated of them all.  The staff at this hotel are professional, caring and know how to make the guest feel comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and relatives.

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel-Very cool and unique property
Summary: The folks at the Ayres were very nice and helpful. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. The courtyard was very cool. The complimentary breakfast was very nice. The spa area was very nice. I would reccommend to anyone considering staying in the orange county area.

I have stayed here several times and my family and I have always been treated with kindness and respect and the utmost hospitality..Ayres is the best..If u are looking for a great place to stay I highly recommend Ayres...

I stay at the Ayres Costa Mesa several times a year when I visit my company HQ and the hotel never disappoints. The staff is always exceptionally friendly and the property has a warm, elegant atmosphere that you just don't find in the big chains with their, soulless, cookie cutter facilities.
Manager Response: Dear Michael K,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent stay at our hotel. We are so pleased to see that you stay with us during your business trips. We truly strive to offer the highest quality of service and ambiance and are so pleased to see that we succeeded in those goals in your eyes. Thank you for your kind feedback, it is greatly appreciated. We hope to see you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We really enjoyed our time at your property. The staff was great and very helpful. Beautiful property. The Hotel amenities were great. We used the shuttle service to and from the airport. We were treated great from the start of our stay to the end.

I am a repeat visitor to the Ayers, and despite hating travel for work in general, the Ayers is always wonderful. Neat clean rooms, helpful staff, late arrivals are not a problem, shuttle service is excellent, and thier resteraunt has something for everyone.   There are two small issues on several visits the spa did not work in the main building and as a woman alone I was not walking across the parking lot to the other building in a swimsuit at night or in the day for that matter. The other thing, the drapes. They had these semi sheer drapes with darker drapes as decoration. The darker set would not close having a screw applied to the rod so that they stayed in place for decoration rather than function. I am certain that even at night with the light on no one could see in. I

This last stay was my 4th in as many months. I keep getting upgrades and it keeps getting better and better each time. From a standard room to one with a jet tub, next a fireplace and great staff. The hot breakfast is an added bonus, not your usual cold cereal, rolls and coffee.

Only a couple complaints. When checking in I asked for a room facing airport so we could see the planes coming and going. The gentleman who checked us in said SURE you bet no problem well....when we got to our room it had a view of the pine trees and the other tower of rooms. I didn't want to have to go down and complain so we stayed in that room for two days. The other complaint was there were a couple of black hairs in the shower and a couple more on the wall by sink. Breakfast was standard nothing special. Not many sweet things to eat. I was most disappointed in the fact that the boutique inside the lobby was gone! It was so cute. I was looking so forward to shopping there. Also I tried to ask the maid for a couple extra towels and she could not understand English so we kinda
Manager Response: Dear mssmitty311,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent stay to our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and will be sure to use it to improve guest satisfaction in the future. Please accept our sincerest apologies that your request to see departing planes was not met, we truly strive to offer the highest quality service and are disappointed to see that you were not completely satisfied. We do hope you will come to stay another time in the near future so we can ensure an enjoyable stay. Thank you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay when on a family or business trip.
Summary: A very nice surprise . Big and comfortable rooms. Convenient location. Just few miles from major attractions. Appreciated the complementary hot breakfast. Will add to my list of favorite places to stay while on trip to Southern California.

Love this gem! Staff is very accommodating, and location is great with access to all major freeways. "Very" applies to clean, comfortable,  and great staff! Not your typical today's slick-simple-sleek-contemporary-hotel" as décor is European with old world paintings, wallpaper, carpets, etc but having great rooms with fireplaces, lovely courtyard and other seating areas to read a great book, or just relax appeals most to me. We Americans like our space and this hotel gives you just that. Décor isn't from Sotheby's or Christies' but the feel is genuine and matches the attitude of the staff.

It was so nice to walk in and be greeted with a smile. I didn't feel rushed or like a number. My room was extremely clean. I enjoyed having an early coffee in front of the fireplace in the lobby. I enjoyed my weekend stay and will be back.
Manager Response: Dear Tupperware12,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a flattering review of your experience at our hotel on TripAdvisor. We truly appreciate the compliments on the kind and accommodating service, it is exactly what we strive for. We are so very pleased to see that you enjoyed your clean accommodations and coffee in the lobby. We are ecstatic to see that you will be returning and hope it will be in the near future. Thank you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Good size rooms, very quiet even with children on the property. The customer service was excellent.  The hot breakfast was very refreshing and they even took time to use real eggs instead of powdered ! I will be coming back !
Manager Response: Dear MrTrimble,  It is so very satisfying to see that you thoroughly enjoyed your visit to our hotel recently. Thank you for the compliments on the accommodating service, we are flattered to see you found it to be excellent. It is also nice to know that you savored the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. We look forward to welcoming you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My wife, and I, were on our honeymoon and we searched through hotels.com, when we came across the Ayres Hotel & Suites, Costa Mesa, CA. We instantly liked what we saw. We were originally planning on going to San Diego where we frequent on our yearly sojourns. But we decided to try something different especially on our honeymoon! When we arrived, I checked in with Gina, who was very friendly and professional. We were acoompanied by our 8 year old son. She checked us into a nice room. But I thought to myself, why don't I ask for a complimentary upgrade to a suite since this was a very special ocassion, for us. After all the worst they could say was, "No". So, I went back to the front desk and calmly asked Gina if I could get a complimentary upgrade to a suite, and I explained to
Manager Response: Dear jtvapd1,  We are so very pleased to see that you chose our hotel for your honeymoon celebration. It was our pleasure to accommodate you with a complimentary upgrade for your special occasion, we are thrilled to know you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. Thank you for taking the time to let others know how exceptional your visit with us was on TripAdvisor, it is greatly appreciated.  We cannot thank you enough for the glowing review and hope to see you anther time in the near future. Congratulations on your marriage and thank you again!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Excellence in everyway! When I come to Newport Beach/Costa Mesa one of my favorite things is staying at the Ayres. This is my 6th stay with them and I enjoy it more each time I am there. Staff in the restaurant/lounge has virtually no turn over. What a wonderful thing to be greeted and remembered visit to visit!

I actually found this hotel on Trip Advisor.  It is in a wonderful location minutes from downtown and the ocean.  Lovely room with everything you would need.  Breakfast included was delicious.   Everyone helpful and friendly.

Summary Heading: Wanted a suite - ended up with a sad hotel room:(
Summary: I recently stayed here for a quick overnight (flying out of Orange County Airport) after attending a convention in San Diego and was pretty disappointed.  I need to clarify though that I was 'expecting' a suite and ended up with a rather bland, depressing room.  The suites look lovely and just wished I had a chance to spend time in one rather than my sad room:(  I booked this through Expedia and apparently the 'deal' I got for the one night did not include a suite) - I wish this had been made known to me prior to booking - a lesson learned on my part.  The room does have a mini fridge and coffee maker - I noticed there were a few microwaves in the hallways? but not one in my room.  The furnishings were lacking, towels very worn and again - the room was just depressing.  The
Manager Response: Dear Sheri S,  Thank you very much for taking the time to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel by leaving a review on TripAdvisor. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and will definitely use it to improve guest satisfaction in the future. Our deepest apologies if you were not truly satisfied with your accommodations, we truly strive to offer the highest quality of amenities and room features and are saddened to see you did not find them to be as such. Thank you for the compliments on the plentiful complimentary full American breakfast buffet and convenient location.  We hope to see you another time soon so that you may experience a Junior Suite. Thank you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Very pleasant staff, clean rooms, nice decor, and a great value. I stay here almost every month and have yet to be disappointed. The bartenders are very personable and take care of their guests. Very close to the John Wayne Airport.

Spacious,  Beautiful, clean, room included mini fridge and microwave. A mall close by and lots eateries in the area, nice property. Love this hotel.Great overnight for airline crews. Front desk friendly and made us feel welcome.
Manager Response: Dear Angela H.,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your exceptional visit to our hotel. We are very pleased to see that you found your accommodations to be beautiful and clean. It is also nice to know you enjoyed the extra amenities in the room such as the mini fridge and microwave. Thank you for the compliments on the friendly service, it is truly what we strive for. We hope to welcome you another time soon and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I had a one night stay here at this hotel and I must admit, it will be on my favorites list.  It was only about a 10 minute drive from the Orange County/John Wayne airport. The shuttle driver was courteous and on time. The front desk personnel were friendly and helpful. I stayed in one of their suites so I had to walk outside across the parking lot to the other building. This was my only complaint since there were a few stairs to go down to get into the other building and that was a bit much to maneuver with my luggage. Maybe there's a better way but I couldn't figure it out.  The room had a Victorian theme complete with poster bed, whirlpool tub and Victorian table set. I wasn't too fond of the green sofa but it wasn't a deal breaker. The bed was very comfy even through the 1am
Manager Response: Dear Gina B.,  We are so very pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel recently. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review to recommend our hotel to others on TripAdvisor. It is very nice to know that you were able to take full advantage of the extra services we offer such as the complimentary shuttle service. It was our pleasure to have you as our guest and we hope to welcome you another time in the near future. Thank you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I would stay there again  found some cool things to do off the beaten path. People where very friendly. Breakfast was awesome great historical building  wish it was closer to the beach garden was beautiful but to chilly to us at that time if year

The Ayres is a beautiful boutique style hotel.  We stay there when we go to Costa Mesa to visit our son and daughter-in-law and our grandson.  It is a comfortable, generally quiet hotel to stay at and very convenient to shopping and their home.  The only negative and the only reason I ranked them Very good rather than excellent, their breakfast quality has dropped off measurably.  The quality is just not the same as it was previously at breakfast.  It would appear they have switched to boxed, frozen and powdered.  Other than that, we love the Hotel.

My employer purchased a room in this hotel for a conference and I am so thankful. It is as if I have my own one bedroom apartment. Everything was top quality and spacious. I couldn't have asked for more. The view to the pool is also lovely!

It is a small hotel with a charming atmosphere created with furniture, accessories, and easy to listen classical music. The associates behind the counter were of great help recommending places where to dine. Great service and nicely furnished rooms. Even though the parking area was almost full at all times, there always seemed to be a parking spot for us near our entrance.  Good basic breakfast. We recommend this place.

Summary Heading: Great price for a nice hotel
Summary: Nice room, friendly staff, breakfast included and very reasonable price. We will certainly stay here again when we come down to visit my son who lives in Costa Mesa. It is a huge hotel, so plenty of rooms for accommodations. We stayed in their deluxe king room. Plenty of room for the 2 of us. They have wifi as well.
Manager Response: Dear Dutchgirl1955,  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your recent visit to Costa Mesa. We are very pleased to know that you enjoyed your Deluxe King Studio Suite and found it to be appealing and spacious. We truly strive to offer the highest quality of service and are delighted to see that we succeeded in that goal with your stay. We simply cannot wait to welcome you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Our recent trip to Newport and staying at this hotel was a first for us. We will ABSOLUTELY be staying at this hotel again. The moment we walked in, we were greeted, checked in, and received the highest customer service possible.   The free buffet breakfast, cookies and cucumber water every day, the "welcome back" greetings, the social network posts of "hope you are enjoying your stay", to every other minor detail was impressive!!  We highly recommend this hotel!!

Summary Heading: Best value in Newport Beach area
Summary: We have stayed at the Ayres Costa Mesa on multiple occasions spanning over a decade. It is our go-to hotel when visiting Newport Beach or Disneyland. The commercial neighborhood is unimpressive (hotel is next door to a Shell gas stations), but it is a short, easy drive to Newport Beach or John Wayne Airport, and only about 20 minutes to Disneyland.  My wife and I stayed here for two nights in January while visiting Disneyland with some of our grandchildren. I was impressed at how clean and well-maintained the hotel was - it doesn't look a day older than it looked ten years ago! Rooms are spacious, breakfast buffet is excellent (eggs, sausage, bacon, toast, cereal, French Toast, juice, etc.).  Front desk staff is always very pleasant and helpful, lobby comfortable. The hotel is

I'm pretty sure about I lost my apple charge in the room, but when I called the house keeper they said no, nothing left.  but the other things were good, american style, nearby there is seven-eleven, and some restaurants to choose.

husband and I wanted to get away for New Years are stay with perfect staff was very helpful and frien dly can't say enough about this beautiful place. everything was top notch can't wait tnno go back thank you so much.

Summary Heading: Ayers Costa Mesa worst customer service! Never again!!!
Summary: We've stayed many times at Ayers, Seal Beach. But just returned from a 3 nt stay at the Costa Mesa location, due to a better deal online there. Costa Mesa Ayers is just as beautiful inside as Seal Beach location, but the staff here was terrible! We will NEVER return! Upon check in, after a long drive, around 10:00pm, the front desk girl informed me we were checking out on the 29th. I said, no, there's been a mistake, I originally had made online reservation for 3 nts, from Dec 27 checking out Dec. 30 but then I called the hotel directly to add on a day, checking in on Dec. 26.Our grandchild's baptism had been moved up a day early. She was very pleasant and assured me it was NO PROBLEM at all, that they had plenty of rooms left, and she'd change it. I remembered she had an
Manager Response: Dear 6boys4me,  Please accept my most heartfelt apologies that your experience at our hotel was anything less than exceptional. I am quite disappointed and embarrassed to see that your visit and interaction with the team was so unpleasant. Our motto is, "We care about people." I will be sure to reiterate this with the team members. We truly strive to offer the highest quality of service and I am so very disheartened to see that this goal was severely not met with your stay. Rest assured, each and every one of your comments will be shared and discussed to prevent future incidents such as this. Again, my deepest apologies that your stay was not satisfactory and I hope you will reconsider giving us another chance to redeem ourselves in your eyes. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience and again, please accept my sincerest apologies on behalf of the service you received.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Staff was wonderful and helpful. My wife and I are from Southern California, but we needed a quick/easy getaway. Ayres definitely provided that and the location is so close to the beach and other great hang out spots (South Coast Plaza, The Block, Fashion Island, etc.). Even though this hotel is located right by the airport and freeway, inside the room was extremely quiet. Clean bathrooms, the room itself is incredibly clean, and the beds are wonderfully comfortable. The hot breakfast provided was worth it as well. If you have kids, or even if you don't, the whole family can enjoy french toast, eggs, bacon, fresh fruit, country style potatoes and more. I was just blown away at how much this place exceeded my expectations. I would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Bryan W.,  We are so pleased to see that we were able to exceed your expectations on your recent visit. It is nice to know that you found your room accommodations to be quiet, clean and comfortable. Thank you for the compliments on the great location and complimentary breakfast buffet. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and we hope to welcome you another time soon. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know how exceptional a stay with us can be. We cannot wait to welcome you again!  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We love staying at the Ayres. When we visit my sister's place sometimes her house isn't large enough for all of us so we stay at the Ayres. It's beautiful, comfortable, elegant, and service is great! Feels like home away from home.

the staff was great the location was convenient and the value was exceptional. be sure to try the jet tub in the suites. this hotel was very quiet even though it is close to the airport and two freeways.

This is the only hotel chain we stay in when we are in SoCal!  This was a quick last minute trip and the usual one we stay in in Anaheim was all booked up!  We decided to try Costa Mesa and were super excited that it was the same great rooms, breakfast, and service we have has before in Anaheim!  It's comforting to know that I can stay at any Ayres hotel and feel at home!!  Costa Mesa Ayres hotel was awesome!  Thank you!!!
Manager Response: Dear Janb1537,  We are so very pleased to see that you enjoy staying at any of our various locations but especially ours. It is nice to know you choose our hotels for your quick last minute trip. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know how exceptional a stay with us can truly be. We greatly appreciate your compliments of how pleasant the service, rooms, and location are. We cannot wait to welcome you another time in the near future and thank you again.   Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Check-in is as easy as a phone call; Cookies available on check in are top notch; the Bistro has 5-star food and service; business accommodations have recently been improved and the staff quickly embrace you as family... your return is like coming home.

I called the hotel with my bedding and pillow preferences explaining we wouldn't be checking in until 10p then joked asking they save me some cookies.  We checked in at 9:30p with Melissa.  What  an excellent representative of this fantastic hotel.  She reconfirmed the bed nearest the bathroom had hypo-allergenic pillows and blankets (asthma) and the other bed had the down and feathers.  Then she hands me our cookies! Amazing!  We had requested and received a quiet room facing the courtyard and didn't even hear a door close.  Our room was immaculate, coffee, mini frig, bathroom amenities, free wifi, and the microwave is by the ice machine down the hall. The room remodel is just about complete and the huge Christmas tree in the lobby is beautiful.  Our room seemed wider than in

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Ayres Hotels & Suites Costa Mesa!
Summary: Gina was extremely pleasant & patient in helping us find 2 connecting rooms with queen beds on the top floor away from the elevator. Very comfortable beds, great pillows, water pressure was great in the shower. Good breakfast with yogurt, fresh fruit, oatmeal, granola, honey. Overall a wonderful stay! - J

Stayed here for business.  Room was very clean & neat.  Staff very courteous.  I even brought my video game system for fun after business and couldn't connect it online.  There was a 24 hour help desk that helped me connect online right away.  This made the work even better and easier that technical support was available.  Also, the breakfast buffet everyday was good.
Manager Response: Dear proudFillipino,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a flattering review of our hotel on TripAdvisor to let others know about your pleasant stay with us. We are so pleased to see that our front desk agent was able to help you connect your video game system for some fun after your long business day. We truly strive to offer the highest quality service and are thrilled to see that we succeeded in that goal with your visit. We do hope you will come stay with us another time soon and thank you again.  Sincerely, Susan O-Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: The Best Deal In Orange County! Seriously!!!
Summary: I travel a LOT. I travel with my family a LOT.  This particular Ayers (not that they all aren't great) is exceptional. The grounds are first class. The service are first class. The rooms are top notch. The food (not just the amazing included buffet breakfast) but the restaurant is excellent and at decent prices. I can't honestly say enough good things about this location. This is about my 20th time staying there over a period of about 20 years.

I was celebrating a special event and the staff at Ayres went above and beyond to make it special. I visited durring the holidays and the lobbies were decorated to be magical. I can't wait to return for my next "special occasion"

Summary Heading: A bit of charm in the OC
Summary: When you walk into the lobby you feel like you are in a small country inn. The staff is very pleasant and helpful. The entire hotel is very clean and well maintained. My only complaint - a small one is the room décor - it could be updated to go along with the country inn feel. The walls were stark and barren and the lighting terrible. Obviously designed by a man - it was almost impossible to apply makeup in the bad lighting - I only hoped I didn't look like I was a visiting circus clown when I left the room. The breakfast was plentiful and hot - a rare treat for a buffet. The free parking was welcomed in the OC where they stick it to you for parking.

Summary Heading: Best Go To Place in OC
Summary: We have stayed at the Ayres Costa Mesa a number of times.  We have also tried many of the other hotels in OC and always end-up going back to Ayres.  They have great staff, great service, great free breakfast, and great accommodations.    All at a reasonable price. Oh yah, they have free parking!  Others charge for parking!

Great location to John .wayne airport.     Convenient  hotel shuttle was able to take us to many spots.      Rooms were very clean,     Staff most helpful.      Delicious breakfasts!        Staff in front lobby were most helpful too.
Manager Response: Dear Idf2010,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. We are so delighted to see that you enjoyed our complimentary full American breakfast buffet. It is also nice to see that you were able to take advantage of the complimentary shuttle. Thank you for the compliments on the accommodating service, we truly strive to offer the highest quality of service and are thrilled to see that we succeeded in that goal with your stay. Thank you again and we hope to see you another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I cannot rave enough about my stay at this hotel. Not only was the hotel absolutely beautiful, but the staff was super friendly and shuttle service was a lifesaver! The rooms were very comfortable, and the jacuzzi tub was a relaxing surprise. We will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Sabrina o,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a flattering review of our hotel on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience. We are so pleased to see that you loved our hotel and felt inspired enough to leave a five star review. Thank you for your compliments on our service, it is such a pleasure to see that we left such a great impression. We are delighted to see that you were able to utilize the complimentary shuttle and enjoy the whirlpool tub. We do hope you will come stay another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The hotel is a great place to stay! I've been staying here for the last two (2) months during the week for business. I only wish it had been a personal trip instead of business so that I could have shared the wonderful experience with my family.  The rooms are very nice and well accommodated and the customer service is impeccable.  Anyone coming to Southern California for business or pleasure would be fortunate to stay at the Ayres and experience the quiet comfort they provide.
Manager Response: Dear Brad C,  Thank you for your kindly worded review to let others on TripAdvisor know about your recent experience at our hotel, it is more than appreciated! We cannot thank you enough for the compliments on our service, we truly strive to offer the highest possible guest satisfaction and are greatly pleased to see that we succeeded in that goal with your business trip. We hope you will come stay another time and bring your family along for another great experience. Thank you again!  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Solid Hotel - Comfortable rooms and great service
Summary: Great place to stay near John Wayne Airport.  Solid shuttle service.  Rooms clean and service is great. The breakfast is very good.  I feel that I am important to the staff and this is a very nice business traveler hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Mark P,  It was such a pleasure to have you as our guest recently. Thank you for the more than favorable review of your experience at our hotel, we truly appreciate it. We are pleased to see that you were able to take advantage of the complimentary shuttle service and enjoyed the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. You truly are important to us, we are so delighted to know that this was conveyed to you during your stay. We hope to see you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: They shuttled me around to various places I needed to go, the restaurant and business center areas are very accomodating, and the customer service attitude of all the staff is outstanding. I will make it a priority to make this "home base" for all my travels in the Irvine area.

First time staying at an Ayres property, and overall it. Was a good experience.  The hotel building and layout are die rent than your run of the mill hotel.  Rooms are situated around either an internal courtyard, or the outdoor pool.  The rooms are very lovely with an olde world ambiance.  The rooms were always clean with plenty of amenities provided and the staff were very pleasant, helpful, and knowledgeable.  The breakfast each morning which was included, was a step up from the express breakfast that other hotels provide, and was hot and delicious each time.  My two negatives are minor,  but were important to me, so I feel they need mentioning.  The first is that while the hotel is located in an upscale  beach town the actual location of the hotel is more down market in

We used FF miles for this 3 night stay.  The hotel location is great for travelers.  The room was sparsely decorated but amazingly quiet - especially being so close to the freeway and airport.  We would stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Jan L,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. We are so pleased to see that you found our hotel to have a good location and great service. Thank you for your feedback on the room decor, it is greatly appreciated and we will take it into consideration when making improvements to the hotel. We hope to welcome you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Looking for a place to re-charge? Look no further than this hotel.  It will AMAZE you from the minute you step in to the lobby and feel the warm welcome from the staff and feast your eyes on their Christmas decorations. We stayed in the mini-suite and got a late check out, it will make such a difference. Be sure to stop by the pool and jacuzzi with lounge area was such a treat. Dinner must be had at their restaurant, simply AMAZING food. I had the Salmon Bountiful Salad and it sure lived up to it's name. You will not want to ever leave this place.

Summary Heading: This Place is the Whole Package
Summary: This place is a gem.  Hotel staff is friendly and very efficient.  The rooms were clean and very comfortable and exactly what we needed.  The shuttle service within a five lie radius is amazing and the full breakfast is delicious.  The hotel is very centrally located and can't be beat for all your needs.
Manager Response: Dear TJ S,  We are so very pleased to see that you enjoyed your recent stay at our hotel. Thank you for taking the time to leave a favorable review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience here. It is nice to know that you found our team to be friendly and efficient, we truly strive to offer the highest quality of service and are so very delighted to see that we succeeded in that goal with your visit. We are also thrilled to see that you were able to take full advantage of the complimentary shuttle and enjoyed the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. We hope to see you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I was amazed and surprized from the moment of arrival to departure how exquisite this hotel is.  The staff from registration to the maintenance staff ensured that our every need was met.  Very clean and well maintained and compares to Mission Inn, Riverside and  Merriot, Indian Wells in decore.  Luxurious beds and lots of pillows, I can't remember when I have had a better nights rest!  Thank you Ayres owners and staff for a wonderfull stay. Looking forward the next stay.  PS the breakfast buffet was super!

Lovely European-style Boutique hotel. Beautiful interiors. Clean & smells good!  Even elevator smelled clean! Treated courteously & promptly at desk. Open courtyard w/tables & fountain. Restaurant is like a pub & intimate feeling. Rooms have been updated/spacious.  Will definitely come back!

I do not know how this hotel got such high ratings, but it is not fabulous as may people are stating. That is how i got hooked in.  The so called suites were very standard.    The only difference is it has a spa tub inside bathroom. You have to wait until tub fills up with water, get out and go to the wall switch to turn it on. The heads are not adjustable, so do not plan on it being a custom massage experience. I think it is over priced, over rated and out dated. Room was stuffy and small for being a so called "Suite"  Outside spa was dirty. The workout room was small and smelled like sweat. Breakfast was good, but not great, because food is made in quantities, it was not very tasty. Free breakfast have signs on the table saying "gratuities not included". The only positive
Manager Response: Dear Anasmile34,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a candid review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. While we are pleased to see that you found our service to be pleasant, we sincerely apologize if the rest of your stay was anything less than exceptional. Typically people truly enjoy the complimentary full American breakfast and we are devastated to see that you were not completely satisfied. Please accept our sincerest apologies if you found your accommodations to be outdated or of lesser quality; we truly strive to offer an experience unlike any other and are disappointed to see that you had a less than satisfactory opinion of the accommodations provided. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and we will be sure to keep it in mind when making improvements to the hotel. We do hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future and thank you again.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This hotel exceeded our expectations by far!  The staff was courteous and efficient and the hotel was beautiful.  Our room was extremely comfortable and the beds were great.  The full breakfast buffet was sufficient and for the price we paid, was well worth it!  I would definitely stay again!

We'd stayed here before for a wedding, so knew it was a nice place. The rooms are very comfortable and the hotel lobby and grounds are very pleasant. Currently they are decorating for the holidays and it already looks great. The restaurant serves a full breakfast which is part of the stay. We also had a late dinner splitting a turkey club sandwich which was delicious.

The staff was super friendly, the New Orleans style courtyard was very quaint and relaxing, and the restaurant was excellent!! There is something to be said about a place that serves REAL eggs and thick sliced bacon cooked to perfection for it's FREE breakfast!! I absolutely loved that our room had a balcony that overlooked the courtyard and when we were done relaxing at the hotel everything we could want was so close by. We can't wait to go back.
Manager Response: Dear Lorlphyll,  Thank you very much for taking the time to let others know how pleasant a stay can be at our hotel. We are so pleased to see that you enjoyed your visit, especially in terms of the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. Thank you for your compliments on the food as well as the setting, your feedback is greatly appreciated. We are also thrilled to see that you were fond of your room accommodations and view of the courtyard. We sincerely treasure your comments and look forward to hopefully welcoming you another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Overall, this is a great place  to stay.  The service is excellent, the staff accommodating and the beds are sooooo comfortable.  I would like to know who makes them as I would like to purchase one.  The only caveat is the workout room.  It is way too small for this size hotel. It could use more equipment and a larger space.
