I would highly recommend this hotel for its overall value, quality and service.  The breakfast is wonderful - scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, salsa, shredded cheese, pancakes/French toast, granola, yogurt, cereals, toast, orange/apple juice, milk - are you hungry yet?  Eat outside in their beautiful fountain courtyard.  P.S.  They also have fresh cookies waiting for you in the evening by the reception desk. YUMMMM

Why did I choose the Ayres? Simply for its excellent rating on tripadvisor - and I was right to do so. The style of the hotel is old-fashioned American, as I would call it - you can't really tell if it is new or old, rather timeless. I had a junior suite, two spacey rooms and a bath on the ground floor, with access from the nice courtyard. Staff are friendly and helpful, breakfast is basic, but good, parking is free - what else could I ask for - especially at that price?  John Wayne airport is not far from the hotel, so planes taking off actually fly over the Ayres. And this hotel is very popular for weddings, so it can be quite busy, I heard. Fortunately, I did not notice any of the two possible factors for noise - neither the airplanes nor the wedding taking place disturbed me

I stayed here and hated the experience. It was loud and noisy. The front desk staff was rude at best, and obviously not trained properly. I will stay at a chain hotel that I can count on. Also too far from a decent restaurant.................................
Manager Response: Dear Mjfassocllc,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a candid review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. Our sincerest apologies if your stay here was anything less than exceptional. We truly strive to offer the highest quality of service and are devastated to see that we did not succeed in that goal with your stay. Our motto here is, "We care about people;" I will be sure to reiterate this with the team to ensure more positive guest experiences. Again, please accept our heartfelt apologies and we hope you will reconsider staying with us another time in the future.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Nice room, most comfortable bed we have ever had away from home. The restaurant had a great complimentary breakfast. Loved the patio, waterfall and cute tables and chairs. The got tub and pool was clean, with towels and the nicest staff checking on in us. Kimberly at the front desk was so great, she brought the luggage cart up to my room, and was so sweet! Excellent choice to stay here!
Manager Response: Dear Ddarling1,   It was truly an honor to have you as our guest recently. Thank you for leaving a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience at our hotel, your feedback is very much appreciated. We are so very pleased to see that you enjoyed your accommodations and your Ayres Dream Sleeper bed. Thank you for the compliments on our service, we truly strive to offer the most exceptional experience to all of our guests and are so very delighted to see that we succeeded in that goal with your stay. Thank you again and we hope to see you another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Had a good time here.  We stayed From October 31st to Nov 7th, and the hotel couldn't have been nicer.  Bed was comfortable, people at the front desk were always friendly, courteous and helpful.  Can't say enough about the shuttle they offer within a five-mile radius of the hotel.  It saved us on more that one occasion and made renting a car totally unnecessary!  The OCTA busses were convenient and easy to use as well. We also used the pool(s) and hot tubs.  One of the best features was the free breakfast buffet they offer every morning, a great way to start the day.  Would highly recommend to anyone, and we would definitely stay there again on a return trip

I stay here each time, I am in the area. Mostly on business but would also recommend for pleasure. Great breakfast and large clean comfortable rooms. Friendly staff and nice outdoor pool.Reasonable price. They also have a reward program Stash for frequent travelers.
Manager Response: Dear Wilhelm R.,  We are so very honored that you choose our hotel each time you are in the area. We are so pleased to see that you enjoy the complimentary full American breakfast buffet as well as the heated pool. Thank you for your compliments on the large clean and comfortable rooms as well as the accommodating service. We cannot wait to welcome you another time in the near future, thank you again for the flattering review.  Sincerley, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This hotel should serve as an extraordinary template to chain hospitality providers that they should not be assessing excessive rates for what is standard for the leisure and business traveler. In other words, this property is a polished, yet independent gem among the corporate, cookie-cutter bastions of Hilton, Hyatt, Marriott, and the like. The professionalism exuded from the hotel staff is exemplary, as compared to chain hotels, where the name of the brand(it sells itself, no matter it's state) is far more important than the name of the individual guest provider. Quite simply, an outstanding staff that serves it guests and cares for the needs of the guest is what gives AH&CM-NB its birthright to be realized as a hotel. The design of the rooms are modern and bold, with no
Manager Response: Dear Benedict J,  Thank you very much for the more than flattering 5 star review! We truly strive to offer the highest quality service and are so pleased to see that we seem to have exceeded that goal with your recent visit. The housekeeping team will definitely appreciate your comments and I will be sure to pass them along. Thank you for the compliments on the complimentary full American breakfast buffet and the decor, we are so thrilled you enjoyed both. Thank you again for the fantastic review and we hope to serve you again in the near future.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Price, great place to stay
Summary: It was very clean, nicely decorated, very reasonable for the Orange County area and  great location. The hotel was divided by two buildings, the suites in own building, had their own free breakfast area in that building which was very convenient.

It was such a pleasing and peaceful experience. Everyone who attended to me were kind, happy and considerate. When future business/family activities locate me near your hotel I will be there. Thanks for such a great experience.

The stay here was really great experience, got very good and clear communication from staff whenever needed. Breakfast was very good. Team at hotel are pretty job for maintaining service and cleanliness.

From the time we walked in the front door - we loved the hotel.  The Front Desk Staff when we checked in and when we checked out were wonderful!!  The rooms were nice, Clean, and comfortable.  The morning breakfast was very good.  The pool area was very nice - the kids loved the pool.  Would recommend!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay! Would stay again!
Summary: Stayed based on a recommendation. Lovely hotel. Great and helpful staff. Room was large, spacious and clean! They accommodated my requests to be away from the vending machines and elevator and for a late check out. Comes with a free breakfast - eggs, bacon, French toast/pancakes, hot and cold cereal, juices, fruit, coffee and tea. It was fantastic. They have a pool and a gym which I did not have a chance to check out. Free parking. Now only two drawbacks - 1) the street to get there is odd, you have to go around the freeway; 2) I turned on the heater and it set off the smoke alarm. Other than that, I have no other complaints. Would definitely stay again in in the area!!
Manager Response: Dear Ahyiweewee,  We were honored to have you as our guest recently and are so pleased to see that you chose to stay with us based on a recommendation. Thank you for your compliments our helpful service, we truly strive to offer more than exceptional customer service and are so pleased to see that we succeeded in that goal with your visit. We are also so pleased to see that you enjoyed your accommodations and the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. Thank you for your comments on the sensitive smoke detector, we will definitely have to look into that issue with the winter approaching. We hope to see you another time in the near future and thank you again!  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Pros: nice courtyards, European style breakfast with delicious yogurt. Cons: check-in at 3:00am (you need to pay extra $s for early check-in), no comforter, exposed small closet, no safe, child-sized toilet, poor sound insulation, some staff is unfriendly
Manager Response: Dear C C,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a candid review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. Our sincerest apologies if your stay was anything less than satisfactory and if the service was not of the highest quality. We apologize if there was any confusion at all about early check in possibilities; we only charge to guarantee that the room is cleaned and ready upon a scheduled early check in time. If you wanted to check in early without paying, it is based upon availability in which you would need to call the day of. Again, please accept our heartfelt apologies that your stay was not more exceptional. We hope to see you another time in the near future so that we may offer you the best possible experience.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Great hotel for NARF (Newport Autumn Rowing Festival) rowers, coaches and families. The hotel is less than a  mile away from the beautiful single track running and paved bike path around the Back Newport Nature Preserve and offers a great early morning run before the rowing regatta events. It is one mile from NAC and is a few blocks from Irvine Ranch Market and food mart for healthy and gourmet picnic foods and ice for the regatta, ice for ice chests and has a McDonalds across the street for late night snacks. The hotel's open center court yards that are surrounded by rooms with open walk ways feature trees, fountain and a pool and remind me of Spanish Colonial hotels--open, elegant, spacious. Its a great place if you are into trail running, don't have your dogs with you, and

The hotel staff is very welcomming. The hotel has shuttle from airport. very nice hotel , so clean . has big rooms including ref. coffee machine and small kitchen. Free Wi Fi. first time for me and for sure will come back again.
Manager Response: Dear Itain,  Thank you very much for letting others know  that our hotel is a great place to stay by leaving a glowing review on TripAdvisor. We sincerely appreciate your compliments of the accommodations and are pleased to see that you found them spacious and clean. We truly strive to offer the highest quality of service and are glad to see that we succeeded in that goal with your stay. We simply cannot wait to welcome you back again so please do visit soon! Thank you again.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Very Pleasant Stay at the Ayers
Summary: An excellent location in Costa Mesa, near John Wayne Airport, the Ayers was a very neat, clean, well managed hotel that made it a pleasure to stay.  The price was excellent and they had a room available when we checked in early.  The hotel staf was very friendly, courteous and efficient.  The thing that impressed me was the cleanliness and every item in the hotel room was in excellent condition.
Manager Response: Dear KLGColorado,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a gratifying review on TripAdvisor to let others know how pleasant a stay at our hotel can be. We are so pleased to see that you enjoyed your visit  and that we were able to accommodate you early. Thank you for the compliments on what a great value and how conveniently located our hotel is. It is also nice to know that you found our service to be of the highest quality. We look forward to welcoming you again in the near future and thank you once more for the kindly worded review.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Repeat guests: we have stayed on 3 occasions, and will agail
Summary: We have found this hotel to be a fine place to stay, with a delightful pair of inner courtyards on which our rooms open (windows that work!). We have stayed here on several occasions, and will stay again (but see cons below).  Very well kept, pleasant furnishings & nice appointments, reasonably priced. A pleasant place to bring my significant other for business and as a weekend getaway trip. Staff are professional, helpful, and like working there (I asked).  The breakfast buffet is relatively simple but the options are satisfactory and freshly prepared (not a prepackaged piece of buffet pseudo-food in sight ;{). Service staff like everyone else I chatted with in the hotel are professional, helpful, and like working at this hotel.  Bar has an excellent wine and back bar

The hotel and amenities were excellent. The hotel staff were all very friendly and professional. It was a great place to stay with close proximity to Balboa Island and the airport.  I will definitely recommend The Ayres.
Manager Response: Dear WLArcher,  Thank you very much for taking the time to recommend our hotel on TripAdvisor. We are so pleased to see that you thought the amenities and service were worthy of a 5 star review. Thank you for your compliments on the great location of our hotel. We greatly appreciate your kind words and hope we have the chance to welcome you back another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Very convenient to SNA, comfortable, large rooms with top-notch finishes.  Great value for the area also.  You will not find a better combination of room and price in the area.  Very friendly, good variety at breakfast.  Would definitely recommend (have stayed there twice now for business in Costa Mesa).

Great hotel, clean rooms, clean area, great guest services. This hotel almost reminds me of Paris Las Vegas, has a European look and smell.   Downside: Can sleep in because planes are loud.  No ashtray around, I didn't want to smoke there since so nice but could not find an ashtray to save my life. Had to hide my butts in a corner.  Shower head was not pushing enough water out, felt like I was taking drizzle shower.  Overall place is lovely and I would love to stay again but the plane just killed it for me.

I was travelling for business and many of the people I was meeting met me at the Hotel. This was ideal as the Ayers suites lobby/foyer was quite and perfect for meetings. Also close to the shops, overall a great location. The breakfast is OK and the gym is a little small but apart from that I would highly recommend the Ayers.

Was perfect,  super close to airport, shuttle was awesome (get in get out).  Beds were great, food was great, best of all it was reasonably priced.  Airport was not across the street but still close.  Had an evening flight still before 10pm and was picked up in like 10 minutes.  Noise is not bad was on the airport side maybe heard 1 or 2 come across, was no big deal.  Was in conference for 2 days and did not hear one plane!!   Bad part about this whole thing I normally do not write reviews, but this was just so easy had to share.  Must say if I have to do another 200 character minimum I will not be writing anymore reviews.
Manager Response: Dear motoagogo,  We were so very honored to have you as our recent guest. Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review about your experience at our hotel, it is truly appreciated. It is nice to see that you enjoyed your Ayres Dream Sleeper mattress, the complimentary full American breakfast buffet, and that you considered the hotel a good value. We are also so pleased to see that the complimentary shuttle was of great service to you. Thank you again, and we hope to see you another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Although the site was under some remodeling and smell of paint, we had a wonderful stay.  The staff was gracious and very helpful.  The restaurant was nice for breakfast and the hot tub was a great way to end the evening.  I would however suggest less perfume in the cleaning supplies.  If you suffer from respiratory problems the staff will accommodate your needs.

This is a clean, fresh hotel with a quaint courtyard for both the restaurant and the pool. The rooms were good size for southern California. The only drawback was frequent airline departures that tended to rock the room until well after sunset.

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and service. Very nice room with jacuzzi tub, pool, etc. the iron however ruined my white shirt, even after I ran a load of water through it on steam, spray etc.  to clean it. Breakfast was basic but hot and good. Another disappointment was the shuttle. Supposed to be free with 5? Miles but when I called an hour ahead of time to get a ride to UC Irvine they said they couldn't get to me for 45 minutes. It's only 2 miles to campus and they needed more than an hour lead time after 8 AM? Why have a shuttle then? Still I will probably stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Jim N.,  It was a great pleasure to have you as our guest recently. Our sincerest apologies that the shuttle service was not able to accommodate you right away. Scheduling arrangements must be made much in advanced to guarantee a specific time since it is a widely used service. Also, we are so very sorry your shirt was ruined by the iron. We will have to look into the appliance to ensure this does not happen to any future guests. We thank you for your review to let others know about your experience and hope to see you again in the near future.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for business and family!
Summary: I stayed at Ayres Costa Mesa for my class at National University.  From the time you stepped in, efficient and hospitable check, nice European style room, free wifi, free morning breakfast, homemade cookies, Jacuzzi and pool, fitness room, laundry room. It has the right amount of everything!  The breakfast is just right, oatmeal, scrambled egg, cereal, fruit mixes, pancakes, toast... The other amenity that is really convenient is the shuttle.  They take to anywhere within 5 miles (well the church that I went during my stay there is 5.2 mile aways, so they still kindly take me).  They do pick up too!  Very convenient if you did not feel like renting a car.  The staff are excellent, very helpful and accommodating.  I love the lobby in the Suite building and the courtyard
Manager Response: Dear Hutapea,  Thank you very much for selecting our hotel for your stay during your class at National University. We were honored to welcome you recently. It is nice to know that you enjoyed your accommodations, the complimentary shuttle, and the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. Your compliments are greatly appreciated! Thank you for your review and we hope to see you in the near future when you bring your family to the area.   Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I went to a conference and needed somewhere to stay close by the John Wayne Airport. The Ayres Hotel was available and extremely reasonable and so I braced myself for a sub-par experience. I was so wrong! The room was nicely styled, the entire hotel has a New Orleans 'style', that is not cheesy at all. There are two open courtyards at the heart of the hotel, one with a fountain and tables by the restaurant/bar and the other surrounding a beautiful lap swimmable pool and hot tub. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were soft-not the rubber bumpers I dread. The complimentary continental breakfast was over the top! Actual eggs, bacon, pancakes, fruit, hot and cold cereal in the actual restaurant. The shuttle was a great feature and they even took me to a dance class one night
Manager Response: Dear J M,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a flattering review of our hotel on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent stay. Your compliments of the hotel decor and ambiance are greatly appreciated. It is nice to know that you also enjoyed your accommodations and found them comfortable. Thank you again for your kind words and we hope to see you another time in the near future!  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We came here on a retreat. The breakfast was wonderful, I have an allergy and they were able to accommodate me at breakfast. Our dinner for the group was not very good at all. Chicken dinner was not fit for consumption, need to revisit their menu. The accommodations were fantastic! There were also many choices for meals in the area. The hotel was very helpful and friendly, I would recommend this place.

We stayed here for a conference and the hotel was very clean, comfortable and had a great atmosphere.  The shuttle service was very convenient since the location isn't one you can walk to much.  The free breakfast was excellent!

Excellent venue and location! A very "Real" bargain and excellent location! I would recommend this to anyone visiting the Orange county area! OJBHVFCO;WEURHF'O;WUIHEF'OWIEF'OWIEHF'WIHEF'PRWIEHVF'QIRNC'PRI {FEM {EF

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel for the money
Summary: My wife and I spent five nights here while visiting my daughter and some friends in the area. Compared to many  big name fancy  hotels in the area the Ayres was a bargain. We even splurged for a suite off the courtyard and with taxes and everything it was less than two hundred bucks a night. The free breakfast was very good, eggs, pancakes, bacon cereal etc. Parking is kind of tight (but free) until you realize there are probably another hundred spaces in the Ayres Plaza shopping center right next door, maybe 50 feet away from the south building.   There is a real restaurant in the hotel with a bar that is open all through the day until 10:30  PM or so. They have three shuttle vans to run guests around the area and although we didn't use them they looked like they washed them

Stayed here as part of a Women's Retreat and had a very nice time. Rooms were good size and spacious, buffet breakfast at restaurant was delicious, pool and lobby/lounge areas were enjoyable. Our meeting room was long and thin and made for a very awkward "classroom". Our toilet didn't flush the first day, but that was quickly remedied. Very pleasant customer service. This was my first stay at any Ayres property, and I look forward to my next.
Manager Response: Dear Sandra O.,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience at our hotel. It is such a delight to host women's retreats and we were so honored to welcome you and your group. Thank you for the compliments on the complimentary breakfast buffet, the pool, and grounds; they are greatly appreciated. It is nice to know that you thought our customer service was pleasant. We apologize for the toilet inconvenience but are glad to know that it was quickly remedied. We look forward to seeing you again in the near future.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The hotel was a pleasant surprise. Service and value terrific, location extremely convenient for us, services provided beyond expectation. Driving us to locations within 5 mile radius was something we didn't even imagine existed but suited our situation perfectly.

We came here to attend a meeting at the Island Hotel. Ayres was 10 minute-drive away. But Ayres’ a bargain, $109 per night, comparing to so-called 5-starred Island which was $299 with “meeting discount”. The hotel was really nice: good-sized lobby, open court (yard) for breakfast and gathering, decent bedroom. amenities included free breakfast, free parking, free Wi-Fi (work very well), a small refrigerator and a microwave at the corner of ice machine. (We can stay here and relaxed for weeks!) The only drawback we can see is the small breakfast lounge: can’t accommodate a group of (many) guests who happened to be here for a weekend “reunion”!
Manager Response: Dear Chuang004,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent stay with us. Your compliments of the great value of our hotel are greatly appreciated. We are so very pleased to see that you enjoyed the complimentary full American breakfast buffet and WiFi. However, we do apologize if you thought the breakfast room was not large enough. Other than that, we are so delighted to see you enjoyed your stay. Thank you again and we hope to see you another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I had the pleasure of attending the Fall Board meeting of the California Garden Clubs, Inc. at this property.  It did take about a day to find where different event rooms were located, and I helped a fellow late arriving board member to her room about 11:30 at night, and it was a real maze to find her room.   The meals were very good, and the staff was very attentive; they are in the process of adding a full business center, so I brought them articles to copy and received good advice about restaurants in the area.  In general, I thought this hotel was very accommodating.  The parking can be a little difficult when the hotel is nearly full.

This hotel was fantastic and was in a terrific location.  The hotel's shuttle service was excellent and the drivers, especially Bill, were willing to suggest some of the sites to see in the area.  I can't recommend this hotel enough.  Even the beds were incredibly comfortable.

We stayed again in one of our favorite hotels - actually had two reservations with a stay in Catalina in the middle.  The staff is always welcoming and helpful and provide excellent service.  This location is close to everything and is both family and business friendly.  The restaurant and bar service is the best - love the olive tapenade appetizer and the menu choices.  We look forward to our next stay.

Summary Heading: Our Favorite Costa Mesa /Orange County Hotel
Summary: We have stayed at this location several times as it is convenient to our daughter's home and to the airport.  The rooms are always immaculate and service excellent.  The bed is amazing and full breakfast makes it even more worth the stay.

Summary Heading: Located close to John Wayne airport and close to Balboa Island.
Summary: Very nice clean and handy location, although located on one way street Bristol.   Buffet breakfast comes with a nights stay.  Good place for couple or families.  The rooms appear to have been somewhat recently updated, The bed is kingsize and very comfortable.  Furniture well appointed comes with a bar refrigerator and microwave for those who would like to stay for a longer period.

Friendly. Smiling. That's what every guest wants to be greeted with when they arrive at their hotel destination whether after a long flight or a short drive. Friendly, helpful front desk staff. Ayres Costa Mesa/Newport Beach delivers on that front (no pun intended) and in all aspects of a guest's overall experience. Attentiveness and attention to detail are obvious throughout the property.  The complimentary breakfast is tasty, delicious with several nutritious options, and some that are not so "nutritious", but necessary, like BACON. Please keep the bacon! You have your choice of dining inside the Chateau, or outside in the courtyard, which has a Zen-like quality about it with a gorgeous fountain. You certainly do not feel like you are in the Newport area with John Wayne
Manager Response: Dear Phoebe_McKeasley,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know how pleasant your stay with us was. We are so pleased to see that you enjoyed the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. We will make sure to keep offering the bountiful selection, bacon included! We truly strive to offer the friendliest and most attentive service possible and are so glad to see that we succeeded in that goal with your visit. Thank you for your compliments of the well appointed accommodations, they are greatly appreciated. We hope to see you again in the near future.  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: The Ayres in Costa Mesa Rocks!
Summary: From the time I arrived on Thursday evening [26 September 13] until my departure on Monday morning [30 September 13], I felt like I belonged here. Every employee acted as if they wanted to do their best job for me. Desk staff, Housekeeping, Restaurant staff and shuttle drivers all made my stay great. I honestly hope that I will be in the area again just so I can stay there.

You never quite know what you're going to get going through Priceline but this was one of the best I have had. The hotel was every bit of the 3 1/2 stars it was advertised to be. The general areas were clean the room was clean and the full breakfast was great. They put me on the list for a room with 2 queens and it was ready at the time of check in. I really wanted to try their restaurant but the 9PM close was too early. The décor is dated but clean and coordinated. I really have nothing negative to say about this hotel everything worked out as good as could be expected and there were no hidden charges either. It also had laundry facilities on the floor which was very convenient as well as microwave and refrig. I would go back if ever in the area again.

Summary Heading: "A delightful break" while helping to "Cruise for the Cure"
Summary: Sometimes the "close getaways" turn out to be the most relaxing~ and we recently showed our Classic Car in Orange County, only an hour away, & participated in the "Cruisin for a Cure", City of Hopes 14th Annual car show/ Event fundraiser.    The Ayres was a great choice~ Reminds me of a "boutique" hotel, nice Victorian flare and wonderful historic vintage photos, circa early 1900's, of the Ayres family contributions to Southern California, construction sites from the  LA International Airport to the Newport Yaught Club!  Reasonably priced, Excellent accomodations, Engadging staff~  We'll be back!   (Wish we eaten at the wonderful restaurant with Chef Jeffrey at Ayres)  we walked around the corner for Sushi, my husband loves Japanese)  and the prices were outrageous~ portions in

I stayed the night to be close to the fairgrounds for Cruising for a Cure car show and the hotel was perfect!  I was at ease leaving my Hot Rod in the parking lot over night (which is one of my biggest concerns when staying at a hotel) it was very clean & comfortable it had very nice amenities and the complimentary buffet breakfast was really yummy. And even thou I checked in late, the staff was very pleasant and helpful.  I will definitely be staying again !!! : )

Had a great time. This experience definitely bears repeating. Next time we will stay longer and use the wonderful pool and spa. Your staff is very courteous, informative, and friendly. And the breakfast buffet is awesome!

Pros: - All the staffs are friendly. - Room is tidy, with sofa, small living room - Mini pantry is ok with microwave oven - Hotel breakfast is ok  Cons: - Mini pantry got microwave oven but no plates/spoon/fork ? thought this to be basic utensils. - Room carpet seems to me was not vacuum everytime room cleaning was done. - Breakfast do not have sausages :) - The Wifi in the room was so weak that I am only able to connect it in living room, not in my bedroom.

This is probably the best hotel I have stayed in and is a great value.  The hotel lobby and rooms are elegantly decorated and classical music is played in the lobby and halls.  I liked the layout of our room which of course had a bathroom, but also a bar area which had another sink along with a frig. This way I could use the bar sink if somebody was in the bathroom.  A hotel sore point for me (yes, pun intended) is usually the bed and pillows, however the bed and pillows here were very comfortable and I did not awake with a stiff neck.  The complimentary breakfast was much nicer than most with eggs, sausage, ham, diced potatoes and vegetables, pancakes, and more.  Everything was delicious and beautifully displayed.  We ate dinner at the restaurant one evening and it too was

Summary Heading: Lovely but don't expect to sleep in
Summary: The Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa is beautiful, clean, beds comfy, rooms spacious & staffed with lovely people.  Special thanks to Melissa who was always so bubbly & helpful.  The free breakfast was very good, lots of bacon etc. We didn't like the powdered eggs though and after 6 days, we were getting a little sick of the same selection.  My disappointment came at 7am every morning when the planes from John Wayne airport would start flying overhead.  There was no way I could sleep past or after that.  If you know you will be getting an early start when you stay here, I would highly recommend the hotel.  If you want to sleep in past 7am, I would look further away from the airport.

Summary Heading: Not Quite what I was expecting
Summary: First, thought the rooms were nicer (quess you have to pay extra for the suite) the room smelled like cigarettes, I should have complained because they ended up charging MY credit card. I don't smoke. I didn't go to breakfast & checked out early after very little sleep due to the airport traffic. There's bikes on the outside patio where workers enter, I assume. This was by my room ...not comforting when your alone for the night just wanting sleep. Oh and called later to figure out Credit Charge & managment thus far is unavailable,needless to say the whole experience was disappointing.
Manager Response: Dear KimberlyR101,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a candid review of our hotel on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience. Our sincerest apologies if your stay was less than exceptional. We do our utmost to offer the best possible accommodations and are surprised to see you thought otherwise. We apologize for the inconveniences and are more than happy to take your call if you choose to discuss this further. We do hope you will reconsider staying with us again.   Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This was our first trip to US & we were a bit apprehensive in booking a hotel. But we had all pleasant experience right from out first call to make our booking  to our one week stay here. Its a nice cosy place with very friendly & helpful staff. We have just a small suggestion, breakfast menu can have some variation.

We had a wonderful although short stay at Ayers Costa Mesa.  We had previously stayed at another Ayers in the area and were expecting the same thing, but this one far surpassed expectations.   It was exceptionally clean, and the bed was so comfortable.  I rarely sleep well the first night away from home, but not this time!  We will be back!

I, too, am a member of the California/Nevada District Exchange Clubs.  Our arrangements were made through the catering department and Kathryn Forester was fabulous to work with.  Our Hospitality Suite, which we were allowed to furnish ourselves, was adjacent to the lovely patio area.  The staff was very helpful.  Wonderful place to stay and I will book our next event there again.

I LOVED our stay, I get severe migraine's with just a hint of cigarette smoke.  Lot's of Hotels State, they have no smoking rooms but, SMOKE goes every where and lingers...  I had no problem that stay.   Breakfast was very good along with all staff that we met.

I recently stayed at The Ayers Hotel-Costa Mesa for a  Board meeting  for the California-Nevada District  of the National Exchange Club.  The rooms are very nice and the staff are wonderful.  Their breakfast buffet had a nice selection of both hot and cold entrees.  The patio area is very nice and the staff was very accommodating for our conference room.  The hotel is very convieniently located and is very well kept and clean.  I would definitely stay there again!

The staff is so helpful and accommodating. They go the extra mile. When we arrived early, Gina was so nice and helped us to get a room despite our five hour earliness. She got our room rushed and we never felt like we were needing anything.

Summary Heading: Six Days of Worry Free Quality Lodging
Summary: Stayed at the Ayres for a week long stint to UCIrvine.  The hotel was wonderful.  Staff was extremely pleasant and efficient.  Wonderful to not have to worry about the lodging at all.  The location is one way directional because it adjoins a freeway but was not a big issue except during OC rush hour.  Wonderful, worry free business related stay.

Having previously lived in OC, I am familiar with most of the hotels and areas...and The Ayers Hotel - Costa Mesa is tops. Staff at the front desk are awesome. I stay about once a month for business and pleasure, and they are always able to handle my special requests (including room placement). Very quiet. Very clean. The cost is reasonable. Best of all, it is less than 5 minutes from the airport and convenient to everything I like to do.

Summary Heading: Our favorite spot in Orange County
Summary: We stay at the Ayres every time that we are in OC.  We typically stay in a Junior Suite which has a little more room, and a jacuzzi tub.  The surroundings are elegant, the staff ultra helpful, and the cost is affordable for such luxurious surroundings.  Everything that you need is right there - a restaurant (very good food), breakfast is included, and a lounge.  Everything is immaculate.  They do it right!

This is a great business hotel, I was a part of a two day conference and what a nice facility. The staff was courteous and attentive to our needs. The rooms were clean, comfortable and well maintained.  Breakfast buffet had a nice selection of the usual fair, hot food hot, cold food cold.  Nice place for a business meeting, really close to John Wayne airport.

What a charming place! I wouldn't normally pick a place like this but it was really a great hotel. Clean rooms (except for a lingering cigarette smell in 2 rooms). We had to switch out of the first room because it was really bad. the second one wasn't so bad. They bake cookies three times a day for the lobby guests and have a very and knowedgeable staff. The restaurant is wonder and convenient. The breakfast buffet is superb!

This was my third stay at Ayres/Costa Mesa. This is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at, whether on business or pleasure. It's a luxury hotel without the luxury price. There are simply not enough superlatives to describe the experience. I would drive many miles out of the way to stay there.

If your looking for a moderately priced clean hotel this is a good pick. The breakfast was better then many of the free breakfast that come with the rooms.  My only real complaint is there were not any towels for the kids at the pool. Granted the hotel was booked full but they should have anticipated this. When it was brought to their attention there was no effort to get more towels.  On another note one of our parties room was given away. Not sure what happened here but it was surely disappointing to the family that had to drive 1 1/2 hours home and come back the next day.

My husband and I visited for a minor surgery and this was the perfect place to recover!  We spent 4 days here and it was fantastic!  The in house restaurant is superb!  The bed was super comfortable and the room was perfectly spacious!  Everything was very clean and the hotel staff was attentive!

I was in the area for a conference and this was the perfect hotel for our stay.  Not only are the rooms nice and reasonably priced but the lobby areas are huge and have many sitting areas/tables that groups can congregate around.  Breakfast was good and coffee was strong!  There was an Aston Martin sitting at the entrance the whole time we were there and we kept wondering what that was about.   VERY nice.

We scheduled an early check in as usual and encountered no problems getting a room because they were not full.  It made it very comfortable for my husband while I attended a seminar at the hotel. Unfortunately, the staff was not happy that they allowed us to check in early and threatened the next time to charge an extra 30.00 dollars if we tried to check in early again. This development was not exactly pleasing since we have been using Ayers for a few months.  I guess they did not know there are other options in the area that don't mind early check-ins.

Stayed here for the first time while in town for a wedding. Very nice hotel, great rooms with good beds. Breakfast food was delicious. The service staff at breakfast was a little rude but the front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel was close to the airport which was a plus.

This is a nice, conveniently located facility near the airport.  Rooms were spacious and nice and staff was very accomodating.  I would have rated it higher, but we did have a couple glitches while there.  The bedding arrangement was not what I requested, but they were able to solve that the next day.  I don't really hold this against the hotel, but a cockroach wondered into the entry area of the room one day and was surprised to see that in this hotel which was a very clean and well kept hotel.  I also thought it wasteful to have the fireplace going in one of the lobby areas while the air conditioner is running at the same time.

This hotel is in a great location. Have a restaurant and bar. The facilities are comfy and well maintained. Rooms are clean and quiet. They provide with a shuttle service from and to Orange County John Wayne airport. I recomend it to any visitor to the Costa Mesa Area.

Great room, lobby and overall feel.  The staff were very friendly and helpful with traveling logistics and local knowledge.  The shuttle to and from the John Wayne Airport was a nice touch and the drivers were friendly and prompt.  The open air feel and layout of the lobby, breezeway and connecting spaces were perfect for SoCal.

This is a lovely property.  You will find the rooms are very clean and well furnished.  The central courtyard hosts a water fountain which reminds us of places in Italy.  I would recommend staying at the Ayres Hotel.

Summary Heading: Reasonably priced hotel near Newport beach
Summary: We spent one week at the Ayres Hotel.  I would have given our stay 5 stars if we had had a better reception when we checked in and I was not happy that we were given a handicapped room for our stay.  By the time, we arrived in our room, I was too tired from our flight from Boston to request a room change.  Our room was clean and the bed was extremely comfortable.  The complimentary breakfast was a nice touch.  We did not use the pool but it looked nice.  The common rooms are quite lovely and convey a warm and welcoming ambiance.
Manager Response: Dear Mar1046,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to inform others of your stay with us. We are so delighted to see that you enjoyed the complimentary full American Breakfast Buffet and thought your room was extremely comfortable and clean, despite the fact that it was not the room type you wanted. We hope in the future we can better accommodate you. Thank you again!  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: A great place to stay while in Newport Beach!
Summary: From the moment I left the Orange County Airport and got on the Ayres Hotel shuttle, I had a great experience.  The shuttle driver was helpful and friendly, and so were all hotel employees. I loved my comfie room. It felt spacious and luxurious, and I really liked the marble floors!    The breakfast was excellent.  The pool clean and a nice place to lounge. I loved the free shuttle to anywhere within a five mile radius.  Ayres Hotels knows how to make a guest comfortable and feel like they are having a luxurious experience!

I was pleasantly surprised at this cute little place.  The hotel is clean, pool and conference areas are nice, room service was great.  The thing that really sets this place apart for me was the staff.  Very friendly, helpful and above average!

clean and comfy rooms.  cool little pool area. Great breakfast!!!!! This boutique hotel is surely great for a business trip, quick family trips, solo  trip or a couples getaway.  The outside courtyard and pool area are beautiful, quiet and relaxing.  The breakfast is complimentary and plentiful!  I did not try the lunch or dinner there, but I bet the food and service is just right.  I noticed that they have a bar.  I was tempted to see if I could get a late night beer,,but I had the kids withe me :-)
Manager Response: Hi Richard,  Thank you so very much for taking the time to share your experience at our hotel with others on Tripadvisor. Your kind words are very much appreciated. I am so delighted to see that you thought your accommodations to be clean and comfortable. It is also so nice to see that you enjoyed the full American breakfast buffet. You will surely have to sneak away next time to have a quick brew at the Le Chateau Bar! :) Thank you again and please do visit again soon!  Sincerely, Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Didn't expect such a good hotel in this location
Summary: No complaints, great stay, nice pool and cabana area. Breakfast could be better, Garden area was very pretty to eat in....close to newport abd the orange county seap meet, I would totally stay there again!

The location was very convenient to the airport and easy to find. The room itself was clean and the bed was very comfortable. There was also a good selection of hot food available for breakfast. We had an overall excellent experience and would definitely stay here again.

Thank you for making my recent stay an Excellent Experience.  The quality of your facility coupled with the reasonableness of your rates made my business trip Wonderful.  I only wish I could have stayed longer!  All of your staff were helpful, congenial, pleasant to deal with and made me feel very much at home.  The availability of the shuttle service and the ease at which I was able to use the service took out any anxiety I had about getting to all of my destinations on time.  I look very forward to staying there for future business trips.  You obviously impress upon all of your employees the importance of making a "WOW" impression.  Your efforts are VERY MUCH appreciated.  Thanks again!!!

Not your usual sterile hotel at all; with courtyards, hot tub, outdoor pools, places to sit and read in the hotel and in the courtyards, and excellent,  healthy food right at the restaurant there at the hotel even until late at night (which is generally a thing of the past in the USA), it was a great place for all of our family members to stay and prepare for the wedding of my niece. Yes, the lights in the bathroom were a little dim and I would have liked for there to be a mirror somewhere in the main part of our hotel room, but I cannot complain since everything else was just that nice and staff were friendly and helpful.  Very centrally located in Costa Mesa, easy to find, and yet, a little off the beaten path with even bicycles to rent! Note that the the breakfast fare was

Summary Heading: Great service in a nice hotel
Summary: The staff was great at Ayres.  Kimberly went above and beyond carefully crafting the bus route - to and from, with transfers - for my older college student to spend the day at Disney.  The shuttle drivers were terrific taking me and my college freshman back and forth to the Concordia campus (as well as the airport).  We had three different drivers and they were all cheerful and helpful.   We were in a nicely appointed King Jr. Suite and it was very comfortable with good beds, a 2nd sink outside the bathroom and reasonable room for three.   The full breakfast was a notch above the typical one and there were cookies set out in the evening. This two night stay was a little rushed so we didn't use the pool but enjoyed it on our first stay the a few months before.  Great hotel, great

Summary Heading: Nice and comfortable place, a great value
Summary: We enjoyed our stay, the beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. The two problems I noticed were the bathroom lighting was not bright enough over the mirror and there was no TV guide for the cable channels. I would definitely stay again and would highly recommend the Ayers Hotel.

This was just a quick get away for my husband and myself and this property was perfect!  It was centrally located to every where we planned on going, the grounds are beautiful and well maintained and the staff was quiet friendly.  The room was exactly what we wanted, we stayed in a junior suite (in the suites building) w/ the jetted tub and a patio. The bed was a dream, incredibly comfortable, the patio was small and doesn't have a view but we're smokers so it's only purpose for me was morning coffee and a cigarette.  The tub was relaxing and comfortable, all the furnishings were beautiful. There were a few things that could use some TLC, for example the caulking around the tub/tile area could use to be redone but all in all everything was perfect especially for the price.  I'd

Stayed here on a recent trip to Costa Meas for a funeral. Found the location on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. Location is great if your business is near the airport. We had a junior suite which was nice. Only issue is personal. Bathroom is a long way from bedroom. Ideal layout would have it between bedroom and living room. Only a minor issue. Staff is great and attentive. Breakfast is good and atmosphere very nice. Also spent a few hours at the nice pool. Being so close to airport; you will hear some jet noise but minimal in my opinion. Hotel is offset a little from extended center line of runway which helps and hotel has soundproofing features. Elevator was inop the morning we left. A little inconvenient. Would definitely stay here again and recommended it to many

A wonderful hotel with all the amenities you would want in a stay away from home.  The mattresses are so cosy , I slept so well when we were there.  The Pool areas are just lovely and the Breakfast area is just great along with the breakfast.   .  Just love this hotel.Thank you
Manager Response: Dear patricia6636 -  It was a pleasure having you as our guest recently. Thank you so much for your kind words and for choosing us for your visit. We love hearing that a guest has found his/her stay so satisfying and our trademark Ayres Dream Sleeper mattress so very comfortable. We appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you back very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Second time staying at an Ayres Hotel and both times were excellent. Had an issue with the iron staining my shirt and Carl at the front desk took care of it, no [--]. He gave me a tide stick to try first, didn't work, then said to buy the same shirt and bring him the reciept and the hotel would reimburse. Took care of it, no questions, and awesome solution and great customer service as the shirt was for an event i was in town for. Carl also sent up a brand new iron to my room.

The staff were so helpful, friendly, and attentive! The rooms were clean, well appointed and comfortable.There is hardly a bad view with the pool, courtyard and lovely furnishings. The complimentary breakfast was delicious and very plentiful. We did socialize, with family and friends, both in the courtyard after breakfast, around the pool and hot tub, as well as in the lobby and lastly in the parking lot, as no one wanted to leave! We had 5 rooms for my daughter's wedding and all the guests commented on how luxurious and comfortable the hotel was.

We've stayed at this hotel for many years and continue to go back. The property hasn't changed for years and still feels like first time I stayed there. The rooms are the best and well... the breakfast is better than any of the large chain hotels. REAL scrambled eggs along with best of everything else you could want for breakfast. If you like English charm and polite staff you'll never be disappointed staying here.

We stayed 2 nights at the Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa.  ( me and my hubby)  Check in and Check out was fast and easy. Hotel staff was very friendly.  Check in was at 3:00pm I was able to check in at 2:30pm this was a plus for the hotel because we had an appointment in Claremont Ca.  and we needed the extra time.  We stayed in a Jr. Suite.  The room was large and clean, the bed was very comfortable.  Breakfast was very good.  The price was reasonable, I will stay here again.

This was a good location for our visit. Easy to get to and nearby major freeways.  The Suite we had was roomy for three. The staff were excellent and helpful and provided a few extra services and improved directions to the places we were visiting. We were  surprised that being so close to the airport there was hardly any noise.

This hotel is a great place to stay when in the Costa Mesa area.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The rooms are great as is the food.  My husband and I look forward to our stays.  The hotel and bar are very convenient while staying at the Hotel.

Summary Heading: Hotel made Orange County even better
Summary: Not only was the weather fabulous, my stay at the Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa made it even better.  In Costa Mesa the Ayres Hotel has a Suite side as well. I felt just as important of a guest as those who stayed there.  Both sections of the Hotel were beautifully furnished and the staff were always helpful and kind at all times.  The restruant severed delicious curtious breakfasts and wonderful meals.  The workout facility had dumbells, universal gym, 2 treadmills and more. And of course a big screen TV. The beds were very comfortable.  The courtyard was very nice; especially in the evening cool air.  You will be glad you picked the Ayres on your next trip to California.
Manager Response: Dear Tim -  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel and for choosing us for your visit to Orange County. Southern California is very sunny and we try to match that with our sunny dispositions! I am so thrilled that you found the service so welcoming at both the Front Desk and in the restaurant. I am also pleased to hear that you were able to take advantage of an evening in our picturesque courtyard. Guests do tend to love this extra place to rest. We hope you will consider staying with us again very soon.   Safe travels,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Don't Go if you want to socialize at the Hotel
Summary: Would not recommend if you want to socialize with Family at the hotel.  Our family was in from all over the US for a wedding.  Front desk staff was disappointing at check in, really the attendant was down right rude.  We were expelled from both the courtyard (this is understandable) and the lobby area as well, after hours.  We were not noisy.  Rooms and beds, very comfortable and clean.  Housekeeping staff, excellent. Close to the beach and shopping.  But, would not recommend if you are spending any time at the hotel.  There is no where to gather after 10pm.
Manager Response: Dear ejkjee -  Thank you for your candid review of our hotel. While I am pleased you found the hotel clean and comfortable, I do apologize if check-in was not more welcoming and that you were not able to mingle with your family as desired. We do hope our guests understand that we wish to ensure a good night's sleep for each of them, so large gatherings in public areas are discouraged after 10 pm. We encourage those guests desiring large family gatherings to consider reserving meeting room space with us as we specialize in family reunions among many other types of events. We hope you will still consider staying with us in the future.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I have spent there ( in the suites building) 3 nights with my daugthers. THe rooms were very large  very clean, elegant and comfortable.The location is perfect: the Hotel is very close to the domestic airport ,convenient  either to explore the beaches,either to visit disneyland, and to  go to make shopping ( south costa plaza is 3 minutes drive).

I just spent several nights at the Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa.  The staff were very helpful and friendly and went the extra mile in helping me with my boarding pass for John Wayne Airport flight.  Excellent breakfast and housekeeping service.  Was visiting family (granddaughters loved the pool) from Newport Beach and couldn't ask for a better location.  Close to Balboa Island and of course the airport.  Have stayed there several times and will not hesitate to stay there again for certain.

My 13 year old daughter and I stayed in the Suites building of the hotel for 5 days as she fought her way to Gold with her team in her water polo tournament.   Mainly reviewing the excellent service: The check in and out were swift. We asked for a higher floor and got it, no fuss. The housekeeping was unobtrusive and thorough. When I asked that it be done later as child was napping, no problem. Needed directions to a pharmacy: was given a google map outlined with the route in magic marker. A pharmacy item we needed was even stocked at the desk, saving me a trip.  Asked that I be able to take breakfast from buffet up to daughter who was feeling unwell. No problem, just return the plate.   Answered the phone immediately, overall people were kind and professional. It made it easy

I stayed at The Ayres Hotel for a conference and found that it was lovely, the breakfast really good, van service, comfy beds, even washers and dryers etc. I flew into LA using the John Wayne airport and The Ayres Hotel was just minutes away. It was 5 minutes from South Coast Plaza and 10 minutes from the beach. I didn't use the spa or exercise room so I can't report on that but I do know that they have those available. It doesn't look grand from the exterior and the view that I had was of the parking lot. However, I was quite surprised at the pleasant atmosphere and quality overall. I just found the overall stay was excellent. I will stay again.
Manager Response: Dear jtwheeler -  It was a pleasure welcoming you during the recent conference. We love having the opportunity to exceed a guest's expectations with our comfortable accommodations and pleasant atmosphere. I am so thrilled we were able to do so in your case. Hopefully your travels bring you to the area again soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This was my first stay a an Ayre's Hotel.  Very pleasantly surprised.  We really enjoyed the relaxed feeling that the Ayre's hotel & suites provided.  We were here with a group and traveling to different locations daily and it was the perfect location for our purpose.  It is located near the John Wayne/Orange County Airport and has free shuttles to and from the hotel.  The employees were extremely friendly.  We enjoyed breakfast daily which included eggs, potatoes, bacon, pancakes or french toast, oatmeal, muffins, toast, fruit, yogurt, coffee, tea, milk, and orange juice.  Very good breakfast.  Our rooms were spacious and very comfortable.  We had a junior suite, which included 2 queen bed, a small refrigerator which came in very handy, and a mini microwave.  The accommodations
Manager Response: Dear Angela -  It was an absolute pleasure having you as our guest recently. Thank you so much for taking a chance on us and giving us the opportunity to provide you with your first ever Ayres Hotel experience. We are thrilled to have made such a favorable impression on you and given you a pleasant hotel experience. Your comments are most appreciated. Please visit again soon.   Regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I really can't find anything wrong or bad to say about this hotel.  The price was right, the jr. suite room was comfortable for a family of 4, everything was clean and the staff was exceptional.  I book this room based on 3 things: value, breakfast included and tripadvisor reviews.  I was not disappointed.  The breakfast was way better than any other hotel I have ever been in where breakfast was included.  Everything was home made and prepared on site.   I have to admit that I was concerned with the potential noise from the airport being so close.  I live in a very quiet residential neighborhood and I thought it might be a problem.   Honestly, it didn't bother me one bit.  I don't recall any planes after 10 and they didn't wake me up in the morning either.  I was on the second

This was our first stay here and ended up being a pleasant surprise.  We were in the area with several other families for a water polo tournament.  This hotel was a very comfortable and homey.  We stayed in a junior suite, so were in the adjacent building to registration.  The lobby and breakfast area were a great place for our families to be able to socialize and meet up.  The room was spacious and it was a nice layout.  It was great that it included a microwave and refrigerator along with a wet bar type counter (including a small sink).  Free internet, parking and hot breakfast were also included.  Also, free airport shuttle.  This was a very good value for the room price.  My only small complaint was that the breakfast was the same everyday (scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes,
Manager Response: Dear Tracy -  Thank you so much for allowing us the chance to welcome you for the first time. How fantastic to learn that we made such an impression and proved a welcome surprise. I am thrilled to hear that you found every aspect of your stay comfortable. I also appreciate your breakfast comments, which we will utilize when we next review our offerings. We are appreciative of your review and hope to welcome you back soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This is my second stay and will always now be my go to location when staying in Orange County. Excellent service. The facility is always clean and fresh. Love the breakfast in the morning. If you are flying in to Orange County Airport then this is the location for you.
Manager Response: Dear xbejinez -  It was an absolute pleasure welcoming you recently. We are so humbled and thrilled to have made such an impression and become your choice of hotel when visiting the area. It really means the world to us. Thank you for your kind words and please visit again very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Close to airport, easy on/off freeway access, clean rooms, very accomadating pool side lounging, good food, great breakfast compared to other "included" breakfast hotels and most important...friendly/helpful staffing.

My husband and I stayed here for one night and were very sad to check out.  The room was beautiful and the hot breakfast was outstanding!  I have stayed at two other Ayres Hotel and wish there were more of them in other areas.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in Costa Mesa
Summary: 6 of us stayed here for 3 nights at the end of July. Overall o was super impressed. Kimberly was great with helping us get a reservation during a super busy weekend. The hotel is easy to get to and a great value for the money. Courtney was excellent during our check in and helped us get rooms that were near each other, again a chore because they were sold out for the weekend. The property is beautiful, rooms clean, an staff friendly. Breakfast is plentiful and the best part is there are two dining rooms to choose from so it was never super crowded like a lot of places that offer free breakfast. Also, the rest of the staff was very professional. This place is a full service, nice hotel with motel prices!  Great value and I will definitely stay again.

Excellent service at front desk even at 3 am. Comfortable room and good restaurant. Staff members were friendly everywhere. Internet service was of good speed. It was hard to arrange shuttle service according to my schedule.

Summary Heading: Nice staff, free hot breakfast buffet was delicious, and very clean room.
Summary: Definitely our favorite OC hotel. It is very close to airport and the plane noise can be annoying during the day but we are usually gone so have not been too bothered by this. Very nice hot breakfast buffet with a variety of items from bacon and eggs to oatmeal and yogurt. We like how close the hotel is to the fairgrounds, beaches, shopping, and freeway. One downside is parking. Spaces are small and some people think their SUV is a compact vehicle and take up two spots. Parking is already limited...they are just lazy. There are larger spaces around back so we park there so we do not get dings on our car from the jerks who park like crap. Overall,  a great hotel.

The Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa is truly an outstanding property. From the time of arrival to check out you receive nothing but the highest quality of courtesy and service. We travel so much that when you receive this type of professional treatment you don't want to leave.  We live in Las Vegas and our hotels should take notice and learn from the Ayres experience. We both as well as our group felt that your staff was glad to have us as guests!!! We will return to Costa Mesa soon. Thank you for another wonderful experience.

I have stayed at Ayres in Costa Mesa, CA on a number of occasions.  I have always been taken care of and have never had a bad experience at this hotel.  The rooms are always clean and ready upon arrival.  The complementary cookies in the front lobby are a great extra too!!

The Ayres Hotel chain always offers the classiest, most well-appointed facilities of all the hotels, and they do it at a most competitive rate.  The full breakfast is a wonderful feature, which saves their guests time and money, many of which are families with young athletes participating in local tournaments and are pressed for time. Their personnel are some of the most personal, genuinely polite and caring in the industry.  They have become our hotel of choice over the years for all of the above and more.  I would recommend them, and do, most highly!

I booked a suite at this Ayres, complete with the Romance Package for our pre-wedding evening. I requested a suite with a pleasant view, and the Romance Package would include a chilled bottle of champagne, and chocolate covered strawberries.  The room I got faced a parking lot, and the back of a 7-11 store. Really! The champagne and the strawberries NEVER arrived!  The room was sparsely appointed, and the bathroom so dark, I could not even shave properly.  I was totally embarrassed, and immediately booked my fiancée in a beautiful hotel in nearby Huntington Beach, the Hilton Waterfront.  Front desk reception was aloof, disingenuous, and barely welcoming. When I asked to extend my checkout by one hour to prepare for my wedding the next day, there was zero empathy or understanding
Manager Response: Dear Rich943 -  Thank you for your review of our hotel. I am exceedingly sorry that your stay with us was not more exemplary. We understand that kicking off the wedding festivities correctly was of utmost importance, so I deeply apologize if the room and view did not meet your expectations. We are always happy to switch a guest to a more suitable room should we be made aware of any issues and occupancy allows for it. As to the service you experienced, what you describe is not acceptable and I will be sure to address it with the Front Desk team. Warm, welcoming service is and should be a staple of a stay at this hotel and I apologize for this as well. We appreciate your choosing us for visits previously and hope you will still give us another chance to show you how remarkable a stay with us can be.   Regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Great hotel ! Best hotel I've ever stayed in. We were pleased with spa jacuzzi tub and cleanliness. Location is awesome, very close to great restaurants, shopping, & beaches. Breakfast & staff were awesome.

We stayed for 4 nights in July. We booked this hotel because we saw the good reviews and got a great deal. We stayed at several other hotels in the area before and many charge extra for wifi, parking and breakfast. Ayres includes everything.  When I called for reservation, I specifically asked for 2 queen beds since none of us want to sleep on a sofa bed. The lady who took the reservation definitely did not make clear to me that I might not get the room type I asked for otherwise I might not have booked it. When the confirmation email came later, it did say that the room type is a request but since I talked to a real person I thought I would get what I asked for.  When we were checking in, the front desk told us that we are getting a king and a sofa bed. I said that I
Manager Response: Dear SLTrips -  Thank you very much for your review of our hotel and for allowing us to welcome you for four nights recently. While I am very pleased you found such value in your stay and the accommodations comfortable and clean, I do apologize if the room type you requested was not available. As stated in the confirmation email room types are not guaranteed, however, you are correct that this should have been better communicated and I will definitely follow up with the appropriate people. We hope this issue did not impede your stay and that you will still consider staying with us in the future.   Safe travels,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Nice ;place.  Accomodating front desk staff, and the complimentary breakfast was very good.  I would stay there again, and would recommend it.  the only con:  close to the airport, and the early take offs were noisey.
Manager Response: Dear Jeff -  It was a pleasure welcoming you recently. Thank you so much for choosing us and for your kind words. We are so thrilled to hear that you found your stay comfortable. Hopefully you will visit again very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at Ayres ( nights of July 5,6, 7 ,8). We found the room quite nice and comfortable. The staff were helpful and courteous. Eating or just sitting in the courtyard was very pleasant. The shouttle was very helpful and convenient.  The only negative was the noisy planes flying overhead during the day. It was and is difficult to register as a member of the STASH Hotels Group.
Manager Response: Dear Jacques Z -  Thank you so much for allowing us to welcome you recently. I was overjoyed to hear that you found your accommodations comfortable and the lush courtyard perfect for a little bit of relaxation. While the plane hours are restricted, I do understand that they can be disruptive and do apologize. As to joining Stash, all a guest needs is an email address and we are more than happy to help them sign up. We appreciate your review and look forward to welcoming you again.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This is a nice hotel with friendly staff all the way from front desk to restaurant but reading the reviews @ ta I was expecting a gem which it wasn't. Our room was ok, bed was somewhat old and uncomfortable and breakfast was mediocre unless you like lots of bacon, also apparently they have a laundry room on second floor which was directly above our room and people instead of having fun were doing their laundry at anytime of day.
Manager Response: Dear GXN -  Thank you so much for your candid review of our hotel. While I am pleased you found the service amenable, I do apologize if your stay was not more stellar. Guests generally enjoy our breakfast offerings and room amenities but we understand that each guest's expectations are unique and we are sorry to not have met yours. As to the noise from the laundry room, I do apologize for that as well. We are always happy to find a guest a more suitable room should occupancy allow it and we be notified of the issues. We hope you will give us a second chance to show you we are a gem.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Very friendly staff, rooms always clean. there are many parking lots available. Free internet and  breakfast. Great locations, many restaurants and places to eat in this area. Proximity to Irvine and major shopping centers.

My husband and I spent 4 days at the Ayres Costa Mesa over the 4th of July weekend.  We were very impressed! What a beautiful place and for such a reasonable price.  The ambiance has a European flare with beautiful paintings on the wall and chandeliers on the ceilings. The hot breakfast was one of the best I 've ever had at a hotel that was included in the price of the stay.  They used traditional plates, glasses, and napkins - no paper products, which added a nice touch.  The bacon was very crisp, which I like. They also had scrambled eggs, potatoes, french toast or pancakes, oatmeal, fresh salsa, cut-up fruit, cold cereal, muffins, bread, pastries, OJ, cranberry juice, apple juice, hot chocolate, and milk. Please make sure and bring some dollars, as tips are appreciated for

From check-in to check-out, we had a great first time experience. Recently updated, quiet, great restaurant. Great value. The location is terrific. It's close to the airport, but also near Knott's Berry Farm, Disneyland and a short drive to Legoland. It is ten minutes from the great beach areas. Every staff member was helpful, knowledgeable and courteous.

We travel to Europe quite often and so when we walked into the lobby of the Ayers Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa, I was amazed!  I don't think I've been to very many (if any) hotels in the US that have truly captured the essence of Europe quite as well.  The antiques and accessories in the lobbies, halls and our suite were authentic and well chosen and what a treat to listen to classical music while having a lovely hot breakfast.  It was so much like a morning in a hotel in Europe that we vowed to stay at an Ayers Hotel whenever we can!  If you need a Euro-fix but can't get-away for more than a few days (and want to be about 15 minutes from the beach), we HIGHLY recommend a stay at Ayers Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa!

The overall experience was great due to the comfort and cozy feel of the rooms.  The service was fantastic.  The pool atmosphere - for me- would have been better without the kids.  So, if you want peace and quiet, perhaps not the hotel for you in the summer.  If you're looking for kid friendly and  a more high energy environment, the pool area was great for that.   You will hear the planes from the nearby airport, but there is a curfew at John Wayne for air traffic after 10pm.

We stay at this hotel all the time...4 - 6 times a year or more.  But this stay we decided to use the pool that is outside of building #2.  There were no towels at the pool...we had to go ask twice for towels and the furniture at the pool is so uncomfortable...wrought iron table and chairs and cheap plastic lounges the we're so uncomfortable you almost couldn't use them.  I know this isn't a resort hotel but they could make the pool area A little more resort like and inviting.  Hotel is still a good deal considering the location...down the street from Newport Beach zip code.
Manager Response: Dear Pamela -  Thank you for your candid review of our hotel and for your continued patronage. I am terribly sorry to hear that your pool experience was so disappointing. We definitely understand that comfort and service with this particular amenity is a must and will look into what we can do to remedy any issues with furniture. I also encourage all of our guests to visit the pool in the building next door as it has been recently remodeled and has a beautiful cabana area and lush greenery. I am pleased that this experience has not soured you on our hotel and look forward to welcoming you again.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Great value for a beautiful hotel
Summary: Super friendly staff, great breakfast (plus free wifi and parking included in the daily rate). Very clean and nicely decorated, and an easy drive to the beach. My one and only suggestion is to include conditioner along with the shampoo. Many hotels are going to the one bottle of conditioning shampoo, but that doesn't work for us long haired gals:)! We plan on staying here next year because it was such a great hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Pam -  It was a pleasure welcoming you recently. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience and for allowing us to welcome you. We are very pleased you found value in your stay and your accommodations comfortable. Your conditioning shampoo comment is quite timely as currently we are in the process of reviewing various separate shampoos and conditioners as a possible option for amenities. Perhaps when you next visit they will be on the counter. We appreciate your review and look forward to your next visit.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We had a 1 br suite and it was really nice having the two rooms with two tv's and frig.  The breakfasts were wonderful and it was nice sitting out on the patio with a glass of wine.   I would stay here again If I was in the area.  Location was good also.  I didn't hear any street noise at all on 3rd floor in the main building.    The only issue I had was no makeup mirror.  The mirror was so far from the sink and the lighting was so dim that it was hard putting makeup on.  That would be an added plus I think.
Manager Response: Dear Brannie -  Thank you so much for allowing us to welcome you and for your kind review. We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed our one bedroom suite and the overall ambiance of the hotel. While we do not offer makeup mirrors, I will be sure to pass this idea along to our Quality Assurance department for review. We appreciate the suggestion. We are grateful for your recommendation and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I was so looking forward to getting to a clean room. So tired could not wait to got to bed. Open the door to the room and the smell was so bad. I thought I was going to have an asthma attack. We walk to the bed and the smell was so bad, we had to leave the room.  share our story to the front desk, did not care. So we went to the westen, and had a great time.
Manager Response: Dear ddcornwell -  Thank you for your candid review of our hotel. I am so sorry that your experience with us was anything less than exceptional. Please accept my sincerest apologies for the odor issues. We take the cleanliness of our hotel very seriously and are always more than happy to move a guest to a more acceptable room should an incident like this occur and need addressing. I am very sorry that your needs were not met by the Front Desk team and have already discussed this with them as well as with the Housekeeping team to ensure against it in the future. We hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We actually stayed at another Ayres Hotel for most of our visit and decided to stay at the Costa Mesa hotel the night before we were leaving from the John Wayne airport because it was so close.
