We had a standard room for the night instead of a suite.  The room was very suitable. Next time we will turn our rental car in early and take the shuttle that is offered at the hotel. We were served by a delightful mixologist in the lounge and met a gentleman whose son's family lives in our hometown. The entire facility is carefully maintained. Amazing!
Manager Response: Dear SwedeChrys -  Thank you so much for your enthusiastic review. It was an honor to have you as our guest recently even if only for a brief stay. To be described as "amazing" is just fantastic and it is wonderful to hear that you found each part of the hotel welcoming and even made a friend along the way. Your recommendation is most appreciated and we look forward to your next visit.   Safe travels,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I had a great experience staying at the Ayres Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa with my son's baseball team.  The hotel itself is just charming with a cute outdoor patio area for eating or working on a laptop.  The free breakfast is perfect in terms of variety.  The staff is excellent..everyone that I came across was extremely nice and helpful.  It is within walking distance to many different restaurants to please everyone.  It is close to the beach, the big fancy mall, Disneyland, etc.  I would definitely come back and stay here again should the opportunity come up.
Manager Response: Dear Stacey -  Thank you so much for allowing us the chance to welcome you and your son during his recent tournament. I am thrilled to hear that the accommodations and service exceeded your expectations and, especially, that you loved our comfortable European-inspired courtyard. Many guests love this feature as it is a place to relax and recoup after a long day. We are very grateful for your review and hope you will visit again very soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I was looking for a Hotel in the Costa Mesa area.  was hoping to find one reasonably priced close to the ocean. Using Tripadvisor I couldnt find a decent one at a good price near the beach. I Settled on this Hotel due to the good ratings yet still within minutes of the ocean and close to the Airport. I  Was shockingly . surprised when i arrived . It had the look and feel of a much more expensive hotel. the lobby was quite upscale and the staff very freindly and professional. The room was extremely nice for the price range and had alot of upgrades such as a jetted tub. although out room had a view of the Freeway the sound proofing was phenominal.  The breakfast that was offered was above average. Not just your plain old self serve you normally get. If there is anything about the
Manager Response: Dear Todd -  Thank you for your very kind review of our hotel and for taking a chance on us. We love hearing that  we have surprised a guest with how comfortable a stay with us can be, so thank you for sharing your delight. It is always wonderful to hear that the guestrooms and various amenities exceeded a guest's expectations. We appreciate your enthusiastic recommendation and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Very Relaxing and a Feast for the Eyes
Summary: My husband and I just came back from staying at the Ayres Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa for 2 nights. We stayed in a junior suite that was very comfortable and beautifully decorated. This hotel is beautiful inside and out. It is located very close to the John Wayne International Airport (an easy six minutes drive) and convenient to the beaches. The hotel is like an oasis in the middle of a relatively busy area. It is located adjacent to a shopping area, a Shell Gas station, a 7-Eleven and a McDonald's. The amazing thing is that you feel like you are in a hotel somewhere in the Mediterranean. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. The decor is traditional European and there are beautiful oil paintings and chandeliers everywhere. We really enjoded the decor, the calmness, the
Manager Response: Dear Luzmarina -  Thank you so much for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you for two nights recently and for your very kind and thorough review. The Ayres family takes great pride in each hotel and is involved in everything from the decor to the day to day operations of the hotel, so it means a great deal to all of us that you found every aspect of the hotel so welcoming and comfortable. As to your comments regarding in room safes, we will take this under advisement for when we next revisit the guestroom amenities. Thank you again and please consider us the next time you are in the area.   Safe travels,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stayed at this hotel second time when I visited Orange County again for a training. I must say that everything was again very nice including its helpful and polite staff from housekeeping to hotel managers. The location is very convenient, near John Wayne Airport, South Coast Plaza mall, 3 beautiful beaches within 4 miles of the hotel. Lots of good restaurants, with reasonable and affordable price. Room was super clean. Free breakfast buffet, free wifi and wires Internet and free shuttle service.  I would definelty recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Saadi_S -  Thank you so much for allowing us the chance to welcome you a second time. We love when our guests return and give us the opportunity to show them how consistent a stay with us can be. I am also pleased to read that you found the location of the hotel convenient to so many local Orange County attractions. We appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you back a third time!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We always enjoy our experience at the Ayers Hotel in Costa Mesa.  My wife is sooooo particular and she raves about the Ayers Hotel.  The rooms are spacious and very clean.  The beds are so comfortable you would like to take them home with you.  The breakfast is always excellent.  I can't say enough positive things about our experiences with the Ayers Hotel & Suites.
Manager Response: Dear David -  Thank you so much for your enthusiastic review of our hotel. We greatly appreciate your continued patronage and are thrilled you and your wife find your stays so consistently comfortable. We are so grateful to be your "go to" hotel in the area and look forward to your next visit.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: A beautiful hotel not too far from the beach!
Summary: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous!  Check in was a breeze and the staff at the desk helpful and very pleasant.  I was upgraded to a suite and stayed in the "all suites" building on the third floor.  Our room was spotless and beautiful.  We had a small fridge and a microwave.  It was very quiet and I didn't hear anything except the planes that flew overhead while the window was open.  This is very close to the airport in costa mesa.  I originally wanted a hotel on the beach, but there wasn't anything under $200 a night that had good reviews.  It was well worth staying 10 minutes from the beach to stay at this fabuluous hotel.  The free breakfast included scrambled eggs, bacon; potatoes; cereals, fresh cut up fruit and all kinds of rolls/bread as well as juices and coffee (which

Summary Heading: I see why this place is number 1
Summary: I can't think of one area this hotel dropped the ball on. Rooms great big clean, fridge, 2 big tv's bar area all in our 2 room suite.  Restaurant good staff awesome pool, a little small but clean and well managed.  The breakfast was good.  Lots of variety, Bacon!    The attention to detail was present in all areas.  Cleaning staff in particular was on top of everything.  I appreciate the work it takes to train and keep a great staff and it was obvious they have things figured out at this particular Ayres.  Even though close to Airport,  we didn't hear it at all at night. As near as I could see they  don't recycle cardboard which I found a little unusual in Ca.  They do use glass plates and cups in breakfast which saves a lot of waste.

Summary Heading: Tried the Marriott, came back to Ayres
Summary: I have stayed at the Ayres Costa Mesa many times for work, and all were wonderful. A couple of weeks ago, some co-workers convince me to try their Marriott. Not only was it more expensive in many ways, the walls were thin, the headboard in the adjoining room not well attached to the wall (if you get my meaning), and the beds at the Marriott were too hard. The towels were also cheap at the Marriott!!   The Ayres has excellent staff, a great restaurant, and plenty of staff always walking around, ready to help. The room is clean, towels are quality, and they take care of everything. Terrific Value.  I really like the breakfast--I can chose what I want, and it is ready. No waiting to pay $10 for a breakfast that isn't what I really want. When you talk to the staff, you find out that

beautiful hotel with an excellent service. breakfast buffet was wonderful! suite has a whirlpool tub. room was big and clean. location was very convinient. airport and south coast plaza and many restaurants near by. we'll definitely come back again.

Well....... as usual the rooms and service were amazing!! My sister and I wanted to get away for a couple of days and of course I chose Ayres what else. The price is great and the breakfast is awesome and so relaxing.  This might seem strange but I was glad to see a tip basket at the food buffet and also the tables had a table card that let you know that gratuity was not included in the breakfast. I know first hand as a recent waitress that this is so considerate of the company. I was glad to tip and the cooks and waiters deserved it! They were on top of it the whole time, our cups of coffee were never empty!

My husband, mother, daughter and I were in town for our daughter's graduation from UCI.  Based on our experience during a previous stay, it was a "no brainer" for us to book a room for a couple of nights at Ayers, Costa Mesa.  Excellent accomodations:  great price/value, very nice  (and clean) room, delicious breakfast.  Oh, and warm, delectable cookies in the afternoon.  Nice, personable staff.
Manager Response: Dear DORF828 -  Thank you so much for returning to our hotel! It was wonderful having the chance to host your visit during your daughter's graduation. I am so pleased you found the hotel as comfortable and accommodating as your first visit. We are very grateful for your review and wish your daughter the very best in her future!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Quality hotel with suites and ornate furnishings.  I had a patio suite in the second building which was quiet, and comfortable.  My business meeting was in a pool side meeting room on the bottom floor of the property.   Customer service is attentive whether you are dealing with the shuttle driver, desk clerk, housekeeping or food service staff.  The design of the hotel is unique, but it works in this setting.  It would be a mistake to pass this property without consideration.

We stay at Ayres whenever we visit SoCal.  Usually at the one in Costa Mesa.  We have always had a great experience and this time was no exception.  The service, room quality, food and value were great once again.
Manager Response: Dear Philip -  It is always a pleasure welcoming you. Thank you so much for making us your choice of hotel when visiting Costa Mesa. We are so thrilled to hear you find your visits so consistently comfortable. We are very grateful for your review and hope to welcome you back very soon.   Safe travels,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: i say in this hotel every time i come down to costa mesa for work. Their hotel is always clean the staff is always helpful and it is safe. I love their breakfast in the morning its always fresh and the coffee is really good.
Manager Response: Dear Adam -  Thank you for your kind review of our hotel and for making us your choice of accommodations when in the area. We are always more than happy to provide you with comfortable guestrooms and welcoming service. We appreciate your kind words and hope your works brings you to the area again very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: On a quick business trip I just spent a few hours in this property. Convenient because off highway exit. Very traditional design of rooms. However, clean rooms, polite staff. Don't go there for fitness (very small room with 2, 3 machines), pool (unless you just want to dip) or, especially, breakfast (true continental breakfast or what americans understand under that term: no Orange Juice, no black tea, no service - essentially everything which makes you fat and ugly is on the very limited buffet. Breakfast area extremely minimalist). Internet WiFi however is good throughout the property.
Manager Response: Dear Geneva2009 -  Thank you very much for your candid review of our hotel. While I am pleased you found the staff accommodating and rooms clean, I do apologize if our breakfast offerings were not as expected. We value any constructive comments and will use yours when we next revisit what we are providing. Thank you again and please consider us the next time you visit our area.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Happy to be able to check in early. Unfortunate noisy kids in pool till 10:30. So glad JWA closes 10PM til 7 AM as jet noise is substantial during those hours. Breakfast is nice and good coffee.  Conference guest music loud at 9:30 AM, so happy we weren't sleeping in. Next time we will request being away from both courtyards. Avoid super uncomfortable pull out beds!
Manager Response: Dear Sue -  It was a pleasure welcoming you recently. Thank you so much for your review and for allowing us the opportunity to host your stay. I am glad to hear you generally enjoyed your visit although I apologize if noise created any kind of problem. We would be more than happy to provide a guestroom away from the courtyard during your next visit. Thank you again and please consider us the next time you are in the area.   Safe travels,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This is a great place. We went with the kids and it was great. You can hear the airplanes when you are at the pool, but we slept great and couldn't hear the planes at all. Free parking, free wi-fi and free breakfast make this the best value in Orange County. I would go back in a second.
Manager Response: Dear Jonathan -  It was a pleasure welcoming you recently. Thank you so much for your review and for choosing our hotel for your stay. Whenever we hear we have done an "excellent" job providing a guest with the best possible service and accommodations we are thrilled. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you back soon.   Safe travels,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The hotel was very lovely and clean. The only complaint we had was when we went to breakfast, we decided to take our food back to our room. By the time we got back someone called and asked us to bring back their plates..also the next day we when we walked in at about 8:50 we were told to hurry because they close at 9...we felt that was very rude.Otherwise everything was very nice. We also appreciated having the shuttle service.
Manager Response: Dear Jazzgirls -  It was wonderful having the opportunity to welcome you recently. I am so pleased to hear that your overall stay was a comfortable one and that the complimentary shuttle service proved useful. I am sorry if the incidents you mentioned at breakfast time came across as rude as I am sure this was not the intent. Your comments have been reviewed with the appropriate individuals to ensure against this in the future as our top priority is providing the warmest possible service to all of our guests. We appreciate your review and hope you will visit again soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Friendly  and accommodating staff - and clean rooms. I recommend this hotel. I stayed here for a workshop held at UC, Irvine (the hotel is close the campus and the airport). The roar of the airplanes from the nearby John Wayne airport was a bit off putting. But the friendliness and professional nature of the staff made the stay enjoyable.
Manager Response: Dear brownphdgirl -  It was a pleasure welcoming you during the recent workshop at nearby UCI. Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your stay and for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. To know we have provided a guest with comfortable accommodations and warm service is fantastic as that is our main goal. We understand that the nearby airport can produce noise but like to inform our guests that the flight hours are limited, so early morning and late nights are no fly times resulting in comfortable sleep for our guests. We appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you back very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We just want to praise the always professional, flexible and helpful front desk staff at this hotel.  We are here every few months and always have a nice experience.  The hotel continues to be in good shape and the quality of everything is high, especially for their price point.  As often as we stay, a little more variety in the breakfast would be nice.  You have to not mind jets flying right over in the daytime.
Manager Response: Dear EdFB  Thank you so much for your kind review and for your continued patronage to our hotel. I am so pleased to know you find your stays consistently comfortable and that the service and accommodations bring you back time and again. We will be sure to take your breakfast comments under consideration. Thank you again and please visit soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The Ayres is a very lovely hotel. The all employees were friendly and helpful. The room we stayed in was very clean and comfortable. Can't wait to come back in June, having all of our out of town guests stay at this hotel for my son's wedding. And we are using one of their conference rooms for the Rehearsal Dinner. The "Living Room" it's called, French doors open up to the pool area. Beautiful!!! I highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Char -  Thank you very much for your kind words and for making us even a small part of your son's future big day! We look forward to hosting your family and showing them just how comfortable a stay with us can be. We are also thrilled you chose hold the rehearsal dinner in the Living Room as the decor and view will definitely have a great impact on all the guests. We wish you the best of luck in all of the planning and hope it is a successful event.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Very Clean and staff was wonderful
Summary: Even though planes from John Wayne Airport fly over the Ayres Hotel the hours of operation did not impact our stay. We really like how accommodating the staff was and how very friendly all of them were. Would definitely recommend to others.
Manager Response: Dear SAMM2734 -  Thank you so much for taking the time to recommend our hotel and for choosing us for your visit to the area. It was an absolute pleasure welcoming you as our guest and we hope you will stay with us again very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My daughter had a soccer tournament a few miles away.  It worked out awsome!  And of course the 5:30 cookies went over well with her!! Breakfast was really good as well.  I think the only thing that was an issue was the fold out bed....not comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear Cindee -  Thank you so much for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you and your daughter recently. I am so pleased to hear that your stay was so comfortable and the complimentary amenities to your liking. As to the mattress on the sofabed, we definitely want to ensure our guests are getting the best possible service and would be happy to investigate the possibility of replacing this mattress if you would be kind enough to email us with the appropriate room number. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and look forward to welcoming you again in the future.   Safe travels,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The room was elegant,  quiet and comfortable. Enjoyed the complimentary full breakfasts and a delicious lunch and a dinner during our weekend stay.  We enjoyed the beautiful artwork--paintings and old photos displayed on the lobbies oand hallways.  The staff were fiendly amd helpful.

I stayed at this hotel while I was in California for a business trip. This hotel is beautiful! Everyone was very friendly and the rooms were simple but the beds were very comfortable. The free breakfast was amazing and the coffee was also delicious! The shuttle was also very convenient they offer a shuttle for guests to use to pick you up and drop you off with in 5 miles from the hotel. They're super close to the airport and also provided transportation to and from for me as well. Overall this was a great experience and I would definitely stay there again!

We had an early morning flight and the thought of fighting traffic lead us to this Ayres hotel. I like Ayres hotels in general.  They are well appointed and include, parking, breakfast and internet in the room rate.  The breakfast at this hotel was especially good, including a buffet of eggs, sausage, fruit, yogurt and some table service. A very good value.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -  Thank you so much for taking a chance on us when you decided to beat the traffic! How wonderful to know we have lived up to the expectations set by our sister hotels. Like them, we strive to provide top notch service and the most comfortable accommodations possible. We were honored to have you as our guest and hope you will stay with us again very soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Wonderful   h GPS ad they can not find this hotel.   But once you find it it is a gem.  Loved it.
Summary: Great place friendly staff.  Close to beaches.   Great shuttle service.   Be careful with your GPS as it will route you somewhere else.  But this is a perfect place to stay.   Has a great bar cand restaurant.  Everything  us woderful. great breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear Boxshop -  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel and for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you. It is wonderful to know you found your stay so comfortable even with difficulty in finding the hotel. While guests generally have a fairly easy time finding us, the one way street can make things a bit tricky. We do provide specific directions in our confirmation letters and always encourage guests to call with any questions or trouble they may have in locating us. We are so glad you were able to make your way to us and we hope you will visit again in the near future.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: One of the Nicest in the Area
Summary: I enjoyed two nights here, a week apart. The first night in the adjacent building and the second in the main section. Both areas are nice and each has it's advantages. I had a suite in the main building and it's always nice having the extra space, but since I was traveling alone not really necessary. I understand this is a family owned and operated company and I think it's reflected in the way the hotel is run. Everyone was cordial and friendly and some employees have been with the hotel for decades. The decor of the hotel is reminiscent of finer hotels around the world, an elegant ambiance. I entertained guests for dinner in the hotel restaurant and everyone one enjoyed the entire experience.  I used their complimentary shuttle to and from the airport, a very nice convenience.

We stayed in a 2 queen room at the Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa. The room was large and had lots of mirrors, which was nice when several people were trying to get ready at the same time. The bathroom has a large jetted tub and marble flooring.  The hotel offered complimentary hot breakfast each morning and provided excellent service. We especially loved the pool area. There are nice cabanas to get out of the sun but still enjoy the breeze. The location was very easy to get to and located a 20 min. drive to Disney or the Beach. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Southern California.

We only stayed one night at this Ayers Hotel in Costa Mesa and it was great.  The rooms are beautiful and comfortable.  We decided to stay at the hotel for dinner instead of going out.  The food and service were great.  No complaints from the 6 or us that stayed and ate there. Would stay at an Ayers Hotel anytime!

Excellent hotel and service. I enjoy the Ayers. The location is close to John Wayne airport. There is a great selection of restaurants in the area. The rooms are  a nice size and very clean. If visiting the OC this is a centrally located hotel. The pool and Jacuzzi are both very nice.  I will stay here again. Was here for 3 days.

My stay at Ayres Hotel was pleasant and enjoyable. I was in town for a convention, which was down the street. Therefore, it was nice to be close. When returning to this area, I will likely stay here again. Clean room and pleasant staff. Breakfast was a nice spread.

Summary Heading: Another wonderful stay at Ayres Costa Mesa
Summary: This is the 8th time we have stayed at the Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa, but the first time I've written a review. We love this Ayres and when traveling to this area would not choose another hotel. It is a clean, well equipped, well taken care of, beautiful and accommodating hotel! The food in the restaurant is good. We stay in a regular room with a king bed and it is plenty of room for us. We like the rooms on the 2nd or 3rd floor where the door opens onto the court yard because I don't feel closed in when walking to my room. This time we had 364 which had a window view of the courtyard. It was also nice. I highly recommend the Ayres Hotel and Suites.

Summary Heading: A great place to stay near Newport Beach and the Orange County coast.
Summary: Just coming to the end of my 8-day stay here, which included both a conference hosted in the hotel and a few days after for holiday.  Stayed in a 'Junior Suite' - roomy, welcoming, clean and comfy. Nice.  Food has been good (tho mostly I've sampled it as part of a group catered outside of the main restaurant), breakfast great and the staff uniformly and remarkably friendly, efficient and welcoming.  Only downside is noise from occasional planes taking off from the airport, but neither terribly early or late and didn't bother me.  Easy access to great shopping, several stunning beaches and (my favourite) Balboa Island.  Would happily come again if I got the chance.

Booked a 5 day stay on line and the photos did it justice.  It was a very nice and clean hotel.  The food in the restaurant is very good.  It was somewhat confusing getting around the hotel but the rooms were very nice and lcean.

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel, perfect for our weekend
Summary: We stayed here while in town to run the OC Half Marathon. We booked a suite and were very pleased with this room. The room had an extremely comfortable King bed, and plenty of space for us to spread out our race gear, stretch, and relax. The room also had a spacious jetted tub which was very relaxing. But most importantly, the room was very clean - it's my deal breaker when it comes to hotels, no matter how many stars. My husband and I really enjoyed the property in general; the decor is European, something we don't normally see, and at first when I saw the pictures online I equated the decor with old. But once on property, I could see that everything was in excellent condition. I have to extend major kudos to the hotel manager; the race set up a special shuttle through the City

Summary Heading: Incredible hotel, great environment, excelent rooms and beautifull plazas
Summary: This hotel was an incredible suprise for me. The decoration is nice, the common room is very plesant, they had water and some cookies for the guests (close to entrance). The staff is very helpfull and nice. My room had two king size beds, a big TV, the bathroom was spacious and very clean. I love the 2 squares they have... Seems like you're in italian environment... Very beautifull! You can have your breakfast in one of them and in the another you can enjoy the pool and the jacuzi :)  The hotel is big and has a lot of paitings in the walls. It's a very classic athmosphere, but at same time sofisticated! The decoration remembers a little bit the maritime discoveries. There's some little boats and objects related with maritime navigation in the decoration. The place have also,  a

Fantastic. Rooms are beautifully decorated.  Hotel is ultimately clean. Plenty of room, comfortable beds. Comfortable sofa. Delightful fireplace in the room was an added touch. Room had a refrigerator, coffee maker , iron and ironing board.  The Hotel Shuttle is very accommodating. Beautiful swimming pool area, fountain area outside the restaurant. The restaurant's food was delicious.  Will be staying at an Ayres Hotel again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel with a great staff
Summary: Rooms are sizable and well appointed.  Free wireless.  Free buffet breakfast (at least through my company).  Staff is extremely courteous.  Clean and well kept.  Would absolutely recommend.  (Decor is a little cheesy, but everything is still nice).

very accommodating from the people at the front desk to the service in the restaurant. I needed a recommendation for a beauty shop that was open on a Sunday AM and the oerson at the desk called around and found a great place for me. When going to the restaurant the servers were very accommadating. We would start with a few people and as more arrived we could include the new comers even if it meant changing tables or adding tables. The menu was diverse and the prices reasonable..

The attention to detail in the design and decor of this hotel was impressive.  The location was good to highways, Newport Beach, Balboa Island and UC Irvine.  The restaurant was excellent with a beautiful courtyard setting to dine outdoors.  The pool was very nice and well kept.

We had a great experience at Ayres.  Nice size standard room, clean, comfortable bed, quiet and well appointed,  Very handy location in Costa Mesa.  Parking and wifi are included in room rate as is a delicious hot breakfast.  We will return, and highly recommended.

We like this hotel for its convenient location, free Internet, Parking, and Breakfast.  The minifridge is a bonus surprise.  Both check-in & out were efficient and prompt. The breakfast is better than most free breakfast with at least 6 hot items.  We love the bacon and friendly attitude of the serving staff.

The Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa is our go to place when we visit our daughter that is a student at UC Irvine.  We have been to the hotel so many times that we are now members of the Stash Rewards program.  The hotel is centrally located in OC near the university, shopping, eating, and major freeways.  The front desk staff is always so friendly when checking-in.  We also enjoy the complementary breakfast in the mornings.  The breakfast staff is always smiling and friendly, too.  The Ayres provides a great selection of fresh and tasty eats for breakfast in a buffet type setting.  The rooms are nicely decorated.  We typically get one of the junior suites, which have comfortable beds with nice linens, and clean and spacious bathrooms.  The junior suites also have a microwave,

Good breakfast and helpful front desk staff. When I arrived I couldn't get through to the hotel so I had to take a taxi. This was annoying. The restaurant in the hotel also closes at around 11 pm, which made it difficult to see people in the evening.

Great very friendly staff. Breakfast was awesome.  Great views down to pool and outside patio. My husband, mother , and daughter all were talking about how we will definitely have to come back! Thanks guys !

Front desk staff 7 bell service people were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant had good food, large portions, we had dinner and breakfast there. The breakfast buffet had a good selection of hot and cold food as well as goodies to add to your coffee. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, I slept well here which isn't usually the case.

The front desk staff is always very friendly & helpful.  I standard rooms are nice, but I really like the Jr. Suites the best.  The Jr. Suite has a much better setup with a couch & an amazing jacuzzi tub.  I really love the theme of the hotel with all the paintings on the wall.  It really sets the hotel apart from your average hotel.  The restaurant on site is really good as well!  The breakfast service in the morning is always very enjoyable.  I highly recommend this hotel!!

The hotel had been recommended to me and I made the reservation despite the fact that I read a few negative reviews online; for one night, I figured, I could manage whatever was coming my way. To my great surprise, none of my expectations were met. Instead: everybody at registration was very friendly and accomodating, the room was pleasant (and quiet, as I had requested) with all the amenities I needed, the restaurant food delicious and fairly priced, the restaurant staff delightful, the restaurant atmosphere pleasantly subdued to enable intimate conversations, the breakfast truly 'full' and tasty (one small complaint: as I was in a hurry -- which I had not indicated upon my arrival --, I had to walk into the kitchen to ask for coffee). My one negative comment, which has nothing

I had to make a quick trip for work and with a very affordable 'conference rate' for the night, I anticipated budget style accommodation.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The lobby is elegant and inviting, with turn of the century art and decor - it was beautiful and impressive.  The staff were very friendly.  I stayed in room 359 and it was quiet, spacious, very clean with nice furniture and decor. The breakfast buffet was included in my room rate; they served bacon, scrambled eggs and french toast, alongside breads, fruit and yogurt.  I have to add, I am an avid coffee drinker and the coffee at breakfast was the best I have ever had at a hotel!  All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel for a short stay in Orange County, I would be happy to return here as a guest.

I was in Orange County for business and also had business in San Diego and Los Angeles; this hotel was a perfect location for easy on/off the freeway. Rooms were clean and the daily full breakfast was a great way to start the day. A small complaint is lack of parking near rooms. As there are a few different buildings, the walk to the car was far - maybe they can somehow have certain areas for certain buildings. Another small complaint was lack of water pressure... One last thing...this hotel was previously a 'Country Inn and Suites' - the only reason I know that is because there were still signs in the bathroom stating such - after the hotel has been a Ayres for well over 2 years. I would certainly return - now that I know a little more what to expect.

We stayed in room 352. It was very quiet and clean. Stayed here two nights.  The only bad thing was that the door to the bedroom made a loud noise every time we opened it after being shut so we woke up our kids at night every time we used the bathroom.  Free breakfast was ok, too bad they dont have a cook to make omletes like the embassy. I asked for an omlete but the waiter said that would be an extra charge. Price in costa mesa was cheaper than anaheim but Location was 10 miles from Disneyland so next time we will try the Ayers in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear 37Traveler37 -  Thank you very much for choosing us for your stay and for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. We are so pleased to hear that the room was quiet and clean, although we wish your stay was truly remarkable from start to finish. We know our sister property is close to Disneyland but do hope you will allow us another chance to show you how exceptional a stay with us can be!  Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Clean rooms, excellent free breakfast and free parking!
Summary: I was attending a seminar at the Hilton Hotel just up the street from the Ayres. I was not crazy about paying $20 plus just to park at the Hilton. Not being familiar with the area I did a little research and had to try this place because of all the great reviews. It did not disappoint.   I got one of the junior suites, which are in a different building from the main lobby.The lobby of the second building was beautiful and felt very much like home with the fireplace going. Huge paintings on the walls, ship models in plastic cases, and very nice furniture. My room was very clean, roomy, and the jacuzzi tub was a nice surprise. Plenty of extra towels and it even had a small dining table with a couple of chairs so you don't have to eat off the coffee table or use the writing desk to

Stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Orange County.  The one-bedroom suite was nice enough and fit our family of 4 great.  The breakfast buffet was perfect and a great way to start the day.  Our only complaints were that it is really close to the airport - planes don't start flying until 7:00 am - so if you like to sleep in, good luck!  Also, they are doing MAJOR renovations to one of the floors and the noise was definitely annoying.  They too didn't start working until after 7:00 am, but it closed the pool which my kids were looking forward to using in the evenings.  What I didn't understand is from the start why they didn't place us in the 2nd building, away from all the noise!

Summary Heading: Good overall with one minor disappointment
Summary: I had stayed 3 nights at $125 per night this week for a conference.    The room is pretty clean, but there were little pieces of hair on walls and toilet seat.  The breakfast buffet is not bad with a live person making pancakes or French toast and a real person serving coffee and removing plates. The two people serving the buffet area were very friendly and helpful and they seemed to be the most friendly persons through my stay. I added 1 star to the overall score of 3 because of the buffet staff's helpfulness.    The hotel is pretty quiet at night and most common areas are very clean.  Everything meets my expectation, except the bedding.  For some reason, my down comforter is completely flat and seems to have some moisture.  I did want to bother with it but this is unusual and

My stay at the Ayers Hotel in Costa Mesa, CA. was the most wonderful experience.  I was greeted with the most fantastic staff.  Arriving early,  they held my bags until my room was ready.  I was able to use the business center to log on and print boarding pass.  There were 2 wonderful pools and 2 hot tubs.  Rooms were so spacious, marble tile, elegant comfortale beds. wet bar and comfortable sofa.  Great restaurant, and the workout room had just the right equiptment.  Complimentry full delicious breakfast was included as was the free shuttle to John Wayne Airport.   Did I forget free paper and chocolate chip cookies at night.  This is a five star hotel in my opinion.  Kevin L

Summary Heading: Great hotel at a reasonable price!
Summary: I have stayed a several different Ayres Hotels and always been happy but last night was the first time I stayed at Ayres in Costa Mesa.  I found it very centrally located - Close to Newport Beach, Fashion Island and South Coast Plaza and only 45 minutes form LAX.  The entire property is very well maintained and the rooms are quite comfortable with quality beds and linens.  Breakfast was included with a nice variety to choose from including a cooked to order hot breakfast if one so desired.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.

I have frequent business trips.  I prefer the Ayres properties for all my trips, but especially to the Newport Beach property.  The rooms are well appointed. When I can justify it, I stay in the Suites - at a rate that is still less than the major hotel chains.  Aryes is pretty much all inclusive - no internet fees, no parking fees - and a very good breakfast is included in the price.    Book early  - they do sell out.

Summary Heading: A step back into mid-20th Century feel, yet the ammenities of the 21st
Summary: This is definitely one of my favorite hotels. The Decor makes you feel that you just stepped back into the 40's and 50's. But not just any standard hotel back then, into one of the most luxurious, well appointed "5" Star hotels of that era. Feeling like a dignitary, you stroll to your room. The Decor never misses, and continues the feeling right up to the Pillows used on the Bedding. The Pools and Hot Tubs are always well maintained, the workout room is great, and the Restaurant is also well done.   You will definitely not be disappointed with the price, amenities, great personable staff, Shuttle services and the list goes on...

Summary Heading: Great New Hotel in Costa Mesa
Summary: We've stayed in 2 other Ayres' properties before, and were excited to find one in the area that we were visiting this time (Costa Mesa). This one is very new, but is shaping up to be as excellent as the others that we've visited.   This property was just as friendly, well appointed, and organized as the other 2, and the staff has been fabulous at each site.  Breakfast was excellent, with a good selection of healthy food, for vegetarians and meat-eaters alike. Thank you!!

Very nice clean room, very close to the Huntington Beach, comfortable beds and nice jetted bathtub. Breakfast was excellent and a superior customer and front desk service. We will stay in this location again..

The staff at the Costa Mesa Ayres should teach other hotels about customer service! From the front desk, the restaurant and cleaning staff, they couldn't be better. The hotel is beautiful, extremely convenient from John Wayne airport, and amazing for the price. Food in the restaurant was good as well. You come away feeling valued as a customer. Also, there is a nature preserve nearby for biking (bike rental at the hotel), joggin, or walking. Great!  Definitely coming again.

The weeklong stay was fabulous. Breakfast was excellent but missing some sausages. Bed was like home! It is compared to my sleep number bed. Staff was very very nice and very pleasant. Amenities are so convenient! Close to airport and UCI. Shuttle drivers are great! I felt safe in this hotel, even though I did not see a security guard roaming around even in the wee hours! Love it! Love it! We will definitely comeback and spread the news! Highly recommended!

Great hotel in Costa Mesa...20 minutes to Disneyland and 15 mins to Newport Beach...great location and very reasonably priced. Stayed in a Jr Executive Suite...nice size, clean, comfortable beds...only con was shower water pressure was lacking.  Kids loved both pools and the comp breakfast was good. Free parking...what else can you ask for.  Would recommend to my friends and family.

This was a weekend trip away for just the weekend. The hotel, employeesand free breakfast guffet was all very good. Our only complaint was that they had a high school volleyball tournament nearby and it could be noisy at times. We realize there was just lots of teenage girls around and it was just their nature. Highly recommend this hotel!

This hotel is great.  My son and I stayed there for 6 days while he was checking out the Law school.  We were comfortable.  The housekeeping service is top rate.  I felt incredibly safe in this hotel.  I can't say one thing negative about it.

This hotel has a great European feel to it.  Great pictures in the hallways, wonderful fireplace and seating room, pleasant employess, breakfast is perfect with healthly choices.  Rooms are comfortable, clean with plenty of space.

We booked this for 2 nights as we were visiting family in Costa Mesa.  It's across from one of the runways at John Wayne Airport but you heard very little jet noise.  Check-in was effortless and we loved our suite.    It was nice having a separate BR from the LR area.  The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  We thought the breakfast buffet was fantastic.  There was a big selection of items and all were well-prepared.  The last time we visited this area, we stayed at the Fairmont.  That was lovely but we ended up liking the Ayres Hotel more and will book again when we're back in CA.  The room rates were very favorable.
Manager Response: Dear It'sTimeToTravel -  Thank you so much for allowing us to welcome you and for taking a chance on an unknown hotel. We are absolutely thrilled to have provided the kind of service and amenities that will bring you back to us for another visit and look forward to welcoming you back the next time you are in the area. Thank you for your review!  Safe travels,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My husband, daughter, and I are in love with this hotel. Luxury. We feel like a million dollars when we are here because of the kind staff (including the breakfast staff!)! It is very clean, stylish, and comfortable. The pool and hot tub are excellent. Every time we stay here we are so glad that we did! It is BEAUTIFUL. Unfortunately, I do get a special rate with another hotel chain, and it is often less expensive than this. But when we do splurge and stay here, we love every minute!
Manager Response: Dear Joel L -  Thank you for making us your splurge! We are always happy to know our service and decor have made a difference in a guest's hotel stay and are thrilled to have made such an impression. We want you to stay here as often as possible too, so please feel free to call us any time you are visiting to see what special rates and promotions we have available. We appreciate your review and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Safe travels,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: best place to stay in Southern California
Summary: Relaxing place to stay with great staff. Excellent value in Southern California. Like the idea that you can rent bicicles on the premisis as there is a nice trail nearby tha you can ride to the beach. Centrally located between Irvine and Huntington Beach area and near the Orange County Airport.
Manager Response: Dear Christine -  Wow! What a very kind review of our hotel. To be called the "best in Southern California" is an absolute honor. Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your visit and for sharing your experience online. I am so pleased you found the location and added amenities (such as our bicycle rentals) conducive to your needs. We are very grateful for your review and hope to welcome you back soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Stayed here with my boyfriend numerous times. The whole experience here is a class act. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated, very European-the rooms very nice (love the furniture style!) with bar and fridge. Love the breakfast in the morning, think it was included in the price. Always nice to go down to the jacuzzi for a relaxing soak. This is one of the nicest hotel chains around! Love staying here!!

We have been using Ayres Hotels personally and for our church retreats for the last 12 years and have always been treated with great accommodations and service. The decor of the Ayres Hotels are so beautiful, the pool area so pleasant, and the beds in these spacious beautiful rooms offer a great night of sleep. You cannot go wrong with choosing Ayres Hotel.

Ayres is bringing European style into Southern California.  And this is perhaps one of the most decorated Ayres property.  The high ceiling lobby decorated with antique sofa and ship model handicrafts definitely make this hotel one of the kind.  Also breakfast area is one very unique restaurant of it's own.  Library style setting is something very hard to find in a 3-4* hotel.Room is nice and clean with a lounge area and a flat screen TV.  European style bed is signature to Ayres.  Breakfast was quite standard.  Scramble egg, bacon, pancake, oatmeal, cereal, toast, milk, juice, and coffee.  Other Ayres has omelet but I guess it's more difficult for this one since the dining area mainly serve as a regular restaurant.  The pool is very nice with Jacuzzi and cabanas, which is a

I have stayed at the Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa several times for business. Overall - an incredible value for the area. Free, hot breakfast is also a very nice perk & they offer a shuttle that will drop you off & pick you up in the surrounding 5 mile radius. Very easy way to get to/from Southcoast Plaza mall if you have some free time. The rooms are well appointed & clean but the decor does make me giggle - it's a little Renaissance Festival themed if you ask me but it works. It's an incredible price for Orange County and they also offer free {outdoor} parking for guests.

This hotel never fails to provide a clean, well decorated room, excellent service, and great hospitality!  We try to stay more often, but come at least once a year, and have never been disappointed.  Oh, and did I mention the price blows away the competition?  :)

Nice and helpful staff, spacious room and washroom, good hot breakfast, and overall excellent service were my experience there.  I will certainly prefer to stay there again, whenever I go to the Orange County, CA.

This hotel is lovely an quaint! Comfortable beds, very clean rooms and free breakfast and parking provided. We arrived early from Australia and asked if we could check in early, this was no problem at all. Would DEFINATELY recommend and stay again!

Stayed there for 2 nights (Jan. 30 - Feb. 1, 2013). Very comfortable - large and very clean (new?) room.  Great service. Very close to John Wayne Airport (5-10 minutes drive) and also very close to Disneyland. Breakfast at the hotel's restaurant (included with the room) was great.  However, there is complimentary breakfast (coffee and muffins,etc) at the lobby.

I have been staying here in the suites (the unattached building) for business for about 8 months, twice a month for week long stretches. The suite building has its own breakfast seperate from the main building, which is so convenient. If you have a room on the first floor, there will be a patio for you to chill out on while drinking those complimentary brews. I especially love the Happy Hour cookies as well as the complimentary ice cold brews that are in my room waiting on me. There are great restaurants nearby such as Aculpoco, Memphis Cafe, Umami Burger, Wahoo's, and etc. I will definitely be coming back when I am in the OC. on business.

Room was very clean and nice each day, breakfast was more than I had expecded with all food very good and hot, staff very nice and did what ever it took to make us happy. Will stay there again no question.

Summary Heading: Nice place for short or long stay.
Summary: I stayed in a "suite" building and the room had a nice large jacuzzi bath tub, coffee maker, refrigerator, and microwave.  This room is fit for a long stay.  The queen size bed was not too soft and not too hard and just right.  The hotel stuff are very friendly and overall atmosphere is an old French country?decorated  with dark furniture and oil paintings of 16 century scenery's and portraits.  The WiFi worked very well.   There was no in room safe.

What a great place to stay...very friendly staff, beautiful property, and the rooms were really nice.  I stayed in a regular room and a friend stayed in a junior suite.  He said his suite was very nice as well.  Nice buffet breakfast in the morning.  All the amenities including free and easy internet access!

This is a truly fantastic hotel.  You cannot find a more friendly, comfortble, convenient and economical place to stay in the greater Los Angeles area.  The free parking alone is worth about $30 per night.  Then throw in the free cvooked breakfast (not fancy but everything you would want), free high-speed internet and free morning newspaper and you are easily saving another $30 to $40 per night. And you get all this at one of the lowest room rates in the area.  But best of all, you get to stay in a well-run, great little hotel.  A real jewel.

i chose this hotel, simply due to having a really great experience at the Ayres hotel in Chino, CA recently.  Once again, the highlight was the staff.  The gentleman i spoke to on 1-4-13, "Allen", was exceptionally patient and kind.  When my family arrived to check-in, he heard me give my name to another employee, and he gave me a wave and introduced himself.  I wonder if this type of personality is a requirement in being hired at an ayres hotel or if they have awesome training...or both?  also, we made a call to ask for help with something and the gentleman who came was equally as nice...and he worked hard for us.  I wish i had his name.  our room was great...by the way.

The room was clean but very neutral in color. As my daughter put it she liked the hot tub but thought the hotel was scary because it reminded her of the hotels you usually see in the horror movies.  Especially the old style elevator.  I am glad I did not have to pay full price for the room.

I stayed here due to the reviews. It IS good. The price is very fair. From the cookies at check in to the breakfast buffet in the morning, the food was excellent. The hotel lounge is nice but not so good a place to watch an NFL playoff game (too laid back). My room was in the "Suites" building. The room was wonderful but if you are elderly and have some difficulty getting into a tub you should ask for a shower or look for a different property because the tub in my room was a gigantic spa with very high sides.  The exercise room is just off the lobby in that building. It is small and kind of basic. The wifi Internet connection was fast and reliable throughout the property..

We were in Orange County for a gymnastics meet across the highway from this hotel.  The location was convenient.  Everything was clean, the staff was helpful and friendly, the food was great.  Kids had fun in the pool and we were close enough that we could go to Disneyland for the day and not feel like we were making a trek to get there.  We will definitely stay here again when our travels bring us back to Orange County!

We had a wonderful stay here.  When we arrived, we were told we had a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite.  The room was very clean, the wifi worked perfectly, There was a small balcony outside our room with privacy screening.  The complimentary breakfast was delicious as well.  the lobby had a fire going and comfortable seating which was nice as our daughter wanted to sleep in.  We enjoyed our stay very much and will stay here again!

My family from the East Coast came for a special occasion, and I booked them rooms in Ayers Hotel for a long weekend.  They were all very pleased with their rooms and the service.  The staff went out of their way to accomodate us by allowing us to gather in one of the lounges, while we waited for other guests to arrive.  They enjoyed the beautiful compimentary breakfast, the free shuttle, and the quiet atmosphere.

My daughter works in Orange County but lives a few hours away so I normally have been staying at a hotel when I visit her. I have stayed at most of large chains and found them very nice and large but none that really stood out...unless it was a view from one of the windows. This past visit I stayed at the Ayres Hotel because of the location near the airport and the wonderful offer of no charge for parking, shuttle to and from the airport, and a full breakfast.  I was not expecting to find a beautiful, comfortable, hotel with each staff member being pleasant, friendly, and helpful. From the desk clerk, to the bartender, gift shop sales clerk, the hostess greeting us before breakfast and someone who turned on the fireplace in the large lobby area in another part of the hotel just
Manager Response: Dear Julie S -  What a humbling review! Thank you so much for your very kind words and for taking a chance on us. We absolutely revel in the opportunity to exceed a guest's expectations with our service and accommodations. To be called a guest's best hotel experience ever is absolutely amazing and we are so thrilled you had such a pleasant stay. We are grateful for your recommendation and look forward to welcoming you again soon.  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I Travel often and see a varity of Hotel-Motels. My Stay at the Ayres was perfect. From the staff that greeted us at the front desk, to the room, its cleanliness and the amenities that were offered I would galdly stay at this hotel without reservation.. By the way, they have a very excellent restaurant the staff there was also excellent the selections were good and the cost reasonable... I had a wonderful Visit... Thanks

We were in town for business and Ayers was perfect for what we needed. The rooms were a good size and had 2 sinks. A nice size area with a couch and table for our laptops. Would recommend for a nice quiet stay.
Manager Response: Dear Marianne D -  Thank you so much for your kind review of our hotel. Perfection is exactly what we strive for, so it is wonderful to know you found everything in order during your stay. Your recommendation means a great deal to us and we hope you will visit again very soon.   Safe travels,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The Ayres in Costa Mesa has a wonderful, welcoming staff that really takes care of its customers.  Great rooms with windows that open!!!  A very comfy, home feeling is presented at the Ayres.  Also, the breakfasts are great.....they provide healthy alternatives along with a traditional homemade breakfast......all included in you room fee!
Manager Response: Dear Carrie -  Hospitality is the name if the game and we were honored to have the opportunity to extend it to you! Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your visit and for sharing your experience on TripAdvisor. We appreciate your enthusiasm and hope to welcome you back very soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We took our kids and grand kids to Disneyland.  We decided to spend a couple of extra nights and booked a room at the Ayres in Costa Mesa.  Our suite was very quiet and comfortable.  The hotels public areas were very nicely furnished and warm.  We enjoyed our included breakfast and found the hotel staff friendly and ready to help.   We will gladly return when staying in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Mike G -  Thank you so much for allowing us to welcome you and close out your vacation with a little bit of relaxation. I am thrilled you found everything in order and hope you will visit us again very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Our #1 Hotel Pick For The Area
Summary: We stayed for New Year's Eve and although there was an incident at the end of our stay,it did not take away from the overall pleasant experience we had. I read other recent reviews and I think some people do not do their research and then blame the hotel when an issue arises. We also went to the OC Fair NYE Block Party and had no issues with late night/early morning noise. When we arrived, there was a LARGE bus tour group that had just arrived as well, yet we would never had known it had we not seen all of the luggage. Our room was quiet and we had no problems getting a table for breakfast. By the way, your whole group does not have to dine together. You tell the cafe gentleman/woman your room number and they will mark off the # of guests that are there. They will make note next
Manager Response: Dear AllieInCali -  It was a pleasure welcoming you over the holiday. Thank you so much for your review and for making us your choice of hotel when in the area. I am so pleased you found the accommodations comfortable and clean and the service prompt/attentive. We do our absolute best to rectify any issues a guest may have, so it is wonderful we were able to see to your needs so quickly. We are very appreciative of your recommendation and thorough review and look forward to welcoming you again in the near future.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I took my husband on a surprise weekend getaway to Disneyland in late October.  I booked a suite at the Ayres in Costa Mesa.  The whole hotel is absolutely gorgeous!  We had a slight problem upon check-in but the desk clerk was apologetic and worked to clear things up.  The suite was huge and we even had a tiny balcony.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean.  Breakfast was good, served buffet style in a room laid out like a small restaurant.  The weather was nice and we opted to eat outside in the beautiful courtyard.  The hotel even has a cute little gift shop.  Overall it was a very enjoyable stay and I look forward to staying at this hotel again!
Manager Response: Dear chiwawa4556 -  And we will be waiting! Thank you so much for your positive review and for choosing our hotel for you visit. We are always thrilled to learn we have made an impression on a guest. Your recommendation is most appreciated. We look forward to welcoming you again very soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We had a great time in the Ayres hotel. Loved the atmosphere, room was spacious and clean. Nice breakfast. Excellent, friendly staff. Great location for visiting LA (Disney 20 minutes). We enjoyed every minute in this hotel, and hope to return some day.
Manager Response: Dear Josephadus -  It was an absolute pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you so much for choosing us for your visit and for your kind review. To be described as "perfect" is without a doubt a hotel's dream and we are so pleased to have provided you such an exceptional experience. We are very appreciative of your recommendation and hope you will visit again very soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Disappointed this time but will return
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel several times before so will write off the poor service at check in on my most recent trip as an aberration.  I will return based on past good experience.  The staff was so interested in checking us in expeditiously that it assigned the same room to three sets of guests and then was slow to rectify the situation.  The room was clean and very comfortable.  The location of the hotel is convenient but certainly not scenic. A full complimentary breakfast is available but was hard to enjoy in a packed dining room.  Good weather allowed us to dine outdoors on the patio but this may not prove to be an option during inclement weather.  Parking remains an issue. If you drive to dinner it is very difficult to find a space upon return.
Manager Response: Dear suzyqmalamute -  Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. While we appreciate your continued loyalty, I do apologize if you were disappointed in your stay due to the service received at check-in. What you describe is not acceptable, so please rest assured I have reviewed your comments with the Front Desk team to ensure against anything like this in the future. We are very glad this isolated incident did not sour you on our hotel and that we will have the chance to welcome you again.  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Ayers Hotel for New Year's Eve
Summary: The hotel is well maintained and great location if attending the O.C. fair block party. Staff was friendly (registration, lounge, restaurant breakfast). The hotel shuttle did take a group of us to the fairgrounds but we were disappointed that the shuttle did not run after 10:30 p.m. When the block party would end around mid-night. Everyone was on there own to get back to the hotel.  When I made our reservation we were told that the breakfast buffet was to end about 9-9:30 a.m. onnNew Years Day. I called the banquet manager Rick to ask if it could run later due to it being New Years and most of us would have stayed out late. Rick advised it would stay open till 10:30 a.m. Which was nice.  Right about 7:04 a.m. We were woken up to jets taking off from the airport. We have stayed
Manager Response: Dear Leah -  It was wonderful having  the chance to welcome you on New Year's Eve. Hopefully you had an enjoyable time at the OC Fair block party! I am very pleased you found the hotel accommodating (especially in regard to breakfast) however I do apologize for any noise issues you may have experienced. We are always happy to contact guests and ask them to lower noise levels should we be alerted to the problem so encourage our guests to do so. I also appreciate your comment regarding shuttle service on New Year's Eve. It is a valid point I will consider during next year's celebration. Thank you again and please visit us soon.  Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Best kept secret in Orange County
Summary: We stayed for 6 days over the holidays.  Hotel is well positioned for access to all of Orange County activities.  Very nice decor, definitely did not feel like your typical chain.  Room was lovely and well appointed and very clean.  Loved having a fridge and microwave in the room and  laundry room down the hall.  We had a king bed with a queen pull-out for 2 adults and 2 young kids and it was plenty.  Staff is amazing - every single person was warm, helpful and friendly.  Breakfast is great - a huge selection and very good food - and free!  The coffee is particularly good and I am a coffee fanatic.  Weather was chilly so we did not try out the pool but they look great and the kids were dying for a dip.  Would highly recommend this place to anyone staying in OC.  Shopped around
Manager Response: Dear IGot2Babe -  Thank you so much for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you for six days recently. To have made such a positive impression on a guest is outstanding as we do our utmost to ensure each guest feels comfortable in our hotel. I especially appreciate your comment regarding our team and will be sure to pass it along so they know how much they are appreciated. Hopefully upon your return the weather will have warmed up and your children will have the chance to try out the pool!  Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I am totally shocked that this property was rated #1 by Trip Advisor for this area.  We just stayed there and would not stay again.  It is a typical Ayres property in that it is the European decor-no problem with that-but the minute we stepped into the lobby, we were hit by a musty smell that is unexplainable.  The hotel itself is clean and well-maintained, but where does the smell come from?  And the floors in both rooms we had access to (started in a smaller room, ended up in a larger suite) were very uneven.  Did they remodel over a very old sub-structure?  Breakfast was free but a hassle.  You are assigned seating as you enter, and there was never enough seating.  Sorry, but in my opinion, the food was boring and tasteless - just free.  I am just not able to believe any of
Manager Response: Dear MJAL -  Thank you so much for your candid review of our hotel. While I am pleased you found the decor pleasant and the hotel itself clean,  I am so sorry that your stay with us was anything less than exceptional. The smell you describe is alarming to hear of as we have not had previous complaints of such a strong odor. I apologize if this negatively impacted your stay and will have the Housekeeping and Maintenance teams look into immediately as we want to get to the bottom of this issue. Thank you for alerting us to this issue and, again, I do apologize and hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The lobby and suites are beautiful. The locations is great. But the insulation is awful - I heard every airplane that went by and all the doors in the hallway that opened and closed. I also heard the maid vacuuming upstairs. Breakfast is good, but all the guests in a room have to go together. This hotel is probably fine for people who have a schedule to keep, but not for someone who wants to relax and sleep in.

Great hotel.  Such a good price for everything you get.  The service during breakfast was the best I have had at a continental breakfast.  They kept refilling our coffee, etc.  The location was convenient - easy access to three major freeways.  The hotel lobbies were so pretty with all of the Christmas decorations.  Would definitely stay here again, but would choose to ask for a room away from the pool area as it tended to be loud at night before it closed.
Manager Response: Dear trojankelly -  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel and for choosing us for your stay. We strive very hard to be "great" so it is wonderful to hear that everything proved satisfying. I will be sure to pass along your comments to the breakfast team so they know how much their hard work is appreciated. We are very grateful for your recommendation and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful, extremely quiet hotel with excellent service and food
Summary: I heard great things about your property, people and meals from two friends before I booked my stay. They were right. It is a beautiful well maintained hotel. The room was nice, clean and fresh. All of the people I dealt with were friendly and helpful. The meals were excellent. The meeting room was quiet and nice too. My hotel room was also extremely quite, I slept well all night. The courtyard and pool area were so relaxing. What a nice place from the decor to the people. I will be back!
Manager Response: Dear Broker2 -  Thank you so much for taking the advice of your friends and allowing us to welcome you to our hotel. How fantastic to know we lived up the the expectations they set for you. I am so pleased to know you found your accommodations comfortable and clean and your overall stay so relaxing. We appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you back very soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at the Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa on several occasions and the hotel accommodations, cleanliness, housekeeping personnel, front desk staff,  and management are top notch.  As a retired Hotel General Manager I tend to be a little more critical when staying in hotels and this one is at the very top of my list.  We love staying in this hotel.  It is convienent to most everything one would need in Costa Mesa, Irvine and Newport Beach.  Can not recommend this hotel highly enough!

We love this hotel! My wife and I spend considerable time in southern California and the Ayres Costa Mesa is one of our favorite stops... Always welcoming, no hidden costs and the best breakfast (and service crew) anywhere!

We loved staying at this hotel. The rooms are comfortable and tastefully decorated. The beds are perfect with a mountain of soft pillows to sink into. The breakfast buffet was much more than we expected and delicious too. We will definitely stay here again.

Always comfortable, customer oriented, and wanting to make everything a great experience! Restaurant offers hot breakfast. Easy to get around from this hotel.  Staff were very helpful, providing information about local travel, and accommodating our request to be on the ground level.

We stayed at the Ayres Costa Mesa many times about 10 years ago and considered it our favorite "Get Away."  At that time, we would have rated this hotel equivalent to any 5-star hotel anywhere.  The "raised" Queen Anne style beds were so inviting when you opened the door to the room (they matched the decor of the hotel), they gave free drink and appetizer coupons at check-in; and there were fresh, gorgeous apples everywhere you could think of to take at any time of the day.  Now, the beds have been changed to those that you would find anywhere in any hotel (boring); not more free coupons; and the apples have been changed out for cookies at the check in during the day. The staff was pleasant and helpful (gave really good restaurant recommendations).  The room, however, had an
Manager Response: Dear Diane -  Thank you so much for your candid review of our hotel. While I am pleased you found the service welcoming, I do apologize for any guestroom issues. We are adamant in our desire to provide guest with comfortable and clean rooms, so what you describe is unacceptable. I have already taken appropriate steps with the Housekeeping Team so insure against this in the future. And while we no longer offer a Manager's Reception with drinks and appetizers, we do offer a substantial complimentary breakfast that most guests find very appetizing. We would be very sorry to lose your patronage and hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Ayres while in town for our daughters rowing regatta. The staff was excellent from the first phone call to make the reservations all the way up to checking out.  The hotel was lovely, clean, comfortable, easy to find, and more than we could hope for.   We will stay here again and will recommend it to others.
Manager Response: Dear Frissy -  Thank you so much for your positive review. We appreciate you choosing us for your stay and are thankful for your kind words. We love exceeding guest expectations and are thrilled to have provided you with such exceptional accommodations. You should definitely visit our on-site restaurant, Le Chateau, during your next visit!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This was our second stay with our kid's rowing team. This hotel is wonderful, beautiful and so comfortable. Love staying here, just wish we had more time to luxurate in it. On this trip the only unfortunate thing was my room was not ready when I got there at 3:10 pm. I wanted to get checked in before the team got there and ended up waiting for 30 minutes for the room to be finished being cleaned. I was unhappy about that, but the room was very clean once I got in.
Manager Response: Dear Darcanfot -  It was such a pleasure welcoming you to our hotel. How wonderful to know that you found your stay so exceptional. I do apologize that your room was not immediately available to you at our normal check-in time. There are sometimes delays due to late check-outs and higher occupancy. I am pleased this did not sour you on our hotel and hopefully we will be able to welcome you again soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I went here for a business trip and conference.  The hotel was very accomodating for our group of 70.  The room was nice, clean, spacious and really nothing bad to say.  I liked it.  The grounds were quaint and staff was friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Tara -  It was a pleasure welcoming you and hosting the recent conference. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. I am thrilled you found your stay so comfortable and that we were able to take care of your group so well. Hopefully you will have the chance to visit us again very soon!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Good value, bonus: nice fresh hot breakfast
Summary: Have stayed at this Ayres several times now. Very quiet hotel, responsive and helpful staff.  Good breakfast - fresh, hot, varied. Lovely decor, traditional tasteful. Very nice common areas. Will stay here again, travel to SoCal frequently.
Manager Response: Dear BostonIrishRose -  We appreciate your kind words! Thank you so much for your continued patronage and for taking the time to review our hotel. We are thrilled the complimentary full breakfast made such an impression. Looking forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Our rowing team stayed at the hotel. Parents and about 80 kids.  The staff was well organized and helpful. I was so impressed.  Really nice hotel with small boutique feel.  Restaurant was great.  Beds comfy.  Would use again!

We always stay at this hotel when in town. It is so comfortable and the staff is polite and helpful. The beds are great and the rooms and hallways are very clean. The lobby in the adjoining building is cozy and pleasant to sit in with the fireplace going. Breakfast is more than adequate. The hotel is close to everywhere we want to go while here.
Manager Response: Dear Frances -  Thank you so much for your review and for making us your choice of hotel in the area. We know there are so many hotels to choose from, so it means a great deal to us that you keep returning. It sounds as if you continually find every aspect of the hotel welcoming and comfortable and we are thrilled to provide you such consistent stays. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to your next visit.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Unusually nice hotel. Refreshingly different than most.
Summary: Excellent breakfast. You don't feel like you're in a cafeteria. Lobby is very pleasant and refined. It was decorated very formally with classical music playing -  perhaps their trademark . Room is great.
Manager Response: Dear MinneapolisPatrick -  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. It was such a pleasure welcoming you as our guest and I am so pleased you found the decor inviting and your guestroom comfortable. Our hotels are all European-inspired boutique hotels, so you are correct about the trademark! We appreciate your review and look forward to welcoming you again very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This hotel was the perfect getaway for my husband and I. We have annual passes to Disneyland and wanted to go on a mini vacation, but most of the hotels around the immediate area were booked since it is the weekend before Halloween. I came across this hotel since it is only 15 miles away from Disneyland and I like how it is close to the beach also. We arrived at the hotel at 3pm and we were directed to the suites in the building next door. I like that there are separate buildings because the atmosphere was much more relaxed than in the main hotel that had kids running around. The jetted tub was very relaxing and we sat on our patio for some fresh air at night. The room was very well kept and the artwork hanging from the walls was very beautiful. I didn't care too much for the
Manager Response: Dear Laura -  We were so pleased to be able to provide you with comfortable accommodations for your romantic getaway. We know that sometimes just a short, relaxing retreat from the every day can do wonders for a person and were thrilled to hear your stay was so satisfying. We are very grateful for your review and hope you and your husband will visit again very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I thought this place was really interesting. There is a lot of history behind the building and some great photos along the corridors documenting it.
