The staff were very helpful and the breakfast was good.  It is near to the airport, but I did not notice the planes that much except when I was at one of the two pools on the property.  It is in a very convenient location and there are a couple of convenience stores within walking distance, which I like because I like to stock up on water and snacks for my room!  Also, I needed something dry cleaned in  a hurry and there is a place right across the street that helped me out!  My only complaint was that the jacuzzi tub in my room was really noisy.
Manager Response: Dear S M -  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. Thank you as well for choosing us for your visit. The Ayres family has a lot of business history behind them, so it is fantastic that you found their story so fascinating. I am also thrilled you found every aspect of the hotel comfortable and welcoming. We would, though, like to check in to the tub noise you describe, so if you would be kind enough to contact me with your room number at your earliest convenience we will have the Maintenance Team immediately look into it. Thank you again for your recommendation.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This hotel is dark and muggy with loud airplanes flying by all day into the night and loud guests in the morning! I really like staying at the Ayres in Seal Beach and I was hoping the feel was the same but It wasn't:(  I will definitley stay at another location in the future:)
Manager Response: Dear Kimberly1117 -  Thank you very much for your candid review of our hotel. I am so sorry to hear that you found your stay anything less than exceptional. While there are strict guidelines governing air traffic at the airport, I understand that any airplane noise can be disrupting for some guests regardless of time of day and for that I apologize. As to loud guests, we encourage any guest experiencing a noise disturbance to contact the Front Desk so the team can work on finding the source of the noise and put a stop to it. We appreciate your review and do hope you will give us a second opportunity to live up to the standards set by our sister hotel.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Exceeded expectations, welcoming, clean and comfortable hotel.
Summary: This is a charming hotel with a unique layout that contributes to the ambiance of hospitality.  The rooms were spacious and clean, and the staff were very accomodating.  We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived - we thought the website pictures did not really do the hotel justice.  Excellent value, proximity and shuttle service to John Wayne airport a bonus.
Manager Response: Dear Anonymous514 -  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel and for choosing us for your stay. How fantastic to know you found our hotel so hospitable and that the actual hotel exceeded the expectations set by our website photos. We are very appreciative of your recommendation and hope your travels bring you to the area again very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This is a lovely hotel, Ayers Hotel Costa Mesa, meets our expectations for service and cleanliness, it's what we expect from Ayers. European style hotel, very clean, well maintained rooms. We wanted to take the bed home with us it was so comfortable. We also dined at the in house restaurant, food was great, service prompt, very enjoyable. Next time I return I plan to upgrade to a Jr. suite

We stayed here for 3 nights.  The staff was excellent, though the decor and furniture in the lobby seemed dated.  The pool(s) were nice and refreshing and clean.  The fitness room was small but was adequate for the workout that we did.  The breakfast was one of the best we have had for "free" from a hotel.  Note, little cards on the table say, "gratuity for breakfast not included".  Yet, for whatever reason our table was never serviced no matter where we sat.  We saw other tables getting refills on coffee and such, but the only thing done for us was to clear our table after we left.  As a result, we gave only a low tip.  The beds were comfortable, but I did not like the big fluffy pillows.  On the morning we were leaving, I found a pillow in the closet would have suited me

My husband and I found the Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa, CA(Newport Beach) to be a great place to stay for the wedding we were attending.  The European inspired boutique hotel is managed and maintained in the Ayres family tradition. We found it to be friendly, first rate service with an inviting atmosphere and wonderful value for guests.  The b & b aspect of the hotel was an added bonus to the stay. We have friends who stay at the hotel regularly and they have always commented on how much they like the location and appeal of the hotel.

Stayed here with two family members in June 2012.  Wanted something close to the OC fair so that we didn't have to use car.  PROS:  Centrally located to fairgrounds, malls, and beaches.  Just hop on the freeway and you're there in about 15 minutes.  Charming decor.  We had a Jr suite which was fairly spacious with wet bar, microwave and fridge.  Check in was pretty quick, staff was pleasant.  Woke up too late for breakfast so can't comment.  Shuttle was convenient....it dropped us off/picked us up from the fair.   CONS: Wish there were more places to eat near the hotel.  Only restaurants in walking distance are McDonalds, Subway, Flame Broiler and one other I can't remember.  Hotel is not in a pedestrian area so you will need a car to go places (can also use their shuttle).

The staff at the Ayres was very kind and helpful.  The chef at the breakfasts was very fast and such a great cook.  It was nice to have a complete breakfast instead of the normal "Continental breakfast" that you get at most hotels.  The hotel gives you a feeling of "warmth" with it's comfortable decor.  Nice artwork throughout the whole hotel.  Our room was superb!  My only complaint would be that being so close to the airport the planes were pretty loud.  Fortunately they stop flyingat a certain time of the night. The restaurant had a fabulous Monte Cristo sandwich! The best we've ever had!

Summary Heading: Just can't go 5 stars, It's about communication
Summary: I loved my stay at Ayres Hotel, enjoyed the food at their Bistro so much I talked the nice folks at Trip Advisor into letting me review it on it's own instead of just part of the Hotel. Normally parsimonious when a place claims to be 4 1/2 stars they best be able to deliver.   Great lobby decor with Ocean Battle scene paintings.. Art Gallery large ... it would not fit on your wall at home  paintings... elegant opulence is what it cries out ...   Room was great with a desk and sofa as well as a table for two and really comfortable mattress. There was an issue with the internet which took over an hour and a second call but then they fixed it... it was floor wide from what I gathered and I was not the only call for help.  The restaurant in the hotel has it's own review (as I

We stayed 5 nights in a junior suite at the end of August. Rooms are spacious well furnished and really clean. Beds were super comfy and the staff are really helpful. Good location, a short drive to the beach, shopping mall and well placed to the freeways.   The breakfast was okay - not many healthy options and finished quickly but coffee was good. We also liked that you could pick up coffee and pastries if you were up before the buffet breakfast started. A great great stay and if we were back to the area this would be our top choice!
Manager Response: Dear FreedaMagic -  It was an honor to welcome you recently for five days. Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your visit and for taking the time to share your experience. It sounds as if the location and complimentary full breakfast made quite the impression, so we are very pleased you found such value in these. We are thrilled to be your top choice in the area and hope to welcome you back very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice and comfortable.  Like staying at grandma's house!
Summary: My first stay at an Ayres hotel and will not be my last!  The decor is traditional with antiques everywhere (or furniture that looks like antiques anyway) and yet it's comfortable and inviting.  Nothing modern about the furnishings  and that's the charm.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful---unusual in this day and age sadly.  I had dinner at the hotel restaurant and it was delicious!  Just as good if not better than most 3 star restaurants.  All in all I thoroughly enjoyed my three day business here.  Like staying at grandma's house.  :-)

Summary Heading: A touch of Europe with some lovely features
Summary: I've been coming to this particular Ayres for years---I've been here numerous times.  The location, for me, is wonderful, as my visits center around Costa Mesa and Newport Beach, with a bit of visiting in Laguna Beach.   I completely am AGAINST a fee for parking---I find it atrocious to pay for parking that is a mile away and oftentimes full because of weddings and other events held at the hotel.  I know that the Ayres is adding parking 'in' to their prices because I can book less expensive hotels that are quite nice for less.    However, I do enjoy the ambiance of the hotel, especially this one.  I love the courtyard and the fact that each table has a little bit of potted herb on each.  I love the fireplace going in the evening in the lobby in one of the buildings.  I love the

We stayed at this hotel for 4 days at the beginning of September. The rooms are very spatious and clean, the beds are good and the service is excellent. They have breakfast included with the price for the room and it is very good. A lot of food was served: scamble eggs, potatos, bacon, pastries, fruits, etc. We ate in the morning at the hotel and than hit the beaches and needed food only late in the afternoon. We were four people in the room (I my wife and our two children 18 & 20) and having not to pay for breakfast was a big relief. The inconvenient thing was that the hotel is close to the airport and when you are out at the open swimming pool the departing airplanes can be a little anoying but if you are at the court swimming pool you will not have this problem. Also you do

Summary Heading: Recent visit to Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa
Summary: I have been impressed with the attention of the adminstrative staff, the quality of the suite that I have stayed, the fitness center and the breakfast. For the price we pay you just can not get a better value in this part of the country

Summary Heading: recent visit with ayres in newport
Summary: Recently my husband and i went to celebrate our 25 anniversary in Newport (we are from Louisiana) . We stayed at this love establishment. I must say my bed sheets seemed a little dull so i had to purchase new ones and replace then (but i didnt mind ) I loved the restaurant and the service was remarkable. I had quite the entertaining british lady help me out i believe her name was Anoosha? and this lovely older woman named Cassie (who helped me book my room) They did such a great job of setting the tone to my trip. We are coming back next summer. Thank you Ayres Newport Beach!

I started staying at this Ayres hotel when I would visit a friend in the Costa Mesa area, since then I have stayed for the service, breakfast, and friendly staff when I travel to the Newport Coast area of California. It's not terribly close to the beach, but the 20 minute drive is simple, and it's not too far from Disney... about 30 minutes. The rooms are beautifully decorated and spacious. They have a suite with a door on the bedroom and a sofa bed for traveling families, that suite is a bit smaller, and then the have a separate building with large single room suites. The lobby areas , full of seating and beautifully decorated aren't a bad place to meet with a client. The inner courtyard which the breakfast area opens into has lovely fountains and greenery, perfect for a family

Summary Heading: Ayers in Mission Viejo is better...
Summary: Just recently (within the past one - two weekends) my boyfriend and I were celebrating our anniversary. We had previously stayed at a different location before, but I felt we had a much better experience at the location in Mission Viejo, CA. It's not so much that the amenities or anything of that sort were lacking, it was just the young lady at the front desk. We had booked the hotel directly on their website because there was an inncentive to recieve a $5 Starbucks gift card; which we never recieved. This young lady --I'm very positive her name was Cassie-- was just gossiping and complaining way too much and much too loudly to another co-worker. I'm not too big on being able to hear another person's conversation while they're working. Especially when they're complaining about
Manager Response: Dear Jasmine -  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. I am so very sorry that your check-in was not a warm one and that you did not receive the $5 Starbucks Gift Card. What you describe is not acceptable as we want each guest to feel comfortable and welcome when arriving at our hotel . Please rest assured that this incident will be discussed with the appropriate parties. As to the gift card incentive, if you would be kind enough to contact me, I would be happy to send out the gift card immediately. Again, thank you for your review and please do book directly with us the next time you are in the area.   Safe travels,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The services are very good. Breakfast, airport and plaza shuttle are difinitely more than a bargain. Hotel staff are very helpful make you feel at home away from home. This is fantastic. We are definitely returning not long.
Manager Response: Dear Yonah -  it was a pleasure welcoming you to our hotel. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor and for choosing our hotel. We know you have many choices of hotel in the area and are very grateful to have been chosen. We absolutely want to make our guests feel at home, so it is wonderful to hear you were so comfortable during your stay. We hope your travels bring you to our area again very soon.   Many thanks,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This is a nice, clean hotel typical of the Ayres brand. However, it is not my favorite. The Ayres Hawthorne is the best! This hotel is a little out of the way for restaurants, etc. There are two buildings and if you aren't in the one with the restaurant, you have to go outside to get to th ebreakfast. Also, the breakfast wasn't as good and varied as Hawthorne. This one was closer to a "continental" style breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear Tarheel74 -  Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your stay and for your continued patronage to our hotel chain. We completely agree that our Manhattan Beach hotel is wonderful and would have loved to live up to our sister hotel in your mind. Rest assured we will at minimum take a closer look at your breakfast comments as we definitely want to be on par with all of the hotels in the chain. Thank you for your candid review, though, and please consider us the next time you are in the area!  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: For free breakfast, airport and south coast plaza shuttle service - it's well worth it.  There are few places to walk to for dinner and the restaurant in the hotel is good food. We walked to a chain Mexican restaurant nearby and should of ate at the hotel.  The room is nothing special and mine had a little musty smell, although my door led to the outside.  The stair wells smelled a bit too.  Things were cleaned well and for a sofa, little fridge, desk and full closet it was worth the value.  Meeting room space was decent and could host a small conference, but not that ADA friendly.  My toliet was running all night, thank goodness I know how to turn off the water.  I told the staff, they were very friendly, expecially the food staff, but they didn't seemed to be concerned with
Manager Response: Dear Donnie92673 -  Thank you so much for your candid review of our hotel. While I am pleased your overall stay was satisfying, I am sorry if your experience was not more exceptional. Value is, of course, important in a hotel and something we strive to provide our guests, but we also wish to wow them with our comfortable accommodations and warm service. I have discussed your room and housekeeping comments at length with the necessary team members and appropriate steps are being taken to insure against these issues in the future. We do appreciate your review and hope you will consider us should you travel to the area again.   Regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Stayed here at least 200 nights over 20 years.  Consistently top notch.  I'm greeted by staff I've known for 20 years.  Friendly and competent.  Rooms are big.  Furnishings are period pieces of old CA.  Good restaurant.  Wonderful location.
Manager Response: Dear Carl -  It is always a pleasure welcoming you to our hotel. Your continued patronage is absolutely  invaluable to us and we are so appreciative of your kind words. We cannot thank you enough for your years of loyalty to our hotel. We are so appreciative of your review and look forward to your next visit.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Solid quality and great value for this area
Summary: Looking for a place to stay to hang out with family on Balboa Island. The Balboa Inn is a dive a resort prices. The two hotels at Fashion Island get extra expensive when you add in $28/day for parking, $15/day for Internet, no breakfast. The Ayres was just the ticket, with a value-minded base price, free parking, free Internet, nice breakfast buffet included. I'm sure the rooms were just as nice as the hotels charging twice the price, and we were only 10 minutes from Balboa Island and the beach.
Manager Response: Dear TomChatt -  Thank you so much for choosing us during your visit to Newport Beach. We do try to provide as much value to our guests as possible with our complimentary breakfast, parking, and WIFI, so it is fantastic to hear that you found these amenities complemented your stay well. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you back in the near future.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: After reading some previous reviews I was a bit worried about this place but it turned out to be nice.  The rooms (we had 2 junior suites) were large and well planned out with a small microwave and fridge.  There was another area near the bathroom that held the coffee pot.  It was also handy for doing my hair and make up since there was a large mirror and counter space.  The room also had a small table, couch, coffee table, desk and chair. As far as the internet, we also had a problem logging on until we figured out that only one of us could use it at one time. We thought the breakfast was nice even if it was the same everyday (we stayed 5 days). The lobby and gift shop were nice also.  However, we never got to the restaurant as we went out everyday and we were in a different
Manager Response: Dear SandraG67 -  Thank you so much for taking a chance on our hotel. I am so pleased to learn we were able to meet your needs and provide a pleasant hotel experience. I appreciate your helpful comments regarding the hallway and servicing of your son's guestroom. Please know I have discussed these at length with the Housekeeping Team to ensure against them in the future. I do hope you will have the opportunity to dine at our on site restaurant,  the newly renovated Le Chateau, should you return. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to your next visit.   Safe travels,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My recent stay at the Ayres was the best!   The entire staff is absolutely wonderful!  Excellent customer service, excellent restaurant service.....the Ayres staff goes above and beyond to serve its customers....great place to stay!!!
Manager Response: Dear Carrie -  You are too kind! Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your stay and for your very warm words. I work with a phenomenal team of people who truly care about the guest experience, so I will be sure to pass along your compliments. We greatly appreciate your review and hope to welcome you again in the near future.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Didn't get what I paid for
Summary: I checked in, then unload & unpacked a lot of stuff. I intended a 5 night stay. After I got done I headed fir the dining room for dinner. It was being remodeled for the whole tome of my stay. This was a super important amenity for me. I worked hard all day & wanted to relax. I had to get in my car, find fast food (exactly what I was trying to avoid) and drive in circles because of the awkward location of the hotel. I wish the front desk staff would have explained this the situation with the dining room/room service, for 150.00/nt I think I got ripped off and will not stay here again. I should have gotten a discount at check-in, along with a disclosure. You have lost this customer. I ended up only staying two nights and had to pack up and switch hotels. I can totally understand
Manager Response: Dear Khayhoe -  I appreciate your candid review of our hotel. I am truly sorry that your experience with us was so short and that your overall stay was an unpleasant one. Our restaurant did recently undergo a rather thorough renovation that lasted approximately one week, and I do greatly apologize that this was not communicated to you upon check in. Please know I have discussed your comments at length with the Front Desk team to ensure any major changes to hotel amenities are discussed with guests upon their arrival. Again, I am very sorry for your experience and hope you will give us a second chance to show you how comfortable a stay with us can be.   Regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: When I checked in, I thought the hotel & room were lovely and I'd have a good experience. Not so much. The first problem was an inability to access the internet from my room. When I talked to the desk people about it, I was told there's no problem that they know of. My IPad worked everywhere else that had internet, and it miraculously worked in my room the second day. The toilet ran intermittently, every couple of minutes. I couldn't hear it when I shut the bathroom door, but still... Although the AC worked fine, the room felt humid. The real problem for me was that the hotel is beneath an airplane flight path. Had I known this prior to booking, I never would have stayed there. Although I was told the planes weren't allowed in the fly zone until 7 AM, I was woken up at 6 by the
Manager Response: Dear Lmft414 -  Thank you so much for your candid review of our hotel. While I am very pleased you found the room comfortable and the service accommodating, I do apologize if your stay was not more exceptional. We always encourage our guests to inform us should anything in the guestroom be functioning incorrectly and do appreciate you letting us know of the issues with the toilet and internet. Rest assured these issues have been addressed to the best of our ability. I am sorry your stay with us was not an exemplary one and do hope you will visit us again and give us the opportunity to provide you a different experience.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The staff is always very friendly and I get the impression that each staff member had a vested interest in how my stay was going.    The property has always been nicely kept.  During this stay, the bistro was closed for remodel,  but there are an abundance of eateries nearby.  Even though the hotel sits under the departure path of Santa Ana airport, the noise is at a minimal.  There is a curfew for flights before 7am and after 10pm.

Rooms were clean and free breakfast was very good with good choices. The hotel staff were accommodating. I would stay there again. It was a really great value for what we got. The location was good with easy freeway access.

The outside is adorable. The rooms are smaller sf wise, but they have wet bar, mini fridge, 2 separate seating areas and a desk and chair. Our room overlooked the pool and kids were out there until 10:15pm. Didn't bother me since I was still awake. The other set of rooms opened to the restaurant courtyard. If you plan on sleeping in, I would ask for a room away from there. The free buffet was excellent!!!  Oh and the bed was comfie and loved the fluffy down comforter. Great location, great customer service. Would definitely stay again!!
Manager Response: Dear SoCaliNomad -  It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. We are always excited to see the phrase "pleasantly surprised" in a guest's review as it means we were able to provide service, accommodations, and amenities that made a positive, lasting impression on a guest. We aim to please our guests with everything we do, so it is always wonderful to learn that we have met our goal. We are very grateful for your recommendation and thankful that you took time to let others know about our hotel. We hope you will think of us the next time you are in the area.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This is my 8th stay in this hotel over several years.  It remains one of my favs! It is elegant, clean, and stylish.  The rooms are clean.  The beds and pillows are very comfy.  We called the morning of our arrival and were able to arrange to get have an early check-in.  We made the 5:30-7:30 cookie time when we came back from dinner.  The jacuzzi felt great late evening.  The breakfast was yummy, and the coffee was superb. The only negative was our air-conditioner was either too cold, or the fan kept turning off during the night. The VISA special added to the great value of our stay.
Manager Response: Dear Sue -  Thank you for allowing us to welcome you back for the eighth time! How fantastic to know we are able to provide you with consistently friendly service and comfortable accommodations every time you visit. Guest loyalty means a great deal to us, so we are very appreciative that you have made us your choice of hotel in Costa Mesa over the past few years. Thank you so very much for taking the time to review our hotel, and we hope to welcome you a ninth time very soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stay at the Ayres on business on a fairly regular basis and it is always a good experience.  The staff is always friendly and helpful!  Jose and Cesar in the restaurant are always on point and make it a great visit as well. Comfortable, clean and friendly!  Always keeps me coming back!

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay off beach
Summary: Clean, well maintained rooms and excellent customer service. Ayers Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa is a nice, comfortable place to stay while in the Orange county, Irvine area.  The breakfast was decent and there are numerous places to eat within walking distance.  Good value for the relative high cost location.  One drawback is its location close to the John Wayne airport, but there are noise ordanaces that limit plane take off and landings so minimizes 11 PM to 7 AM sleeping hours.
Manager Response: Dear  Mietz -  It was a pleasure having you as our guest. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and for your kind words. It is always fantastic to learn that a guest has found his/her stay clean, comfortable, and welcoming as these are the things we strive to provide in a hotel stay. I am also pleased to hear you found the location convenient for your needs. We are always grateful for a recommendation and greatly appreciate your review.   Many thanks,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The price is decent and the rooms are furnished with nice beds but that is the end of the nice. I bring my own shampoo (the one they supply is so bad) and they do not provide conditioner.  It is  basic hotel. The breakfast is nothing to look forward to with the watery eggs and tasteless muffins. The bacon and oatmeal are fine. The coffee is not good. But its free...  i have been staying here for years because it is located near the place I am visiting, and large groups tend to book here because of price and the hotel does not make the needed additions to staff or breakfast rooms.  I will in the future ask if there is a group booked when I plan to stay and move elsewhere if this is the case.
Manager Response: Dear Travelforfun111 -  Thank you for allowing us to welcome you to our hotel once more. We appreciate your patronage and are pleased to know you find the beds comfortable and the guestrooms nicely furnished. I do apologize, however, for any issues you may have experienced with the breakfast and service levels due to large groups. We generally do our utmost to staff according to occupancy, but I would be happy to review our current staffing levels to see what can be done to remedy this. As to the breakfast, we review our offerings often, so please know your comments will be used when we next revisit them. We appreciate your candid review and hope you will give us another opportunity to prove to you how exceptional a stay at our hotel can be.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Excellent value and professional, polite staff.  I arrived very late -- too late for dinner but was able to walk a short distance away to a nearby McDonald's.  The neighborhood is safe and very near UC Irvine.  I used the Business Center and it was well stocked with everything I needed - even at 1AM!  There is a free breakfast - but I left too early to enjoy it.
Manager Response: Dear Selective Traveler931 -  Thank you for allowing us to welcome you however briefly. We are honored that you find us worthy of such a positive review after a very short visit and thrilled to have inspired such a strong impression. We hope you will have another chance to visit us for a longer period and really experience all we have to offer, including that complimentary full breakfast!  Safe travels,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The rooms in the annex are quite dark and are showing age; they need lighter-weight materials (not rayon-type drapes and bedcovers), and fresher brighter colors.  Van service is exceptional and the drivers are a good source for local events.
Manager Response: Dear Anonymous869 -  Thank you so much for your candid review of our hotel. While I am thrilled you found our shuttle drivers personable and knowledgeable, I do apologize if the draperies in the rooms were not to your liking. I will be sure to share your comments with the design team at our corporate office for their use the next time the guestrooms are updated and renovated.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This hotel was beautiful, with excellent service.  The breakfast was very good with fresh danish, breads, hot food, cereal, etc.  The rooms and lobbies were very nicely (and elegantly) decorated and very clean.  The decor was sort of a mix of old English, with a touch of medieval and nautical.  Definitely not modern but beautiful.   Though it was near the airport, there weren't many flights that you could really hear.  The price we got was a total bargain compared to the quality of the hotel.  Right off the highway for easy access to anywhere in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Achebeekay -  It was an absolute pleasure welcoming you to our hotel. Thank you for your kind review and for choosing our hotel for your stay. We wish nothing more than for our guests to experience the ultimate in accommodations and service, so it means a great deal that you not only found value in our hotel but also comfort. We appreciate your recommendation and hope you will keep us in mind the next time you are in the area.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stay here every time we visit Newport Beach (as we used to live in the area).  This is a very nice hotel that is just starting to show it's age, although it is maintained well.  It's very upscale, without a crazy expensive price tag.  We stayed in a jr. suite, which was perfect, as I love the extra space you get.    The negatives: I do not like their pillows (down or feather - not supportive at all) and will have to remember to bring my own next time - I woke up with a sore neck both mornings.  Also, I wish the pool/spa was open past 10, as we were out and about all day, so it would have been nice to relax in the spa when we got back for the night.  The positives: The service can't be beat.  The staff is wonderful.  And the included breakfast is one of the best buffet
Manager Response: Dear KSKG -  Thank you so much for making us your choice of hotel when in the Costa Mesa/Newport Beach area. We are always thrilled to find out that a guest consistently experiences warm service and comfortable accommodations when visiting us. I will be sure to pass along your pillow comments to the wonderful Quality Assurance team at our corporate office for use the next time these bedding items are reviewed. We are so grateful for your review and look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa-Newport Beach
Summary: We were in this area for a week on business and we could not have been happier with our accommodations. A real "cooked-in-the-restaurant" breakfast buffet is included that was just delicious!  The restaurant provides a wonderful array of offerings that accommodated lighter as well as heavier appetites and their hours of operation were just perfect for us. The cocktail lounge is very cozy with a very friendly bartender. Everyone who works here is so nice! GREAT STAFF and SUPER SERVICE! The courtyard area and separate pool area are both delightful. At night, the twinkle lights pop on in the courtyard--reminded us of a romantic European setting. Complimentary coffee and muffins are provided in the lobby for early risers (i.e. prior to the breakfast opening) and afternoon cookies
Manager Response: Dear Marcia -  We DON'T want you to ever leave! Thank you for your enthusiastic review and for choosing our hotel for your stay. To have made such an impression on a guest with our many amenities and friendly service is fantastic to hear and we were so pleased to be given the chance to provide you with an exceptional stay. I am also pleased that you found the decor to your liking as it was given much thought and effort by the Ayres family. We appreciate your enthusiastic recommendation and hope to welcome you again in the near future.  Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This was my second stay at the Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa.  My first time was probably six years ago with my mother on bus tour to Laguna Beach.  We had no idea at that time where the tour would have us stay.  We were very pleasantly surprised at such nice accommodations.  Well since then I have been wanting to take that same trip back with my mother and stay again in such a beautiful hotel. But it just never happened.  She passed three years ago.  Well the memory of our trip and the Ayres Hotel had not faded.  My sister and I were able to redo that trip on our mothers birthday, August 6th.  The hotel was just as I remembered it.  Beautiful building, beautiful comfortable rooms and wonderful staff!  Upon arrival we were very pleasantly told they upgraded us to a junior
Manager Response: Dear Joanjoan_12 -  What an incredibly touching tribute to your mother. Thank you so much for allowing us to be even a small part of this special event. To know we made such a strong impression during your first visit  and continued to do so the second time around is wonderful, and we are thrilled to have been the setting for this remembrance. We are grateful for your review and hope to welcome you back again a third time.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Just came to stay a night for the Duran Duran concert at the OC Fair.  Arrived for early check-in and spent the day by both pools!  Had a fabulous lunch at the Le Chateau restaurant.  Took the free shuttle to the concert, but had to take a taxi back.  (We were told that the shuttle stops at 11:00, but depending on the need, the driver must report to the airport to pickup flight crews for about the last hour.  We were told to give a half an hour notice for pickup and they would let us know at that time if they could shuttle us or not.  I felt well-informed and was prepared to get a taxi anyway.) The staff was very professional, courteous and helpful.  I would stay here again and would recommend to friends and family!
Manager Response: Dear Jen4Kings -  It was a pleasure welcoming you recently. How wonderful to know we contributed to a great time at the Duran Duran concert! I am so pleased you were able to take advantage of our early check-in and have the opportunity to really experience our hotel's amenities, including the pool, complimentary shuttle, and Le Chateau. The highest honor a hotel can receive is a guest recommendation, so it means a great deal that you would be an Ayres Hotels advocate. We are so appreciative of your review and hope you will visit again soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Arrived by shuttle today evening so relieved to have a shuttle no stress!!!! Hotel looked nice clean etc was happy till we checked in the reservation wasn't don correctly we needed a 2 queen room and were given a king room :-( daughter tried the pull out queen but I was hard we ended up topping and tailing in the king! Shuttle service warning ...... Drivers finish at 11 pm so if ounare doing anything late double check shuttle times etc we were steamed at orange county fair and had to pay for taxi!   Overall the hotel was really nice child friendly comfortable breckfast was nice I would reccomended jut double check onaraw you Defo need!!!
Manager Response: Dear DDFan fromGB -  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your stay and for your positive review. While I am pleased the shuttle service proved convenient  and the breakfast appetizing, I do apologize for any mistake that may have been made with your reservation. Under normal circumstances we would be happy to honor the reservation and provide the guest with the appropriate room type, so I am sorry this was not an option in your case. Still, I am happy to know your overall stay was a satisfactory one. We hope you will visit us again soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Professional staff and service all around
Summary: I have stayed at the Ayres & Suites Costa Mesa many times and the staff has been very gracious and professional every single time. The entire staff has much pride in the work that they provide their guests. At any time when I have stopped at the front desk I have been greeted with a "hello" and friendly response for any question. The shuttle van service is very prompt and efficient. The complimentary breakfast is very good with eggs, bacon, potatoes, pancakes or french toast, fresh fruit and yogurt, cereals and oatmeal, juice, muffins, toast and pastry, coffee and teas. The breakfast is served to you from the buffet and dishes cleaned up for you. Very nice touch.  There are two buildings, one with jacuzzi suites, the lobby of which is beautiful and spacious with a fireplace and
Manager Response: Dear Bluestater -  Thank you for your very thorough review of our hotel and for your continued patronage. We love seeing our hotel through a guest's eyes, so greatly appreciate the time it took to address each aspect of the hotel. While I am pleased that you are generally satisfied with your stays, I do apologize for any inconvenience encountered by the few issues noted at the end of your review. I have already spoken with the Housekeeping and Maintenance Teams to ensure these issues are immediately addressed so this will not be experienced by you or any future guests again. We are very appreciative of your recommendation and look forward to your next visit.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Had a sweet mini vacation here in this chateaulike property. Very impressed with the overall feel and cleanliness of this property and friendly service we experienced. Lovd our Jr Suite, which was comfortable and roomy.  Had the best shrimp and appetizers @ happy hour in the onsite restaurant.  The hot tub was clean & quiet the nite we stopped by the pool area.  Every worker we encountered was helpful & nice.  We would definitely stay here again.  Costa Mesa is a nice central location, easy to zip over to PCH, Balboa, Newport and Huntington Beaches, yet affordable and not touristy.
Manager Response: Dear Jonikins W -  It was an absolute pleasure welcoming you to our hotel for your mini vacation. Thank you so much for your kind review and for taking the time to share your experience. I am thrilled we were able to provide you with exceptional accommodations and warm service. I am also very pleased you found the happy hour offerings at Le Chateau appetizing as many guests are not aware of our happy hour, so we definitely want to spread the word! We are very grateful for your recommendation and hope you will allow us the opportunity to welcome you again very soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We are not even finished with our 3 night stay but I must rave about the Ayres Hotel and Suites again.  We upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite and we have loved it.  Staff is so nice and room are very clean and very comfortable.  Except for the planes from John Wayne airport I(nothing you can do about that), it is very quiet here.  The free breakfast is exceptional with eggs, bacon, homefries, pancakes or french toast,fresh fruit and yogurt, cereals and oatmeal, juice, muffins, toast and pastry, coffee and tea offered daily.  Love the crispy bacon!    We usually go to Marriott or Westin properties as we are owners with both  but if there is an Ayres available, I would definitely choose to stay with them because it is such a great experience!
Manager Response: Dear 350NancyB -  Wow! Thank you so much for your enthusiastic review of our hotel. We relish the opportunity to provide our guests with comfortable accommodations and exceptional service and are so pleased you have found that both of these exceed your expectations. To be able to surpass the large chains you have mentioned as a hotel experience is unbelievably humbling and we are exceedingly grateful to your for your patronage. We hope your travels will bring you to Costa Mesa again very soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The Ayres is an extremely nice hotel with the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in at a hotel. They have a fantastic breakfast and it is fairly close to the beach without paying the outrageous prices that usually come with being close to the beach. We have stayed here before and will stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear M0nicaMB -  We are so appreciative of your positive review. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers and for choosing us for your stay once more. How wonderful to know that you found your Ayres Dream Sleeper mattress so comfortable and that this, along with the value of our complimentary breakfast, contributed to such a remarkable stay. It is also fantastic to hear that you were able to take full advantage of our location and enjoy the beach this summer. Thank you again for your review and please consider us the next time you are in the area.   Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: From the moment you walk in the door, you are treated with respect and kindness. Rooms are spacious and always sparkling clean! The restaurant is fantastic. Breakfast is included with your stay. Dinner was always a teat with Luigi taking care of your every need!
Manager Response: Dear Lyk2ski -  Thank you very much for your kind review and for choosing our hotel for your stay. We do our utmost to treat each guest with courtesy and respect and are thrilled you found your experience so pleasant. I am also pleased to hear that the cleanliness of the hotel as well as our restaurant team members made such an impression on you. We hope you will visit us again soon, whether for an overnight stay or simply to dine at Le Chateau. Thank you again for your recommendation.  Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: The only hotel to stay in!!
Summary: My kids and I love this hotel, we will never stay anywhere else!! The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are always clean. The hotel iteself and it's surroundings I always find to be very clean. The staff have always been very nice and helpful. And the breakfast buffet is beyond what the average hotel breakfast is and we love that.. Ayres rocks!!!!!
Manager Response: Dear Oceanblues32 -  You rock too! Thank you so much for making us your choice of hotel in Costa Mesa. To know that we are able to make your stays so consistently comfortable is so wonderful and it is an honor to be the only hotel for you and your family. We are very appreciative of your recommendation and hope you will visit us again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Nice hotel it is kept up in the cheapest way - rooms are very nice though, the breakfast was terrible but one manager was very kind and professional.  Too many children not supervised in pool area to relax.  Minimal parking.  Found only 1 vending machine per building, on one floor out of four floors that was out of order.
Manager Response: Dear Lynna57 -  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. While I am pleased you enjoyed your room, I do apologize if the issues noted made your stay anything less than exceptional. We wish for all of our guests to feel relaxed and comfortable at our hotel no matter the area they are in and encourage our guests to contact the Front Desk if for any reason fellow guests are being disruptive. Had we the opportunity, we would have done our utmost to ensure guests and their children were behaving appropriately in the pool area. I am sorry if this caused any inconvenience as you mention you were at the hotel for rest and relaxation.   As to the breakfast, we are constantly reviewing our offerings and will definitely utilize your comments when we next revisit them. We appreciate your review and hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future.   Regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed in Ayres, Costa Mesa for 4 nights in mid July, 2012.The guest room we had (not a suite)was very spacious for me and my spouse. There was a nice leather sofa , a big working desk, a little round table and a wet bar . Everywhere was so clean and well maintained and that includes our room, the courtyard, the pool area, the corridors, the lobby and the washroom in the lobby. The breakfast which was included in the room rate were of excellent quality. We had hot items such as real scramble eggs, non-oily potatoes, very very lean bacon (a pleasant surprise), pancakes, freshly cut melons/pineapples, salsas, hot oatmeals. Although they didn't change the selections much but I don't mind eating the same thing everyday because all the food are so fresh/delicious and don't look

My husband and I were seeing a concert nearby and wanted somewhere close to stay overnight instead of driving all the way home. This place was only about a 10 minute ride to the concert which was located at the Orange County Fairgrounds(the fair runs mid July to Mid August). Also, If you like the beach it's only about a 20 minute car ride. There are two hotel buildings and the decor is quite lovely. I especially loved the paintings in the lobby and also the old pictures of Newport beach and its surroundings. The only things we encountered  that were negative were we couldn't check in early and the parking spaces are so tiny. Also, the airport was close by so you could hear the airplanes, but it's not a really busy airport so not many planes took off .The upside was parking was

Summary Heading: Another Stay At My Favorite Place
Summary: This was my second stay at the Ayres and I would still recommend it as the best place to stay in Costa Mesa. The room decor is inviting and the bed continues to be the best Ive ever slept in. I actually checked in to getting one this time...and guess what...they sale them and deliver them to your home. I can't wait to have my own Ayres mattress. It is absolutely the best sleep you will ever get. Every employee at the hotel is very friendly and helpful as well. If you are looking for a great place to stay...This is it. Nice..Clean..Friendly..and a great nights sleep. What else could you ask for..Well they also have a complimentary breakfast buffet in the mornings that is great as well, with a little courtyard and fountain that you can enjoy while the morning sun rises.

Courteous professional staff; comfortable environment with every amenity; best beds EVER!  I have stayed here twice a year for the last three years and every stay has been great.  I check out feeling well-rested and just a little spoiled.  Excellent restaurant and wait staff.

I recently stayed at the Ayers in Costa Mesa, CA.  The suite I occupied was beautiful with every ammenity I could have wanted.  The bed mattress was more comfortable than my bed at home.  The full breakfast was hot and very good.  The staff upon check-in and check-out were courteous, attentive and professional.  I had dinner at the La Chateau restaurant and the food was delicious and reasonably priced. I will not hesitate to stay at an Ayers property in the future.
Manager Response: Dear Shilah -  Thank you for allowing us to welcome you to our hotel and for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers. We are thrilled you enjoyed your Junior Suite as well as the Ayres Dream Sleeper mattress, which many guests find exceedingly comfortable. We wish for our hotel to be a home away from home for all of our guests as it sounds as if that wish was fulfilled in your case. We are very grateful for your review and hope you will visit us again very soon.   Many thanks,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This is my second stay at an Ayres property and I am sold on their hospitality and breakfasts!  This one in Costa Mesa is easily accessible by freeway, very close to OC airport, and not too far from the beach or South Coast Plaza.  The hotel has two buildings each with a nice lobby and plenty of parking.  The suites are very spacious and would be great even for a family of 4, by myself it felt huge!  The furniture and bathroom are not luxurious by any means, but are very clean and there was a jacuzzi tub if that interests you. The bed was very comfortable.  No airport noise heard in my room.  Pretty great hot breakfast included.  For the cost, this hotel is one of the best I have encountered in value (particularly in OC)  and with no complaints it gets a 5 out  5.
Manager Response: Dear Travelingagain08 -  It was a pleasure welcoming you to an Ayres Hotel for the second time. Thank you so much for your enthusiastic review and for sharing your experience with fellow travelers. To know each element of the hotel, from the guestroom size to the hotel location, exceeded your needs and expectations is absolutely wonderful to hear. We strive to provide the best possible value to our guests throughout the entire chain, so it means a great deal to us that you found your entire visit so worthwhile. We hope you will choose us again the next time you are in Costa Mesa.   Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stayed at the hotel junior suite for 2 months while on a business trip. It was extremely spacious and came with a king size bed, sofa,microwave and a refrigerator.  I enjoyed my stay and the staff were courteous and friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Christina -  Thank you so much for allowing us to host you for two months. That is a very long stay, and I am pleased to hear we were able to make you feel so at home in our accommodations as it can be difficult to be away from your actual home for such an extended period of time. It is also wonderful that the staff was friendly and welcoming throughout your stay as we do wish all of our guests to feel at ease in our hotel. We are very appreciative of your recommendation and hope you will have the opportunity to visit us again soon.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Ok I am going to tell you the truth about this hotel! I choose it because it was rated so high on this webite, well there are a few problems not mentioned. When we arrived we immediately heard airplanes flying directly over the hotel. I did not see this mentioned anywhere previous to this. When we inquired about it at the front desk we were told that they only are allowed to fly 7am-10pm like it wasn't that big of a deal seriously?? That means no sleeping in ever!!! We then asked if we could stay one night and see how it goes and were told no you have to pay for your stay in full now which was 4 days for $650 or we can cancel the rest of your stay and take the chance your room gets rebeooked. Seriously??? We didnt really have a choice so we had to stay who wants to spend their
Manager Response: Dear Lisa -  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I greatly apologize that your stay with us proved disappointing. We are located less than a mile from John Wayne Airport, which is detailed on our website, however, our hotel was built with enhanced sound insulation to ensure guests are not disturbed by the daily flight patterns. While most guests appear unaffected, I do understand that some guests may have sensitivity to sound and am sorry if this hindered your rest in any way. We also do our utmost to accommodate guest wishes in relation to room type, location, etc., but, occasionally, occupancy levels hinder our ability to meet requests. In this case it prevented us from essentially holding a room for the three additional nights mentioned. I do apologize that we were not able to meet your needs in this case as we truly wish our guests to feel completely satisfied with their stays.   Again, we appreciate your review and hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future.   Regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stayed here 4 nights this past week and I have to say this is a great place.  It was highly recommended by my friend who lives close by and is friends with the manager.  We stayed in a suite with king size bed and queen sofa sleeper.  There were only two of us, but could fit a family of 4.   It was nice to have a wet bar, microwave and small refridge for snacks.  The hotel is so close to the freeway that everything is very accessible.  It is a 5 minute drive to the airport, so if you don't like airport noise, probably not the best place for you!  I did not know there were two pools until the day before I checked out, but always had a chair and seemed to be the only one there. Too hot while I was there to use the hot tub.  Loved having the free 5 mile radius shuttle, which we
Manager Response: Dear Julesann69 -  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to welcome you to our hotel. It means a great deal to us that you found everything from your accommodations to the service welcoming and that your overall stay was satisfactory. The Ayres Hotels are known for their spacious guestrooms, so it is fantastic to hear that yours proved large enough for your needs. I am also pleased you were able to take advantage of our complimentary shuttle service as many guests find this especially convenient. We greatly appreciate your review and do hope you will choose us again in the future.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stayed here for a weekend in what was my first stay at an Ayres property. Here is my assessment:  Pros:  1. From my research on hotels in the area, this really did offer the best value proposition. After staying here, I can see why.  2. Our room, a junior suite, was spacious, well-furnished and well-lit. The bathtub with water jets was a big plus.  3. Wi-fi access, breakfast, and parking were included in the room rate. Collectively, a great bonus.  4. The hotel is not far at all from the beaches, which makes it ideal for a weekend getaway.  5. The interior of this property in particular is just splendid, with classic styles applied uniformly.  6. Staff were pleasant and professional from the moment I made my reservation over the phone a few weeks prior to the time I checked
Manager Response: Dear Inavigator -  Thank you for your detailed review of our hotel. It was such a pleasure having the opportunity to introduce you to our hotel chain, and I am pleased you found that our location, decor,  and complimentary amenities presented an enticing hotel value. I do apologize for any inconvenience caused by a late night need for headache medications. I will most definitely discuss this with the team at the hotel and investigate possibilities fro avoiding this issue in the future. We greatly appreciate your comments and hope you will choose us again in the future.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We just returned from a 7 night stay at the Ayres at Costa Mesa.  I would actually give this hotel a 4.5 rating.  First off it is a great location to all the nicer beaches in Southern Cali.  We were 10-15 mins away from Laguna, Newport and Balboa.  Not to mention Dana point.  The area is safe and clean-a big plus!  Lots of restaurants and malls close by as well.  We stayed in a Jr. Suite and it was very spacious with a jetted tub.  With a micro-kitchen, we had everything we needed to feed 2 adults, a 10 and 7 year old.  Morning breakfast was hot and quick.  Depending on how full the suite building is, there are 2 breakfast locations.  I do wish they would vary the menu a little.  After 7 days of the same (eggs, pastries, pancake, bacon, toast, fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, potato
Manager Response: Dear Larkmom -  It was such a pleasure welcoming you for an entire week's stay. Thank you so much for your review and for choosing our hotel for your stay. To know that each aspect of the hotel proved itself comfortable and convenient is very encouraging, and I am so pleased they lent themselves to a truly remarkable stay. As to your comments regarding our fitness room, we always appreciate guest comments about our accommodations and services and routinely use them when reviewing said elements. I will be sure to share your remarks with our Quality Assurance and Design team for use when revisiting remodels and renovations in our fitness room. Thank you again for your review. We look forward to welcoming you again very soon.   Many thanks,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Short stay but overall good experience. Nice hotel and good complimentary breakfast.

My husband and I were attending a wedding in Newport Beach and wanted our son, daughter in law, and baby grandson to join us and enjoy the beach since they live in the CA desert.  I wanted a good value but also as many amenities as I could get including a large room for each couple and a frig and microwave for baby bottles, etc.  We are from Atlanta and were a little anxious about how nice the Ayres could be and still be so reasonable in price.  My husband was an international business man for years and we were accustomed to traveling 5*  all the time.  In retirement we have to be a bit more frugal.  The Ayres was beautifully decorated, the room was roomy and so clean, the staff was excellent and  the breakfast was pleasant.  My husband swam his laps every morning and we loved
This was my second visit and i enjoyed the suite, the breakfast and the shuttle service. I combined business in UCI with short visits to musea. I discovered the Irvine museum.
Manager Response: Dear Hankemper -  We were thrilled to have the opportunity to welcome you once more. Thank you for choosing to return to our hotel and for your positive review. I am so pleased you found your stay enjoyable and were able to take advantage of our surrounding attractions and complimentary shuttle service. We appreciate you taking the time to review our hotel and hope to welcome you a second time.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This was my first stay at Ayres in Costa Mesa due to work travel, but it won't be my last.  Very helpful staff, unique and relaxing environment, excellent restaurant and a full breakfast included!  Throw in free parking and wi-fi and you have a memorable (however brief) lodging experience.  I will look forward to coming again.
Manager Response: Dear JDPHX -  It was a pleasure welcoming you to our hotel for the first time. We love having the chance to show our new guests around the hotel and provide them with exceptional service. It is fantastic to hear we provided you with comfortable accommodations and that you found our many complimentary amenities amenable. We look forward to your next visit and hope to make significant impression on you once more.   Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I was not sure what to expect as reviews were mixed.  We stayed in the suites side, and the room was large.  We liked having a mini fridge and microwave.  The outdoor courtyard was very inviting with lots of flowers and a large fountain.  The decor was very classical European.  The staff was very friendly and the restaurant food good.  Breakfast is included, but ends at 9:00 on weekdays (which is a tad early for non-morning people like myself).    The bed was ok.  Ours tended to want to cave in the middle and we are not large people.  Bathroom was large and spacious.  Parking was ample and free, as was internet access.  The only thing this hotel was missing was a coffee bar in the lobby.
Manager Response: Dear WilliamTheSilent -  We love having the opportunity to exceed our guest's expectations, so your review is a wonderful thing to read and is greatly appreciated. I am so pleased that the grounds and decor proved inviting and the accommodations were spacious and comfortable. We definitely want our guests to have the best possible rest (which is SO important in a hotel stay) so will have the Maintenance Team investigate further to see if this particular mattress needs replacing. I do apologize if this in any way impeded your stay. Your recommendation is most appreciated and we hope you will visit us again soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Ayres Hotel July 2-6, 2012. The front desk staff were very helpful and courteous in accomodating us which included an upgrade to a Junior Suite. The Hotel and guest rooms were nicely furnished; The beds were very comfortable. The room was very clean and the housekeeping staff were friendly, courteous and accomodating with requests. Given its proximity to the John Wayne airport we were concerned about noise. Standing outside planes taking off could be heard but this place must be well insulated because I can honestly say that we were never awakened by any noise. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle service within 5 miles of the hotel. We took advantage of this service and found the driver James to be timely and friendly. The hotel offers a free breakfast,
Manager Response: Dear Bballmom52 -   It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you so much for your thorough review and for choosing our hotel for your stay. We know you have the choice of many hotels in the area, so it means a great deal to us that you chose us! I am thrilled to hear you were treated with warm service and that you had the opportunity to indulge in our various complimentary amenities, including our shuttle service within 5 miles and full American breakfast. We are so appreciative of your recommendation and do hope you are able to stay with us again very soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I enjoyed my stay at the Ayres in Costa Mesa from July 7-11, 2012.  My room was exceptionally clean and well cared for by housekeeping throughout my stay.  I stayed in the Suites Building on the fourth floor.  I especially enjoyed the lobby areas in each building - lots of room for impromptu meetings with colleagues - and always a fire in the fireplace.  Breakfast was excellent.  Location is okay - very near the Santa Ana airport so there is much airplane noise.  That isn't much of an issue for me, but if it is for you, you might consider another property.  Never had a problem finding a parking place or getting help from any member of staff.  I would definitely stay here again and actually am going back for ten days next month.  If you are traveling with anyone who is staying in
Manager Response: Dear BeyondGrateful -  We appreciate your kind review. Thank you for choosing our hotel for your stay and for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers. Our inviting lobbies are a hallmark of the Ayres Hotels, so it is wonderful to know you found them so welcoming and useful. I am also pleased to know you found the service warm and the accommodations clean. Thank you again for your review and we look forward to welcoming you next month!  Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Old World but very comfortable with all modern conveniences, Professional but friendly staff, Great full course breakfast & WI FI included. No charges for parking on site a big PLUS and all this at half the price of other comparable area hotels. GREAT EXPERIENCE at a GREAT PRICE.

Stayed at this site July 5th through July 8th. The facilities were lovely and clean. The restaurant was very good, and we felt we got a good value. The pool was a bit chilly, but we didn't really go for that and the kids didn't seem to mind at all. We would certainly stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Julie -  It was a pleasure welcoming you to our hotel earlier this month. We relish the opportunity to provide the cleanest and most comfortable accommodations to our guests, and it looks like we were able to do so for you and your family which is fantastic! We are very grateful for your recommendation and hope you will think of us the next time you are in the Costa Mesa area.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Don't be fooled by the pretty photos on their website! Rooms smell musty and old, wrinkled/stained carpet in rooms. Areas of the hotel are not clearly marked it is easy to get LOST in the hotel. Front desk staff arrogant and put off when asked to help out. Disappointed to discover that there weren't many standard amenities available. No business center or computers available for regular use, limited toiletries (no conditioner or shampoo) No food pantry.  Uncomfortable beds :(   On a positive note the breakfast was good and restaraunt staff provided great service. Mantinenance staff and house keeping very friendly!
Manager Response: Dear S-7family -  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. While I am pleased you found the service in our restaurant amenable and the maintenance and housekeeping teams friendly, I do apologize if your overall stay was anything less than remarkable. I was very distraught to read of the issues with your room and do greatly apologize. We take great care in the presentation and cleanliness of our guestrooms and do normally provide a variety of toiletries, including a shampoo/conditioner, lotion, facial soap and body soap. I apologize for any inconsistencies with our normally high levels of cleanliness and presentation and have already shared your comments with the Housekeeping Team to ensure this does not happen again. As to the availability of a computer for guest use, unfortunately we do not have an available business center for guests but are always happy to assist in printing items on their behalf and do provide complimentary WIFI for guests in all public areas and guestrooms.   Again, thank you for your review. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.   Regards,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: stayed over 4th of july week and had a great time. hotel was decent but the staff made it great. from the front desk to the cleaning crew...very nice,polite,helpful, and knowledgable. buffet was great and Juan must be the hardest working guy, keeping  the buffet filled. very clean...inside and out. pool and hot tub were great as well. as close to a 5 star hotel u can get without paying the 5 star cost. will stay again next year. thanx costa mesa.....p.s. airport is close and alittle noisy only during the day tho..well insulated rooms.
Manager Response: Dear Seahunt69 -  It was a pleasure welcoming you over the 4th of July holiday. Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your stay and for your kind review. It is fantastic to know you found the hotel and team members so comfortable and accommodating. I will be sure to pass along your compliments to Juan as he works very hard to ensure guest satisfaction and is an integral part of our team. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to your return next year.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Ayers Hotel - Incredible Style and Value
Summary: This was our first stay at an Ayers property (there for a wedding with lots of other folks).   The property is REALLY well designed.  The junior suite is a great room for a little amount of money.  The building furnishings and finishes are high end.  We will definitely stay here again, when we have the opportunity
Manager Response: Dear Iswallow -  Thank you for allowing us to introduce you to the Ayres Hotels of Southern California. We absolutely love having the chance to show first time guests how exceptional a stay at our hotels can be. I am pleased you found the accommodations and ambiance so welcoming and hopefully this helped make your celebration even more jubilant. We are pleased to know you would choose us a second time and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My kid and I stayed at this hotel with the rest of our Lacrosse team and had a blast.  Good food options within walking distance of the hotel.  Super kid friendly hotel and the rooms are spacious to house multiple people.  Great location that provided easy access to the downtown Irvine and surrounding areas.

We visit our son often in Orange County and have tried several hotels, but continually go back to the Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa.  The hotel is beautiful, with great service, spacious and clean rooms.  The lovely French decor patio w/fountain provides a wonderful, peaceful atmosphere, and the hot buffet breakfast is second to none!  And then, of course, the warm cookies served in the lobby every evening are a favorite as well!
Manager Response: Dear Shelley -  What a very kind review! We greatly appreciate you choosing our hotel again and again and are thankful for the time spent to tell those on TripAdvisor about the hotel. We wish nothing more than for our guests to leave feeling we are an "excellent hotel," so it means a great deal to us that you find the accommodations and team so exceptional. Your recommendation is most appreciated and we look forward to your return.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Felt Like our Last Name was Ayers!
Summary: Wife & I stayed here to check out the place for a future Church Marriage Retreat. We were given a nice tour by Samantha & Brenda & got to see the entire Hotel & learn a lot about the history of the Hotels & the Ayers Family. This is still a Family Owned Hotel & let me tell you, we felt like Family right from the start! Everyone from the Front Desk to Housekeeping was more than willing to lend a hand or answer a question. Needed towels for the pool, got them quickly. Locked ourselves out of the room (apparently a "Costco" card won't open the door..OOPS!) & front desk brought one right up. We had dinner at the Le' Chateau restaurant located in the Hotel & let me tell you, the service & the food were both exceptional! Our waiter Miguel took very good care of us & the Caramelized
Manager Response: Dear Mario -  We appreciate your very kind review of our hotel. It means a great deal to us that you truly felt like family as we strive exceedingly hard to ensure each guest feels welcome and appreciated. I am pleased that you found every element of the hotel comfortable and that you had the opportunity to dine at our award winning restaurant. It is also wonderful to know that the service was consistently prompt and thorough throughout your visit. I will be sure to pass along your compliments to the team members who conducted your tour of the hotel as they are all an integral part of our team and we relish the chance to let them know how much they are appreciated. We look forward to welcoming you and your many friends very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This was our first time in a Ayres Hotel and will not make it our last time.  Easy access to shopping and friends.  A very clean hotel, and the entire staff was the tops. The complimentary breakfast hit the spot, just like home.  Mahalo for everything. Paul and Cheryl
Manager Response: Dear Paul -  Thank you for allowing us to introduce you to the Ayres Hotels of Southern California! We love having the chance to show those new to our hotel collection that a stay at an Ayres Hotel can be the ultimate in comfort. It is fantastic that the cleanliness of the hotel and the welcoming service also contributed to a satisfying hotel experience as that is what our main goal is and always will be. We appreciate your review and hope to welcome you again in the future.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This was the second time staying here while attending the Barrett-Jackson Auction in Costa Mesa.  Hotel is great, the location is very good with easy access to beaches and surrounding attractions, staff is friendly and accomodating and the complimentary breakfast is very good.  We ate in the hotel lounge a couple of nights and the quality of the food was very good (best nachos ever).  Luigi was our server both times and he provided top notch, professional service.  There is some noise from the airport during the day but that is to be expected given the location -we weren,t there much during the day anyway.  Would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone.
Manager Response: Dear Andy -  It was a pleasure having you as our guest. Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for a second time and for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers. We strive to provide a comfortable and convenient hotel experience to each of our guests, so it means a great deal that you found everything from our close proximity to nearby attractions to the service provided at Le Chateau conducive to an exemplary stay. We greatly appreciate your enthusiastic recommendation and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This place made the whole weekend great! We had several people from out of town coming in, they set aside a block and everyone just called in and used our names to get special rates! Everything was clean and all the staff was extremely helpful. The entire wedding party stayed here as well, including me (the Bride) and my new husband. It made meeting up with family a breeze. The courtyard in the main building was a great place to have breakfast, and it's great breakfast with eggs, bacon, fruit, pancakes, etc. We also used their 'Living Room' to hold our Rehearsal Dinner. It was Great! the food and service was fantastic! It is a great location, near Airport, freeways, services, and not too far from the beach.  We made use of the pool to keep all the kids busy... It really was the
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer -  Congratulations on your new union and thank you so very much for allowing us to be a part of your special event! As wonderful as weddings are we know they can be stressful for the bride and groom, so we do our utmost to ensure everything runs as smoothly and efficiently as possible and do our best to provide the ultimate in comfortable and convenient accommodations. I am so pleased you, your wedding party, and your guests found the hotel experience exceptional. We appreciate you choosing our hotel for your event and are very thankful for this kind review. Perhaps you will visit us again on your anniversary!  Safe travels,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Very enjoyable stay at Ayres Hotel for six days. It was a great location for doing business in the Newport Beach/Irvine area.  Very quiet, no traffic noise.  The free buffet breakfast was the best hotel breakfast I have had in thirty years of travelling, and the service was very attentive. Easy access to the freeways.

Ayres in Costa Mesa was close to everything in the area. Beaches, restaurants, and the airport in Orange County. The property itself is quite lovely. The rooms are nicely appointed and are quite comfortable. The staff is very good at making you feel welcome. The complimentary full American breakfast was beautifully displayed, plentiful and quite delicious. I will definitely be returning to this property when in the area again.
Manager Response: Dear 1Monica -  We appreciate you choosing our hotel for your visit and for sharing your experience with fellow travelers. Nothing pleases us more than to know our guests are completely satisfied with the service and accommodations offered, so I am very pleased you found everything from the guestrooms to the service exceptional. We do find many of our guests appreciate our location as it is in close proximity to so much of what Southern California has to offer and I am thrilled you were able to take advantage of the many nearby beaches. Your recommendation is appreciated and we look forward to welcoming you again in the future.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My stay at this hotel was the most perfect stay ever at any hotel.  It was beautiful, comfortable, clean, and very well staffed.  Every single person I encountered was warm, friendly, helpful, accommodating and pleasant.  I was exhausted and, thankfully, was able to check in early.  The food was excellent and very reasonable, even delivered to my room.  I was only there over night but was made to feel welcome and at home in such a beautiful, comfortable setting.  It was such a wonderful experience that was far too short. My family really believed I was staying in southern California - a permanent resident of the Ayres Costa Mesa!
Manager Response: Dear June -  Thank you for the amazing compliments! To be described as "perfect" is a hotel's dream and I am thrilled we made such a wonderful impression on you. We want nothing more than for our guests to be completely satisfied with every aspect of the hotel, from the cleanliness of the rooms to the service.
