It is fantastic that we were able to give you all of this and more. We are very thankful for being your choice of hotel and hope you will choose us again in the future.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The service makes this place a gem. Everyone in the hotel and restaurant are so welcoming and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear SVCLinda -  Thank you so much for the wonderful compliment and for choosing our hotel for your stay! I will be sure to pass along your comments to the rest of the team. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and hope you will visit us again very soon!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Stayed at this lovely hotel June 10th & June 11th 2012. We arrived at noon and were able to check in although the check in is not until 3:00 p.m. Staff was very friendly and made us feel right at home from the moment we arrived. The room we had was a junior suite room 291. The room was huge with a very comfortable king size bed, sofa and desk with free wifi. The bed had lovely linens and oh so comfy mattress. The bathroom was also huge and came with a jetted bathtub. The location is very near the John Wayne Airport and many airline crews stay here. We were also treated to a wonderful breakfast in the restaurant. All in all a surprising find and would recommend to anyone staying in this area.
Manager Response: Dear Polette -  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to surprise you with our comfortable accommodations and warm service. Each of our team members takes the guest experience very seriously, so it is wonderful to know that your stay with us was so remarkable. I am also pleased to hear that you found the bedding so comfortable as the Ayres Dream Sleeper mattress is well tested and we find that many of our guests absolutely LOVE them. We appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you in the future.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Ayres to attend a wedding.  We arrived early and they did their best to take care of us.  The employee at the front desk was wonderful.  The lobby was very nice, and had cookies in the afternoon.  We stayed in a suite, and it had a microwave, and fridge, which was nice along with a separate sink.  The breakfast in the morning was very good and we were always greeted with a smile.  Our room was very quiet, even though it is very close to the airport, it was not an issue.  We had a beautiful view.  The pool in the second building which houses the suites is not as spacious as the other, but no one was there, so it was fine.  If you stay in the other building, be sure to ask if the pool area or patio are being used, the were when we were there, and I would imagine
Manager Response: Dear Judygolfing -  It was such a pleasure welcoming you to our hotel. We appreciate you making us your choice of accommodations during such a celebratory event. We are always pleased to know that a guest finds everything from our accommodations, to our service pleasant and conducive to a comfortable stay. Thank you very much for your review. We hope to welcome you back very soon.   Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: The Ayres Hotel at Costa Mesa-Newport Beach
Summary: The Ayres at Costa Mesa is a very welcoming Boutique Hotel. with a family welcoming atmosphere. The staff is very cordial and helpful. The rooms are clean and the bathrooms look like they have been recently updated,  The restaurant food was good and the service was very good. You get to know the familiar faces of the servers and they also get to know you. They provide Shuttle service to several local places, making your stay that much more comfortable. I recommend it to anyone needing to stay in the area. It is close to many places of interest as well.
Manager Response: Dear Adriana730 -  Thank you so much for your very thorough review of our hotel. It means a great deal to us that you found your hotel visit so comfortable. I am pleased you had the opportunity to experience every aspect of our hotel, from the warm service to the delicious cuisine at Le Chateau Restaurant. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you back very soon.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Very beautiful hotel.  We stayed there for 2 nights and this hotel is simply immaculate.  Very clean, serene environment.  The staff is professional, kind and helpful.  5 star service and accomodations for a very reasonable price.  Will stay here again and again when I visit SoCal.  Thank you Ayres for a fantastic experience.
Manager Response: Dear Ocean610 -  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you to our hotel. We are always thrilled to have provided a guest with the ultimate in service and comfort, so I am pleased we were able to make your stay so exceptional. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and do hope to be your choice of hotel when visiting Southern California in the future.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: I expected a whole lot more..
Summary: I chose this property because it was the best value and offered free parking compared to other surrounding hotels that aren't Motel 6. Location is a decent driving distance to Newport Beach and South Coast plaza.. And expect to be doing a lot of that, driving! Exiting this property only allows one way direction.. If you see something you like that is West, you'll have to find your way around the freeway to get there.. Stayed the weekend and it was near empty.. Definitely a weekday working (wo)man's hotel, and the fact that the weekday rate is higher confirms this.. The staff was very friendly, the room looked great!.. Leather sofa in a basic room was a nice touch..   My reason for rating just Average is because the few things that were an issue REALLY bother me: the A/C here
Manager Response: Dear GzyOnline -  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I do apologize if your stay was anything less than remarkable. While I am pleased you enjoyed the rooms and service, I am sorry if the issue with the air conditioner was not resolved promptly and efficiently and that it impeded the quality of your stay. We make every effort to ensure that guest requests for maintenance issues are addressed immediately so our guests can experience the most comfortable possible hotel visit. Again, I am sorry this was not handled to your satisfaction and have already shared your comments with the Maintenance Team so guests will not be made to deal with faulty air conditioners in the future. Thank you again for your review and I hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future.   Regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stayed in a Jr. Suite. The room was very nice and the staff was great as well. I loved this hotel. The exercise room could be nicer and the pool leaves a lot to be desired but the rooms are great. I also enjoyed the restaurant. The service and food were excellent. I'll be back for sure.
Manager Response: Dear Sidney -  Thank you for your kind review and for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you as our guest. We love being able to provide our guests the very best in accommodations and service, so it is wonderful to know we were able to do so for you. I am also pleased you found the award winning Le Chateau cuisine so tasty! Your recommendation is much appreciated and we hope you will choose us again in the future.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We tried to like this hotel during our most recent 7 day stay.  My husband and I stayed at this hotel years ago and just loved it. I have to say though that we were disappointed during this trip.  The hotel has become dated during these four years- the carpet needs cleaning, and there's just an old smell in the hotel hallways and elevator (which lingered in our clothes in our suitcases).  Although they've kindly upgraded us to a suite after we alerted them of the fruit fly problem in our room- I'm afraid the room as just as dusty as the last. Sorry- we really tried to like the hotel for old times sake...
Manager Response: Dear Kkw_123 -  Thank you very much for your candid review of our hotel. I am truly sorry that your experience with us was anything less than exceptional. We know cleanliness is key to a guest enjoying his or her stay with us and have very high standards for care and maintenance of the various areas of the hotel, so I apologize for any inconvenience that may have been caused by what you describe. Please know that your comments have already been shared with the Housekeeping and Maintenance Teams to ensure each of the issues discussed is addressed immediately. We appreciate you visiting us for a second time and hope you will grant us another chance to provide you with a remarkable hotel experience.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Excellent place to stay, great restaurant, very nice.

We were having a wedding on Newport Harbor and compared the hotels in the area.  Although the Ayres was further away from our venue, it was a much nicer hotel and was less expensive. We were able to get a complementary room block at a reduced rate.  As it got closer to our wedding day, the internet price of the rooms had fallen to the reduced rate which we were previous quoted.  The hotel adjusted all of our reservations to a rate which was now below the current internet rate without us having to ask for the adjustment. The hotel is clean and well maintained.  The common areas are elegant, which we used as we were a large group with out of town guests.  The hotel provided a free shuttle from John Wayne airport which came in handy for the out of towners.  The hotel also provides
Manager Response: Dear Blackcuda1 -  Congratulations on your new union! Thank you for allowing us to be a part of this very special day. We know that weddings can be stressful events, so it is very important for the hotel experience to be a comfortable and seamless one for all parties involved. I am very pleased that we were able to meet and exceed this goal in your case. We appreciate your very enthusiastic recommendation and send our best wishes to the bride and groom.   Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I have been traveling to orange county for 15 years or more for business. I am sure I have stayed in every hotel within a 5 mile radius of John Wayne airport. I only discovered the Ayres on Bristol in Costa Mesa, in the last year. I have now stayed many times in both the regular hotel and the suites Hotel next door and they're both great. Comfortable rooms, great staff, and the free full breakfasts are wonderful. Now, I look to reserve in this hotel exclusively when I have to be in this area, and only book elsewhere when the Ayres is full up. Oh yes and included in their extremely reasonable rates is free Wi-Fi. I don't understand why other hotels continue to charge for this obvious necessity for any travelers, let alone business travelers.
Manager Response: Dear NoMossGrowsHere -  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers and for your continued patronage. We truly appreciate the opportunity to provide you with an exceptional hotel stay again and again, and I am thrilled you find your visits so consistently comfortable. We do know that WiFi is very important for travelers, especially those traveling on business, so are more than happy to provide it as part of our complimentary amenities.We appreciate your recommendation and hope your travels bring you back here very soon.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: From the beautiful decor, friendly and efficient staff, wonderful food (free breakfast, and cookies in the afternoon!), nice pool, and exceptional value, I would rate this property as one of the nicest I have stayed in. I just wish there were more things to do in Irvine so I would have an excuse to go back to this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear Happyt525 -   Thank you so much for your very kind review. To know we have provided a guest such comfortable accommodations and welcoming, thorough service gives us great joy. I am pleased you found the decor so beautiful as each Ayres Hotel is designed with the greatest attention to detail. We hope you find an excuse to come visit us again very soon.   Warm regards,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We were so surprised and impressed with this property.  It's in Costa Mesa, but very, very close to Newport Beach (which was our venue, so extremely convenient).  The hotel is big enough to have everything you need, but small enough to be highly personal.  The breakfast is in the restaurant and the best I think I have had for an included breakfast; just really nice.  We were super impressed with the hotel, its amenities, the staff and the location.  we would definitely recommend -- especially if one is looking for a boutique hotel -- and we would unquestionably stay here again.

Perfect location for shopping, beach, or theme parks.  Friendly staff, very attentive to our needs.  Room was spotless, bed so comfortable!  Loved having the complimentary breakfast outside in the beautiful courtyard each morning.  So much is included in the nightly room rate--no charge for parking, breakfast, and even complimentary cookies in the lobby each evening!  We loved coming back from our day at the beach and being able to have a delicious dinner at Le Chateau (they don't mind beachwear attire at all!)

Summary Heading: First time at Ayers and I was very impressed
Summary: From the moment I was picked up from John Wayne airport to my departure I was given great services. The Shuttle arrived at the time that it was promised. I was greeted as I walked in the door. The rooms were immaculate!! I would stay here on every business trip.

Summary Heading: First time at any Ayres and I was impressed
Summary: Right off the Highway 73 for an easy access to beaches. Spotless rooms and exceptional service on check-in and check-out. Really surprised by how right on this hotel was and the rate was great.  Slept like a baby. They gave late check-out with zero hassle. Good choice.
Manager Response: Dear Kyle -  We are honored to be your first experience with an Ayres Hotel! Thank you so much for sharing your experience with fellow travelers. It means a great deal that you found the service so amenable and the accommodations conducive to a wonderful night's rest. Our rates are very competitive, so it is fantastic that they suited your needs as well. We hope to welcome you back to this Ayres Hotel or another in the collection very soon.  Warm regards,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The Ayres has been the choice for many meeting I've attended lately.  It is close to the airport thus easy to get in and out of.  Each stay has been excellent with very courteous staff.  The food is always excellent and plentiful.  Rooms are clean, nicely appointed, and comfortable.  My only complaint is that the lighting isn't the best so reading in bed can be a challenge.
Manager Response: Dear Juy -  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel on TripAdvisor. How wonderful to know that we consistently provide such exceptional meetings and catering! I am also pleased to know you found the accommodations comfortable and relaxing as well. I do apologize for any issues with lighting as I know it is important to be able to read and catch up on one's daily "to do" list when away on business. We are always happy to assist in finding a solution should a guest have any issue, so, in the future, please feel free to contact our Front Desk team so we can ensure the accommodations meet all of your needs. We hope to be a part of your future travel plans.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Great quick 2 day stay with my daughter. Pure efficiency combined with friendly staff.

Great hotel close to the beach ( just down the freeway) Very clean and classy ! Quiet and safe neighborhood. The restaurant was fantastic - not your typical hotel food at all - it was WONDERFUL !  The service level was impecable - everyone was engaged and happy to help. I will be returning here the next time I am in the OC.
Manager Response: Dear Karen -  We are thrilled to have been given the opportunity to welcome you. I am so pleased that everything from the cleanliness of the hotel to the service exceeded your expectations and that your stay with us was so remarkable. We do find that guests enjoy the cuisine at Le Chateau, specifically the Monte Cristo sandwich (which has received wide recognition in the area). Perhaps on your next visit you will get the chance to try it. We appreciate your recommendation and do hope to welcome you again very soon.   Warm regards,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Pictures match the experience - classy sophisticated decor - exceptional guest service and very clean rooms - very convenient to the beach without the beach prices. Very convienent to the freeway. The restaurant exceeded our expectations - GREAT FOOD !  Will stay here again !!!

We had heard of the Ayres hotels from friends, but never had the opportunity to stay in one. While in the area for our daughter's graduation from college and an extended visit with family, we chose the Ayres in Costa Mesa because it was close to family. So glad we made the selection!  From the road, the hotel looks like noise could be an issue, but we requested a room in the back and never knew we were minutes from John Wayne Airport and a busy freeway interchange. We stayed in a king room in the suites building, and it was large and comfortable. Beds were great, bathroom spacious and everything was clean and well maintained. There was a beautiful sitting room/lobby area separate from the main lobby where you could enjoy a drink, sit and read, etc. Breakfast was included in the

Summary Heading: What an beautiful hotel this is!
Summary: I booked rooms with this hotel to bring a team of people to attend a near by conference. Because the prices were reasonable and the pictures online looked amazing. I was not disappointed, in fact I was impressed with everything about this hotel. It was beautiful, clean,  quiet and peaceful. The staff from booking the room to check-in and out was great! My team members loved it and wondered if there were other Ayres hotels in other places. They served an awesome breakfast way above and beyond a continental type buffet. We went swimming, hot tubing, hiking, golfing and even walked to a near by restaurant! It was such a wonderful experience for all my team!
We had a great experience at The Ayres Hotel.  The rooms are beautiful and very well appointed.  The complimentary breakfast is second to none.  We will be back in two weeks.

This was our second two-night stay at this hotel and we were as pleased this time as the first time. We booked directly on their website, got a GREAT deal, and continued to be be amazed at the value. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The rooms are clean and amazingly sound-proofed. Although the hotel is located right next to the airport, we NEVER heard a peep from the airplanes unless we were outside. Of course, we never heard any noise from any neighbors either. The breakfast, which was included in the sensational room rate, was hot and fresh both mornings, with great selections. We were in the area for both business and family events and the hotel was located with easy access to the major freeways. We will definately return for a pleasure visit.

We booked through OC Marathon website.  Not knowing the area and the hotel, we were very pleased with the hotel.  We stayed two nights.  Considering it is very close to the airport, it did not interrupt my sleep.  The complimentary shuttle service was reliable and relatively fast.  We were able to take advantage of the complimentary breakfast the second morning.  It included eggs, bacon, potatoes, pan cakes, oatmeal and more!  The wifi was reliable. We enjoyed our stay here.

I've wanted to report this incident for a long time but just couldn't have the time and don't know where to report to begin with.  Finally have the time to Google and found this site.   After New Year’s Eve party, my husband and I checked in at Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa early morning of January 1. 2012.    When I woke up, got out of bed and when I took my blanket out, I saw a small bug on my bed, it was small, I thought it was an ant first but it was a little larger than an ants, it’s moving fast so I tried to block it with a piece of card because it’s heading towards the end of the bed.  I told my husband to take a photo of it because I have a suspicion it might be a bed bug.  I’ve heard from my best friend that there’s a bed bug epidemic on hotels these days
Manager Response: Dear M M -  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I am deeply sorry that you encountered any problems during your stay and apologize for any inconvenience that may have been caused.   Please know that we take this issue very seriously and have a standard protocol prepared if there is even a hint of a possibility of what you describe. After this incident the room was professionally treated and kept our of service for nearly 30 days to be 100% positive there were no problems remaining. This incident is not anywhere near the nature of our hotel and again I am sorry that this hindered your experience in any way and invite you to contact me if you feel the event is still unresolved.   We do hope you will consider staying with us again.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Even though this Ayres Hotel is very close to John Wayne airport, the soundproofing is so good that we never heard the planes taking off.

Stayed here while on biz in the area and would never stay here again.  This hotel gives the impression that you are stuck somewhere in time.  The hotel is very dated and smells.  The rooms while large are just awful.  The covers are dusty, the rug could use a major cleaning and the bathroom are barely adequate.   That's all the nice things I can say about it.
Manager Response: Dear Dalcrew1985 -  Thank you very much for your review of our hotel. I do apologize if your stay with us was anything less than remarkable. Our decor is European-inspired and we find that many of our guests find the ambiance unique and appealing in comparison to regular chain hotels, however I am sorry if it was not suited to your taste. As to the cleanliness issues discussed, we understand that a hotel's cleanliness is of the utmost importance, so rest assured I have already shared your comments with our Housekeeping Teams to ensure that each room is cleaned based on our very rigorous standards.   We do appreciate you taking the time to review our hotel and hope you will choose to stay with us in the future.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We had a very nice stay at this hotel.  The property is clean and well maintained.  We booked a jr suite and due to our request for a courtyard view at check in, we were put into a deluxe...the front desk manager should have informed us that we would not get a suite (we would have opt for the suite instead and would have saved us time and hassle of changing room later in the evening after we got back from dinner.)  Our room key did not work after coming back from dinner and so we were at the front desk getting new keys when we found out of the room mix up.  Allen (night front desk rep) did a great job in compensating for our inconvenience.  Our suite room was in the second building on the 3rd floor facing the main building ( room 388).  Overall, it was a little more spacious and

Summary Heading: Best hotel in the John Wayne Airport area
Summary: If you are staying in the John Wayne airport area, this is most definitely your hotel. It is very comfortable, cozy, spacious beyond belief (the rooms have a bed or two , a two to three person couch with a center table, a desk, a table with two chairs, a kitchenette and in some cases even a hot tub) and inexpensive. It has not one but two very comfortable lobbies, a pool and other amenities. They give you free breakfast, free parking and a very efficient shuttle service to places like the airport, UCI, Fashion Island and other attractions. And the price is about the same as other hotels from the area, such as the Atrium, which are way, way worse. The staff is very friendly, the hotel is quite clean and the service is spotless. There is nothing bad to say about this hotel. I have
superb. friendly, cosy, great breakfasts, upgrade without request (because we had booked a king, but only 2 queens available), spacious.

Nice always cleaned rooms. Huge bad, but sometimes if you want to sleep till noon airplanes would not give you such chance.   Breakfast is pretty good, and you have some choice. But unfortunately if you stay there for a long time you would certainly notice that it never changes. And it is difficult to eat same food every day.  There 2 pools with warm water. But as for me, I would prefer one pool but at least 25m long, because those two are a bit short if you can swim well.  The personnel is very friendly. All of them are willing to help you in case you ask.

Beautiful campus, incredibly nice staff, clean and comfortable rooms, amazing complimentary breakfast, easy to get around. Five of us attended for a conference, but came a day early for meetings.  There were nice places to meet and talk both outside and inside.  We felt spoiled!

I stayed 3 nights on a business trip.  The hotel has a lovely courtyard with a fountain and fragrant plants.  I would again request a room with a view of the courtyard, as with the window open the sound of the fountain is lovely.  Clean and service-oriented place.  Fun restaurants within easy walking distance.  Full breakfast included with the room was excellent.  Excellent and timely shuttle service.  Definitely will stay again if in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Oregonmom1 -  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you for three nights. We wish for nothing more than for our guests to leave our hotel completely satisfied with the hotel's service and offerings, so it is heartening to know that we were able to do this for you. We often have guests comment on the elegant European feel of our courtyard as well and I appreciate you pointing this out to fellow travelers. Thank you so much for your recommendation. Hopefully you will visit the area again very soon and give us the chance to welcome you once again.   Many thanks,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the hotel this past weekend while in town for a wedding. Check-in on Friday night was super easy. I asked for (and was granted) a complimentary upgrade, and the gentleman, Allen, at the front desk couldn't have been nicer. The room itself was nice furnishings. The decor and ambiance of the main areas (lobbies, elevators, etc.) were all very classy, nice, and welcoming. Breakfast the next day was good - not great - but since it is included in the rate I don't have any major complaints. Offering bananas at breakfast would be a nice addition though! The staff was all very friendly, including the gentleman who was painting the outside of the building on Saturday morning. Free parking is a plus, since most places do charge for it. Same thing with free internet. We would
Manager Response: Dear Hlafe -  It was a pleasure having the chance to welcome you to our hotel. Thank you for choosing us for your stay and for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers. The Ayres Hotels of Southern California are a family owned and operated chain of hotels and great care is taken in the details of each property, so we are appreciative that you found the decor so inviting. Your comments regarding our team are greatly appreciated as well and have been shared to ensure each team member knows he or she is acknowledged and appreciated. We look forward to the opportunity to have you back. Thank you again.   Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The hotel was very nice and the staff very friendly and helpful.  Loved the old European decor. The room was cozy and quiet.  The whirlpool tub was a great way to relax after a long and tedious drive.  Breakfast was better than most.  The free parking and breakfast make this hotel a bargain in this area.  Would definitely stay again if in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Tonya -  We appreciate you choosing Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa for your stay. Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and for your kind comments. At the end of the day, the guest experience is truly what is most important, so it is fantastic to learn that you found your stay with us an exceptional one. it is also wonderful to hear that the complimentary amenities (parking, WiFi, and full American breakfast) assisted in making your visit so comfortable. Perhaps on your next visit you will have the opportunity to try the award winning cuisine at Le Chateau, our on site restaurant. Thank you again for your review and we look forward to your return.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: The planes start taking off from John Wayne Airport at 8:00am on Saturdays - so if you are looking for a place where you can sleep late, go elsewhere.  But you may not find such good value at other hotels in this part of Orange County.  The bed was very comfortable, the linens were good quality.  The room was clean and well appointed - and we had plenty of hot water.  The decor is not my taste but it was easy on the eye.  There are lots of common areas and courtyards, two pools and a jacuzzi. It's a fairly large property.  We were on the third floor.  There's a small boutique/gift shop as well.  It was very quiet even though the hotel seemed almost full.  The staff were very attentive.  The breakfast, which was included in our room rate, was much nicer than most hotel breakfast
Manager Response: Dear CalifCoupleSanDiego -  We appreciate you allowing us the opportunity to welcome you. Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your visit and for your very kind words. We take great pride in providing our guests with the best possible service, accommodations, and amenities, so I am pleased we were able to uphold these very high standards during your visit. Thank you for pointing out the hotel's ambiance as well. We do find that our guests are very enchanted by our lush courtyard and European-inspired boutique decor, which can be seen in many of the Ayres Hotels of Southern California. Thank you again for your review. We look forward to your next visit.   Warm regards,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I had no hot water in my room and there beneath the bathroom vanity was filthy.  I stayed one night and checked out.  The place has an odd set up too where I had to walk across the parking lot from the building where I checked in to the building where my room was located.  And while there was coffee in the "main building" where the lobby was, there wasn't any available in my building until the breakfast buffet started so again I had to walk across the parking lot.  The staff was ok.  The service in the restaurant was slow even though it was almost empty.
Manager Response: Dear Angela -  Thank you for taking the time to share your comments on TripAdvisor. I am truly sorry that you found your stay with us anything less than remarkable.   The hotel does encompass two separate buildings, one being our suites building and the other the hotel building. The suites building was built the most recently and contains our luxurious Junior Suites and One Bedroom Suites. We find our guests are often the most comfortable in a more current building containing a lovely living room style lobby with fireplace and the many works of art and European-inspired decor the Ayres family so lovingly selected for our hotel. I do apologize, however, if this created any sort of inconvenience and will review your comments regarding the availability of coffee with the team at the hotel.   As to the water and cleanliness issues, we are always more than happy to accommodate our guests by moving them to a more suitable room if we are alerted to any problem. Unfortunately we were not informed of these issues and were not able to address them and for this I sincerely apologize as we definitely want our guests to be as comfortable as possible when visiting us. Please know your comments have been shared with our maintenance and housekeeping teams to ensure against this in the future.   We thank you again for your review and hope you will consider staying with us in the future.   Sincerely,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We were in Newport for a wedding and a lot of the guests stayed at this hotel.  It was a great experience - rooms were comfortable, service was great and the complimentary breakfast was awesome!  Planes do fly over this hotel - it's close to the airport - but the only time we found that disturbing was when we were in the courtyard outside.  It was not constant, so not a big problem. We didn't notice it in the room at all.
Manager Response: Dear Linda -  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you during such a special event. Being a hotel that hosts weddings ourselves, we know that a wedding is such a wonderful occasion and it is important for the family and friends of the bride & groom to be afforded a comfortable hotel stay during such a celebratory time. It is fantastic that the accommodations and amenities provided made your stay so satisfactory. Hopefully based on this visit you will do us the honor of visiting us again in the near future. Your recommendation is much appreciated.   Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Every stay here is wonderful. The lobby is warm and inviting, the rooms are great and the service is first class! Of the Ayres I've visited, Costa Mesa is by far my favorite! Breakfast is also very good. This isn't your Continental Breakfast by any means. It's real food, and all you can eat. Stop by for lunch in the courtyard if you're ever in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Michael -  It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest once again. Thank you very much for taking the time to review our hotel and for your continued patronage. What a treat to know that we are your favorite out of twenty hotels! We really do take the guest experience very seriously so I am pleased we are able to make your stays with us so consistently comfortable. I will be sure to share your comments with the team at Le Chateau as they work very hard to ensure our guests leave the restaurant fully satisfied. We appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Had a great night at the Ayres.  Stood here with my husband and two children (ages 2 and 6).  Beds really comfortable.  Rooms nice size and clean.  This was our last night of our 5-night California trip and it's unfortunate that we didn't stay here longer.  It was raining on the day we checked-in.  We were able to check-in early and got a room.  The woman at the front desk was very friendly, and even recommended a couple of indoor activities to enjoy since it was raining.  The breakfast buffet the next day before we checked out was great.  Had everything for every eater......eggs, bacon, potatoes, fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, etc......  Would definitely return and stay longer!
Manager Response: Dear Geaniebaby -  Thank you for choosing our hotel and for taking the time to share your experience. We truly value our guests and attempt to show this in the offered accommodations, amenities and service, so it is fantastic to know that we were able to do so in your case. Thank you as well for pointing out our many breakfast offerings as we find guests are generally very pleased with our complimentary full American breakfast.  Perhaps next time you will have the chance to stay more than one night and experience a little more California sunshine. We look forward to your next visit.   Warm regards,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This was the 2nd time I have stayed at the Ayres in Costa Mesa and both times have been awesome!  The rooms are very clean nicely decorated.  The service by the staff was impeccible and the breakfast was very tasty!  I would highly recommend Ayres!
Manager Response: Dear Jacygem -  We appreciate you choosing Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa once again. I am so pleased to hear that you find our accommodations and amenities so consistently exceptional. We truly strive to provide the best possible experience to our guests through hospitable service and inviting hotel offerings, so it is wonderful to know we have met this goal once again. Thank you for your recommendation and we look forward to your return.  Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: A beautiful,quiet room,and,friendly and helpful staff.The food was great,and the ambience was relaxing.Being in town for a family wedding,the atmosphere of the hotel lent itself to being a wonderful setting for a reunion of sorts.A definite cornerstone of a tremendous,unforgettable weekend.
Manager Response: Dear Michael -  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa for your stay. We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. What a treat to know that the comfortable accommodations and helpful service lent themselves to such an unforgettable weekend. Perhaps on your next visit you will have the chance to dine at our award winning restaurant, Le Chateau. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to your next visit.   Many thanks,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Overall a great place to stay while in the Costa Mesa/Newport Beach area. I would recommend this facility to anyone in the area. Warm frinedly atmosphere, helpful staff, great food.
Manager Response: Dear Don -  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers. It is wonderful to hear that the atmosphere, service, and cuisine lent themselves to an exceptional stay. Perhaps on your next stay you will have the chance to visit the many shopping and entertainment destinations near the hotel, such as Fashion Island, South Coast Plaza, and the Irvine Spectrum. We look forward to your return.  Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Lovely room, great bed, quiet and comfy! Decorating was "over the top!"   We stayed in the multi-story building next to the building where the front desk is located and the door was 8 steps down a flight of stairs; the other entrance was blocked off, for some reason - so be careful if you have walking "issues."  We'd stay there again!

We stayed for two nights at the Ayres in Costa Mesa. The staff at the front desk was very friendly during our check in, especially Cassie who helped us check out at the end of our trip and make another reservation for July. The room was really nice and clean and had the most comfortable bed. They had great breakfast, something for everyone. The breakfast staff was great especially Juan and Jesus. The staff were dressed very formal as if you were in a fancy restaurant. The hotel's garden was beautiful with lots of flowers and a fountain. We'd definitely come back here again and I'd recommend it to everyone.
Manager Response: Dear LasVegas739 -  We appreciate you choosing Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa for your stay. What a treat to know that everything from the cleanliness to the service exceeded your expectations. Our ultimate goal is guest satisfaction and, hopefully, guest recommendation, so I appreciate you sharing your experience on TripAdvisor. I am privileged to work with a phenomenal team of people who truly take the guest experience seriously, so I will be sure to pass along your comments to all of the team members you mentioned as we would not be able to provide such exceptional service without them. We hope to welcome you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Everithing was perfect, and then it happened : "The Marriage"
Summary: Nice Lobby, almost luxurios, very kind people in the frontdesk. The room was so nice, window facing the beautifull pool patio. That fryday night was a quiet one.In the next morning good breakfast deserved the title of All-american. We spent the day walking in Newport Beach and came back very tired. I wished a good night of sleep to move on to San Diego the next day, but as soon as we arrived I noticed the chage in the scenario by the pool. They were going to have a marriage party and we couldnt close the eyes until ten past midnight !
Manager Response: Dear BillfrmBrazil -  Thank you for your very kind review and for choosing Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa for your visit.  While I am pleased that your enjoyed the accommodations, breakfast offerings, and location, I apologize for any inconvenience that may have been caused by the wedding the hotel was hosting.  Our Front Desk team tries exceedingly hard to inform guests if a celebratory event is taking place at the hotel during their stay and are always happy to switch accommodations to a room further from the event if the guest so desires and an alternate room is available. We also place strict time limits on events at the hotel as we know a good night's sleep is of the utmost importance to our guests. I am sorry if this event was not communicated to you more clearly and will be sure to review your comments with the Front Desk team to ensure our future guests will have full access to all of their options. We do appreciate your review and hope you will allow us to welcome you again in the future.   Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Good Location to Accessing Other South OC Locations
Summary: Our family likes to visit the OC area and this was the first time we stayed at this hotel. While the hotel is located within the John Wayne Airport accent flight path, we hardly could hear the noise due to the triple-payne glass used for windows. The hotel was located in a central location making access to tourist spots very easy (Irvine Spectrum, South Coast Plaza shopping mall, Fashion Island shopping mall, Hunnington Beach boardwalk, etc.). The weather was great during the three days we were there. We also obtained a very good rate for the two rooms we used. A good value and nice hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Mark -  I am thrilled we were able to welcome you for your first experience with the Ayres Hotels of Southern California. Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to extend to you our exceptional service and show you that a stay at an Ayres Hotel can be convenient and comfortable. As stated in your review, Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa is central to many Southern California attractions and I am pleased that our location gave you the chance to visit the variety of shopping and entertainment venues in the Orange County area. We appreciate your review and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: After living in the OC for 30 years we made a move to Fresno to be close to grandchildren.  Yet we still have reason to come back to OC for a weekend or several days.  We always make our reservations at Costa Mesa Ayres Hotel and Suites.  Wonderful customer care - great rooms - fantastic breakfast !  What more could you ask for?
Manager Response: Dear Breezyblnd -  It is always a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you for your continued patronage and for your very kind review. Nothing makes the team at the hotel prouder than to know they have created the most consistently comfortable hotel experience for all of our guests, including our returning guests. We appreciate you choosing us time and again and look forward to your next visit to Orange County.  Many thanks,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Hotel is good but service  at the breakfast buffet is rude
Summary: we ( around 10 families) booked this hotel . Hotel is good and rooms are neat. we liked the  decor . The breakfast buffet was free. me and my friends family went to breakfast buffet. we asked the waiter for warm milk for kids. we asked 2 cups each. weather was cold outside and milk provided in buffet was cold. Since microwave is in 2 floor , it is difficult to go and warm each cup of milk and come back for eating. This particular waiter after bring the 3 cup of milk said " it is too much work to warm the milk " and it would be extra charge. He was  totally rude and rediculous. we did not argue with him at all.  Next morning I went for breakfast that same waiter was staring angrily at us. I did not ask him for anything ?, He was  serving coffee to others , but did not ask us  for
Manager Response: Dear FamilyMom A -  We appreciate your candid review of Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa. While I am pleased you found the cleanliness and decor of the hotel satisfactory, I apologize for any inconvenience that may have been caused during our breakfast hours.   We understand that each of our guests will have different dietary wishes during breakfast and are always happy to accommodate guest requests when possible. In this particular instance, during a very crowded breakfast, we did offer to bring a large pitcher of warm milk for the 10+ in this single party for a nominal fee in order to increase efficiency of our breakfast service and ensure all of our guests were given the best possible breakfast experience. I apologize if this information was not relayed more accurately.    Please know that we take guest comments very seriously, and I have already shared these comments with the breakfast team to ensure our guests are as comfortable and accommodated as possible during breakfast. Again, thank you for your review and we hope to welcome you again in the future.  Warm regards,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We've stayed here several times over the last few years and always been pleased. We care most about cleanliness and comfort, and this hotel provides plenty of both. The decor is traditional/nautical. Staff are always polite, the free breakfast is tasty and a great value, and there's really just nothing to complain about. Good choice!
Manager Response: Dear Andy -  Thank you very much for your kind review and for your continued patronage. It is wonderful to know that we are able to provide you with exceptional service and accommodations on each of your visits. I am pleased that you find the decor inviting, the complimentary full American breakfast tasty, and cleanliness up to the impeccable Ayres Hotels standard. We appreciate being your choice of hotel in Orange County and look forward to your next visit.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I lived at the Ayres for nearly two months and experienced nothing but first rate service.  The entire staff was polite, courteous, and professional.  And the beds...I can't lie, sometimes I'll stay there just to sleep in one of their beds.
Manager Response: Dear Mark -  It was a pleasure welcoming you for such an extended period of time. We appreciate you allowing us the opportunity to provide the the best possible hotel experience. I am so pleased that you found the service and accommodations consistently welcoming and comfortable. We hope to welcome you again very soon, even if only to sleep on one of our Ayres Dream Sleeper mattresses.   Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Stay here when in the Costa Mesa-Newport Beach area
Summary: I stayed here in mid-March 2012 for two nights when I had some business matters in the Costa Mesa. I selected the Ayres Hotel & Suties in Costa Mesa on the basis of what I saw on the Internet, these reviews, and because the price seemed affordable especially when it included breakfast. I booked a Deluxe Room and checked in about 15 minutes before check-in time. I was immediately upgraded to a Jr. Executive Suite ... without asking. My room was on the second floor of the Suites Building, with an east-facing view of the airport. The room was clean, well appointed, comfortable, and, simply put, lovely to be in. Some reviews complained about airport noise, so I was waiting for it to materialize: It turned out this was a complete non-factor. Basically, what did the trick for masking
Manager Response: Dear Brent -  Thank you very much for your enthusiastic review of Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa and for choosing our hotel for your stay. We know you have a range of choices in the Costa Mesa area so it is wonderful to know that you chose us. I am pleased that your welcome was so warm and your accommodations so comfortable. The guest experience is of the utmost importance to us so it is always a pleasure to hear that we have made a guest's stay thoroughly enjoyable. Thank you again for taking to time share your comments on TripAdvisor. We hope to welcome you again very soon.  Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I stayed one night at Ayres Hotel in March 2012.  This is an independent hotel with two main buildings.  Check-in was quick, efficient and friendly.  My room was located in the second building on the second floor in a quiet location.  The large room was somewhat traditionally decorated and included a couch, several chairs and free wireless.  During my stay at the hotel, I never heard any noise in the hallway or outside my window.    Overall, the room was very comfortable if not exactly cozy.  The bed was firm and of good quality.  I didn't have to push 67 pillows out of the way to pull back the covers, which was much appreciated.  The only thing I didn't like about the room was the wall mounted ventilation unit.  This one was not as noisy as some I have experienced, but it did
Manager Response: Dear Ted_Fez -  Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your stay and for your very thorough review. It means a great deal that we were able to provide you with the amenities, service and accommodations that made your experience as comfortable as possible. There is no higher honor for a hotel than a guest recommendation so I am beyond thrilled that we were able to make such a positive impression on you. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Ayres Hotel & Suites for three nights at $129 per night.  Since the price is so good, I don't really have many complaints, although I wouldn't be happy if we were paying more than that.  The layout is much like an Embassy Suites (for the suites, not the individual rooms), although not nearly as nice.  We weren't able to check in early, and the room wasn't even available until 30 minutes past check-in time, which is really not acceptable.  When we finally did check in, there was an industrial sized fan blowing on the carpet, which was soaking wet.  Apparently the previous guest had spilled something on the carpet.  I had to call the desk to remove the fan, and the carpet was wet all weekend.  But we couldn't even hear the TV or ourselves talk over the noise of
We stayed one night (4 of us) and the stay was very plesant.  Nothing to complain about.  Clean room, great breakfast and good front desk service.
Manager Response: Dear Plassey60 -  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your stay and for sharing your experience on TripAdvisor. Our ultimate goal is to provide our guests with an exceptional and flawless hotel experience, so it is wonderful to read that we were able to meet this very high standard. Perhaps on your next visit you will have the opportunity to dine at the award winning Le Chateau, our on site restaurant. We hope to welcome you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: First time to stay at an Ayres hotel...it was wonderful...the hotel had the look of a European facility, with many portraits and wall hangings from the Renaissance and other periods. Glass cases exhibiting sailing ships embellished the ambiance. A fire-place with a delightful fire was a great setting to drink Boodles (gin) and Tonic and relax after a busy work day. The suite was large, comfortable and inviting. The large bathtub had six jets that all worked perfectly, providing and excellent massage. The radio was in perfect working order and the tones of symphony was great. The staff was friendly, the free breakrast was grand, and my overall experience was excellent. I shall gladly return. No. 1 in my experience.
Manager Response: Dear MrGentleIrvine -  Thank you for your very kind review and for choosing our hotel for your stay. I am thrilled that we left such a positive impression on your first visit to an Ayres Hotel. It is fantastic to hear that each of the amenities and accommodations offered provided you with such a comfortable and convenient hotel experience. Hopefully we have turned you on to the Ayres chain and will see you back very soon. Thank you again.  Warm regards,   Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: I was here on a business trip and it was a great location.  Close to the beaches and attractions around Orange County.  Although in the immediate area there isn't anything to walk to.  Need a car.  The planes are a nuisance however I was gone most of the day and it didn't bother me.  It's not like the planes are taking off every couple of minutes.  They are spread out.  The breakfast and amenities are great although did not see the work out room.  Why work out in a room when you can go down and run at the beach?  Very nice hotel and good value for a business trip.  Not sure I'd book it for a vacation though.
Manager Response: Dear Rowlett9105 -  Thank you for your candid and kind review of our hotel. It was wonderful to welcome you as our guest, and I appreciate you taking the time to let others know about the hotel. As stated, we are centrally located to many Orange County attractions, but we do also offer shuttle service to anywhere within a 5 mile radius of the hotel, which makes for easy travel to nearby business, restaurants, and shops such as South Coast Plaza. I am pleased that the breakfast and accommodations were to your liking and hope on your next visit you will have the opportunity to check out our fitness room, which is located in our suites building. We hope to welcome you back soon.   Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We had an amazing stay at this hotel! The rooms are incredibly clean, the staff is helpful and the property is beautiful. The price was fantastic for what we got. The restaurant was compatible to the nicer ones in Irvine and was delicious. The only odd thing is that there is a piano that is only for show which is bizarre. The airport is close by but the planes do not fly during the night.
Manager Response: Dear Sunshine908 -  It was a pleasure having you as a guest of our hotel. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers. It is wonderful to hear that you found the dining at Le Chateau as well as the cleanliness and accommodations so agreeable. We hope to welcome you back in the near future.   Warm regards,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Consistently excellent. Clear attention to detail. Hampton on steroids isn't quite enough of a compliment; the feel to this hotel is wonderfully better in every respect of the stay (and I really like the Hampton experience and value). This is a family run business and it shows.
Manager Response: Dear Junnah -  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel. I am so glad that we are able to consistently provide comfortable accommodations and service for you. The Ayres family cares deeply for each of our hotels and the overall guest experience, so I will be sure to share your kind comment with them as well. We hope to have you back very soon.  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Ayres Hotel was offered as a choice hotel for our trip to CalJam,  the world's greatest chiropractic event of the year.  We found the hotel to be very nice, clean, and reasonable.  Originally we thought it to be within walking distance of the seminar venue, however upon arriving it was not.  No problem.  The hotel offered a shuttle for us back and forth, pretty much at our request.  The pool area was not in operation during our stay but we were offered the pool next door.  Very accommodating.  Close to the airport.  Complimentary breakfast, WiFi and Parking.  All in all a great place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear KlassyK -  Thank you so much for choosing Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa for your accommodations during this event. I am pleased to hear that the complimentary shuttle service offered within a 5 mile radius of the hotel made for a more convenient stay. I do apologize that one of our pools was out of service during your stay and am happy to report that it is now accessible to all guests. Again, we appreciate you choosing our hotel for your stay and look forward to your return.  Warm regards,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: This hotel was a total surprise and joy. From check in to check out, the experience was very positive. The rooms are large and very comfortable. Great Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. Free breakfast. Free WiFi. Free Shuttle service.
Manager Response: Dear Floydntexas -  It was such a pleasure having you as a guest of our hotel. Thank you for taking the time to inform fellow travelers about Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa and for your positive comments. We are thrilled that the service and amenities, including the complimentary airport shuttle, made for a comfortable and satisfying stay. Perhaps on your next visit you will have a chance to try a dish at our on site restaurant, Le Chateau.  We hope to see you again soon.  Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: We discovered Ayres/Costa Mesa on our last trip to Orange County and we are back for a second time.  And the quality of the hotel especially the comfort of the rooms is superb.  It is also great value since it includes a really good breakfast. One is near the John Wayne airport and there is some airplane noise if you are outside but this noise was not as noticeable in our bedroom.
Manager Response: Dear Bezile -  We appreciate your kind review of Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa. I am so pleased that your second stay with us was a comfortable one and that the amenities, including the complimentary breakfast, made for an exceptional visit. It is always wonderful to host a guest on more than one occasion as it gives us the opportunity to get to know our guests that much better. We look forward to your third visit.  Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Such a quaint hotel.  They make you feel more like a guest in their home than any old night at a hotel.  Highly recommend this cozy, beautiful and unique establishment.  The entire staff seemed to really enjoy their job, all were pleasant and helpful.  You will not be disappointed if you choose to stay here.
Manager Response: Dear Virginia G -  Thank you so much for taking the time to let other travelers know about our hotel. Your kind words regarding our team here at the hotel are greatly appreciated, as are comments about the hotel itself. I am lucky enough to work with an exceptional group of people who take pride in their work and desire nothing but the best for our guests. I will be sure to share your comments with the them so they know their hard work is appreciated. Thank you also for bringing our Jacuzzi tubs to the attention of your fellow travelers as well. We are always happy to accommodate guests in these rooms when available. Again thank you for your review. Hopefully you will return soon.  Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary Heading: Stay in Southern California, you should be staying here!!!
Summary: I travel monthly to Southern California and cover both the Redland/Riverside and the Costa Mesa/Irvine areas. A friend recommended that I try staying at Ayres Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa, because he had a great stay and enjoyed both the beds and friendly staff. After enjoying my first stay, with the most comfortable beds, as well as the ever helpful and friendly staff, I looked to find that this family owned hotel has 19 other locations throughout Southern California. I have enjoyed breakfast, lunch and dinner at the Le Chateau Garden Bistro and I can say that the chefs all serve great menu choices and delicious food. I now schedule all of my staff to stay at the Ayres Hotels, because they will get a restful sleep and enjoy a great breakfast buffet that is included in the
Manager Response: Dear Duane -  Thank you so very much for your wonderful endorsement of our hotel and the entire Ayres Hotels chain. It means a great deal that you have taken the time to share information about our hotel with fellow travelers and that you found your stay with us so remarkable. I am so pleased that every aspect of the hotel was to your liking, including our award winning on-site restaurant, Le Chateau. We look forward to hosting your next stay.  Safe travels,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for 6 weeks off and on for training at my new job and this is the hotel they prefer to use.  This hotel made up for the fact that many nights per week over a 6 week period that I wasn't at home in my own bed.  The rooms are updated with very comfortable beds and you get a nice flat screen TV with all the channels you need.  The bathrooms are spacious and all the rooms I stayed in had a small bar area.  There is a small gym on site that helps keep you active and the restaurant is pretty good if you don't want to drive to another location.  Staff is super friendly as well so all in all it's a good stay.  I would say the only things they need to work on are the condition of their computers for guests to use as they are pretty outdated-could barely log into gmail!  And
Manager Response: Dear Penny -  Thank you so much for your kind review of the hotel. It was an honor to host you for such a long period and it is wonderful to hear that the accommodations, amenities, and services made for a satisfactory stay. Your suggestion regarding the computers is much appreciated as well. Please know that we are currently in the process of revamping our business center and should have the most current equipment and software very soon. Please also note that we do have microwaves available in all of the rooms in our suites building. Perhaps on your next stay we can ensure you room in this building. Again, thank you so very much for your review. We hope to welcome you again soon.  Regards,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: Spent a couple nights here prior to heading to San Diego for a golf tournament.  Had researched the hotels in the area and decided could not pass up the opportunity to try this establishment out.  The hotel is so picturesque - quaint and cosy.  The rooms were large and bright and the bed was very comfortable.  Spent a few hours in the restaurant in the late evening for a few drinks and certainly enjoyed the hot breakfast.  Really enjoyed our stay and will certainly be back again next time I am in the area.

Summary Heading: Money well spent for a comfortable, clean, restful home away from home
Summary: Let me be clear about the Ayres: it is not cheap, but you do get tremendous quality and value for your stay here. To start, the front desk will generally call you moments after checking in to ensure your room has met your expectations. They bake some of the best tasting cookies I've had which are both complimentary and welcoming. The gym could use an upgrade but hey, it's southern California! -just head down to Newport Beach a few miles away for some pacific breeze and a great workout experience! The breakfast is really one if the best complimentary ones I've had - always fresh, filling, and excellent service to start your day. It can get crowded but I have never had difficulty finding a seat. In summary, the Ayres is one of Costa Mesa's best kept secrets. It is not as well
The rooms are large, clean, and comfortable.  Breakfast is included (buffet, good quality).  Close to great shopping and food.  For the money, a real winner!
Manager Response: Dear Marjen -  Thank you so much for your review of Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa. It was wonderful to hear that your stay was satisfactory and that the amenities were as desired. I work with a wonderful team who strives exceedingly hard to make our guests comfortable so it is always fantastic to hear such positive feedback. Thank you again for your review and we look forward to your return.  Warm regards,  Susan O'Brien-Moore General Manager

Summary: My regular stay in OC.  Probably 400 nights over 15 years.  Great hotel and staff.  Consistently great service.  Convenient.  Spotless.
Manager Response: Dear Carlsonce -  Thank you so much for your kind review of out hotel as well as your continued patronage. What a treat to know that we are your choice of hotel so frequently and that we provide you with the service and amenities that make your stay comfortable and satisfying. I will be sure to share your comments with the team here at the hotel as well.   We look forward to welcoming you again!  Sincerely,  Susan O'Brien - Moore General Manager

Summary: We stayed here in Jan. for a wedding and family trip to Disneyland. The location was perfect. Easy access to freeways and close to activities. The free breakfast was very good. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are large and quite comfortable. It can be a little noisy due to proximity to the airport, but we didn't have any trouble sleeping. Nice grounds too. Plenty of free parking. We would stay here again.

Summary Heading: You feel pampered at this hotel!
Summary: The most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, the most courteous staff and great atmosphere...this is no cookie-cutter hotel.  I have stayed here multiple times now and find the service and accomodations impeccable and the prices very reasonable for the level & quality.   You are close to the airport...a plus...but you do hear the air traffic when you sit outside in the courtyard.  I have never noticed it much in the rooms.

I just returned from my 11th annual stay at the Ayers Hotel and Suites Costa Mesa-Newport Beach and was not disapointed. The decor, the clean rooms, and the freindly service all add up to the most pleasent hotel experiece I have all year. If that weren't enough, the free breakfast is second to none with a full-featured buffet and it's location near the airport and beach are ultra-convenient.  I recommend staying here anytime you're in Orange County.

Summary Heading: Strongly Recommend Ayres Costa Mesa - Newport Beach
Summary: I reserved concurrently 2 rooms for 3 nights and an additional room for 2 nights to coincide with a family event in Anaheim.  The staff was friendly, professional, courteous and efficient.  I made a mistake on my reservation and they were very responsive and offered to remedy my error with no charge to me.  The hotel property is beautiful, tastefully decorated, comfortable and well maintained.  The Chateau restaurant has a lovely ambiance and the food and staff are excellent.  The morning complimentary full breakfast is plentiful and of excellent quality and value.  I have no hesitation to recommend the Ayres Costa Mesa - Newport Beach hotel.

Summary Heading: Best bang for the buck in the Newport Beach area
Summary: I stay at the Ayers Hotel in Costa Mesa several times a year when traveling south from Santa Barbara.  The hotel staff is always prompt, friendly and courteous.  Rooms are always very comfortable and well appointed.  I'm usually not there for the "happy hour" but the breakfast, which is included, is an excellent hot breakfast.  I don't recall getting treated any better at the Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons.

Summary Heading: Stay here for the best experience; don't waste your money/time!
Summary: I give this a five star for great service, breakfast, cleanliness and price! We have stayed at other hotels in the area at over TWICE the price with no breakfast and a parking fee (usually valet with their hand out!)and internet charge. The hotel is convenient to the SNA airport. Check out the packages for an awesome deal! The breakfast is a FULL buffet with hot and fresh items. The rooms are beautifully decorated. You will not be dissappointed! fast, friendly check in...they go out of their way for you.

Summary Heading: Reminiscent of an Italian villa with USA amenities
Summary: Annually, I visit Santa Ana for business and I stay at the Ayres.  I am greeted by the friendly front desk staff and warmly welcomed by the restaurant staff.  The rooms are large and have a great desk set-up for working in the room.  There is a small refrigerator and wet bar sink as well as the standard coffee maker.    The on-site restaurant is truly wonderful.  The prices are responsible and the food is delicious.  My favorite dinner is ahi tuna on a bed of greens or the sea scallops.  The bar area has a "happy hour" where you can eat lightly with a 4 cheese and fruit platter or angus sliders (this is not the complete menu) to accompany your favorite beverage.  In the morning, the restaurant is the location for the complimentary breakfast.  This is a deluxe breakfast buffet

My wife and I needed to be in Newport Beach for an early meeting and my usual hotel was booked. When I arrived, I was warmly greeted by Elizabeth at the front counter. Check-in was quick and smooth. We were in the room about 5 minutes when Elizabeth called to make sure the room was satisfactory.The room was large and comfortable. The bed however, was too soft. I should have tried for a suite upgrade as they have a higher quality bed. Not a good hotel for a day sleeper as the airplane noise is a bit load. Luckily there is a curfew at the airport (I think it is 10:00PM to 7:00AM) so you don't have the noise at night. The wall are a bit thin, so yo do tend to hear more than you care to. There is a evening happy hour in the bar with reduced drink prices, not free as in many other

I like their breakfast and the staff in the breakfast area. Lots of parking and upgraded rooms are nice. The new building is nice for picture taking. A mall is only about 2 miles or so from her and not too far from Anaheim.  The only thing I don't like at this hotel (Compared to Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt where I usually stay) is that the front desk staff do not look up and greet customers when you are leaving or entering the hotel. I brought this to the attention of our Liaison for this hotel and they still do the same. I don't like it as I am usually greeted in other hotels. The only reason I am still in this hotel is because my client likes this hotel.

Summary Heading: Love this Hotel will be my go to in Costa Mesa
Summary: What a great Hotel and for what you get a real bargain. The room was nice and very clean the public areas were actually somewhere you might want to hang out and have a drink or enjoy the fireplace the staff were all attentive and the free breakfast was a notch up on the Continental at most chains. Thank you for a nice stay!

Summary Heading: Staff was helpful rooms were great.
Summary: Elizabeth at the front desk was helpful throughout our entire stay.

Beautiful property with nice, european-style atmosphere.  Very convenient to airport.  Although it is near a busy road, I didn't hear any traffic noise at night (I was in a room farthest from the road).  Slept very well, even though I usually don't when away from home.

Airport hotel early 20th century period large rooms in separated buildings.  Outside entrances can cause security concerns to women traveling alone.  Outdoor pools, good restaurant, laundry, free breakfast, airport shuttle. Negatives - Meeting rooms are limited by low ceilings and staff seems cavalier to needs. Overall we were disappointed with the meeting experience.

Loved the charming rooms, cute restaurant, great pool. Best of all was the wonderful staff. Every employee from the front desk to the painter said an enthusiastic "Good morning!" I was here with a large, high maintenence  group and they met all of our expectations. Requests like Towels, pillows, wine, pool views, too cold, too hot, all met with a sincere smile. Come for the comfort, come back because the fantastic staff.

I recently stayed her for a wedding in November. Being in the customer service industry I always pay attention to customer service and the staff was friendly and very efficient from the time I walked in. I was taken by surprise because when I placed my reservation over the phone a few months prior the young lady taking the reservation seemed a little rude.  I honestly was not expecting much from the staff. The gentleman at the front desk called me by name asked me about my flight which I thought was very kind and thoughtful. He made up for the telephone operator.   The rooms were spacious, nice and clean. The only issue I had was the breakfast and it had nothing to do with the hotel. I am from the south so having oatmeal on the buffet and not grits was a little strange for my
I love the Ayers Hotels, I stay at an Ayers hotel when ever I can.  Great staff, very very clean hotel.  Great Value for the money.
Delightful hotel in Orange County - my favorite place to stay.  The staff is so friendly and professional, the decor is European old charm and the restaurant is so delicious!!

Summary Heading: Our Stay at the Ayres Hotel
Summary: I had previously stayed at an Ayres Hotel in Orange County and really enjoyed my stay.  So when my son was getting married in December at the Newport Dunes, I recommend to family members from out of town to stay at the Ayres Hotel and Suites in Costs Mesa.  The hotel is right off the 405 and 55 freeways. It was very easy to get to the Newport Dunes (only about 3 miles away) and you pass the Fashion Island Center Mall to get to the Dunes! We priced other hotels, all-in-all others could not compare with this hotel. This hotel has both rooms and suites. We stayed in one of the suites, very spacious and clean!!  The king size bed was very comfortable!  Parking is FREE and complimentary full breakfast is included!!  We had a total of 7 rooms - 2 suites and 5 rooms with the majority

We've been coming here for almost 20 years.  Each trip is a delight.  The rooms are comfortable and clean, the breakfast is wonderful, and dinner at the restaurant is truly an experience.   We enjoy the fireplace in the suites building as well as the pool - perfect for an afternoon of reading and relaxing.
I think for the cost the room was very nice.  Staff was helpful.
Great hotel.  I will definitely go back.  It was lovely and impeccably clean.  Staff was friendly and accommodating.

Loved our 5 night family stay with adjoining rooms; the restaurant was a great perk, both the free breakfast and happy hour.  The dining experience at dinner rivals fine restaurants in the area.  The service throughout the hotel was friendly and excellent.  We will be staying again!
Charming hotel with reasonable price, free full breakfast, free Wi Fi and free parking.  Great location half way between SO Coast Plaza and Fashion Island
Loved this hotel clean upscale feeling. Close to beaches and major shopping. Free hot breakfast was awesome. Front staff was porfessional and friendly. Would stay here again for sure

A one night stay at the Ayres was a pleasant surprise.  When we arrived, we were offered a upgraded room.  The Ayres has a slight European ambiance to it, staff were friendly, the room was clean, and bed was comfortable.  However, the walls must be pretty thin as we clearly heard someone next door turn on their shower at 6:00 am.  The complimentary breakfast was generous in its variety and set in its own dining room.

I stayed here for 3 nights to do some Xmas shopping and truly enjoyed the room which  was a bedroom and kitchen living room area and the free breakfast that was included with the room.  All enjoyed the free shuttle pick up to/from the John Wayne Airport and they take you anywhere within a 5 mile radius which was wonderful for Xmas shopping.  I was taken to Ikea, Balboa Island, South Coast Plaza and other surrounding areas.  Superb hotel, will book this hotel for future stays.

I stayed here while I was at a conference, so didn't use most of the facilities, like the shuttle or the pool. But the staff were lovely, the breakfast was (as other people have said) really good, and the wifi was fast. The decor wasn't really to my taste, but when it's this good value, I'm not complaining about small things like that, because overall it was a great place to stay for a few nights.

Summary Heading: European winner with a great breakfast
Summary: I stayed here 2 nights for a wedding-the hotel has a very personal boutique feel-There are 2 separate wings with 2 lobbies. The way I booked my room meant I stayed in each wing. Both rooms were very nice.The second lobby was great for meeting our party in front of the fireplace-As mentioned by previous guests, the breakfast is excellent plus the room is not your regular boring vanilla area-it's all beamed ceilings and tons of wood-Would not hesitate to book this property again--

The Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa offers the best breakfast (free) than any other hotel.  The staff is courteous and assists with coffee or any specialties that you might want.  No other hotel does this without a fee.  Best ever!!

Always accommodating, easy shuttle to and from airport to hotel.  The breakfast is awesome, buffet style eggs, potatoes with peppers, bacon, either french toast or pancakes, oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogart, cereal and juices--or you can order off the menu.  The gift shop is adorable. The only complaint I have is that the gym is very small.  About a mile away are some trails that you can jog if you like.  Hotel staff is very helpful.

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel is my home away from home!!
Summary: The beds and pillows are very comfortable.  You can sit in the lobby in front of the fireplace and chat with friends or sit in the courtyard and listen to the water cascading in the fountain.  The flowers are always in bloom and fragrant.  Rooms conveniently have a microwave, sink, and coffee pot.  Most rooms have spa tubs to relax the weary traveler such as myself.  Breakfast is free and if you ever find yourself dining in, the chef is a marvel - the food is excellent.  I stay there so often that the hotel clerks know me by name.  With the holiday season upon us, the lobbies are very festive!   Like I said - it's my home away from home!
Nicely appointed hotel, beautiful courtyard, helpful staff, clean room, and great location. Would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Great location,excellent shuttle service, extremely helpful staff
Summary: They offered a shuttle service within a 5 mile radius and they were so great in getting us places.  The location was centralized enough that so many things were accessible with the use of the shuttle.   They offered free full breakfast- sit down style with servers.   It was a great place to stay- very accommodating!
