This is a very nice hotel. The room was pleasant and clean and the staff was very helpful to me. The breakfast buffet was great as well. If friends come into town, I would definitely recommend this place.

Summary Heading: Short stay at Ayers Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa, CA
Summary: We were really impressed with the facility.  It was first class all the way.  We were told there was a complamentary breakfast and expected a sort of continental style with rolls or buns, coffee and maybe cereal or something but we were pleasantly surprised with a buffet style that was better than any place we had ever stayed before.   Anytime that I am ever again in the Costa Mesa area, Ayers will be my first choice for lodging.   Thanks

I came for a conference. Wonderful accommodations. The room was clean, quiet and the bed very comfortable. The complementary breakfast, scrambled eggs, country potatoes as well as cereals and bread items were delicious and plentiful. Our meeting rooms were good and we were able to adjust the temperature to our comfort. I would come again for a personal stay.

We stayed at this hotel on a recent 4 day trip to Orange County. The property is amazing. Beautiful decor, courtyard garden, and 2 pools. Our room was clean, very comfortable, and beautifully finished. Parking at the hotel is provided free of charge as is the full breakfast buffet each morning. The food is excellent and is a great bonus to the already reasonable room rate. The hotel is located approximately 5 minutes from John Wayne Airport and about ten minutes from the 3rd largest shopping mall (South Coast Plaza) in the USA. Drive about 15 or 20 minutes from the hotel and you're in Newport at the beach.  If you're looking for a great stay in Orange County area, you will definitely not be disappointed. We will definitely stay here again.
Beautiful hotel. Very clean and staff was very friendly and personable. Would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel stay with the feel of home.
Summary: We stayed here for one week and were never disappointed by any aspect of the hotel.  The outstanding staff from front desk to housekeeping were all exceptional and friendly, never too busy to answer questions.  The free buffet breakfast is fabulous...not just muffins and pastries, so much more and delicious too.  We had dinner in the hotel's restaurant and the food was delicious and our server Luigi was terrific.  The beds and pillows were comfortable and plush.  The grounds were beautifully maintained.  The location close to the beaches as well as the airport makes this hotel ideal.  I will stay here each time I return to the area.  No complaints.
Stayed here for just one night while in town for a family event. Loved the jetted tub and fresh bed linens. Friendly and efficient staff at check-in. Good breakfast, too.
We have stayed here now a couple of times and just love it!  Nice grounds, fabulous breakfast buffet, lovely rooms, friendly staff.  Now, how can you beat that?  Looking forward to our next stay!

I've stayed here a few time and every stay was great. The hotel is really incredible!  Rooms, service, interior, pool breakfast, everything is very good. I like rooms interior, it is really cozy. Rooms and bathrooms are clean. One time I had a jacuzzi in bathroom. What a pleasure at the end of working day.The bed was very comfortable. One time I was living in Ayres for 5 weeks, and I really feelt like at home. The stuff is also very helpful.The only thing: it is very close to John Wayne airport, so there is a little bit noisy in the morning. I recommend Ayres for sure!

At the end of June every year we organize a team to participate in a fundraising walk in Newport Beach; we live 50+ miles away, so the only way I can get the family there at 8 in AM, is to bribe them with a hotel stay close-by.  This worked especially well this year with the Ayres Suites in CM; very reasonably priced, considering it's not that far from the beach (Bristol to Jamboree takes you to PCH).  I arrived early to check in, got a 2nd floor room well away from elevator and the lobby.  Room was very clean, had WiFi that worked the whole stay (sometimes I think we have something that generates server problems hidden in our luggage).  Beds were above average, and room was dark enough for sleeping in on Sunday.  Breakfast was above average for hotel free breakfast, with
I've stayed at the Ayres in Costa Mesa on numerous occasions. The staff and accommodations are incredible. The dining room is awesome for both breakfast and dinner. I love staying there!

Summary Heading: Great help in time of need
Summary: I ended up missing my flight at John Wayne and Ayres Hotel was one of the hotels recommended by Frontier Airlines.  They were very courteous and helpful in getting me a room at the last minute.  The rate was excellent, the room was great and the front desk was very helpful.  They also gave me a complimentary shuttle ride at 5am to the airport.  I will stay here again.

Our visit was for two nights and I was very pleased that we chose Ayers Hotel and Suites.  The staff from the front desk to the resturant on the premises were incredibly friendly and helpful with everything.  The room was very spacious and the bed was very comfortable.  I would have to say that would be my biggest issue with most hotels is the beds and a bad nights sleep over a cheap bad bed, Not at the Ayers hotel they have put the effort into giving their guest a good night sleep I appreciate that.  Great for Business guest.  The grounds are well kept and the resturant menu has a diverse choice of foods to choose from if you don't want to go far looking to eat.  The complimentry hot breakfast buffet completes the really nice touch the hotel puts to the guest experience.  I
Great friendly staff.  Excellent complimentary buffet.  Convenient free hotel shuttle within 5 mile radius.

Great hotel at a great rate.  Room is very nice and functional with a refrigerator and separate wet bar.  Very friendly staff.  Great food in the restaraunt.  Lobby and decor are classy with some really interesting pictures on the walls along with great ship models.

I stayed here for 2 nights for a class reunion. It was wonderful! The rooms are very very nice and super clean. The hotel is beautifully furnished with lots of couches and chairs and a wonderful patio area. I had lunch at the restaurant and the food was good and not too unreasonable for a hotel. There is an included hot breakfast buffet that is quite good and lots of choices...not your regular free type.  Only negative is the parking......I had to park quite far from the room and it was a hike to the entrance. But overall I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again

This is my 2nd stay at the Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa. Pros: Friendly staff, great rates, free full breakfast, free local van transportation (e.g. John Wayne Airport, Local Shopping Centers, etc), free DSL in rooms, free computer in lobby and Business Area, free parking, windows actually open for fresh air, comfortable beds, refrigerator, coffee maker […] & microwave in room, easy freeway access, onsite restaurant with great food and reasonable prices. NOTE: The hotel is near the airport, but the airport is closed from 11 pm to 7 am. Cons: None that I can think of.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel but location is pretty busy
Summary: This is a nice property with a beautiful open courtyard, nice bar and breakfast is upper scale buffet style. Rooms are clean and spacious with a Spanish feel to the whole place. The location is not far from the airport which keeps the place busy with pilots etc and planes are taking off just above you from John Wayne Airport. The fitness room wasn't bad could be updated a little otherwise a nice place to stay in Orange county.

Summary Heading: My place to stay on trips to Orange County
Summary: After having lived in Orange County for 30 years and then moving away when I came back for a visit with several things to do in the OC my choice of hotel was Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa.  I had met with their staff prior to moving, when still working, and they offered wonderful benefits for our travelers from across the country.  So when I had a need to visit I contacted the Sales staff and was provided with the same warm welcome on a personal level.  My husband and I will be back in Orange County in October for a number of appointments and we can once again be found at the Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa

Summary Heading: Great value, Great service and convenient location!
Summary: This place is conveniently located on the edges of Costa Mesa, Irvine and Newport Beach. It is very clean and comfortable. Parking and breakfast, which was pretty good, are included in the room rate - something that few other hotels in the area offer. The quality of the service is exemplified by the fact that the crib (porta-crib) we requested was in the room before we checked in. Those of you who travel with small children recognize that this is uncommon. We will happily stay here again.

Great rooms, very clean and comfortable.  The beds are wonderful, you feel like your on a cloud.  They have an excellent complimentary buffett breakfast.  They offer so many choices you stand there for a moment to take it all in.  You have your choice of scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon, fruit, french toast or pancakes, cold cereal, pastries and the most delicious hot oatmeal.  The staff in general are very friendly and courteous, but the breakfast group are amazing.   It's in a nice part of Orange County, close to freeways and about 20 minutes from some nice beaches.  We've stayed here many times over the past few years.  Lovely place to get away to.  We are looking forward to our next visit.

I stayed at the hotel for a friend's wedding anniversary party.  The hotel easily transferred the reserved room into my name and made the changes needed for the number of days that I was staying. The hotel has 2 separate buildings and it is looking a little aged but in very good repair.  The room had a musty smell that did not dissipate when we turned the AC on.  Luckily, we had an operable window so we just opened the window.  It is a bit odd that there are no screens on the window (or anything to keep someone from falling out!).    Our bed and linens were comfy and the shower was good.  It is a nice place to stay, nothing special but the staff is friendly.  I did not eat at the breakfast (did not really understand that it was included or I might have).  If you miss the hotel

Our room was very clean and comfortable. The shuttle service was very convenient.  Shuttle service was provided to the airport & the South Coast Mall.  We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay at this hotel again.

My daughter and I stayed at this hotel while we were vacationing in Ca. It is so nice and clean and we still talk about how comfortable the beds were. It was like sleeping in a cloud. This will be the place I stay on my return trip to Ca.

Ayres Hotel & Suites is conveniently located just minutes away from the Orange County/John Wayne Airport on Bristol Street offers the look and feel of a boutique French country inn surrounded by freeway, shopping and beach convenience. I've stayed here several times since it opened as Countryside Inns & Suites and it's still my preference over the nearby big-name chain hotels. There are large & suite rooms, 2 pools, fitness center, free internet, free parking, free airport shuttle and a restaurant/bar serving breakfast, lunch and dinner indoors and outside by the lovely central fountain. The staff is friendly, welcoming and you can linger for hours in the cobbled courtyard or elegant lobby. There's a beautiful life-size cloisonne sheep and tapestries in the lobby. I feel at home

I travel to Newport Beach frequently for business and pleasure.  When my house there is rented out, I usually stay at the Balboa Bay Club.  On my last trip, the Bay Club was unavailable and I found Ayres through Trip Advisor.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The decor was charming, clean and fresh.  There was internet, a sufficient workout facility and two pools.  Normally when breakfast is included, I don't bother (usually not worth it). Ayres breakfast was quite good.  You won't want to miss it.  The service was friendly and prompt..parking was plentiful.  I was even given a complimentary bottle of wine...how great is that!  If you are in Newport Beach for work or visiting friends and relatives and you don't mind not being on the water, Ayres is the place to stay.  It was

Summary Heading: This is great place to stay!
Summary: Located in a great location.  Many places to eat nearby.  The room was very spacious and clean.  The breakfast was terrific with plenty of seating.  We will difinitely stay there again and recommend Ayres to our family and friends.
Ayres makes a business or training trip a real pleasure. After a busy day it is essential to relax, unwind and rest to be ready for the next sessions. Ayres accomplishes this 100%.

Ok maybe this review wont be that  accurate but for the very short amount of time I had here it made a great impression.  Stayed here just for the night after a wedding and had to go to work next morning.  The beds were incredibly comfortable.  The rooms were immaculate.  I got a glimpse of thier pool which I wish i had time to use.  No noise issues and the price was good.  If i ever have a need to stay around the Newport or Costa Mesa area this would definitely be a place I'd come back to.

Summary Heading: Beautiful botique hotel with comfortable beds & friendly service.
Summary: This wonderful chateau style hotel and exceptional staff was a very pleasant experience.  Food and service was very good.  Relaxing in the traditional central courtyard was very quiet and pleasant; a great place to read or converse.  The rooms are tastefully decorated and the beds exceptionally comfortable.

Check-in was quick and efficient.  The room was very big and comfortable.  Bed was comfortable.  Restaurant was excellent!  We ate supper there nearly every day, and between my wife and I, we tried 9 or 10 different entrees...every one of them was excellent.  Breakfast buffet was wonderful every morning with many hot dishes to choose from along with cereal, yogurt, and lots of fruit and melons.  Check-out was a nice surprise when the staff found us a better discount rate than we had used when we made our reservation and brought our room rate down considerably.  Any time we go back to the Newport Beach / Costa Mesa area, we will certainly stay at the Ayres again.  This was not our usual 'economy' hotel, and it was worth every penny!

Summary Heading: Wonderful charm and excellent value: perfect for those who hate cookie- cutter  chain hotels"
Summary: The check-in staff were very helpful despite the late hour, the free shuttle service to local malls etc. was extremely convenient, and the free hot/cold buffet breakfast was tasty and excellent value.  The room was large, nicely appointed, and always cleaned well.  Two more startling compliments:  I am a poor sleeper and I found the Ayres special mattress unbelievably comfortable; also, I was skeptically expecting the promised "European " ambiance to be very artificial, but the decor in the public areas  from big to small aspects (antique furniture, sumptuous upholstery, gilded paintings and old candle sconces, etc. ) reminded me of stays in genuine converted old manor houses in Europe. Yes, the airport is nearby but we found it easy to tune out that noise, and we did not

Our second visit to the Ayres Hotel & Suites was as memorable as the first.  When you enter the lobby and subsequently your guest room you will think you've accidentally signed into the Four Seasons Hotel!  The staff are extremely warm, knowledgeable and helpful.  Both pools and spas are very nice.  The breakfast included in the basic room rate is heads and shoulders above any hot breakfast buffet I've ever experienced.  The food is delicious, the staff are excellent and you can either dine in or take your food outside to eat in a European style open courtyard around a lovely fountain.  Finally, the value you get for the cost of your stay in second to none.  I still cannot believe how little we paid for the experience we had this month.  Thank you Ayres!

My wife and I stayed her for one night for a friends' wedding weekend.  The location is not within walking distance to the beach, but if the beach is not part of your plans (like us, due to our short stay in SoCal) this is a wonderful hotel.  I called it a little "gem" because it is not what I was expecting.  It's an independent hotel (not a Hilton, Sheraton, etc.), has a very comfortable rooms, VERY comfortable beds, and a great morning complimentary breakfast.  The breakfast was the best complimentary breakfast we can remember: eggs, breakfast potatoes, bacon, fresh salsa, cheese, oatmeal, fresh fruit, pancakes, cereal, pastries/muffins, juices and coffee.  It's also located about 10 minutes from John Wayne airport and 30 minutes from Long Beach Airport (at 9:30 a.m. on a

Summary Heading: What a great place to stay!
Summary: I am so happy that we chose to spend two nights at the Ayres Hotel and Suites!  We own vacation properties with both Marriott and Westin so we usually stay with them but decided to try the Ayres after reading such good reviews on Tripadvisor.  The value at Ayres is excellent.  We did not need to rent a car for this portion of our vacation as a free shuttle to and from the airport was provided and they will also take you anywhere within a 5 mile radius.  The service was great too as the driver dropped us off at the front door of Seasons 52 at South Coast Plaza and picked us up within 10 minutes of calling for a ride back!  Breakfast is outstanding and it is nice to have a choice of two pools.  Our room was upgraded to a suite without asking and it was much larger and  nicer  than

The Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa is a friendly and inviting place and a great value too.My wife and I came to relax over the July 4 holiday weekend and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The free (real) breakfast was far superior to any breakfast offered in hotels of similar or higher price. The swimming pools and hot tubs were another very enjoyable aspect of our stay as was the proximity to the Newport beaches. In summary, I highly recommend this hotel

Very clean and up to date, this hotel give you a bit of luxury and a feeling of being "on vacation". The buffet breakfast is great and the staff works hard to keep all the food stations well supplied and the tables free of used dishes.

I stayed here with my husband for a weekend away and we had a great stay!  You can't beat the FREE breakfast, FREE wifi, and FREE parking!!  The front desk was friendly and the hotel was clean.  We had dinner in their restaurant one night and it was really nice.  I would highly recommend the rotisserie chicken dish.  The one drawback is that you can hear the planes from the nearby airport outside.  However, we couldn't hear them in our room.  The pool was really clean and looked like it was recently renovated.  We loved everything and will be back soon!

Summary Heading: Pretty hotel with a nice courtyard
Summary: I stayed for 5 nights. The room was nicely appointed, i liked the free breakfast, great free wifi, and the location was convenient.

A charming and lovely hotel; we were comfortable from the moment we walked in.  Many nice touches, like cookies at 5:00 PM, lovely gift shop, many restaurants nearby and one very good one right in the hotel.  Nice pool and hot tub.  We were very comfortable in our lovely suite too.  Staff very helpful and friendly.  I can't say enough good things!

Summary Heading: Love it, love it, and love it some more!
Summary: Very clean and comfortable. The staff was so curtious and friendly. Thank you for everything! Oh, and the breakfast was amazing!

My friend and I arrived several hours before check-in but our room was ready and waiting. After we dropped off our bags we were offered (and accepted) a lift to the trade show we were attending. The room was clean, comfortable and well-appointed, especially considering the price. The breakfast was only so-so, but it was plentiful and free. Everyone we dealt with - front counter staff, bartender, shutlle driver and others - was polite and helpful. If you're staying near John Wayne airport or, for that matter, anywhere in Irvine/Costa Mesa/Newport Beach, this is a great hotel at with reasonable rates. The nearby restaurants look pretty poor so you'll probably want to drive into town for dinner.

We have stayed at the Ayres Hotel and Suites in Costa Mesa several times over the past few years, and each time we stay we are impressed with the helpfulness of the staff the quality of the accommodations, and the great breakfast buffet.  The staff is always willing to go the extra mile to be helpful.

This is the second time I have stayed here and both times were perfect.  Spacious rooms, wonderful buffet breakfast-included--free parking and internet.  It was very clean, friendly and safe.  I'll be back!!!

Summary Heading: I'll stay here every time I'm in southern California!
Summary: Personal touches, lovely hotel and thoughtful amenities.  Close to the airport, good restaurants, beaches - ideal central location. Excellent access to CA main highways.  Perfect place to stay in this area.  Wonderful free breakfast and free onsite parking.  It's just a lovely hotel.

Summary Heading: Excellent value for the area. Convenient location.
Summary: We had an excellent stay at this hotel. It is a great value for the area!! Our room was spacious, CLEAN and had the amenities we required and we were upgraded to a Jr Suite and had a jacuzzi tub. The beds were super comfortable! Free wi-fi gave us the access we needed. The only issue was on arrival my luggage was given to a bellman and wasn't delivered promtly. But eventually received luggage and rest of the stay was picture perfect! This is the 2nd Ayres Hotel I have stayed in and I will always check if they are available in the areas I am traveling to!!! The free breakfast was awesome as well! It is close to the airport but the noise was not disruptive at all!

Summary Heading: Thoroughly enjoyable from start to finish
Summary: This hotel met or exceeded my expectations from start to finish. Every staff member I came in contact with was pleasant, professional, and helpful. The beds are very comfortable. The rooms are spacious, modern, and clean. The shuttle van was especially great, and saved me a lot of cab fare during my stay. I can't speak to the recreational and fitness facilities since I did not have time to use them during my 3-day stay.

I've been staying at this hotel for years and I'm never disappointed.  It's very near the John Wayne Orange County airport and close enough to everything you need.  The front desk staff is wonderful and the breakfast is outstanding.

Summary Heading: Very European, charming, great restaurant, & excellent personnel!
Summary: I stay here when I'm in OC - it's convenient to everything.  The downstairs restaurant has outstanding food and great specials every night.  The rooms are large, quiet and immaculate.  I used to stay at the Marriott Bay View (just down the street) but why spend $200-250 more per night???  Especially when the Ayres Newport is far more charming.  I highly recommend this hotel!!

The staff at the restaurant and the shuttle drivers are great, the front desk staff is hit or miss. The shuttle will take you anywhere within 5 miles of the hotel. The food in the restaurant is good, breakfast is buffet.

We were unaware that we would be staying in a property in the landing path of a airport. We chose this location because our previous stay at the sister location in Anaheim was outstanding. Needless to say Anaheim was booked for the 4 days we wished to reserve & felt confident picking another location. Each day the roars of planes landing or taking off blared through the living room & bedroom windows waking us against our wishes. Additionally there was a church group whose music & vocals radiated through our closed windows & doors- when we called the front desk the female who answered said it's in the managers hands & the concert level of noise was muted. There were small black hairs in 3 different places in the shower. When entering or exiting the lobby we were not greeted or

Summary Heading: I would go back here anytime - fantastic!!!!
Summary: I want to let people & hotel management know what a terrific staff they have. Some who stood out were cousins Bill & Ralph - shuttle drivers & Jose D. a server in the bar / restaurant. On the whole all the staff were very fiendly & helpful. Many went abov and beyond what I expect from a hotel. I would and will go back and stay again, Susan McGoey - Canada.

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel, just beautiful. One of the best
Summary: From the minute we walked in we knew we had picked the right place. Everything about this place was great. First they let us check in over 2 hrs early. We felt under-dressed just walking in. Had a huge Christmas tree near the entrance and the lobby was very nicely decorated. Elevators were fast and there are many located around the hotel. Location is the only part that I had a hard time with. They are near the airport and close to many highways, but the street is a oneway so it can be confusing trying to get back @ night. Breakfast was one of the best I have ever had. It varied daily, and they never ran out of food. They also give you extra time past the standard breakfast times. On our last day, we saw many people come in late for breakfast and they still allowed them to eat

Summary Heading: Amazing Gem with Charm and Style
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Ayres Hotel 1 night as we were wrapping up our road trip and could not have been happier. This hotel is an absolute gem from every angle. It is so beautifully and aesthetically appealing and we were lucky to experience it with the holiday decorations still there. The hotel is charming, a European old style with lots of classy touches and luxury. Check in was fantastic, our room was perfect. The rooms are spacious, with several sitting options, a mini wet bar/kitchenette and bathroom. Everything was clean and polished. We did not use the pools, so we cannot comment on them or any of the other amenities. However, we did enjoy the breakfast that was included with our stay and were again super pleasantly surprised, as not only were there choices for us
Nice and clean, freindly staff. Fast food outlets nearby. Lovely pool. Huge breakfast in the morning. Pleasant stay.

Summary Heading: Old and elegant,perfect place for older people. Rude employees.too much security and rules.
Summary: When we 1st arrived it was trouble from the start, you have to put down a deposit & it cant be cash which was a bummer bc i had no $ on my debit so i had to drive all the way to bank n put $ in it & then was able 2 check in...ugh whatta drag n waste of time..then got 2my room & as always i check it out to make sure everything looks clean & the 1st thing i did was check the bed & come 2 find dirty sheets that had a fresh mustard stain,Pubic hairs& wierd crusty particals. I was in shock i kept saying to myself...is this for real!!!?? So I put my nose 2the test &smelled the sheets to confirm if they were actually dirty & it smelled used and sweaty... So i call front desk & told them (they sounded like i was crazy!)we got the sheets changed & then i thought it was over.nope in the

Summary Heading: A hot November day in Orange County
Summary: As an organizational consultant I regularly fly into Orange County, CA. During the past year I have preferred to stay at the Ayres Hotels of Southern California. This Costa Mesa/Newport Beach location is only minutes away from John Wayne Airport. In the past I have stayed at the large hotel chains nearby, but in this time of tightening budgets I elected to stay at this facility primarily for its convenience, comfort, cleanliness and affordability. With its French Provincial furnishings, wall coverings and large marble fireplace this hotel has characteristic old world charm. It has the elegance of European boutique lodging, without the price. Ayres Hotels are locally owned and operated by the Ayres family, for several generations; important because they have a history of giving

Went to this hotel after staying at the Hilton Airport hotel.  This place is a lot better.  Comparison: Hilton gives points but charges for parking, internet, breakfast, and hotel is noisy.  Ayres has breakfast included (although not as good as the hilton but better than a Hampton inn or other free breakfast).  Parking, internet and cookies are free!  The hotel although next to the airport was very quiet.  Also some restaurant just on the other side of the street.

Enjoyed a very pleasant stay in great surroundings.  Well appointed spacious bedroom and well stocked bathroom with good toiletries.  Lots of towels.  Coffee making facilities.  Plenty of clothes storage.   The bed was very comfortable.    Great breakfast with plenty of food and drinks available.  Plenty of free parking available.  Free newspapers available in the morning and cookies in the afternoon.  Checking out after a reasonably long stay was effortless.  Good location for shopping.

My husband and I had quiet a nice two night stay.    Pros:  Location was great for our needs for the weekend, although it is not in a trendy area, it is close to freeway access.   The price was good for O.C. (Newport area)  which can be pricey especially in summer.  The room was pleasant, clean, and roomy overlooking a charming courtyard.  Free parking, internet and breakfast buffet adds to the value.  We would stay here again if we were in need of a room in the area.  Cons:  Room lighting could be better and the courtyard view room a bit noisy in the morning with guest eating breakfast

This hotel reeks of smoke!  Their website advertises as a "100% smoke-free facility."  Totally, totally wrong.  There are ashtrays at every entrance (four at the front door!), on the patio and in exterior hallways.  Disgusting (and cancer-causing).

We stayed here because our son is starting college nearby. Hotel was wonderful. Close to all, very nice and helpful staff, charming court yard with good restaurant. Will definitely stay here again. We booked a package incl flight with Expedia and it was a great deal.

Summary Heading: Watch the Bait & Switch - Will Never Stay Here Again
Summary: I originally booked my trip for a deluxe room with a king size bed. After coming in late at night I was put in an unclean handicapped room with a queen size bed. Having spent the night on the couch after the hotel was "sold out", I tried to change the room but was unable to do so. The sold out status was not the case as one could buy a room online. And the staff was completely unaccommodating. Buyer beware!

Came here with my family on my first trip to OC last year and it was a terrific stay. The hotel is very close to John Wayne airport yet the hotel was quiet and you could barely hear the planes flying.  Excellent service from staff and everyone was very friendly. We stayed for one week in July and had a room with two queen beds that faced the pool. The beds were soooo comfortable I didn't want to get up! Breakfast is included in price and was buffet every morning with the usual selections like eggs, bacon, and the occasional surprise like Chilaquiles!  Hotel has two good sized pools, jacuzzi's and offers free cookies in the lobby. We found it to be a great location to Newport Beach and the rest of OC. Free parking and wifi too.

This is just about the nicest place I have ever stayed.  The staff was super courteous, the room was wonderful, the breakfast superb, the bed soft but not flimsy.  The only problem we had was a toilet that had a flush lever that tended to stick causing the water to run.

I was a bit wary of the Ayres from other reviewers' description of its location next to John Wayne airport.   But the airplane noise was almost unnoticeable after dark, and the Ayres has to be the best value in Orange Co. -- free parking, free full breakfast, afternoon cookies, two pools and hot tubs, fitness center, etc. And a very nice European courtyard too. What an incredible value!

Just recently stayed one night at this hotel, and was not impressed. Based on the many good reviews, thought perhaps it had changed from years ago when I stayed there. It hasn't!!!!   Badly in need of  an update on all things.The front  desk was very friendly,and my husband enjoyed the breakfast, even though the dining room where it was served belongs in another era. Will give them an E for effort.It is like time has stood still for this property. It was clean though, which is a plus.

Summary Heading: Stayed here for job training and I wished I could've stayed longer...
Summary: Ayres Hotels are truly unique from any other hotel company I have stayed at. It is not a huge corporation that franchises their hotels; each hotel is owned an operated by Ayers Hotels. Pretty much like a mom and pop's hotel chain. Everything here is excellent and I truly have nothing to complain about. The hotel is located in nice quiet area with easy access to the freeway. The hotel and restaurant staff is excellent. The room was like staying in royalty and the bed was very comfortable. Rooms are equipped with super high speed internet access and the hotel has a great gym. There is also Wi-Fi throughout the hotel. You will not regret your stay here or any other Ayers hotel and it is nice to finally stay at a hotel that you truly don't want to leave. Have a good one, cheers!!

Summary Heading: Clean, comfy, close to Newport Beach
Summary: Stayed here for one night at the end of our trip - needed to close to Newport Beach to go out on a whale watching trip the next morning. Got there too early to check in, so left our bags and returned later that evening. We had a king-sized bed - which was so comfy - and a large room with TV, hairdryer, ice machine down the corridor, coffee maker (not really good for tea, and only 2 teabags per day), clean bathroom, free wifi, plenty of free parking. Breakfast was complimentary - toast, eggs, bacon, cereal, fruit, drinks, muffins... buffet self service. Only 10 minutes drive from the beach. The turn off to the hotel is easy to miss, as its straight after the traffic lights - we missed it the first time and had to do a detour around the block, since the road is one way that the

Believe all the positive reviews you read here on this hotel in ...they all say exactly what I would say about this hotel. I stayed for 5 nights attending a high school reunion and the hotel provided attendees a group rate (very reasonable!). Room was nicely situated - very nice furnishings, very comfortable bed, it was quiet, no a/c issue for me, staff & housekeeping excellent - food in restaurant excellent for hotel food - very nice complimentary breakfast with hot foods, intimate little bar area, etc, etc. The only minor thing for me was the lighting in the bathroom. There was no over the mirror lighting and there wasn't sufficient make-up lighting...which is very important for us women! I did not give it a 100% on location only because it can be a little confusing getting to

Summary Heading: We will continue to vacation here!
Summary: It is conveniently located near Newport Beach, Huntington Beach and Laguna Beach.  There is no parking fee, and the rates are quite good, even over holiday weekends (our last trip was over Labor Day weekend).  The staff is friendly, and the rooms are clean.  The open courtyard and open pool areas are welcoming and comfortable.  We have stayed here twice and will continue to do so when we need to get away to the beach!

Summary Heading: We'll definitely remember this hotel chainT
Summary: We were part of a bus tour group going to the Pageant of the Masters in Laguna Beach.  We had never heard of the Ayres Hotel, but were pleasantly surprised by how wonderful it was--definitely first class.  The room was beautiful and clean with plush bedding, very nice furniture, and granite countertops.  The bathroom was large enough for 2 of us to maneuver around each other--another sink and dressing area was just outside the door.  A complete breakfast buffet was served in the restaurant, which you could take outside into the courtyard or around the pool--plenty of seating wheverever you turned.  The staff was very courteous and accomodating.  We will definitely stay again at an Ayres Hotel

I stayed at the Ayres in order to attend a two-day professional workshop.  The hotel was very convenient to the airport and to the location of the workshop.  They provided the transportation to both the airport and office.  The staff was very friendly, courteous and accommodating.  The hotel is beautiful and styled on the European tradition of hotels.  The beds were amazingly comfortable and the rooms were quiet.  The cost was very reasonable for all that you experience:  granite in the bathroom, full bath and shower, refrigerator and coffemaker, cable TV and internet connection.  I cannot say enough about the elegance, comfort and and style of this hotel.  It was a pleasure to stay there.

Summary Heading: Loved it, would go back in a second!
Summary: Great hotel, wonderful service,  delicious breakfast,  very pretty place.     The customer service was  friendly, helpful.      Even tho the hotel is very close to the airport, it was not noisy.    A few things that I loved===the fresh lemonade daily in the afternoon, warm cookies at 5 thirty each evening,   the super clean lobby,rooms, everything.   Breakfast was perfect, and best of all,  I got a great deal on Expedia for this property.   It is also very close to South Coast Plaza, what a mall!    It is alslo close to beaches, Disney, and less than an hour from LA, in no traffic.    Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Excellent value, unique travel experience - like staying in a museum
Summary: If you are reading this review, it is because you have the good fortune in discovering tripadvisor.com as an excellent and reliable way to pick a hotel in anywhere in the world. I have used tripadvisor.com before in other cities and found that the ratings and reviews are very accurate, assuming you take the time to read the many of the reviews and decide if the low reviews have any validity or if they were just caused by the travelers unrealistic expectations or were just lies created by competitors.   This is a unique hotel that would appeal the most to people that love staying in fine European hotels and going to art museums. People who have traveled a lot and appreciate something more than the usual American hotel. I have stayed in 4-5 different Marriott hotels recently and I

Hotel had an old world charm. Beatifully decorated made us feel as if we were in a very expensive hotel for a small price.  Rooms were large enough for 4 of us (2 kids, 2 adults). Comfortable beds, very clean, kids loved the jacuzzi tub. Free internet in the business centre available 24/7 was extremely helpful and appreciated. Breakfast in the main building is a buffet that had ample delicious hot and cold food and very courteous staff. The courtyard to eat in was gorgeous and bright adding to the overall charm of the hotel.  The gift shop had many interesting items to look at.  Free parking was ample. Only downside, lots of airport noise even with closed windows.  Would stay here again and again.

I really enjoyed my 5 days at Ayres. The room was large enough, and plenty comfortable. I felt it was a very good deal for the money. There are, however, two minor improvements which I would suggest. First, the TV is mounted in place, and cannot swivel, or extend, to allow it to be viewed from any angle other that directly ahead. The other minor complaint I had is that the A/C never did cool the room properly. I had it set to 72 degrees, and it ran constantly for my entire stay.  On the plus side...everything else! The bed, and bedding, was clean and perhaps the softest I have ever experienced. I had absolutely no problems with noise either interior or exterior. The internet access was very easy to use. The jacuzzi/tub was incredibly comfortable.  The complimentary breakfast was

Located at the end of Orange County Airpot's runway. Surprisingly never really an issue but obviously a factor in their pricing. Hotel is very nicely furnished. Complimentary breakfast very good although not a great variety it was cooked. Only downside was the small pool area.

Summary Heading: Can not wait to get out of here!
Summary: Clean, large, rooms in kind of a country French nautical theme.  But, the location and staff make this place seem like a jail cell with nice curtains.  There is nothing to do within walking distance and the hotel is located at the departure end of the runway for the Santa Ana airport, before the quiet zone.  Forget working out, the very small gym is not properly ventilated and too crowded to use any of the machines without bumping your neighbor.   The hotel appears to have nice public spaces, but you are not allowed to sit in them without paying money to one of their various "restaurants."  Guests are constantly being shoo'd away by insistent Latin American staffers who literally seem to be transplants from the hotels that gouge customers with $8 water bottles south of the

My wife and I stayed at The Ayres Hotel & Suites from July 24th - July 26th. This property was a Comfort Inn & Suites before Ayres took it over and did a remodel. We had a Junior Suite with a KING Bed in the building next to the main building. We got a pretty good deal, IMO thru Expedia.com for $89/night for the Junior Suite. The deal included FREE breakfast & FREE parking all 3 nights! The building we were in had its own small pool & Jacuzzi with lounge chairs/chaise lounges/umbrellas. It also had its own Breakfast Buffet area on the 1st floor. We stayed in room #167 which was up front near the street on the lower level, it had a patio outside the room with 2 chairs and a table that was enclosed in by a wall. This was a rather nice bonus! It looked like only the rooms on the

This hotel has a staff that is very friendly and kind, if you just talked to them. We had car trouble coming into CA, but they held are room for us and upgraded it to a juccuzi suite, which was fabulous. We used their shuttle to go to Balboa island and So. Coast plaza, and our trip wasn't a bust. It was a lot of fun, would go there again. Hope you'll see this and will go too.

This Hotel is located about 12 minutes from Newport Beach depending on traffic.  Also close to the airport. We had no problem with airport noise at all. We slept very well.The accommodations are very nice. Our Air Conditioner was broken the first night but they came in the nxt morning and replaced the unit. All was fine. We got a discounted price originally for this hotel on Hotels.com so I said nothing about compensation for the inconvenience of the Air. There were free drink coupons given to hotel guests. Great pool and spa. The Continental breakfast in the morning is OUTSTANDING ! One of the very best I've had while traveling. This saves money for families.      The Hotel itself has an "Old World" feel to it with lovely fabrics and comfortable surroundings. The outdoor

My stepmother and I traveled along with my sister's swim team, and this was the hotel chosen for the team to stay in. I am so glad that we stayed here! The beautiful courtyard was the best part, where we enjoyed our complimentary breakfasts and a few glasses of wine in the evening. The drive to Newport Beach wasn't bad, although if  you're going on a beach vacation, I would recommend staying somewhere a little closer. However, the rooms were clean, we never needed anything that we didn't have, the staff was friendly. Overall it was a very nice hotel.

We arrived on Sunday afternoon --had a fantastic lunch at Marche Moderne (reminded us of food in Paris), got a free make-over at the Dior counter in Bloomingdales, a massage in Newport Beach, and dinner at Maggianos. Fantastic day. Room was great--lots of pillows, comfy beds, and a nice European courtyard with tables and a fountain--reminded us of Italy and Paris. Not high end, but more charm than a Marriott or Westin. Great location.. Very clean, excellent and helpful staff.  Breakfast was good--the hazelnut syrup for coffee was a nice touch. Took a tour of UC Irvine on Monday (the real purpose of our trip) and did some shopping at SOuth Coast Plaza. a fantastic trip--next time we're in the area, we are definitely staying here!

I arranged for the bridal party to stay at this Ayres hotel in preparation for hair/makeup the next morning.  The deluxe room was large effect for 5 people to do hair/makeup.  The furnishings in the room were older, but we didn't need anything flashy.  The beds were so comfortable!  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Free internet & parking was a bonus.

Summary Heading: Spotless hotel, good restaurant, great location, great value, great staff.
Summary: While this property might not be brand new, we found it to be a very clean hotel and the staff was very helpful in all ways. We were able to schedule the free shuttle at the times we needed to travel with no problem. The next time we are in the Newport Beach area, we will be staying here without shopping around.

After a very unfortunate choice of RCI property in San Clemente that we left w/o staying a night, we were lucky to find this first-rate hotel which saved our vacation. The suite was plush, the bed was ultra comfortable and the restaurant was outstanding. The location was great- we had golf, the beach and at least two malls within 10 minutes. The pool area was clean and modern(too much chlorine) and the fitness center was new. I can't tell you how grateful we were that a last minute decsion turned into a great week.

Summary Heading: friendly staff, comfy beds, large rooms, a wonderful place to stay
Summary: we stayed at the Ayres for 2 nights, a saturday and sunday, the room was large, well appointed, the bed was extremely comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful, the breakfast was yummy. my only complaints are that breakfast hours during the week end at 9am and since we were on vacation, this was too early for us to take advantage of the free buffet they offer, on sunday the breakfast was open until 10am so we feasted on fresh fruit, eggs, muffins, fresh coffee, bacon, etc. i also thought the lighting in the bathroom area was subpar, the low wattage left a lot to be desired. it is super close to john wayne airport but the airport observes quiet hours so the airplane noise was never an issue.

Stayed here for 4 nights and had a very nice stay in a "junior suite" at a very good rate. Tastefully decorated rooms and lobby/halls/dining room. Room was large w. nice bath and a sitting area and little extras (such as tea/coffee making, magnotron) that make your stay pleasant. Helpful staff and free internet acces even if you don't have a laptop, since you can use the business center. Free fitness, free (little) swimming pool. Also a 7 Eleven around the corner for simple groceries, and eateries close by. I can only mention one disadvantage: if you want to sleep until late and are disturbed by noise, be aware of planes leaving from the close by John Wayne airport from 7 a.m.

Summary Heading: You really just have to experience it
Summary: I have stayed in a couple of other Ayres properties in the LA area - and they are all pretty much the same.  First off, let me say that the folks that work here are very nice and the rooms are spacious,  quiet, and clean.  At the basic level, isn't this all we really need?  Now beyond that,  your opinion will waver depending on your design taste:   If you like an old-school, old-world, kind of antique-y aura, you will probably love it.  That's not to say this place is old - it's not.  They designed it to look and feel old!  If you like a more modern and cozy feel (like I do,) you will be repulsed.  That being said,  my co-workers and I all have differing opinions about this place!!!!  The Ayres website refers to their hotels as "inspired European-style boutique hotels."

Summary Heading: Comfortable hotel with a few issues
Summary: (Sorry if this is a duplicate posting; the one I started disappeared while I was writing it.)  I gave this place a 4, but there were some problems ...   I didn't know what to expect at this hotel, since I got it as a 'no name' selection on Hotwire.  The hotel is located very close to the John Wayne/Orange County airport, and if you don't like smallish airplanes taking off nearby, this is not for you -- but I didn't find the noise to be a problem; the windows are doublepaned and the takeoffs stop at 7 pm.  Saw lots of flight crews staying here.  The room was a bit over-decorated for my taste (too too Victorian) and the lamps were in odd places, but DSL was fast and FREE!!! and there was a decent desk and a minifridge and a big TV and sofa and chair.  The bed had a pillow top

I spent the night at the Ayres hotel last week.  I checked in late after arriving at John Wayne airport and then headed on to San Diego the next morning.  The staff was friendly and the accommodations clean and comfortable.  The hotel is very convenient to the airport.  Next time I'm in the area I will return.

Some of the negative reviews made me hesitant in booking this hotel. I took a chance and was pleasantly surprised!  I was in town for a medical procedure for my young son. It was a virtual oasis for me, a haven from the stress and pressure.  At the last minute my mother decided to come along and we needed to have two queens, versus one king. I called the day before and added the request. The agent reserved the room so that it would be ready for our late arrival. All of our requests were honored as well; a view of the pool and a quiet room.  Since we booked directly with the hotel we were eligible for the ample breakfast and for the beer/wine in the evening(I believe the complimentary beverage service is offered only Monday through Thursday and we got the vouchers at check-in).

The website showed a fantastic looking hotel. Thinking it might not be as good as the promotion, we still booked it and were so pleased that we did. The hotel is decorated beautifully, the employees went out of their way to please us and the room was more than sufficient and decorated with taste. The amenities were as promised, including a free full, hot breakfast buffet each morning and a complimentary drink each night.  The airplanes from the Orange County Airport do not fly between 10PM and 7AM, so there was no disturbing our rest at night. We feel we got first class accomodations at a bargain price. Would definitely return and highly recommend.

Ayres Hotel  Dec 7, 2008- Dec 13 , 2008. My husband and I stayed at this wonderful hotel for a week. It is spotless, great resturant, super staff that make your visit a joy from check in to departure. A few problems arose that were immediately resolved. Breakfast everyday is included in your daily charge , delicious, great assorment, free parking daily, free internet. No hidden chargers at all. We have stayed all over the world this little gem, is under rated with 3 stars, but don't tell anyone, they might raise their prices or worse change their attitudes, become uncaring as some of the so called 5 star hotel are.

Summary Heading: A very unique and memorable hotel. Also great value
Summary: My personal experience was WOW. I had gotten a great rate through Hotwire but I was still pleasantly impressed when I arrived.   This hotel was unique. It had a nice décor and everything had a picture hanging on it. Even the hallways were memorable with pleasant oil paintings hanging all along the walls. These were pleasant paintings with recognisable themes unlike modern “art” that leaves you baffled. The room we got was extremely pleasant. It was spotless clean and very beautifully decorated in an old style. I absolutely loved it. It also had a very deep jacuzzi.   There are actually two buildings in this hotel. We got a free upgrade in the more expensive building. The hotel is close to an airport and yet there did not seem to be any noise at all from planes. Perhaps there is

Summary Heading: Pretentious, but with no reason to be
Summary: This is a nice hotel, conveniently located not far from the John Wayne airport. We had an okay stay overall, but I will certainly never be staying at an Ayres hotel again. First, the hotel staff (from top to bottom) are incredibly pretentious. We went down for the breakfast dressed in shorts and t-shirts and were given dirty stares every day. We also were told we could use the microwave to heat up some leftovers, but weren't allowed to and the hotel cook had to do it for us. Once we got the food back, we sat in the restaurant to eat it and were booted out by the maitre' d who said that the seats were for "customers". (In reality, there were NO customers in the restaurant at the time, and considering we were spending over $600 at this hotel, I don't see why we couldn't be

Summary Heading: Beautiful comfortable hotel... really enjoyed my stay
Summary: A group of us decided to have a girls getaway weekend before the business leg of trip kicked in on Monday.  The three of us stayed quite comfortably in one of the Ayres suites.  The hotel was beautiful and very inviting.  Talk about personality!  it was incredible!  When we checked in, the front desk staff was a little put offish but I guess it didn't help that we were acting like a bunch of country bumpkins with our jaws hanging out.  Plus it was around 2 a.m.  and we were rather boisterous.  The lobby area is on the same grade as the parking lot and it was very convenient to just pull in under the arcade, unload our bags, and stroll right into the lobby. The complimentary breakfast was very well appointed with way too much food and choices.  Parking was free and we had no

I loved this hotel. The shuttle picked me up within ten minutes of calling them from John Wayne Airport. The driver was very courteous and helpful with restaurant suggestions.  Shuttle was waiting for me in the morning to take me back to the airport at exactly the time I asked for.   The front desk clerk was friendly and made no mention of my room being booked on a discount website.   I was told the hotel was full but I never heard a single noise from other guests. I did hear airplanes but they were not a problem. I hear them louder at my home.   My room was huge and spotless.  Very nicely decorated. The bedding was very comfortable. The bathroom was big and luxurious.  Had a hair dryer and night light. Soft towels. The coffee was good too.   There are free computers in the

I had to go to Costa Mesa for a weekend event with my company.  I saw the Ayers on-line and booked a room for 2 days (Fri-Sat).  Wow - it was better than I could imagine.  For the small price I had a great large room.  The room was nicely decorated (tatefully).  There was also TV w/HBO - a refrigerator and a shower with separate dressing area.  In the courtyard was a lovely  water fountain and statues with  tables and chairs (reminded me of when I was in Rome, Italy). eating out.   I had dinner by the fountain with a friend as they also have a restauratn.  They gave free breakfast with the room - ham, eggs, oatmeal, etc.   I would even consider coming back for a romantic weekend.  What a lovely "oasis" in this community.  Also there was much "history" on the walls showing boats

Summary Heading: Good... unless there is a problem
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel four times in the past four years, and it is very charming. Breakfast buffet, cookies, apples, decor - nice little touches. Until this last stay we never had any sort of problem.   This last stay,  however,  we encountered a problem and I'm afraid we have seen 'the other side' of the coin.   We were awoken around 12:30am by the loudest noise coming from inside the wall - my husband said it was definitely a main plumbing pipe that had not been insulated. It sounded like a freight train and woke us up out of a dead sleep. It continued for almost an hour  - an employee was called and came up to our room, and he even commented on how incredibly loud it was. We wanted to move immediately but were told the hotel was completely full and no other rooms were

My 2 year old daughter and I stayed here 9 weeks total, while my husband was on business. All together, this hotel was awful! It is very business-like, but not kid or family friendly.  The staff treated my daughter horribly with hardly any smiles and for a 9 week stay, that gets to be really discouraging! The pools are designed horribly..one right in the middle of the courtyard so that everyone can see you and hear you.  We specifically asked for rooms not next to construction and 3 weeks were put there anyway...and the noise was very loud and disturbing.  We carried a lot of stuff and 2x as well they had no bell hop on duty right before check out time to help us with bags, so my toddler and I had to do it all by ourselves! For the price, if you have a family, just go somewhere

I would not recommend staying here. First of all, it is in the airport's flight path, so the noise during the day is ridiculous. At night the noise is tolerable. Unfortunately, the second night we were there the hotel was hosting a 10 yr high school reunion. There was no parking because of this. The 'kids' (they should have known better!) were noisy, running around the hotel until all hours of the night. Hotel security was inadequate to keep them from doing so, although I do believe they were trying their best. The complimentary breakfast was barely passable. This property has potential, but would not stay here again even if they paid me!

We stayed at this hotel because we enjoyed our stay at the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach. The hotel was clean and in a great location for access to the freeway. The breakfast buffet was super and the free access to the internet in the business centre was a bonus ! The room was spacious and comfortable.

I expected so little of this hotel based on the prior reviews, and based on the fact that it was booked through Hotwire.  But I was surprised to find when I got there that:  1)  The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful.  I think on the whole, this staff was more customer service oriented than I've experienced in a long time.    2)  The rooms were very nice and the beds were very very comfortable!  It was the first time in over a year that I've stayed in a hotel and not woken up with an aching back.  3)  The hotel amenities were totally sufficient for this class of hotel.  a nice pool and hottub, a pretty paltry workout room but good enough to get the job done, nice restaurant, lobby and meeting areas, and very nice rooms with good bathrooms.  4)  The breakfast buffet was

AGAIN this is a great hotel. I never have any problems they are very accommodating. The breakfast bar is excellent.The staff very nice. The rooms are very clean. I loved it and would recommend to anyone anytime. Cannot beat it for the price. Anyone that complains should stay in Baltimore at one of the hotels that charge $250.00 for rooms that are really $40.00 rooms and look like it too!!!! Love this hotel!!! Keep up the good work!!!

Summary Heading: Not quite as advertised but renovating
Summary: I stayed here on recommendation from a business partner, and based on both his say-so and the hotel's website, it was not quite as nice as advertised.  My trip was last minute, but even at that, my expectations were a lot higher for $199 a night.  Parts of the hotel are under renovation, which is actually good news.  It is a little outdated.  I had to request a new room my second night as the courtyard room I had was way too noisy (outside talkers/smokers, doors slamming, toilets flushing, etc).  Once moved to the back of the hotel, it was much nicer.   It's very near John Wayne airport but after 10 and before 7 it's perfectly fine with no airplane noise.  Room decor is fine, but bathroom amenities are Motel 6 quality.  I did appreciate the in-room internet service.  There are

We booked at the last minute through Hotwire. Room was $76 a night including a full breakfast buffet (which was excellent). Hotel is very close to airport, but since John Wayne has a 10pm-7am curfew it wasn't a problem.  Rooms were nice, bed extremely comfortable.  All areas very clean (a must for me!) Would definitely stay here again.

I normally stay at the sister property in Mission Viejo when I travel on business, but I thought I'd try the one in Costa Mesa since I was able to Hotwire it for about $85/night.  The property is undergoing renovations, and I would like to give it a try again after they are completed.  I found the layout very confusing and not very well marked with signage as to lobby, elevator, etc. on the 3rd floor where I was.    I found it a bit disturbing that there was no key entry system from the parking lot into the lower level elevator area and thus not secure from the outside.  Since parking was a bit crowded, this could be a concern for some, but  I'm sure that will be addressed with the renovations.    This property is somewhat older than the Mission Viejo location, and the rooms

A friend and I wanted to see the Rose Parade up close instead of on TV. We took a tour with Cartans and this was the first year they stayed at this property.  The room was clean and quiet, though we were on the flight path from John Wayne Airport. (Yes, you could hear them fly over.) We had a room in the 'suites' hotel, though I wouldn't call the room a suite by any means. It did have a fridge, microwave, sink and coffee maker, but no couch, etc.   The beds were comfortable, the bathroom was kept extremely clean and had a jacuzzi tub. Everyone on our tour agreed it was a terrific hotel.  I have to praise the hotel staff as there were three tour groups there for the parade and ours, at about 150 people, was probably the smallest. They managed to have three breakfast set ups with

Hotel was just ok, I had greater expectations based on tripadvisor reviews. The breakfast is good, I enjoyed it, but the rooms are very noisy, we could hear the water flushing next door, the shower water running, etc, the room faced the pool where music was loud, and the AC was noisy.  The decor a bit outdated.  It is ok to crash over night.

The room had a musty smell. As I was expecting a relaxing afternoon at the pool, it was far from that. You could hear children screaming from inside the hotel. The pool did indeed have approximately 50 screaming children in it. I stayed as far away as possible. There was another pool located next to a parking lot which was as uninviting as the other.  The entire place had a strange smell and it was really hot in the hallways. The AC was obviously not on. It was the middle of  summer!!! Not comfortable. I felt as though I would be trapped in the old, slow, barely working elevator. I decided to use the nasty (also smelly) stairs a few times. You get what you pay for. BUT you can definitely find a more modern, up to date, better smelling place for your next stay in the area.

We had planned to stay at the Holiday Inn across from the Hilton Hotel in Costa Mesa but our reservations were lost and we were directed to th Ayres Hotel Suites. The Junior Suite was on the 4th floor of the adjacent building and it was a very nice, spacious room. Note that it is in the flight pattern of the Orange County Airport but there are no flights from 10pm to 7am. The Hotel breakfast is very good and can be had either in the first floor of the adjacent wing of the hotel where our room was or in the courtyard of the main building of the hotel; we chose the courtyard as the weather was perfect and the courtyard is very pleasant. We also had a delicious dinner in the courtyard at a very moderate price. We would stay there again.

We stayed At the Ayres Hotel and suites for 1 night while passing through this area. This is a very nice hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. I would recommend this hotel to families or business travelers. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. We had breakfast the following morning and it was very good and staff was great. Parking is free. Even though it is near the airport we didn't notice the noise. It must be insulated well. The airport must have shut down at night because I didn't hear anything during the night.  This is a well run facility.

Summary Heading: New favorite hotel in southern California!
Summary: On a trip to LA to do some college tours, I needed a decent room for my 2 teenage daughters and myself.  I did my research on betterbidding and then chose this hotel on hotwire.  I got a fantastic rate = $98.84 incuding tax. Since this included hot breakfast for 3 and a free drink in the evening, it was certainly a steal.  I imagine people are afraid to stay here because it's right by the airport (which I didn't know until driving up).  However, I was pleasantly surprised to find that I didn't notice the noise from even 1 plane during our stay!  Amazing engineering :)  The room was spacious, the courtyard and furnishings throughout the hotel felt very luxurious (like a European boutique), and most importantly, the beds were amazingly comfortable with mattress toppers and down

Just stayed here for 4 days while near L.A. for business and it was an excellent hotel.  Even though the hotel was close the the airport the planes didn't really start until 6-7 in the morning and I never heard them in the early evening.  The breakfast in the morning was excellent and I have to say that the beds were the most comfortable that I have ever slept in.  It was funny that when I got home I was thinking that I wasn't looking forward to getting into my own bed as I would much rather sleep in the one at the hotel!!  The "European-inspired" look of the hotel was cute and not too over done and the courtyard in the middle was very nice to sit and relax in.  I would stay here again on business but it was a little far from the action if I were to go for a holiday ( if you

Two nights at the Ayres. I have stayed in several of their properties and this one is one of the nicer I have been in.  I had a room on the west side of the out-building and never heard a plane for which I was pleasantly surprised. The room was large, the furnishings extremely rich (too much for my taste, but I do not own it)  and very comfortable. The bed was comfortable, a big deal with me, and there was a fridge and microwave.   The breakfast is a real breakfast with real eggs, not the gross frozen re-heated kind, bacon, potatoes, cereals, toast etc.   There is free wi-fi in the lobby only, the internet access in the rooms has a 2 foot cable and costs about $9/day. That always annoys me!! I luckily carry a 10 foot cable so at least I could see the TV and work on my laptop.

Summary Heading: Not the worst, not the best...
Summary: My wife and I stay here for one night because we knew the event we were attending was going to run late.  It's close to an airport and planes fly over the hotel.  Lucky for us we're used to the sound of planes flying over so this didn't bother us too bad, but if you are looking for peace and quiet - this hotel is not for you.  The room we stayed in was surprisingly big but dark and had a musty smell to it.  The staff was friendly and the breakfast was free.

We just came back from a 2-night stay from May 18-19, and it was very nice, though it does not some minuses.  We paid $159 for a suite, and I thought it was well worth it.  1.  Check in:  Very prompt and courteous.  They had just baked a fresh batch of cookies and promptly offered us some.  Our daughter loved it.  The lobby was bright and beautiful.  2.  We had booked a suite and was told on the phone it had a whirlpool, though it did not.  We were in the main building where registration is, and I think we would have liked the other building  better.  Our room had a faux leather couch which we did not care for.  The room was dark so I had to turn all the lights on.  It smelled stuffy, so we opened both windows as well.  It smelled to me like cheap air freshener, though my

Summary Heading: Awesome Stay @ Ayres Hotel and Suites
Summary: We just returned from a 2 night stay at Ayres Hotel and Suites Costa Mesa, CA and we had a great time.  I purchased the room through hotwire at only $73 per night and what a bargain.  The room was beautiful and the complimentary breakfast buffet was fantastic.  Not just a couple old pastries and some fruit.  We were there on Spring break and went to Disneyland the hotel is about 10-15 minute drive from Disneyland I would stay here every time we go to Southern California if we can!!

Absolutely no complaints about the 2 nights we stayed here. Located right between Costa Mesa and Newport Beach. Hotel was beatifully decorated and room was very comfortable. We had a Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom which was nice.  Complementary breakfast was great and parking was free (very rare for any hotel in Southern Cal). 5 minutes to Fashion Island and convinient to freeways and restaurants.  Great Stay!

We had a family get-together in mid-January.  Five rooms were reserved; my husband and I stayed 5 nights:  Weds till following Monday.  Pluses:  Free parking... compared to many hotels in metro areas now charging daily parking fees of $12-18.  Hot breakfast ... including made to order omelettes and other egg dishes, but only during the week since hotel seems to cater to business travelers rather than leisure...fresh fruits selections very limited; after 5 mornings; breakfast got to be "boring": same 2 or 3 choices of cold cereal and other breakfast "starchy" food. Effective Sound-proof windows ... very necessary since the hotel is right under the flight path of John Wayne Arpt.   Prompt response for extra blanket and towels.  Adequate room size.  Oh ... and there is also free

We are a family of three and had to find temporary quarters while our own house was receiving some work. We chose the Ayres based on its reputation as an upscale boutique hotel. We were very pleased with our two night stay.  The bedroom furnishings are very upscale, with marble flooring in the bathroom and entryway. While we did not book a suite, the room had a small area near the door and bathroom that was furnished with a small counter and elegant mirror. This was an extra nice touch.  The beds were very comfortable, and all the bedspreads and comforters were very upscale.  The breakfast buffet was adequate, with hot scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, and cereal. Not as nice as a cooked to order breakfast, but it was convenient.  Since this hotel is a stone's throw from the end

The Ayers overall is a nice hotel.  My first night they were booked full and could not honor my request for a 1st floor room near the lobby and I was put in the back of the hotel - 2nd floor overlooking the pool - the light in the hall to these doors facing the pool were out and it was EXTREMELY dark back there.  2nd day of stay my request was honored by a very friendly staff member and I was moved to the 1st floor.  The biggest complaint about this hotel is the parking.  The lot is quite narrow and there are no side doors to the hotel which forces you to park way in the back where the lighting is horrible and you feel a tad unsafe coming in late at night.   The decor is nice, the breakfast is good and again the staff was friendly.

Summary Heading: It was Okay. . .Far from the beaches. . .
Summary: If you are just using this as a bed, the property is fine.  But for us, it didn't feel enough like Laguna Beach, Newport Beach. . .  It seemed too far from the beach, too close to the airport and is surrounded by strip malls.  Kind of takes away from the vacation feel.  However, the room was more than adequate, as was the hot breakfast.  The rates are also pretty good, but for me-- next time I'm going to spend more to stay closer to the beach!!!

I loved this hotel.  It was clean and comfortable.  We stayed at the Ayres because the Disneyland properties were both full and expensive during spring break.  The drive was only about 10 to 15 minutes to Disneyland and less than 5 minutes away from the John Wayne Airport.  The staff was very friendly and the full complimentary breakfast was a plus.  This saved us quite a bit of money because there were 7 of us and I prefer a real breakfast to get the day started than a continental breakfast of just pastry and juice.  I would definitely stay here again.

The hotel was fine, but I was not pleased with the service. When I checked in, I was told that my suite  would be $159.00 per night on Friday night.. When I left, the bill read $189.00 per night. I was told I was "bumped" to a better room because the hotel was almost sold out.   I've read good things about Ayres, but l'll never return to the one in Newport Beach.

We were very pleased with the Ayres Hotel. The rooms and the hotel were very clean, the complimentary breakfast was more than satisfactory, and the staff was friendly. The highlight of the stay was their beds - according to the sign in the lobby, they're custom designed for the hotel chain. The mattresses are "double-pillow-top" and the down pillows are awesome - so incredible, in fact, that I had to find the tag so I can try to get them for my own bed!   My only complaint is that the light/fan in the bathroom was noisy, but it may just be something that needs a quick repair. The hotel is close to the John Wayne airport, and when sitting outside, you can hear the air traffic; however, we did not hear the planes at all during the night.   Within the hotel are two courtyards, one

Summary Heading: A Must Stay While In The LA Area
Summary: My Family of four stayed at the hotel for six nights while vacationing in the LA area. The hotel is located between LA and Anaheim & several beaches. When I arrived,the hotel staff was friendly & my room(A Jr. Suite) was available. (You must reserve a suite,*an excellent choice). The room was great. Each the morning the breakfast buffet that is available in each area of the hotel was prepared fresh & contained a variety including fresh fruit. The hotel is located in a great area for shopping & eating out. Because of the nearby airport,you could hear planes periodically between 7:00am and 11:00 pm. The noise was tolerable. The hotel was equipped with a buisness room that contained computers & "printer" with access to high speed internet.( There's also high speed access in your

This a great little boutique hotel. Lobby and courtyard are very European looking. The rooms are large and clean, and everything was new.The pool area was nice enough, and the breakfast was great. It was a hot breakfast, and included made to order omelets. If you don't need to be right on the ocean, this is a nice place to stay.

We just spent 2 night at this hotel and slept like we were at home, the bed was so comfortable!  The staff was always friendly, the room very clean and promptly serviced and the location excellent for our needs.  The breakfast was hearty, not a continental breakfast, with some choices.  We need to return next month and booked our reservation as we checked out.  It also was quiet and felt very safe.  We have been returning to this area for over 16 years to visit family and found this to be a most comfortable destination, much quieter than staying at the beach!

We attended a wedding reception and were guests of the hotel for 3 nights.  Housekeeping service was non-existent or lacking - had to call to get the room made up (which didn't happen) or request towels (one set was available for two people), toiletries, restock coffee packet and toilet tissue. We were to have early check-in and complimentary cheese tray/champagne but was not received.  Staff at front desk is disinterested. Breakfast was the same each of the 3 days and if you got there near the 'end' of service time, don't expect fresh coffee or food 'refreshed'.

We stayed at this hotel on Saturday and paid $72.00 for the night, and we were even able to check in at 1 pm.  The staff was very friendly, the hotel was clean and comfortable.  The room was very clean and quite spacious with a leather sofa sleeper. The bed was very soft and plush, it was like sleeping in your own bed (maybe even better).  We were surprised to find that even the floor was soft (which is unusual). We stood on the 3rd floor and had  a nice view of the pool. In the evening the front desk has the best fresh, hot, homemade cookies you've ever tasted.  We didn't try the breakfast because we were late, but the complimentary apples were crisp and delicious. We would definetly recommend this hotel and stay here again! It was close to the John Wayne Airport so we heard a

I stayed for a weekend with a friend who was attending a conference. The room was immaculate, the beds the most comfortable I have ever had in a hotel, and the staff was friendly and genteel. The complimentary buffet breakfast was excellent and complete, with friendly staff in attendance. I recommend this hotel very highly. The hotel itself was VERY quiet; the only problem for some people might be the airport noise, but we were not bothered. Great experience; would go back!

So we decided on staying here by driving past it one morning and thought it looked OK. Went inside and enquired about cost and availability and managed to get room (Junior suite) with breakfast and drink coupons for $95 per night.  Before we signed in we checked the room out and boy was it nice. Plenty of space (have 10 year old daughter) nice furnishings and all round enjoyable place. Breakfast good but repetative, pools clean quiet (except for planes) the whole experience was one of enjoyment. The cookies and the fruit were a source of amusement as my daughter made a point of shouting that a flight crew was checking in so get to the cookies before they do. But hey it was holiday time and who cares. Having stayed in other hotels in the Anaheim area this was a haven to behold.

Summary Heading: Excellent! The breakfast alone is worth the stay!
Summary: This place is awesome. It's really nice, very clean, well maintained, and the staff are extremely freindly and helpful. It is a little pricey so shop around for a good deal or be flexible with your timing. In terms of location, it is close to John Wayne Airport but about 20 minutes from Disneyland or 15 minutes from the beach. The rooms are fantastic! The breakfast is simply unbeatable - IT"S FREE and BETTER than most you will have to pay for. The pools are great and the decor is excellent. Stay here!

I think there is definitely an old part and a new part to this hotel.  We paid $129 a night on the Ayres website, and checked out two days early because it was so mediocre.  Our room was tiny, there was no microwave, and the fridge was stuck under the bathroom counter. (Ayres usually have a small bar with a fridge and microwave.)  Housekeeping was marginal, and access to our room was achieved by walking down two tiny concrete steps, under some scaffolding, and through a back entrance.    We didn't book on Hotwire, but the couple ahead of us did, and they were arguing about their accomodations with staff.  Apparantly this is a problem they aren't willing to work out.
