Overall, I would say you should try to find a place with consistently better ratings.  It's very

Summary Heading: Wonderful Hotel Manager, Nice Rooms, Great Price, but don't expect beach
Summary: I think the cost of this hotel is definitely worth a stay here. Another reviewer stated that the noise of the airplanes is awful, I have stayed in several hotels in this area and they all have the same airplane noise (since they ARE located next to an airport) this hotel is no better, but definitely no worse.  True, it is not in Newport Beach, but it is just a short drive down the freeway to it. If you are expecting to be in the heart of Newport Beach, don't stay here, stay at the Marriott in Fashion Island We used this hotel for my wedding. It was on a Saturday, so it was pretty calm and quiet. Since it is near the airport, they are busy Monday -Thursday & kinda slow on the weekends. My guests were VERY impressed. I had very distinguished relatives who have been around the

Summary Heading: Good and bad of the hotel
Summary: I was on a business trip in the month of april 2005 and was staying at the ayres hotel (newport beach) with 2 other colleagues. Our reponse for the 3 wks stay at the hotel was a mixed one:  Thumbs up:  1.  Location: - between fashion island and south coast plaza where we did our shopping. - stone throw away from John Wayne( orange county) airport. - It was a peaceful nice town 2. The beds were really comfortable. 3. The homemade cookies at the lobby in the evening were really good.  Thumbs down:  1. Location( yes, sorry, kinda contrdictory to above) - though the name is ' newport beach' --- its NOT at all near the beach.  2. The breakfast was the SAME every morning ! ( for 3 full wks!) 3. Generally,the service was really lousy. Almost all the staff have similarly reply: " i

Great hotel.  I travel twice a month. so I know hotels. The staff at check in was very friendly, received free drink and free breakfast.  It was a very nice buffet.  Their beds are the best I have slept on ever...I have stayed at the Westin and many others and these can not be beat.  Your guest room is a bit hard to find ..but the hotel is laid out on very attractive grounds.  Two swimming pools and spas. Good work out facility. Women will feel safe here.  Try the relish in the restaurant.  It is homemade and delicious.    Great Corporate hotel!

Summary Heading: Just stayed one night but liked it
Summary: Yes, it is by the airport which is why I booked it.   I'm a bit confused about some of the complaints.  If people would check a little more on the hotel they would know that its by the Orange County Airport and is not on the coast. Which I thought was  reflected in the price. (if people researched  hotels more in general there might be less disapointments overall)  I don't find these to be  faults of the hotel.   I thought the hotel was very nice, clean, large bathrooms, the hotel itself has a european flare.

Yeah I got this also through Hotwire as a Newport Beach Location!     What is worse it is South off of JOHN WAYNE Airport's noisy take-off strip. The place looks like an oversized Motel. The Main Lobby is nice with a country charm feel and large paintings everywhere. Had a decent sized pool but both Saturday and Sunday they had special events with tables setup all around so could not be used! You are miles from the beach and the pool was useless. The area around the complex also has nothing of interest to walk around at. Since we got a discounted internet rate it didn't include breakfast, but we could have added it for $20. Yeah right! I can go to Coco's or Denny's for less. The rooms are ok, lots of country color, good size, we had a queen bed and a sofa on the side. A small

- Location: NOT Newport Beach!!! They call themself "Newport Beach", but it is in Costa Mesa!! That is 7 miles from the Beach.  I can only see fwy55 and fwy73... Or may be airport Johnwayne. But Beach? In my dream.   If you think that it is good price for a "Newport Beach" hotel... you are doomed!!   - Front Desk: Arrived @11PM, there were 2 other guests in front of us, but only one staff is working (trying to take care of a complaint or something...)  After waiting for 15 mins,  another staff show up (My wife an I wonder why it take so long before the second staff willing to come out from his room and help..) So, after waited for over 20mins we got our key. Yes, not keyS because they only offer ONE key for my wife and I...  - Hallway: The hallway is dark, narrow and old.

Summary Heading: Not up to usual Ayres quality
Summary: We stayed here a few years ago on the "Ayers Suites" side of the hotel and had a great visit.  We've also stayed at other Ayers Inns and had truly outstanding experiences.  This 2004 Labor Day visit was rather a disappointment.  We had booked a Deluxe room with a king bed and sofa bed on Orbitz several weeks before (it was prepaid).  We called to confirm with the hotel that morning, and when we arrived the staff refused to honor the reservation, insisting they had the right to give us whatever room they pleased--in this case a queen standard room.  We even had a printout showing the room we had booked and paid for.  After all 3 check-in staff refused to honor the printed reservation, we insisted on speaking to their manager.  At that point the desk staff came back and said the

you make you pay for an extra day, if you shorten your visit. not good for the business traveller. If you work is done, and you want to check out, then you are stuck with an extra day's worth of billing.

I've been staying here during a workshop in Irvine (at SkillRamp). My stay has been great so far:  Check in was quick and easy; no wait. B/C of hotel layout, room was a tad hard to find! That's due to the 2 courtyards they have - one with a medium size pool (not for laps) and great hot tub, and the other with a large fountain, statues, and chairs/tables so you can enjoy free wine/beer at night and free breakfast in the AM. Staff has gone out of their way to help me. Hotel restaurant is pricey, but there are MANY places nearby.  The neighboring airport causes occaisional noise, but not too much or too often for me - I even kept the windows open at night (I have a room facing the pool courtyard). Complementary rides to nearby (5mi) businesses is a plus but I had my own ride.
Great location, great hotel, friendly staff... We loved the breakfast in the courtyard! By the way...we booked through the Hotwire and breakfast buffet and free drinks were included...

It's noisy; non-stop airplane noise.  It's a family hotel, lots of kids running around, screaming on top of their lungs.  The blankets have holes in them.  I booked the hotel through hotwire, came out to $100 a night (total).  Even though the advertisements state it includes breakfast, upon checking in, they make you sign a waiver stating that the room was booked through the internet, therefore you won't be getting breakfast. Facility is ok, but the staff was snobby and unhelpful.  They think they are working for a 5 star hotel, but I think it's not even 1 star!!!  Poor service, bad location, unhelpful staff.  Don't stay here even if they pay you to!!

Summary Heading: good location for travel between newport beach areas
Summary: We just returned(August 19-24)The hotel is great! the disadvantage is the airplanes flying over. The advantages are the good breakfast, location and the good comfortable beds. the price is good also for all that you receive--complimentary shuttle within 5 miles, happy hour drinks, cookies etc......

Summary Heading: Quiet and Nice Close to Newport Beach
Summary: We stayed there August 6-10, 2004. I was very impressed with the hotel and accomodations in the suites are fantastic. There is a buffet which is fully cooked (eggs, ham and eggs, pancakes, waffles or french toast) I was impressed. As an Executive, I am hard to please. The pools are small, but then again, you are there for the beach. The cool thing is that the hotel is located between the South Coast Plaza Mall and Newports Fashion Island. I highly recommend the location and hotel. Location is very safe. Any questions, please contact me!

This place was unbelievable! I stayed here for work and thought this hotel was stunning. Victorian, drapy curtains, plush rugs, immaculate... I could go on but this is an amazing place with a great price tag. I stayed in the Executive Suite so I don't know if the regular rooms are quite as nice - but I'm sure they are. The room had a jacuzzi and when I came to the room there was fruit and champagne waiting. I have no complaints- this place is gorgeous. Easily 4 stars with a 2 star price tag. Do not believe the bad reviews- this place is great.

Summary Heading: Worst hotel experience of my life
Summary: Warning - do not book a stay at this hotel through any online discount service unless you don't mind being punished for doing so.  I booked my July 2004 stay in March 2004 through Hotwire.  I then contacted the hotel directly to request a King, non-smoking room.  When I checked in I was asked to sign a waiver that I understood I would not be given the complimentary breakfast buffet, despite the fact that it was advertised as a hotel emenity on the Hotwire website.  The room I was given was a double smoking room - the odor was unbearable, I returned to the front desk to request a diffferent room only to be told very rudely that this was the last room in the hotel.  I was checking in 2 hours before the normal check in time so I find that hard to believe.  I'd also reminded the

When arriving, the hotel was furnished beautifully and we could smell the homemade cookies, but the person at the front desk was unfriendly.  Once we got to our room, I noticed the lotion they leave you in the restroom was half used.  I told the maid and she left me two, but it left me wondering how clean our room really was.  The main thing they forget to tell you is you are directly under the flight path from John Wayne Airport.  It makes it difficult to relax and have a conversation whether you're in their courtyard or by the pool.  Because of this reason, I would never go back.  There are too many other places to stay closer to the beach and away from the planes!

My wife and I stayed here on New Years Eve for a little getaway. We received a great price on the internet, less than $60 a night. Great hotel, bed and breakfast feel. Take note though if you get a bargain through the internet you don't receive the free buffet breakfast. Other than that, this is a great hotel, good service, well kept and close enough to the beach communities.
